Reviews.Title: “just as good as always”
Reviews.Author: jaanja
Reviews.Content: this is our fourth stay at the desert rose and as always it was a great stay. everyone is so friendly and helpful. the rooms are spacious and comfortable. we had a slight problem with a group of teenage cheerleaders running the corridors in the early hours but a quick call to reception and security sorted them out in 5 minutes. I would highly recommend this to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Norma T
Reviews.Content: Recently returned after a weeks trip staying at Desert Rose Resort. It is a friendly resort with great rooms, they could do with updating but have absolutely everything you would need in them. No noise or hassle, no casino which is a bonus with all the madness of Vegas. Easy to get to the Strip and all the mayhem. I would recommend this to anyone who enjoys the madness but wants to live away from it. Saved ourselves a small fortune by eating the breakfast each morning. Staff were very helpful, even organised a birthday cake! Clean and tidy, good pool area. couldn't fault it.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff but not a resort”
Reviews.Author: rogerbisi
Reviews.Content: After one week at Wyndham Grand Desert in Las Vegas, my wife and I moved to Desert Rose for just one night, because of flight changes. We tried an early check in, but the hotel was sold out. No problem. The staff was very friendly and offered us to leave our luggage there, what we declined. We came back in the right time and got our room. It was clean, reasonably equipped and that is it. The 2 TVs are outdated. The elevator smells really bad (maybe because of the hot weather and the woodfloor). The internet was slow during good part of the night, even just for reading e-mails. The swimming pool is small and the complimentary breakfast is poor (but good). Besides that, I don`t know why to call this hotel a resort. Our choice was misguided because on TripAdvisor Wyndham on April 2012 was 23 out 281 hotels in Vegas (+500 reviews) but Desert Rose was 7 out of 281 (+2400 reviews). My first thought: Rose would be even better(!), but no way. It helped to remind me TripAdvisor must be used as one of the sources of opinions and I should always double check how many stars the resort (hotel) really have before booking it. I didn`t write this review because I was upset with my own choice, but to put Desert Rose in the right place. If so many people really like it, good for them, but Rose would not to be my choice again.

Reviews.Title: “Desert Rose is an oasis!”
Reviews.Author: bcrw
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Las Vegas as a home base for day trips to some of the scenic natural wonders in the area. The location was perfect, quiet and peaceful, no smoking, no casino. . . but an easy walk to the strip and reasonable distance to Zion, Grand Canyon, Red rock. The staff was very helpful for planning trips, recommending restaurants, grocery stores, etc. The rooms were spacious, the kitchen accommodations in the room were perfect for quick breakfasts or lunches, drinks, etc. We were there for 7 nights, so eating out every meal, every day can be tedious, especially with kids. Kitchen offered a break from the restaurant routine. Kids spent their time in the heated pool and hot tub. Breakfast buffet was busy (spring break) but provided good hot and cold options. Pull-out beds were not comfortable, but kids shouldn't care. I would definitely go back; it's a nice cozy oasis from the sensory overload that IS the strip. Safe walking at night.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it here!”
Reviews.Author: Nick and Diana T
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Desert Rose for the first time over Spring Break.. And we loved it! It's beyond everything we expected, and we will be faithful to this place til the end. The rooms are mini apts, equipped with beautiful balconies. The pool is open rather late considering Vegas standards, and the entire place is clean, clean clean! I feel at home here, and the hubby and I will keep coming back. Another major plus is that the hotel is practically on the strip. We would be able to party all night and walk back safely to the hotel with no problems.

Reviews.Title: “Time of your life”
Reviews.Author: Lizi999
Reviews.Content: We have just spent our 15 visit here. We love the rooms the distance from strip and the overall friendly approach from the staff. The pool is amazing, but they could invest in a few more sunbeds, we have been going for so long we know the script but many people are stood standing once all the beds have been taken. Use the gym early doors or once the sun has set this is always the peaceful time. We usually use the barby after the managers reception and never had needed to wait. The place is clean and quiet which is what you need after a hard day shopping! I always ask for a top floor corner suite and always get one. Fantasic time, were back in 14 weeks!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: Dimples033
Reviews.Content: The rooms were excellent and roomy. Very clean. Friendly and pleasant staff. Nice pool.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: Rendvs
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here before and always look forward to spending time here again. We are also Shell Vacations Club owners, which makes our stay here extra special. We arrived a bit after noon on Saturday, April 7 and although the check-in time is listed at much later, they were very accommodating and allowed us to check into our suite (it's not a "room") right then. As always, it was clean and comfortable. I love that there is a separate bedroom from the living room/dining area. The full kitchen with refrigerator and stove and microwave makes it so much easier to bring back those large Vegas portions from the restaurants and heat up leftovers, which is also a big money saver! The pool was busy with families and since it's not that big we didn't dip in, but will most likely when we come back in the summer. It really is like having your own apartment and since we'd been to Vegas many times before we weren't in a big rush to hit the casinos and did spend some quality time just lounging around the place. The free wi-fi connection was excellent and free HBO kept me amused while I caught up on movies. The front desk is very professional and courteous. Another huge plus is the free breakfast buffet which is open later on weekends. Hot scrambled eggs, ham slices, make your own toast, plus a big selection of cereals and coffees and fruit. Another big money saver. You can eat at the tables set up in the lobby or pile up your plate and go back to your room and enjoy it on your balcony! The resort is also within walking distance of Hooters, Tropicana and MGM Grand. There isn't really a need to rent a car since you can walk to the Strip and catch the Deuce bus - only $5 for a 24 hour pass! Looking forward to our next stay!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: roadrunnerMidlands
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 7 nights over Easter and it was ideal for us. Plenty of parking and has the ideal location away from the Strip but close enough to walk to it. Room was a surprise with a full Kitchen with Fridge/Freezer and was well equiped. Walmart was close by. Go away from the Strip, past the airport, left at the end of the runway, left at the other end and its on the left so we ate in a couple of times. The only slight drawback was that during Breakfast it got very busy and seats were limited so we grabbed what we wanted and went back to our room. Tea, Coffee and chilled water available 24 hours from the Reception Area with beer, wine and soft drinks available when the Managers Reception take place. All the staff are very friendly and if you want to come back to a quiet place after being dazzled on the Strip this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “I keep coming back!”
Reviews.Author: OC-Lynch
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Desert Rose for the first time in February 2011 by recommendation of a family member. It was the first time I stayed at a hotel off the strip, so I was a little nervous. I am happy to report that Desert Rose did not disappoint. The rooms are very nice and updated with granite countertops. We stayed in a 2 bedroom and felt like we were home away from home. The kitchen & full fridge allowed for us to stock up with groceries for our extended weekend and it was great coming back from the clubs and being able to grub on the food we cooked before we left. We could either walk to our destinations on the strip or take a short taxi ride. We loved our stay so much that we stayed at the Desert Rose again in February 2012 and again had a great experience. To our surprise, the complimentary breakfast now includes hot items such as eggs. We didn’t try the breakfast, but heard it was an okay deal for complimentary. I love how close you are to the strip without having to pay strip prices. Desert Rose always offers great deals on their website and doesn’t charge a ridiculous resort fee. We are already book for our next stay this summer & can’t wait!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: claire e
Reviews.Content: We picked the Desert Rose due to the two room suite and the good reviews it had received and it lived up to all expectations. Location is ideal, one block from the Strip and MGM, yet the resort offered a quiet and relaxed atmosphere after the strip. Our room was large and had a very well equipped full kitchen with granite countertops. One King bed and one queen bed, both very comfortable. Free buffet breakfast was busy, but we took food back to our room to eat. Free Happy hour and snacks was a lot quieter. The resort put on an Easter Egg hunt for the kids, and took care to make sure that we were happy. Resort staff were very friendly and happy to help. Our kids (age 10 and 7) loved the pool and the egg hunt. We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Desert Rose Best Place to Stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: LoisLaneFlorida
Reviews.Content: This was my third time to stay at Desert Rose on a business trip. The resort itself has many superb qualities. The property's best features are the quality accommodations, kind and caring staff, complimentary hot daily breakfast and the fact that you don't have to walk thru a mile-long casino to get to your room! Taxi rides to the Strip were about $12 and the front desk staff was wonderful about calling a taxi when needed. Being able to start every day with a complimentary full breakfast was a special treat. Every contact with a resort staff person, no matter their position, was most pleasant; this is clearly the result of training from the highest levels. Housekeeping did a great job of replenishing hangers and other needed items. And they did it with a gracious smile. The price of the accommodations could not be beat!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, Great location, Good value”
Reviews.Author: Paul M
Reviews.Content: Literally at the start of the strip. Only a short walk to most of the major Casinos so no taxi required. Rooms were comfortable and clean, the staff were very helpful and friendly. If we go back to Vegas will definately be rebooking. As it is not a casino it is a good way to wind down from the buzz that is Las Vegas. Breakfast was more than adequate and happy hour was a nice treat and a good way to meet others.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Fabulous for families”
Reviews.Author: Darlene E
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this resort. This is a fabulous hotel for families or anyone who does not want a casino in their hotel. The service and staff were excellent - from pre-stay to check-in and check out. Breakfast was provided and was quite good and the suites are a decent size and have everything you need. Close enough yet far away enough from the Strip, easy drive to/from the airport, and easy access to highways. The pool and the hot tub were fabulous, and we enjoyed much R n R poolside. A great place to relax and de-stress after a day's or evening's outings/adventures. I went w/ my sister and her two kids age 14 and 12, and it was the perfect place for us. I highly recommend this resort. I have only 2 complaints (not everything is perfect) - the hide-a-bed mattress was super uncomfortable; my nephew never got a good nights' sleep; and the work-out room had no weights and the equipment seemed a little bit too used. Minor complaints when everything else was so fantastic. I would totally stay here again; next time I will bring my daughter who is now 5; she would love it - a lot of families with young kids stayed here. Just right. We had a blast. Did I mention I highly recommend this place? Thank you Desert Rose!

Reviews.Title: “3.5 stars”
Reviews.Author: PURpleYAMS
Reviews.Content: This is not my first time to stay in this oasis. In fact whenever I'm in town I make it a point to stay here. Each stay in the past was good bordering very good. This time around I want to say the same but i have to lower my ratings. I was looking forward to my stay here after a long and tiring flight.I just want to shower and go to bed. Check in was pleasant and a breeze. Front desk was very thorough with info re the facility. As I was ready to for bed I found a silver fish an insect like a roach on my pillow!!! That was just gross and I felt that the room was crawling with them!!! I took the pillow out and decided to just complain in the am. Morning came and I told the front desk clerk what I found on my pillow, I showed her a photo. She promptly changed my room. The recovery part was expected but the silverfish on the pillow is just plain yuck. They also changed their fare for breakfast. Lesser choices now but still good.

Reviews.Title: “A must stay location and amenities”
Reviews.Author: don9231
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Desert Rose Resort from April 1st to April 6th, 2012. We picked this location due to many of the areas that other reviewers mention including proximity to the "strip", good location for families, room size, free breakfast and "happy hour", and not being directly attached to a specific casino property. This property lived up to each of the excellent ratings that it has recieved. The staff was courteous and friendly and the conceirge had useful advice. The kids (ages 14 and 8) loved the pool and the suite. It was a great "home base" to come back to after day trips/or sight seeing. The breakfast was ideal for getting the day started and was not as crowded as some reviews had indicated (especially if you went there by 8 am). We would highly reccommend the Desert Rose Resort to anyone planning a trip to Las Vegas. We would also suggest taking a day trip to Valley of Fire State Park and taking in the Recycled Percussion show at Tropicana.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel not far from the strip”
Reviews.Author: goldenjag
Reviews.Content: Good hotel. Only a short walk away from the MGM grand. Great rooms. Only thing wrong is small breakfast room. Not many chairs if its busy.But plenty of food.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: inthebiz72
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Desert Rose instead of choosing to stay at the Mandalay Bay for a convention we attended. We didn't want the big, typical Vegas hotel experience. We had done that for the previous convention and did not enjoy our stay. This place is a wonderful oasis from the craziness (and smoke!) of Vegas. We loved our room. It was very spacious and comfortable. My only complaint is that the carpet is starting to look a little tired but otherwise everything was clean. We even did a full bed-bug check after we checked in (we are hotel owners) and it was all clear. (Thank goodness!!) Everyone was very friendly and helpful at the desk. The pool was lovely and there were always people enjoying it, even on the cooler days. We found our room to be very quiet through the night. It was so nice to have a full kitchen, lots of space in our room, a free breakfast (although the choices sometimes were a little boring), free WIFI. Unfortunately we were never able to enjoy the Happy Hour but that is another nice touch. All of this and no resort fees like the other bigger hotels. Definitely great value and an enjoyable stay. It was a $13 taxi from the airport and an easy walk to the Monorail at MGM and to the Strip. We will definitely stay here for our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Not for the Hangover crowd, but good for families.”
Reviews.Author: SacWebb
Reviews.Content: This is not a resort to go to and act like an idiot and then either brag to your friends or do the what happens in Vegas stays in Vegas thing. This is a place to go with your family. Our two bedroom unit was fine for our family of four (two 17 year old daughters, my wife, and myself).Two couples would have been fine, but six persons would have been crowded. The kitchens are well equipped, but will fit no more than two. The staff was friendly and helpful.The resort is close to the airport and there is a lot of outside noise, but the windows and walls were well insulated and we slept fine. The pool appeared adequate, though we did not use it. The exercise room is well equipped with the most in demand equipment. The Internet connections worked great. In Las Vegas the word "resort" can mean many different things to different people. This place is a "resort" in that it is located in a high demand city, in a high demand area, with good, but not opulent, amentities. For us, that was what we wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family resort”
Reviews.Author: lashero
Reviews.Content: First off -- I am not a huge fan of Vegas, so I really loved this resort because it was so NOT Vegas. My family (husband, me, 3 kids: 11,13,15) stayed here while we visited the Grand Canyon, Hoover Dam & Lake Mead. The rooms are condos w/ small fully equipped kitchens & living rooms. We stayed in a 2 bedroom/2 bath suite - 1K, 1Q, 1 Dbl sofabed for 4 nights. The grounds & pool are lovely: well-kept, clean & private. All of the hotel staff is friendly. The hotel is close to the strip (behind the Hooters Casino Hotel & across the street from the MGM), but you would not know it when you're on the grounds. The regular beds were comfy w/ lots of pillows; the sofa bed was...well...a sofa bed; you really can't expect much! A continental bfast is served every morning in the lobby. It's not a fabulous bfast BUT it is more than adequate & was better than most included continental bfasts I've had. If you have early morning plans to head out to sightsee, the bfast is a life saver! And the starbucks coffee makers are full 24/7. We ate twice at the hotel & twice at a local diner called Coco's (check that restaurant out; it's great!) I was so happy with this hotel, that I hate to complain about anything. The following really are just minor warnings: the bathrooms are small, so there is not much room for your toiletries. The A/C works REALLY well. It literally BLASTS freezing air out of the ducts. The bathrooms get especially cold when the AC kicks on. Fortunately, it only blows for about a minute before your room cools to the desired temperature. When booking your reservation online, check for specials on the site. Our suite was $199 per night & the 4th night was .01...yep one cent. The 4 night stay was cheaper than the flight and cheaper than the helicopter/boat tour we took of the Grand Canyon!

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with the choice”
Reviews.Author: littleella
Reviews.Content: We were a group of ten friends. Two were not staying at the Desert Rose but they changed to it for the end of their stay. It has a great location and is comfortable, clean, friendly, secure, and seemed to be smoke-free. Housekeeping was a bit sporadic. There are laundry facilities. The breakfasts were variable in quality and fairly basic but there was always something for all but the most picky eaters. We liked the evening receptions as that gave us a time to meet up and plan evenings and excursions for the following days.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay!”
Reviews.Author: Debi W
Reviews.Content: When the noise and craziness of the LV Strip gets to be too much it is wonderful to head "home" to Desert Rose. A quick 1.5 block walk from Las Vegas Blvd right off Tropicana and you are home to a quiet, casino free world of exceptional room comfort, beautiful pool to relax, exceptional staff who treat you like family! The daily breakfast is billed as a "continental" but is much more...breakfast includes eggs, toast, sausage/ham, oatmeal, fruit, cold cereal, and, of course, coffee/tea and juice. We truly enjoyed our stay and when heading back to Vegas will most definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Family oriented :-)”
Reviews.Author: MandarineBlossom
Reviews.Content: Great location slightly away from STRIP, simple but nice rooms, free breakfast and afternoon snacks+drinks, free wifi, though quite slow, computer+printer in the lobby, rooms with kitchenette that include everything you need to cook and serve your own food, swimming pool outside. The bathroom slightly too small. Breakfast stops being served at 9, so it gets crowded before 9AM. Breakfast could be of a better quality to my eyes.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing room great location!”
Reviews.Author: styln75
Reviews.Content: We had a ground floor 2 bedroom suite. It was amazing for the price. It would sleep 6 very comportably w/ 2 bathrooms. And it had a kitchen, living room and dining room, with a balcony. The beds were amazing comforatable. We slept great, The pool was beautiful but we didn't get time is use it. The breakfast was AWESOME. Sausage, eggs, hashbrown, ect. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Within walking distance of the Strip and great breakfast included!”
Reviews.Author: P M
Reviews.Content: We were invited to join a friend at this timeshare. The 2 bedroom was roomy and quiet for our party of 5 adults. One person took the couch, with 2 in each bedroom. It seemed newly decorated - clean and neat with TVs in all rooms. Outdoor parking just outside our unit was very convenient. The hot breakfast included each morning was a treat, as we sat near friendly vacationers each morning. The gym is small, but not crowded and we used great treadmills. One in our party swam in the pool and found it comfortable. We usually stay in suites at the Golden Nugget Hotel downtown, but found this to be a very nice alternative. I do have to add that the twin beds were comfortable for the 2 of us petite women, but may not suit larger or taller persons.

Reviews.Title: “I don't think it gets any better”
Reviews.Author: mdacre
Reviews.Content: This is now my third time I have stayed here after the first time, it was like I was coming home! It is ranked very high out f all the hotels in Vegas and I have yet to stay at any of the 6 others that beat this but in my opinion, for a condo, I don't think it can get any better. Think about it, a full kitchen yet you don't have to make breakfast because they provide it for you, as well as a managers reception Mon-Thurs....you WON'T be disappointed with this place. I only wish I was staying longer than one night but booking through Hot$i;e you never knw until you hae booked it.

Reviews.Title: “Best Deal for large families.”
Reviews.Author: pb1bicdic
Reviews.Content: So I found out about the hotel from searching this site. I found the reviews to be accurate and honest. When we check in, not five minutes into the hotel concierge gave us great info on free shows on the strip and the best way to maneuver from strip to downtown. If I could change anything it would be the hours of contenital breakfast. That time went so fast and the line so long that I only wanted to grab juice and leave. However, the staff was very accommodating and friendly that more than made up for it.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: Nancy I
Reviews.Content: I am an elite owner with SHELL Vacations Club and this is one of ours. Usually SHELL properties are all GREAT, but this one leaves much to be desired! It was old and run-down, noisy, and had "QUESTIONABLE" employees and other guests! Not at all the nice atmosphere I expected or am used to with SHELL. It is a nice location...close to the strip...walking distance, but the place itself is almost a dive!

Reviews.Title: “A nice piece of quiet away from the strip!”
Reviews.Author: John E
Reviews.Content: Before heading out to Vegas,for the first time,I checked reviews for this resort and it was rated in the top 10 in Vegas(Tripadvisor).My wife and myself chose this resort over others also because it had a kitchen,so we wouldn't have to buy food all the time,and because it was comprised of a number of 3 story buildings instead of overcrowded,smokey,noise filled towers.It was only a block from the strip and within walking distance to everything.We arrived in Vegas late but the 2 ladies at the reception desk were very helpful and without asking put us in a better,closer room to the front entrance.The service during our whole stay remained this way.There was no noise,everything,including the room, was very clean and breakfast was included everyday.Staff was very friendly and always willing to help.Don't get me wrong,we went to Vegas to see all the lights and glitz and glamor and we explored the strip thouroghly,but at night it was nice to come back to a place that felt more like home instead of always having to walk through a casino to find your elevator tucked away in a back corner.There was also a nice pool area(which we didn't use because it was a little cool)and if we ever go back to Vegas we will definitely be staying here again and have already recommended it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “"Best off the Strip"”
Reviews.Author: Wanda M
Reviews.Content: I decided to do a "me" break for a few days before heading to San Diego, and booked this hotel on-line and was pleasantly surprised. The 1 bedroom suite was perfect, and it was set away from all the noise on the strip. Its the perfect location for allowing one to enjoy the strip, but to also get away and tour Las Vegas. The parking is very convenient and its located just off some secondary roads that allow for easy access to the freeways and airport. The staff are very helpful and quite knowledgeable in directing you to the numerous tourist/shopping sites, as well as sharing cost saving tips on booking evening venues. There is a lovely pool and BBQ area, as well as a work out area for those that don't want to walk the strip. It also offered complimentary internet/WIFI access at no charge. The other great benefit of this hotel is the happy hour and great breakfast that was included in the cost....I will definitely be back to this facility...

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis in the Desert”
Reviews.Author: xexec
Reviews.Content: The perfect place if you want a quiet, comfortable,upscale experience away from the noise and congestion of the strip. The rooms are really apartments with full kitchens, separate bedrooms and everything else you could want. Everything looks new and is spotlessly clean. There is no casino which we loved, but It is an easy walk to all the casinos and restaurants and it's a great place to come back to. The staff is friendly and helpful. Breakfast and an evening reception with snacks and drinks are included. A great value!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, location and luxury”
Reviews.Author: AJ115
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Desert Rose for 4 nights in March 2012. We couldn't fault the room: very spacious, huge bed, fully stocked kitchen utilities and comfortable lounge area. The price was £60 a night and amazing value for Vegas. The location was a 5 min walk from the MGM Grand and the top of the strip, so not a problem for us. There are free drinks and snacks available for guests from Monday to Thursday 5-7 which was a nice touch. Breakfasts were OK and pretty standard with plastic plates, bowls and cutlery. Swimming pool and jacuzzi very enjoyable and helped ease the morning hangover. Would definitely stay there again and recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: isabehr
Reviews.Content: Check-in and out was seemless, our room was modern and clean..they fed us breakfast every morning and even provided free drinks before dinner (only on weekdays, i think) It is unbelievably quiet at night for Vegas but conveniently located about 2 blocks from the strip. I seriously felt so comfortable the minute we arrived...this is not the place for wild party animals, but the over 40 crowd will appreciate the setting...

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful and beautifully maintained.”
Reviews.Author: grammiewags
Reviews.Content: I stayed three nights, visiting family in Las Vegas. Not being a big gambler, it was fine to visit the casinos and hotels, but they are so dark, smoky, crowded and noisy. The Desert Rose is a welcome respite, but close enough to be convenient. My room was clean, spacious and comfortable. Lovely linens. Nice vanity with room for all your "stuff." All the amenities you need and Wi-Fi to boot. Starbucks coffee around the clock. Nice complimentary breakfast. I've stayed at other hotels and I'm going back to the Desert Rose.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!! Awesome place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: g c
Reviews.Content: After spending 3 nights searching for non-smoking hotel, I found Desert Rose Resort. I was worry about the smoke. To my surprise, it was totally smoke free. Awesome!! The room! No it was not a room. It was a condo with 1 bedroom and full kitchen. It was very comfortable. My trip was for a business conference, so it was so nice to come back to the peace and quiet of the hotel. The front desk staff when we arrived were extremely nice and friendly. Plus they have a free evening happy hour. It has free parking and is close to the airport and strip.

Reviews.Title: “A great surprise”
Reviews.Author: KarlaClaros
Reviews.Content: My husband, son and I traveld to Las Vegas but we were avoiding to stay in a Hotel with a Cassino. Using trip adivisor we find Desert Rose. What a great surprise. The staff is very friendy and the rooms were clean and comfortable, also each room had a smal kitchen with all the appliances. It was like an appartment. Only a walking distance to the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Jason512
Reviews.Content: We found the Desert Rose Resort through Trip Advisor and had a great stay. It is just back from the main strip and is nice and quiet. No casino on site. Our room was very nice, we also had a lounge area and small kitchen with fridge, microwave etc. Ideal to stay in for a cooked meal. We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful and would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great staff”
Reviews.Author: Histojim
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent place to stay, especially if you are looking for a non casino hotel close to, but not on the strip. Quiet and comfortable, reasonable price, excellent complementary breakfast. Close to the airport and to the strip. The staff are friendly and go out of their way to be helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: catloverSotogrande
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on TripAdvisor we booked 8 days here. It was a very good choice. The location is ideal, could walk to the Strip easily but it was nice to come back to the peace and quiet of the hotel. It is useful to have a kitchen and everything was provided. The front desk staff when we arrived were extremely helpful, the room cleaning staff also very nice. The hotel area was very well maintained. We did not eat breakfast because we bought our own but it looked very good when I saw it. The comment about the pool being small is valid but not much they can do to change that. Not enough sun beds when it is very busy I think. Nice pool towels provided as well as lots of other towels in the room. If I could just make one comment and it is probably a personal preference - I had to go out and buy a pillow because the pillows they provide are as hard as rocks!! As I said, just a personal preference but if you like a softer pillow you better take your own! Very good value and as good as everyone on here said that it was. Highly recommend it. I am not sure if this is the correct forum to make a comment about Hertz rent a car. We booked this trip through Expedia including rental car and we were booked with Hertz. Never never again would I use Hertz. If you have a choice use someone else. They were dreadful.

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: Rosettagrey
Reviews.Content: We looked at Trip Advisor before booking our break in Vegas, I was initially wanting Bills Gamblin Hall which I couldn't get at the time we booked (last July), so I booked Desert Rose. I am so glad we did. We couldn't fault it, all the reviews are right, the only thing I would mention is that the swimming pool was quite crowded and this was in March so in summer months ideally the resort could do with another pool etc. The apartment was spacious, comfortable and we couldn't fault the service, it was a haven from the noise and craziness of the Strip, albeit we loved to visit, but to come back and chill. We will probably never return to Vegas as it was a long trip for us but if we do we would not hesitate to return to this little oasis of peace, calm and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “"Vegas' Best Kept Secret !"”
Reviews.Author: PietroMorrizio
Reviews.Content: The title of my review was not my words - these were the words of the airport shuttle driver after he dropped off all the others on board at their respective hotels. He said clearly that you can spend plenty of money on The Strip, but the Desert Rose Resort is well situated, very clean, and highly affordable. I was very impressed with the DRR, and would stay there again on future trips to Vegas. The rooms are more like apartments, and are very large, even having a lounge & kitchenette. The wi-fi reception is very steady, and the place in general is very relaxed. I didn't indulge in the poolside, but it looked great. Best of all - you take the rear gate (your room pass opens it from the outside), and you are about 75yds from The Strip, and about 100yds from The Luxor. It is on a block that is shared by Hooters and the Tropicana casino, and MGM Grand, Excalibur, New York New York, are an easy five minute walk away. If you pay the daily amount of $7, the public bus will take you up & down The Strip until all hours of the night. I would say that the only downside I found was that I felt the breakfast was rather dull. I am not big on buffets, and that's what you get, but hey - this is Vegas, so if you can't find a diner or something that makes a better breakfast, then you are not getting out like you should !

Reviews.Title: “Budget Friendly Family Paradise in Vegas.”
Reviews.Author: AshFab
Reviews.Content: We took our son to Las Vegas for Spring Break and had an AMAZING time. I was a little worried when we turned off Tropicana and onto Duke Ellington passing some of the college kids at Hooters. Hooters is on the corner and I had a moments hesitation about not staying on the strip, when I saw the traffic but the moment we pulled in it was all forgotten. The grounds and hotel were immaculate the location was excellent. We quickly discovered we were able to walk across the Tropicana parking lot and head right to the strip. The first night we visited Excalibur, Tropicana, Luxor the shops at Mandalay Bay and the M&M store. It was such a great location. And the hotel itself was like staying at a quiet island resort. It was so peaceful. Even despite the large number of other guests which I didn't even notice until we headed to the breakfast buffet in the morning. Be warned it can get a little crowded there. But even that didn't dampen our spirits because the place was just so perfect for our needs. There is a store a little ways down Tropicana ( they have the address listed on the refrigerator) and if you want you can go pick up supplies to prepare your own meals and save money. We only picked up a couple of necessities there because we liked trying the different restaurants in town but we had a fridge to store leftovers when our eyes were bigger than our stomachs. I would absolutely stay here again! Do not hesitate to book this hotel. It is a gem in the heart of Vegas!!! Pros:Free breakfast, affordable, clean updated rooms, family friendly, helpful staff, and location! Cons: The lines at the breakfast buffet were pretty long, but it was a free hot breakfast so it is hard to even complain about that! LOCATION: Located directly behind the Tropicana. You can walk to the strip through Tropicana's parking lot. Near Excalibur, MGM, NYNY. Great Location!

Reviews.Title: “would seek out in the future”
Reviews.Author: AmericanInEurope02
Reviews.Content: Good location, easy parking and great rooms. As others have commented the breakfast sucks, there is a Denny's a short walk if you want a full breakfast. Otherwise stick with toast, cereal, juice and coffee or tea. The place is a 3 floor apartment buildings, not sure on the exact number of buildings and a central area. Would seek this place out in the future. However if you have never been to Las Vegas before get a hotel on the strip for the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home!”
Reviews.Author: 72Kari
Reviews.Content: Last week my husband and I stayed at this great family resort! Only one block off the strip, it was easily accessible to the MGM Monorail. Every staff member was courteous and friendly. Carrie the concierge was so helpful and energetic to all! The rooms were immaculate and well situated. We really appreciated the full breakfast each morning and happy hour in the evening. Free!! Shell Vacations really takes care of you! We can't wait to bring our friends and family to the Desert Rose Resort!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Location!”
Reviews.Author: sinbad060
Reviews.Content: My daughter is in the military and she got us rooms at the Desert Rose for a November trip to Las Vegas to celebrate a milestone birthday. What a wonderful resort. It saved us money because you were close to the action but far enough away to avoid temptation. The rooms were a very nice size, clean and I cannot say enough how great the location is. The continental breakfast was substantial, which was also a cost savings. The pool was beautiful, too cold in November to use but very nice. Nice little suite type room. You will not be disappointed by staying at a property that does not have gambling. Will definately stay there again. What a well kept secret!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience staying at the desert rose resort”
Reviews.Author: Rob S
Reviews.Content: i stayed at desert rose resort for 7 days during march 2012, swayed by the reviews on tripadvisor and the price i went ahead and booked via hotwire. We arrived earlier then the check in time on a sunday, and the staff was more then happy to check to see if any rooms were ready and we were given the choice of 2 rooms, we eventually checked into room 3306. Reading former reviews of credit card fraud i asked if i could leave a cash deposit and they were okay with that, they just said it would take 5 extra mins to check out so the room could be checked by the staff. The room was a one bedroom suite, the rooms are very clean but are a little dated (eck! conventional televisions). This room doesnt have a view, the balcony was situated toward the center of the complex. Overall i have no huge complaints about my stay here. We took advantage of the full kitchen by driving to the walmart which is right down tropicana ave (not within walking distance tho). The strip is within walking distance although we drove the rental anytime we were going to the strip. The continental breakfast isnt anything special its OK at best, but it was economical and we ate ate there just about every day before heading out. At times the lines for breakfast were long, but whatever its free. The resort doesnt feel like its in vegas because its very quiet, and once you hit the strip and tour some of the other hotels the hustle and bustle is a huge contrast. If you're looking for a clean cheap quiet hotel to stay in i recommend the desert rose resort, if you want all the bells and whistles of vegas and dont mind $$$ stay somewhere else Thanks to the staff of the desert rose for making our stay comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “Not dissappointed”
Reviews.Author: Hans K
Reviews.Content: After reading the great reviews about the Desert Rose I was happy to find that they were indeed true. We stayed there from 3/14/12 to 3/17/12 and were completely satisfied. The place is spotless inside and out, staff is very friendly and helpfull, The location is great, quiet but only a few minute walk to the hustle and bustle of the strip near the Tropicana, MGM Grand and Mandalay Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place close to strip”
Reviews.Author: CRtravelerDenver_CO
Reviews.Content: This is always one of my favorite places to stay. We do a trade show every year and have stayed here for the past 4 years. It's usually quite (even though its very close to the airport), has a nice breakfast (get there before 8am or it gets really busy), and it's so close to the strip its easy to walk! Sits right behind Hooters Hotel. Nice parking great staff! Love it and will stay there again next year!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Bryce H
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Desert Rose from Feb 20th to 25th and it was fantastic, especially the help given by the concierge Carrie. She went above and beyond the cally of duty in assisting with our itinerary for the week. She arranged for ticket pick ups and even found a way to re-cover my lost camera. She was friendly, out going and did everything she could to make our visit exciting and interesting with a buget in mind. The breakfast was a great bonus every morning and accomodations were good. The entire staff were friendly. The grounds were well kept. It was warm enough to swim and the pool and hot tub were very enjoyable. Thanks Carrie from Bryce, Ruth, and Shirley!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Value”
Reviews.Author: Dennis K
Reviews.Content: I stumbled on to the Desert Rose, trying to find a place close by, without the hassle of a casino hotel. This place is great. Might need some updating, but it is clean, the staff is great, and the location is perfect, walking distance to everything. Hard to believe that a decent breakfast, a happy hour and a nice fitness facility are also included. Only caveat would be to avoid any room that faces E. Reno Ave. - the traffic can get loud, although it never caused us to lose sleep. Get a second or third floor room, on the inside, if possible. But this place is an unbeatable deal.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly great!”
Reviews.Author: kw6289
Reviews.Content: We paid literally next to nothing for this hotel, so didn't expect too much as we stayed in Caesars Palace the night before. We were SO wrong. We arrived for check in and were allowed to check in straight away, the staff were really quick and efficient. The room itself was a lot bigger than we expected with a huge double/kingsize bed and a sofa bed, the sofa and sofa bed were surprisingly comfy. The room had a small balcony and a large kitchen and living area. The bathroom was smaller but still good and really clean. Really importantly for us there was a free safe in the room too! The hotel offer a free wi-fi service which can be used in your room. The Desert Rose is around a 5-10 minute walk to the main strip but it doesn't feel too far and the reception staff are happy to call a taxi on your behalf, the hotel is also literally just behind Hooters where taxi's are waiting to take people aswell. The hotel offered breakfast in the morning which was nice and a good selection. This hotel was such a bargain I'd happily go back and recommend to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: gary c
Reviews.Content: Free Wi-Fi + Free hot breakfast + no resort fee = the best place to stay in Vegas as far as I'm concerned. The rooms are all suites with separate bedroom and a full kitchen - including a dishwasher! The staff is friendly and helpful and everything appears very well kept and clean. Its not in the middle of all the action but is about a 5-10 minute walk to the strip down by the Tropicana, and right next door to Hooters which has the great Mad Onion restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT PROPERTY - SOUTH STRIP”
Reviews.Author: MaxCMitchell
Reviews.Content: I stayed 5 nights while attending the REMAX 2012, R4 International Convention. Reserve an internal unit. The daily maid service was an added benefit. The unit was neat and clean, gated grounds were also clean and well cared for. The price was very reasonable as well as no hidden costs. I’m likely to book this location when RE/MAX comes back in 2013.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed with the suite”
Reviews.Author: yorkiemom61
Reviews.Content: Beautiful suite. Well worth the $$$. 2 couples 1 adult & 1 child was very comfortable. Will stay here again if come back to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “program with problems”
Reviews.Author: F0gh0rn
Reviews.Content: Our 2 couple group reserved into this resort, using a promo discount of the eco program. The facilities was everything we as a group wanted for our week stay. Quiet evenings away from the strip. The resort is a 3 block walk to the strip with the Excalibur, Tropicana, MGM and New York resorts at this 3 block walk. If you have a vehicle, this is a great place, as you can park right outside your balcony. Rooms are spacious and comfortable, with couch, table, kitchen and a bathroom for each master bedroom. Our little problem we had with the resort was getting services to empty garbage and replenish supplies, the idea of the eco program is your linens would be changed on the fourth day. After talking with the front desk 2 times about supplies and garbage, I needed to go directly to the manager. We discussed the problems I was having with housekeeping and resolved the situation. Breakfast is in the main lobby every morning with eggs, cereal, toast,coffee and juice. Nice to get this as it can be very pricey finding breakfast and the high price of the smorgs at the hotels Nice size pool and 2 hot tubs. The proximity of the airport was not an issue for noise at all. We would definitely book again at this resort in Las Vegas

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Bet711
Reviews.Content: Needing a little updating, but there are many things that make this a great place to stay. Located across from Hooters, and near the MGM Grand. Easy access to the strip, if that is what you are looking for. Mon. thru Thurs. happy hour in the lobby. There is wine and beer, and soft drinks, plus, carrots and celery with ranch dressing, nachos, and a couple of other things. Also a big plus, and a rarity...substantial continental breakfast served in the lobby. Great for families. One bedroom, one bath that we had was roomy, and also had a decent size kitchen. Good wi-fi reception, very cozy "condo" type accomodations. The staff was friendly, and willing to help with information. overall.....good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Candy N
Reviews.Content: This place is clean and the rooms are large and very comfortable with large couch, TV, large kitchen with all the ammenities like microwave, fridge, stove and dishes. Free breakfast every a.m. and it is just off the strip with easy parking. I liked that you don't have to walk through a smokey casino and ride an elevator to the 30th floor to get to your room . Staff is friendly, pool is clean. Have stayed there 4 times now and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and perfectly located.”
Reviews.Author: xelaju007
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife spent 5 nights at the Desert Rose while attending the World of Concrete Expo on January. We were looking for a place where we could rest after a long day walking and visiting the show. Location is perfect, just one and a half block from MGM and Hooters, a 3 blocks from the strip; everything is at walking distance since you can use the monorail at MGM. Suites are clean and convenient, staff is friendly and nice. If you do not like the smell of smoke and the noise of the casino hotels then this is the place for you. Perfect for families.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience.”
Reviews.Author: Teagued
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 5 nights. Our room was on the third floor, facing the back. (MGM) We were very happy with our stay. We took some day trips and appreciated the home-like feeling of the room. Breakfast was okay, nothing spectacular but adequate and the price was right! Like others have mentioned, the strip is right there, just a short walk and you in yet MGM or Tropicana. For anyone not staying on the strip, it's a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “best buy on a budget”
Reviews.Author: seasurf
Reviews.Content: cant beat the price. full kitchen including dish washer! staff very very helpful. its two blocks on tropicana ave to the vegas strip, they are long blocks but walkable. free internet. breakfast standard fare. clean. You need to visit the Bellagio fountains on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, once again!”
Reviews.Author: StefiSlovakia
Reviews.Content: After such a great experience at this hotel during our previous stay, we decided to stay at this place again. No smelly smoky crowded casinos, no 2 mile walk to get from your car to your room. Cozy and convenient. This place has a wonderfully equipped kitchen. It's nothing like home, but good enough for making your favorite home made meals. I'm very picky when it comes to food and neither my husband nor I tried breakfasts or managers specials. Not because they're bad, just because we like something different and at this hotel we had a great ability to stick to our choices. Separate bedroom area was great when my husband needed to get some work done and I wanted to watch TV. Staff was, just as the last time, very attentive with no issue to point out. What I would bring to your attention is that rooms are a little worn and they are not luxurious or high end. But they do offer what most people need and probably a bit more and very very clean. I've been recommending this place to all of my friends :)

Reviews.Title: “A good place to "resort" to!”
Reviews.Author: vacationfromvacation
Reviews.Content: My 13 year old daughter had a dance competition in Vegas at the Orleans hotel. They were booked so we scrambled to find another place to stay. I was attracted to this resort because the rooms are set up like tiny apartments. It felt really relaxing, as if we were home....with the living room, roomy kitchen and even a dining area! My 10 year old son loved the tv in the living room and my daughter and I watched in the bedroom. The decor was cheery and warm and the place was immaculate! The couch was comfortable and so were the beds. I was able to cook a few times and found the kitchen working perfectly. There are no casino slot machines so there was no smoking which was a huge plus! It was within walking distance of the MGM Grand where we ate dinner. The breakfast at the hotel was pretty good...dissapointed that there were no pastry or bagels, just toast. However, the coffee was Starbucks...piping hot! The pool area was great. Only complaint was that the inside rooms are dark so ask for one facing the outside or the pool, NOT the inner courtyard area which was a bit depressing staring at hotel walls and walkways. This hotel was very quiet so we slept quite well! The only annoyance was that it took quite some time to get across Las Vegas AVe to get my daughter to her events at the Orleans as you are competitng with airport traffic. I reccomend this hotel for families!

Reviews.Title: “The Desert Rose an Oasis Away From the Strip”
Reviews.Author: KLH1956
Reviews.Content: The Desert Rose is just the place to stay. Away from the hustle and bustle of the Strip and cacophonic noise of a Casino. The units are very well equipped and furnished. The complimentary wifi service was great for organizing activities. The staff was very friendly, helpful, and accomodating. The complimentary continental breakfast was a perfect way to start the day. We're looking forward to returning to the Desert Rose the next time we go Vegas and we definitely would recommend this resort to our friends and relatives.

Reviews.Title: “Desert Rose not such a rose any more =====>>>>”
Reviews.Author: DaveandVera
Reviews.Content: Hello everybody.As you can see posted here the Desert Rose Resort is a very good place to stay in Las Vegas.It is close to the strip.It is convenient given that you have a small kitchen.It offers the one or two bedroom option.They offer free drinks in the evening with some very cheap finger food and a cheap continental breakfast in the morning.So regarding the free stuff they do it as cheap as possible.However it is free but not as good as one may think.I have been going here every year for the last 5 years for one week.It is usually around Sept-Nov time of the year.Every year it has been a slam dunk for price comparison and value but things have changed.Last year a Mon-Fri one bedroom unit cost me $403.Very good for what you get.This year you pay $656 ???. So it is quickly now not such a good deal and I must shop around.The Trip Adviser Rating has dropped from 1 or 2 to 7 at the time of this posting.Its too bad they do this as they had a good thing going for many repeat customers.If you have any questions on this place please ask and I will tell you what I know. BTW if you so decide to pay the extra money to stay here avoid the back units.The garbage truck arrives early in the morning unloading the garbage dumpsters.The noise will wake you.......its like a clap of thunder for 30 min straight.And that my friends is the unbiased truth. Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great value. Bad bugs?”
Reviews.Author: Boriski
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights (ave.$54/night incl. tax), and returned for another following a road trip to the Grand Canyon. Before booking accommodation in Vegas, you have to decide what type of stay you want, and get a feel for the different styles. If you want a party-hard, hangover place, this isn’t it. We found Desert Rose to be a peaceful and welcome place to return to each evening, after the trashy, noisy Strip. Overall: It’s fantastic value-for-money in a large suite with kitchen facilities. Unlike most hotels in Las Vegas, there are no surprise, exhorbitant resort fees charged. Best for families or those wanting a quieter non-casino experience a reasonable walk from The Strip. What’s good: This was our 22nd hotel stay in fifteen weeks across North America, and one of the best value for money and largest rooms so far. We had a one-bedroom suite with balcony and full kitchen (microwave, refrigerator, stove). We booked the night before our stay on hotels.com for an average rate of $54/night (incl. tax & breakfast) for three nights. It’s a 15 minute walk through Hooters and Tropicana Hotel carparks to the start of the strip at MGM Hotel/Casino. Our first stay was in a third floor room (facing the internal courtyard), and a third floor room facing a carpark our second stay. Beds were comfortable and the room and bathroom were clean. Free wifi worked well our first stay, but a bit unrealiable and patchy our second. Staff were enthusiastic, friendly, efficient and polite. Plenty of free carparks available. There’s a tiny shop onsite with limited snacks and toiletries, and a guest laundry available (small fee). A bonus free beer, softdrinks and limited snacks are provided for guests for a few hours in the evening Monday through Thursday. Breakfast was included in our rate, and was standard hotel continental (cereals, yoghurt, bagels, toast, juice, coffee and bulk-style scrambled egg & mini sausage). Free coffee available 24/7 in the foyer. Two colour tvs in our suite, with a reasonable selection of channels. In-room safe also available. Potential showstoppers: My partner had 17 bed bug bites, 24 hours after our second stay here. Whilst we can’t guarantee the bites were from here (we stayed in two other hotels within two weeks), and everyone reacts differently (some people take up to 9 days to show a bite, and others don’t react at all), I’d recommend you inspect mattresses, around the bed and furniture & fixtures thoroughly for any bed bug signs (as with all hotels) After our stay, we found two entries (dated 2011) for this hotel, on the bed bug registry website. Minor annoyances: (there weren’t many). Both stays were reasonably quiet but staff can sometimes be a bit loud, yelling and chatting to each other as they work around rooms. Transport: we caught the Westcliff Airport Express bus (WAX) from the airport ($1.50pp) – it’s an approx. 10 minute walk from the stop at E. Tropicana Avenue (after Kovan Lane) to the resort, but is do-able providing your luggage is small. Bus passes for the gold, double-decker Duece Strip bus are cheaper if purchased off strip. The Duece Strip bus stops nearby the resort (around the corner on the Boulevard, outside the Tropicana carpark) and can take you along the strip and back. Safety/Security: The side exit gates to the facility can be inadvertently left unclosed by exiting guests (staff need to regularly check), as gates have a dampner on them on don’t quite close properly if left to swing shut. This puts guests at risk for uninvited visitors in the resort compound. We witnessed a young man chased by a security guard, attempting to gain entry to the resort through one of these side gates. Also, avoid betting on sidewalk ‘spot the marble under the cup’ games – they’re a scam. We watched a guy running one of these ask the watching crowd for a $100 bet to pick where the marble was. A $100 note held up by an audience member was quickly snatched and the guy did a runner. Sidewalk gambling is not legal, and you’ll likely be scammed the same way.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely rooms & short walk to the strip”
Reviews.Author: Simona K
Reviews.Content: Great service and lovely rooms. Perfect for families and those who do not want to be bombarded with ads and sales people as they make their way to their rooms. It's small compared to the mega casinos nearby but very peaceful. The staff was there to make your stay pleasant and not necessarily to sell you something along the way. I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “I will stay there again...”
Reviews.Author: Jose P
Reviews.Content: It was great to stay with my family in a Hotel without a Casino. Great rooms. The breakfast was better than most.

Reviews.Title: “This should be the title the oasis as this is brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: bigbird25059815784
Reviews.Content: This is a very reasonable hotel which is deserves more credit. It is ideal for whereever your travelong alone or with a family.

Reviews.Title: “Fancy In Vegas”
Reviews.Author: ChevyGirl11
Reviews.Content: I have absolutely NO complaints. I thought the decor was cute..the 2 bedroom/2 bathroom was perfect for my needs. Room was clean, and staff was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Good service, bad room”
Reviews.Author: Mike_666_69
Reviews.Content: We got a 2 bedroom suite. Small, ugly and one bedroom had its own bathroom. Other bathroom, scurry across the hall. Beds miserable. 70's decor--I said on walking in, "at least the fridge isn't avocado green." Dishwasher broken. TV's were old and I'm sure the nearest flat-screen was in the Hooters hotel, whose butt-end filled our view. Kitchen about like my first apartment, but with fewer utensils. Not Residence Inn by a long shot. On the other hand, staff were great. Can we have coffee filters? Can we have a pillow? They scurry away too fast for you to tip them. Morning breakfast perfectly adequate. Location: yes, they're a block and a half away from the strip. If you don't count going around all the walls and barriers. Still, good location, 10 minute walk to the MGM. I won't stay here again, but if you can get this for under $100 a night, totally worth it.

Reviews.Title: “loved it here”
Reviews.Author: malibu-jenni
Reviews.Content: I had a fantastic time at this hotel in Vegas. It was 5 min walk to MGM grand and strip. Very friendly and helpful staff. Very welcoming, complimentary beer and wine, for before you go out, good breakfast buffet, relaxing pool and good gym. Spacious condos with everything you need. It is not attached to a casino, which suited us for this holiday, and is mins away from the airport so is the first stop on the shuttle. we missed our flight home (oops) so stayed another 3 nights here in another room just as good, and received a lot of help from the staff. This is a fantastic hotel, well worth the price xx

Reviews.Title: “Peace and Quiet away from The Strip - and Great Value”
Reviews.Author: PGL3
Reviews.Content: It was our first visit to Las Vegas and everyone told us we must stay on The Strip. Having ignored that advice and chosen the Desert Rose for its low prices, we found we had made the right decision. The hotel is basic when compared to all the big-name hotels but you can spend as much time as you want in the fancy hotels, enjoying the shows, casinos and restaurants (we spent plenty of time at the wonderful Bellagio, seeing a show and having a couple of meals). Then at the end of the day it's a real pleasure to get away from the noise and the lights to the peace and quiet offered by the Desert Rose. The rooms (suites) are great, everything is clean, the breakfast is OK, the staff are friendly - what else do you need?

Reviews.Title: “Broken DVD, Broken Dishwasher”
Reviews.Author: SeaJenniTravel
Reviews.Content: Customer service over the phone was great. Upon arrival, the carport and lobby area were attractive. Brand new condos are across the street and Hooters is the nearest restaurant and casino. The reception agent at the front desk, Ashley, spoke in a bored, yet well rehearsed monotone, but at least she was clear and easy to understand. The one bedroom room seemed great at first. The living room area is wider than most one bedroom rentals where I have stayed. It was easy for a group of four to walk around each other. The couch with chaise lounge is big and comfy. There is a dining table for four, granite countertops, new cinnamon hued cabinets with desert hued adobe colored walls. It has a soothing desert color scheme. There is a balcony that seats two. They also have 2 bedroom units. There is an extra deep bathtub, next to the toilet, which is separated by a door from the bathroom sink. The space in front of the toilet is about 2 feet wide. It feels like an airplane toilet. The living room carpet was soaking wet and smelled like carpet cleaner. The only DVD player was broken. The dishwasher was broken. The elevator shuts on the second person walking in or out. The pool area was clean. The halls were clean. The breakfast is standard fare: scrambled eggs, sausage, oatmeal, cold cereal, juice, coffee, and apples. I love a free breakfast. The staff was diligent at restocking and cleaning the breakfast area. 3.7 miles or a $15 cab ride to Circus Circus. Although the dishwasher was broken, the kitchen is great. I eat out for almost every meal, but I brought groceries on this trip. My total expense for 3 days and 2 nights of eating out for a family of four was $9. I would stay here again. It isn't glamourous, but it is comfortable and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, but not worth it.”
Reviews.Author: Sophia S
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the desert rose before taking a trip to the grand canyon. The location is excellent. Not too far from the strip and not too far from the airport. When I arrived they booked us into a suite which had one double bed and a couch. It was me, my husband and my children. The poor kids had to sleep on a rather hard and uncomfortable couch. I later then found out whilst visiting my sister's room who was staying with her kids that there was much larger suites. I asked the front desk who refused to move my family too another room and so we packed up and my travel agent booked us into the Four Seasons hotel. This hotel needs to have a better system of booking rooms so that they can accomodate everyone. Sophia.

Reviews.Title: “That's where to stay”
Reviews.Author: LaurentBeijing
Reviews.Content: All the reviews I read before booking here are accurate. Actually, it would be better kept as a secret than promoted... When in Vegas, don't stay on the Strip. It takes endless time to get to your car or room. Here, you park (free) and just walk 20m to be in your room. Which is large and well equipped. All of Vegas (and around) is yours, without the mess of the mega hotels. Decent breakfast is included. Book there with no second thoughts!

Reviews.Title: “Thankful for Desert Rose”
Reviews.Author: Dale R
Reviews.Content: Recently my wife and I stayed 7 days at the Desert Rose, Las Vegas. We were pleasantly surprised with the clean and spacious rooms. We had all the conveniences of home including all appliances, separate bedroom, comfortable bed, dining area, and two TV's. Our room was cleaned daily. The entire staff from the cleaning folks, to the management were friendly and we were greeted with many smiles and "good mornings". The staff was professional. The Consierge service was great and helpful. The a.m. breakfast was good start to the day. The wait staff did a good job at keeping things full and tables kept clean. I think the best part was it was NOT directly on the strip. It was good to come back after a busy day to peace and quiet without all of the crazyness and hoards of people on the strip. We would recommend the Desert Rose if you are looking for a little more reserved place to stay without the excess of the strip. Thank You Desert Rose for a memorable trip. The Dale & Treasure Roush - Michigan

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, walking distance to strip”
Reviews.Author: twooutofthree
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I stayed here in the middle of February for 5 days. Desert Rose is a clean, comfortable, nice place to stay in if you don't want to stay on the strip. We stayed in a one bedroom condo which also includes a kitchen. Room was clean and bright, the maid was great! The pool area has plenty of pool chairs to relax in. You get a complimentary breakfast which is not bad (no restaurant in hotel), there is a wonderful place to eat though if you don't mind walking for 5 minutes. It is called Cocos and is just up the street. Ask the reception for directions. Great breakfast and lunch too, we never had dinner there but I am sure it is good as well. Check into the hotel went smooth! There is not alot of rooms with a view, also make sure you don't get a room besides any hallway doors! You can hear doors shutting and the maids that go around to clean in the morning. The strip is in walking distance, it takes about 8 to 10 minutes. We walked once and took the cab after that. You can't grab a cab from off the strip, it has to be able to pull into a driveway or small street to pick you up (drivers get fined if they stop on the strip). Or go to the next hotel and stand by the entrance, cabs are always coming and leaving there. All in all a very pleasant stay. We would definately go back, next time I'd like to stay on the strip though.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Non-Commercialized Place”
Reviews.Author: Martin C
Reviews.Content: The Desert Rose is in a great location close to the airport on the south end of the strip. The rooms are very nice with an ample bedroom and a sitting room. Having stayed there three times I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful surprise”
Reviews.Author: Adventurer2011
Reviews.Content: Great value! Suite, kitchen - great price through Hotwire. Breakfast was fine too.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable...”
Reviews.Author: emsawyer665
Reviews.Content: Our big trip to Las Vegas was supposed to be perfect as we prepared to renew our vows with friends and family. Upon arrival at the Desert Rose, it was obvious that their mission was the same as ours, from beginning and even after our trip was complete. Smiles and welcomes from staff greeted us and stayed with us everyday throughout our stay. Our stay was continually checked on not only by front desk, but from every employee we came into contact with. You felt like royalty with the above and beyond treatment you received from every employee. Even the concierge was amazing and no question or task was to big or to small. Our room was AMAZING!! Two bedrooms, full living room, balcony with a fantastic view, a kitchen with all the amenities; everything was perfect, quiet and extremely comfortable. Pool area was fantastic as well as work out facilities. Breakfast each morning was terrific and getting the evening started with wine and beer served in the main building around the fire place was incredible as well. I like the touch of music that was selected each evening by our server. This gave us a nice chance to visit with other patrons and enjoy the start of great evenings to come. I still can't get over how each employee approached us to make sure our stay was going well. With replies like "Yes mylady" and "yes sir" made your fill almost like a bit of royalty. We were there over Super Bowl weekend, yet everything was so smooth. You can't beat the location, right off the strip. Walking distance, or short cab rides. We asked the front desk for limo service and within minutes our driver G'Day was transporting us up and around Las Vegas. (Def check out Fremont Experience. AMAZING) We found it cheaper to pay for a limo and not feel rushed taking a cab. After a busy night on the strip, it felt so nice to come back to the Desert Rose, to a welcoming staff and an awesome room. Drinks on the balcony each night gave us the chance to sit and take in Vegas. We brought along a party of 5, and had plenty of room and comfort just a quick hop of the strip. We can't wait to come back and bring the whole family in just a couple of months. Oh, once you get to the Desert Rose, def take time to 'stop and smell the roses.' Several different rose plants around the property are worth checking out. Thank you to all the staff of the Desert Rose who made sure our trip was Unforgettable, and still checks on us to see how we are doing. ABOVE AND BEYOND are three words to best sum up our stay at the Desert Rose!

Reviews.Title: “Forget about the casinos...”
Reviews.Author: Neema S
Reviews.Content: As a frequent traveler, this place was among the best hotels (if you can call it that) that I've ever stayed at - and the first time a review was warranted on TripAdvisor. We scored a fantastic deal on Hotwire and were a little hesitant about being off the Strip, but were pleasantly surprised when we arrived. About a 5 minute walk from where you want to get, this place is located right across MGM and beside Hooters, Tropicana, and Excalibur. Lots of cheap & great food at those three properties. Expecting a typical studio-like hotel room, we had a fantastic 1 bedroom suite with a full kitchen and balcony. Great breakfast in the mornings (grab it and go back to the room for a more pleasant experience), and an under-used pool and 2x hot tubs. Will be back here for sure, makes the Vegas experience a little bit more less exhausting. =)

Reviews.Title: “Great, Great, Place.......”
Reviews.Author: gaylesay
Reviews.Content: This place was wonderful to stay at in Vegas. Close enough to strip, but away from hustle and bustle for down time. Clean, and very comfortable. Complimentary Breakfast each morning with hot foods, and beer and wine, soft drinks and snacks each evening. Can't beat that. Very friendly, helpful people working at The Desert Rose. Highly recommend, this place is great!

Reviews.Title: “Great condo style rental”
Reviews.Author: superdriver223
Reviews.Content: I was totally surprised with the value at the desert rose. If I can remember right it was about $100 a night, that was the 23rd to the 26th of December. It had everything you would need if you were sticking around the hotel. My only complaint is that there was not nearly enough seating for the breakfast crowd. But, other than that it was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: VillageTraveler_7
Reviews.Content: We had some timeshare pts that we needed to use so we decided to go to Las Vegas for the 1st time in 25 yrs. After a 1.5hr delay in getting a taxi from the airport, we arrived at the Desert Rose & were able to check in early. We didn't realize that we had chosen SuperBowl & Republican Caucas weekend. We had a choice of rooms & opted for an inside room with a garden view. It was perfect - very quiet & had a nice decor. We enjoyed having the small kitchen to chill our wine & fruit. The bed was very comfortable with lots of pillows. We were surprised to find out about the free breakfast in the morning. Nice way to start our day. We came to Vegas to see the town & enjoy the Phantom of the Opera & the Donnie & Marie show, both excellent. Since we spent most of our time outside the resort, I can't say much about the resort activities. The staff was eager to make sure that we enjoyed our stay. We had one dinner at Delmonico's in the Venetian. Outstanding. We also had a late lunch in the Eifel Tower restaurant which was a great place to sit & people watch. The drinks outside the front of Caesar's were also great. We sat there enjoying the sun, a rare event in the NW in the winter. If you are looking for something away from the strip, I think the Desert Rose is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Service”
Reviews.Author: SaskatoonBella
Reviews.Content: I was so impressed with the quality of service we received from all the staff, they were so friendly and helpful, they most certainly provided us with first class service. Located a few blocks from the strip, near the MGM, it was very nice and quite, but close to all amenties,and just a short drive to the airport. They provided a complimentary breakfast ( hot and cold food ) plus complimentary happy hour drinks. The one bedroom suite we stayed in was very clean, spacious and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: Robert G
Reviews.Content: Right off the strip with all the amenities needed for a great stay. Breakfast included and wonderful, caring help ready to make certain your time with them is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Super Nice Staff”
Reviews.Author: Murphthesurf6236
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Desert Rose. In contrast to the strip, it is unpretentious, quiet and comfortable. Yet, it is just a block or so from all the lights and excitement. It's near the MGM and New York New York. The rooms was really nice and clean. The bed was comfortable. Housekeeping staff was friendly and attentive and our room always looked great when we got back to it. The front desk staff were friendly and helpful, as was everyone else. No bad attitudes.The seemed to genuinely care that we enjoyed our stay. It is not a big fancy resort, but it has everything you need and is well maintained. We would definitely stay here again and I have no hesitation recommending it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent.”
Reviews.Author: VanGaal
Reviews.Content: Stayed Jan 2012. Great location just off the strip, free parking, quick easy check in, large clean room with great shower. Effective and quiet A/C. Only downside we found was the breakfast which was not bad but not great - only a minor issue though, definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Good family spot in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Biscottina
Reviews.Content: This is an all-suite resort with no casino, which is perfect for families. We were happy to see that the one-bedroom suite that we had reserved was clean and well-appointed. The suite included a separate bedroom with a door, a full-kitchen (with full-size refrigerator) including all dinnerware and silverware, a dining area and living room with balcony. The location is decent within walking distance to MGM (where you can catch the monorail) and restaurants. The resort includes a hot breakfast (eggs, ham (or bacon or sausage), instant oatmeal, fruit, cold cereal, etc. They also offer evening reception with beer/wine and snacks.

Reviews.Title: “A LAS VEGAS CALM OASIS”
Reviews.Author: spysmum
Reviews.Content: Desert Rose resort is the perfect place to stay for those not wanting a smoking gambling hotel in the city that never sleeps. the all suite accommodation is comfortable, serviced daily, well equipped and in a convenient location, just a block back from the Strip, and close to the airport. The friendly helpful staff make you feel very welcome, and there is an excellent concierge service. You can park right next to each block, and a basic hot breakfast is included in the room rate. Whilst not the cheapest place to stay in Las Vegas, the level of comfort and high standard make it an excellent choice. We have used this hotel several times, much preferring it to the crowded, noisy, very anonymous, bigger Strip hotels

Reviews.Title: “Desert Rose”
Reviews.Author: Steven H
Reviews.Content: Big ol giant rooms, friendly and helpful staff, little wine happy hour wasn't bad either! Great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: BuddaOnt
Reviews.Content: The staff was very good, rooms were excellent and the location was just off the strip beside Hooters.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better”
Reviews.Author: Freyjas-star
Reviews.Content: Came back for a second stay because this is such a great find. The feel of a resort provides a great setting and also a nice complement to the glitz on the Strip. Having a two bedroom suite with a living room and a full kitchen allows you to relax together and have some snacks in a natural and economic way that just isn't possible with hotel rooms. The breakfast included scrambled eggs and ham or sausage and an impressive variety of fruit juices as well as the cold choices one would expect of a continental breakfast. Every single staff member we interacted with was extremely friendly and seemed genuinely concerned that guests enjoy their stay. When I was asked at check out whether anything could have been done better, I honestly couldn't think of a thing.

Reviews.Title: “Tourist Capital of Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Fish-Fun-Seaker
Reviews.Content: All the positive reviews here are correct. However there are a few things that set the Desert Rose apart from the Strip hotels. The staff are so friendly. Starting the morning off leaving my room and being greeted by every staff member, from the maintenance man, to the floor cleaner, to the laundry person, to the gardener really puts a smile on my face. Being able to choose some healthy options from the complimentary breakfast and grabbing a paper and a Starbucks coffee to sip by the pool. Then striking up a conversation with other guests from around the world (thanks you lovely ladies from the UK) while lounging in the sunshine and breathing smoke-free air. This Canuck can't wait until March when I head back to the Desert Rose for St. Patrick's Day.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis from the strip”
Reviews.Author: darrylwk
Reviews.Content: Free parking, free breakfast and only a block and a half from the strip! While there on family business I found this place a relatively quiet retreat from the strip area and city noise in general. Being able to cook your own meals is a plus. The place is divided into four separate condos apart from the main building and lobby area. In the center of these buildings lies a large pool and whirl pool surrounded by pleasant side walks and greenery.
