The suites arrangement reminds me of a Residence Inn or Staybridge Suite and is logical with space use. It is showing some wear and if you like your white socks black on the bottom then the carpeting and tile floor will add that. The carpet shows wear and some dirt but in all fairness the buildings and grounds are kept up and the staff works hard to be helpful. Also the hall corridors and its carpeting are partly opened up to the outside thus the dirt being drug in. The breakfast is average but offers a large open area and a resort feel to enjoy it in. The Starbucks coffee seemed fresh and hot. Desert Rose is a place that lives up to its name and deserves a serious consideration on your to stay list especially with the great Hotwire price we received. The beds were also very comfortable and no problems with noisy neighbors during our three nights there.

Reviews.Title: “What a treat!”
Reviews.Author: Chris D
Reviews.Content: We all love going to Vegas for the bright lights but the casino gets really old about bed time. The Desert Rose is the perfect solution for my company. We don't have to walk through a smokey casino, stand in line for a breakfast buffet or navigate a parking garage to find our car. The Desert Rose is in the shadow of the Strip and only 10 minutes from all of the convention centers. Our company will stay at the Desert Rose every time we go to Vegas as long as I am making the decisions.

Reviews.Title: “Sipping coffee right now:”
Reviews.Author: Tedsma87
Reviews.Content: Thank you Trip Advisor for helping us choose this place. We needed a quiet retreat from the Strip, smoke free. This place is perfect. I am sitting on the sectional in the living room of our large fully equipped condo having coffee from the 12 cup Mr. Coffee. TIP: Bring your favorite and filters from home if you hate hotel coffee. :) Lariza was able to check us in early at 11am. Took 5 minutes. She was very nice and very helpful. The bed and pillows are so comfortable. After an exhausting day yesterday I slept like a baby. Highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Suited the purpose”
Reviews.Author: spring t
Reviews.Content: I read a lot about this place on tripadvisor before finally booking a 5 night stay here. The positives and negatives have all been covered by many people already so I wont repeat the same things just for the sake if it. But most things mentioned in the posts here are spot on! I was at CES last week, which is the one week of the year that hotels on the strip charge ridiculously high prices. even this place was over $100 a night, which isn't exactly a great deal compared to it's regular rates. It was, however, good value even at that price. I found it served my needs for the 5 nights I was there, and as soon as CES was over on the Friday, and the strip hotels lowered their prices, I spent the weekend at The Mirage for the same prices as I was paying during the week here. It's just the way things are in Vegas I guess.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: RoadtripperColorado
Reviews.Content: This property is a time share that rents units to the public. It is clean well kept, and convinient. It is only a block off of the strip and a short walk to the casinos at the south end of the strip. The units have full kitchens and the parking is convinient for those who are using a car to get around town, the big casino parking lots tend to take a long time to get in and out of, here your car is just outside your unit and easy to get to. It's also nice to be able to get away from the hustle and bustle of the strip while being only a short walk from it. if you want room service and never to leave your casino hotel property this is not for you but if you like a bit of calm and the convinience of a full condo while having easy access to the strip this place is the ticket.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant,yet again.”
Reviews.Author: jaffakelv
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Desert Rose,and was again spot on. I requested a quiet room,as my wife's a light sleeper,and we stayed on the third floor in building 4 - it was perfect. I've mentioned in a previous review (as others have done) about the amenities,and they were great again. There's nothing else to add - when we return to Vegas,we'll be staying here for the third time!!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet retreat”
Reviews.Author: jkfarside
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Desert Rose a couple of times and it is definitely a favourite. While it's close to the bustle of the Strip, it is very quiet. I particularly enjoy having a large suite where you can sit around the table, surfing the web or having toast and coffee. Internet is free and fast, a hot breakfast is included, and they even have a complimentary happy hour (5-7).

Reviews.Title: “Very Ordinary”
Reviews.Author: Dids50
Reviews.Content: Spent a few days here on my way home from a business trip in Chicago. The one good thing about this resort was that it was as far away from the main drag as possible! Otherwise very tired decor, mediocre service, terrible breakfast and most unpleasant pool deck.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem of a find”
Reviews.Author: KB72Wirral
Reviews.Content: This a a fabulous place with which to see the delights that Vegas has to offer. We travelled with family that had been to vegas many times and have stayed in all types of accomodation in Vegas including the big hotels. The great thing about the Desert Rose is that you dont get in the big hotels is that you have all the self catering amentities not just room only so you don't have to walk miles just to get a coffee. The complimentary breakfast was always satisfying and started you off for the day including starbucks coffee. 'Happy hour' was an added bonus. The pool was more than sufficient for our requirements but to be honest we didn't use it that much as there is so much else to see and do. With only a short stroll round to the strip it is also excellently positioned to enjoy everything Vegas has to offer. Every me,ber of staff were so friendly and helpful and a credit to the management. Nothing was too much trouble. The bonus of the apartments having self catering facilities means you can do Vegas on a budget if needed. i absolutely and thoroughly loved this holiday and cannot wait to get back to Vegas and the Desert Rose Resort ASAP.

Reviews.Title: “Off the strip, great value, awesome happy hour, helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: happydaze-7
Reviews.Content: Great value, roomy, clean rooms. Not enough seats for breakfast which had enormous line ups at times. Brekky was ok. Happy hour brilliant, concierge was friendly and bubbly but only there 5 days a week. Pretty silly especially during Xmas and new year! Terrible wifi in the rooms very frustrating. Excellent maintenance and staff although our ground floor room had obviously been broken into which was disturbing but, well, it is las vegas afterall. Staff were awesome helping with an unexpected emergency situation, would stay again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean and reasonable”
Reviews.Author: derektt1
Reviews.Content: Nice condo w/ amenities like home, free wifi and buffet breakfast. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: KenRM1
Reviews.Content: My wife booked one bed suite We had a great time The resort is a non-gambling Hotel. The suite's have a fully equipped kitchen with marble countertops, fridge, stove, toaster etc. and are well maintained. The bedroom had a bathroom with a shower. The resort offers free continental breakfast. Staff was very friendly and helpful. The resort is located in a very convenient spot: very close to the airport (we did not hear much noise, though) and close to the southern end of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Close but far enough away”
Reviews.Author: DonnaF90
Reviews.Content: Loved this place. My sister, daughter and grandson and his friend were initially going because we were going to the Grand Canyon and were basically just looking for someplace to drop our bags while we were being tourists. We stayed for four days just prior to Christmas. The staff is courteous and helpful. Our only complaint was that we were on the 3rd floor in Bldg. 3 and there was a loud humming noise all night. We mentioned this to the front desk (it's the generator on the roof) and they immediately changed our room. Since we determined it was too cold to try to go to the Grand Canyon, we enteretained ourselves with shopping and relaxing. We were in a two bedroom unit and it worked out perfectly. There was room for everyone. The boys were able to connect their XBox and the free wifi is great too. Someone mentioned the fact that breakfast was pretty ordinary and seating limited. We found the breakfast to be a great start to the day. We went down to the lobby, got breakfast and took it back to our room. Would definitely stay here again. Very good experience. T

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great resort!”
Reviews.Author: MitchellDeltona
Reviews.Content: I went with my daughter and wife for a week. The Resort is practically adjacent to the Hooters casino which is about a block off the Strip across the street from MGM. We went for News Years Eve and the resort was still very peaceful though fully booked. The staff is well organized and eager to please. It was a little cool for us to use the pool...we're from Florida, however there were frequently braver souls using it. The fitness center is standard for a small hotel with several treadmills, eliptical, bicycles, and weight center, all well maintained and clean. The room was immaculate and you can believe my wife and I went over it thoroughly. The free breakfasts were awesome and for RCI guests they delivered to the room. Free scrambled eggs, bacon, bagels, coffee, fruit juice, and cereal every day...AWESOME. Would recommend for anyone. Even the internet worked all the time, a rarity in my experience these days.

Reviews.Title: “Have a complaint....too bad for you”
Reviews.Author: kavoss
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1/2-7/11 and first impression was "this is nice". Good location and security. First night went to sleep and thought the person upstairs was going to come through the ceiling. Heard every step they took. Wasn't their fault, faulty construction as you heard every step. Called the front desk 2x and they had no solution. Asked to speak to manager, who was in a meeting, and he never called us. I wear ear plugs to sleep and it still woke me up. I have knee issues so staying on 1st floor was only option as stairs are steep. Took shower in 2nd bathroom and stood in 1 inch of water during entire shower. Flat screens in bedrooms and living room were nice as was the gas fireplace. Staff had good suggestions on food options not on strip. Probably won't stay again as there are too many options and I like to sleep. I'm an RCI points member and this was my first time staying and probably last.

Reviews.Title: “great condo”
Reviews.Author: 108peter
Reviews.Content: dont miss out on this place. great location nice and quiet in the evenins, lovely room. bril free b/fast and free bar 5pm till 7-30pm. 5 mins from a/port. 3mins walk to mgm grand

Reviews.Title: “Nice and quiet resort near the Strip by MGM Grand”
Reviews.Author: Teribel
Reviews.Content: This is our second time staying at this resort. We chose to return as we are Shell Vacation Club Members and find it worth the points and we love their complimentary breakfast, their excellent service and free wifi which are not included in the room charge of most of those 4 or 5 star huge Vegas hotels would offer, plus it's smoke-free! A bit disappointed that they cancelled the Wednesday Manager's reception, but they still have weekday's happy hour/reception with compliementary wine and beer with a round of bingo. Don't get me wrong, it's nothing to do lose as you didn't get to pay for the bingo. It's just for fun so even a four-year-old can join and play. Just one thing about the pull-out sofa as our 14-year-old complained after his 1st night sleep that the springs were kinda broken so he ended up sleeping on the lounger. Otherwise, everything is fine. We will probably come back if we have a chance to visit Vegas again!

Reviews.Title: “The more quieter side of Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Spicki
Reviews.Content: I booked a 2-bedroom condo based on the positive reviews here at Tripadvisor and was not disappointed. The resort is a non-gambling facility and since it is owned and operated by a timeshare company (Shell Hospitality) the rooms are either Studios, 1-bdr or 2-bdr condos. The condos have a fully equipped kitchen with marble countertops, fridge, stove, toaster etc. and are well maintained. The bathrooms were a little on the small side, but were clean like the rest of our condo. The master bedroom had a bathroom with a shower while the 2nd bathroom had a tub. The resort offers free continental breakfast which in my opinion spoiled the exclusive atmosphere you find in the rooms, since the breakfast area is way to small. Same goes for the pool area. While nicely modelled, it is way to small considering the size of the resort. Staff was very friendly and helpful. The resort is located in a very convenient spot: very close to the airport (we did not hear much noise, though) and close to the southern end of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Rest and Relaxation”
Reviews.Author: margsalady
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two weeks. The accommodation is immaculate and spacious. The front desk staff are most helpful and courteous. I was fortunate enough to have the breakfast served in my room and the ladies who served it were always pleasant an d cheerful, the breakfast is ordered the night before from the menu and arrives at the time requested. there was ample food to c hoose from. Always a bright c heery goodmorning from either Gloria or Clara when they came and asking if there was anything else they could do. There is a small gym and a lov ely heated pool area with two spas and bbq facilities. The manager's evening reception was an opportunity to meet fellow guests. I had a most enjoyable time here.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, without the smoke and noise of LV”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl C
Reviews.Content: 19 Dec - 24 Dec Check in was abit of a wait, but they apologize for the delay. They automatically ask for your credit card and ID, before you do that, ask them what it is for? Usually it is for the $100 deposit damage deposit for your stay, we did not give them our credit card, instead we gave them $100 cash as recommended by the reviewers. They will give you a receipt and you can get your damage deposit when you check out, make sure you get the receipt from them before you leave the front desk. Room was clean with a full service kitchen, (we did not use them to their fullest extend). They have mixer with baking sheet, blender for making margaritas etc. Very well equipped. They have a temperature control in the room that you can customize the temperature of the room that you like, it is quite noisy but we were fine with it. Room: We were pleased with the room, no complaints Pool : Too cold, we did not use it Fitness Room: It was decent with different equipment Breakfast : Good spread, as per other reviews, there is no space for eating. Go early to get your breakfast and bring everything up to your room and have a good breakfast with nice plates and cutlery instead of plastic ones. Just bring the bread up as you have a toaster in the room. Eat in peace and in style! Bring a container to fill up the juice of your choice. I was taking breakfast for both and you get pretty good at packing the breakfast for two although I have to do 2 trips for coffee. Staff: Friendly Parking: Good, ample parking. I would recommend renting a car, it is easier to get around Las Vegas Great for couples and family, I would definitely go back there again

Reviews.Title: “Good For Short Break”
Reviews.Author: Tafftraveller
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally located just two blocks off the strip, especially if you want good value. This is a fairly small complex by Las Vegas standards. The rooms we were allocated were large and reasonably furnished. One of the rooms did not smell very fresh and as soon as this was pointed out the room was changed. The complimentary breakfast was OK but you will need some luck to find a seat to eat it. The small seating area was very full when we went there.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: eastcoaster0
Reviews.Content: I need to state first and foremost; this is not a "Vegas" hotel. There are no slot machines, no entertainment, no crazy lights or loud music. If this is your first time to Vegas, and you are young, single, ready to party 24/7, do not stay here. This was our 3rd time to Vegas, and my husband and I have done the casino hotel, the shows, the craziness, and we were ready to lay back and take the strip in small doses. This hotel could be in any city in the US. The strip is right outside your door, but still a world away if you get what I mean. It was quiet, clean, and spacious. We did not take advantage of the heated pool as it was FREEZING outside, -2C on some mornings! The breakfast was nice for the first 2 days or so, then got old. Bacon one day, sausage the next. Very limited healthy options. I was hoping for bagels, muffins, diced fruit, yogurt, etc, but all they served was cereal and perhaps bananas or apples. As least the bread was whole wheat! My husband loved it though, and had a big helping each day. The service was exceptional. About 30mins after we checked in, the front desk called to make sure our room was ok and wanted to know if we needed anything, to just give them a call anytime. How nice is that? Lots of families, older couples, a few younger groups but they were the exception. If we ever go back to Vegas again, we will stay here for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Very, very average at best.”
Reviews.Author: B H
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights. It was minimally decent. Old, dated, nothing special. DO NOT expect fancy. You will be disappointed. I stayed here through Shell Vacations and was charged $42 Housekeeping Fee. I stayed for 2 nights and did NOT receive housekeeping. When I balked at that, and clarified that I was being charged 1/3 of my room rate for a service I did not receive, they simply said, "Yes, that is corrrect." ????? I know this is mostly a Shell Vacation Club problem, but I do believe that the hotel should have reduced the rate. $42 for housekeeping that you didn't receive is just a ripoff. Would have much rathered get a good deal at one of the nice casinos and probably come out spending less $$ in the end. Vegas is fun, but it's ridiculous fees like this that won't have me coming back.

Reviews.Title: “A Superb No Fee Resort with excellent service and nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: GMoniNYC
Reviews.Content: I spent a week in August 2011 at the Desert Rose Resort, located 1 ½ block from S. Las Vegas Boulevard and 10 minutes drive from the Las Vegas Airport. The front desk staff was helpful when asked about the location of the nearest grocery store, and for a late checkout, check-in was a breeze, The suite was quite spacious and clean, from the stove top to the dishwasher in the fully equipped kitchen, to the bathroom. The Resort features includes a daily buffet breakfast, a free USA Today newspaper is available at gift shop, free wireless internet, and free parking. A cocktail reception in the breakfast area, Monday through Thursday with beer, wine, soft drinks and light snacks. There is also a pool and spa area, a barbeque area where you can BBQ poolside and a gym; and yes, the machines all worked. Laundry facilities are available in building’s laundry room, an iron and ironing board provided in the suite. The concierge is quite knowledgeable about what’s happening around Las Vegas, was helpful in scheduling a Grand Canyon tour –– Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: GeokTin
Reviews.Content: Stayed there in Dec 2011 - 2 bedroom apartment with 2 toilets and well equipped kitchen. Spacious, cosy and clean. Light breakfast provided was a good start of the day but indoor sitting places limited as it was cold sitting outside during Dec period. Staff were friendly, helpful and informative. Would highly recommend this place and would definitely go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “WILL DEFINITELY STAY AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: sfugate
Reviews.Content: We chose Desert Rose because of the great reviews. We went for Christmas. A terrific value and a nice hotel. The private bedroom, living room, full kitchen and small dining room were wonderful. It was great to have the included breakfast buffet (the menu is the same every day with scrambled eggs, sausage, toast, cereal , juices and coffee). The location is great--withing walking distance to MGM grand and many other spots, as well as the monorail. We will stay here for our next visit to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty releaxed for Vegas”
Reviews.Author: GregRidgecrest_CA
Reviews.Content: This place is great if you are going to Vegas for something other than partying. I went for IT training that was onsite and I couldn't have been more delighted. The rooms are very large, clean, and well-furnished. Grounds are somewhate confusing, but clean and nice. The lobby is great, I even got used to the adult contempary music they piped in. Good free breakfast, and happy hour during the week was great also. Its about a block to the strip so the location isn't the best, but I liked it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Freckly68
Reviews.Content: If you want a clean (if a little tired), large, well equipped and quiet room at a great price then this is the place for you. OK, so it doesn't have the amenities or service of the big Vegas hotels but that's why you are paying a third of the price. Despite that, you still get a free breakfast, a 'happy hour' with free wine or beer Monday-Thursday, huge rooms and peace and quiet 10 minutes from the strip. There is a Coco's diner around the corner and a general store a block away for those essentials (turn right on Tropicana Ave) and if you want to save some cash there are bus stops nearby that get you anywhere you want to go in Vegas for $5 a day (e.g. the bus stop on Tropicana Avenue takes you directly to Fremont St). All in all, great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for Price”
Reviews.Author: TlgSsr
Reviews.Content: I was surprised at how close Desert Rose is to the Strip. The airport shuttle pick up/drop off is available. The breakfast consists of scrambled eggs, meat, toast, cereal, juices, oatmeal and Starbucks coffee. It is decent and saves a lot of money. The rooms show sign of age, but were clean and in decent shape. Friendly staff with easy check in. If you are looking for upscale glamour, stay somewhere else. If you want a clean and comfortable place to stay for a reasonable price, stay at the Desert Rose.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value.”
Reviews.Author: thiagomarzagao
Reviews.Content: It was just a 5-minute walk off the Strip. The room was enormous: it was actually an apartment, with a fully-equiped kitchen, a living room, a small balcony, a bedroom, and a bathroom. Everything was clean and working properly. The front desk staff and the concierge were always very helpful with our requests. Breakfast was included and ok. In total, I paid about $300 for an entire week, whereas at the big casinos you may pay $300 for a single night. I have no real complaints, only minor issues I mention here for the sake of completeness: the elevator and the lobby had a funny smell; the TVs were not flat screen; and at night, that short walk to or from the Strip is quite desert (I was there in December, I suppose it may be different in the high season). All things considered, I would definitely stay there again and I strongly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Decent but not all that”
Reviews.Author: RREC
Reviews.Content: Not sure why the desert rose gets such glowing reviews. It's decent, and a fairly good value but it's not as great as it sounds. The good: Check in was quick, people were nice. Decent value, 2 br suites for the price was nice. Avoid 4322 (and possibly all corner 2 br units), looking old and a very bad room layout. 4322 is better, more on that later. Decent breakfast. Hot food but very basic. Eggs, sausage or bacon, cereal ,breads. Handy to fuel up and included in price is always nice. Seating is a big problem though, although common in hotels, they are very short on tables. Pretty good location, you can get to the MGM quick, especially if you hop the back wall. If you have to walk around Hooters, it can be a bit more of a walk. No courtesy shuttle. The Bad: Looks and feels it's age. Exterior and interior wall surfaces are very 1980 and it ages the facility. They've done quite a bit of updating but age is very apparent. Things like old tube tv's make it look very old as well. The beds are not comfortable at all. Very hard. We didn't sleep well at all and my back felt horrible in the mornings. Maintenance seems to be an issue, our heat didn't work (thus the move to another room on the 2nd day), ice maker didn't work (or was just empty) for all 3 days(this is a pain, there is only 1 icemaker per building, on the bottom floor.) We had to walk to another building which required no less than 4 key swipes and a good bit of walking. Not as clean as i expected. Caulking in the bathroom was mildewed, corners were dirty etc etc. Not horrible but very noticeable. We had to call in maintenance issues no less than 3 times, I don't think i've called maintenance 3 times total in my life. For all the issues we had, wasn't any compensation or call from management, just canned apology from the staff. I gave it an average score because the price is good, but in my opinion you do get what you pay for in this case. Any more expensive and i would have rated poor.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for families”
Reviews.Author: ckwc
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights at the beginning of December and reserved a 2 bedroom unit. The unit was quite spacious with a full kitchen, 2 bedrooms, 2 full bathrooms, and a good-sized lounge area that a had a L shaped couch (pull-out couch + chaise lounge). The room was clean and well-equipped when we checked in. The only minor complaints were that the rooms felt a little dark as there were no overhead lights (except in the halls and kitchen area), only lamps with big lamp shades and second, the pack and play for our toddler was old and rickety. Our room was situated right next to Reno Blvd and at night the traffic was audible. Too cold to swim in the pool although there were other guests using the hot tub. The walk from the room to the reception area was cool as the corridors are all open air which just meant wearing a jacket. The breakfast was decent - cold and hot (instant oatmeal) cereals, toast and a couple of hot breakfast items (eggs and bacon or sausage). The evening receptions were basic with just pretzels or nachos and salsa for nibbles but the soda machine available and bar offering beer and wine. Seating in the reception area during breakfast and evening receptions was an issue at times since outdoor seating wasn't available (too cold). The front staff was very helpful with recommendations for food (take out menus) and already available printed directions to local sites. We got a great deal on our room and had 5 adults and a toddler comfortably stay in the unit. Loved the location and the fact that it is a non-casino hotel. We went to see shows at Tropicana and MGM and both were within easy walking distance. Also enjoyed being at the south end of the strip. One of the activities we would recommend to anyone is to rent a car and go to the red rock canyon (scenic drive). It's about 30-40 min drive from the hotel and is visually stunning (plus very cheap entry fee: $7/car) and lots of hiking trails. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for your money”
Reviews.Author: alice t
Reviews.Content: We have been five times in Las Vegas with a lot of luggage and a rental car. This hotel is wonderful. You can drive your car close to your room (suite). It is a piece of cake to bring your suitcasec to your room. There is a kitchen, a lot of space and a free breakfast. WHAT MORE DO YOU WANT. And it is very close to the strip. We always go here when we are in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Good value resort situated at one end of the strip”
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey08
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights at the resort. If you want to be in the thick of all the action, this resort is not suitable as it is located at one end of the strip and does not have a casino. Felt safe walking at night back to the resort which is a 10-min walk to the strip. Complementary breakfast consists of scramble egg, sausages/bacon, juices, toast and cereals is good enough to start the day. Starbucks coffee made available at the lobby all day is indeed a welcome esp when you need a hot drink during winter times. Did not get to enjoy the happy hour from 5 to 7pm as we were out most of the times. Staff at the resort are courteous during times of interaction. I will strongly recommend this resort to others.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Linda W
Reviews.Content: Travelled with my teenage children from Australia. This was the perfect location for us as it was away from the noise, hussle and bussle of the strip. The two bedroom apartment was excellent with two bathrooms which allowed us to get ready quickly in the mornings. Breakfast was fine and the staff were helpful and friendly. I would return to this resort without hesitation, but maybe in the hotter months so we can make use of the pool. We also stayed in Beverley Hills, Anaheim and Big Bear Lake and the Desert Rose Resort was as good if not better than all our other apartments.

Reviews.Title: “quiet, comfortable, good location, great value”
Reviews.Author: TG64
Reviews.Content: We were traveling with a friend on a week-long vacation and wanted accommodations that would allow us to make our own meals and have plenty of space and privacy for everyone. This extended-stay, apartment style location is close to the Strip and provides easy access to the major attractions along the Strip as well as highways if you're traveling a little farther. It is quiet, the staff is friendly, and a free breakfast and happy hour are provided on several days of the week. The Internet connectivity is free although it is frustratingly slow and needs to be upgraded. The hotel offers a free breakfast and happy hour in the lobby area -- the layout of that area creates an inefficient traffic flow when there is a crowd of people and the seating is rather uncomfortable when it is available. The layout of the apartment-style units do not provide any desks or other work space so the dinner table or coffee table is the only place to set up a laptop and work -- it would be nice to have a small desk added to the units. Overall it is a great value and a great location -- we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: tl4tl
Reviews.Content: I am a former local who lived in Las Vegas for almost 30 years this is by far the best deal around. I usually stay with friends but sometimes I want to just have a little mini-vacation with me and the hubby. Since I know that most, if not all, the resorts add on that ridiculous resort fee and I cannot stand walking through a smelly casino I opted this location. Most resorts will not even guarantee you a non-smoking room too, its actually based on availability (read the small print). This used to be an apartment complex back in the day, and I actually had a friend who used to live here. They were well maintained apartments and Desert Rose has done an amazing job with the conversion. The kitchen is fully supplied, fridge, dishwasher, stove, pots, pans...you literally could go to the grocery store and cook a full meal. The dining area, and living room area is very spacious and the bedroom with a tub is nice. There are no flat screen tv's but who cares? The tv in the room does the job just fine. This resort is within walking distance to MGM, Hooters, New York New York ect...once you get on Tropicana & LV BLVD there are trolleys everywhere. OH and did I mention you get a breakfast? Yes, sausage, eggs, cereal, juice, Starbucks coffee, soda...a breakfast you would easily spend $20.00 on before tip so keep that in mind. The parking is free, the pool is heated and no stinky smoke. I love it!!! Great job DESERT ROSE!

Reviews.Title: “love it~love it~love it !!”
Reviews.Author: donnernvonner
Reviews.Content: The Resort as a whole was fabulous.....perfect distance from everything!!! WILL go back!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place Close To The Strip”
Reviews.Author: barrassyard
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Desert Rose for 13 nights in September 2011 after our first 5 nights in the MGM Grand...The Desert Rose was a lovely place to stay for a bit of piece and quiet away from the strip.. The room was great with a full kitchen including full oven,microwave and kettle/coffee maker... The breakfast included was fine and included bacon or sausage,scrambled eggs,bread,cereal, porridge and fruit.....You also got the free Managers reception Mon-Thurs evening which included red,white or rose wine and lager,soft drinks( The rose was very nice)... The Las Vegas Strip was only about a 6 minute walk and if it is too hot you can always head from the Desert Rose through the back door of the MGM and then out of the front onto the strip to take advantage of a bit of air conditioning :-) The pool area is very nice and a great escape from the strip for a bit of sun bathing,It also has a hot tub for a nice soak...

Reviews.Title: “10/10 full size 1 bdrm apt w/kitchenette - brkfst included”
Reviews.Author: Mary Ann R
Reviews.Content: We are 55+ and were looking for something with a kitchenette to relax and have a morning cup or a sandwich for lunch instead of eating out all the time. We found this gem. A full size 1 or 2 bedroom apt just behind the Tropicana Casino. Quiet area, pool, whirlpool, free continental breakfast with lots of choice we loved it and rooms are a great $$ value. Bathroom toiletries like soap/shampoo included. Fridge stove microwave dishwasher/soap coffee maker/coffee A 1 block walk to Las Vegas Blvd.

Reviews.Title: “Much more than you expect, a wonderful treat”
Reviews.Author: oceanfans20
Reviews.Content: We could not have been more happy with our room at the Desert Rose. The location is great, only a short walk to the strip or an easy drive to the freeway. The room was amazing for the price. I was expecting it to be a bit run down and a little frayed around the edges. It was lovely. We have stayed at very fancy hotels and gotten great deals on them but this was so much more. The staff was so friendly and the extras were really nice. It is so great at the end of a long day (we were hiking) to come back and sit down with a little wine and relax. We were constantly marvelling at how well we did to find this gem. I would recommend it without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: alb2343
Reviews.Content: Just off the strip. walking distance from luxor and mandalay

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Jimminy_Cricket
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at the Desert Rose during the marathon weekend with the 4th night for a penny, and our whole stay was $270. Amazing deal. The room was spacious and comfortable, with a full kitchen and all the silverware, plates, cups, pots and pans that we might possibly need. The bed was comfortable. Every morning, there was a breakfast buffet in the lobby with scrambled eggs, sausage or bacon, yogurt and granola, toast, cereal, and either bananas or oranges. We enjoyed sitting in the breakfast area and talking with the other guests there. Sometimes it was crowded, but we always found a spot to sit. It's about 15 minutes to walk from the Desert Rose to the strip. We frequented the 9 Fine Irish Men bar at the New York New York and one night ate at the Mad Onion at the Hooters Casino, which is an okay place for an inexpensive meal. The hotel is non-smoking, which was wonderful after walking through smoky casinos all day. I would definitely recommend it, and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Absurdly,ridiculously, outrageously good value.”
Reviews.Author: WindyinSancreed
Reviews.Content: So you find a hotel one block off the Vegas Strip doing 2-bed condos for £40/$60. Got to be a flea-pit,right? Poorly-maintained with zero frills and staff who hate the world. WRONG. If there is a better-value hotel in the world, please let me know where it is. The rooms are clean and well-maintained with small but proper kitchens. There is a free breakfast in the morning and drinks in the evening. And the staff manage to combine nothing is too much trouble with enormous natural charm.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay !!!!”
Reviews.Author: bebestorm
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights at the Desert Rose Resort (Dec.1st to the 6th) !! The rooms are a little out dated, but it was a great location for us !! Every rooms are like little appartments with everything you need in it (stove, fridg. microwave etc.). The morning breakfast is also great (included) !! Complimentary drinks + food on Thursday-Friday and Saturday 5-7 !! We went to Las-Vegas to run the Half Marathon and couldn't have picked a better hotel !! Very quiet Hotel, couple mins. walk to the Strip... The beds are very confortable !! The emplooyees are very nice !! The closest hotels on the Strip are MGM Grand, Luxor, Tropicanna and Hooters !!! YS+HT

Reviews.Title: “Greatest Family Resort Ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: gardea L
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Deserts Rose was one of our most memorable one yet!!! The staff was awesome, the rooms were awesome including the full kitchen and all the appliances and kitchen pots and pans. I loved there free full breakfast. I will definitely go back. It is very family friendly and it is very close...just walking distance from the strip. Best think is the pool was nice an heated so we could enjoy a swimm in November and have a family bar b que at the same time in thier giant barbeque's

Reviews.Title: “Super service”
Reviews.Author: Bumpa2328
Reviews.Content: There were six in our party and we stayed for four nights over Thanksgiving. We had two two bedroom apartments and were very impressed with the rooms and the cleanliness of the rooms. The first night the AC did not work in of the apartments and they had a repairman there within 10 min. Although he worked on it for 3 hours he was unable to fix it. The next morning someone else came and rewired the unit and it was perfect from then on. Breakfast was very good and the staff kept refilling the items as needed. I would not hesitate to stay again. Very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: Lars E
Reviews.Content: The Desert Rose Resort was the perfect place for us to stay in Las Vegas. It is extremely close to the Strip (1 block to Tropicana, 2 to MGM) but because it's not directly on the Strip it was quiet and great for relaxing. We were there over the Thanksgiving weekend so it was extremely busy at the front counter when we arrived but we didn't have to wait long. The staff were all friendly and provided great customer service, explaining everything we needed to know about the resort. The one bedroom suite was great as we had a bit of space to spread out and kept a bit of food and drinks in the fridge. The pool area was nice and a good place to relax for a few minutes after spending the day sight-seeing. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money accomodation in good location”
Reviews.Author: jayarrscott
Reviews.Content: My wife & me stayed for 3 nights mid-November and were very happy (for the price paid) with the accommodation, breakfast, service and location ( 5 minutes walk from the start of the strip - hence quiet). This hotel would be especially god value for a family of parents + 1 or 2 kids on a budget, owing to the large room size.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort off the Strip”
Reviews.Author: kattim
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a week here recently when I had to be in Vegas for a conference. We decided on the Desert Rose from the trip advisor reviews and because of a special rate they were offering. We could not have been happier. Check-in was a breeze. We were directed to a room on the third floor. The room had no view at all - except into a nondescript inner courtyard but that said the room itself was fine. Certainly the room had all amenities we needed including a separate bedroom - essential when you get up earlier than you spouse and don't want to bother him. We thought the breakfast was great. We really did no cooking at all as we ate out for dinner and just picked up sandwiches for lunch. There was no need for any groceries because of the breakfast. The concierge was really enthusiastic about her job. Clearly she loves Vegas. We walked over to the Strip several times. It was really accessible. We found the Tropicana offerred the best choices for gambling and it was really easy to get to. If you don't want to walk though and really like to gamble you might look somewhere else. We however would certainly stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: delos002
Reviews.Content: I really love this place. It is close enough to the strip to walk. The MGM Grand Hotel is right across the street and Hooters Hotel is right next door. The rooms are pretty nice and spacious. There is a kitchen and a sofa bed if you have extra people staying at the room. We are part of Shell Vacation Club and I must say that this is the one of the best rooms we have stayed at. The staff is very friendly and helpful. I would definitely recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “DDR the Sequel”
Reviews.Author: Charlie5051
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd time staying at DRR and was every bit as good as the 1st time. We will stay there again. In fact, whenever we our in Vegas, we won’t stay anywhere else. The Desert Rose Resort will exceed all your expectations. It is awesome! And this year it has even improved by offering a FREE hot breakfast. Imagine how much money that is going to save you, especially if you are a big family. From the friendly, helpful and welcoming reception to check out there was never a problem. The resort cleaning staff are charming, friendly and helpful. The rooms are incredibly comfortable and don’t be fooled by pictures, they are a lot bigger in real life, at least twice the size of a hotel room if not three. Comfortable, clean and decorated tastefully. A full kitchen with everything you need and then some. The king sized bed is awesome and we slept extremely well. The price is unbelievable for what you actually get. You can pay top dollar and just get a room in a hotel on the strip or pay LESS and get a full on apartment. It is quite and so close to the strip it is almost on it.. Tucked in behind Hooters and the Tropicana and a stones throw away from the MGM. It is in a safe neighbourhood and enough security around to ensure it remains that way. Free internet and breakfast was a great way to start the long days out in Las Vegas. A lovely pool and grounds with ample FREE parking - no valet charges or tipping!. Along with the free breakfast there is free drinks and snacks in the afternoon. There is menu's in the room of nearby local restaurants that delivery at more than reasonable prices. This place will actually save you money staying there. This is certainly a gem of a place. I cannot speak highly enough of it and can’t wait to get back. Thank you to all at Desert Rose. If you need any more info contact me at charliemclaughlin1@gmail.com

Reviews.Title: “Family resort”
Reviews.Author: roja48
Reviews.Content: Great spot, just two blocks off the strip. No noisy casino, just peaceful and comfortable suites. Friendly, helpful staff; nice pool area. Just stay here and be happy!

Reviews.Title: “Great family hotel”
Reviews.Author: muggyhen
Reviews.Content: We ended up choosing the Desert Rose as we have four children and we couldn't find anything to accommodate us all on the strip. It was definately the rigt choice. Our suite was amazing. It was very well equipt - with every kitchen utensil you could want. It was spacious and perfectly clean. The staff were helpful and the location great. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “First Impression are mistaken !”
Reviews.Author: phil0264
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Vegas, to celebrate our 2nd Anniversary (We'd got married in the Little White Chapel in 2009). We checked Tripadvisor and in 7th spot was the Desert Rose, with many glowing reviews, and it was cheap - always a good reason. We finally arrived (29 hour delay in Philadelphia due to delays and fog) to be greeted by a very helpful young lady. She informed us our booking had been cancelled by Expedia as we hadn't turned up. "Not to worry", she said and with a few deft clicks of her keyboard and with a sincere and warming smile she handed us our key. We set off out and along the corridor. This was our first impression, which was soon completely obliterated. Those passages are starting to need a very light touch up, which a lick of paint and the the repair / replacement of some of the edges of the carpet would resolve (and I'm being very very picky here). We also passed a couple of the other residents and I must admit I pre-judged them (using the TV stereo-typing of certain cultures) and we wondered what sort of establishment we'd booked ourselves into. These fears were quoshed once we'd walked into our room. It was spotlessly clean, very well appointed with everything from a free safe through to a huge fridge, cooker, dishwasher, and even the essentials of a toaster, microwave, coffee maker (with free coffee bags, sugar & creamer), even a bottle opener. The bed in out one bed suite was what us Brits call a Super King Size (6 foot across), and was very comfy with as many or as little a number of pillows as you'd like. There was even a big TV in the bedroom with HBO & other well known channel on it. The bathroom had everything you needed, including shampoo and conditioner. In the lounge was a big l-shaped settee, which was big enough to sleep on by itself, but very quickly and easily converted into a pull out metal action bed. There was all the bedding, including more pillows in a big cupboard / wardrobe in the lounge area. Finally there was a dining table with 4 chairs around it, that was a mere dumping ground for us. To say we were pleased was an understatement. Next morning we woke early for the breakfast. There's a choice of 4 cereals, plus a granola and yoghurt, 2 choices of milk, 3 choices of fruit juice, you can even have a soft drink if you so desire. There is white and wholemeal bread, 3 catering sized toasters, margarines and a nice choice in jams (or jelly's as the Americans call them). You get scrambled eggs and either some superb skinless lincolnshire-type sausages or bacon as well. Finally, you can get genuine Starbucks coffee - which is available any time of the day. Hint - get there early as it does get packed, although if the weather's nice there is additional seating outside, and on one morning the very popular (and rightly so) sausages disappeared within an hour and due to the unfortunate timing of their next delivery, they had no more left. That was my only very very slight complaint about the breakfast. Best of all, you can load everything up on the polystyrene plates and take it back to your room. 4 evenings a week there is a managers special this included free beer and wine and nibbles. We only managed to see this one evening and the nibbles consisted of dips and vegetables, etc. We were on our way out for a steak and didn't want to spoil our appetite. Outside is a pool (we didn't check to see if it was heated but never heard anyone scream when they got in.) The loungers are very sturdy and comfortable, as my wife fell asleep on them. There are even 2 huge gas barbeques out there for anyone to use. The location is very good. Out the front and turn right and you'll head straight to the Luxor and adjacent Mandalay Bay or Excalibur Hotels in a matter of minutes. Turn left and you walk across the back of Hooters. As you get to main road you can go across to get to the MGM Monorail, left to the junction of the Tropicana, MGM, New York hotels, or right takes you a few steps to Coco's Restaurant & Bakery (I'll do a review of this later). Hint, if you're gonna use the buses catch one here on Tropicana and get a day ticket for $5. If you get one on the strip it's $7. And finally to the staff. I have never met as friendly, courteous and helpful a group of staff outside of a top 5 star hotel. The overall chain owns the Hyatt group and that sort of quality shines through in everything. So, the big questions. Out of a score of 10, what would I give it? - 9.9 (and that's being as picky as a picky thing that's very very picky !!!) Would I recommend this to a friend? Since I returned over a week ago this has been done quite a few times already. Book it, and get great quality at a cheap price in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless. Amazing for the price.”
Reviews.Author: Matt W
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 7 days in mid November and it was amazing value for the price. Staff were courteous and the suite itself was superb. Complete with kitchen, balcony, spacious bedroom and all of the gadgets you could need for a comfortable stay (including 2 40" televisions). Takes 5 minutes to get onto the Strip if you cut through Hooters car park and walk across the Tropicana bridgeway. Would recommend this to anyone at all.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden treasure”
Reviews.Author: Mick A
Reviews.Content: Located south of the strip and just a block away from MGM this hidden gem is well worth concidering for a stay in vegas. We stayed 10 nights and enjoyed the laid back, relaxed tranquil (no slot machines!) atmosphere that srrounds this hotel. Rooms are spacious, well equiped and air conditioned. Beds are massive. Breakfast is rather early 6am to 9pm, but theres plenty for everyone, basic breakfast (scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, toast etc and cereals for starters). Free beer & wine 5pm to 7pm which gets guests together, sometimes they play bingo etc. Nice size pool, with adequate sunbathing facilites, also has a gymnasium which is well worth the visit. This hotel tends to attract the elder guests, but there were plenty of young couples there when we were there in early November 2011. We used Hooters casino which is just a short 5 minute walk from Desert Rose, here you can pick up a bud for $1.50. Hotel staff are very friendly, and will make you feel at home.

Reviews.Title: “Bellagio service with a Motel 6 price!”
Reviews.Author: CircleCityMike
Reviews.Content: Recently our family stayed at The Desert Rose for vacation. It is a nice change from a casino hotel where you have to walk through smoky gambling areas to get to your room. Located just behind Hooters Casino, it's a short walk to plenty of nearby attractions and the monorail stop at MGM. All rooms are either 1 or 2 bedroom with a full kitchen. We went down the street to Von's supermarket (we drove…it’s way too far to walk) and bought food for lunches and dinners rather than eat out every day. Hot breakfasts are free each morning, which is nice (eggs, sausage, bacon, toast, etc). They have free parking and a Happy Hour Mon.-Thurs (free drinks!). Service was great; the staff was very friendly and accommodating. The rooms looked new and the property was very clean. The only thing negative we experienced was that our bedroom wall faced the outside walk and people walking by with noisy shoes or rolling suitcases could be heard very easily. This is an excellent value and when we return to Vegas we'll definitely be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Don't look any further...this is the place you'll want to come back to!”
Reviews.Author: Lihue48
Reviews.Content: There are three important requirements that my wife has when we choose a place to stay, no matter where we visit. First, a comfortable bed, second, open windows for fresh air, and third and most important, no noise, especially at bed time. If any of these aren't met, I will hear about it for sure and life will be miserable. But when they are met, I hear nothing but compliments and I'm a happy guy. Take note men, please your partner and you reap rewards. This is where we will definitely stay again on our next visit to Las Vegas. No question. We've stayed in many hotels on the strip and downtown many times before, but for convenience, comfort and relaxation, and free Starbucks coffee in the morning for my addiction, this place can't be beat. There are major hotels and casinos that you can easily walk to like the Tropicana, MGM, New York New York, Excalibur and Hooters to do your gambling and to see a top-rated show. Then when you've had enough of the noisy, crowded, smoke-filled casinos (don't get me wrong, I like the excitement and fun there), you can leave it all behind and casually stroll back to your oasis in whatever condition you may be (no DUI to worry about) to rest and re-energize for the next day, starting with a free breakfast. I can keep going with all the positive stuff but you get the idea. Thank you Desert Rose for removing any apprehensions about coming to Vegas. We'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “The friendliest place in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: SUEANNE4
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 10 day stay at this hotel and really coudnt fault it. The suite was excellent, well equipped even a kettle!!( most places only supply coffee makers) The breakfast was a great, sometimes eating it where it was served, other times taking it up to our room.. Gloria deserves a mention here a ray of sunshine so early in the morning and she and the rest of the breakfast staff kept the place spotless and replenished everything so quickly. The Starbucks coffee on offer all day was handy normally grabbing up a cup when we got back after a busy evening. The pool area had really comfy loungers and being Nov had no problem getting one! managed to swim a few times, despite slightly chilly weather, as pool was warm. Facilities like free interntet, safes in rooms and computer downstairs enabling us to print of boarding passes (big thanks to Tommy P for his help) all very useful. Even came back with no dirty washing thanks to good and very cheap laundry room. The concierge was also very helpful and had a lovely rapport with customers. It is about a 10min walk to the casinos which isnt a problem but with the rest of our family staying much farther!! up the strip did resort to taxis towards the end of the hols and was only about $13 from Caesars Palace. The nearby Tropicana Casino is really nice if you dont want to stray far any evening. Staying here gives the best of both worlds peace and relaxation with the craziness of the Strip only minutes away and we wouldnt hesitate to rebook. Thanks Trip Advisor reviewers and Expedia for helping us have a great hols .

Reviews.Title: “Another fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: Lovinmambo
Reviews.Content: Another really good stay at Desert Rose, we visited 2 years ago and we were still impressed on our second visit and will definately stay again when we visit vegas, the hotel is clean,comfertable,great location and the staff are lovely and helpful. There is now hot food avalible at breakfast which is a welcome addition and they still run the managers happy hour monday through to thursday evenings where wine and beer are complimentary.

Reviews.Title: “A smoke free good deal for a hotel”
Reviews.Author: mmd_11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel while visiting family in the area. This hotel looks just like the photos on their website. The rooms are large with full kitchens (they even have blenders, toasters and hand mixers!). This is a non-smoking hotel and does not have a casino with it, which makes it great for families. In addition they have a nice, hot breakfast every a.m. This hotel is about a block from the "strip", which takes about 8 minutes to get to. The only disadvantage is that the nearest Wal-Mart that we could find was too far away for us to walk to comfortably. The hotel staff were very polite and friendly. We will definitely stay here again when we visit Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Desert Rose Resort Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Beryl C
Reviews.Content: My son and I had a very pleasant stay at this resort. Located off the strip it provided us with a quiet place to stay although it was only a 5 min walk to the action. My son and I had seperate rooms and as a single senior female staying alone I felt very safe. The staff (especially Carrie the concierge) were helpful and courteous. 24 hour coffee and a complimtary breakfast was truly appreciated. The rooms were extremely spacious ....way to much space for me :-) I would stay here again and would never consider staying at the "big" name places

Reviews.Title: “Best Vegas Value”
Reviews.Author: Bailar
Reviews.Content: -We checked in 11/12 and stayed 3 nights. Only paid a little over $200 total (1-bedroom apartment) using the locals discount (residents of Nevada, California, and I believe Arizona). The room was nicely furnished and the only outdated items I noticed were the TVs (not flatscreens). Desert Rose is an easy walking distance to the Strip. -The breakfast was good and plentiful, but I wish they had bacon sometimes instead of sausage. It's free so I can't complain too much. The breakfast hours are a bit early on weekdays (6am-9am). -It is easy to use the bus to get yourself to/from this hotel and the airport -- take the route WAX and get off at the Tropicana & Koval stop. Runs about once an hour. A single bus ride is $2 per person. Also, if you buy the 24-hr bus pass at the airport, it is only $5 (vs. waiting til you get to the strip and the 24-hr pass becomes $7.) Bus passes are definitely a lifesaver around Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “An ideal place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Arlene R
Reviews.Content: The Desert Rose is a very pleasant place to stay when in Las Vegas. The complimentary breakfast every morning is delicious & has wide variety. Also the cocktail hour during the week is enjoyable. The staff is friendly, helpful & very attentive. I recommend this place to anyone who wants to be close to the strip. It is kid friendly as well.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place will go back again, and again.”
Reviews.Author: karenlrite
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this location three times now and have loved it each time. I love he spacious rooms, friendly and helpful staff. The location is super close to the strip without being in the middle of the crowd. I feel safe here, and love the extra ammonites. They have improved their breakfast, so it is worth waking up early enough to get it. The only bummers were the pool is not heated and needs to be. It was too cold to swim in. The hot tub wasn't very hot either. We tried to BBQ, but it took so long to heat up we took the meat back to our room and cooked it on the stove.

Reviews.Title: “Good honest value ... now thats a rarity in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan B
Reviews.Content: If you want glitz and glamour then dont stop here. If you want a great place to stay, relaxed, helpful, clean and with all the facilities that you could need in a sensible package where ererything is NOT an additional cost extra then stay at the Desert Rose Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in the Las Vegas Desert”
Reviews.Author: Cotlew
Reviews.Content: It was wonderful to land at the Desert Rose Resort, only a couple of hundred yards from the main strip. The prices of accommodation, the actual suite, with a full kitchen, a lounge and a large bedroom, were great. The rooms were clean, the staff helpful and friendly and the pool and spa were excellent. A continental breakfast was included, which, was a little un- settling, given the number of guests and a very small eating area. Hot food was included too, and apart from the crowding in the eating area, the breakfast was fine. I recommend the resort to any travelers who want to be close to the strip, but not right on top of it. PS. Stay away from the Buffets at large resorts like MGM. Food poisoning waiting to happen. It actually did with me.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay and located just behind Hooters. Near everything and great peoples”
Reviews.Author: fpi agency
Reviews.Content: This was our first in Vegas and this resort is close to everything with great services. Even though it was cold, the services was great. Has everything in the loitchen top cook all meals. The bed is very comfortable and does not lack hot water. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “good value near the strip”
Reviews.Author: parkinson42
Reviews.Content: Stayed 10 nights in October and had no complaints. Room was cleaned every day. The kitchen was fully equipped which included dishwasher, fridge freezer, microwave oven and large electric cooker. Air conditioned. Hotel was 10 minutes walk from the MGM. If you are going Downtown make sure you use the single decker deuce express whcih stops outside the MGM Limited stops

Reviews.Title: “clean, tidy and affordable”
Reviews.Author: heusm
Reviews.Content: hotel was good, very clean and tidy,great location just off the strip, breakfast and coffee included. the only complaint would be the inadequate staff who cannot book cabs and do not inform international guests of daylight savings, other than that cannot fault the hotel itself

Reviews.Title: “Rose indeed”
Reviews.Author: joe90gt
Reviews.Content: First visit to the US for us and I have to say I was pretty impressed with the Hotel - our apartment was spacious and clean - the actual bath/shower room was a bit small but there was a large washroom with sink and enormous mirror attached so that didnt matter, the power shower was really powerful with no lack of hot water. The kitchen - not that we used it much! was excellent with huge fridge freezer, microwave and cooker and dishwasher. The main bedroom was very comfy and the sofa bed perfectly adequate for children. The only downside was the noisy aircon but you get used to that and it didnt bother us especially as it was great to come back to a cool room after being out in the 40 degree heat. We were always up really early for the buffet breakfast which was comprehensive, I think it got busy later but we never found out. Desert Rose is located about a 15 minute walk from the strip, although we took the car quite a bit and did the valet parking stuff, its down a quiet road with no casinos so its a great location if you cant be bothered with the "lunacy" of the strip 24/7. The swimming pool (and jacuzzi) was fine and opened till 11 at night, I didn't go to Vegas to chill by the pool but it was nice in the evening after a hard day. We had a ground floor apartment with a small patio in the shade which was close to the foyer but not noisy, the grounds were pleasant and kept clean. The concierge ( I forget her name) was enthusiastic and very helpful. To allay any fears of our credit card numbers being used fraudulently we paid the $100 deposit in cash and got a receipt, no problems. Would we stay here again, definately

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: virginiagirl83
Reviews.Content: My husband, son & daughter-in-law enjoyed a four-day stay at the Desert Rose Resort, which is easy to find & convenient to the strip. It was a welcome place to come home to at the end of each tiring day. Each room is like a mini-apartment with all the amenities you would ever need. It is also quiet, which is a blessing after the hustle & bustle of the city. The only complaint would the lack of seating in the breakfast room. Every time we went to eat breakfast, the place was overflowing with guests, which is good for the hotel but bad for fellow travelers. I have to say we never heard other guests at all - only at breakfast. We would stay again & recommend not only for the location but also the price.

Reviews.Title: “This Resort was perfectly located and great value.”
Reviews.Author: macojays
Reviews.Content: My friends and I have just returned from Vegas. We spent 12 nights at the Desert Rose Resort and would definitely recommend this resort. Just a very short walk from the strip. And that is saying something...as there is no short distances in Vegas. It was great to have somewhere to come home to at the end of the day...to relax and put the feet up. As I was traveling with friends it was great to be able to have a quite drink and not have to sit on a hotel bed. The apartment was an excellent size and fully self contained. It was great to be able to get together with our friends and relax, and make plans for our next day in LV. What an awesome place...12days and we still could of stayed longer. The shopping, food and just the overall wow factor of Vegas makes a great holiday. I would definitely recommend this holiday destination to everyone. Hint....go with an empty suitcase, have very,very comfortable walking shoes and ENJOY.!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Netcom training trip”
Reviews.Author: jjcopeland
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel 9 Nov - 11 Nov 2011 for Netcom training event. This is a great hotel right behind the Hooters hotel right off of the strip. Each room is a suite with a full kitchen with dishwasher and fridge. The hotel has breakfast every morning and is a 5 min walk to Hooters hotel and 10 min from Tropicana hotel.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, good value for family & friends”
Reviews.Author: chrisMiddlengland
Reviews.Content: We choose it for the location: 1/2 mile to Luxor & MGM, 1.5 miles to Caesars. We didn't have a car, walked everywhere along the strip and only took taxis to off-strip venues. Despite the proximity to McCarran Airport and the strip, it's very quiet. The rooms were clean, only the couch was a bit dusty. Kitchen well equipped, all appliances worked. Comfortable living area, small balcony to sit outside. Internet slow, but reliable. Reception helpful & prompt. Breakfast average by US standards, free coffee all day (for UK travellers, it'll be a disappointment). Daily maid service considerate and sensible (no waking up at 8 am to make the beds). Nice pool area with heated pool & lovely jacuzzi. Really good choice for a family or group of friends. Tip: Coco's Bakery, a small US fast food-style eatery is just round the corner. It's open 24/7 and a decent meal including soft drink & coffee is about $ 15 per head. They do delicious take-away pies as well. For grocery shopping, Walmart is a 1/2 hour bus ride.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect to be with your family”
Reviews.Author: RenataChamon
Reviews.Content: This is a perfect hotel to be with your family! The rooms are big and clean, and you have everything you need!! The staff are very kind. The hotel offers free breakfast, which is very rare in Vegas. The breakfast is continental, nothing extraordinary, but it's a great kindness of the hotel compared to other hotels in Vegas. It is an excellent hotel for those who do not want to stay in a hotel casino.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: willempostTheHague
Reviews.Content: Just a seven minutes walk to the Strip (MGM/Excalibur). Clean, spacious rooms with a very dedicated staff. If you don't like the noise of the casino this is the perfect place. Nice swimming pool. In a few words: this is the home of hospitality!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: alfachik
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Desert Rose in late August for one night before and one night after a three day Grand Canyon trip. I was pleasantly surprised with the accommodations. The room was very clean, comfortable and best of all quiet. I only used the coffee maker in the kitchen but it was very nice with a full size refrigerator and range. I didn't use the pool so I can't comment on it but it looked nice. It was hot outside and the air conditioning worked well. The staff was very helpful with check in and out as well as helping me print my boarding passes. Everyone was very polite and friendly. There is also a complimentary breakfast which looked nice but I just had coffee and a bagel. It is easy walking distance to the casino hotels like Tropicana and MGM Grand. I was traveling solo and was comfortable walking back and forth-there is a security person who walks around the property. One night I was out rather late and did take a short cab ride back. All in all I was very pleased with my stay and enjoyed the quietness of this property.

Reviews.Title: “great place great location friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: kkhof
Reviews.Content: One of the easiest places to access and easy to get from place to place. Enjoyed the view from the room and it was very quiet. it was a great place and great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Holiday & Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shell W
Reviews.Content: We stayed here and it was in a perfect location. Lovely quiet hotel. 10 mins from the airport. 5-10 mins walk to MGM, Hooters & Tropicana. Rooms perfect, fully fitted kitchen with everything! The bed was so comfy!! Pool very clean. Grounds kept very clean and tidy. Staff very polite and friendly. Free Access to internet. Free continental breakfast (if you can get up in time!!!) 24 hour shop in the hotel. Another shop about 5 mins walk motel 6 so much cheaper and lots to chose from. Walgreens and CVS supermarkets on the strip about 15-20 mins from the hotel. Monorail was good but dont bother going all the was downtown las vegas nothing there and looks a bit rough!!! stay at the top!! Will defintaly go back again and will more than likely stay in the desert rose resort. Amazing Holiday!!!! : )

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel...”
Reviews.Author: nozza105
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from staying for 6 nights at this hotel. We booked it due to the great reviews on trip advisor and so we were slightly removed from the buzz of the strip. We were not disappointed. The hotel is a 5 min walk from MGM and therefore very close to the strip. The rooms were huge and the kitchen was fully equiped. Breakfast was good every morning although going early is important in order to get a table! Not that this mattered to us as we were keen to get moving anyway. It was great to have drinks available all day. We were too busy exploring Vegas to use the leisure facilities but they looked clean and well looked after. Towards the end of our stay we hired a car to go off exploring the wider Nevada area. The hotel had free parking which was really useful. We really enjoyed our time at this hotel and would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in the Desert”
Reviews.Author: crookieScotland
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel.The rooms are suites as opossed and have a kitchen area which is fully equiped.The hotel structure is a little dated but it is spotlessly clean and the staff are pleasant and helpful.There are 4 laundry rooms with modern washing machines and dryers.The hotel is about a 5 minute walk to the MGM where the monorail will take you down the strip.You can purchase a ticket for $12 which will allow you to hop on and off the monorail for 24hrs.The pool is small but was not busy when I was there.I have stayed at more up market hotels on the strip but if I ever return to LV this will be my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “For those who want a peaceful place to come home to”
Reviews.Author: ccrider775
Reviews.Content: I am a repeat client of the Rose. I always ask for a suite in the back, inside because I'm there to get some R & R. My husband is there for a day with me then goes hunting so I'm there by myself for 4-5 dys. I walk the strip, play some cards then come back with peace of mind knowing I'm secure. For those who complain about the breakfast ????? What part of free don't you understand and where else are you going to have Starbucks coffee available all day? The rooms are very clean and comfortable - free Wifi and a great staff. After a day of inhaling smoke in the casinos and streets, its a delight to go to a smoke free atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas diamond”
Reviews.Author: bapplet
Reviews.Content: I would encourage anyone I know to stay at this resort. It was so nice to be able to park and walk right in to your room unlike the casinos where you might walk a mile down a never ending hallway to your room. This hotel felt very safe, the gates are locked at all times and there was never anything that made us feel like we weren't safe. The rooms where so quiet you couldn't even hear the planes leaving McCarren airport. This hotel will exceed your expectations. Very clean and comfortable. I don't have one bad thing to report and we stayed at this resort for 7 full days. It was a wonderful experience and you won't be dissapointed. It is within easy walking distance of the MGM and Hooters resorts and you can catch the Tram at MGM to go down the strip. No smoke smell, comfortable beds & very clean.

Reviews.Title: “As billed.”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyAnglin
Reviews.Content: Clean, close to strip. Amenities are better than fine. Hospitality and service were first class. Continental breakfast and a wine and cheese hour around 5 were very nice. Would visit again. Met our expectations completely.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the non-gambling visitor”
Reviews.Author: adrianrys
Reviews.Content: We had a good-sized one-bedroom suite at a reasonable price, including kitchenette large living room and free breakfast. Although they call it a continental breakfast, it is in fact a large hot meal with lots of choices. There are tables inside and outside, but best to get up early if you want to find a table. Nice swimmming pool. Hotel is within easy walking distance to the strip and conveiently close to the airport. Friendly helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Close to the action!”
Reviews.Author: jdichosa
Reviews.Content: I've been to the Desert Rose twice already and loved both stays. It is so close to all the major casinos and is located just one block from the strip (just behind the Hooters Hotel and Casino). I love the fact that I can have a place that is quiet and relaxing, but can easily change pace by walking down the street to the Strip. The complimentary beer and wine happy hour helps! The rooms are very spacious and most come with a kitchen. I have stayed in both 1 bedroom and 2 bedroom suites. If you are expecting the bells and whistles or a major resort, then this is not the place to stay. But if you want a nice and relaxing place to stay (no gaming or casinos on site) and be close to where the action is, then the Desert Rose Resort is perfect for your weekend getaway or your week long vacation!

Reviews.Title: “BRILLIANT HOTEL!!”
Reviews.Author: wenrad
Reviews.Content: Stayed at hotel on 14th october for 3 nights, then the flamingo for 1 night, this hotel blew the flamingo totally out of the water! do not stay at the themed hotels, the desert rose is so much more value for money, its cleaner,rooms bigger and the staff are far friendlier! its a great sanctuary from the madness that is vegas! our bags were lost in transit at the airport, the staff at this hotel couldnt do enough for us, they even rang us the next morning to see if we needed any more assistance. great location, lovely complimentary breakfast and beautiful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Cakeroo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an amazing find! Really close to the strip, but without the extortionate prices of some of the strip hotels. Our room was much larger than we had expected, very clean and furnished to a high standard. Staff were very helpful and friendly. Very good selection of food for breakfast - cereal, fruit, toast, cooked breakfast, tea, coffee, juices... the list goes on. We went to Vegas to get married and I couldn't have asked for a better hotel to stay in. Without a doubt we will be returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice”
Reviews.Author: Sbo_11
Reviews.Content: The Desert Rose is great if traveling with children- rooms are big enough to spread around and kitchen is very handy. Decor is perhaps a little tired but it's ok. Despite being non-smoking hotel, we got an overwhelming smell when we first walked into the room but was moved straight away when we complained. Staff were very friendly and concierge got us some great tickets and gave us some good recommendations for shows. Handy to the strip if that's what you want to do. Free wifi was good.

Reviews.Title: “Top hotel!”
Reviews.Author: willempost
Reviews.Content: What a surprise! Close to the strip (MGM, Luxor, Excalibur), Just a 7 minutes walk. Very clean, spacious rooms and a wonderful staff. What else can you wish? Even a managers reception. Well deserved position in the Las Vegas top-ten hotel list. Definetely the place to stay in Las Vegas if it is not necessary for you to have a casino around you with all the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Family trip, with young adults.”
Reviews.Author: LJSurrey_11
Reviews.Content: I'm writing a fairly detailed review for people who are making this as a once in a lifetime trip and want to get the most out of their stay. Just returned from Las Vegas and a seven night stay at the Desert Rose Resort. Our party consisted of my husband, two daughters, (21 and 23) and myself. This was a treat for the kids and we needed accommodation that would allow us all privacy. Having done a lot of research I happened upon the Desert Rose which offered two bedroomed apartment with two en-suite bathrooms, ideal for our needs and a fantastic rate for the week, via booking .com. Price included breakfast and managers happy hour for the duration of our stay. Upon our earlier than expected arrival (10.00am) the staff very kindly allowed us to access our suite and we commenced our holiday by time spent by the pool. Reception staff welcoming and pleasant. The suite was well equipped with everything needed for a self contained stay. Beds very comfortable, housekeeping attentive with service every day if required. Pool, reception and communal areas always appeared spotless. Sports/gym room functional and adequate if needed. Block away from the strip, a real pleasure not to be in a casino hotel. Breakfast and the pool facilities do get busy, but fantastic value as all included. (Breakfast didn't change whilst we were there, but there was always plenty of it with staff on hand to replenish if short) Good advice from the concierge re shows and attractions. Regarding comments re helicopters, there are a significant number of flights, we didn't find the noise intrusive and it would impact on a considerable number of other prestigious hotels as they are flying down the strip! The only moan, and it's a very small one: some of the suite furnishings and pool furniture is looking a bit "tired" and dated, a refurbish of certain items would not go amiss but overall we had a fantastic time, made very special by being able to return to a clean, well equipped and friendly resort which came at a fantastic price compared to similar properties on the strip. I would highly recommend this choice of accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Lis T
Reviews.Content: I was very happy with this resort. It is very conveniently located, just a short walking distance away from Vegas Strip and is much cheaper than the hotels which are on the strip itself.
