The rooms were very clean and spacious, the beds very comfy after a long night out. The breakfast was average, but I am not fussed for food. Most importantly for me is the location and cleaniness which if you are expecting here, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing place to stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Kathy A
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Desert Rose in mid October and really enjoyed it. We had spent the 11 days prior camping so felt really spoiled when we arrived. The front desk people were very pleasant and called the room to make sure everything was OK just a few minutes after we got to it. Loved the fact that we didn't have to walk through a casino to get to our room/check in. Enjoyed the managers reception on the week nights (especially the free beer). Enjoyed the complimentary breakfast and coffee. Found that if we walked up to the strip on Reno Ave. rather than Tropicana Ave. the walk was more pleasant - very short walk to all the action. I also think the bar be ques by the pool are a nice touch. I will be returning in December for the Rock and Roll marathon and can't wait to stay again!

Reviews.Title: “VALUE FOR MONEY”
Reviews.Author: barrie m
Reviews.Content: What more is there to say ,Buffet Breakfast,Managers Reception 4 evenings with FREE DRINK AND SNACKS ,FREE COFFEE 24/7 ,FREE INTERNET,BIG ROOMS,CLEAN,location just off the strip easy walk, Airport just round the corner,good value,quite.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: Carol A
Reviews.Content: I am an owner of Shell Vacations and this is one of their resorts. Both times i have stayed here, the staff have made sure I am comfortable. Our last stay, on the weekend of Oct. 19th, 2011, I was given a room which had a leak from the A/C. There was a smell with damp carpeting. The staff immediately gave me another beautiful room in the building I asked for and closed off the damaged room until repairs could be completed. Upon passing in the halls, they are always smiling and asking if there is anything I need and to not hesitate to call. When I did call housekeeping for kitchen towels, they arrived within 10 minutes. Thank you, Staff of the Desert Rose in Las Vegas for an enjoyable experience! Carolyn Avalos

Reviews.Title: “A Home from Home”
Reviews.Author: Jeff07
Reviews.Content: Before returning to the Desert Rose in mid-October this year having had such a brilliant experience last year, I was a little anxious thinking it couldn't possibly be as good again. As it turned out, I needn't have had any concerns whatsoever because it was even better than I remembered! My wife and I already knew the location was perfect (less than one block from the MGM), and the rooms / apartments were fantastic (little things - like real coffee, not that instant stuff - left for you to enjoy in your own coffee machine) made me realise we'd made the right choice - again! Everything about the rooms / apartments was outstanding. I couldn't fault a thing about them and - to be honest- wouldn't insult the staff by nit-picking and making out they were anything less than perfect... from the uber-comfortable setees to the massive microwave in the kitchen right the way through to the air conditioning (which we couldn't have done without, seeing as it was in the high eighties / low nineties while we were there..!) Whereas last year they did a continental style breakfast this year it was sausages, eggs and toast - along with Starbucks coffee,cereals and fruit juices etc. but you know what? It might not have been the most comprehensive breakfast I've ever had but it tasted great all the same. Finally, a mention about the staff. They are all so friendly and deserve a pat on the back. Everyone we came across would go 'the extra mile' for any reason!!! They were what made it for us! Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “A rose in the desert!”
Reviews.Author: charles s
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Desert Rose Resort for six enjoyable nights in September 2011 at the beginning (4 nights) and end (two nights) of our 2000 mile road trip visiting places within the states of Nevada, Utah, New Mexico and Arizona. The Desert Rose Resort is conveniently and quietly located a short walk away from the busy strip and was absolutely perfect for our ‘non-casino’ and ‘non-pool party’ accommodation requirements. The building is smart in appearance and very well maintained. Our ground floor accommodation was spacious comprising of a large comfortable lounge with external balcony area, a fully equipped kitchen and a good sized double bedroom with an en-suite bath and shower. Each morning we enjoyed a hot buffet breakfast in the lounge and patio areas around the fabulous pool and Jacuzzi hot tubs. We have absolutely no hesitation in recommending the Desert Rose Resort to anyone and everyone visiting Las Vegas for a holiday break!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Value -- With All the Amenities”
Reviews.Author: pam_kukla
Reviews.Content: Our travel agent chose The Desert Rose for us when we needed to spend the night in Las Vegas -- and didn't want the casino atmosphere of strip hotels. The resort was two short blocks away from the strip, so very convenient, but inside the resort we felt as if we were in a lovely, quiet desert resort. Our apartment was very nicely furnished, better than many upscale timeshares in which we've stayed, a fully furnished kitchen, and spotless. Carrie the concierge was terrific and easily handled all our requests for help, information and reservations. Especially for couples or friends, we'd highly recommend The Desert Rose Resort. (Oh, yes, great complimentary breakfast with Starbucks coffee!) It'll be our first choice next time we are in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Seriously the best place to stay off strip!”
Reviews.Author: runmommierun
Reviews.Content: We have nothing but great things to stay about good ole' DR! We have stayed 6 times and have never once been disappointed. Yes, it is off the strip but it takes 5 minutes to walk to Hooters Casino or 10 min. to MGM. The front desk staff is helpful and nice and any of the employees that you pass will smile and ask how you are. The place is the safest around too. They have security walking around at all times. We had someone even call our room, to let us know we had left oir GPS in the car! The breakfast is what it is. Something to get you through. Nothing fancy but it does the job. There is free starbucks coffee all day in the lobby. We love that there is a full kitchen. We stock up on drinks, snacks etc. The pool is average but with music, plenty of lounge chairs, two BBQ grills and two hot tubs. If you are looking for a Vegas style pool, rent a cabana at another hotel on the strip with some of the money you'll save at Desert Rose! Free high speed internet saves you money too! The rooms and beds are comfortable and smell clean. We love that the beds are seperate from the living space too. We will be back to stay at Desert Rose every time we visit Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious unit with privacy and great common living space”
Reviews.Author: KOOTENAYGYRL
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a three night stay at the Desert Rose resort. This was a great property for our group of three. My husband and I took the master bedroom with ensuite. We never really figured out the shower, it kept changing from hot to cold. My sister in law had the other bedroom, she said her bed was comfortable although a bit firmer than what she would like. The two room suite was in good shape but the carpet was old and worn. The best thing about our suite was that we could be together but yet have lots of space that ensured our privacy as well. The walk to the strip was easy and I always felt safe. I think if we would have been there any longer than the 3 nights the walk would have become tiresome. And if you want the ability to just stop into your room to have a drink or change your clothes you have to walk all the way back. We found when we left for the strip we were gone for the day. The staff was very friendly and helpful upon check-in even though we were early. We never did make it to the pool, evening reception or the breakfast. But for our group this trip this was a great hotel choice.

Reviews.Title: “Everything I expected thanks to trip advisor!”
Reviews.Author: Oregontraveler4420
Reviews.Content: Five, 40 something moms went to Las Vegas for both R&R and fun city life...sample day....flew in on a Thursday..yeah for us Happy Hour by the pool from 5-7! Slept in comfy beds...mornings to the complimentary scrambled eggs, bacon, fruit, yogurt, cereal and hot Starbucks coffee....then swim suits to lay by the pool for our morning nap....off to get dolled up to enjoy the city....two very nice bathrooms in our suite with plenty of hot water for all 5. The deuce bus was sweet and worth the 20 bucks for unlimited use for our three night stay...met some nice people and locals on the bus with great recommendations! It is a 10 minute walk to the MGM after doing it 4 times it got old especially in 90 degree heat....but we didn't care! When we checked out we rolled our luggage to Hooters for a $9.80 ride back to the airport. Not bad to transport 5 ladies! Everything was great! Hotel staff were very nice! We are already planning our next trip back! I have used Trip Advisor and it's many members comments as my guide for our annual vacations....always I know what to expect thanks to the members....I never have had a bad experience in the many years of use....Thanks Trip Advisor and the members who let us know where to go, stay and where NOT to go and stay....we the people should decide how our hard earned money should be spent!

Reviews.Title: “Great for visiting Vegas on a budget”
Reviews.Author: KCbeachbum
Reviews.Content: If you want to visit Vegas on a budget and don't mind walking a bit to the attractions, Desert Rose is perfect. I stayed there in September with girlfriends, and it was fine - clean, friendly and free breakfast. We walked to the strip every day - only about a 5 min walk to the action - but usually cabbed it home at night which was only about $7. If you want a more traditional Vegas trip (fun hotel in the middle of the action), this is not for you. This is, however, is a good value and seems to be great for families.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value for the price”
Reviews.Author: fascyn8
Reviews.Content: Would agree with everything in the other reviews: the room was in decent shape and absolutely clean (neither of these is a given in Las Vegas). The free breakfast an added bonus. Didn't have any trouble finding a place to sit at breakfast or by the pool on any of the days we were there. The staff was very friendly/helpful. Did notice by the pool that the flight path for the helicopters taking off from the airport is directly overhead. Easy walking distance to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: MeredithMN
Reviews.Content: Stayed only 3 nights and thought it was good value. Staff very nice, wifi great, hot breakfast crowded but adequate. Location was perfect-close to the strip, but away from the chaos and no casino to walk through. I will stay here again. Only downside was small bathroom with bathtub with extremely high side which made getting in and out an adventure.

Reviews.Title: “Great for an extended stay”
Reviews.Author: Hal200
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week because our daughter was getting married there on a Wednesday and some guests were coming early and some were staying after. The room was big enough that we could entertain and didn't feel cramped after being there for a week. Best to go to breakfast early and towards the end of the week we brought it to our room and ate. They had pretty much the same scrambled eggs every morning so we went to the grocery store and bought a few things to spice them up a bit. Very quiet nice place to stay. Only complaint would be that the carpets needed a cleaning. I wore socks when in the room and the bottoms were black. Bring slippers maybe.

Reviews.Title: “Best price and best hotel for family”
Reviews.Author: Aristeuc
Reviews.Content: Huge rooms, very clean, nice parking lot, 2 blocks from strip and MGM, rooms fully equiped with kitchen, microwave, forks, knives, spoons, and anything you may need for cooking.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot to stay within walking distance to everything”
Reviews.Author: adawosdi
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night. One bedroom apartment like set-up. The front desk was very helpful. The room was spotless. Wish we had more time to use the pool. Missed breakfast but that was because we were out on the strip all night long. A treat to walk to everything. Parking seemed safe and secure. Would definitely stay here again. The rooms were very quite.

Reviews.Title: “10/10”
Reviews.Author: joanneheeley238
Reviews.Content: All the positives you have read from every review are true:- * spotlessly clean, *well equiped, comfortable, spacious rooms. *excellent staff. *good, hot filling breakfast, Starbucks coffee, nice quality eggs,toast, butter, ice cold milk and cereal selection. We went shopping at Walmart for snacks, water, beer and wine. Five - fifteen minute walk to MGM/Trop through Hooters car park, can get a little bit tiresome but worth it when you see the amazing view. Surrounding area a bit grotty, the odd homeless person and broken glass/litter, however its very quiete at night. Our room looked on to Hooters pool, so we heard music all day long if we had the balcony door open(we didn`t mind the music at all) Some of the rooms faced inwards, I would imagine they could be dark but this is only a very minor niggle. We never had problems with people saving seating around the pool,which was very clean, well maintained and relaxing, To sum up, the Desert Rose does what it says on the packet! Would highly reccomend for all the right reasons, we had a brilliant holiday in fabulous, lively Las Vegas, whilst staying in a Spanish style residence with a small and friendly feel.

Reviews.Title: “" A place to chill in vegas "”
Reviews.Author: Paula A
Reviews.Content: This resort has excellent service, an outstanding conseragie " Scary Carrie" nothing is too much trouble for her, from booking show tickets to helicopter flights to the Grand Canyon and even sorting out a church, limo, flowers and an evening venue for a wedding !!!!! All staff very welcoming, the room has everything you may need if you want to cook also an outside bbq area near the pool .Rooms are well equiped and clean.Breakfast hot and fresh, also fruit every day! Unlimited starbucks fresh coffee, tea and water all day. Happy hour free drinks monday to thursday 5-7pm. Location next to Hooters Hotel and a short walk to MGM Grand and the strip! No slot machines in venue so peace at last!!! We were a party of four adults and stayed for a week in October 2011.

Reviews.Title: “A Relaxful Resort near the strip”
Reviews.Author: colin-leeds
Reviews.Content: We have been to Vegas a few time and stayed in hotels on the strip including Aladdin (Planet Hollywood) Luxor and The Hotel. This was our second visit to Desert Rose and it is definitely our favourite. This time we stayed for 19 nights in September and find the place relaxing to return from the strip as only a short walk we are in our mid sixties and found the walk no problem. Regarding reviews most have been stated before but cannot understand about the breakfast as this is a an added free extra which is not offered elsewhere on the strip .The pool can become busy but there is always your balcony to relax and the towel saving around the pool is the guests at fault not the resort .The staff make you most welcome and a special praise to Erica on the reception whom was most helpful. The cleanliness and standard of the room is a high standard .Also appreciated we were not disturbed if the sign was hanging on the door .We did not hire a car as taxis can be arranged from reception and only needed to do a grocery shop at Vons which is about 20 dollars returned and the other time to the airport. We cannot fault this place so many good points free wifi, staff are most courteous and go the extra mile to make you welcome .The rooms are roomy with a balcony. Hopefully management of the resort will read this review as we would like to say thank you for a good vacation as could not send them an e-mail as their internet addresses on the website seem to be not working.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value when on offer”
Reviews.Author: Stormcab2
Reviews.Content: This resort is 3 star, but the value and facilities means I have to give it 5. You don't get a room, you get an apartment. Lounge with kitchen and all facilities - huge TV, washing machine, iron, toaster, microwave, fridge. You also get free wi-fi, parking, breakfast. When we booked a few months in advance we paid £36, around $45-50. We tried to book another night a week in advance but it was coming up with around $119! It is right next to the strip, I would say a 5 minute walk. I am a real person www.stormcab.com

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great price”
Reviews.Author: teddyoneill
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking to enjoy Vegas, without the having to walk past slot machines to get to your room. There is no casino in the desert rose, but the MGM grand casino and the strip is three minutes walk away. The rooms in the Desert rose are beautiful and the free breakfast is a big bonus. The staff are ultra friendly and helpful. I did have an issue with the price of a phone call I made from my room, but they are dealing with this query as I write. If I ever return to Vegas I will use the Desert rose again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean rooms, and pool area, shame about location..”
Reviews.Author: Jenfav
Reviews.Content: We booked to stay at the Desert Rose resort in Las Vegas after good reviews. We stayed in a one bedroomed apartment, which although a bit dated, was spotlessly clean, and very spacious, (apart from small bathroom). Breakfast was good, as long as you went early , if you chose to go after 8am, then its manic too many people in too slamm a space with not enough seats. Although really the only downside for us was the location, a bit too far removed from the centre of the strip, However that said, the Desert Tose is extremley good value for money, and as not many places can offer breakfast or one/two bedroomed apartments at the price Desert Rose can, I would still recommend to stay here, and pay for the odd taxi if you do not want to walk etc The price is very good, and the staff very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “This is the best place to stay in Vegas.”
Reviews.Author: Chelseabean1205
Reviews.Content: This is our third year in a row staying at the Desert Rose, if you don't want the hustle and bustle of the strip, then this is the place to stay.. The rooms are big, the full kitchen is awesome for saving money and for saving your waistline from fast food. We go to Walmart and Vons and stock up for the duration of the time that we are there. Everything is clean, this year we stayed in a 2 bedroom and unfortunately the carpet hasn't been replaced yet.. Not to worry, the rest of the cleanliness makes up for it. The staff are awesome, the breakfast is fine of you want to eat the same thing for the length of time that you are there. We bought our own breakfast items and ate in our room. A couple of mornings we went to get bread and the line up was a bit long. We would never eat down there, not sure why anyone else would either when you have a full kitchen table and chairs along with real utensils that are only a few mins away. Take advantage of your room and use it to eat in, not crammed in the small area down there. The pool is a lovely reprieve for the afternoon, just an FYI if you go in the afternoon, the pool will almost be empty. I still get a kick out of the people who think that they can put their room towel on a chair and expect it to be there 3 or 4 hours later. Another FYI if you go and you see this happening, just do what we do and remove the towels..The sign says first come, first serve...NOT first come and first save. I do not tolerate people putting towels on the chairs at 7 in the morning and expecting their chair to be there later waiting for them when there are others who would like to use them..Please have respect for the others who are there with you, if you don't plan on going to the pool at 7 then don't put your towels on the chairs This place is a quite little spot that you will completely enjoy. There's lots of parking, it's clean as a whistle, the staff are great, the location is good, wear good shoes if you plan on walking. We always rent a car so that's not an issue for us. I can't wait to visit the best little kept secret again..maybe a couple of years, but this is definitely where we will be staying.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value overall”
Reviews.Author: whitegold67
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for our party of four, being just off the strip means you can get away from the 'madness' but are close enough to walk back in. We had a 2 bedroom apartment & it was excellently maintained & very spacious with great facilities such as fridge freezer, dishwasher, fully equipped kitchen, 2 bathrooms(1 en-suite), 1 shower & 1 bath. We did not not cook or buy much food in as its cheaper to eat out especially being next door to Hooters were you get prime rib or barbercue rack for $9.95 each & budweiser $1.50 a bottle! The staff in the resort are very friendly & helpfull with Carrie from the concierge being the star of the show. She gives very informative & honest answers to any question you have & has an amazing bubbly personality. The only problem is the lack of sunbeds & seats around the pool. This leads to confrontation between holidaymakers at times. We'd rather they bin the free breakfasts & drinks evenings so to by more sunbeds & eliminate this issue. Overall a very good location just off the strip next door to Hooters & MGM(if that suits you) & a very good resort with staff to match.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and friendly”
Reviews.Author: catpo
Reviews.Content: Just left the Desert Rose.5 night stay in 2 bedroom 2 bath. Friendly staff, comfortable room, just great for our needs. Quiet away from all the hubbub but not too far away. It really was great valuse for your money. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Different but value for money”
Reviews.Author: VFWorcs
Reviews.Content: If you are used to staying centre strip in Vegas then the Desert Rose is very different! A longer walk to get to the action and much quieter with no bar or restuarant in the hotel for you to get drinks / lunch during the day. However the inclusive breakfast and managers reception are really good value for money and mean you can save a lot. There is free tea & coffee and water stations that you can use at all times. As per the other reviews, the pool side beds and breakfast area gets very busy - you have to be up early to avoid this. A tip for those travelling from the UK - you will probably arrive at lunchtime but check-in is not until 4pm - we had to wait around and then got a room at about 3.30pm - we sat by the pool whilst we were waiting so it is a good idea to keep items that you'll need on this first afternoon at the top of your case or in your hand luggage. The rooms are a good size with excellent amenities in the kitchen - coffee, washing up liquid and even kitchen roll was provided! We spoke with a couple who stayed at the Desert Rose last year and they had their credit card cloned (as mentioned in other reviews), so make sure you give a cash deposit on arrival - $100. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay but I think we missed the bright lights and action of the big hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect !”
Reviews.Author: BarbaraCanada
Reviews.Content: We booked this resort as it was highly recommended by a co-worker. We were not disappointed. Check in and check out was painless. We arrived a bit early, so they stored our bags and we were off to explore until check in time. We were on the 2nd floor , of building 2 , in a very spacious one BR suite , it was more like a small apartment ! Large walk-in closet , spacious bathroom vanity(with drawers for extra storage). Add'l closet with in-room safe in the dining area. Super clean , and a VERY comfy bed. Didn't use the kitchen , but it lacked nothing if anyone was inclined to cook ..full size fridge, stove, microwave, coffee maker, toaster , and dishwasher..with cutlery, dishes, glasses, bowls, etc. Complimentary parking, hot buffet breakfast and manager's reception Mon-Thurs 5-7 all the wine and beer you could muster in two hours :-) , Breakfast was crowded, but not if you went early . We often took it back to our suite , and ate there. Suggest you bring along a small tray to do this , as there are none available at the buffet. The coffee cups are small ( with lids available) (Starbucks coffee btw , yum!) ..but we used to take the larger coffee mugs from our kitchen for our morning caffeine fix..or better again , bring along a travel coffee mug to fill up. Many restaurants along the strip , the best bargain was right next door at the Hooters Hotel , a restaurant called the Mad Onion , $9.95 Prime Rib dinner , was excellent as was their chicken & rib dinner , also $9.95. They had 0.25 cent wings after 12 ..and $1.50 Bud products ..and the most awesome server Mikki ..she was a laugh ! The Desert Rose is not too far from the strip , take the shortcut across Hooters back lot . Its approx a $15 cab fare from the airport , be sure to pay cash or they charge an add'l $3 to pay with credit card. We loved the location , and the fact that there was no smoke filled casino to walk through to get to our rooms. Staff were very friendly and accomodating . We arrived about 10 mins too late for breakfast one morning , but one of the ladies who was cleaning up said not to worry she would get me something from the kitchen and came back with two plates of breakfast for hubby and I. Doubt if we'd get that kind of service at a huger property on the strip. The pool area was really nice , get there early to claim a chair if you plan on spending a few hrs in the AM sun . They open @ 7 AM. They also have two hot tubs which are really nice, and a gym ..that we never used . We will definitely go back to the Desert Rose when we return to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Yes. Las Vegas No.”
Reviews.Author: NHat
Reviews.Content: Just read the review by DONKEY3 and must say I more or less agree with what was said. We stayed for four nights 6 -10 October as a stop over on our way home from Hawaii. Arriving at the hotel at about 11.00am after overnight flights the friendly receptionist allowed us to book into what she descibed as a handicap room immediately although official check in was not until 4.00pm. The only difference to the normal rooms was the wheel in shower instead of a tub and availability of aids for the toilet. To sum up good points:-Good size comfortable rooms, location, friendly and helpful staff, and value for money. The only negative point as stated by donkey3 was the breakfast and lack of appropriate seating. We too were less than impressed by Las Vegas, a one day trip for the experience would have been sufficient, but if we were to return we would again stay at the Desert Rose.

Reviews.Title: “Nice quirt place to come back too”
Reviews.Author: Sandbarry
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Desert Rose for 2 weeks in September. It was every thing we expected from reading the reviews. We had a ground floor overlooking the gardens in block 4.Good breakfast every morning. We didn't use the swimming pool much as too hot & not many umbrellas they were taken up with people putting their towels on beds & tables at 7am when the pool opened then never used them we saw a table & chairs left for 3 hours .Our room wasn.t cleaned until 4pm which wasn't very good when coming back for afternoon rest as we had an 8 hour time difference.Carrie at the desk was very helpfull at getting us tickets for the Terry Fator show. We had a car so drove out to different places & to the strip every hotel has self parking. A lot of people who didn't have any transport where moaning it was too hot to walk to the strip.A very enjoyable Holiday & will use the Desert Rose again when we come back to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: sunlover86
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 years and loved it, so when we went back to Vegas we opted to stay here again this year. I did not enjoy it as much this time as previous stay. The resort is very good, staff very friendly, breakfast adequate to get you started for the day. However, I was dissapointed with my room. Carpet had several stains whick looked like cigarette burns and my sheets were not changed once during my 6 days...no BIG deal but I wash my sheets home every week and though they would do the same here. I knew because the bottom corner had a black grease stain on it and it was there the entire stay..The room was never vacuumed either..A little dissapointing. We also had requested a nice room as we were return guests and have sent family/friendds to this property but were given a room overlooking the patios of other rooms..not great to look it considering before we had a 3rd floor room overlooking the street which we much preferred as we could see the lights of the Strip. Would I stay here again if I return? Maybe..but there are some other great places to stay in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel near the strip”
Reviews.Author: simba070
Reviews.Content: Very nice and big rooms with full kitchen, bedroom and livingroom, even a balkony. We stay there for one week in September. You can walk to the Strip in 10 minutes. Very comfortable stay. The only minus is the breakfast, it is not enough chairs and also at the pool it is not enough sunbeds. You must be there early in the morning if you will catch a seat. But a good and relaxing stay with good parking space, nice and friendly staff and safe surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: subzeror
Reviews.Content: Great resort just off the strip - about 5 minutes walk from MGM casino. Great pool / jacuzzi / gym - feels like an oasis of calm near the craziness of Las Vegas itself. Breakfast was okay - not the best I've ever had but perfectly adequate and there is free coffee throughout the day. There is also a 24 hour shop for snacks, water etc. The rooms were spacious, quiet and with very comfortable beds. We stayed there twice, once in a two bedroom suite and once in a one bedroom suite - both rooms were great. We had a power shower in one of them which was a particular treat. There is a spotlessly clean and well-equipped kitchen, perfect if you want to eat in an save some $$ for the routlette table. It's very close to the airport - you're not disturbed by airplane noise but means you can leave the hotel and the last possible moment to catch your return flight, making the most of every moment of your trip. The staff were very helpful and very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant and clean.”
Reviews.Author: Carmen A
Reviews.Content: All i have to say is this is the best deal in town. Very pleasant people at the front desk. The rooms are very clean and the bed is pure heaven. They had breakfast and this was not a continental breakfast they had scrambled eggs, bacon, sausages, coffee, ceral raisan bran frosted flakes fruit loops and they had hot ceral oatmeal, fruits, orange juice, tea, soda, toast, all kind of jams. Monday through Thursday from 5:00- 7:00 all the beer, wine and soda complimentary drinks. The pool is not huge but very nice and heated. If you want to relax this would be the place to do it, it's off the strip no noise or drunk people to hear. I would recommend this place i had a very good and pleasant stay. Three thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “The best kept secret on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: donnajeffTamworth
Reviews.Content: we really loved this place! It was so inexpensive compared to the other hotels but had plenty to offer. The rooms (or rather suites) are large and have everything you need from enormous fridges to dishwashers. The staff and the concierge (Carrie) were friendly and helpful. It was spotlessly clean and we would definitely go back. We only booked a few days here because we planned to go to The Luxor to experience one of the more well known hotels but regretted our decision. We tried to cancel and book additional time at the Desert Rose but it was fully booked for weeks in advance. The 'happy hour' is fact two hours and although the drinks aren't the best wine/beer available, it's free as is the breakfast buffet so bear that in mind because the choice isn't vast but there is plenty of it. Complimentary coffee available all day too. It has a great atmosphere because it's small enough to enable people to mingle around the pool and we had a good time chatting to the other guests. No one we met had a bad word to say about it. Because of its location off the strip, it was quiet and peaceful, however it does mean that to get to the Strip, you have to walk but we didn't find it a problem. This place is a little gem and means you can have an affordable trip to LV with all the home comforts. When we stayed at the Luxor a few days later we paid considerably more for our room and there wasn't even tea/coffee in our room and as we were 16 floors up it made it difficult to get any!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: cazzalfc
Reviews.Content: Great location just off the strip behind Hooters. We stayed in a one bedroom apartment. Had a kitchen with all appliances (even though we didn't use them). Would be ideal if you were there for a while,, Breakfast was free, which saves you some money, also free coffee throughout the day. Managers reception during the week with free beer or wine and nibbles. Couldn't ask for more in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great location,just off the strip”
Reviews.Author: Lyn S
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 nights in 2 bed apartment [5 ladies] plenty of room for everyone.Location was brilliant just a short walk to MGM and strip.Free breakfast and all day coffee was a definate bonus. Carrie the concierge was amazing , getting us good deals on tckets for Cirque du Soleil Elvis and Love.Would stay here again if we come back to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ohtoberich
Reviews.Content: Excellent place to stay. I don't think that there is anything else that I can add to all the other reviews marked 'excellent'. The only drawback is that it is a bit of a walk to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing gem!”
Reviews.Author: 123pip
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing, costs about 5dollars between 4 people in a taxi from the airport! 4 girls in their mid 20's stayed here and can't rave enough about it, very secure with key card gates everywhere, pool was clean and more than enough sun beds although people did leave towels on them! even the pool has a locked gate, and is open untill 11pm! the ONLY bad thing was the walk from the strip to the hotel, i wouldnt reccomend young girls walking from the main strip to the hotel by themselves, its only about 5mins but the area is residential and we didnt feel safe at all walking to the hotel at 3 or 4 in the morning from the nightclubs! The room was like a apartment and had all essentials needed, we only got a one bedroom and 2 of us slept on the pull out sofa, was more than enough room! Staff where very plesent and helpful and their knowledge of the area was great aswell as maps and things to do! Excellent value for money, breakfast was included and was very nice with a wide selection, the hotel also has a 24hour little shop at reception selling all sorts which is very handy after a wild night in vegas!!

Reviews.Title: “Believe the reviews - this place is a hidden surprise”
Reviews.Author: OrlandoAussies
Reviews.Content: I spend hours researching accommodation before booking. For 6 months I kept checking reviews for the Desert Rose Resort, as there had previously been some issues regarding credit card scamming. As this resort seemed perfect for our family of 4 (2 adults, 2 children aged 10 & 13) I decided to take the chance following more positive reviews. We were not disappointed. Our experience was that the complex lives up to the current comments in all respects. We had a 2br suite which was very spacious, with separate living room and kitchen, and 2 bathrooms. While the decor was somewhat dated, it was well maintained and surprisingly clean. There is a fully equipped laundry room in every block of suites. Complimentary breakfast was standard fare, but still welcome. Seating in this area was not plentiful, but extra is available outside near the pool. This is not a modern, glitzy complex. There are some walls with chunks out of them, but this comes with wear and tear, and is minor in the overall picture of cleanliness, location and value for family dollars. As for previously reported credit card issues - upon check in you are asked for a deposit of $100 which I paid in cash and was promptly returned at checking out. The only negative I could make is that the carpets in our suite would have benefitted greatly from being steam cleaned.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful return visit”
Reviews.Author: sasksunseeker56
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at the Desert Rose resort again this year, only this time for eleven days versus one week, and we were totally pleased again. The accomodations were as clean as usual, the staff is very pleasant and accomodating, and we love the location. If you want to get to the strip, it is only two blocks away, transportation is close if you want to catch a bus, and the airport is close. The newly redone Tropicana is just around the corner, and is a great place to gamble if you want to do that. Hooters is right next door, and they have cheap Bud Light available at all casino bars. The weather was great, the shopping is great, and dining is always a fun adventure. We have talked other friends into staying here and they loved it also. Hopefully we will be able to return next year.

Reviews.Title: “very good value”
Reviews.Author: seagull082
Reviews.Content: a short distant from the hustle & bustle of the main strip , if i was to go back to vegas i would check out the availability of the desert rose . was very impressed with the service , cleanliness & comfort , the pool & the breakfast was a nice touch just abit samey but there are other places nearby to eat if you wanted a change . loved it !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent bang for your buck!”
Reviews.Author: Frank0336
Reviews.Content: Best hidden secret of Las Vegas.... Definitely recommend it to anyone. It is only a block off the strip, so no noises and no casinos or smoking unless outside. The room had a small kitchen with everything you would need if you were cooking, living room, separate bedroom with full bathroom off it. Hot and cold breakfast with juices/coffee/fruit was included in the price along with free wine and beer Monday - Thursday from 5-7pm. The rooms were cleaned every day and were very clean, it would be nice if the carpets were replaced, but it didn't make any difference to our opinion of the hotel. The bed was very comfortable. The front desk staff was always courteous and helpful. Free parking and internet. The pool area was very clean and always full. The only thing I didn't like was the fact people had chairs/beds marked with towels and they were gone to the strip for the day. So, try to put your towels on them early enough (7am) if you plan on staying by the pool for the day. Great hours for the pool area as well, 7am - 11pm excellent for when we got back to the hotel and needed to rest our weary bodies in the water

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms near the strip”
Reviews.Author: Ben R
Reviews.Content: The rooms were big with a furnished kitchen, living/dining room, and bedroom. The rooms were cleaned everyday. The breakfast was pretty good too. It consisted of sausage or bacon, eggs, bread, fruit, yogurt, granola,cereal, juices, tea, coffee. There were a few days when I was there they had free beer and wine in the afternoons from 5-7 I think. It was nice to go for drinks after the class I was taking let out. The Desert Rose is also pretty close to several casinos. One of which had a metro rail. I didn't ride it as a friend with a car was there with me for most of the trip.

Reviews.Title: “couldnt ask for more”
Reviews.Author: bankrupt2
Reviews.Content: Desert rose is situated just off the strip but everything is within easy walking distance. four of us shared a two bedroomed apartment. Our first impressions were wow! and that continued throughout our stay. The apartment and kitchen was well equiped, comfortable and clean. The bedrooms were on oposite sides of the living room giving each couple great privacy. It was spacious and amazing value for money. We later stayed at the mirage but if returning i would go back to desert rose without hesitation. the free breakfast was great, scrambled egg, toast, cerials, coffee all day. you could also fill up your water bottles for free. the desert rose also has free beer and wine from 5-7 four nights a week!! yes you heard right. free internet and happy polite staff. couldnt fault this place.fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the Strip but without the undesirables”
Reviews.Author: Jenny T
Reviews.Content: A quiet oasis that was a 5min walk to the Strip. After a long day at the smokey and neonlight-blasting Strip, we needed a peaceful and affordable place to rest our senses - no gambling, no smoke. Desert Rose Resort fit the bill and we had a pleasant 4-night stay at the property, which was reserved through one of the accommodation booking sites. Greg at reception was very warm and helpful during our check-in. The breakfast was chaotic though, so we had our morning fill elsewhere, or you can cook up something in the attached fully equipped kitchen. We had a slight problem one day with the door lock but it was fixed quickly by the technician. Parking is free for hotel guests and the weekday beer/wine evenings at the lobby a welcome touch. Will recommend to anyone who want to take a break from it all after a crazy day at the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Good alternative to tacky Strip resorts”
Reviews.Author: assenac
Reviews.Content: The Desert Rose is just two deceitfully long blocks from the Strip and very calm and quiet, even if the airport tracks are just next door. No spectacular decoration here : just large, well-lit rooms and a decent pool (don't count on swimming in it though, it is suited for kids). Huge parking lot. It's easy to get to, there's a airport expres bus stop on Tropicana and cab drivers know it. The perks include free breakfast (served in the lobby) and free fountain sodas between 5 and 7 pm during weekdays. All in all good value for money especially if you don't intend to gamble or/and travel with kids

Reviews.Title: “Perfect lodging in Vegas for kids plus G'ma and G'pa”
Reviews.Author: teachermama1
Reviews.Content: Yeah, I wanted to stay at an awesome themed hotel on the Vegas Strip. I could've had a good price at one of those hotels too. However, my husband and I were not alone on this trip. It was important for us to be away from smoke, have a kitchen and not have to walk a mile or two just to find our room. My parents were with us and they are in their late 70's and our children are 12 and 8. Not the typical Vegas crowd, huh? We stayed here for 2 nights as part of a 2 week vacation starting at Seattle, and ending at Phoenix (Grand Canyon.) We really liked this resort. We had a 2 bedroom, 2 bath and the kids slept on the sofa bed. We cooked dinner one night after getting groceries at a nearby Wal-mart. (We have dietary restrictions and it was nice to save money too. We had 2 weeks of restaurants....) Everything was extremely nice, clean and felt like home. No need for bed bug spray here. The only reason I didn't give it 5/5 was that the pool was very small and the breakfast below average. My husband didn't let the kids in the pool. We have a pool at home, and he felt it had too many people crowded in it and he was worried about not enough chemicals doing their job. We really didn't have time for it anyway. In 2 days we saw SOME of Vegas, but not anywhere close to everything we wanted to see without wearing out the family. The breakfast was free. We checked it out the first morning along with LOTS of other people. It was extremely crowded with not enough seats. Get there EARLY to avoid that. We cooked oatmeal with fresh fruit in our kitchen instead the next morning. That was way more enjoyable. I had read a lot of reviews about credit card numbers getting stolen after staying here. I can't prove anything, but my credit card number was just stolen this past month. It was the one that I used to secure the reservation online many months ago. My mother used her card to pay the balance upon arrival (only paid one night to hold reservation) and so far hers hasn't been stolen. So watch out. We walked to the Luxor from the hotel and it wasn't much of a walk, even for G'pa. We then walked to the Excalibur, New York New York then across the street to MGM, then back to the Desert Rose. Then G'ma and G'pa stayed in the room for the rest of the day while the four of us ventured out to the Venetian and more doing valet parking with the rental car. Vegas is A LOT of walking to see things. Overall it suited our family. If my husband and I ever go back alone we will stay on the strip at a fancy themed casino hotel. However, for our purposes this time it was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent spot just off the strip”
Reviews.Author: Robert7388
Reviews.Content: We have just returned after staying for two nights (Sept 9th and 30th) on our way to and from Utah we were a party of five and had a two bedroom suite which was excellent both times clean,fully equipped kitchen,two bedrooms and two bathrooms just what we needed,the staff were friendly and helpful,and we enjoyed the complimentary Breakfast plenty of cereals,toast,eggs and sausages coffee,fruit juice etc we would stay again and recommend it 100% we had no problems at all, and remember the complimentary on site parking.It is also very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot!”
Reviews.Author: Philly3145
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 10 nights in September and as it was for a longer trip we wanted somewhere with a little peace and quiet. This place is perfect. Yes it is a little dated but in terms of value for money you can't go wrong! The living space is excellent and it was nice not to have to trapse through a casino floor to get to it. Even though the pool area is busy (they could use some more beds) we found that people don't tend to camp out there all day so you can usually grab a bed soon enough. All in all a great base, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Average, Average, Average”
Reviews.Author: KevanEastYorkshire
Reviews.Content: The resort apears to get good reviews and if all you care about is price then it has to be good value. We (two groups of friends) had a two bedroomed apartment and yes it had everything we wanted-aircon, well equipped kitchen,two bathrooms etc etc no complaints. However the place totally lacks charm completely. We were lucky in that our second floor apartment looked out towards the strip and we could sit on the balcony however lots of rooms had windows/balconys that looked onto walls and into other properties in the complex. The pool is OK however it is not a place of any luxury and the pool area does get crowded. Yes there is free breakfast however its a bit low rent as is the night time 'drinks party' -lots of people filling up, eating as much as they can, in an atmosphere where 'quality' is a dirty word. The Desert Rose is not a place of sophistication and not one to which I would return. It is walkable to the strip, it is gambling free, it did have a welcoming events worker but....its not vegas

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the money”
Reviews.Author: kristinanethercott
Reviews.Content: If you don't need fancy, you just want location and value, this is the place to stay. We stayed here Sept 21 to 25, 2011 with 2 teenage boys and the 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom condo was perfect for us! Free hot breakfast and about $100/night to be a block behind the strip is an awesome value in Vegas. Rooms were clean, was quiet at night for normal sleeping families and access to cabs and the strip was just perfect. The front desk will call for a cab anytime, my only complaint would be the concierge desk which closes at 5pm and is not open at all Wednesday or Saturdays, so plan ahead here, this is not for the fancy traveller who needs elite dinner reservations, etc, but for us, it was just fine!

Reviews.Title: “If you want resort feel, 2 min walk from strip..STAY HERE!!!”
Reviews.Author: becky_1739
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed with desert rose in September for 8 nights and we LOVED the desert rose. The staff were friendly and when we arrived 5 hours early they let us in our room straight away, no worries! Rooms were huge and bed was super comfy. 24hr starbucks coffee in lobby is a treat and continental breakfast each morning consists of eggs, bacon/sausages + breads, cereal, juices etc... delicious! And a special mention needs to be made for Carrie the resorts concierge as she was OUTSTANDING!!!! Got us super tickets to any show we wanted and was more than helpful.. We fell in love with this city & when we go back we will definately be staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, perfect price”
Reviews.Author: HellsbellsShef
Reviews.Content: This place is great if you just want somewhere to stay whilst exploring the sites and sounds of LV. If you want to be able to walk downstairs and get the glitz and glamour of Las Vegas then go somewhere else - if you want somewhere cheap to stay that's a ten minute walk away from the glitz and glam then go for it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: budgettravelers2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Desert rose while in town for Barrett Jackson car auction. Chose this place as it was near Mandalay Bay. very close to the airport but there were no issues with noise. We liked the fact that there was no casino to hike through to get to our room. The kitchen was great to have and was very well equipped. The resort is a bit dated but well maintained and very clean. The included continental breakfast is handy to have, but we found the facility for it a bit lacking. It was usually very crowded and a bit of a cattle call. Staff were helpful. Nice that they provide a computer in the lobby. We checked our email and booked our boarding passes with it. There is also free wifi throughout the hotel. We had our kids stay two nights with us and there was no extra charge. About the only complaint was that the bathroom was off of the bedroom so anyone sleeping on the pull out had to come through the bedroom to access it.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant quiet(ish) escape in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: stevetupper
Reviews.Content: The Desert Rose is called a "Resort" for some reason. It is part of a larger group, and linked to timeshare people. BUT there is no way that you'd know that. The standard rooms (1 bedroom) are a very good size. The kitchen area is just amazing - a 5 ring oven, full size fridge freezer, and so on. Living areas are well sized. There is a good sized pool, jacuzzi, and kids splash pool - and even a gym (should anyone really be that active!). The pool areais locked at 11pm, no evidence of partying. The staff are all very friendly and helpful, the small shop is about adequate -but not if you wanted to have something to cook on the oven. It is about 5 mins walk from the MGM Grand, Hooters, and a couple of mins more to Tropicana, so location, just back from the Strip, is great. Only being 3 stories high, you dont need to wait long for the lifts on each of the 4 blocks. If I had to find anything missing,it would be the lack of restaurant for lunch and dinner. Oh - and th contant sound of helicopters, but this is Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: TravelinSteph3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Desert Rose Resort through Western Expeditions. The room was great! Loved the fact that we had our own kitchen area and living room, separate from the bedroom. All the rooms were very clean..Im very squeemish when it comes to hotel rooms and I was not at all here. The breakfast was average but a huge perk! Especially since I wasn't expecting breakfast at all. Close enough to walk to the strip..another plus! The pool area was nice for a quick dip. Alittle confusion during the reservation portion of this trip. I had to call ahead of time to add an additional night stay at the Dessert Rose, since we had to fly out earlier to beat Hurricane Irene. Upon our arrival, they did not have my newest reservation for the additional day. Thank goodness they did have a room available. I was also worried that previous reviewers were talking about being victims of credit card fraud here. I asked the front desk everytime I was there if this was something that I needed to worry about. The staff reassured me that they have taken the right steps to prevent credit card fraud in the future. Other than this, everything was fine. Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Desert Rose”
Reviews.Author: 4bootz
Reviews.Content: Stayed in September, it was lovely weather ( rained a bit ) but nothing to keep us from doing anything. Front desk staff were awesome! very friendly and helpful. Rooms are comfortable amd clean. Breakfast is pretty basic and boring but its free so whos to complain. The pool area gets very busy early on in the day but if you go after dinner you have the area almost all to yourself! Very nice. The only thing I did not like and its not the resorts fault is the noise from the helicopters constant flying over, every 5 min. Just a short walk to the MGM and the strip, in a nice area too not sketchy at all. I would def stay there again if I travel to vegas again.

Reviews.Title: “Great all round place”
Reviews.Author: CCandSS
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 9 nights in September. About 3 minutes walk from the main entrance to the MGM and about 10 minutes walk from the strip. The rooms are big, clean and have a well equipped little kitchen. The free breakfast isn't anything to rave about but it does the job. All are the staff are friendly and helpful, especially all the cleaners. Overall, for the price it's a good place to base your stay in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “All the good reviews are true”
Reviews.Author: Pretty_Kitty_Ottawa
Reviews.Content: Can't beat this place for value, that's for sure. We stayed for 4 nights in December 2009 for some ridiculously low pre-paid rate of about $69/night. One-bedroom suite was comfortable and well-equipped. We try to stay somewhere different each time we visit Las Vegas, but this might be one place we return to.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: YorksUK
Reviews.Content: A lovely off-strip hotel. No casino - and much the better for it. Friendly reception, spacious mini-suites that were well serviced. Free wifi, breakfast and early evening drinks reception. Excellent value - we will stay again when next in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: PaulandChris09
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights prior to touring the canyons and 4 nights after, everything was perfect. Loved the rooms and the total ambience of this laid back hotel. Everywhere was so clean and everyone so friendly; a short walk to the strip and so economical. My only criticism is the lack of space/beds around the pool, but hey...its not the Tropicana and apart from this offers the best value in Vegas. As suites, the rooms offer far more space and options than most 5 star hotel rooms. Great sofas to chill out and watch a bit of tv when the Strip gets too much! Well equipped kitchen kept spotless. Cant recommend this hotel too highly. Book it now!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Except.....”
Reviews.Author: Maritimechic
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay except our air conditioning broke down day before leaving and the room they put us in was overlooking the garbage bins -- not very nice. What they could have done is show us the room first because I would have asked for another choice. The staff at the front desk were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Value or Money”
Reviews.Author: tourerBrighton
Reviews.Content: Favoured Hotel (as long as you have a car) Great jumping off spot for South End of Strip. Staff pleasant. Rooms large. Large Fridge for your Walmart Trip!. Everything you want for a budget get away from it all.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families”
Reviews.Author: tinarussell1234
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. The rooms are sooo nice and large, what a treat to actually have a bedroom. Great place very quite. My only thing with it is that we love to walk alot in Vegas , but this hotel felt along ways from everything. But nice once your in the room. Great value for the dollar.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Sanctuary from the Noisy Glitz”
Reviews.Author: Laura45_11
Reviews.Content: My friend and I were not too happy about returning to Las Vegas for our flight home after the awe inspiring beauty and serenity of Zion National Park. We needn't have feared. The Desert Rose was a lovely, quiet sanctuary from the garish, noisy spectacle that is Las Vegas.We had a spacious 1-bedroom suite boasting a separate bedroom a comfortable king size bed, and a living room with a pull out sofa bed, all rooms tastefully decorated, high end toiletries in a luxurious bathroom with a deep tub, fully supplied kitchen and patio. Throw in a large pool surrounded by palm trees, and a staff that is genuinely friendly and treats its guests like royalty. A sumptuous breakfast ( far from "continental") with all-too-rare GREAT coffee was an unexpected treat. To top it off, the price was very reasonable for this Mexican style hacienda, just two blocks from the Strip. Great value. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “son's wedding trip”
Reviews.Author: salbraz
Reviews.Content: I went to this resort the week before my son's wedding that took place in Henderson, NV. It was a nice resort. I loved having a complete breakfast included everyday and the evening reception Sunday through Thursday. The linens and towels were changed daily which is different than most of the exchanges I've done in the past. Dumped the trash as well. Very nice. Also received a free newspaper through Thursday. I'm not sure what happened to Friday and Saturday. There were 2 big rainstorms and there was a lot of flooding in the dining area the first morning, but there were lots of personnel trying to correct that as soon as they could. My only complaint is I left the resort for one day and my room was not cleaned that day and I came back to dirty towels, etc. After a call to housekeeping, that was quickly corrected.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, if you don't mind a little extra walking.”
Reviews.Author: warren_99
Reviews.Content: We had a good room for a very fair price. The front desk was very friendly and professional. The breakfast was quite good as far as continental breakfasts go. I'd definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “a hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: clair24_11
Reviews.Content: we had our first family holiday to america with our 4 son's we had a great stay at the desert rose resort just what we wanted . with only a 5 minute walk to the hustle and bustle of the strip it is nice to come back to the resort and relax.the pool was a hit for the boy's and the breakfast's and happy hour were just great felt right home even played bingo alot of fun. the only dissappointing thing was our son's baseball cap was stolen which he saved up for to buy which is a let down we tried many times to get a response from the manager still waiting for one..i would stay again yes but i would lock all things away so nothing else could be taken

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: ReginaJaw
Reviews.Content: Went to Las Vegas with husband, 11 month old daughter and my parents. Booked a two bedroom suite at Desert Rose Resort. After all the reviews we were worried about credit card fraud but they had no problem taking cash deposit at the front (we got it back at the end of our stay). Booked our stay through Expedia and got an amazing price. The suite was perfect! It was great having the extra space for 4 adults and 1 child. The continental breakfast was just right. The outdoor pool was a bit cooler than we're used to but was still warm enough to swim in. The hotel was close enough to the strip so we could easily walk there. The concierge Carrie is wonderful! Booked a limo tour of the strip through her and it was very much worth it. Got free show tickets to a comedy show and it was funny and great seating. Definitely recommend the hotel and would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: julesy239
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights in September. The grounds and rooms were all clean, the bed was comfortable, full kitchen, small lounge and dining area; breakfast was free (cereals, toast, eggs, sausages/bacon, fruit juice; even yoghurt!); some days you have to find a place to sit and eat but we managed just fine. Just 5 minutes walk to MGM and the busy strip. Best of all it was quiet, which was most welcome from all the noise and bustle of the strip. It was one of the best places we stayed in throughout our trip in the USA. It's not fancy like the casinos but we loved it. No complaints, just compliments!

Reviews.Title: “Good location just off the strip!”
Reviews.Author: Explorer4523
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 4 adults and we stayed here for 3 nights in August. Our room was clean and comfortable. It was spacious, had full kitchen and was cleaned every day. Just a 5 min walk from the MGM and 20 mins from Mandalay Bay. A great location to get away from the hustle and bustle of the Strip. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great holiday”
Reviews.Author: alan e
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the desert rose resort from the 5th sept 2011 for 7 days and have not got one complaint about this resort,l can honestly say that it has been the most relaxing break we have ever had,it was clean,staff were very helpfull,5 mins from the strip, you must speak to the concierge,her name is carrie,she has always got a smile for you and is very helpfull if you need help with anything, overall this was the best hoilday we have had,we can reccomend the desert rose resort. alan,ann

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: peterrig
Reviews.Content: rented 2 x 2 bedroom suites found to be clean and very spacious but a bit dated.. pool area basic and could do with extra umbrellas for shade. reasonable location behind hooters and within walking distance of the strip. breakfast is a bit of a cattle market but why complain it is free. concierge is very helpful and friendly with no complaints about staff but if you want to sleep late put the sign on the door, more than once woken up by housekeeping after a late night, not what you want. internet in reception was useful but usually busy, good for checking mails but a bit slow. all taken into consideration good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, close to strip, family oriented, super staff”
Reviews.Author: Robert S
Reviews.Content: First trip to Las Vegas with another couple and we were totally impressed with the accommodations. Room was spacious with full kitchen and 2 bedrooms with a pullout in open area. Only a 5 minute walk to the main strip where the hustle and bustle begins, so when you want to relax, the resort is the place to be. Will definitely stay again on our return to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “What a little Gem in the rat race that is Vegas”
Reviews.Author: stcsgt
Reviews.Content: What a find, just staying two days but could stay a week as the room (1 Bedroom Suite)was great and roomy with a seperate lounge room. This is a timeshare property however it also sells rooms online and is worth a look at if you dont want to stay up on the Strip. It is a short walk to HOOTERS next store (see review on 9.95 Prime Rib) if you want a nice meal. Note to others The Desert Rose serves a complimentary Breakfast, YES FREE theres a change for resorts and its a chance to talk to others in the Resort. YES FREE WIFI IN THE ROOM where has this place been as it is setting the BENCHMARK and many should follow its lead, I refuse to pay 9-10 a night for wifi so this is a bonus. The staff are friendly and always say hello and how are you and always seemed to be happy, there is a small convenience store in the lobby for those last minute items. If you like to cook your own meals and have a nice coffee with milk then you will find it here, a fully set up kitchen waiting for you to purchase some food and make a meal of it, lets face it there is only so many buffets you can go to and so much Prime Rib you can eat.. Not far from MGM and the Monorail Station so you can explore the strip and get on and off so get a day or week pass whichever suits your needs.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location close to strip”
Reviews.Author: Bolto02
Reviews.Content: Recently travelled to Vegas with family and choose to again stay at the desert Rose. This resort again lived up to my expectations, if you are travelling with family this resort is a must you will not be disappointed, it's close to everything the strip has to offer and when you have enough the desert Rose offers a quite relaxing environment to come home to.

Reviews.Title: “close to the strip but far enough away”
Reviews.Author: jonathan b
Reviews.Content: this place is great. excellent service, nice accomodations. all rooms are suites with a full kitchen. ours had 1 king, and pull out couch. this would be a great place for a family with kids (though there are limited things for kids to do in vegas). we used the deser rose as a launching and landing point for our grand canyon vacation+vegas tour. it's behind the hooters hotel, which is across from the MGM. you can cut through the hooters parking lot to get to the MGM right at the monorail entrance. very convenient. from there, you have full access to the strip with a very short walk. no restaurant on site, but it's vegas! plenty of nice restaurants nearby, especially the MGM and NYNY.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!!!”
Reviews.Author: Firechik
Reviews.Content: Beautiful rooms, fully stocked kitchen, comfy beds, spacious bathroom, large balconies, big sectional couch in the living room, cozy dining room, well-manicured grounds, pool and very friendly staff. Great deal! Will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Vegas, Schmegas...”
Reviews.Author: CAROL13LongIsland_NY
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, clean and well appointed, although some of the furnishings, such as the TV entertainment center, was well worn and scratched. TV reception could have been better as well. Full hot breakfast was good, but very crowded. We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite as I have 2 sons that are 20 and 18 and they won't sleep together, so one stayed in the bedroom and the other slept on the chaise longue type sofa in living room. Full kitchen set up, oven, stove, full sized frig and I think I saw a dishwasher. If you need a good home base and want to do some light cooking, (or not) great venue. We didn't stay long in Vegas, less than 24 hours, as it was only a stopover to fly home after a fantastic trip to see many National Parks. We hated our brief time in Vegas, as first timers we were disappointed in how ''skanky'' it seemed to us. Walking on the "Strip", we were inundated by very pushy men and women handing out playing card sized cards advertising pictures of mostly naked women ''we bring girls to you in 20 minutes'', etc... Reminded me of 42d Street back in the 70's and 80's before the area was cleaned up in NYC. Our trip was for the National Parks and after the unbelievable beauty and scenery, it was a great let-down to drive/walk through Vegas. Will never return there, but if you want a very inexpensive, very nice, quiet place to stay, this is it. We travel a lot and work in Manhattan so we are used to BIG, noisy cities. Hotel: Yes Vegas NO!

Reviews.Title: “Vacation of Fun & Adventure”
Reviews.Author: BeemerTraveler
Reviews.Content: Recently traveled to Las Vegas and decided to stay at the Desert Rose Resort based on reviews from Trip Advisor. I must say we were not disappointed. The accomodations as well as service and location all provided for a great weeks vacation. This Resort is great if you're looking for some peace and quiet after enjoying the casinos and entertainment on the strip. I would stay here again when visiting Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “If in Vegas, on something of a budget, stay here.”
Reviews.Author: slimjady
Reviews.Content: Superb position just 1 block of the strip. You can walk to virtually everything. Very comfortable rooms and well equiped. Nice pool and spa area. Really is a super hotel. Don't really want to focus on any negatives because there really wasn't any but if anything needed improving I would have to say the breakfast. There wasn't enough variation on the cooked breakfast and no savoury croisants etc. But this is minor. Overall I would highly recomend and when back in Vegas will come to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Shhhhhh! Keep this gem a secret!”
Reviews.Author: KathleenSanDiego
Reviews.Content: I'm whispering because I don't want too many people to book rooms at the Desert Rose and leave none for me! This resort, just off the LV Strip, is a welcome oasis in a plastic desert. The suites are large, the breakfasts are plentiful, the pool is inviting, and the staff is top-notch and so friendly. We have been to the DR many times and have never had even one little problem. If you want to bring your family to Las Vegas and you're looking for something more relaxing than a casino, this is just the place.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing experience”
Reviews.Author: JGrFinland
Reviews.Content: Desert Rose Resort is one block off-Strip, so it is quiet, but close enough everything. Pool area is nice, rooms are spacious. Staff is really nice. Only thing not so great is crowded breakfast area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vegas Vacation”
Reviews.Author: allab0utme
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a great Las Vegas vacation. Our stay at the Desert Rose Resort was wonderful,the resort well kept,the free breakfast plentiful,and the people very helpful. We were treated like family. This resort is just a short walk to the MGM Grand and the strip just outside their building. Everything was very close. This was a very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Alternative to the strip”
Reviews.Author: RoyalNight
Reviews.Content: Just come back from the Desert Rose after staying for a week. At first I wanted to book a large, brash, typical Vegas hotel right on the strip, but I stumbled upon the Desert Rose and as it was reasonably priced with such good review here on tripadvisor, I took the plunge and am so glad I did! The Desert Rose is a smaller, quieter building down at the bottom end of the strip, near MGM Grand & New York New York. Unlike these other hotels which have 1000's of room's with restaurants, shops, casino's & nightclubs all inside, The Desert Rose is basically a large reception area with 4 blocks just behind it. Each block only has 3 floors and besides a small gym & a pool there is little else here. At first I was concerned that by staying at such a smaller venue I was somehow "missing out" on the full Vegas experience, but I needn't have worried; after spending a day walking through all the other hotels in the area it was kinda nice to come back to the peace & tranquility of the Desert Rose. The room was very spacious and comfortable, even if the decor was a little dark. Upon checking in I avoided using my credit card (after reading some of the negative reviews on here that all seem to complain about card cloning!) and simply put $100 deposit down which was fully refunded on leaving. (There was no problem doing this and reception didn't seem to mind) There are a couple of things just have stopped me from giving a full 5 stars; a) No Bar; this is the first hotel I have stopped at where there is no bar. Not the end of the world I know but it would be nice mid-afternoon to be able to grab a beer or soda without having to go on a sponsered walk to a nearby bar. b) Repetitive breakfast; The Desert Rose is one of the few (only?) hotels to provide breakfast free of charge, so at first it might sound a bit ungrateful to complain, but by the end of the week I was sick of it and wanted a change. The choice each morning was a selection of cereal, drinks (which included fruit juice or tea/coffee) toast, and 2 hot cooked items. The problem is the hot choices never change; it is scrambled eggs EVERY SINGLE DAY plus the other choice alternates between either bacon or sausgaes. In a week I had scramled eggs & bacon 4 times and scrambled eggs & sausages 3 times. Would it have killed them to throw in some baked beans once in a while? or fried eggs for a change? Also they stop serving just after 9am weekdays so no lie in if you want breakfast here! c) Mon-Thurs 5m-7pm they have a "happy hour"; basically there is a little serving hatch that they open where they will give you a plastic beaker of Miller beer, or house red or white wine, so again, not much variety or choice. They also switch on the soft drinks machines from breakfast so you can get juice or cola. It also says "bar snacks" but this turned out to simply be a big bowl of pretzels. d) small(ish) pool means fighting for sunbeds. This is a common problem at most hotels, and despite signs stating "sunbeds cannot be reserved" there is no enforcement of this rule, and it was not uncommon to see towels reserving sunbeds at 6am in the morning. Despite these minor quibbles it was a very enjoyable stay and I would come again without hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Michelle B
Reviews.Content: We are Shell Owners and this was our first visit to this property. It is off the strip but easy access to monorail and cabs are reasonable to the strip. The staff is friendly and concierge very helpful with tickets and free shows. The rooms are comfortable and nice kitchen. Pool is nice/ hot tub and a small cool pool for kids.. Nice cocktail hour and breakfast. We would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Great money saver!”
Reviews.Author: Evie-Girl1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Desert Rose for the first time. It was a pretty sweet little resort for $30 a night! One bedroom with a kitchen, living room and everything you need to cook, mix margaritas and even bake a cake! We stayed for 6 nights. The first night, we took a taxi to the Wal-mart, cost about $30 return, bought our food and booze for the week and had plenty of cash leftover to spend out and about at attractions or nightclubs. I would recommend this hotel, we had a great time and the staff are very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Love it, nice and quiet”
Reviews.Author: Happy I
Reviews.Content: It may not look as good as the hotels along the strip, but I really like it because it is only a couple blocks away from the strip and no gambling floor, therefore it is excellent for family and quiet enviroment. Friendly front desk and staff, my suite has two bedrooms and a sofa bed in the living room. The kitchen is full of utensils and appliances for the renter. The per night cost is another attractive point compare to other hotels along the strip. Walking to the strip only take 5-10 minutes, depends on how fast a person walk. Will definitly recommanded this resort to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: stogamom
Reviews.Content: I've been to Vegas about 12 times for work, so I've stayed in most major casinos, and didn't need to pay for a thing. Travelling with your family, on your dime, makes you look at other places! We aren't gamblers either. We stayed here for 3 nights with our teen aged daughters and has a 1 room suite. The girls slept on the pull out and the chaise and were fine. The kitchen is a great ammenity. It's fully stocked with dinnerware, cookware and silverware. You get a stove, dishwasher and microwave. The breakfast is good and when you have a family, saves a lot of money. We made dinner in the room twice, a huge money and time-saver. We hit the pool in the am before it got too hot (we were there when Vegas had record heat, 112 a day). I reccommend grabbing a pool seat when you go to breakfast, as like at all Vegas hotels, they fill up quickly. The pool is very clean (I'm a stickler for that) and they provide plenty of towels. The room looked new, clean, and spacious. We could dry our towels and bathing suits out on the patio. We had a view of an air conditioner, but that was no big deal. Location: walking distance to Hooters and MGM casinos. We actually went to Hooters to gamble a little bit, as it was close to the hotel. It wasn't too bad! Not glitzy, but they had cheap tables and it felt more like gambling at a bar vs a big casino. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay wasn't long enough!”
Reviews.Author: Shmol
Reviews.Content: The hotel and its grounds are very beautiful with lots of greenery and a nice pool area. It's perfect for families and couples alike and offers incredible value for money. We couldn't believe how much we got for the price we paid! Our room was actually a large suite with a full kitcken and large fridge. It had an amazingly comfortable bed, but the bathroom was a little bit small in comparison with the rest of the suite. The breakfast was good too with hot items served alongside the usual cereals, muffins, etc. The lobby area where they served breakfast did get quite crowded in the morning but one is bound to encounter crowded spaces in Las Vegas. So, no complaints there. We also apreciated free Wi-Fi in our room. Now we were aware of the threat of credit card fraud at this hotel from reviews of other fellow TA reviewers. So, we opted in for a cash deposit upon check in just to be safe. We only stayed at this hotel for one night, which was regrettable because we could have easily stayed there for a couple of weeks or more. Hope we will be back there someday!

Reviews.Title: “Number one”
Reviews.Author: foss54
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean, the staff very helpful and we loved it. Free breakfast and drinks at happy hour. Been to Las Vegas before and have had OK and bad hotels but this is the one I would return to, no problems or grumbles at all. Rooms were, clean, fitted with all you will need and more - including the kitchen sink, yes full kitchen, with hob, fridge, microwave. Pool and spa , 106 degrees so was needed. Out of the way of the casino (short walk) so you could get away from the action when you wanted but very near to the top of the strip. I will return as it is a gem of an hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel With Everything You Need..BUT a little off of strip..”
Reviews.Author: princess423
Reviews.Content: Two of my girlfriends and I spent four nights in Vegas. This was by far the best deal there was for hotels. Desert Rose only has suites--one bedroom and two bedrooms. Since there were three of us we decided to stick with the one bedroom, and we had a great deal to go along with it!
