We got the fourth night for a penny deal, which initially had me a bit skeptical about the quality of this hotel (also, because it was off of the strip). When we arrived our feelings quickly changed. The entrance to the hotel is simple, but beautiful and the attendees at the front desk were quick to assist us with checking in. Upon entering our room, we were greeted by a large living room in front of us and to our right, a fully equipped kitchen. It wasn't like many hotels with the tiny refrigerator; this room had an apartment/house size fridge, along with a dishwasher, sink, stove, microwave, plenty of plateware and utensils. We didn't plan on doing much cooking, but to have it available just in case we did was very convenient; in addition to having ample room for leftovers from restaurants and bottles of alcohol. Enough about the kitchen! The living room had a L shaped sofa, television, plus a stereo system with a subwoofer. Very spacious with plenty of room for pre-game dancing. (I do wish they had an ipod/mp3 adapter to go with it, but the radio did it's job.) My friends and I entered the bedroom to find a king size bed facing another television. The room was slightly smaller than an average size hotel room, but average hotel rooms don't have a living room and a kitchen! The bathroom had a huge counter, which is very convenient for girls who need plenty of room for makeup, jewelry and straighteners. The toilet and the shower were in a seperate room from the counter and sink, which prevented any fighting over taking too long in the bathroom. I was very much pleased. Accomodations: Room service brought towels every day, changed the garbage, and washed our dishes in the dishwasher. Monday thru Thursday, there was free wine in the lobby/breakfast area until about 7 or 8 (Can't remember.) The host poured us wine glasses filled to the top of semi-good wine. Breakfast was until 9 or 10 every morning, a little early if you're up until 6 in the morning BUT i got up to get bacon/sausage, toast, and eggs. Distance from Strip: Since we went during one of the hottest months of the year, walking to the strip wasn't very fun, but only about a five minute walk. The walk brings you near the MGM hotel and the New York New York hotel. I would've taken less taxis if it weren't 110 degrees!! Anyway, not too far. Crowd: It was an older crowd. It seemed to be people there on vacation with children or there for business. It did make it a little awkward/funny to walk in from the club at 6 in the morning and see all the older people awake for breakfast already. My one problem was the taxi service! The first two nights(Thurs & Friday) were fine, taxis came within minutes. However, the last two nights and the morning we left, it took nearly a half an hour for the cab to come! I'm from New York so there isn't much patients for slow cabs. All in all, I had a wonderful time in Vegas and Desert Rose was part of such an incredible experience. I would stay here again because of the service and the room. If you feel uncomfortable with passing by a crowd that isn't around you're age (21-30; here for partying) then I would say pass on this hotel. But! if you want a great deal on a room that is more like a one bedroom fully-equipped apartment and you don't mind a 5min walk to the strip, this is definitely the place foryou! I'm 21 and I did not mind the quick glances of the older crowd or the "you are gorgeous" comments from the older men. haha. it made vegas that much more fun!!

Reviews.Title: “Large apartment, in good location.”
Reviews.Author: Jojohodgson
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights and it was great. From our check in which was very informative and friendly to our departure. The room was massive with a bigger fridge, oven and microwave than I have at home. There was even a dishwasher! The beds were amazing and huge and comfy. The rooms were a bit old fashioned but were clean and everything you need when away. The air con was great and a blessing as the weather was so hot. The location is good, just next to hooters and a 10 minute walk to the monorail at MGM. It was nice to not have slot machines and a casinos to walk through to get to your room. The happy hour was a great idea, we only went to this once during our stay as we were usually out. The breakfast is very busy, but we used to go and get it and then take it back to our room which saved us having to buy breakfast out. It was a basic breakfast, but was enough to keep you going. Would stay here again if I was back in Vegas. It was a bargain for everything you get. We went to the pool once and we got a lounger no problem, but didnt stay long as the weather was so hot.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and nice spot on strip”
Reviews.Author: michelleneuro
Reviews.Content: Lovely resort in a great spot on the strip across from MGM! Clean, and most comfortable beds!

Reviews.Title: “will be back”
Reviews.Author: lindyloo6
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Desert Rose Hotel at the end of a 3 week road trip to the USA, booked in for 7 nights. We had stayed at the Planet Hollywood hotel the year before, but decided to stay at the Desert Rose this time as family had stayed there the year before and had raved about it. When we looked at trip advisor at the time of booking it was number 3 in all hotels in Las Vegas so that pretty much decided our choice. The hotel is located just of the strip, at the same end as the MGM Grand and the tropicana hotels. The resort is set out into several blocks very European holiday style, you enter into a large reception area which doubles up as the breakfast area and general relaxation zone. The doors at the end of this lead direct onto the pool area via a swipe card and into the various accom blocks. The rooms are massive and the kitchen is bigger than most peoples back here in the UK, it has everything you would think of and loads more. A massive USA fridge freezer, and also a coffee maker and they provide the coffee. the seating area and dinner table are good quality and a small balcony off the living room, The bedroom is large with ample wardrobe space both inside the bedroom and also in the living area, the only thing that may put some off is that the bathroom (which has a large dressing area with sink before the loo and the bath) is directly off the bedroom, this could be awkward if you are sharing with someone sleeping on the double pull out in the living room. As part of the price for the room you also got breakfast which is unusual for the US this was ample and of good quality, got very busy though and most people were getting it and taking it to their rooms as very few places to sit and eat it. you also got free drinks in the evenings midweek i think, of beer and wine and some nibbles, this was a nice touch and we did use this a few times. The walk from the hotel felt very safe at night and it took about 10 mins to get to the strip on foot, you could walk past the tropicana and get to the bus stop to catch the deuce in minutes. One point to remember is they don't charge your card until you check out also I did hear one of the reception staff commenting that they would check if one guest had left negative feedback about them on trip advisor. All in all a great hotel and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Desert Rose Delight”
Reviews.Author: brenbrid
Reviews.Content: Fourth trip to Vegas. My wife and I really enjoyed our stay at the Desert Rose Resort. No big line ups to check in. Friendly helpfull staff. Quiet resort. Huge room, Clean,Comfortable bed, Nice Balcony, Super Kitchen. Free wireless internet in the room was fantastic as we could check on show deals on a daily basis and find keep in touch with home. Free breakfast is ok but be prepared to wait in line unless your an early riser. Tip: take your food back to your room. No worries about seating, eat on your balcony. Managers afternoon wine/snacks not worth it unless you just happen to be walking through the lobbey. Nice pool, could use another 10 lounge chairs to accomodate people. Small but decent workout facility, Easy walk to strip, Close to monorail. Did not see any homeless people or vagrants on Duke Elington Way. Had no concerns for safety. $15 Cab ride with tip one way to/from Airport. Although helicopters are always flying up and down the stip, the resort is on their approach to the airport and it can get a tad irritating if you are out on the pool deck. We will be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect resort, A full suite with all amenities. What more could one want?”
Reviews.Author: maxi23_11
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Desert Rose Resort in Las Vegas, departing August 31. It is near perfect and a bargain at that. The hotel is located just behind Hooters Casino about a block and a half from the MGM grand. With good weather it takes about 7 minutes brisk walking to reach the MGM grand and you can take a short cut through the MGM and exit on the strip. In summer the temperature is rather hot 105 F and so if you want to avoid too much sun exposure you would need an umbrella in the day to make the walk. Otherwise its fine and nicely located allowing easy access to the strip. In the nights it’s a breeze. The great plus with this hotel is that it provides a reasonable breakfast, which is rare even for most hotels in Las Vegas. Of course you would want to sample some of the sumptuous buffets at the casino hotels from time to time, but a free breakfast helps to cut costs and gives you the power of choice. The other plus is that there is no resort fee charged which can amount to about $20 dollars per room per night at the other casino hotels. The most notable thing about the rooms is that the standard room is 650 square feet!. That's right, with separate living dining and kitchen areas and a patio to boot! In that respect it is very similar to the other all suite hotels that you may be familiar with e.g. Residence Inn, Fairfield Inn and Suites, Springhill Suites and others. You get all amenities e.g. fridge, stove, microwave, toaster, plates, cups, glasses, cooking utensils etc. I was fortunate to book in the summer and the promotion running offered the fourth night for a penny. You could not beat that anywhere. (I checked) So I highly recommend the Desert Rose Resort. It is a nice all suite hotel, with 2 televisions, full concierge services, free wireless internet, no resort fees, free breakfast and evening treats and a quick walk to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Why has this place continued to operate while stealing from people blind?”
Reviews.Author: Ken S
Reviews.Content: My family and I attempted to stay here for the July 4th weekend this summer (2011) and OMG! We had heard about the issues surrounding credit cards being run to the hilt after leaving this place, but we thought we would be the lucky ones...well here we are in September and we have discovered we have fallen victim to this crap! Pardon my language, but you can understand our frustration. Let’s not mention the fact that they reassured us that this problem had been taken care of, which obviously it wasn't, let’s talk about a few other glaring and obvious things. 1) I hope you like big cockroaches, not like they are in your room but you better watch what is outside your door and make sure you don't let one in by accident. Now I know that this is an issue in this area, but OMG! 2) We decided after a very miserable 1st nights stay, this wasn't going to work for us and elected to check-out, we were told that they had billed us for the entire 4 days stay plus amenities. They said this was common practice, yet every other hotel will secure the first nights stay and have you settle at check-out if you still want to pay on that card or another form of payment. This is exactly what we did as we went to check-in at another hotel and they said they have always done it this way. So what kind of crap is this place pulling? It took some serious deliberation between our bank and the front desk to unlock the funds and release them back to us before we left; 3) and now the dreaded use of our credit card 2 months after we have checked out. I was deceived by its glowing reviews and have now come to believe that those individuals that had nothing but negative to say were closer to the truth. Funny thing, since arriving back home I was getting my haircut and got to talking to my stylist and low and behold she had a very bad experience in Las Vegas with a group of her friends from a church group. And guess where she stayed.... you guessed it "The Desert Rose Resort!" Go figure.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Pat175
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Desert Rose Resort for 4 days just a few weeks ago and it was great. Check-in was quick. All of the staff were extremely polite and helpful. The room was very clean and comfortable. We didn't utilize the kitchen but noticed that it was well-equipped. The bathtub and toilet were in a room together and it was a little cramped but the tub was huge! The pool was clean and was never over-crowded. The free breakfast was good, but it was busy every morning. We only attended the free cocktail hour once, but it was quite nice also. The strip is within comfortable walking distance - even in heels! I would definitely go back to the Desert Rose if I visit Vegas again.

Reviews.Title: “Great apartment suites”
Reviews.Author: ryan_knapton
Reviews.Content: The Desert Rose has awesome apartments with a full kitchen, dining room table, lounge area and a spacious bedroom, all at a great price! It's a very short work to the Strip and the MGM Grand. Breakfast wasn't amazing, but hit the spot. The pool area is great, there's free Internet and coin laundry facilities on site. All in all, a great stay for my wife and I, but if I was looking for some real casino action I'd stay on the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “COULDN'T HAVE BEEN BETTER”
Reviews.Author: GELLIOTT
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a great value hotel without all the hustle & bustle then this place is for you. Desert Rose is situated at the end of the strip next to the tropicana hotel just minutes away from the airport. (taxi was $13) it takes around 5 minutes to walk to the strip. The rooms are a great size and fully equipped with cooking facilities, hair dryer, air con, tv in front room and bedroom and towels for indoor and outdoor around the pool area. We ate out most days as there aren't really any supermarkets near by but walmart is only a short taxi ride away ($15) if you wanted to stock up. they do have a small shop at the desert rose but only sell canned drinks, choc & crisps. There is also a bbq area around the pool that you can use for free but again would need to go to Walmart to get supplies. Breakfast was the same most days (egg, sausage or bacon, cereals, toast and fruit, juices & hot drinks)but not to be knocked as there was always an endless supply. it did become busy towards the end of breakfast time but they do allow you to take it up to your room so we tended to get up early and go down and fetch what we wanted and take it to our room and eat it abit later. Free drinks (wine & lager & soft drinks) are served in reception mon-thurs from 5pm-7pm again an endless supply. Some days were busier than others but never had to wait more than 5 minutes for a drink. Rooms were cleaned daily if required. all the staff couldn't do enough for you and were always very helpful and friendly and didnt appear to be just looking for a tip. The lady working on concierge was very clued up and would go out of her way to save you money and get you the best deal. we had booked all our trips before we went but she happily phoned them up for us to arrange pick up. Overall a fantastic time (although too hot) if i was going to vegas again I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. when I booked it I thought it was too good to be true with free drinks, breakfast, Starbucks allday and minutes from the strip/airport but it wasn't.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay, within walking distance of the strip”
Reviews.Author: karen7392
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our 4 children ages, 7,12,14,16 stayed here for 3 nights. Accommodation was very spacious, beds were comfortable and we found it very quiet. Free WiFi was excellent and the complimentary breakfast was adequate but not as nice as other places we stayed. The breakfast area was far too crowded - they need to provide alot more seating! A great place to stay, off the strip! Excellent value for money!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely cheap hotel just off the strip.”
Reviews.Author: AileenMolly
Reviews.Content: We (a family of 3) stayed one night at the Desert Rose. I booked this hotel after reading all the very good reviews on Trip Advisor. We weren't disappointed. We had a 2 bed, 2 bath room with full kitchen. The kitchen had all essentials needed for a family to cook etc without having to eat out. The beds were very comfortable, the room sizes were good. The comp breakfast was basic but nice. The breakfast area can get very busy around 8am-9am. The pool was not very clean (cloudy) in the evening when we used it, but was clean and sparkly the following morning. We really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: impresif
Reviews.Content: This is a very good place if you want to stay away from all those densely populated busy casino hotels. Huge hotels mean you might have to take 10 minutes or even more from your car (hard to find a parking space as well) to your hotel room (might have to pass through a huge casino lobby before reaching elevator). A smaller size resort means more convenience and privacy. I stayed in a one bedroom suite with a full kitchen. Very comfortable and well maintained. It also provided buffet breakfast, and a nice swimming pool though a little bit small. It also has free WiFi though a bit slow, which is rare among Las Vegas hotels which charge a fortune daily. If you want a more relax stay or you are not a gambler, you would not go wrong with this resort. I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional value and family friendly”
Reviews.Author: JJRT_travels
Reviews.Content: We had a 2 bed suite which had lots of space, a huge lounge area and a well equipped kitchen. 2 bathrooms helped with a family of four. The complimentary breakfast isn't great, but the kitchen facilities in our room gave us the capability to supplement it and to eat in quieter surroundings. We chose Desert Rose because it didn't have a casino, but did have plenty of other facilities (laundrette, pool, BBQ area etc). Location is great - just a block from the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Efficiency Suite in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Antipich
Reviews.Content: Stayed in 2 room suite with fool kitchen facility. Skimpy but satisfactory breakfest and good price. Just what I needed!

Reviews.Title: “quiet vacation close to the Vegas strip”
Reviews.Author: Jose G
Reviews.Content: Our family resently went on a leisure vacation to Vegas. This was a family trip which included our younger kids. We were surprised by the hospitality and the comfort from the Desert Rose Resort. Its located next to the strip where all the action is and kept our kids busy with activities. We will definetly plan our next vacation here.

Reviews.Title: “Casino free”
Reviews.Author: luv2trvl077
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Desert Rose for 2 nights based on the reviews that i got from trip advisor, we have no regrets. With the price paid, we can't complain. After doing a tour of the different hotels/accommodations in Vegas when we got there, we're glad, we stayed here. No casino in the foyer, no one smoking cigarettes and the room itself is really good. If anyone needs somewhere to sleep peacefully then i would recommend this place, just a walking distance from MGM Grand.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good hotel for families and non-gambelers”
Reviews.Author: ArmoVacationer
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty good hotel that is located right behind Tropicana Hotel. Our room was a one bedroom apartment like suite with a full sized well equipped kitchen – which included a refrigerator, a stove, microwave oven, a toaster, blender, a coffeemaker and other kitchenware items such a glasses, plates, etc. The toilet was fully persons with disabilities (ADA) compliant. The only problem was that there was too little counter top space around the bathroom sink to comfortably place toiletries. The rooms were clean and the bed was comfortable. Also, in the living room there was a sofa bed that could be used as a bed if needed. The hotel has free WI FI with good reception. Cell phone reception in the room was very bad so we had to go to the street to place calls. Parking spaces were located very close to the rooms with was very convenient. The hotel served pretty good complimentary breakfast. Also, all day they serve complimentary Starbucks coffee of excellent quality. However, the scrambled eggs served were of less than average quality. The hotel has a medium sized swimming pool which could have been maintained better – the water was less than sparkling and I saw some black things on the walls of the swimming pool. There are also two Jacuzzis and couple of barbeque grills.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Jenny R
Reviews.Content: Off the Strip, but close enough to walk. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We had a 2 bedroom and a 1 bedroom for a totla of 6 people. The rooms were clean and roomy. I wish the continental breakfast was served a bit later though--ends at 9:00am. That would be my only suggestion.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, decent breakfast, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: p_tong0
Reviews.Content: Off the Strip but close enough to the MGM and the monorail. We had two 2-bedroom suites for 8 adults. Service at the front desk was very friendly and rooms were clean though starting to look dated. We didn't use the full kitchen but just wanted the gathering space of a living room. There were TV's om each bedroom as well as the living room. Breakfast was very crowded but more than adequate, including scrambled eggs, bacon or sausage, cereals, bananas, toast, juices, coffee, and soda, Towels for the pool are provided in the units. Pool was in our opinion too small considering there were a lot of families there with kids that spent a lot of time at the pool, but that didn't matter to us since we came to go to the Strip and eat at the celebrity chef restaurants while waiting for the start of our Grand Canyon rafting trip. The Desert Rose stored our suitcases for $5 for the week we were on that trip. A good value since we used the stay 4 nights for the price of 3 deal.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel close to the Strip”
Reviews.Author: vaggy1
Reviews.Content: The rooms are a nice size, clean and well stocked - plenty of coffee and utensils - it is a full kitchen. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms are comfortable, but getting a bit dated - but immaculately clean. Breakfast is a cramped affair - there are too many guests all wanting breakfast at the same time and not enough space to seat them -ant that is in August. That said - excellent value for money, and it is one block from New York New York.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: sunflower065
Reviews.Content: We would definitely go back. Its off the strip, which is nice but close enough to walk to several casinos. We had a two bedroom suite. It was nice to have a full kitchen and a living room with a deck....great room for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: adcaro33
Reviews.Content: Let me just say that the five days I spend in the Desert Rose Resort were the best days I've spend in Las Vegas.... when we got there, my friends and I , were tired from the long drive and the service desk staff notice it and immediately check us in... they made us feel welcome and appreciated.... especially a young lady, that I forgot her name, but she had very beautiful color eyes. What can I say about the room.... we stayed at a one bedroom suite.... very nice furniture, very clean and well stocked kitchen, and a lovely bedroom.... the housekeeping staff did a great job cleaning and stocking the room every day. The pool was small but very relaxing and not crowded... and the breakfast buffet was great to start the day So overall my experience in the Desert Rose Resort for me from 1-10 is a 10+++++.... I definitely will be staying there the next time I visit Las Vegas, NV...

Reviews.Title: “Hit the JackPot”
Reviews.Author: BlingAndShareIt
Reviews.Content: Don't use a rental or taxi if you won't be going far from the casino area. Use the bus for $20 with an unlimited 5 day pass. The Deuce stops at every major Casino or you can take the express and skip to the end. I got to Planet Hollywood for convention quicker onThe Deuce then people who drove could find a parking place there. The bus stop is really close to Desert Rose and the bus takes you door to door to the airport. Between the money I saved on the bus and the breakfast provided at Desert Rose I could afford to take in some shows.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Atmosphere with no casino close to the "Strip"”
Reviews.Author: Suzanne C
Reviews.Content: The rooms were spacious, exceptionally clean and the full breakfast and "Happy Hour" were a definite plus!

Reviews.Title: “Great resort we will be back”
Reviews.Author: Joan S
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Desert Rose. It takes you away from the hussle and bussle of the Strip. It is quiet and relaxing around the outdoor pool, rooms are spacious and relaxing . Great breakfast served daily. Our friends that were with us enjoyed as well. Close walk to the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: ProfMercator
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights and enjoyed the stay. Lovely one bedroom with full kitchen. Comfortable bed, nice furnishing, well maintained. Service was first class. We had two problems while we were there with the in room safe and after calling the front desk security was there within 5 minutes each time. They even were able to adjust the air conditioning balance so the living area didn't have to be in the deep freeze to keep the bedroom cool. There was a beer/wine reception each evening with light snacks - pretzels or carrots and celery and dip. Breakfast in the morning was good but set up poorly with everyone having to stand in line like an old fashioned cafeteria. It took a long time. The food service people told use they were in the process of reconfiguring the food into stations. If that happens the bottlenecks should be alleviated. It will still be crowded, though. Their lobby is not large enough to handle everyone at breakfast. The pool is small and looked very busy. We did not use it. The concierge had very limited hours and we tried twice to find him/her with no luck. The front desk was however very helpful in giving directions on where to go on the strip to find discount tickets for shows. All in all, a great place to stay if you don't want to pay strip prices but want to be near the action. The availability of 2 bedroom suites and the full kitchens would make this an excellent place for a family or larger group to stay. Free, easy access parking, too. No big multi story parking ramps with which to contend.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant stay at The Desert Rose”
Reviews.Author: AH65
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel because we wanted somewhere close to but not on the strip as this was our 2nd visit to Las Vegas we wanted to be able to relax by the pool some days and its reviews were good, well we were not disappointed its a quiet little oasis a little bit of a walk from the strip but by no means too far 5-10 mins. The accommodation and pool (never too busy) are excellent as far as cleanliness and security goes and all the staff were very pleasant especially the concierge Carrie who is nuts in the nicest possible way (Carrie you did make us laugh) and very very helpful. The breakfast is a buffet style eggs bacon/sausage, bread/toast, cereals, fruit, hot or cold beverages all very nice and plenty to keep us going all day. Also the happy hour in the evening was good, choice of drinks soft/alcoholic and nibbles of different sorts each evening. Would give The Desert Rose a big thumbs up loved our stay there so thanks guys.

Reviews.Title: “Desert Rose Resort”
Reviews.Author: nellie027
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a 2 bed apartment at Desert Rose, it is about a 10 minutes walk from the strip situated at the back of Hooters Hotel. The reception is very large and includes a small shop at the side of the reception desk that sells basics, the staff made us very welcome and were very friendly and gave us plenty information about the apartments facilities, it has a gym and a vey nice outside swimming pool with loungers and table and chairs. The apartment was very clean (serviced each day) if a little dark looking due to dark decoration, heavy curtains and dim lights but as your not spending all day in your apartment its not a problem.The apartment was well funished had a fully fitted kitchen with everything you needed ( although we didnt use the kitchen as it is very reasonable to eat out) a spacious lounge with all the usual Tv,Dvd etc lead onto a small balcony, one bedroom was en - suite the other had its own bathroom were basicaly furnished and had TV and very very comfy beds. Leading from the recepion area was a comfy lounge area where a continental breakfast (included in the price) was served each morning which as the apartment only cost £23 per person per night was exceptional value as some hotels/apartments are very expensive in Las Vegas. There is a travel desk in the reception area and Jodie was brilliant and can arrange good discounts on any tours, theatre/ dinners booked, better value than the ones booked on the Strip. We wouldn't hesitate to recommend these apartments.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing stay handy for the strip”
Reviews.Author: tanicholls
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights at the beginning of a flydrive trip. This hotel idoes not have a casino, therefore it feels much quieter with a nice relaxed atmosphere. We had a one bedroom unit, which was very spacious, with a comfortable sofa bed. It was nice having a full kitchen so we could be independent. The pool area was very relaxing. Free parking and a good selection of choices for breakfast. If I was to return to vegas I would definately stay here again, it is nice to get away from the buzz and noise of the strip, and chill by the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and value for money”
Reviews.Author: ROHIT N
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent and a value for money package. I got this from Hotwire. The location of the hotel is very well chosen and around 5 mins away from the strip. I would recommend this place to stay in Vegas if you are looking something off the strip and still want to be close.

Reviews.Title: “perfect!”
Reviews.Author: cocange
Reviews.Content: Perfect location to visit Las Vegas. Nice and helpfull crew. good service, nice pool and perfect accomodation! We enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money!”
Reviews.Author: mtjon007
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent value for money. It is highly rated on Trip Advisor. BUT .... it is inexpensive, so don't expect Bellagio / Venetian style accommodation! The location is ok. Yes, it's right at the bottomed of the strip but the walk to the strip, say 5-10 minutes is fine. If it's hot, cut thru MGM. You can do 75% of the journey in an air conditioned environment. The hotel room is fine. It's a very good size. It's not excellent, but see the point above re cost. The bed is comfortable. The air conditioning isn't quiet but it works well. Generally, the room was clean and tidy. The bathroom is small. Shower over the bath. The kitchen is reasonably stocked with utensils. Big fridge freezer. The swimming pool is small. It gets busy over the weekend. It opens at 0700 and you need to get out there soon after. There are a decent number of sun loungers but few umbrellas. Whilst there are signs re "No diving" etc these are not enforced. There is no lifeguard. The pool is much quieter on a Monday morning. Breakfast. Oh dear. How desperate are people? It's free. There's a reason!! It's free though so (I want to say something involving flies and excrement but won't) it's sooooo crowded. Honestly, the scrambled eggs are awful. The sausages marginally better. But it's free!! So I'm not complaining. I'm simply making the observation that it's free for a reason! Some on this site have mentioned bagels / croissants etc. We are yet to locate such fine delights! Some have said it gets crowded ... an understatement. But it's free (did I mention?) so people lose a sense of taste and behaviour etc!! But those who complain on this site about the lack of variation in the breakfast menu are out of order. It's free. If you don't like it, go and pay $10 somewhere else. Generally, the clientele are good. We wondered if the hotel might attract a noisy element given the price. It doesn't. As with everything tho, there'll always be one! The staff here are excellent. A major selling point. They really are responsive. I've stayed at 4 hotels in Vegas in the past 16 months. This isn't the best, but it is the best value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, good value, off the strip - know what you are booking”
Reviews.Author: MumTraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a family of 4 - had a 2 bedroom 2 bathroom suite. The suite was great, beds comfortable, everything we needed, small kitchen (which we didn't use but obviously other guests camp out for weeks and cook for themselves), luxury bathrooms. Our rooms looked onto the front car park but no noise at night, or from the airport. We liked the pool, and it didn't get too crowded, although there were a lot of families staying. We liked the evening weekday reception for a drink, but we didn't want to join the queue for breakfast so went round the corner to Coco's - which cost us but was very good. We found it was practicable to walk to the MGM Grand even in the heat of summer, and from there you can get to most of the other casinos with a short walk/metro stop. The concierge seemed knowledgeable but was often engaged, we had to queue for a while to talk to her. All the other staff seemed efficient and competent, no problems there at all.

Reviews.Title: “NICE PROPERTY, GOOD LOCATION, GREAT VALUE”
Reviews.Author: Yobabs
Reviews.Content: The Desert Rose is a three-story, gated property with plenty of parking. All room doors open into the open air, but are all in a keycard-accessed area. There is a single, small elevator in each of the two wings; it’s shared by the guests and hotel staff, and at times, it’s not really quite sufficient to match the need. The elevator doors have an unfortunate tendency to close too quickly, so beware. Each unit has a full kitchen, including full-size fridge, oven, cook-top, microwave, large sink, and dishwasher. All dishes, cutlery, and cookware are provided. There is a small dining area with a table and four chairs. The living room has a sleeper sofa and a pull-out bed. There is an HD TV in the living room and in the bedroom, but every channel was SD and stretched the picture out of its correct aspect ratio. There is a small terrace, but it was way too hot to spend time outside. Each unit has its own digital thermostat. The bathroom is located off the master bedroom. It includes a small room with a toilet and tub/shower. The sink is in a good-sized vanity area just outside the bathroom. The bedroom also had a fairly good sized closet. Having the bathroom accessible through the bedroom forced whoever was sleeping in the living room to either interrupt the occupant(s) of the bedroom, or go use the restrooms in the lobby, so that was an iffy design decision. Electrical outlets were plentiful; it wasn’t hard to find a place to plug in chargers (but a power strip’s always handy to bring along). The WiFi was generally good, but faltered a bit while streaming Netflix. Breakfast is a bit more comprehensive than it was for our last stay. They now offer scrambled eggs and either bacon or sausage each day. They also have four types of juice coffee (the coffee’s available 24/7). The line can get very long if you go after 7:30 a.m., and there is already fairly limited seating in the lobby for the size of hotel. Having stayed there before, we knew to bring plastic trays to take the food back to the room. Once you figure out how to get to the MGM’s monorail station, it is a brisk 10-15 minute walk there from the Desert Rose. We bought two-day monorail passes (using discount coupons from the brochure rack by the Desert Rose’s concierge desk), and that was a good investment. The monorails are frequent, quick, and, most of all, air-conditioned. We’ve been there before, and we’ll stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Off the strip, but right on the money.”
Reviews.Author: DrNebulon
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for bright lights, excitement and a crazy party atmosphere, this is the wrong place for you. My wife and I stayed at the Desert Rose for 4 nights. And while it's a bit of a jaunt to the nearest tram (which always seemed longer on the return trip at the end of the night), Desert Rose is close enough to have easy access to the big name hotels. After a long night wandering the strip with the heat, buzzing of slot machines, flashing lights and mobs of people, walking into a spacious, clean, cool room at the Desert Rose was one of the highlights of each evening. Guest services was very friendly, and the concierge was very helpful in assisting us with a car rental and show information. The manager's reception was a nice treat in the afternoon, while the breakfast in the morning was always fresh and delicious. Had we stayed more than a few days, it might have become a bit monotonous, but breakfast prime rib at the Mad Onion in Hooters next door was the perfect cure (sounds cringe-worthy, but it totally wasn't). If there were any downsides to the resort, it's that the pool area is quite small compared to the number of rooms (and therefore guests). It was a total zoo at just about all hours of the day. Also, on our second night there, so "heavy-walkers" moved in upstairs and thumped around until the wee hours. But while it's not particularly sound proof between floors, we rarely heard any noise from outside of the building or from our adjoining neighbours. I'd suggest making sure you have a decent idea of where this resort is before you land, if you're taking a taxi. We had to pull over at a gas station and use a tourist book to give our cabbie directions. Also, while anyone who's been to Vegas knows there's a lot of walking involved, that extra jaunt to get from the Strip to the Desert Rose is worth preparing for. Like everything in Vegas, it seems a lot closer than it actually is. Wear good shoes! My wife ended up with massive blisters after our first day, and that makes for a painful vacation. Overall, for the spaciousness and cleanliness of the resort, and the peace and quiet it offers compared to the rest of the Strip, you'd be hard pressed to find better value.

Reviews.Title: “BRILLIANT!!!”
Reviews.Author: lollipop62
Reviews.Content: What can we say......"We'll be back" Loved it. The apartment was excellent. 2 bedrooms with plenty of room. Spotless. A free safe, which you don't find in most Europe hotels. Fully equipped kitchen, the list goes on. Felt safe walking back in the early hours of the morning. Hotel staff helpful especially when i found a little dog that had jumped out of a car window. Would love to know if the owner collected it. All in all one of the best holidays ever.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet hotel in Las Vegas area”
Reviews.Author: SECScape
Reviews.Content: The room was very spacious, nice and clean, with a small kitchenette (we only used the fridge, but this would be good for those wanting to dine in). The pool is very small and crowded, but it was too hot to use it anyway during the day. The free breakfast was average, good assortment of cold cereals, usual eggs and toast, one kind of whole fruit; the coffee was very good. Get there early as it gets very crowded. We passed on the manager's wine/soda in the afternoon after seeing the crowds (and the only appetizer was a few cauliflower). On the one hand, this hotel was too far to walk to the strip on a 100+ degree July day, ~15+ minutes (we did it a few times, but it was tiring), but it was really nice to get away from the noisy (!) strip and huge crowds at the end of a day. In cooler weather it would be a very easy walk. Taxis were readily available for the few minutes drive to the beginning of the strip, or the 15 minute drive to the end of the strip (~$20-$25). A bus pass is available for $7 for one twenty-four hour period up and down the strip, but the wait in the heat is brutal in summer (the bus is $5 for one single trip). The hotel is a $12 ride from the airport, very convenient. We stayed for the beginning of a rafting trip and it was very convenient and clean, but in retrospect should have switched after our trip to a more upscale hotel on the strip for the ease of sightseeing and resting midday in a nice spot. (Be warned: There are NO benches or chairs in the ENTIRE city of Las Vegas, unless in front of a slot machine!) The concierge was enthusiastic but disorganized and the wait was long to talk to her, she seemed to be often talking to friends instead of the customer. The one computer was very slow and again the wait to use it could be very long, but that was fine. Overall good for an inexpensive and quiet option near the airport and fairly close to, but not on, the strip. We did sleep well.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to escape from the Strip.”
Reviews.Author: villa6
Reviews.Content: This is a great place for a group of people who want to stay close to but not on the Strip. We really appreciated being able to get to our room at the end of the day without having to trudge through a casino. The breakfast was fine (especially considering the price) but repetitive. We really appreciated the 24 hour beverage service and the staff was great.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome value for money - recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: wendyabram
Reviews.Content: The Desert Rose is in a great location and we had a great 2 room suite. It is within walking distance to the strip, close to the airport and very family oriented. The Happy Hour is a great hit daily at 5pm and the pool & hot tub were fabulous. The only thing we could say that put us off was the massive queue for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “The best vacation of my life.”
Reviews.Author: lgar118
Reviews.Content: Been here twice in two years. Both times have been exceptional great customer service, clean rooms, all employees extremely friendly, the pool was clean, lobby very clean. Thank you for a unforgetfull expirience. Looking foward to plan my next vacation. Luis Garcia

Reviews.Title: “Perfection - for the price”
Reviews.Author: PeteM01
Reviews.Content: We thought that we had booked two one bedroom suites for two nights (through Expedia) but neglected to check the paperwork too closely. It turned out we only had a single one bedroom suite between 5 of us. However, the Desert Rose immediately changed our booking to a 2 bedroom suite, which was perfect for us. This was all performed with a smile at the front desk. The suite was clean and very well-equipped. There is enough in the kitchen for a month-long stay (e.g. full-sized cooker), and lots of space in the living area. The a/c was a bit noisy but efficient (useful in July in Vegas) but, surprisingly, there was no noise at all from McArran airport, one block away. The complimentary breakfast in the lobby was very popular, requiring a queue of a few minutes. Get there early, or simply take the bread, eggs etc up to your suite to eat. Coffee and tea (good quality) were available all day in the lobby but free soft drinks were limited to breakfast and evening drinks reception. We did not attend the latter, being a bit put off by the Tuesday night Bingo, but this was again popular. The pool is small but did not get crowded and the gym facility was also small but was often empty. The location is great, just off the Strip, near to MGM, Excalibur, New York New York and within walking distance of Mandalay Bay, Hard Rock Hotel, Caesar's Palace, etc. In the immediate vicinity, there were a couple of shops and cafes. To sum up, we can't recommend this place highly enough!

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay off strip”
Reviews.Author: julieandcharlie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two days at the end of a two week road trip. Couldn't fault it. Easy walking distance to strip. Excellant accomodation and reasonable price. The free breakfast and aftenoon snacks and drinks were a good touch. Very relaxing if you want to avoid the hustle and bustle

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: KMKpaper
Reviews.Content: Very conveniently located off Tropicana and the south end of the Strip. One bedroom condo unit plenty spacious and well appointed for 2 people. Pool could be larger or resort could use another pool. Didn't use the pool after the first day too many kids and water not as clean as it should be. If you rent a car it's easy to get out of town to got to Lake Meade, Death Valley, Red Rock Canyon etc. Grounds were well maintained and shady, providing relief from Las Vegas heat.

Reviews.Title: “A Decent Place to Stay on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: BMan25
Reviews.Content: Desert Rose Resort is an older, all suites timeshare place that rents out to the public when not occupied by one of their members. We were there for a family reunion and all were satisfied with the accommodations. Not fancy, but perfectly adequate, clean and well kept. Its tucked behind Hooters and the new Tropicana towers, across from MGM Grand, so an easy walk to The Strip and a short cab ride from the airport. Not the place if you want "the fancy-schmancy Vegas big hotel experience," but its priced very reasonably and comfortable. Breakfast buffet every morning--very crowded with long lines most of the time but decent scrambled eggs, sausage,cereals, bananas, coffee (Starbucks), etc. Nice pool on premises. Everything gated and secure. Excellent front desk staff and very helpful concierge!

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay there anytime!”
Reviews.Content: Friendly check-in Knowledgable employees Clean, well-kept rooms and grounds Breakfast is just OK The only drawback is the pool is way too small for the amount of guests.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: Godzilladude
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a central location for some National Park visits, not necessarily to see Vegas. Traveling with the teenager, we like to have a suite when we can, without spending an arm and a leg. The Desert Rose fit the ticket nicely. It is a converted apartment complex, just behind Hooter's Casino, just a block or so off the Strip, towards the south end, off Tropicana. Given the place was likely built in the 1980s or 1990s, it is in VERY nice shape, well cared for. We stayed in a one BR unit for four nights. Very good service, from the front desk to everyone else. Nice size pool that was shaded in the later afternoon. Good free breakfast and happy hour. We had a first floor room, facing the street, and no noise at all to bother us. Yet a quick five minute walk down to the monorail, MGM Grand, the Strip and mobs of people. Everything in the room was good, save the AC, which was a bit loud. Our particular unit had a base rumble like a slightly off-balance washing machine hitting the spin cycle. But still not a problem for sleeping, and it kept the temperatures very nicely constant. Plenty of pool towels in the cabinet under the TV. Overall, very, very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Nice alternative to staying in a casino but right on the strip”
Reviews.Author: djkBuf
Reviews.Content: This place was awesome. We stayed here thru RCI timeshare. Our room was bigger than any casino hotel I've ever stayed in. It was basically an apartment with a kitchen, living room and giant bedroom with a jet tub. Perfect for a family with children. Best part is it's next to Hooters hotel and casino and just a 2min walk away from MGM and the las Vegas blvd strip. I Will stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: Bigface33
Reviews.Content: It was my husband and I first time to Vegas and we already talking albout coming back with family . My husband was the one to find desert rose on tripadvisor and thank god he did , it was everthing everyone said on their review , this place was Great, I love the fact that it was no casino here I can't stand the smoke in others casino we walked in overall this place was great

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 4cdnglobetrotters
Reviews.Content: The Desert Rose Resort is a great place to stay. The room was very clean and Large. It was nice having breakfast available in the morning. A comlimentry beer or wine was also provided late in the afternoon at the front reception. The location was about a 10min walk rom the south end of the strip. Being right next to Hooters for 25cent wings was also a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great price”
Reviews.Author: yurubi
Reviews.Content: This place offers very good pricing and the location is about two blocks from Luxor (beginning of the strip). Room was very spacious and clean. The room had a living room and kitchenette, more than I expected, specially after paying less than $100 per night. Free parking. Free breakfast. Good deal and I would definitely stay here again. Didn't use the pool or any other amenities so I can't comment on them.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best..........”
Reviews.Author: Apeks
Reviews.Content: This is very easy to rate. One of the best hotels we have ever stayed in. Spacious one room appartment, good cleaning, included wireless, good included breakfast, free drinks and snack mon-fri from 1700-1900, nice pool and always smiling staff members. Top it with an excellent location and low prices. Have to best the best value in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “excellent would highly recommend for families”
Reviews.Author: thesfamily0
Reviews.Content: This resort is small however excellent, has wonderful staff, accomodation (that actually looked like the pictures) the pool and breakfast is wonderful, cannot say enough about how good it was, thank you Desert Rose

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: b0r0lass
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the desert rose end of june beginning of july. The only negative thing I have to say about this place is the distance from the strip. It is a little further out than I thought it would be but I think this was made worse due to the heat it was a 115 degrees everyday we were there and very difficult to walk in it , so I feel this was half the problem. The resort itself is fantastic apts nice everything you need we had a two bedroomed on with two bathrooms. The complimentary breakfast was ideal nothing flash but what do you want for nothing. The queues are a big put off though so get there early. The concierge a lady is brilliant she will do anything for you book tickets etc, and is full of information for you. There is also a lovely lady called Gloria who lives in the hotel she is a gem and she sits and crotches by the concierge desk. She crocheted me and my sisters all a lovely red rose each, lovely woman. The pool is great and you could usually always get a sunbed. If it was cooler I would definently stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best place we stayed at during 3 weeks in the USA”
Reviews.Author: McSwain
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 5 Norwegians. This summer we had the vacation of our dreams: 3 full weeks in USA, starting in New York, then Hollywood, Vegas, Williams and Santa Monica. The Stay at Desert Rose was the best value for money we have ever had: Friendly staff, extremely well equipped and large rooms (suites/apartments), great location in walking distance from the strip, but without the noise. Free parking, working wi-fi, two bathroooms, extremely clean, free drinks and snacks in the evening. The list just goes on. I will definitely stay at Desert Rose again, if I go back to Vegas. -Svein, Norway

Reviews.Title: “Lovely quiet setting in middle of Las Vegas hubbub”
Reviews.Author: ChristyForhan
Reviews.Content: Nice comfortable setting near all the noise of Las Vegas. Huge 2 bedroom suite was great. Plenty of room for 5 people. Pool area was nice, too. Breakfast was ok. Go early to avoid the very long lines and lack of seating. Good security, too.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem!!”
Reviews.Author: obione980
Reviews.Content: Great Location. Good Price. Central. We stayed 4 nights in a self contained apartment. Clean. A cool oasis in every way in the midst of the crapshoot that is Las Vegas. This hotel has my highest recommendation!

Reviews.Title: “Just book it!”
Reviews.Author: gfh77665
Reviews.Content: Peace and quite, just a block from the strip! After a full day and part of a busy night on the Strip, drive one block and rest easy in a condo-type tropical oasis. Why rent a strip casino room for $200 or more, when you can have a two bed, two bath, kitchenette condo for HALF that price? The Desert Rose is THE BEST VALUE in Vegas. Book it!

Reviews.Title: “Desert rose is ...well, is like a rose in the desert!”
Reviews.Author: Adrie v
Reviews.Content: Great location near MGM & Hooters. Great rooms. Absolutely clean with good size rooms and helpful staff. Breakfast is fine too, although rather crowded during rush hour. Pool is cool. Hot tub is hot.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastci Hotel, will always go back here when Ireturn to Vegas”
Reviews.Author: donnell
Reviews.Content: Thanks to trip adviser reviews I booked this hotel for my family for a 4 ight stay in July. This hotel is ideal for familys couples etc..... I stayed in a two bedroom suite. It had a full kitchen, fridge freezer, cooker, dishwasher, excellent when you have a family. Three TV's, very comfortable beds. Good but basic complimentary breakfast. Also free wine or beer between 5 and 7 on a Mon to Thurs evening. Five minutes walk to MGM and the monorail. I have stayed in the strip on many occasions, however, the value for money, cleanliness, and size of the rooms plus all the other things stated above mean that I will no longer aim for a strip hotel..... will definately be back to the Desert Rose.......

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: CFdW
Reviews.Content: It is clean and close(walking distance) to the Strip and Mono Rail but nice and quiet. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Would definately stay here again.!”
Reviews.Author: aussietraveler44
Reviews.Content: Stayed here4 nights at end of June 2011.Very glad we found the Desert Rose[thanks to tripadvisor].Great value for money Very clean. We had 2 bedroom 2 bathroon suite, lounge/kitchen areas,3 tv,s,eveything was there that was require we didnt cook while there but having a fridge was great for drinks and snacks etc It is off the strip, which we liked and was only 10min walk to get to the strip hotelsand all the action.felt safe walking around at night. Free parking and breakfast is another bonus-the breakfast does get very crowded though if your not early. reception staff very friendly and helpful.booked our grand canyon helicopter flight thru their tour desk getting best discount i was able to find anywhere. we had two problems while there 1 a blocked toilet that was fixed with in 10min of letting reception know and 2 on our last night our airconditioner had broken down.We arrived back at our rm at 11:15pm to an oven!!.Maintenance were there in 5 min of our call to front desk. It was unable to be fixed so we were given another rm to sleep in for the night no extra charge. Everyone from reception .the maintance man ,housekeeping and security were very helpful and profesional .Thankyou to the Dessert Rose for our stay in Vegas. if we are ever fortunate enough to come back I wil lcertainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the accommodation. Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: MandyH37
Reviews.Content: The trip began with a small hiccup in that booking.com had not emailed our revised booking dates as we had moved the trip a day forward. Consequently Desert Rose had let our room go and also charged me for a 'no-show'. I was initially told they had no rooms but after a short stand off we were accommodated in a conference room and told we would be given a suite the following day. True to their word we got our booked suite the very next day and after that all was well. The accommodation is spacious, the resort itself is a quiet haven away from the strip, which is a 5-10 minute walk depending on how fast you walk and how hot it is! A good casino next door at Hooters and a must is the Mad Onion restaurant in Hooters with beer at $1.50 a bottle. Bargain. We went in many of the casino hotels and if you want on-strip location then book them, we didn't find them smokey at all. I know some reviews state this. Desert Rose provided a basic but good breakfast and free drinks between 5-7pm. Pool area nice with jacuzzi. I would return again.

Reviews.Title: “I want to go back here!”
Reviews.Author: jimw48
Reviews.Content: In over 40 years of travel all over the world, this has to be the best value hotel/resort I have ever experienced. The suite was a one-bedroom apartment, with full kitchen facilities for self-catering, spacious lounge and dining area. As it is not a casino, there is no noisy or smoky gambling area to keep you awake at night, and no slot machines to relieve you of your spare cash. The incuded breakfast was sumptuous, with a full range of hot dishes, cereals, toast, juice, fruit etc. And never crowded, as the brakfast period ran for 2 hours. And we had free drinks in the afternoon at the manager's reception. This is 5-star luxury at a 2-star price. My wife and I were her 2 days from 14th June, and wished we had booked in for a week. We will next time!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and spacious lodging at a great price”
Reviews.Author: 4evertravlin
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night as we used Las Vegas as our gateway to a trip of southern Utah. It was more than I expected. We booked via LasVegasDirect.com which I had never used before but we had no problems. The one bedroom suite was plenty spacious for 2 people. The bed was very comfortable. Having the full kitchen allowed us to store our groceries; the free breakfast was a bonus. It's a long block to the Strip but an easy walk for most people. Free parking. Calling it a resort is a bit of a stretch but it was an excellent choice in lodging for WELL under $100 a night. We would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Resort”
Reviews.Author: newfamilytravelers
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Las Vegas with kids. We have a 4 y/o and a 1 1/2 y/o. I really wanted a suite style room so we could put the kids to bed and still be able to relax in the living room. The kitchen is a plus with kids too!!! The entire resort was clean and staff were friendly. The pool was nice. The continental breakfast was so, so. The same eggs and sausage everyday with the same 3 cold cereals. But you have a kitchen in your room so you can make what you prefer. Our refrigerator wasn't working correctly and they replaced it immediately. The location is also ideal. A block off the strip, right behind Hooters (cheap gambling, drinks and food) and across the street from MGM. It is also walking distance from NY, NY, M. Bay and the Luxor. We will definately stay here again!!! They even had a pack and play ready for us when we arrived. The beds and pillows were also super comfortable!! Which is great when you are out all night and exhausted!

Reviews.Title: “Love it! Will always look here first when coming to Vegas.”
Reviews.Author: DaniMyles
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd stay at the Desert Rose. The first one was just my husband and I in a one bedroom suite and we loved it! This time we brought the kids and had a 2 bedroom suite...perfect! Only a block from the strip but the area is still quiet so you wouldn't even know you were that close. Everything was clean. The beds were amazing...like sleeping on clouds. Suite comes fully stocked with all the utensils and appliances you could possibly need to prepare meals in room for your family to save money. Plus the free breakfast is not just your ordinary continental cold breakfast...hot eggs and sausage available too! The pool is small but still enjoyable and there are BBQ grills available for use at the pool which is nice! We stayed our first two nights in one of the casino hotels on the strip just to have that experience....I will not do that again, such a waste of money! I will come back again and again to the Desert Rose on my future trips to Vegas. Friends that visited our room were equally impressed and said next time they will book their stay at Desert Rose as well!

Reviews.Title: “our second visit”
Reviews.Author: snffrank
Reviews.Content: this was our second visit to this hotell and just like the first it was second to none the staff all bend over backwards to help allways have a smile and a wave we canont fault it in any way at all and will be back for a 3rd and a 4th visit soon rate out of 10 we will give it a 20 think that says it all

Reviews.Title: “loved this hote!”
Reviews.Author: dcirulis
Reviews.Content: Have visited this hotel several times now its set just off the strip near Hooters Hotel. No gaming in this place which is nice!. Breakfast provided free of charge (sausage, eggs, fruit cereal, tea coffee chocolate juice, sodas). Nice apartment style with your own kitchen lounge seperate bedroom. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED even has free managers reception monday-thurs where you can get a free beer/wine and snacks.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: vaca2010_10
Reviews.Content: The Desert Rose Resort is a fabulous find in Las Vegas. We were very pleased with our stay. The room was super clean, staff was so friendly and helpful. The breakfast and Managers Reception were a great addition! We will definitely come and stay again. In fact, I've been telling everyon I know about it and giving them the name and number!

Reviews.Title: “Good budget resort”
Reviews.Author: Dancing_Dogging
Reviews.Content: This is the first time we have stayed at the Desert Rose. It is typical of the shell resorts, large living room, kitchen, separate bedroom and bathroom and above all comfortable beds though this resort could do with a bit of updating. Some of the furniture through out the resort was looking a bit tired. Good place for families on a budget and peace and quiet away from the strip but in walking distance. Great to have free breakfast and afternoon drinks included.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Resort Apartment”
Reviews.Author: jim_bayfield
Reviews.Content: Lovely apartment. Separate Bedroom, lounge, large kitchen, good sized bathroom. Just off the strip and close to MGM and New york New york. Nice size pool. Quiet , off strip location but within easy walking distance. Our room only had a view of a small garden, but some rooms overlooked the pool. Did'nt matter that much as we were out most of the time. Very good and well equipped kitchen, massive fridge/freezer. Great if you wanted to do a little self catering but as there is a great choice of restaurants didnt use it that much. Great for making tea / coffee snacks though. The free breakfast buffet was good and you could pick up and take to your apartment if you wished. Mon to Fri had a free wine / beer between 5pm 7pm which was great. Overall highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Love The Rose”
Reviews.Author: BarbEdmonton
Reviews.Content: My daughter and myself recently returned from a 5 day stay at the Desert Rose Resort. I love it there, it is a little piece of paradise in the middle of Las Vegas. We thoroughly enjoyed the pool, and the free breakfast every morning which was just wonderful! The staff there are very friendly and helpful, and the rooms are really nice, clean and comfortable. It was within walking distance of the strip, and after a busy day out it was so nice to come back to such a lovely resort and unwind and relax or go for a dip in the pool. I have stayed there once before and was so glad to be able to do so again. We will definitely come back. Thanks to the terrific staff for a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “I love this place”
Reviews.Author: philippeCiney
Reviews.Content: Third time in this resort and I still love it... Fantastic and quiet location ( a few steps from the Tropicana) ; fantastic (and clean) suite, great staff, lovely pool, good breakfast, easy parking and a super price !!!! (I paid $ 70/ a night in May !). The perfection in Vegas...

Reviews.Title: “Hardly a resort but comfortable enough”
Reviews.Author: zach42
Reviews.Content: The Desert Rose rooms were large and had a full kitchen which was helpful as we prepared the majority of our meals rather than eating out. Bed was comfortable and rooms were cleaned daily. Even though it was a non smoking room, it had the smell of smoke (not everyone follows house rules). Bathroom/ toilet was small but adequate. The rate came with continental breakfast which was 3 cereals, scrambled eggs and sausages - no change of menu here. We could have done with more fruit Even though the hotel was off the Las Vegas strip, it was within walking distance of MGM Grand and bus stops - there is a Vons supermarket within about 5 bus stops where we bought all our groceries at a reasonable price. We did not try the pool as we either went out or it was crowded, but the other guests seemed to enjoy it. We chose not to pay by credit card as many reviewers complained of credit card fraud after visitng resort but hotel was accomodating when paying by travellers cheques. The only thing was that by no using a credit card, we could not dial out from room phone to make local calls - the receptionist connected us to our call. We could call this a resort but it is suitable for a family or people on a budget as it is very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Comfort!!!”
Reviews.Author: hyker1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I felt like we were in a lovely condo! Full kitchen with fully stocked utensils and place-settings, separate living/bedroom space with TWO televisions, vanity area outside the bath, and balcony overlooking a quiet courtyard and fountain. Desert Rose staff treated us like royalty and since the Concierge had a day-off, they showed us an easy location to pick up discounted show/dinner tickets. Being close to MGM Grand, it's walking distance from the Vegas Monorail. Crossing the busy intersection was dicey at first, but once you know where to go, it's easy and safe. One thing my husband and I loved was that this "resort" is NOT a casino. There are no gambling halls, slots, or anything on the property to make it crazy and noisy at night. However, it's convenient to gaming and Hooter's is right next door, so that's an accessible place whenever you're wanting some gaming. It's also VERY secure. You'll need an access/room key-card to get from place to place in the building. Drawbacks: the ONLY ones? We did have a leaky shower faucet. We reported it, and it still leaked the next day. Breakfast (which is delicious & complimentary) was the same both days, without variety. However, most Vegas resorts don't even offer comp. breakfast, so we were still pleased with both the hot and cold offerings. The sausages were especially yummy. Lastly, getting to the strip for the first time on foot is daunting. Be sure to ask staff to show/explain the safest way to go. I highly recommend Desert Rose. It's beautifully decorated, hospitable, friendly, and AFFORDABLE!!! Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “home away from home”
Reviews.Author: happy23005
Reviews.Content: our stay was great. It was an apartment with maid service. The breakfast was also very good. You have everything you need even a gym and pool. I wish this resort was national.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: holidayaddict
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights at the end of June. Loved the rooms which had own kitchen, living area, TV and TV in bedroom too. I was a bit concerned overlooking Hooters but their music stopped at 10pm and it wasn't very loud anyway. Only concern we had was heavy bass music, well you couldn't hear the music just he thud thud thud of the bass, this was still going at 11pm, it was weird because we could only hear it in our room, the floor was vibrating, I went for a walk around to find where it was coming from and couldn't. I got so annoyed with it I went to reception and told them, they immediately got a security guy to check the premises, and within 5 minutes it had stopped, it happened again the next night but stopped around 9pm. (Not that I am stereotyping but there was a group of lads staying and it could well have been from their room having a few bevvies before they went out, goodness knows how they could hear themselves think with the racket tho!) Given that it was 110 degrees there were only 5 parasols around the pool. My other half burns so easily he has to sit in the shade so we had to get up early so we could get a bed, table, chair and parasol. Breakfast was scrambled egg, bacony sausage things, toast, cereal. Ok but got crowded. Free starbucks coffee all day. They stored our bags after checking out at midday as we had a couple of hours to kill so went off for lunch. I would stay here again most definitely, the rooms were pure luxury compared to other Vegas hotel rooms. Loved the non-casino element.

Reviews.Title: “It is nice.”
Reviews.Author: orange55-11
Reviews.Content: As Owner in this time share, I have very bad experience with the Owner, Mr. Jene and his wife Lea and the whole shell vacation staff. Bought this unite few years ago, I used it only 2 times. Every time I call to enjoy my unit. I was told no vacancies and the charges around 200 dollars a night for my own unit. How they accept me to pay that much for something I own. To top it off the maintenance fees yearly for something I can’t use. Paid thousands of dollars for this unit. You get the picture.

Reviews.Title: “A litte Gem in Mad Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: CardiffMeryl
Reviews.Content: I have recently returned from a 3 week holiday to the USA. Our first stop was Las Vegas, and I booked the Desert Rose after reading the reviews on trip advisor. This is a little gem off the main strip near MGM Hotel and behind hooters. The suite was huge. Kitchen, living room, queen sized bed and bathroom, we even had towells provided for the pool. My only compliant would be that breakfast is included and is the same everyday, but it is adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: MCC3303
Reviews.Content: At one end of the stip - can walk the strip, but it was very hot. Three story high accommodation. Near Hooters - could hear music from Hooters pool area only when in the carpark. Rooms very quiet, clean and comfortable. Slow to service room some days -was as late at 4pm some days. Full size kitchen. Small bathroom with toilet - but managable. Large vanity area separate from bathroom. Large lounge room with balcony. We entertained in our suite with 3 couples. Good room size for adults and children. Two televisions. Breakfast ok - very crowded and not alot of sitting room around dinning area or outside. Pool area very clean. Opens strictly at 0700 with guests waiting to keep seating areas for family for the day. Lift slow. Our hire car got hit in the car park (no note left by other driver)- security advised on course of action to take etc. Close to MGM and rail to go further up the strip.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we`ll be back”
Reviews.Author: jeep0129
Reviews.Content: Well situated, very clean and personnel very polite and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for families”
Reviews.Author: taj24
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed with our two children for 3 nights in a two bedroom suite. It was spacious at about 900 sq ft and we had a nice balcony with a view of the Luxor, Tropicana and New York New York. It was fairly quiet although since it is located at the south end of the strip you do get a fair amount of helicopter traffic. We noticed it particularly in the evenings when we were at the pool through about 9 or 10 at night. I also noticed loud, thumping music on a couple of nights that started around 3 in the morning. Not sure if that was just because our room faced the strip. My parents were in a room that faced the inside of the complex and they never heard a thing. But for the most part, being inside your room is pretty quiet considering how close the strip is. The Pool is the perfect temperature for the heat of Vegas and there is even a hot tub sized kids pool that is only a foot and a half deep-a nice surprise for my 2 year-old. It was pretty shady in the evenings and never too crowded. The free breakfast in the morning is great....eggs, sausage, toast, cereal, oatmeal and bananas. There was a manager's reception the first night we were there with beer, wine, soda and snacks. The parking is free and there was never a lack of spaces. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful, the grounds were very well kept and the strip is within walking distance. It's a fantastic place to stay with a fantastic price to match.

Reviews.Title: “married in vegas Elvis style”
Reviews.Author: mrpaul69
Reviews.Content: stayed here last June not July as stated for 5 days as got married to my Beautiful wife Sandra....there was also my parents...my sister who lives in LakeTahoe her husband and two boys....my younger sister who lives in Florida and her husband...we all stayed at the Desert Rose after reading the great reviews back home in the U.K and it lived up to those reviews....loved this place...loved the large spacious room...loved thats its not highrise had family members staying at Wynn Encore and another fancy hotel....but prefered the Desert Rose...just seemed so friendly and everytime we asked the nice staff...How do we get to here or how do we do this or that...are questions were no trouble and we were always helped with no fuss...Read the last review state that alot of the Europeans were stuck-up well were Europeans and can assure you that we were never stuck-up....anyway know its taken a year to write this review but the DesertRose has never been out of our thoughts..just come back from the Canary Islands celebrating are first year of marraige....but all we could think of was Vegas and the DesertRose just like myself and Sandra my wife go together then so does Vegas and the Desertrose....also liked CoCo at the end of the road for dinner...anyway we cannot wait to come back and this time for longer, as it was abit hectic with going to the court house for the wedding licence and getting married flying over the GrandCanyon taking in a show David Copperfield who was Awsome then from Vegas drove to Holbrook, Sedona, Flagstaff and then on to SanFran and drove on to LakeTahoe in total travelled over 2,400 miles ...

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable place off the strip”
Reviews.Author: NYBuddy33
Reviews.Content: The Desert Rose is a comfortable establishement just off the strip adjacent to Hooters and within walking distance to many strip hotels including MGM, NYNY, Tropicana, etc. The desert Rose itself is relatively clean, but it could use some updating...Some of the furniture is a bit tired. The staff is generally helpful, but could use some improvements. The pool is nice..get there early because it fills up fast. The Desert Rose offers a free breakfast buffet, and a free cocktail hour. Overall, the Desert Rose is a nice place to stay if you're looking to stay at a non-casino establishment and there is reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Kept Secret In Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: BasketballMom64
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at the Desert Rose Resort in June 2011. The service was impeccable. The staff was professional and accommodating when I encountered any problems. I did have a plumbing issue which was resolved in a timely manner (30 minutes). The continental breakfast is very basic, bagels, cereal, eggs etc. The resort is timeshare property. The time share holders or guest appear to be of a European culture, very snooty and not friendly. Not warm and fuzzy like citizen of the U.S.A. This is not a reason to avoid Desert Rose. The suites are spacious, the full size kitchen is wonderful for the travelers with kids who prefer to cook opposed to eating out every day. Very close to the strip. I will definitely reserve a suite at this resort on my next visit and have recommended Desert Rose to numerous friends and associates.

Reviews.Title: “A great retreat off the Crazy Las Vegas Strip”
Reviews.Author: mariasatterlund
Reviews.Content: We stayed for the second time at the Desert Rose in Vegas. It is a close walk to casinos, yet is a nice, quiet, non casino resort. It would be great for families, though we were there just my husband and I. We enjoyed the pool area, the complimentary breakfast and beautiful and spacious accommodations. The bed is VERY comfortable, and the whole place is clean and beautiful. Would definitely recommend and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Vacation”
Reviews.Author: NananneEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a jewel in Las Vegas, clean, friendly and not a slot machine in sight. From the time you check in the staff and concierge are there to help you. The pool area was adequate and never got too crowded as people were coming and going during the day another blessing was that pool towels were provided in your room. Having a complimentary breakfast on hand each day was a bonus and saved quite a bit on our spending fund. There were plenty places around to eat at very reasonable rates and found Hooters next door to be our best find - food was lovely at around $10 - $15 per person. We had a fantastic holiday and would recommend the Desert Rose to our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Really is a rose in the desert...”
Reviews.Author: travelpatty22
Reviews.Content: Thanks again TA reviewers, this was the perfect place for us in LV! It's a beautiful oasis amid the glitter and glam. The staff was very helpful and friendly when we checked in. Our condo was wonderful. Very well furnished and stylish. Carpeting getting a little worn and bathroom smallish, but loved having a kitchen,dining, living room and deck. A great place to relax. The pool is small, but probably not many people using it most of the time. The breakfast was good for a resort with no restaurant. Expect long lines the last half hour. They do need to keep it open longer or put in another serving line. They have 2 of everything, but one line--go figure. But it was worth the wait, considering it was included. The location is great and we never used our car once--walked everywhere, but you need you need to be in walking shape. It was cool and windy so we didn't get to enjoy the pool or our deck as much as we'd like. We had a top floor, inside condo and it was nice--no street noise. Pretty quiet place--partiers go elsewhere. Would love to have a family reunion here. Good place to stay with kids in LV. FYI--the best buffet and meal we had in LV was The Wicked Spoon at the Cosmopolitan(another score for TA reviewers).
