More gourmet style, very trendy, smaller, large Asian selection, and desserts to diet for (lots of gelatto flavors, French style pastries, chocolates, etc)! Wouldn't bother with any of the others unless you want food you could get at home. The $9.99 special at the Wild Onion at the Hooters Resort next door was really good. This is a family place, the other place is in another part of the resort. Had enough food for lunch the next day!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money! Fantastic, helpful, delightful staff!”
Reviews.Author: Cvt2011
Reviews.Content: We had a brilliant week at the Desert Rose - I would thoroughly recommend this resort to families, groups of friends and people who want a quiet retreat from the Vegas Strip without having to leave it too far behind. It's located a 5 min walk from the MGM grand but feels like a little oasis - perfect for relaxing in-between trips to the Strip. The staff were so helpful and catered to our every need - anything we needed they were happy to help. Best of all this place is clean, spacious and superb value for money. I would stay here again and will continue to recommend it to anyone who wants somewhere off the Strip, cheap but enjoys high standards.

Reviews.Title: “Had high expectations and they were met!”
Reviews.Author: H0garth
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived at the Desert Rose the evening of Sun, June 12th and left at 7:00am Thurs, June 16th. We did the "Stay 3 nights, get 4th night for a penny" deal. I'd read all the reviews before we arrived and wasn't disappointed. We love how close it is to the airport. We had a 8:15am flight out and left by taxi for that airport at 7:00. We were through security and walking to our gate by 7:15. Tip: Don't take the shuttle to the airport as it costs $7 per person and the taxi ride, with tip, was $12. We didn't use the pool so can't comment on that but everything else people have said here is true. The staff is friendly, the place is clean, great FREE breakfast, nice happy hour. We had a flat screen TV in the living room and an older TV in the bedroom but we didn't come to Vegas to sit in our room and watch TV. Lots of hot water and good water pressure in the shower. Didn't have any problem using our cell phones or the internet. There's a little convenience shop in the lobby and we bought bottled water there for $1.50. I checked bottled water prices at several places and they ranged from $2.50 to $4.95 so we appreciated the low price at the Desert Rose. Saw the concierge and bought tickets to a show, which included dinner, for $100 less then the price I found on the internet plus she threw in comp tickets to a afternoon magic show. FYI did have to pay cash for the tickets but there is an ATM machine in the lobby. I agree with what people have said on here about the Hooters. We didn't have a car and it is the closest place to eat. We ate there twice due to the convenience but I told my husband I refuse to go in there again even if it meant walking further when it was 105 degrees. Other than the waitress in The Mad Onion restaurant and the hostess in the Hooters restaurant all the other employees seemed surly and never smiled. Plus the place reeked of cig smoke.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay and recommend to all”
Reviews.Author: Jim331
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a very nice property with a very friendly staff, clean well maintained rooms. The pool area was very welcoming with enough space for everyone to feel comfortable. We stayed for only one night but the experience was positive. Our reservation was ready, the price we were quoted was the price we paid and there were no extra charges for anything. The breakfast was a real breakfast with something for everyone and the staff invited us to a happy hour in the lobby for that evening. Although we could not attend the happy hour due to our travel plans it was nice to be invited and we thought it was a nice perk. In Las Vegas it seems like every big hotel-casino is attempting nickel and dime their guests for everything it was very nice to stay in a place that actually seemed interested in providing a positive experience to their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: jmiller60
Reviews.Content: Found a great deal on the internet for this property. We came with extended family so we booked two 2 bedroom suites. I had requested both rooms be next to each other on the bottom floor and they honored my request. Location is right behind the Tropicana next to Hooters. Only had to walk a block to get to the strip. I was concerned about airport noise when I booked the room but never heard any airplane noise. The pool area was always clean. Internet site said continental breakfast and was suprised to see a buffet with eggs,sausage, cereal and fruit. They also had a reception from 5-7 that provided free snacks, beer, wine. They also did bingo. This place far exceeded my expectations! I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Oasis in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: BrooklineGreat
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay to get away from the craziness of Las Vegas but only a 2 minute walk to get back to the craziness!! My 9 year old and I stayed at the Desert Rose as part of a rafting trip - it was just awesome! The staff was VERY helpful, the hotel VERY clean and the pool area was great for myself and my daughter. They were very accommodating for our schedule, storing bags, allowing us access to the pool and showers after check out. The concierge was just awesome, very cheerful and helpfu and even got us a great deal on a rental car - we just wanted it for the morning cost us $20. The breakfast and light apps for dinner were very well planned and organized. We will definitely be back when we do another rafting trip!

Reviews.Title: “Second to none”
Reviews.Author: MacRob81
Reviews.Content: Not only was the service and price excellent but the rooms were fantastic. We had the comfort of a two bedroom/two bathroom suite with a full kitchen. The location is close to everything we wanted and we enjoyed the quiet clean pool and hotel facilities. Our friends in other hotels close by were wishing they had booked here as well. All and all a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Comfortable and Clean Hotel with Great Breakfast - VERY Well Located for the Vegas 'Strip' and Local Access”
Reviews.Author: LPWilliams
Reviews.Content: This review (it starts after the dashed lines below if you want to straight to it) is part of a 'set' of hotels/motels/attractions I stayed in/experienced whilst touring the region in and around southern Utah, aiming to visit the fantastic National Parks there, by hire car in May 2011. I have created an extensive Trip Advisor 'Trip List' which details the numerous significant attractions I visited/the places I stayed in enroute and includes a tour map and (hopefully) lots of helpful information/Internet/Trip Advisor links. Trip Advisor haven't (yet ?) properly integrated it for direct access: to get to it you start by doing the required action to see my individual TA reviews/photos/videos (which I hope you will !) by mouse-clicking my profile 'name' located in the top-left corner of this review, below my profile picture of the Giza Pyramids, then mouse-clicking the blue 'Reviews' link from the resulting pop-up window. As well now being able to see my reviews, you can then access my Trip List by looking in the left-hand 'Contributions list (there you can also see my photos/videos direct) and select 'Trip List' - it is entitled 'Las Vegas + South Utah National Parks + Monument Valley, Arizona - May 2011'; click the title link and away you go - easy, NOT ! (TA admin please note !) For accommodation my price range was $50-$60incl/night (occasionally up to $90incl due to local 'inflation'), for non-smoking rooms in establishments which were best located for visiting the nearby venue (sometimes for several days), that were TA reviewed as quiet/clean and should be well-equipped (eg fridge, wi-fi); I was not too bothered about what eateries etc were in the local area, nor if there were things like a swimming pool, as my days were maximised for visiting the associated National Park/hiking etc, the room being used to reflect on the day/'unwind'/sleep in ! ------------- The Desert Rose was the first place I stayed in, on arrival in the USA landing @ McCarran - $14 for a taxi from there to the hotel. Booked via Expedia at $60incl/weekday night for a 'One Bedroom Suite - 650 sqft'. Pre-paid with Expedia also meant I didn't have to deal with credit cards, considering the recent problems the DR has had with details being illegally accessed and used for fraudulent transactions with your card account..... As expected, the location WAS excellent for accessing the LV 'strip' and also public transport as there were stops less than 5mins walk away. The hotel setting is remarkably quiet considering the location, but even from a 1st floor room don't expect any outside views of anything other than the sides of adjacent buildings or hotel rooftops. So my balcony was fairly pointless, but I could see that ground floor rooms which face inwards could offer the opportunity of a central 'courtyard' view - except you have zero privacy from other rooms and residents walking by. The check-in staff were efficient and courteous, the centrally-located reception also houses a concierge-type desk corner with tourist pamphlets and useful maps and the adjacent seating/serving area for breakfast. The room was quite outstanding; the fully-equipped kitchen is perhaps a bit overkill, but you have a very handy dining table, spacious TV lounge and bedroom with hand basin area + en-suite bath/shower room with WC. It was 90 degrees+ outside and the integrated aircon worked very effectively. Everything was clean, smart and tidy and pleasantly soundproofed - no complaints at all and no bed bugs (I have never had them in ANY bed in ANY hotel and am of the opinion that reviews which mention them are malicious !). Breakfast was surprisingly good, offering scrambled eggs/sausage, fresh fruit, yoghurts as well the usual toast etc and the staff were quick to re-supply and tidy up; polystyrene plates/cups and plastic cutlery (yuk !), but you can't have everything I suppose ! You have the option of eating outside near to the pool area, which makes for a pleasant start to the day and keeps you away from the hiatus around those busy food serving areas... I've had little remarkable to say about the hotel or room itself as there is not much to quibble about and everything is so good. For a comfortable and clean hotel, very well located in the happening area of LV which is also reasonably priced you can't really go wrong with the Desert Rose. Add quiet surroundings, a well furnished room, a better than average breakfast and good access to public transport and it seals the deal !

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for Families!”
Reviews.Author: jandk1
Reviews.Content: 1st place we stayed when arriving in Las Vegas. A bit off the beaten path, but VERY nice & clean! Excellent staff, clean rooms, great pool, filling continentel breakfast! Too bad the price doubled on the weekend! We would have LOVED to stayed our entire vacation with the Desert Rose!

Reviews.Title: “Little gem - cheap and nearly excellent but....”
Reviews.Author: sveci
Reviews.Content: Ive stayed in The Desert Rose Resort early this year for three days, right after two days at MGM. Cant to compare, because of different sizes, different services (casino, entertaining, etc...) and so on. Hotel is situated right next to Hooters or Tropicana or MGM (few yards away). Somebody told me that is not possible to go there by walk and I need to use a car, but thats not true. You just need to cross the highway using crosswalks... so its not that complicated. Duke Ellington street is probably the quietest location on the strip, or just close to the strip (if meaning by monorail stations). So you are not disturbed by a noisy casinos and other typical attractions. Desert Rose Complex is big enough to get lost while trying to find your apartment. But its not a big deal as the huge MGM. Next to the reception desk is the small shop with some amenities and snacks for a long night - big surprise - its really cheap. As usual, you need to put your credit/debit card or cash as a deposit. Early this year there was a problem with some credit card scams, so I ask for a cash deposit - without any problem. Dont know if its solved now, so Im not sure if to recommend to do the same thing as i did. Apartment is big enough except a really tiny bathroom. Resort is offering toiletries for free, so you dont need to bring yours. Kitchen is also fully equipped. I dont know if my apartment was sanitized, but it smelled like an antibacterial solution (windows opening was not helpfull). The other thing is, that furniture should be refurbished (its a bit worn). Resort is fully equipped with internet, but aware of speed restrictions when its fully loaded - same as MGM or other hotels. During my stay, the internet connection was soo slow, but I cant to complain, when comparing to the one at MGM.

Reviews.Title: “Good place”
Reviews.Author: Linnepin_99
Reviews.Content: This Resort was recommended by family and they were right, it's a good place away from the madness of the Strip. Due to our nine hour time difference we were always early for b'fast but it did get pretty busy later on with not enough places to sit. It would be nice if they rotate some of the hot b'fast items because it is pretty basic. But it will start your day of right. Rooms are nice with plenty of space, nice to have a kitchen as well. Unfortunately the pool area is rather small, you almost have to put your towel down first thing because if you go back at 9.00 or so there isn't any spot left. We managed to sit there 3 times, but it gets so crowded that at 11:00 or so you're pretty much sit on top of each other so we left. Again we were lucky we were early risers or we would have missed it all together. Housekeeping could be a bit better, very nice people but are a bit sloppy. But they overall experience was good, you can't beat the price and the location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Stonesteps
Reviews.Content: I was at the resort for almost a week. I had a fabulous one bedroom for under a $100 a night. It was perfect for me. I didn't take advantage of the free breakfast but it looked adequate. Staff was friendly and helpful. The TVs are old and fuzzy, but it was a minor issue.

Reviews.Title: “Take this one if you want to relax”
Reviews.Author: xm66
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located 2 minutes of walking from the 'strip' (near Luxor and MGM). This area is already very calm and it's a very good place to stay if you want to be away from the crazy noisy main street and relax a bit. We had a very spacious room with separate bedroom and full kitchen. The room still had 2 old large CRT TVs, anyway we did not have much time to watch it. The only negative thing was the noisy A/C - even when shut-off we could hear (and feel) the A/C from the room below. This was, however, solved by closing the door on the bedroom during night. Breakfast was good, the staff is friendly, rooms were comfortable and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Our Only Hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: PrinceJepoy
Reviews.Content: We had a very good stay in this hotel. Everything was perfect from lobby to your room nicely decorated, super clean, free parking, secured access to hotel premises, 5 minute walk proximity to tropicana avenue where the MGM Hotel located. Free internet wifi good connection. Super quiet location in spite of it 5 minutes away from strip. free breakfast with lots of selection. free starbucks coffee 24hrs a day. Highly recommended to all who wants a clean.smokefree hotel yet very near to all the actions. In fact i already booked our next trip to Vegas this December to Desert Rose.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: chapel1
Reviews.Content: After 4 trips to Vegas staying on the Strip in Hotels, we decided this year we would like something quieter. The Desert Rose was great from the moment we checked in until we left. Everyone was so friendly and the apartments were great with everything you need if you wanted to cater for yourself. We had a one bedroom apartment, it was a good size and the maid service was good. We paid the $100 cash after reading the credit card problems and this was no problem to them. The lady Concierge was so helpful and friendly, she went out of her way to help. The breakfasts were fine, same things every day but substantial. Only a 10 minute to the MGM ( and we are oldies!!) so everything very close. The only little complaint was that the sun loungers around the pool were all taken/reserved by 8am, this was a shame and there was no chance to get one all day. This didn't spoil our trip though and I would reccomend it to anyone who want a peaceful end to the day.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem,”
Reviews.Author: jaxmax59
Reviews.Content: stayed at the desert rose for 6 nights, stayed in a 2 bed suite, wonderful, room was perfect, daily maid service, plus a complimentary b/fast, just a stones throw from the MGM and the Strip. Pool area was nice and not busy, Staff were excelent always willing to help. We will return, and would recommend to all our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Superb place to stay”
Reviews.Author: TerryfromBlackwater
Reviews.Content: -- We asked for a quiet family room, and got a quiet room , all four sides had no one adjacent. Room itself was spotless, two bedrooms each with its own bathroom , much to my daughter,s delight; 3 televisions, Fridge with freezer, microwave, oven, dishwasher Continental breakfast had Hot scrambled egg and Hot mini sausages plus all the rest. Room was cleaned each day spotlessly. It was within easy walking distance of the MGM where you could catch the monorail to the strip. If you want a reasonable , comfortable place to stay this is it . Tiny moan was the size of the pool amenities , (ie/ loungers and shade ) compared to number of people staying . Terry from Blackwater , England Regards Terry Reardon

Reviews.Title: “This Is An Awesome Place!”
Reviews.Author: funtrip44
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Desert Rose in March over spring break. We were a family of four with two college aged sons. We all agreed that it was by far the way to go when staying in Las Vegas! Our boys had not been to Vegas before and I think they appreciated the resort being away from the strip but also a short walk over as well. It was great to have the two bedrooms and bath areas. Just as the other reviewers have stated it was super clean and well taken care of. The breakfast and managers reception was an added plus and our boys enjoyed it as well. I have waited to write my review so that I could report that we have had no credit card fraud on the card we used for this room!!!!! I must admit I had a concern over this matter, after reading the other reviews months ago but we had no probelm since our trip in March. We rented a car and had no problem getting around and the parking is very easy at The Desert Rose. We would love to go back to the Desert Rose again. They have a great thing going on there. The best of both worlds when visiting Las Vegas. Close enough to walk to the strip, but just enough off the strip to be peaceful! Nice job Desert Rose!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: MidlandsTony
Reviews.Content: Stayed during a vacation visit to Las Vegas and the surrounding area. The Desert Rose is situated in a quiet area behind Hooters and Tropicana, just a short walk to the monorail station at MGM, which we found ideal. Our room was clean and well suited our needs, having a separate lounge with dining table and kitchen was a real bonus. We used the kitchen to cook an evening meal on a number of occasions, which was handy as it enabled us to enjoy our vacation time without having to eat out every night. We usually ate breakfast in our apartment (for convenience), but when we did visit the breakfast buffet on our first morning in Las Vegas (after arriving late the night before) the food provided was more than adequate and the hot sausage and scrambled eggs tasty. All of the staff that we encountered were helpful, friendly and polite, when I rang about a blown bulb the maintenance man visited in a matter of minutes. We found that the Desert Rose met our needs well, it was more convenient than stopping in a Strip hotel and gave us the freedom to make our own choices.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: Jeanette009
Reviews.Content: We traded our timeshare to stay here and we were glad we did. Clean, great pool, fully equipped modern kitchen, daily room service for cleaning and the extra touches of the free breakfast and manager's reception in the afternoon were really over and above the average. We liked having a private place to stay that's very close to the Strip, but not noisy, congested and mammoth like the big casino resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: TexasClide
Reviews.Content: Spaceous 1 bedroom suite with full kitchen was clean, quiet and comfortable. Breakfast good. Evening manager's reception with complimentary drinks a nice bonus.

Reviews.Title: “A few tips re Desert Rose”
Reviews.Author: travelaslongasican
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from 2 weeks at the DR though did visit SFO for 3 nights and did a four day tour of Grand Canyon, Bryce, Zion and Monument. Yes, the breakfast is busy especially nearing 9am when it finishes during the week (10 am weekends) You can always take stuff back up to your room though but they don't provide trays. Cutlery and crockery is all plastic. The 2 bed suites have an ensuite shower room and a bathroom with shower over the bath. Pool area gets very busy especially if hot, they could do with a few more shady areas or umbrellas. If you are walking then the quickest way to the strip is to go towards Hooters but then walk along the back of Hooters along the back wall of the DRose i.e. left out of the car park. You can then cross the Tropicana car park and round to the front of the Tropicana. If you intend using the Duece bus (7$ for 24 hours) the bus stop outside the Tropicana is much easier as the next stop up at the MGM can get very busy - the Tropicana stop bus ticket payment doesn't take cash so either pay on the Duece though you must have right money or pay by card in the machine. If going back on the bus then get off at the excalibur and cross over the footbridge. Don't bother with the monorail as it runs behinds the hotels and at $5 for one trip is expensive. The staff at the DR are very helpful, in all a good place to stay unless your really want to be on the strip. I told the DR on checkout that it would be nice if there was a bar but that is the only downside

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: 1949meatman
Reviews.Content: Loved the Rose the minute we entered our suite.Clean and excellently furnished bedroom , living area and fully equipped kitchen .The location is Great. Close enough to the Strip to walk, but also far enough away for a quiet and relaxing vacation. Lovely grounds and pool area. Great location for Family's. Yummy breakfast and we really enjoyed the snack and beverages in the evening, giving us the opportunity to meet other guests.Can;t say enough about how Friendly and Helpful all the Staff were. We are recommending The Desert Rose to all our family and friends and can;t wait to Return.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Mogs56
Reviews.Content: After reading about the Desert Rose on Trip Advisor we decided to give it a go. We are so glad we did, everything was brilliant. All the staff were very friendly and helpful. No more than ten minutes from the strip but very quiet, the beds were extremely comfortable had great sleep each night. Hooters right nearby $1.50 Bud 24/7 if and when we return to Vegas we wouldn’t consider staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “As a mature couple we loved it, very comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: Lesleyeg
Reviews.Content: Very handy for the Strip, Staff very accomodating, conceirge gave excellent service and went out of her way to get you the best deal. The breakfast was good and the complementary happy hour a great idea. Good value & certainly recommend hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay! Fantastic Value!”
Reviews.Author: Nanoook
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a great stay at the Desert Rose Resort. We got a quiet and beautiful one bedroom suite for less than half the price of one crummy room on the Strip. Our suite was squeeky clean and beautifully furnished. How nice to have a separate bedroom - just like home, but better! The full kitchen was amazing: it had everything you would need for cooking - way more than even my own kitchen! I loved the room decor and how it matched the decor throughout the resort. Even the stoneware in the kitchen maintained the theme! The continental breakfast was great. Scrambled eggs! We completely forgot about the manager's reception, but what a nice touch that is! We didn't have a chance to use the pool but it looked beautiful. The peace and beauty of this place (no noisy, smoke-filled casino here) far outweighs the slight inconvenience of staying 1 1/2 blocks off the strip. I love this place and plan to stay at the Desert Rose Resort for all my future trips to Las Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Peace and Quiet Off of the Vegas Strip”
Reviews.Author: Bizzy4424
Reviews.Content: Desert Rose was a pleasant surprise. We stayed there before and after our recent rafting trip. We arent big gamblers so it was nice to have an "at home experience" and yet be so close to the strip that we could walk everywhere. We loved the two bedroom units and will definitley stay there again. Friendly staff, very clean and a good value!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: traceeh007
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at a number of hotels in Vegas, both on and off the Strip, and I have to say that the Desert Rose is by far my favorite. One block off the strip makes a world of differance- none of that casino/hotel junk to deal with, but close enough to be in the hubub if you want to be within a five minute walk. Awesome rooms with full kitchen. Free breakfast in the morning-eggs, sausage, cereal, etc. Free Happy Hour at night-wine and beer- unheard of! Great pool. What else can I say? I'll only stay at the Desert Rose from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: kellirussell
Reviews.Content: I loved this place. The location was close to the strip. Having a car is necessary in my opinion, but you can travel the back streets to get anywhere on the strip easily. The 2BR was clean and it was nice having 2 bathrooms. The breakfast was adequate ... eggs, sausage, toast, cereals. Also juice and Starbucks coffee. The coffe and tea and cold water were available all day and evening. Nice work out area. Excellent maid service every day. Check-in was a breeze and the entire staff was friendly and helpful. It could get crowded at breakfast in the lobby so we always ate with others and shared a table - lots of older visitors from England and Australia. They were very friendly and seemed to be regular visitors to this place. No casino.,I liked the peacefulness. About a 5 minute walk to MGM Grand and very close to Hooters if you want to visit a casino quick!

Reviews.Title: “Great resort - away from the chaos that is Vegas”
Reviews.Author: WalesJulia
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights at the end of April. Never been to Vegas before and after reading the reviews this seemed the ideal place. And it did not disappoint. Ideal location for the strip, opposite MGM Grand and behind Hooters, but just far away to escape the busy life of Vegas. Arrived after travelling a 10 hour flight and was made to feel welcome straight away. There are reviews that mention problems with credit cards being copied, so we went prepared to offer cash as a deposit instead. Reception did not take any deposit at all or even ask for one. The room was a one bedroom apartment in the 4th block, 3rd floor. very quiet and peaceful. Room was great, comfortable and clean. After adjusting to the time difference, we slept soundly. Breakfast is complimentary. Simple stuff to eat - nothing fancy - just enough to start off the day. Coffee is available 24hours in the lobby. The pool can get busy but we were coming back about 3pm and it was OK then. So off we went for our first experience of Vegas. It is busy, crazy, over the top, tacky and I guess that is what makes it brilliant. Don't take it seriously just enjoy watching everyone else take it seriously. It is actually nice to return to the Desert Rose and walk into a hotel that does not have slot machines in the lobby. Must be the only hotel in Vegas that doesn't. Favourite hotels to visit - MGM Grand and the Venetian. How many hotels have a canal and gondelier running thorugh it? The buffet in the Bellagio is well worth it, great views from the Eiffel Tower. We hired a car for 3 days and made our own way to the Grand Canyon via Route 66. Hubby loved this - we were in a convertible Mustang on Route 66 stopping at typical diners for breakfast and lunch. The last morning of the car we went out early and just drove up and down the strip with the roof down. How cool are we? To sum up - this hotel is a great place to stay, very convenient location and ideal to come back to at the end of the day to escape the hussle and bussle that is Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Nice quiet resort close to the strip”
Reviews.Author: NortheastRasm
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 bed/2 bath unit on the third floor. Our room was clean and linens were readily available for the pool and room. There was plenty of room for sleeping four, a functional kitchen and a quiet atmosphere. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The pool area does get busy and there is not much shade so plan ahead if you are planning a pool day. The breakfast has great variety and there is Starbucks coffee available all day. I was originally concerned from reading other reviews that we would be far from the strip but it is only a 10 minute walk and cabs are readily available. I felt safer walking from here than I did from the Platinum last December. This is a great choice for families, groups and those who do not want a noisy smoke filled place.

Reviews.Title: “THEY WENT ABOVE AND BEYOND CUSTOMER SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: zippy230
Reviews.Content: on our second day in vegas my fiance fell and broke his leg in two places. so needless to say we spent the next two days sitting in our room waiting to fly home where he ended up having surgery. the employees there were so helpful we would have to order food and have it delivered to the front desk employees would actually bring it to our room for us (they didnt have to do that) most people have to pick up their orders in the lobby. they also allowed us a late check out so that he could stay off of his leg as much as possible. i appreciate what they did for us and will be staying there again. amazing customer service...thanks again for everything....

Reviews.Title: “Heaven in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: krasna1
Reviews.Content: Desert Rose Resort is the best place to stay when you visit Las Vegas. It has everything you need. Away from small casino hotel rooms to spacious 1 or 2 bedroom apartments . They have everything in that you need. Kitchen, fridge,large livingroom and very comfortable bedroom. This was my 5th stay at this resort. Morning breakfast, afternoon manager's happy hour, gym and large clean and warm pool. I love the friendly team starting at the help desk to housekeeping. I will recommnend Desert Rose to everyone who wants to enjoy stay in Las Vegas. Nice walk about 10 min from the strip,outlet stores not far away just GREAT place to be. I am already looking into book my next visit in October. Thank you Jeff Tomczak and your crew for taking care of your guests. :)

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: Ceci_at
Reviews.Content: We were a little worried about the credit card fraudulent charges comments, but after talking to their general manager, we've made our reservation online and upon arrival paid full in cash for our stay and also paid cash for the $100 deposit. We're so glad we stayed here! Great staff, rooms were very clean, quite, and the location was great!!! The only thing I didn't care about and mentioned it to them, was their pillows... a little lumpy for my comfort but not enough to ruin my stay; if we're ever in Las Vegas again, we're staying at the Desert Rose Resort for sure. Where else can you get breakfast and a happy hour for that price?

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice...for us.”
Reviews.Author: Momma4Kauai
Reviews.Content: Pros: * Friendly staff - everyone from front desk, to the housekeepers were great. * Comfy bed! * Lots of hot water for the shower, and great water pressure. * Lots of room to spread out - great for stays longer than a few days. Loved having a seperate living room area for the hubby to watch news when he woke up early. * No smoky casino to walk through to get to your room. * Quiet...never heard any neighbors talking, fighting, having sex, or flushing toilets! * Loved having Starbucks coffee available in the lobby 24/7! There was nothing I would really consider a 'con', but I will add some 'be aware's: * Yes, it is within walking distance from the strip (took us a good 7-10 minutes to get to the MGM) but I would highly recommend having a car. Wouldn't want to, and didn't, make the trek more than once. I love walking and enjoyed our 'stroll' (LOL) from the Venetian to the MGM, but didn't like the walk from the MGM to the Desert Rose, and am not sure that I'd feel safe making that walk without my husband. Note that the parking at the DR is FREE (yay!) and that valet parking around town is free - well, we tipped, but I'm not counting that (at least everywhere that we went). * Can't say anything about the quality of the free breakfast/manager's reception, because we never managed to catch them. Unless you're an early bird, chances are, you'll never find out either...they close it down a little too early, in my opinion. Overall, a great stay, and I highly recommend it to people who value comfort and great service over the appearance of glamour and luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely pleasant place that's value for money”
Reviews.Author: oooopljg
Reviews.Content: We've just checked out from a 4 night weekday stay at the Desert Rose and we loved it! Rooms are clean, staff is friendly. Traveling with a baby isn't easy, so I'm glad the room we got had a separate living room and bedroom. Made it easy for us to get the lil one to sleep. I would definitely stay here again if I come back to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic. Loved it, would go back again tomorrow.”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneCraig
Reviews.Content: Where do I start. Lots of space for us to spread out. Happy to have a separate room to the kids. Rooms were very comfortable. We had a king size bed, which was luxurious to sleep in. It was great to be in Vegas, and not be at a casino especially as most of the casinos were full if cigarette smoke. It is only a short walk to the strip and to the local bus to run you all the way down to Freemont Street. Breakfasts were great, lots of choice and they were never short of food. We also took advantage of the complimentary afternoon “manager’s reception” with refreshments and beverages. We didn't have a chance to use the pool, but the area around the pool was beautifully landscaped and looked magnificent. Another fantastic feature of the resort was a full kitchen, although we didn't make use of it either. Wished we had a chance to stay longer, not for Vegas, just for the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: trvlbugdtw
Reviews.Content: This Resort was Fabulous! Staff, accommodations and location. I would recommend this Resort to anyone who wants to have a great vacation in Las Vegas. The staff was very friendly as well as helpful. I felt like I was part of the family. One small flaw... If you're on the first floor, you will hear the those above you walking, ceiling between floors are not sound proof.

Reviews.Title: “Better Than Described”
Reviews.Author: Jetskiriddle
Reviews.Content: Booked room for 3 nights in early May. Room was better than expected. One of the largest I've booked. No casino was a positive for us.Price was great. Staff was nice and welcoming. .Location is very good, just a block or so from the strip. Breakfast was good, eggs were some of the best I've had and I don't particularly like eggs. My only small complaint is that we could hear footsteps above us and the water was pretty loud when they flushed and showered above. I would definitely stay there again and would recommend very highly.

Reviews.Title: “Do it again.”
Reviews.Author: ThunderBayBear
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a two night stay. Great value for the price. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was generous with good variety. The pool area was well kept as were other common areas. The room was comfortable and spacous and fully equipped. The bed was especially comfortable. The location was like an oasis in the desert. Within easy walking of the 'strip' but on a quiet side street. And a short hop to the airport. Definetly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: mahlrond
Reviews.Content: We stayed during a wedding at the MGM, and we were right across the street! Location to the strip was perfect for walking, and we rode the bus, which is very cheap. The bed was the best bed I've ever had in a hotel, and we slept extremely well. We had a two-bedroom, two-bath suite. The sofa made a great single bed, or it could be pulled out into a queen. Perfectly arranged kitchen, but there is also a really good breakfast (though always the same) in the lobby. Pool isn't heated, so unless it's hot outside, it's too cold, but the hot tub was great! The staff is gloriously nice and helpful. I recommend this resort very highly, and will probably stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travel1121
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Desert Rose. It's not your glitzy, shiny, ultra-modern casino hotel on the strip, but that's not what we wanted. The Desert Rose has all the modern facilities and our room was comfortable and we had no problems. We got a great deal with a 2 bedroom apartment (with full kitchen, table etc) which offered lots of space for me and my 2 friends. The breakfast was extensive (although the fruit ran out early). It's a 10 minute walk to the Strip. We walked through the Hooters carpark to return to the Desert Rose at night, which didn't bother me but something to note. If you get a taxi back to the hotel, tell the driver it's behind Hooters - this was more successful for us than giving the name Desert Rose.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint hotel”
Reviews.Author: gl6663
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel first week of May. Just off the strip within walking distance. Great value for the money. Big rooms,full kitchens and clean. Only complaint was "heated pool" I think they meant solar heated(as in it's heated on a hot day) as it was cold to swim in, even though temps were in high 80's.

Reviews.Title: “Keep it secret !”
Reviews.Author: gazManchesterUk
Reviews.Content: From walking in through the door nothing was too much trouble for the staff of the Desert Rose Resort. The room was incredible, from the kitchen area that was fully equipped with absolutely everything you could possibly need - had more than my kitchen at home i think ! Comfiest bed ever, spotlessly clean, endless supply of towels and toiletries. We just couldn't fault the place everything was excellent, the gardens were immaculate, brilliant breakfast with loads on offer. Loads of parking and an excellent location, please keep it secret because it's where we'll be staying next time we go to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for family”
Reviews.Author: alex_jonny
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for three days in March and enjoyed it. The hotel is located just a few minutes of walking from Strip and very quite and calm. Our room was very spacious, very well furnished and had full kitchen. They also have breakfast in the morning, swimming pool and gym. Overall - very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Vegas with a family”
Reviews.Author: 5KiwisinOz
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay in Vegas with a family as it doesn't have a casino attached so you aren't walking through a wall of smoke, show girls and gamblers with young kids. The place is close to the strip only a 5 minute walk to MGM and has spacious rooms with everything you need from a full kitchen and 2 bathrooms. Pool is nice but you have to get in early for a lounger. Breakfast was OK but gets very busy if you leave it to the last minute and seating becomes a premium. Well maintained and secure property, would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Retreat”
Reviews.Author: youknowwhoToronto
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the resort for 1 week in a 2 bedroom suite. The kitchen had everything, even dish detergent and dishwasher powder. We didn't expect that. The facility was immaculate and the staff were helpful and friendly. The location is within walking distance to the strip. Security was always visible in the parking lot and the area was well lit. It is a nice quiet retreat from the hustle and bustle of the excitement. Noise level was at a minimal, we were on the third floor and we would hear the occassional airplane whiz by but we got use to it. Breakfast was great. I expected the basic breakfast, cereal, toast juice etc.. but there was soooo much more. There was eggs and sausages daily. There were advertisments for a prime rib dinner posted at the resort. The prime rib dinner at the Mad Onion restaurant at Hooters for $9.95 was well worth it. If you are looking for a quiet family type environment, this is the ideal resort.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value great resort”
Reviews.Author: lolavegas084
Reviews.Content: After reading some bad reviews I approached this resort with caution and was pleasantly surprised. The resort is located just off the strip but walking distance to Luxor and MGM, no casino so perfect for families...beautiful pool area and the rooms are more like suites. The sofabeds actually turn into a double and single so great for teenagers who don't want to share. Full sized kitchen and incredibly clean, housekeeping appeared to be working 24/7. Each room has a balcony or terrace (( would recommend a ground floor room over looking the pool because then its easy to come in and out when swimming. Free breakfast good selection, and free drinks and starbucks coffee all day. Great value, clean and very pleasant (only downpoint is a tiny bathroom but everything else made up for that)

Reviews.Title: “Best Stay in Vegas Ever!”
Reviews.Author: oldjudge1
Reviews.Content: Unbelievably clean...I actually saw a resort employee cleaning the outdoor railings. The housekeeping staff were extremely friendly and went above and beyond what I expect. Check in was smooth and courteous. Haven't had any problem with the card we used for security and incidentals...so keeping our fingers crossed. Out of the past many years we have been coming to Vegas this was by far the best lodging experience we have had. MGM is a five minute walk away...avoid the Hooters establishment...gives new meaning to the phrases "run down" and "poor service". Only gripe was the fitness center...machines are old and in need of replacement

Reviews.Title: “Excellent !!”
Reviews.Author: paulshols51
Reviews.Content: All the good reviews on here are spot on. Any poor ones and the contributor must have been extremely unlucky. Would recommend to anyone. Do your homework on Google Earth and you can catch the 119 bus service at side of resort which takes you to the Fashion Mall/ Treasure Island and the return stop is under walkway from Wynn to Palazzo. 10 minute ride and drops you off 100 yds from Desert Rose. So much better than walking to Strip and spending an hour on the Deuce !!!.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for the third time will be returning again.”
Reviews.Author: spikey
Reviews.Content: This is our third visit and again very satisfied with service etc. Travelled with Thomas Cook. Deposit covered with cash, due to fraud reports on this site. No problems at all. Special HELLO to Gloria in breakfast room and Manager's, special. Great holiday, near to strip, safe area and happy to return to a comfortable property.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location”
Reviews.Author: dillo51
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel! I was traveling with my husband and a friend, so we got a two bedroom two bathroom suite for an amazing price. We could walk to the MGM Grand and other places on the Strip. I wanted more quiet than you can get in a casino hotel, and I like windows that open. Free parking and free wifi, a beautiful pool. We had a full kitchen and balcony. I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone that wants to be close to the Strip, but not stay at a casino. My only criticism is it took a long time for the water to get hot in the shower. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't even stay yet, already credit card fraud!”
Reviews.Author: JoeMimic
Reviews.Content: I booked a room for this hotel last week for four days in July, wary of the reviews I booked anyways. You have to have a credit card to reserve these rooms to begin with, I used a credit card I only use at hotels when I travel. I booked on the 13th for a trip in July and that Friday the 15th I went off on another vacation. Come to my surprise when I went to use the credit card for that check in, it was denied. I call my credit card company and they tell me there was suspicious activity on the card and several attempts were made from overseas trying to get money off the card. I had to have my card canceled and suffice to say I won't be staying here in July.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Vegas.”
Reviews.Author: Blitzen467
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed 7 nights, staff were friendly and very helpful,especially the concierge who is super knowledgeable extremely pleasant and just fun to deal with. The location is excellent, close to the airport, full kitchen suite was very clean and had all one needed to cook. In-room safe was very good to have. Although the breakfast was plentiful, the menu was the same every day, even the yogurt flavor never changed in seven days. Perhaps bacon,pancakes or French toast could be added for variety. Otherwise we were very happy with our stay at Desert Rose and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Non-Casino Choice”
Reviews.Author: reviewit24u
Reviews.Content: We've been to Vegas maybe 25 times, and for the first time we decided to stay at a non-casino, and selected this property. It's adjacent to Hooters hotel/casino and a very short walk to the Tropicana, Luxor, Mandalay, and MGM. There is a Coco's eatery, AM/PM gas station, and Motel 6 also nearby, and it was about a 10-15 minute drive from the airport. It's a 3 story property made of up 4 buildings, and each building has its own parking lot and laundry facility ($1.25 wash/75 cent dry). The pool area is shared by all 4 buildings and was always packed each time we walked by. They also offer a free breakfast, but for most people it's barely more than a snack. The selection is limited to eggs, sausage, bread, cereal, and bananas/apples and yogurt, plus juice. They offer the breakfast from 6-9am in the lobby and it's a pretty small area to have so many people. We noticed a ton of kids and teens at the property, and a few convention types; not a great place for singles, honeymooners, or seniors. On the plus side, this is like having your own apartment; each apartment comes with a fully stocked kitchen, with stove, microwave, blender, coffee pot, hand mixer, utensils, etc, and cookware. You can literally bake a cake here or any other fancy meal, which we did to save money. The downside is that you'd need a car to make use of the kitchen and go buy groceries - there isn't a grocery store nearby. The rooms and bathrooms (with tub) are very spacious and there is ample closet space and lighting. Each unit has two or more televisions, and also a sleeper sofa in the 1-bedroom unit. The noise level was fair - at night we could hear some walking/heavy footsteps but nothing too bad. You can definitely hear kids running through the halls and suitcases being dragged around because the corridors are tile and carpet. The corridors are also open-air so during the summer I imagine it'd get very hot walking to/from your room. The workout room had 4 treadmills, a bike, an elliptical, weight machines, and some towels/water. I was there early morning and there were always 2 or 3 people with me. The only thing this hotel lacked was a solid Internet connection. It's a wireless connection on your room or the lobby, but it was always down because of too much user traffic. We could usually only get on very early or at night when people were out to dinner. Overall, it was a good choice for a non-casino vacation and we'd recommend it. For a first time visitor though.. stay in a casino for the best Vegas experience(s).

Reviews.Title: “Beware of credit card fraud”
Reviews.Author: sodissappointed
Reviews.Content: First, I have to say we enjoyed our stay at the Desert Rose. Before booking I saw some reviews on Trip Advisor saying they had trouble with credit card fraud but the problem seemed to be resolved. I used my credit card to pay my bill at the Desert Rose in February and have not used it since. Today I received my credit card statement, and had 3 charges for gas purchases made in Brampton, Ontario. I phoned my credit card company to report these charges immediately and they told me there were 7 more purchases made in Ontario since that statement, all for pay at the pump gas purchases. The fraud department said that my information was taken off the magnetic strip on the back of my credit card, and a phony credit card was made. The card has been cancelled. I called the Desert Rose to report this also. They were apologetic, and thought they had resolved this problem. They are concerned that the problem has surfaced once again. Do not use a credit card at Shell Vacations Hospitality. This has been a very disappointing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good location just off the strip”
Reviews.Author: FIO
Reviews.Content: Across the road from MGM so within walking distance of the strip. The rooms are a little dated and basic but have everything you need and for the price a bargain. The pool area is small and there are not many sunbeds. Complimentary breakfast is a bonus, tea, coffee, juice, cereal, toast, scrambled eggs and sausage although gets very busy after 8am. Free WiFi if you have a laptopetc. Neighbours can be noisy, get a top floor room if possible. If you have a car the Desert Paradise is far superior accommodation but you cannot walk to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: rouletteplyr15
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights with my husband and 2 friends - and I have to say it was amazing. I will absolutely return here, and would recommend it to anyone, families, groups of friends, older people. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful - the facilities were clean and very well kept. Location is great, it is about 5 min walk to Hooters for some cheap gambling, or 10 min walk to MGM. It is about a $10 cab fare to the airport, and close to the monorail so if you were wanting to get to the north strip or convention centre, nice and easy. Rooms were very spacious, and the beds were comfortable. If you are up in the air as to whether you should stay here or not....STAY HERE! Oh yeah, the breakfast is great too!

Reviews.Title: “Good stay & great value, but problems with Central Reservations”
Reviews.Author: kseniacoffman
Reviews.Content: I book a number of rooms during the Black Friday sale so it was a great value. Overall, I enjoyed my stay and the amenities, many of which were included in price - free on-site parking, full kitchen, free Wi-Fi, free hot breakfast (sausage, eggs, cereals, etc), free coffee in the lobby all day, heated pool which is open until 11 pm (nice!). The room itself was in great shape, and clean. People who stay there are generally nice - families, retirees, etc. I did not observe any loud parties - it was very quiet both in my room, and on the property. (I had requested a room away from street noise). I did hear the planes from nearby McCarran but it was not too bad. However, I had a number of issues while dealing with Central Reservations. We booked online for a group of my colleagues. When I changed the names on the reservations, I had requested that confirmations be sent to me. They never were - after repeatedly calling them for 3 days in a row (I was getting answers ranging from "you should get the emails in 10 min" to "our email system is down"), I was finally told to go online and get the updates myself. With that accomplished, I felt that we were all set. However, the changes were not communicated from the central reservations to the hotel! So people had problems checking in because in the hotel system, the "old" names still appeared. That was quite an aggravation. It seems baffling that the two systems are not linked. So I recommend this hotel, but with reservations. (My ratings are based on the experience with my reservations - took some points off). If you have to change your reservations, call both the central reservations and the hotel to confirm.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay for the family”
Reviews.Author: JimCalgary_Canada
Reviews.Content: Like the other reviews we enjoined the hotel,, pool, breakfast. The wireless was spotty,, up and down all day.. We had no problems with credit card. Cost of hotel for 5 nights (1 bedroom) was less than 1 night at Cirque for family of 4. We had one of the $.01 cent nights. Best thing we learned was with a car rental (we went to the grand canyon) it was really easy to drive out of the lot and up the back road of strip and then park in free parking at the Strip hotels we wanted to go to so no long tiring walks through hotels or on hot sidewalks.. it was really easy to get around. And we saw lots of off strip locations. Atomic Testing museum and Indoor sky diving were highlights for the family for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Desert Rose Wonerfull”
Reviews.Author: TREEWACKER
Reviews.Content: We stayed that the DESERT ROSE March 27 - April 1 The 2bdr. room we had , had everything we needed,check in went smooth, we paid for the room and deposit with CASH to avoid the credit card scam . We had 2 two bedroom units so they only charged us 50$ per unit deposit. The pool was nice, breakfast was just ok no more, the cocktails in the evenings was not worth it but what do you expect for free Hooters was a easy walk from there 25 cent wings $ 9.99 prime rib and $1.50 BUDS Would stay there again, easy walk to strip CARRIE Just wanted to say thank - you for all of your help yesterday, you went out of your way to help us out. If anyone staying at the DESERT ROSE needs anything just stop by and talk to CARRIE at the concierge desk, even if you dont need anything , just stop by and chat with her she will keep you amused .. THANKS CARRIE Larry & Karen Lloyd & Galye Jen

Reviews.Title: “Quiet place, just off the strip”
Reviews.Author: janice45
Reviews.Content: My husband & I just returned from several days in Vegas as a jumping off spot to Utah & several national parks (3-5 hrs. away). The Desert Rose Resort is a 3 story quiet spot just one block off the strip, near the Tropicana & MGM. One bedroom suites allow the guests privacy. It is well furnished, has a full modern kitchen and a comfortable living area. Amenities include a full hot/cold breakfast, wine & beer social (M-Th), fitness center, heated outdoor pool with whirlpool, concierge and a pleasnat staff who are always willing to accomodate your needs. No casino included, but all of the top, large hotels are within easy walking distance. It's a hidden gem if you want to get away from the hub-bub of the hecticness of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and enjoyable experience”
Reviews.Author: elksfam
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the hotel and we will stay again when visiting Las Vegas. Service was excellent, all staff were very friendly and helpful. Room was clean and well appointed. An excellent value for the price. We plan to try other Shell properties in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, great restful place...awesome staff”
Reviews.Author: flymalie
Reviews.Content: People from Hawai'i LOVE Las Vegas and consider it the 9th island...and we're very familiar with the hotels in Nevada. I had never heard of the Desert Rose Resort before, but discovered it on TripAdvisor after deciding that we didn't want to stay on the Strip, but didn't want to stay way out of town either. This was a risk because nobody here had heard about the Desert Rose - but it was a great risk and I have nothing but PRAISE for the resort! First of all, we arrived on a very early morning flight and really wanted to settle in so we went the hotel, hoping we could get an early check in (9:00 am). To our delight, we were able to check in for an additional $25 - no problem whatsoever! GREAT service at the front desk...we knew from the start that this was going to be a wonderful stay! We had a one bedroom room and everything was absolutely clean, from the bathroom to the kitchenette to the floors (and we are clean fanatics). Parking was free, no problem, and we were able to walk to New York, New York, Mandalay Bay, MGM, etc. Although it was freezing and we didn't use the pool, it looked inviting, and again, we were always met with friendly staff who asked us if we needed anything. The location is so great, even driving around Las Vegas, etc. One flaw - the bed was so comfortable that we had a hard time getting up in the mornings, ha! Great, great resort that I would recommend without hesitation and yes, we WILL return!! Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay!”
Reviews.Author: JeanandRandy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a month at the Desert Rose to get away from our harsh winter. We've never stayed here before, and we were very impressed. At 650 sf the 1 bedroom condo was an adequate size. A very good layout. The furniture is very nice, the king size bed was so comfortable. The linens are high quality. The tub, while not a jacuzzi, was very large. The granite kitchen was nice and the dining area very pretty. The grounds are kept beautifully and very clean. Our balcony faced MGM so we had a partial strip view of NYNY, Monte Carlo and City Center. It was gorgeous, especially at night. The breakfast (included) was good. Fresh fruit, cereals, pastries, etc. The coffee , Starbuck's, surpassed any I've ever had at any restaurant. The manager's reception, while very simple, gave us a chance to chat with other guests. What made our trip really enjoyable was the staff. Without exception they all had a friendly greeting for us. Everyone was so accomodating. The attitude of the staff reminded us of the atmosphere on a cruise ship. The few times we had a problem (very minor) it was addressed within minutes. The highly visible security staff made us feel safe. We've already made our reservations for next year!

Reviews.Title: “Great hidden gem just off the strip!”
Reviews.Author: tipper24
Reviews.Content: This is definitely one of the top values in Vegas. It's tucked right behind the Hooter's hotel and easily within walking distance of the south part of the strip. The rooms have full kitchens so you can save on meals. The pool area is nice and they offer free breakfast which is basic but has some hot options and satisfies the kids ( which is most important ). They also had a reception in the evenings with beer, wine, soft drinks, and snacks, nice. The only negative I have are that most of the rooms don't have views but I will sacrifice that for the price. Besides how long are you in your room in Vegas :).

Reviews.Title: “Well managed hotel. Good value.”
Reviews.Author: Jamesonthego_11
Reviews.Content: Everything as advertised, tidy well equipped suite with full kitchen, more than "continental" breakfast buffet, no smoke, nice pool. Minor maintenance issue quickly and efficiently resolved. Easy, fast and friendly check in/out. Helpful staff. No problems with cash deposit. Overall very nice stay. Seemed very well run would like to stay at their other properties.

Reviews.Title: “Do not use your credit Card”
Reviews.Author: philhaz
Reviews.Content: This resort was ideal, very clean and staff friendly. Breakfast was provided and plenty to eat.Two bedroom apartment was really spacious and ideal for us. Walking distance to the strip. However I have just received my credit card statement and my card has been cloned. £700 in total and they tried to use more. So as previous review states, request new card when you return home as this is an ongoing problem at this resort.

Reviews.Title: “All around great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Robboychoff
Reviews.Content: I throughly love the location. It was off the strip yet it was close enough to have all the amenities. A short walk to the casinos and the mono rail but you don't have to listen to the slot machines all the time. The continental breakfast was awsome and the staff were helpful and friendly. All and all a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Please do not use your credit card.”
Reviews.Author: ProfessorOT
Reviews.Content: Prior to staying at this hotel, I reviewed the information on Trip Advisor. The hotel has ongoing issues with unauthorized credit card activity after check out. I contacted my credit card company prior to my departure to advise of the concern and to red flag the hotel. When I arrived, I requested to pay cash, but the front desk clerk noted that I had to pay cash for my entire stay. I elected to use my credit card and when I returned home, my credit card company issued me a new card. I used my credit card on two (2) occasions when I was away. Based on the previous reviews, I would be fair to assume that the unauthorized attempts took place at the Desert Rose. It is unfortunate as the hotel is a great spot with reasonable breakfast and other amenities. The organization needs to take this issue seriously and rectify the issue.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Soccermom916
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Desert Rose with my son's soccer team. We enjoyed the free breakfast, free parking, free WiFi, the convenient laundry rooms, spacious condo, and fully functioning kitchen. Staff was very helpful with late check out and extra towels. The adults (and teenagers) could safely walk to the Strip in 10 minutes, which was alot of fun for the group. The two bedroom, two bathroom condo could sleep many, many people comfortably. We would definitley stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing no-fuss stay in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: cwoollacott_11
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights in Las Vegas as a single traveller, and chose to stay at the Desert Rose Resort based on reviews I'd read and a good price. I was initially dissapointed that it wasn't directly on the strip in the middle of the action, however that did not bother me at all when I was actually there, infact the slight distance from the strip made it a nice 'getaway' from the hustle and bustle, and it was just a 2-3 minute walk north to MGM Grand where you can connect to the monorail, and a 5-10 minute walk south to the Luxor and Mandalay Bay which offer great shows! walking back at night alone I felt safe. There is no casino, 'nightlife' or shops at Desert Rose. The furniture was very comfortable and I liked the fact that there was a seperate sleeping area, even as a solo traveller it was nice to relax during the day watching TV while feeling like I was in a home, and not a hotel room. The Kitchen was also fully equipped, and the whole apartment was very clean. I didn't end up using the pool or gym, and it seemed to be smaller then other resorts around that I saw, but didn't ever get too crowded. The staff were very friendly and helpful, nothing was ever too much trouble for them. It was about a 4-5 minute taxi ride to the airport, which made it cheaper and much quicker than a shuttle transfer. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A great get away from Las Vegas glitz at the end of the night.”
Reviews.Author: Nancy0987654321
Reviews.Content: After reading positive reviews here, we found that this hotel was just "as advertised" - great! My husband and I stayed at the Desert Rose for a full week. What an oasis from the hustle and bustle of Casino Row! We liked our suite - a nice size and well-furnished. The hotel grounds were nice and we constantly saw cleaning staff hard at work. (The one negative: the loud walkie-talkies they all seem to wear - easily heard in the mornings even with windows closed and air conditioning on.) The pool is small, but was fine and enough seating pool-side. The fitness centre had all I wanted (I'm easy - a treadmill!) and it was never busy, but there is limited equipment. A big plus is the breakfast, which was really good and included eggs and bacon. That and the manager's cocktail hour (nice snacks - different each night we went), and we barely used our (very nice) kitchen! Staff in the lobby were very helpful and accommodating. We used WiFi a lot, and it was fine, if a bit slower during peak (morning) hours. The location is great - very close to some of the top casinos, and we used the bus system to get around, too. My only worry was coming back late at night - the surrounding area is a bit dim and some unsavoury characters hang around near Hooters, but I never felt really unsafe...with my husband there. We always gave a big sigh of contentment as we entered our homey little place at the end of a busy night!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: 155019Diane
Reviews.Content: My partner and I spent four nights at the Desert Rose in Las Vegas in March 2011 and the place was wonderful. Efficient, pleasant staff. The room was so nice, I didn't want to leave it! Very clean, well decorated and the bed was so comfortable I wanted to take it home with me. Highly recommend this hotel - five minutes to strip, yet it feels like you are on an island somewhere. Toronto, ON

Reviews.Title: “Beyond My Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Ctso31
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Desert Rose Resort in Las Vegas for four days and three nights. As a parent traveling with two children, you're always reserved when doing hotel stays online, I've had my share of disappointments so I was very hesitant about the whole experience. I wanted the kids to have fun and safe. The experience was nonetheless a great one. I called to make reservations and the woman I spoke to was very professional and helpful. We booked our stay at a discounted price and asked for a quiet room. The location is a little tricky and you can miss the turn if you're not familiar with the area, but once you know your way around, you find their location is very convenient. Check in was no problem at all, I paid in cash and was given the basic information, we didn't need to pay for WiFi which was good, I had loads of work to do so I needed internet access, a small deposit is required but not "per day" like others hotels I researched in the city. The rooms were excellent! One King bed in room 1 with bathroom and One Queen in room 2 with a bathroom across the way. The living/dining area was spacious, the beds were extremely comfortable, the walk in shower was awesome and the housekeepers were nice and friendly. Nice kitchen area, refrigerator, microwave, sink, dishwasher, etc. The kids (10&11) really enjoyed having their own space, they enjoyed the pool which was nice and big, the fitness room was excellent...three treadmills, bicycles, elliptical, and weight area. The breakfast was super with lots of variety to chose from, they had a managers special every evening and the location is just off the strip about a block from tropicana right across the MGM. Nice walking distance, you get away from the noise of the strip but still can enjoy all that it has to offer. We asked for a quiet room and were placed in an area facing the street, away from the pool, which was exactly what I was hoping for. All in all, I would recommend this hotel to others, I know other's experience will vary but coming from a mother of two, traveling with a teenager, and two adults (the room accommodated all 6 of us) I was very very please with the whole experience and will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Crtennis
Reviews.Content: Great two bedroom condo near all the attractions. Free breakfast and clean rooms at a very affordable rate. Would definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation overdue!”
Reviews.Author: AGiron
Reviews.Content: My family & I recently spent Spring break at the Desert Rose Resort in Las Vegas it was not only a great place to stay but everyone was so friendly and eager to make our vacation as enjoyable as possible. We had a great time & were always informed of everything from the hot breakfast being served to happy hour; we even participated in a St. Patrick's day trivia where you had the option to enjoy green beer or champagne and win a few prizes which we proudly brought home. I am definitely looking forward to the next time we can get away & I highly recommend the Desert Rose.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: amybr0wn
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a one bedroom unit. I felt relaxed and at home. Love the feeling of a condo rather than a typical hotel room. First time traveling without the family. Everything about my stay was great from check in to check out. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay! Don't let fraud sway you away, cash option!”
Reviews.Author: illinoistraveler86
Reviews.Content: A friend and I just got back from a 5 day vacation in Vegas and had a great time! After a few months of A LOT of research about where to stay and the pros and cons, this was the final choice! I was VERY concerned about the whole fraud deal BUT good news, called the hotel prior to arriving and they allow $100 cash deposit, which is returned upon checkout! This really made me feel better and made the whole experience much more positive! We checked in at about 2 am and check in at the front desk was sooo fast and very helpful. After a long day of traveling this is quite refreshing because after walking into every hotel on the strip the lines for check in/ out are very long. The breakfast was good, only had it twice out because we tendend to stay up until early morning and get up really late. We didn't have to eat lunch until later in the day the days we did have it, so it saved money on food. It's the basics a continental breakfast would have. We are in our 20s, but saw a lot of families and older couples around the place. It was also very quiet and no smoke! Which is an amazing plus since the casinos can be pretty bad smoke wise. We also had rented a car and parking was not possible in the front lot, but there were options around the back, just a longer walk to the room. The rooms were nice, desert colors and nice kitchen. I've stayed at hundreds of hotels and found it to be satisfying. It's Vegas,so we spent most of our time out doing things, but the bathroom was great and bed easy to sleep on. Overall great experience and would recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: RGP7361
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a boys golf trip to Vegas and stayed at the “ROSE” Loved the large clean rooms and the space we had. We opted for a 2 room suite between 2, this was a slightly expensive way to do things but gave each of us our own privacy and if required a living area where we could chill with our flat mate. Breakfast as seen in some other reviews is a bit of a scrum, however if you take it that it’s FREE then it’s a price worth paying. Girl on the tours desk is as mad as a brush and very helpful All in all we could have afforded to stay at any of the top hotels in Vegas but wouldn’t have had as good a time as we did at the ROSE Ps did I mention that Hooters next door has Bud for $1.50 !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: mendezrosa
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite, very comfortable. The staff is very friendly and helpful. A convenient walking distance from the strip. Great for families

Reviews.Title: “Nice, un-vegas like place”
Reviews.Author: kellyvick
Reviews.Content: I've never written a review before, but this experience compelled me. I didn't know what to expect when my Grandmother gave me a few nights at her time share, the Desert Rose. It is definitely not your typically strip property. You can sit on your balcony, cook your own breakfast, do your own laundry, etc. If you don't mind a bit of a walk, it is convenient. Very clean, quiet & comfortable. But....all the rumors are true. I had read the reviews before I went and was a bit skeptical. Since I was worried about credit card fraud I used a card that I never typically use. Sure enough, 2 months later I get a call about fraudulent charges on my card. After months & months of complaints why is this still going on? Unbelievable!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful option for family visiting Vegas”
Reviews.Author: travelingwurd
Reviews.Content: Walk to the strip but stay in a place where you have a full kitchen and wonderful breakfast each morning. Modern rooms with updated appliances, lovely living room and bedroom. We enjoyed staying somewhere in Vegas where we didn't have to walk through a smokey casino. Highly recommended if you want a non-casino place for a family that is close to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Good News, Bad News”
Reviews.Author: Bigdrip
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Feg 6-12, 2011. Resort was fine if a bit dated. Good location, free parking, no resort fee. After reading the reviews on Tripadvisor, I was concerned about the instances of credit card fraud. Because of this I used a card I had that had no current charges and a zero balance. Decided to use this card because if fraud happened, I could easily replace the card with no notifications of vendors with monthly re-occuring charges. I used the card upon check in and did not use it again during or since the trip. Sure enough, I received a call from fraud prevention today asking if the card had been used by me in South Carolina for a $200 charge. I said no and will not be held responsible for the charge and the card was cancelled and a new one is being issued. With all the instances of fraud stemming from credit card use at the Desert Rose, you would think management/owners would find out which employees are responsible. Unless, of course, the management/owners might be involved in the fraud. Certainly will not be staying here again. What a shame!

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: ogramDerry
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for six nights in february and we loved it, check in was quick the rooms were large and clean pool area was clean and the staff were very helpful. the buffet breakfast is a bonus. The hotel is close to the strip and i felt safe at night walking back to our room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place! Close to the Strip”
Reviews.Author: lovetravelplaces
Reviews.Content: We just came back from Vegas to snowy Ohio :-( Loved our stay at Desert Rose. We stayed here 5+ years ago, and as soon as I knew we might visit Vegas again, I looked up Desert Rose as a first choice. It worked so well 5 yrs ago, and it was great AGAIN this time! Had a 2 bedroom, 2bathroom. Lots of dishes, utensils, silverware in the kitchen, plus dishwasher. Everything was great in the room and all throughout the resort. Friendly workers, friendly front desk, concierge. Internet wi fi and also a computer for guest use in lobby, plus printer. It was not working the morning of our departure home, so the staff at front desk cheerfully printed our airport boarding passes and even helped my husband change our seats on the flight, plus pay online for our checked bag! Especially if you have a car, this place is great. You can leave the hustle & bustle of the Strip (which is a 1minute car ride). Easy parking practically right at your front door. Felt very safe, key swipe to get into hotel area. Only 3 floors so elevators came immediately when you pushed the button. All the casino hotels have FREE parking so easy to go back and forth when going to the Strip. I would not stay anywhere else!!! If you are looking for excitement the second you step out of your room, however, you might want to be in one of the casino/strip hotels. If you don't want a million people within in view of your hotel doorway, then Desert Rose is a GREAT choice! And very close to the airport, so no worries about getting there on time due to traffic. The only drawback is occasional noise from the airport but it did not bother us. Pool area was nice, clean and there were plenty of towels available in that area. Breakfast was very adequate, something for everyone. If I am back in Vegas anytime soon, I would definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: sashaann
Reviews.Content: My one problem with the hotel was where we were located. I had made the reservation around 9mths before arrival and requested an upper floor room partly for security and partly so as not to be disturbed by people above. However on arrival we were allocated a room on a noisy corner (we had young children) on the ground floor and I did feel that this was in part maybe because we were "naieve brits". However it was a quiet time of year and apart from a couple of nights there was no one staying in the room above. If we were to return I would make the point about the room allocation. On to the positive :-) We had a two bed quite which was perfect with the children and gave us lots of space. It was really comfortable and more than met our needs ( a shower cap would be nice though ;-) ) and we had no problems. Breakfast was fab and more than met our needs and the managers drinks were a really nice extra. The staff were lovely, really friendly and helpful and fully approachable but not overbearing. The hotel is only a few minutes walk to MGM and from there straight on to the strip, the monorail runs to MGM and if driving then very easy to access and you can easily avoid the strip (although we found traffic flowed well whenever we drove down there). It was great to avoid the casino hotels and get away from the hustle and bustle of the strip and I would most definitely stay there again, I would not even consider anywhere else - particularly with the children. As a whole we found Vegas was a great place to take the children and all my previous concerns that it may not be the best place for a family trip vanished very quickly. Would recommend having a car as there are some great trips you can do in to the desert and DRR makes a great base for visiting Vegas and the surrounding areas. And we did not have any problems with our credit card!

Reviews.Title: “Watch out! It appears credit card thieves are still active at this resort!”
Reviews.Author: MontanaBeeki
