Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at this resort March 1-4. My husband and I went with another couple, who unfortunately for them, let their credit card be swiped at the front desk upon check-in. So far their credit card number has been used at 7 Wal-Marts in Texas and a restaurant in Oklahoma and not by them! Because I had read on Trip Advisor about the Desert Rose's issues with stolen card numbers of guests in the past, we were leery of booking a reservation with them, so called first and spoke with a resort representative who assured us that this situation of stolen card numbers had been resolved. Obviously, we can't prove that our friends credit card number was stolen at the Desert Rose, but it is suspicious since this has happened to people staying at this resort in the past and our credit card, which wasn't used at their facility, has not been ripped off. No matter that the Desert Rose is clean, quiet, nicely furnished, well-located with friendly staff, value priced with free wi-fi, a pool and breakfast, the hassle of having your credit card info stolen does not make up for the amenities offered...which is very sad as I would like to recommend this resort as a place to stay in Las Vegas. If you do decide to stay here, I wouldn't recommend giving the front desk your credit card number.

Reviews.Title: “best value you can get”
Reviews.Author: arielam
Reviews.Content: we had a great stay at this hotel. the suite was large,very clean and the bed room was comfortable. Staff very helpfull and polite . very good location. all in all best value for your mony will come back for sure

Reviews.Title: “Jackpot”
Reviews.Author: sikevirden
Reviews.Content: We hit the Jackpot without gambling with our 11 day stay at the Desert Rose which exceeded our very high expectations based on its 93% rating and favorable reviews.The exceptionally friendly and hard working staff, suberb amenities,convenient location and the guests it attracts all contrbuted to our enjoyment.Thanks to Carrie at the activities desk:, Sean ,Gloria and the rest of their breakfast and "Happy hour "staff for their caring efforts.Waffles,sausage , eggs and all day Starbucks exceeded.Cleaning staff kept rooms, common areas and pool immaculate, a delightful reprieve from the paper pamphlet littered streets. Because we enjoyed dining out and attended 8 evening shows,we did not take much. advantage of the fully equipped kitchen or the Happy hours but. they are sure to please the most discerning..Location was a safe stroll from the Strip. A sometimes stubborn computer made printing Restaurant.Com certificates from the voluntary Sales Presentation frustrating for a Canadian. That plus the breakdown of an Airbridge Tour bus enroute to the Grand Canyon paled in comparison to the delight of this resort;a bargain at twice my price. Just wish it was closer to home for a return.

Reviews.Title: “Don't let the credit card fraud keep you from staying at this great place!”
Reviews.Author: LisaFeb2011
Reviews.Content: I've read the reviews and was very cautious but wanted to stay here so I did some research and called the hotel several times. Every time they were very courteous and answered all my questions. I didn't want to leave my credit card with them because of their history of the credit card fraud. The hotel requires a credit card at the time of check in. So I bought one of those credit 'gift' card. Since they don't accept debit cards, VISA and MASTERCARDS do say debit card on the card, so I didn't buy them, instead I bought an American Express Gift Card for $100. They require $100 for any breakage for the hotel. Since I was using a $100 gift card, I was then required to pay for my stay upfront. I paid in cash. They accepted. At check-out, I was given my deposit of $100 back in cash. Because I told them to keep the $100 from the gift card (too much hassle to get the credit back on the card). Everything worked out perfectly! They totally understood of the precaution I was taking. They said that it was something they had no control over that it was the credit card network. We stayed for 2 nights and the service was GREAT! They say, they have a Continental Breakfast, (I was thinking coffee and donuts) it's so MUCH MORE. Starbucks coffee, bagels, juice, cereal, fruit. You'd think it's the same every morning but the 2nd morning, they had waffles! We were very impressed! Overall, it is too bad that such a great hotel had this mishap but I think the hotel itself is a victim. I feel bad for those people too, because it's a pain to have restore your credit card. Don't let something like that keep you from staying at a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great place!”
Reviews.Author: Iwannagotomorrow
Reviews.Content: wonderful staff, fun & free happy hour with treats....Starbucks coffee, continental breakfast. entertainment director very helpful in planning our days

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable- Nice bedrooms”
Reviews.Author: DaydreamerAK
Reviews.Content: Rented a two bedroom for myself and my husband and our daughter and her husband for two nights. My favorite part was the clean nice bedroom with very comfortable king sized beds. Kitchen was in great shape with everything we needed to cook in for one night. Great location near the strip but not on it. I didn't want a casino in the hotel or a towering building. So this was perfect. Only three stories high. It is right across the street from the MGM Grand where we went to the Cirque de Soleil show one night so didn't have to drive! The only thing that I found not perfect was the carpet in the living room of our unit. It had some water stains and the furniture seemed a tad dated but was fine for our purposes. We got the room for a great price. When I tried to reserve again for the following weekend on our return through Las Vegas, the price had gone up- doubled actually and we decided to stay with friends instead. So, like most places in Vegas, the prices are quite variable and fluctuate constantly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: glyn59
Reviews.Content: We (couple with adult daughter) stayed at Desert Rose for a week and were very impressed. It was well equipped with apartments and a buffet breakfast, a pool and hot tub and a manager's drinks special. We lacked nothing during our stay. It was also very close to the Strip - an easy walk to all the main attractions with the benefit of the monorail and bus stops close by. It was great to get back to the calm of this non gambling hotel after the excitement of Las Vegas and The Strip itself. Staff and service were excellent and we wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay if you're not interested in a casino!”
Reviews.Author: TKARCAROLA
Reviews.Content: Living room, dining area w/table for four, fully equipped kitchen w/granite countertops, comfy king size bed, lots of extra pillows,spotless bathroom, free breakfast and afternoon cocktails/snacks. Excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect peace on the Las Vegas Strip”
Reviews.Author: hollieruth
Reviews.Content: Perfect location on the Las Vegas Strip. It's a 2 minute walk from the strip, just behind Hooters. Noise from the strip cannot be heard in the nights, so it's incredibly peaceful and a good night's sleep can be expected. The hotel itself is perfect, nice suite hotel rooms with an extremely comfy bed, sitting area and kitchenette. Complementary buffet breakfast, which is perfect for filling up on before a day sightseeing! Didn't use the pool as we stayed in December and it was quite cold, but I would definately recommend it for a winter city break stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: warrenville111
Reviews.Content: Stayed just one night between Mojave National Preserve and Death Valley. It was a block or so off the strip...near MGM Grand/Tropicana. No problems with walking over to the main boulevard. For a night in February, the pool was empty and quite nice (I could see that it might get crowded in the summer). The breakfast was adequate...bagels, toast, oatmeal, juice, fruit. There was a reception at night with a vegetable tray and drinks...also a nice touch. Room was clean with a kitchenette, separate bedroom, and nice bathroom. Small balcony (no views though).

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS BASE FOR A FAMILY WITH TEENAGERS WHO CAN'T GAMBLE”
Reviews.Author: Jujubaby00
Reviews.Content: We had never been to Las Vegas before and thoroughly enjoyed our five night stay at Desert Rose - great location (just off the Strip behind Hooters) and great value for money at $75 per night for a very clean, quiet and attractive two-bedroom, two bathroom apartment (nice ensuite), free parking, free Wi-Fi, free use of printer in lobby, a decent gym and free cocktail hour on week nights. It does not have a casino or a resort fee, which suited us just fine given that we were travelling with teenagers. It was nice to have a kitchen to mix the pre-dinner cocktails in the evening, but we chose not to cook meals with so many great restaurants to chose from in Las Vegas. After reading so much about the credit card scam that had been ongoing for 6 months prior to our arrival, we took the advice of other guests and arranged to give $100 cash deposit for the room upon check-in (instead of the usual credit card imprint) and avoided becoming the next victim. The free breakfast was basic but more than adequate if you are happy to get up for the 9 am service finish time on weekdays and the free coffee was on tap all day. Breakfast is served in plastic cups,/paper plates which is convenient to take it to your apartment if you wish to eat there instead of the crowded breakfast room and we sometimes had extra muffins left over to eat for snacks during the day. We walked from the resort to sightsee on some of the days, but drove our rental car out to dinner each evening and we would not recommend walking back to the resort at night if you want to feel safe and secure, however during the day is fine. With four people in our family and the need for a little extra room to move on our one month tour of the West Coast, would definitely stay at Desert Rose again.

Reviews.Title: “A little bit of peace and quiet in Las Vegas.”
Reviews.Author: 3toahill
Reviews.Content: We just returned for a 4 night stay in the Desert Rose in LasVegas. We have made at least 20 trips to Vegas and stayed in a varried number of hotels. They are all good in their own right. But if you would like to stay somewhere close to the strip(about 2 blocks off)and do without the noise, hussle and bustle this is the place for you. The resort is located just behind the Tropicana Hotel. Excellent resort for an extended stay. Fully equipped kitchens, sun decks, flat screen TV's,and on and on. Full maid service, managers reception Monday thru Thursday, continental breakfast and a newspaper. Rooms are clean and spacious. We will be staying there on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with our stay”
Reviews.Author: saphire77
Reviews.Content: We had a 2 br apartment, which was great, had plenty of room for everyone to stretch out in, and not be on top of one another. The kitchen was well set up. The breakfast was great, plenty to choose from, something different every morning.Not to far from the MGM, walkable distance to the strip or the monorail. The concierge and the travel info lady couldn't be any more helpful. Great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: KsW_MD
Reviews.Content: Stayed here based on TA reviews and were not disappointed. One BR suite was first class, full kitchen, comfortable beds, quiet area. Breakfast included, SBux coffee, happy hour Mon-Thur with wine and nibbles. Lovely pool area; bit cool for my taste in February however. Security good. Plentiful free parking. Skip the $10 prime rib widely advertised at Hooter's next door due to disinterested staff and chef (judging by the presentation). Get your show tickets at Tix4tonight on the Strip at MGM Grand. Saw Cirque de Soleil Zumanity which seemed more of a peek and freak show with in-your-face sexuality. I'm pretty broad-minded but this was over the top. The Beatles look a like show at Planet Hollywood was excellent for a fraction of the price of Zumanity. Visit Red Rock Canyon and Valley of Fire for some amazing scenery. Both are within an hour's drive. Grand Finale was the IRB Sevens Rugby tournament which, if you like rugby, is a total extravaganza - as NKC would say "unforgettable". Indeed, I am planning a return visit next year to coincide with the usasevens.com games. Altogther a great visit.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay off the strip”
Reviews.Author: Blonda2191
Reviews.Content: Second trip to the Desert Rose. We like that we can walk to the strip, but still walk back to a quiet, safe environment. We had a 2 bedroom, 2 bath suite with fully functional kitchen They have a breakfast every morning that had bagels, toast, yogurt, cereal, coffee, tea, juice, We cooked both stays in the room for various meals. Can't beat the deal!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible stay at this very reasonable resort”
Reviews.Author: RCBF
Reviews.Content: Great vacation spot in Vegas. No gambling on site, but I'm not a gambler so that was okay. Hot tub here is a key. Pool is heated as well and is quite comfortable to use. The kitchenette is really well equiped with a dishwasher and lots of dishes. Living room was nicely sized and the couch was comfortable. Gym is small and mainly good for cardio. Could really use a set of free weights. 1 block from the strip makes trips there really easy. Free parking on site maked for an easy site if you are renting a car. Grocery and liquor stores are a short drive away. Continental breakfast is okay with coffee, bread, one type of fruit, yogurt (or cut fruit), and boiled eggs. It's not extensive, but does the trick. And for the price you really can't expect more. Internet was very usable for checking email, although watching videos didn't really work out. I have already recommended this place to family and friends. If you are looking for a relaxing vacation in Vegas where you can get away from the hustle and bustle of the strip, then this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Comfort, Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: SkyPond
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 9 day stay at the Desert Rose Resort. We were impressed from the moment we checked in until we left. We arrived on a chilly (for Las Vegas) evening to find a warm fire in the lobby's gas fireplace and 4 staff at the desk. Check in took less than 5 minutes. As others have noted, the staff was consistently friendly and asking if there was anything we needed. Special thanks to staff members Gloria, Robert and Clara. We used this resort as a base for day outings to Red Rock Canyon, Valley of Fire State Park, Hoover Dam and for geocaching the Extra-Terrestrial Highway series as well as walking the Strip. The free hotel parking was convenient and only a short walk from the room. The hotel's location made for easy driving access.Because we left early each day, we went to bed quite early and were delighted with how quiet our third floor, indoor courtyard room was. We shopped at Vons Grocery (a 5 minute drive away) to save money on meals. The suite kitchen was great- full size refrigerator and range with oven, great microwave, dishwasher etc. and fully stocked with nice dinnerware, pots and pans and all utensils. We appreciated that Starbucks coffee was available 24 hours in the lobby. The snack rotation accompanying the wine, beer and soft drinks at the weekday evening reception was vegetables and dip one night; chips and salsa the next; small bean tacos the third and chicken nuggets the fourth. At breakfast, we appreciated they included skim milk (many hotels don't) and often strawberry yogurt. We also liked that they had peanut butter and jelly available each morning to make sandwiches. We found the breakfast offerings of 4 kinds of cereal plus oatmeal; either apples, bananas or oranges; bagels or donuts, hard boiled eggs and a choice of three juices to be a nourishing start to the day. The suite itself was beautifully appointed and well cleaned. The bed was comfortable and the little outdoor patio quite nice. We couldn't have asked for more. We looked forward each night to returning to the peace and quiet comfort of this resort and if ever we can return to Las Vegas we will certainly stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Family outing”
Reviews.Author: goddess_hammer
Reviews.Content: Took the family to Las Vegas for George Strait concert. Hotel was across the venue. Staff was helpful, courteous, and friendly. Eager to help with essentials. Desert Rose close to the Las Vegas Strip. Will come back to hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Resort in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: dogrrl
Reviews.Content: Loved having my own "apartment" in Vegas not attached to a smoky, noisy huge casino. The staff were so helpful and obliging and the continental breakfast was much appreciated. Wireless high-speed allowed this single traveler to stay in touch back home. Bed was comfortable, cleanliness was paramount and windows opened for fresh air. Loved the little balcony/patio also. Would definitely recommend anyone stay here, whether with a family, friends or solo. You will be glad you did! Pool is heated so intrepid Canadians can take advantage of it.

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: onthego2011
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews, I was a little anxious about staying at the Desert Rose. The credit card was my biggest concern. However, I called the hotel and said I was paying cash and was advised that was just fine with them and that their would be a $100. deposit which would be returned to me when I checked out. I was o.k. with that as most hotels want a deposit when you pay by cash. I have to say, check in was a breeze and no hassell. Our rooms were ready (we had a two bedroom and a friend had a one bedroom). Our rooms were across the hall from each other. When we checked in (our reservation was for 3 nights) we were advised that if we wanted to stay an extra night that that was no problem and we would get a good rate. On our last day, we decided to stay an extra night. No problem, the rate was great. Thank you Greg, you are a sweetie. I have to say, the staff was wonderful. Very very friendly and couldn't do enough for you.. I read alot of reviews regarding the breakfast. People, get over it, if you want a hot sit down breakfast, go pay for it some where else. The breakfast was better than most that are supplied at other hotels. There is plenty to breakfast choices, even hard boiled eggs. Different types of bread, bagels and fruit, cottage cheese, tea, coffee and juice plus cereals. The room was very clean and well laid out (we were two couples in the 2 bedroom, and a friend was in the one bedroom). All 5 of us were more than pleased with the Desert Rose. Upon checking out, Security checked out room and we were given back our deposits. Would stay at this hotel again and we are telling all of our friends about this wonderful place.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay!!”
Reviews.Author: bsbxuxu
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable and clean hotel!! We had a view to the strip, but no noise at all. The apartment is very clean and they offer daily shampoo, soap, conditioner, moisturizer...The sofa bed is also comfortable. Sheets were changed everyday. THe kitchen is pretty big for a two bedroom apt. Tre refrigerator is huge and there is everything you need to cook a good meal. We almost didint use it, because breakfast is offered at the lobby. They have two kinds of fruits everyday, as well as bread, juices, coffee, hor chocolate, tea, cottage cheese. The breakfast is crowded and sometimes we cant find a place to sit, but if you consider that most hotels dont offer any breakfast, I would rate it a very good breakfast... The front desk people were very nice and helped us everytime we needed. Recommend to people that like to be in a quiet place to sleep and rest. The location is just perfect. Close to all other hotels and you can always avoid the strip traffic using the side streets.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay”
Reviews.Author: krasna1
Reviews.Content: This was my 3rd time at Desert Rose Resort. I have nothing else to say but EXCELLENT. I went there with my now fiancee. It was our 2 years anniversary and our engagement.The crew had our room that we get every time when we are there ready with little gift bag. Housekeeping is very good and keep your room clean. Continental breakfast is simple but it will be satisfying for you. I always spent 6 nights there and I will be returning back in May. I highly recommend this resort. Strip is not too far and fresh walk is pretty good . Enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort in Las Vegas!!”
Reviews.Author: kfernp
Reviews.Content: We recently spent a week in Las Vegas at the Desert Inn Resort. We had a great time & was very please with the resort. It was located just off Las Vegas Blovd & much quieter than other places. Was easy to get to & could go up the back streets to the parking garages into the Casinos. Extremely friendly, wonderful breakfast every morning & clean. Would not hesitate to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Desert Rose in Las Vegas: A great little find!”
Reviews.Author: Jhibben
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Desert Rose which is just a quick walk (3 minutes, maybe) from Tropicana and Las Vegas Blvd intersection (right behind Hooters Hotel) so it's well located. No casino on site but then you don't get the casino noise or exessive traffic. Quick to get into and out of the facility. Rooms are clean, neat and great for a business trip (I use them three or four times a year for business), family vacation - they are "kid friendly". Building is wood so I always get the third (top) floor so there are no elephants over my head at night! Great staff, great attention to details of our stay(s) and there is a continental breakfast as well. If you are in Vegas to do non gambling stuff, this is a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but hit by credit card scam......”
Reviews.Author: MrsRatty
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week with my young family and had a fantastic trip. The location of the hotel is fantastic, just a short walk to the strip. The room was a really good size and had good facilitoes. The pool was quite small but perfect for my children, was even better as it was a very quiet time of year to visit. We only used our credit whne we checked inot the hotel. Had already paid but needed to leave it for security. Just a couple of weeks ago we were contacted buy our credit company as they were suspious of a couple of attempted purchases on our card. Transactions made long after we left the US. Our card was copied /cloned at the hotel (no other explanation). Thankfully the bank was vigilant and it did not affect our balance as the bank refused the card on the two occasions the cloned card was used on online pruchases. We would stay at the Desert Rose again but would order a new card to use for this purpose which we would destroy and cancel on arrival home. If it wasn't for the scam we would have given the hotel a full 5 stars as it is a great place to stay especially with kids.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: pambam
Reviews.Content: This hotel is gorgeous and oh so comfortable! It's great that it's tucked behind the strip with no casino because it's quiet, elegant and comfortable. The decor is lovely and the rooms are spotlessly clean. The 'continental' breakfast is generous and the manager's wine reception an additional plus. Was tempted to steal the pillows and sheets - felt like I was in a 7 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: DrPepa
Reviews.Content: My fiancée and I spent 8 glorious days in January 2011 at this very impressionable resort. From the moment we checked in we knew something was quite special about Desert Rose. The check-in staff was very pleasant and professional. Our room was clean and airy. We both agreed that it was like being in our beach condo in Myrtle Beach SC, only thing missing was the beach. We were a little apprehensive booking a resort in Vegas as we have always stayed at the nicer hotels, but boy were we pleasantly pleased. Every aspect of our stay was a joy, with the quiet of a non-gambling location being a refreshing change. Every staff member we dealt with was helpful and pleasant, and we have unanimously decided this will be our home in Vegas when we travel there and we do often. Strangely enough most of the locals we met while in Vegas were not familiar with the resort. I guess it is 'The Best Kept Secret In Vegas' and quite a good value too. Thanks guys for an enjoyable stay and we will recommend you to all our visiting friends, furthermore we'll see you again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Bloody Fantasic Mate”
Reviews.Author: pimpmummy
Reviews.Content: This accomodation was great, very close to the Strip, It was nvery family friendly, & the service was great. The staff there are very afficiant in there job. They have a breakfast room that was the cleanest I had seen in all the places we stayed while in the USA. Nothing was to much trouble for them.

Reviews.Title: “Recomend”
Reviews.Author: nanc4
Reviews.Content: Great staff, Nice rooms with balcony. Close to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: figgyburn
Reviews.Content: agree with most of what previous posters have written except that i thought the "continental breakfast" was very poor compared to other places i have been to and watch out if you get a room at the back of the resort with outside stairs the bedhead is right against the outside wall and you can hear and feel people coming up the stairs and the door closing.rooms are very dated and the free internet station at the desk has the slowest connection that i have ever experienced.

Reviews.Title: “Desert Rose Resort is the best deal in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Muina54
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our sons, 24 and 21, for 4 days. The resort is very clean and has a great set up with 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms and full kitchen. The staff are very friendly and efficient. The free breakfast daily was great.Yes, there is no casino in the hotel but that suited us just fine. The strip is about a 5 minute walk from the Resort. The price of the hotel was fantastic for what we received. We would for sure recommend this resort to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Got the biggest bang for my buck.”
Reviews.Author: trulysatisfied
Reviews.Content: Though I have stayed at many newer hotels on the strip the previous 51 times, this time though was most enjoyable. The smoke free lobby itself was a welcome sign. The one bed room suite was very spacious. The furniture including the bed, though old was very comfortable. The kitchen appliances in very good working condition. The bathroom neat and clean. Free breakfast, though simple, was very satisfying. The staff kept the tables clean all the time. Even the free snacks etc. during the evening hours was a new experience for us.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: raquelsardao
Reviews.Content: very near the strip, large rooms, excellent service, with a great price. I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “You won't be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: thunderhill_11
Reviews.Content: The Desert Rose is an excellent place to stay in Las Vegas. It is conveniently located two short blocks from The Strip, was very clean & comfortable & provided an excellent continental breakfast (best I've seen). Two couples stayed in a two-bedroom suite with two bathrooms, a comfortable living/dining area & a full kitchen. Room service was available daily & on-site parking was provided without cost. Try it, you'll like it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MelGarza
Reviews.Content: Location was away from heavily congested traffic areas; with easy access to Las Vegas Blvd and Tropicana St. Room was really, really nice and comfortable and was comparable to staying in a very nice one-bedroom apartment in a complex with maid service. There was daily happy hour which, unfortunately, we never got to attend. It provided no hassle parking and our room was just a few steps away. Quite a difference from the big casino hotels where, after a long day with aching feet, you still have quite a hike to get to your room. Hooters Casino Hotel is right next door and their Mad Onion restaurant had really great food at reasonable prices, their jalapeno cheese cornbread was the best I've ever had!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Resort Just Off the Strip”
Reviews.Author: hoosierhiker
Reviews.Content: Perfect resort for enjoying the Strip (a block away) with easy in and out to visit the rest of Vegas and surrounding areas. We stayed almost a week and our suite (well-decorated, spacious and comfortable) had a full kitchen, living room and king-bed in a separate room. We could keep cold beverages, cook small or large meals, etc. Great variety at the furnished daily breakfast plus a manager's reception during the week with coffee and other beverages available 24/7 in the lobby. Staff is exceptional. Suggestion: Take traveler's checks to pay the bill and $100 deposit to avoid any credit card problems since Desert Rose has had past problems and continues the investigation to avoid future problems.

Reviews.Title: “credit card fraud puts damper on little gem of hotel”
Reviews.Author: marknmel
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Desert Rose for a long weekend in October in a two bed suite. I have also had a fraudulent transaction on my account in usa since I returned home. My card was presented for extras at the hotel. This is such a shame because the hotel is a little gem ideally placed just off the strip near to the mgm grand monorail stop and five minutes from the airport and a fifth of the price of the major hotels. The rooms are large and comfortable with cooking facilities and a fridge Especially on a short stay you will spend all your time in the luxury hotels where all the amenities offered are available to non residents,so there is no point in a small hotel attempting to compete with the luxury on the doorstep. The starbucks coffee and cereal/toast breakfast is ideal to put you on until you have lunch/dinner at the sumptuous hotel buffets. If you stay here I suggest you blank out and memorise the three digit security code on the rear of your credit card to prevent fraud.The management need to sort out the credit card fraudsters as a matter of urgency it has clearly been going on for months.

Reviews.Title: “good value and base”
Reviews.Author: pastytraveller
Reviews.Content: We were two families of 4, teenage children. We wanted a good value hotel near to the strip. The Hotel was excellent value and even had a free happy hour during the week. The hotel staff were helpful and if anything needed sorting out they would ensure somebody would do this within 10 mins. The hotel is a little distance from the strip, this did not cause us a problem but for single and younger persons a walk back late at night maynot be suitable, ok for my 21 yr old son but would feel differently for my daughter 19, in twos fine. My only gripe would be the rooms are quite dark and they did have a problem with the heating system that made a noise during the night ( which they were trying to sort out). The rooms were spacious, well equipped and the bed so comfortable. If 4 staying the pull out bed is ideal as this can seperate into two if required.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and close to the strip”
Reviews.Author: the_traveller_from82
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Desert Rose was fabulous! The room was spacious and clean. It was right behind Hooters which is across the street from MGM - just a short walk to the strip. The elevator was a bit scary (loud sound when stopping at our floor) but otherwise the hotel was well kept. Free parking and free wifi are always good bonuses. The breakfast was mediocre. The pool area was great - not as glamorous as other Vegas pool areas but good enough. The hot tub was fabulous! Overall a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Clean, Friendly AND Affordable”
Reviews.Author: GurlFriday
Reviews.Content: This is one of the few hotels JUST off the southern end of the Strip that offers kitchens in every room. No casino...just a clean simple hotel offering 1 or 2 bedrooms with a separate living area and a balcony. Ample parking but for you that won't be driving a quick taxi to/from airport approx. $10. No car for groceries? Have them delivered from Von's. Walking distance from Hooters, Luxor, Excalibur, MGM Grand, The Strip Monorail system and the tickets4tonight booth. Also...my mom's a Catholic and there's a huge Catholic Church around the bend (walking distance). Always felt safe walking even after the sun went down. This place isn't the highest end you can get BUT it's quiet, clean and VERY VERY comfortable. The staff was amazing and genuine and very accommodating. The cleaning crew is wonderful and there throughout the day. There is an outdoor pool and even in 50 degree weather is was open for use. It's well heated. There is a small workout room with a few treadmills, a couple of bikes and one ok elliptical as well as nautilus-type of equipment. There is continental breakfast in the mornings. Basics. Coffee, juice, cereal, hardboiled eggs, bread/bagels, yogurt and apples/bananas. It is a bit of a madhouse with guests scrambling for as much free food as they can get their hands on...so be warned. It's not the fault of the Resort....just greedy guests. I just got what I needed and headed back to my room and made coffee in my own kitchen (I think it's better anyway ;) Although I believe this resort is kind of a timeshare situation we were never once approached into 'buying in'. That's the best sell of all. Can't wait to check out their other properties.

Reviews.Title: “Just So So”
Reviews.Author: thecrankytraveller
Reviews.Content: Nice central location one block off the strip near the MGM Grand intersection. Check in was easy and the hotel has free wi-fi of reasonable quality. We had a couple of minor problems, the fold out bed when folded out revealed peanuts and melted chocolate coins on the base sheet. A quick call to reception got us a new mattress within 10 minutes. On trying to use the in room safe we discovered it was locked. Again called reception and had the security guy come up after about ½ hour, he could not reset it with the electronic tools he brought and said that maintenance would attend to it in the morning, we were there for three days and never heard back from anyone. On day two we only received two towels in place of the three we used (three guests). The kitchen is well appointed with good pots and pans and crockery you really couldn’t ask for more rooms are tidy but I wouldn’t say sparkling clean. I dropped some stuff down behind the TV and in fishing it out found it was pretty dusty and dirty back there. The free breakfast is a battle most mornings as there are never enough seats for the crowd which sort of gets everyone off to a stressful start (nothing like eating your breakfast while another family hover’s by your table waiting for you to finish).The breakfast itself is standard cereal, toast and cold boiled eggs with probably the worst coffee I have ever drank. I found the staff to be helpful in the main but certainly not warm. I think it is a fair priced hotel with decent access to the interstate and the strip, I would probably stay again if on a tight budget but without a lot of expectation.

Reviews.Title: “Credit Card Fraud”
Reviews.Author: Rose154914
Reviews.Content: We checked the reviews in June when we made our reservation and now know we should have checked again. Two weeks after we got home we were called by our credit card company asking about charges being made for gasoline thousands of miles away from our residence. The card was immediately cancelled. It was only used in Las Vegas to pay for our room. Won't see us again at this place.

Reviews.Title: “Best way to stay in Vegas with extended family”
Reviews.Author: hammonds
Reviews.Content: We rented two 2BR suites (at $100 per night each) for the Christmas Holiday. What a great choice it was! The rooms were very roomy and comfortable. We were able to cook a big meal in our full kitchen - the only thing missing was a dish rag and pot holder. There were 2 bathrooms per suite which were roomy and the showers were excellent! There were 8 of us total and we all had plenty of room to be comfortable and relax and enjoy each others company in one suite. The continental breakfast was nothing special but it was nice to have included in the cost. There is no "resort fee" or extra person fees like there are at a lot of the hotels in Vegas. This place is located right behind Tropicana and next to Hooters casino. It was an easy walk to MGM Grand and the tram making the strip easily accessible. Parking was right outside our room and it was so easy to get around to the casinos via Koval Dr. rather than on the strip. Everything is right there at your doorstep. It was nice not to have walk for miles to park you car and then get to your room. All in all, I felt this place was an excellent value for the money. The free breakfast and wifi were bonuses. I would definately stay here again on my next Vegas visit!

Reviews.Title: “Credit Card Fraud”
Reviews.Author: Bellacharm
Reviews.Content: I thought this was a great place to stay, close to the strip and a condo with breakfast for the same price as a mid priced hotel room. The resort was clean and well maintained, the rooms spacious and the bed was the most comfortable I have ever slept in. However before we travelled I was shocked to read about the credit card fraud so on arrival I said I would rather not hand over my credit card details. I was informed if i did not I would need to pay a hefty deposit and was told that the fraud problem had now been solved so handed over the card. A month after returning home(just before christmas) I got the call from the bank to say a $1000 had been spent on my card. The Desert Rose was the only place I used my card and now have the hassle of form filling to try to recoup the money. The Desert Rose have not responded to my email... SO BEWARE.

Reviews.Title: “OK for families wanting to stay close to the strip”
Reviews.Author: ll72
Reviews.Content: Have been to Vegas before and stayed on the strip (Luxor) but wanted something a little quieter (but still with a central feel) this time round as most of our time was being spent sight seeing out of town. Likes: Close to strip - Easy walking distance for people of all ages Staff - Very friendly with an aim to please. Overheard a staff member at breakfast offer to cover a meal (so it didn't get cold) for people to take back and have in their room. Thought that was nice of him! Rooms - Booked a one bedroom suite; had a fold out bed and full kitchen. We didn't eat in the room for every meal but it's good to have options and a little room to spread out when travelling as a family. Dislikes: Room - Our fold out had melted chocolate all over the mattress, sheets were a little worn through and the safe was closed and unable to be opened (by us or staff). Carpet around the dining table was a little sticky in spots but having stayed in family accommodation before I have to say this wasn't a total surprise. Regardless of everything else, linens were very clean, kitchen was fully equipped and room was spacious. Credit Card - Like many other reviewers we had troubles with our credit card when booking our room earlier this year... we had no fraudulent transactions but our card details were found on a 'person of interest' which resulted in all of our cards being cancelled by our bank. Not great and a hassle but in my opinion keeping a track of your transactions is the necessary trade off for the convenience of modern living. I'm now organised with a second lower limit backup card (not used for general purchases or linked to any other accounts) in case this happens again and I'm stuck without credit for a couple of days. Final Opinion: For the price and service I'd definitely stay here again if travelling as a family and looking for something with a bit more than your average hotel room. Thumbs up from me!

Reviews.Title: “I got a good rate otherwise not worth it”
Reviews.Author: pooh_bear_tx
Reviews.Content: Our family, two adults and two teens, stayed at Desert Rose Resorts for a weekday night. We got a good rate of $85.21 (including tax) for a two-bed-room suite. The rate was the only reason I did not cancel the reservation after reading the horrible reviews about the credit card fraud issue. I talked to the GM on the phone a few days before our arrival, and he promised that we can pay cash for the $100 security deposit as well as the room charge. He also asked for my arrival date and my name. When we checked in, I paid everything in cash; however, they still made a copy of my driver's license, which made me uncomfortable. I asked why they needed to copy my DL, and was told that because I paid cash, they wanted to make sure they refund the security deposit to ME, not other people. I was not happy but just let it go. The next day when I checked out, I requested the photocopy of my driver's license to be returned to me, but the front desk said they already submitted the copy to the accounting office, so they didnt have it. Then, what was the point to photocopy of my DL?? Why does the accounting office need that document? We stayed at 5 different hotels during our trip this time. Desert Rose Resorts was the only one copied my DL. The suite itself was nice and specious, but the TV in one of the bed rooms had very bad color of pictures. The internet speed was a joke. The breakfast was not good; we were disappointed. Also there were very limited seats in the breakfast area. The breakfast was served until 9am; it was way too early for a hotel in Las Vegas. There was a long waiting line close to 9am. Some people were still in pajamas. With the rate I paid, I think it was an ok hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Resort.”
Reviews.Author: Lydsie
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were friendly, checking in was quick and simple which is just what we needed after a long journey. The pool was clean and there were generally loungers free although you had to be there either early in the morning or mid afternoon. It was nice that there was no casino and it is only a small resort, the free happy hour was a bonus, it would have been nice to have a bar aswell. We enjoyed having a BBq in the evenings, the food from town square whole foods was lovely, a little more expensive than wallmart but well worth it. We were affected by the credit card scam, however it was picked up by the post office when we returned home and we were not liable. Ive only just found out it came from the hotel on trip advisor. It hasn't changed my opinion of the resort and i would recommend it to others, perhaps recommending they use a credit card and not debit card deposit.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE CREDIT CARD FRAUD CONTINUES AT THE DESERT ROSE!”
Reviews.Author: 60713George
Reviews.Content: Early in December my wife and I were in Vegas for a vacation and were aware that this hotel has a several year history of credit card fraud. Because of that we prepaid for this hotel through Orbits. The hotel still insisted that I give them a credit card for incidentals and even though I knew of the fraud problem, under protest I gave them a secondary card that I do not usually use. Fortunately my bank caught the fraudulent charges and stopped this card before any major damage was done. It still cost me a small fee to cancel and reissue a new card, a real pain. BEWARE!

Reviews.Title: “do not stay here credit card fraud still operates”
Reviews.Author: ray191062
Reviews.Content: had the above not happened thr review would be different..unfortunatley they have done nothing to solve the problem..i have deen back 2 months and my card was used in henderson city so i would assume that someone in the hotel must be passing on details to third parties for fraudulent use. why why why have you done nothing to stop this problem that seems to have been going on for some considerable time?...stay at your own peril it could be a few months before your card is used

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Hotel - Pity about Credit Card Fraud”
Reviews.Author: BallroomBill
Reviews.Content: We are English and stayed at the Desert Rose in October. We thought it great value for money. Today my bank has telephoned me to say that my credit card has been used fraudelently in America to the amount of $500 but, fortunately, my bank did not sanction the transaction. I cannot prove that this was the result of staying at the Desert Rose but as it was only used twice in America and, due to the numerous other complaints, it seems too much of a co-incidence. My advice is to avoid this hotel and stay somewhere else. It's just too much of a risk.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, great price,”
Reviews.Author: courtnal
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable rooms - suites at a great price - less than the Hilton, our conference hotel. Courteous and helpful staff. The continental breakfast rates a B, mainly because of crowed eating area, minimal fruit/yogurt. Serve Starbucks, but only breakfast blend. Note: If you have an education connection, this is definitely the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Resort vacation near the casinos”
Reviews.Author: Prattlecette
Reviews.Content: We switched into resort mode as soon as we got to this hotel which was not what we expected from a Vegas stay! They almost apologised during booking for being all of a block and a half off the strip and not having a casino, but this made it a great visit for us as we could relax away from the strip, and we explored the rest of Vegas more than prior visits. They have a Manager's reception 4 nights with free wine and nibblies, very nice. Rooms are excellent, especially for the price, nicely decorated and equipped mini suites. Only (very minor) quibble was that there weren't that many stairs and you had to get places a little circuitously. Nice pool area, better equipped gym room than many, this is our hotel of choice now in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “credit card scam - STAY AT OWN PERIL”
Reviews.Author: larette
Reviews.Content: This hotel has had a credit card scam going on for OVER 7 MONTHS, and yet they still demand to swipe your credit card upon arrival knowing full well that the problem has not been solved. Instead of fixing their system, they are putting their wellbeing (insisting on a credit card for 'security') over their customers. They did not even mention this risk to us on checking in. They do not care, and would rather have your credit card charged thousands of dollars in fraud purchases so long as they can have your details on system for 'security' in case you steal one of their (cheap!) pillows or towels or whatever it else it is they feel they need to protect. Please reconsider staying here, and read reviews carefully - there are many 4 and 5 star reviews for the Desert Rose on this site but if you read them, you will see that these customers (including myself) have had their credit card details stolen from this hotel. The hotel has even acknowledged responsibility on tripadvisor. I imagine there are many more cases, with people not realising that this hotel is the source of the copying, or even those who have left positive reviews before seeing the fraud charges on their cards. Yes this place is cheap. The location is not too far from the strip, and a free breakfast is always nice, but is this worth it in exchange for having your card and identity stolen? Stop and think about the hassle involved before you book. I had my credit card copied from this hotel (as confirmed by tracing by the bank). It made the rest of my trip terrible as I couldn't book further hotels/buses/flights online without a card. I also had to spend a lot of money and time on contacting banks and police. I now have the trouble of going home and dealing with my mobile phone service which has been cut off, in addition to switching over details to my new card for internet services, and everything else. I spoke to the Manager of this 'institution' which dares to call itself a 'Resort' and yet he was completely unapologetic and seemingly completely uninterested in rectifying this problem in the long term other than claiming he had 'forensics' working on the system. The bottom line is that they have a problem, have not done anything to fix it, have continuted to swipe credit cards, and will not do anything to protect your details and money. It is therefore up to you do protect yourself, and the only way you can do this is by NOT STAYING HERE.

Reviews.Title: “Great Las Vegas gem”
Reviews.Author: HoponHopoff
Reviews.Content: We had turned to Trip Advisor when looking for somewhere to stay for our third visit to Las Vegas and the reviews about Desert Rose Resort looked very promising, giving it one of the highest ratings out of the 285 odd hotels in Las Vegas. We stayed for a week and were not disappointed. The hotel is located near McCarran International Airport and the southern end of the strip and within easy walking distance of MGM Grande, Hooters, Tropicana, Luxor, Mandalay Bay and others. The Las Vegas Outlet Center with some very reasonably priced designer shops is only about 5 minutes drive past the airport. There are plenty of different eating places nearby. When we arrived at the hotel, the check-in was quick and we were offered a choice of a number of one-bedroom suites. We settled for one on the 3rd floor facing the inside courtyard as we were told that would be quieter. It was definitely quieter considering that the hotel is very near the airport and the strip. There was a lift to all floors. There is free parking for guests and access to the hotel is through doors/gates by using your room keys. The accommodation was very clean, spacious and well furnished. Included in the accommodation was a balcony, a living/dining room which had large sofa and large couch which could be used as a single bed, large TV and a radio receiver with sound system (including a subwoofer), large cupboard with an iron and an ironing board, fully fitted kitchen with all cutlery and utensils provided down to paper kitchen towel, scourer and washing up liquid. Also included, a coffee maker, toaster, jug blender, huge fridge freezer, 5-hob halogen cooker with large oven, large wall mounted microwave oven and a dish washer! What else could one want? The bathroom was large enough with a bath which included a shower. The shower was very powerful and invigorating. The bedroom was large and had the second TV, plenty of drawers for storage and a cupboard with ample hangers and hanging space. There was a personal safe in the cupboard.The bed was very comfortable, one of the best I have slept in. It was made up daily and towels changed when requested. The service provided by the maid was excellent. A laundry room is located in each of the blocks on the ground floor and very cheap ($1.75 for a wash and $0.50 for 66 minutes drying). Continental breakfast is included and although not huge by American standards, it was more than adequate with a choice of sliced bread, muffins, bagels, butter and jam, cheese, boiled eggs, fruit, tea, Starbucks coffee, fruit juice and sodas. You can eat in the lobby or take the food up to your room. 5pm to 7pm every Monday to Thursday was Manager’s Happy Hour with complimentary snacks and drinks (beer, wine, tea coffee, soft drinks etc.) There is free wi-fi and a stand-alone computer in the lobby with complimentary printer for guest use and a small shop for essentials. There is a gym, swimming pool and a hot tub but we did not use any of these. The service from all the staff was excellent. We would recommend this hotel to anyone wishing to go to Las Vegas; you won't find better value for money, facilities or comfort. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel for any of our vacations”
Reviews.Author: LeisuretravelerMrEd
Reviews.Content: This place is an unbelievable bargain and very nice. There were 4 of us and the two bedroom suite with separate baths was exactly what we needed. Very clean, great staff, decent continental breakfast. This is definitely our place for trips to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, but be warned !”
Reviews.Author: Neilthehatter
Reviews.Content: My wife and I plus two friends had a great time at the desert rose, top place, however visa fraud dept. called today to ask if have been shopping at Wal Mart over the past few weeks as my card had been used several times, as I have been back in the UK for the last six weeks it is obviously not me ! The only time I have used my Visa card is to pay $500 deposit at check-in, there the deed must have taken place - BE WARNED !!!!

Reviews.Title: “CREDIT CARD FRAUD!!!”
Reviews.Author: grischnackh
Reviews.Content: This review would be very different if not for the fact that our credit card details were used fraudulently after staying at this hotel. We know for a fact that the Desert Rose is the source since this is only one of two places we used the card in the US, and in fact the card has only been used twice in total. Our suspicions are confirmed by the numerous other reviews on the site about credit fraud. The funny thing is that we never wanted to pay the hotel by credit card in the first place. Upon checking in, we asked to pay cash and the guy at the desk told us that we didn't need to pay until checking out, but that we would need to present a credit card as security. Despite this our card was still charged regardless. Do not stay here even if you are intending to pay cash. Having your credit card details stolen is a huge nightmare while on holiday overseas.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: gmell_au
Reviews.Content: If you want to enjoy 'the strip' without being in it, the Desert Rose Resort is excellent. One block from the strip means you have to be willing to walk a little. Breakfast is basic but good considering it is no additional charge. Staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “STAFF, ROOMS, LOCATION, SERVICE, ARE ALL NUMBER 10 IN OUR BOOK!”
Reviews.Author: rodeofans
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Desert Rose from 12/5 to 12/10. Everything about our stay was enjoyable from the minute we arrived til we left. We have a time share at the Hilton Grand Vacation Club and have stayed at others in Las Vegas including the Staybridge and this is the ONLY place we can't wait to return to. Our rooms were spotless--the staff were awesome--and the location was super. I was a little concerned about stairs but each building has an elevator!! I, too, agree with others that a tad more light in the bathroom would be great. I plan to bring a makeup mirror in 2011. With any business dealing with the public--the staff make or break it for me. I can honestly say that everyone from the desk staff to the housekeepers went out of their way to assure that our time at the Desert Rose was as comfortable as possible. I would hire them away from Desert Rose in a heartbeat!! THANKYOU!! THANKYOU!! THANKYOU!!

Reviews.Title: “6 star luxury for 2 star price”
Reviews.Author: bensonhector
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself and 2 teenage daughters stayed at the Desert Rose on a recent trip to USA. It was one of 6 hotels we stayed at, also the cheapest by far. I can only say I wish all our hotels had been even half as good as this one. We had a 2 b/room suite that was immaculate and very well furnished with extremely comfortable beds. The staff were very friendly and helpful, this hotel was just off the Strip in an excellent position. I would recommend this place to anyone wishing to go to Las Vegas, you won't find better.

Reviews.Title: “Credit Card Problem”
Reviews.Author: DianeinDublin
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay with a husband who was resisting the full Las Vegas experience. However, I have experienced a problem with the credit card I used. I saw the complaints about this type of problem before I went, but they all seemed to be from people in Great Britian or Australia, so I thought perhaps I could duck the problem since I'm from the US. Not so. I purposely used a credit card that I seldom use otherwise. Almost one month later, charges started showing up from Great Britian. In fact, my credit card company says that they received a call from a Great Britian business trying to verify that the holder of the fake card was me (a women). The person trying to use it was a man! My credit card company is contacting the hotel management, but based on the past reviews, I'm not hopeful that action will be taken by hotel management. Luckily, my credit card is protected and I'm not liable. Based on this, I'm giving the hotel a thumbs down. :(

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful accomidations & Friendly Resort Staff”
Reviews.Author: nanapag
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay the staff was all very helpful and our room (a one bedroom suite) was very clean, well appointed and very quiet. Afternoon happy hour with complimentary drinks and a snack was a nice surprise. The continental breakfast is simple but a nice perk with staying there. The location of the resort doesnt allow for great views but the modern ammenities and cleanliness makes up for it. The free internet was very nice to have as well. The fitness center is small but has enough equipment. The staff told us to go to the Mad Onion for dinner (located next door in Hooters Casino) and the food was great. The prime rib sandwich is amazing. All in all we would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Ge0ff_F
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights and really enjoyed the experience. The hotel was just around the corner from the MGM Hotel and was really within easy walking distance to the strip. The accommodation was very large, comfortable and clean and had the resort feel about it. Staff were very friendly and helpful and having it's own little shop for necessities was a bonus. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and especially to those who want a quiet place to stay. Excellent for families.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: VancouverBruce
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in a 2 bedroom suite at the Desert Rose while on a vacation with friends. The suite was recently upgraded, exceptionally clean, the staff were very helpful and friendly. The pool facilities were clean and well maintained. The location of the resort was perfect as it is just off the main strip (quiet) but still in walking distance as it is only 1 block away from the MGM. I would recommend this resort to anyone. Bruce Vancouver, BC

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in Vegas without a casino!”
Reviews.Author: abstr
Reviews.Content: I had a hard time trying to find a good hotel without a casino inside of it in Vegas since I'm not a fan of gambling and was visiting city for a different purpose. Desert Rose has a great value/price for those who want to spend Vegas nights in a quiet and comfortable place. Although located not on the Strip, it takes about 5-10 minutes to get to the MGM Grand from there by feet. Inside my room I've found full-blown kitchen with oven, toaster, teapot, coffee-maker, blender, frying pan, glasses and etc which is really good if you're tired of restaurant food. And there were two rooms indeed! One was a dining room with a couch and balcony and the second was a bedroom. Will recommend this place to the families with children and just any people who want to avoid noisy casinoish hotels while in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “2nd stay here and would come back again1”
Reviews.Author: TheMuggins
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 8 nights in November 2010. We are parents travelling with a 3 year old son. We like this place because it is cheap, it is close (walking distance) to the strip, and we can get 2 bedroom rooms with kitchen and lounge room. We were not disappointed on our return trip here. We requested a top floor room away from the pool area and we got it...so we were happy. The room was good, the staff were good and we would definately stay here again if we are fortunate enough to return to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Worst ever”
Reviews.Author: jwh2008
Reviews.Content: This absolutely the worst treatment I have ever had at a resort. My self and another couple waited over 3 hours after check in time of 4pm continually being told there was no room cleaned and resort owners had priority. I do not recommend this over rated resort to anyone. I was shocked the way the desk help talked to people waiting as they were rude and made it sound as the problem was the fault of the guest. Absolutely the worst place I have ever stayed.

Reviews.Title: “The Best of the Best”
Reviews.Author: junebug14
Reviews.Content: On November 21, my husband myself and 2 friends landed in Vegas for a week of R & R. This is the 3rd time we have stayed at the Desert Rose On Duke Ellington Way just off the strip. The location is wonderful because you can get away from the hussle and bussle ( and smoke in the casinos ) for a few hours and then get right back into it. The Staff at the resort are friendly & helpful and your check in & out time is down with ease.The rooms are clean bright and well maintaned we had a small problem in the guest bathroom and within no time from reporting the problem it was it corrected. I would HIGHLY RECOMMEND the Desert Rose to anyone that was spending time in LAS Vegas June Hayes - Toronto Canda

Reviews.Title: “If you are bringing a young family to Vegas, this is the perfect place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: mbourke1
Reviews.Content: The Desert Rose Resort is walking distance from the strip, just behind the Tropicana Casino, and without the ringing of slot machines and smell of tobacco, which was perfect for a family with four kids under 11 years. Complimentary breakfast and very nice suites allowed us to have a very comfortable stay in Vegas in between visiting the attractions on the strip. Also very close to the MGM Grand monorail station.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not special”
Reviews.Author: A.Brouwer
Reviews.Content: The lobby looks very cozy and warm. Check in was friendly, I was given a small map of the hotel and Las Vegas. One member of the staff directed me to my room when I tried to find my room. The room was big, very big. There is a seperate bedroom and the kitchen is great. There is even a tv in the bedroom. The bathroom was rather small. Rooms have free WIFI but however, during my stay it didn't work well. Unreliable and slow. I believe the walls are thin because you can sometimes hear noise from neighbouring rooms and corridors. But despite the location near the airport I haven't heard planes. The location near the strip is excellent, it's not a long walk to the strip. Breakfast was simple, not much choice. Expect queues if you want to toast your bread. There are free drinks and snacks mo-fr 5.00pm-7.00pm which is very nice. This hotel is good but not special, especially for the price paid.

Reviews.Title: “Physically close to the strip, but a world away in comfort”
Reviews.Author: ScarletChauncey
Reviews.Content: The staff at Desert Rose are friendly and helpful. The one bedroom suites are great for a couple - all the comforts of home. Included is a contenental breakfast, but much more than toast and fruit. Monday to Friday there is a Managers cocktail hour. Wine, beer and snacks are offered. The best part is the location - 10 minute stroll to the strip. We walked late at night and always felt safe. Once at the resort you have the feel of the Carribean. Large pool, hot tub and children's pool The buildings are 3 storey-stucco and tiled roofs surrounded by palm trees. No slots or smoking in the lobby. Thus removing you from the craziness and gambling that can be Vegas. A peaceful place to recharge. before hitting the nightlife again.

Reviews.Title: “Thrilled with our stay”
Reviews.Author: bkacir
Reviews.Content: The resort was better than expected. The room was large and had everything you could possibly need. Liked the fact there was no casino and it was easily within walkin distance from the strip.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to sleep, don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: Debra0330
Reviews.Content: Encouraged by the reviews we saw here and looking forward to a peaceful night before a very early flight out (and after a hectic trip to the Grand Canyon and Sedona), we booked a room here for our last night in Vegas. When we checked in, we were led to a room on the first floor. All seemed fine, so we left to wander the Strip. When we returned at about 8:30pm, I noticed that there was a radio playing somewhere in the apartment. To my horror, realized that it wasn't playing in our room, but in the bedroom above us, and playing so loudly that we could hear the DJ's commentary from our room. Okay, so at 8:30, I'm not going to say anything, but at 10:30 we had had enough. I called the front desk, they sent some security guy to first listen in our bedroom (my husband was in bed...it was ridiculous) and then we think he went upstairs. We don't know what happened for sure because the radio sounded exactly the same, if not louder after he supposedly went up there. I called the front desk, and seeing how the hotel seemed not nearly at capacity, asked to be moved to another room. This was accomplished pretty quickly. We settled in for the night around 11:30. At 2 am, we were awoken by the sounds of people stomping in the room above us. The ceiling makes this horrible crackly sound (which I've only heard one other time, at a Holiday Inn in Niagara Falls, but that's another story). That wasn't the worst part. When our upstairs neighbors went into their bathroom, you could hear the sounds of EVERYTHING they did in there (use your imagination, I'm sure it's sufficient). This stomping and bathroom activity went on until 5:30am, or the time we had to get up for our flight. When we complained at the front desk, "unhelpful" would be an apt phrase to describe the reaction. Never again. To make a long story short, I know a lot of people come to Vegas to NOT sleep. But when you stay at a non-casino, off the beaten path hotel that advertises as the Desert Rose does, you don't expect to be kept up all night by cheap construction and inconsiderate guests. Skip this one. There is enough competition and great priced rooms on offer all over the Strip. You don't have to be tortured like we were here.

Reviews.Title: “Little gem of a place with all amenities to hand, as they say in Scotland - pure, dead, brilliant.”
Reviews.Author: loridev2001
Reviews.Content: Eight of us stayed at this hotel which was recommended by two of the group who had stayed last year. Couldn't fault the staff or the place. Have stayed in the big hotels on the strip and now find them to be a bit too impresonal whereas the Desert Rose staff and place to stay were perfect. Complimentary breakfast, pool, hot tub, BBQ areas, managers special were all utilised by our party. No casino which added to its character, no hostesses hovering waiting for you to gamble just a realy great relaxing place to stay. Would only recommend this hotel to very close friends and relatives as I would hate not to be able to get booked because it was full due to my recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Halligan007
Reviews.Content: Nice spacious room, with kitchenette, living room, bedroom and ensuite bathroom. We were impressed with the polite professional service of the front desk staff along with how good the room looked. We didn't use the kitchen but it was fully stocked, even had dishwasher soap. The breakfast was a excellent continetal style, with a toaster available, bagels, dry cereal, milk, juice, and a couple variables boiled eggs(one morning), pineapple (another morning), yogut etc. The internet worked good, had to sign back on in the morning after not using the compter.. not a big deal. For the down side we were happy how close it was to the trip, within walking distance, but after walking to the strip and back at least once a day we were very tired of walking and if we stayed here again would probably only do so with having rented a car. The carpet was old and was the only decorative negative of the room and the bath tube/toilet room was pretty small and took some negotiating to get in and close the door behind you. Really no big deal though. It's very close to the aiport however I had no problem sleeping and could only hear planes if I was really listening for them. I'm a light sleeper and the planes were not a problem, I was impressed. Being on a ground floor may of played a part but it does have openings to garden areas so I think you would be safe from noise in any of the rooms. Overall we really enjoyed our stay there and felt it was a little jem not having to walk through a casino full of smoke to get to your room. Also we were at one of the big casinos and noticed huge lines for travellers trying to check into their rooms. I also received a poll and questionaire after our stay which tells me the Dessert Rose Resort managers are working to keep their customers happy. And since I'm sure they'll be reading this.. Thank You for an Excellent Stay.

Reviews.Title: “The Most Amazing Hotel I have had the privilege to stay at.”
Reviews.Author: RobLowe1989
Reviews.Content: Out of all the hotels this is one of the few with out a casino attached. No smoking environment. Short walk from the MGM and hooters Casino, under 3 minutes. One of the only heated pools and an excellent hot tub. Managers meeting in evenings Mon- Thursday free snacks and wine/beer. Beyond polite and respectful staff. They will go out of their way to do almost anything to make you stay amazing. We checked in to our hotel and the previous occupants broke a drawer, 1 phone call and within 10 minutes the problem was fixed. Also a continental breakfast. Amazing Bed, Gigantic Room with cleaning done by staff daily. When i go back to vegas i will be returning to the Desert Rose.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value, Very Clean”
Reviews.Author: Virginia2002
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here for a mini reunion with some of his college friends. They chose Las Vegas as a good place for all to meet. The Desert Rose was picked based on the price & comments from Trip Advisor & it did not disappoint. In fact a number of those attending liked not having to walk through the noisy casinos to get places & the ease of having a car parked close to the room plus no charge for parking. Other plusses are; 1. Very clean 2. Great to have a living room area and furnished kitchen 3. Full length mirror in the bedroom 4. Has a safe 5. Very nice area by the pool where you can barbecue & relax. The staff was helpful in getting us (about 15 of us) situated. 6. Extremely helpful staff 7. Helpful concierge who recommended getting discount show tickets at TIX4 Tonite offices. TIX does have great deals. 8. Good healthy free breakfast! Foods included hard boiled eggs, cereals, several choices of fruit including fresh fruit, toast, toaster waffles, cottage cheese, juices, coffee and tea. It was more than a simple continental breakfast. If you want cooked eggs to order, fancy omelets, pancakes, etc., you'll need to go out. 9. Free internet. 10. It is not far from the strip - about 2 blocks from MGM. 11. Rooms were quiet. My cons are 1. The lights could be brighter over the sink in the bathroom. 2. The lobby could use a 2nd computer - possibly designated to help those who want to do online airline check ins. There is only 1 for guests & some people were not abiding by the 15 min. rule. This computer was slow. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: lookylooky57
Reviews.Content: we all loved our stay and would love to go back maybe to sumfest the reviews on tripadvisor were bang on from the rooms to the maid service it was great

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of peace in the hectic of Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: uerinke
Reviews.Content: This resort is really recommendable if you want the best value for your money. We had a very nice and clean one bedroom apartment, tasteful furnished, with a kitchen (completely equipped!) and tranquility. If you want to gamble... Luxor, Madalay Bay, MGM and Excalibur are just max. 10 min to walk away... The only thing that is poor is the breakfast buffet. But we didn't bother because with this lovely equipped kitchen you can make your own breakfast without any time pressure.

Reviews.Title: “Desert Rose Resort in Las Vegas is great value for your money.”
Reviews.Author: mytravels55
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Desert Rose Resort and we were there for 5 days. The hotel/resort is in a great location, just off the Strip behind Hooters so the location is great for accessing all the lights and hustle and bustle of the strip but only a short walk back to serenity and relaxation. The area of town is patroled by security on bikes and we saw them continuosly so we had no angst about walking back to the hotel at night. We felt safe. We stayed in a two bedroom with two bathrooms, kitchen and living room which was perfect for taking our young adult kids. The hotel is well run and quick to respond to our needs. The staff are very friendly. The pool and hot tub area was clean and well maintained. The hotel seems to be keeping up it's maintenance so it was nice to see new carpeting in our rooms. No complaints. we'll stay there next time again

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: bkamper
Reviews.Content: Showers were awesome!!, bed was super comfy. Was there for a wedding that was at mandalay, nice to be so close. breakfast was okay, not great. managers reception was a nice touch. rooms and hallways were very clean. Would definitely stay there again! Interenet was intermittent though and was annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Do It!”
Reviews.Author: bogeysue
Reviews.Content: What a disappointment! Rated #4 in Vegas? Don't believe it. It certainly wasn't a good experience for us. We had a 2 bedroom suite. We should have rented 2 adjoining rooms in a hotel on the strip for the same price. Many of the hotels are running good deals. Go there instead. Carpet layers started in our building at 8 a.m. The noise sounded like someone was pounding on our bedroom walls. If we had been warned, we never would have stayed here. The new carpet was definitely needed. The carpet was very worn and shabby in the hallways, so so in the rooms. I could not take a decent shower. It was impossible to adjust the water temperature. With 1/8" adjustments I finally got the water from hot to very warm. The next 1/8" would make it cold. I finally settled for a little too hot and stood out of the flow of water to wash. Then mid-way through my shower it went to ice cold. Other irritations: remote for TV didn't work, light bulb burned out, loose electrical plate in kitchen that sparked when I unplugged the toaster, broken shade in the bedroom, no room for any personal items in bathrooms. (They looked nice but were not very functional) sparse breakfast ended at 9 during the week (Come on, this is Vegas for heaven sakes.) I reported all our problems to the front desk in person about an hour before we checked out and asked the rep to check with the manager for a reduced rate. This was my error. I should have spoken to the manager directly. When we checked out I was told the rate was not reduced because we were already paying much less than everyone else. I asked why we had such a good rate and they didn't know. They claimed everyone else was paying almost twice as much. I had booked through the hotel so I don't believe for one minute I had such a great rate. In fact, I just called to check their rates and they are the same as what I paid. They did offer to extend our check out. Hello, the car is packed and at the curb, we are leaving. The rep at the desk asked if I knew how to get to the 15. He indicated I could take Tropicana and stay in the left lane. You can't turn left on Tropicana and you can't make U- turns when you go right. They couldn't even direct me out of there correctly. I give them a zero for customer service. The location isn't so great. It is close to the strip but I was a little concerned walking through the back of the Hooters parking lot past all their smelly garbage at night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort, great value”
Reviews.Author: wirthdog
Reviews.Content: Tripadvisor was right-on for reviews of this hotel. I booked direct with resort after a Priceline/Travelocity airfare & hotel package showed hotel was "unavailable". Turned out to be a good thing, the resort was running a "stay 3 (or 4?) nights and get one "free". Cannot beat that deal! Five nights for $300...wow! Yes, some parts of condo showing wear BUT ktichen was great, all other furnishings fine, nice balcony & very roomy (we had 19 & 15 year old boys with 2 adults). The L-shaped pull-out sofa was basically one huge bed, plenty of room for 2 six-foot boys. The breakfast each morning was a plus, although lots of room for improvement- since only bread items, fruit & juice offered. Starbucks coffee nice touch. Did not attend manager's afternoon reception but free drinks! This hotel was our launching point for a 2 day trip to Grand Canyon (a must-see!) Another do-not-miss attaction is Fremont Street Experience, especially with teens. Pool was not crowded but hottub looked like it needed attention. All staff very friendly. Location was GREAT & no problems with security- as long as you remember you ARE in Vegas! Will definately look to stay here again.....

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TorontoLeesar
Reviews.Content: A good hotel. I only had a few minor problems. First, housekeeping clean the rooms very late - e.g. 4pm. One time, I called down to ask them to clean the room at 3pm. I then left and returned to the room a half hour later and it still wasn't cleaned. I called the front desk again and had to wait another half hour for the room to be cleaned. Later, I received a voicemail from the front desk telling me that my room had been serviced earlier in the day before my phone call - not true. Second, the concierge wasn't particularly helpful. For instance, he wasn't positive of the prices of the bus and the monorail. Third, they use disposable plates and cups at breakfast. Fourth, the internet connection didn't work one day. But, overall, it's a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Excellent Location, Helpful & Friendly Staff, BRILLIANT!”
Reviews.Author: CraigCollins
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Desert Rose for 10 nights (23/10/10 - 02/11/10) in a 1 bedroom suite (4304) based on location, price & reviews (#4 out of 288 in LV). Having seen reviews, I thought this place must have some shortcomings. I was wrong. After arriving from Australia via LAX on an early morning flight, we arrived at DRR at about 9am, hoping to check in. No you can't check in till 4pm, (which I knew, but it never hurts to try). They stored our bags and we wandered up to the strip (10 - 15 min leasurely walk). As this was our 1st ever trip to LV we were excited to be in Sin City. After walking the streets we got back about 6pm and checked into our room. We had a courtyard room that had a view of Hooters and MGM in the distance. Over the next 10 nights, my wife and I searched for faults with DRR. We even played the "Let's find a grumpy staff member" game and lost.
