Even at 5am everybody was cheerful...front counter staff, cleaners etc. I would recommend anyone to stay here, unless you want a casino, then you wouldn't stay here anyway. Only a short walk to MGM monorail station across Tropicana Blvd. We missed breakfast most days, but we had a couple, basic but thats all you need as you eat yourself stupid on the strip anyway. Pool was great, as was the hot tub, perfect for the long walks we did. We were in LV for a wedding at the Bellagio with friends who stayed there and at the Jockey Club, and looking at DRR we got the best value. $1100 for 10 nights for a room with full cooking facilities and seperate bedroom - what more could you as for. Problems? Picking at straws here - well our A/C was a bit noisy, but as soon as you stepped outside into 90-100 degrees, you did not care. After 1 night the AC was bearable and did not intrude as we set it to low (70degrees). There are NO other issues with this hotel, staff were obscenely friendly, house staff replenised towels etc almost as you put down the phone to request it, taxis arrived soon after they called. Brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “Not great but okay”
Reviews.Author: abcdefgIndiana
Reviews.Content: The hotel and furnishings are a little rundown. The main reason to stay at this hotel is that each room has more square footage than most hotels. Very nice to have a separate room for the bedroom. The bathroom (toilet and shower) is very small and someone who is overweight/obese may have a problem navigating the bathroom. The complimentary breakfast is adequate but boring, especially if you are staying at the hotel for several days [assorted cereals, assorted bagels and sliced bread, hard-boiled eggs, yogurt or cottage cheese, canned fruit, 1 type of fruit (orange, banana) each day, juice, coffee]. One item is usually changed each day. Although it is nice to have a breakfast included in the price, I would not recommend that this be a factor in staying at this hotel. Convenient 10 minute walk to the strip near Hooters and MGM. This is a nice, okay hotel. Special pricing on rooms at the more well known hotels may be a few dollars more (depending on season and day of the week), with less square footage but the furnishings are great and certainly more romantic.

Reviews.Title: “Huge studios, 5 minutes walk to The Strip”
Reviews.Author: AlexZhilyakov
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend. To summarize my stay: Pros: Feels like home!!! * Huge and comfortable room * Full kitchen with appliances * Quiet neighborhood * Free parking * Close to the strip (5 minutes walk) * Breakfast * Friendly staff * Close to the airport Cons: * I wish breakfast included omlet/bacon There is no restaurant on the premises, but it is walking distance to Tropicana, Hooters, Excalibur and Luxor which offer variety of dining options. While it is close to the airport, there is absolutely no noise from planes landing or taking off.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT ESCAPE FROM THE STRIP...YET STEPS AWAY!”
Reviews.Author: mandamia
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, spacious rooms, great price! We would stay again in a heartbeat!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just off the strip”
Reviews.Author: roaming-wifi
Reviews.Content: This place was pretty good value at $115US a night, being a full apartment including a kitchen. There was a pool in the complex but we didn’t get the chance to use it. There was also a coin operated laundry which was helpful. Breakfast was included in the rate. The hotel was about a 5-10 minute walk from the strip, so if noise is an issue for you then this location would be ideal. The Deuce and Ace buses were only a block or two away to get you to the other end of the strip. I can’t really fault anything with this stay, good value, good facilities and staff and a massive room. There was plenty of space to feel comfortable and the whole place was very clean. We really only spent limited time in the room anyway. It was very secure accommodation as you needed your room key to enter your particular building and the gated side entrances. No hesitation in recommending this place!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: rgray2f
Reviews.Content: Five night stay. Well maintained property. Clean. Staff remarkably happy, pleasant and cooperative. When we come to Las Vegas, we will return to the Desert Rose. However, the breakfast and dinner receptions are nothing to brag about--limited food items and very limited and crowded seating. On the whole, an excellent lodging experience in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “awesome would not stay anywhere else highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: shelleysondergeld
Reviews.Content: the service was second to none the rooms were very clean as a motel manager in australia i would rate you as a five star establishment. all staff were friendly and helpful this goes from the housekeepers to management. we will be staying there again in 2012. the location is excellent

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: Maisie44
Reviews.Content: This place is fantastic. The separate bedroom is great and there was a big TV in both the livingroom and bedroom. Nice dining table and four chairs. Livingroom very comfy. Kitchen was great - actually much nicer and more modern than my kitchen at home with all sorts of very nice appliances and a big electric range. Plus a dishwasher which I've never had! I didn't want to come home to my old-fashioned kitchen! The breakfasts were great - lots of difference choices every day with plenty of food to go around. Staff helpful and friendly. I wouldn't stay anywhere else now that I've discovered this place. And you can't beat the price.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: shaywhat4
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Desert Rose Resort for 4 nights/5 days and thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. Staff we met were all very friendly and helpful. Room was very spacious and always spotless. Can't say anything negative about it.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient good value accommodations at Desert Rose”
Reviews.Author: OregonTraveler97504
Reviews.Content: On this, our second stay at the Desert Rose Resort we got a 4 ngihts for the price of three package. We like the quiet, more relaxed atmosphere here rather than the big hotels. The location is within easy walking distance of the MGM, New York and Tropicana hotels and also the monorail. Having a unit with a separate bedroom and a fully equipped kitchen gives one a much more comfortable environment than a hotel room. The free nothing special but it can be filling. The evening happy hour with free beer and wine is a definite plus and gets you in the mood for dinner and casino hopping. No need to rent a car - Desert Rose is a short cab ride from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, really, but security is lax”
Reviews.Author: AussieTwink
Reviews.Content: We did love our stay at your hotel, but that was ruined by a note months later from our river expedition service that our credit had been stolen and spent overseas, confirmed by our credit card company and our bill in October. It seems some answers are in order: Why did it take so long to stop the thievery? What is different now that would prevent this again? Was it an employee? Why didn't you tell us? We had to hear it from our riverguide service. What will you do to regain our trust and business? besides a "sorry about that?" Pending satisfactory answers, we will not plan to stay there again and we will tell our friends not to either.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Want to Stay Anywhere Else...”
Reviews.Author: Jeff07
Reviews.Content: ... and that's the truth! Seven of us went over for a friend's birthday and decided on the Desert Rose because of the glowing reviews they'd had. They were right. From checking in we were made to feel welcome and it came as a pleasant suprise that the photos really do reflect the place - rooms, reception and pool area. Continental breakfast varied daily with everything from doughnuts to waffles being constantly brought out by staff throughout service to go alongside the apparent staples of bread, croissants and cereals that you'd expect. Couple that with the freshly brewed Starbucks coffee on draught, and you'll understand why I'd have to disagree that it takes ten minutes to get to the strip because we managed it in five. The rooms were nipping clean but we were only given two sets of towels after a service despite there being three of us staying there however that was remedied with a quick call to reception (less than five minutes and problem solved). One word of warning about the third bed / matress / torture device under the setee - don't use it unless you are prepared to bend yourself into a shape that nature didn't intend so you avoid getting springs stuck in your back. Do as we did and use the corner of the setee instead (we checked and it is actually meant to be used as a bed so no issue). We missed out on the manager's evenings because we were out on the town so can't comment but overall, there isn't anything I'd say could have improved our stay - from the spacious balcony to the incredibly well thought out kitchen area (and it's true - they actually do have food processers and coffee machines in there!!). All the staff were friendly and genuinely wanted you to enjoy your stay and I have to say all seven of us did to the point where we've already decided we're going back to Las Vegas and the Desert Rose. It was brilliant from start to finish.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: birdyLondon
Reviews.Content: Nice resort style hotel. Away from the strip so you can escape the hustle and bustle. Rooms and clean and spacious - fantastic sitting / dining area. Kitchen also spacious, although we did not use. 10 min to strip which does not feel long at all. Good size swimming pool - did not feel overcrowded whilst we were there.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT GO THERE CARD SCAM GOING ON”
Reviews.Author: tigger-thats-me
Reviews.Content: i went here in oct and the place was lovely ,would had recomnmend it to others . until i went to use my credit card at home and found out that it had been hacked into they said i had £63.33 from the desert rose (what for i asked as we dont pay for resort fees ...do we let me know if we do ) the card had been used in mexico ,but i havnt been there they ran a good bill up so be warned dont go there only if u dont have to swipe your card loved vegas but now im gutted i had been caught out and i dont want others to fall into it like about 10 others have what i can see :(

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: pwf16129
Reviews.Content: clean, great location, quiet but only moments from the strip, staff very helpful wil stay again next time in vegas

Reviews.Title: “Great trip ruined by credit fraud”
Reviews.Author: slyemm
Reviews.Content: I had the most delightful stay at the Desert Rose Resort at the end of September. A lovely, spacious, clean, comfortable hotel, a short walk from the strip. Could not fault it. After I left, my credit card had to be cancelled due to fraudulent use that has been tracked back to the Desert Rose. The management have been less than helpful in resolving this issue and I am extremely unhappy with the current status quo. I would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great little place”
Reviews.Author: Craigy1059
Reviews.Content: For our second trip to Vegas we decided to go self catering rather than room only and so we booked the Desert Rose it was the best decision ever.Convieniently located close to the strip,this is a fantastic little place,and the staff are so friendly.Nothing is too much trouble and with the complimentary breakfasts and evening drinks it is really perfect.The rooms are more than well equipped and very spacious and the maid service is second to non.All in all we had a brilliant stay here and we definitely come back again and would not hesitate to recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “All round excellence”
Reviews.Author: margsalady
Reviews.Content: I stayed 1 week in 1 bedroom suite which was very well equipped. Breakfast served every morning in room, great healthy choices at a time to suit me. All members of staff very helpful. Swimming pool and area were a delight, clean, lots of fresh towels, great bbq area and fitness centre. Managers reception Monday to Thursday evenings gave a great opportunity to meet others. Security was excellent. I would certainly recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “This is the only place we will stay from hereon when in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: ToonTownTraveller61
Reviews.Content: We have been to Las Vegas a number of times. We've stayed in Balley's, The Flamingo, and the MGM Signature Suites. Overall, none can compare to this resort! Unless your top priority is brand new carpet and plasma TV's, look no further than the Desert Inn! The rooms were clean (and trust me, we checked after hearing about all the nasty insect infestations out in the east, such as New York city). Sure the carpets are older and the TV's are older, but that we absolutely the last concern we had! The bed was super comfy with plenty of bedding and enough pillows for six people, let alone just the two of us! The room had a coffee maker (unheard of in the hotels), a full kitchen, a dinette, mounted wall safe, super comfy couch, fantastic balcony (again unheard of in most hotels), great bathroom area (shower pressure was great!) and a TV in the living room area and one in the bedroom. The cleaning staff were excellent, and we loved the front desk group. We didn't like our initial room, and since we were there for 11 days, we wanted a pool view room. We only had to wait a day, and they were able to accomodate us. The pool by the way was great. Very clean, and warm. The only downside was that there could be more lounge chairs (and there were two that were not in great shape. The location of this resort is fantastic! It's right behind the Hooter's Hotel (and we heard NO noise from there) but the bonus was that the Hooter's security guards rode around on their bikes all day and night, so we felt 100% walking to and from the Strip. Also, the Strip is maybe a 10 minute walk from the resort (and if you cross the street, and there are walk lights, you can be inside the MGM in probably less than 10 minutes). We'd like to thank everyone on Trip Advisor who recommended this resort! We are more than pleased and will stay again! We did take advantage the continental breakfast, but were always away during the wine and beer complimentary get together! We'll have to come back soon and check that out! We cannot say enough good things about this resort! Hopefully our return visits in the future, to the Desert Rose, will be our thank you to the resort and their staff!

Reviews.Title: “just perfect!”
Reviews.Author: arte2k2
Reviews.Content: I've been at the desert rose twice this year, and this time I stayed at the Venetian first, but couldn't wait to transfer to this smaller hotel, in which I don't get lost, I'm recognized by the staff, and I feel like home. and no more lines like at the airport...who cares about big hotels? no, thank you, The desert rose resort is just perfect if you want some relax and good service! everybody is nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Credit Card Info Stolen at Desert Rose”
Reviews.Author: CricketInMalibu
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Desert Rose with a group of friends. The rooms are apartment size with fully equipped kitchens. The hotel is quiet but walking distance of The Strip. The apartments are clean and comfortable. Unfortunately, when I arrived home, I discovered that my credit card had been compromised at the Desert Rose. I had to cancel my card. When I called to notify the manager, he sent me a form letter stating that he had been aware of credit card thefts at the Desert Rose and that these thefts had been happening since June, 2010. If you choose to stay at the Desert Rose, have your bank create a travel credit card that you cancel as soon as you have paid for your stay. Never ever let your credit card leave your sight even for a moment. Cricket

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: NZkeewee
Reviews.Content: After reading comments on Trip Advisor we decided to book at the Desert Rose and were not disppointed. Our suite was roomy, the kitchen had everything you could think of with a huge full sized fridge and stove, and large microwave. The bed was extremely comfortable and the bathroom of a good size. Parking free, easy to access and in front of the hotel. We found it was only around a 10 min flat walk to the strip. Vons supermarket with plenty of parking is about a 5-10 min drive away and there is a Del Taco right beside. We didn't take advantage of the included breakfast as it finished to early for us at 9am. When you work all year the last thing you want to do is get up early, shower and get ready to go to breakfast when on holiday! It would be great if the time was extended to say 10.30am as in several other places we have stayed. Our only complaint really is there were 3 of us staying - myself, husband and adult daughter and they always only left 2 sets of clean towels each day. We had to ring every day to get another set of towels. I would have thought the housekeepers would have a note of how many guests are staying in each suite. The suite was very quiet apart from a loud humming in the bedroom wall which we think may have been the air con thru out the building as it would come and go. I noted with interest other guests comments about their credit cards being used fraudulently while staying at around the same time we were there. Our stay was prepaid but our card was swiped by the hotel. We had 10000.00 Yuan charged on our card a few days later and had never used our credit card at all in the USA, nor bought anything overseas so don't know where our card was 'hacked' as it didn't leave our possession or sight. I am now wondering if it also happened at the Desert Rose. Otherwise we would completely stay here again and it is ideal for a family with all the room and facilities and closeness to the strip. We will be recommending the Desert Rose to others.

Reviews.Title: “Credit Card fraud ruined our trip”
Reviews.Author: cln0103
Reviews.Content: My credit card information was stolen at this resort. I've reported it to them and they have acknowledged that they knew about security issues from July-Oct (present). I found it disappointing that this occurred over such a long period of time with nothing done on their end.

Reviews.Title: “Check you credit card if you stayed in September”
Reviews.Author: lpinder
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a group of friends at the Desert Rose and really enjoyed the peaceful rooms, the tasty continental breakfast, the proximity to the Strip and the helpful staff. Unfortunately, according to an email from the hotel manager, some of the staff were too helpful. Of the 14 of us who stayed at the Desert Rose, 11 of us have had to cancel our cards due to fraudulent charges. If you do stay there for the pleasant amenities, be sure to keep a careful eye on your account when you return home.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed bag...”
Reviews.Author: mootz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Desert Rose Resort at the beginning and end of our long trip through the Southwest and this decision was based on reviews in TA. The initial stay was wonderful; we loved that that strip was a five minute walk away, parking was right in front of our building and our one bedroom suite was terrific; clean, bright and sunny and a king size bed to die for. It's incredibly quiet, considering you're located behind the Tropicana and next to Hooters. The staff is wonderful, free breakfast is ok...a little heavy in the bread area, but what the heck, it's free. We only made it to happy hour once, which wasn't much of a big deal for us. The real issue came on our return trip. At this point we had stayed in five different hotels in that many cities, and were happy to be back at the Desert Rose - our favorite of all. Upon arrival to our room (we were in a different building than the first visit), I immediately noticed the carpet looked filthy and worn. As we walked through the suite, the sofa was also very heavily worn, frayed and appeared to be quite dirty. Needless to say, we were quite surprised, and disappointed, considering what our original suite was like. Since we were so exhausted, and didn't want to move again, we decided to just deal with it. We knew we wouldn't be spending much time in the room, and aside from the carpet, the bed appeared to be fine. At the time of our check out I explained to the front desk staff how disappointing the room was, and had this been our initial visit, would have requested a different room immediately, or looked for a change in hotel. The clerk did state they are upgrading all the rooms, however buiding 4 has not been done yet. So, my advice, ask if all buildings have been upgraded. All along our trip I made a point of letting everyone know how wonderful the Desert Rose was, and only hope that no one ever sees a room there they way we saw it.

Reviews.Title: “Walking distance to the strip but at a quiet location”
Reviews.Author: PatrickP1709
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff and 24h reception. Hotel is very quiet and away from noise of the strip. The rooms are roomy and clean. Rooms get serviced every day. There is free wi-fi and free continental breakfast each day. There is also happy hour each night where you get free drinks and nibbles. It takes about 10 mins to walk to the strip and once on the strip, you are near where all the action is. You can jump on a bus if you want to go to the top of the strip or to the factory outlets for some bargain shopping. There is a pool and spa at the hotel. There are no poker machines on-site either. Most of the clients onsite were elderly and couples with kids. Clubs, restaurants, bars and casinos are walking distance away from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Another victim of the credit card scam”
Reviews.Author: vgshea
Reviews.Content: I was one of a group of 13 women friends who spent a long weekend together at the Desert Rose Resort. We had a wonderful time in Vegas and really appreciated the Desert Rose's clean, spacious rooms, helpful and friendly staff, free breakfast, and proximity to the Strip. Unfortunately, within a week after our stay, members of our group started getting reports of fraudulent activity on their credit cards, and the one thing all the cards had in common was that they were used for the deposit at the Desert Rose. At this point, half of our group (myself included) have had cancel our credit cards, with all the attendant hassle. The hotel has been notified, and we were told that they were aware of a "security breach" happening sometime between June and September. In a form e-mail sent to several of our members, the manager apologized for "any inconvenience we may have experienced" (surely the lamest faux-apology cliche imaginable). If it weren't for the credit card problem, I would highly recommend the Desert Rose; but without some assurance that the problem's been resolved, I can't do that. Too bad, because it's a pretty nice place and the prices are excellent. If you decide to stay there anyway, keep a close eye on your credit card bills when you get home.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the spaciousness”
Reviews.Author: philby19
Reviews.Content: Desert Rose Inn is not your typical loud, glitzy Las Vegas hotel, with hundreds of rooms, thousands of slot machines and smokers everywhere.. If you want this, you should go and stay on the strip, where there are plenty of super sized hotels. We booked this hotel for 3 nights, based on Trip Advisor reviews, It suited our family of three (mum, dad and 12yr old son) perfectly. Parking, check in and check out were all a breeze. We were impressed with the quality and layout of our double queen. The separate lounge/tv room, and kitchen was just great after staying in motels for a couple of weeks. It was an easy walk to the corner of MGM Grand and New York New York on the strip yet far enough away to have quiet place to wind down. We were also able to catch the monorail from MGM Grand to stop points along The Strip. Having a free breakfast in the morning was an added bonus - considering the full kitchen in our room was also there when needed. I was pleasantly surprised how quiet the room was considering how close we were to the airport. Of all the hotels/motels we stayed in during our 4 week trip this was definitely one of the best.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny, and do not have to spend many to stay there.”
Reviews.Author: wakiwan
Reviews.Content: Clean, well appointed, good amenities, very helpful stall, located within walking distance of the MGM, NY NY, Disney, just to name a few of the closest places. Good breakfast with lots of time to eat, nice happy hour but did not use it much since walking on the strip or enjoying the endless things to do in Vegas....would recommend it to all....

Reviews.Title: “location debatable , nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: vinzdagama
Reviews.Content: We chose this place wanting not to stay on the strip and so ironically the cribs that I have is exactly relating to the location. Vegas is gigantic in scale and so walking to the strip and then walking across the strip is a pain task. So I would say that there are distinct merits on staying on the strip which this place does not offer. Other wise if a quicker check in , lesser crowds , and some quiet is what you are looking for, then this is a good option. since we went in december, we never used the pool but it id not appear as exotic as some of the pool scapes of other larger places. Breakfast was bit of a mayhem as everyone scrambled to ensure that they load up for most part of the day.Not sure whether to blame the hotel or patrons for creating a fairly annoying experience in the morning. Rooms are neat, spacious as a studio and have good amneties.Beds are comfortable and the bathrooms are spacious and neat. Lady at the tourist desk was a big help and would defnitely consider as a big boon for tourists as you mull varioius choices of shows, canyon trips etal So overall go for it, if you dont fancy staying on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet respite from the Strip”
Reviews.Author: AndysGranny
Reviews.Content: I had read the reviews on Trip Advisor before I booked this lodging, and I have to say that the room did not live up to expectations. The condo was spacious and it was nice to have all that space (a separate bedroom and living room), and we were very comfortable there. But the decor of the room was dated and the lobby was tired-looking. The continental breakfast was barely adequate, and the cocktail reception was only Monday through Thursday. The kitchen was nicely stocked with appliances and dishes, etc. but if you don't have a car, there is nowhere nearby where you can buy groceries, except for the small (and expensive) snack store in the hotel. The computer provided for the use of guests was extremely slow. People ahead of me in line gave up in frustration at not being able to accomplish their tasks. When I finally got to the computer, it took 40 minutes to be able to print out my boarding pass for the flight home , while the concierge sat a few feet away and did not offer to help. Other reviews have described the distance from the hotel to the Strip as a block and a half, but It is really more like the distance of three blocks - a big difference in the hot Vegas sun. I think this would be a good choice of hotel for someone who had a car, but for myself, I would probably choose one of the hotels on the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great room, Great value!”
Reviews.Author: allforoneoneforall
Reviews.Content: In celebrating our teen's birthday, we wanted to be close enough to the strip, but not ON the strip--Desert Rose is a great location for just that! You're a couple of clocks away, an easy walk, yet you have the benefit of a condo with a living room, kitchen and dining area--a far cry from a shoe box hotel room!!! They provide a complimentary breakfast and every staff person we encountered was friendly and eager to help. The only downside was the pool...clean but not the ambiance for a teen, who was the youngest by at least 40 years! Maybe it was the weekend of the geriatric convention? Other than that, great value, great location!

Reviews.Title: “Great Base”
Reviews.Author: RHukUk
Reviews.Content: Desert Rose was perfectly positioned away from the Hustle bustle, but was within walking distance of the strip. The staff were friendly and helpful and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: cef46580
Reviews.Content: We had a quick and easy check in. Our room was nice, clean and comfortable. The sound proofing could be a little bit better. People walking down the hallways talking could be easily heard in our room and our room was facing the street and the airport so we had some car and plane noise but not too bad. While there I used the treadmills and everything was clean and functunal. All the staff was friendly and genuinely helpful. The breakfast was ok but not great. Location wise it is at the south end and off strip, so it is quite a walk to get down to the center of the strip, but right next to the monorail at the MGM. Check out was quick. To sum it up we enjoyed or stay and will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we were looking for!!!”
Reviews.Author: lvando
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently traveled to Vegas to meet up with my father for a weekend of fun.. We got an excellent deal on a 2 bed/2 bath room with kitchenette and deck... Near the pool and breakfast area! It was extremely clean and we were totally happy with it! No strip noise, but close enough to drive to most strip hotels within 5 to 10 minutes. The front desk staff was surprisingly helpful in getting me maps I needed, and we were able to drive to Trader Joe's to load up the kitchen for our stay. The only thing that could be improved is the breakfast, but it was adequate. I was so happy with our stay and the price, I am thinking about staying at the Anaheim location for our upcoming trip to Disney. As a side-note, over 15 friends and family stayed at the number 3 spot on Tripadvisor, and though their views were better, that was it.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant place to stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: YoungWanderers
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an absolute gem. Rooms are huge, with separate living/dining area & kitchen. Kitchen has everything you could want, including American sized fridge and dishwasher. Spotlessly clean and very comfortable. Location is just off the strip (next to Hooters casino, near MGM & New York New York). It has a nice quiet pool area, and there's a pc in reception so you can use the internet if need be. No restaurant or bar on site but breakfast is included and gives plenty of options. Hotel also offers unlimited free wine,beer & snacks from 5-7 every day, no ulterior motive other than keeping guests happy - we couldn't believe our luck! Absolute bargain, and a great escape if you don't want to battle your way through a casino every time you leave your hotel room!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of credit card fraud!!”
Reviews.Author: jaanja
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the desert rose three times now & it was third time unlucky. We had our credit card ripped off to the tune of $4200.00 and the ONLY place I produced my credit card was the desert rose, not even for payment as we had prepaid the accomodation, this was a "security" swipe-what a joke! We have always enjoyed staying here but the place is now starting to show its age and looking a bit tired it could do with a lick of paint and fresh carpets. We would think twice about recommending this to anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: rom1048
Reviews.Content: We were driving back to L.A. from Utah so we decided to spend the night in Vegas. People at the front desk were very nice and attentive. We booked a two bedroom suite but somehow ended up with two one bedroom suites. The place itself is nice and family oriented. The condo was big and roomy with a balcony. The breakfast could have been a little bit better but overall it was ok. I would defenetely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The staff was very accomodating”
Reviews.Author: Linda98765
Reviews.Content: We were traveling with at baby and arrived in Las Vegas 4 1/2 hours before normal check in time. The front desk checked us in right away. The room was great, 2 bedrooms, 2 baths. The kitchen was well stocked. The free breakfast was another bonus. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “A great alternative to the overwhelming big hotels”
Reviews.Author: dsjdp
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at the Desert Rose Resort, Las Vegas for our last two nights of vacation following our driving trip through Nevada and Utah. We've been to Vegas many, many times and always stayed at one of the big hotels. But the Desert Rose Resort was a peaceful and refreshing change of not having to always cut through a casino and all the hubub to get in and out of big hotel. The one bedroom suite was spacious, clean and we were very impressed. Two TVs, lots of bed pillows and a full kitchen stocked with dishes and pots and utensils. We felt like we wanted to stay a whole week. We didn't use the pool so no comments on that. And it's not far off the strip.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant small resort”
Reviews.Author: jvdh44
Reviews.Content: Great location, friendly & helpful staff. Clean, comfortable and quiet one-bedroom suite with free WIFI. Walking distance from Strip. A pleasant small resort with a price that is great for the location. Had free filling daily breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Comfort stay!”
Reviews.Author: mau18
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had been visiting the wonderful National Parks in Arizona and Utah and planned to end our trip in Las Vegas. We are members of Disney Vacation Club and were able to reserve three nights at the Desert Rose Resort, a Shell Vacation Club facility. We were very pleased with everything about the resort. It is located just two blocks down Tropicana Blvd, so very close to Las Vegas Blvd between MGM Grand and the Tropicana. We had a car, so only walked once, as far as the Paris and the Belagio, which was very easy. For the further hotels and at night we used our car since the valet system at all the hotels is excellent. We have stayed at time shares in other parts of the country and the extras at the Desert Rose were exceptional. Never have we been offered breakfast, nighttime drinks and snacks, daily housekeeping and the excellent free wireless computer connection that was part of this stay. The resort is kept immaculate, the staff is always friendly and pleasant. We were never asked to attend a time share program as is usual at other resorts we've stayed at. After staying at National Park lodges, roadside motels and cabins the Desert Rose Resort was a real pleasure. Hard to find fault with a well equipped kitchen, a huge bedroom with a most comfy bed, large living and dining room with a balcony that is so close to all the fun in Las Vegas. It will be on our list of favorite places from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Whining air conditioner and peeling paint with a scary walk to the strip.”
Reviews.Author: SeahorseSecrets
Reviews.Content: We stopped at this hotel based on trip advisor ratings. Yes, I agree, very clean. However, the walk to the strip is through parking lots with little light and coming back very late we were intimidated. The smell was horrendous in a gated area on the north side of the hotel. The night was sleepless due to warm temps and an air conditioner that whined through the night. The welcome message left on our blinking phone was nice but, we could not stop the phone from blinking all night after we had listened to it twice and tried to remove it several times to no avail. Finally, the paint is peeling in the bathroom, clean as it was, makes it look run down. I told the desk clerk upon checkout about the annoyances and he apologized with a smile and said nothing else so we left and do not plan to stay there in December as planned for NFR.

Reviews.Title: “We were extremely happy with everything at Desert Rose!”
Reviews.Author: mbromley29
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised with everything at Desert Rose, we particularly thought the staff were very friendly and helpful. Although breakfast was a little like school dinners we thought the choice and quality of the food was excellent. The happy hour was a lovely touch and a lovely gesture.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate, but not really that bad”
Reviews.Author: TorontoEhTraveler
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel because it's proximity to the Strip (less than 5 min), close to MGM Grand, Hooter and Excalibur/NewYork area. Building is really old, need big renovation. My room was near the road, but quiet enough. Like the way that it had 2 rooms and separate living room, plus kitchen (all stuff are there, like plates and glass are there). For sleeping only, this is a good place. Otherwise, rather stay at one of Strip hotels, by spending a bit more.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Hazzie23
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 5 with 3 children aged 12,10,8. The Desert Rose was the bset place we stayed during our 3 week stay in th U.S.A. It was self contained but offered a complimentary breakfast every morning and was a great sized apartment for us. It was off the strip but only minutes from some of the big casinos and we mostly walked to the strip. Staff were friendly and always offered advice so we would definately stay there again and would recomend to others

Reviews.Title: “The Desert Rose Resort is truly accommodating.”
Reviews.Author: voiceman46
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Desert Rose Resort, in September of this year, was the first since they upgraded and renovated the facility. During our previous stays, we were always pleased, and in fact I had convinced my former high school classmates to gather there as a central location for our re-union. Everyone was very happy with the location, and the accommodations. On this recent trip, we traveled with relatives, who were quite surprised and pleased with the friendliness of the staff, and the condition of our condo. All amenities were provided in the condo, and the only thing we had to purchase was our personal choice in food. As always, the grounds were maintained in an immaculate condition. The fact we were not subjected to the harsh, smoke filled environment of the hotel air- conditioning systems, was definitely a plus. My wife and I plan on future trips to Las Vegas, and I definitely recommend others take advantage of the services offered at the Desert Rose. Sincerely, James H. Murphy, Jr.

Reviews.Title: “My parents stayed at the resort when they...”
Reviews.Author: Toezi
Reviews.Content: My parents stayed at the resort when they got married in Vegas two and a half years ago... I knew straight away it was the place to stay when I eventually made it to Vegas myself. As I travelled with my friend we wanted room to move around and not be under each others feet, as we would in a conventional hotel. Don't get me wrong-all the hotels in Vegas look amazing but you literally have a room. We had a full condo and a balcony. The pool is ample and served it's purpose in cooling us down in the 105 degree heat we had. All the staff were friendly and always helpful-no complaints there at all. The room was cleaned every day. The breakfast wasn't as spectacular as it was when my parents stayed (smoked salmon etc) but it was a lovely option as no other place offers a breakfast. I will be going back and will be staying at the Desert Rose again. I had such a fabulous time in Vegas and would recommend this resort to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT, WOULD STAY THERE AGAIN.”
Reviews.Author: kaz023
Reviews.Content: Use the buses, it really helps with aching feet as there is so much to see. The hotel and staff were great and the breakfast was a bonus,couldnt fault it.

Reviews.Title: “lived up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: lawees
Reviews.Content: this hotel was great a real find it had a kitchen with everything you wanted laundry facility pool that was quiet and complimentary breakfast .still close to strip to walk . a real wee hide away, the only thing to look out for is breakfast it is a real cattle market so get there early.there was even somewere to b b cue next to pool

Reviews.Title: “Desert Rose Las Vegas - you would love it!”
Reviews.Author: slatkovski
Reviews.Content: We were very glad we learned about Desert Rose. My sisters (there are 6 of us) take a vacation to a new city every year. At Desert Rose we found a great location (10 minute walk off the strip; we rented a car for convenience) , accommodations that suited all six of us in a 2 BR suite with living room, dining area and kitchen. The staff was to a person friendly, competent and caring. Any little thing we needed was attended to right away. We enjoyed the manager's cocktail hour on Thursday evening where we met Gloria who was so warm and attentive. She must work there 24/7 because also saw her first thing in the morning at breakfast and every day after. She let me speak to her in Spanish and one of my sisters who is learning understood all of what Gloria said. She is a gem. Dixie Dawn is such a good concierge. She gave us practical and money saving advice. She is well informed, funny and deserving of the promotion we understand she has just gotten. You have six very happy clients and some of us are very vocal, so consider us the best word of mouth that you can not pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, calm place”
Reviews.Author: AARC
Reviews.Content: It definitely isn't a casino hotel, but it's managed very well. We were treated fantastically, and we loved the 1 bedroom suites. Everything you need is in the room, and the bed was too perfect. We wished we could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding value & good location”
Reviews.Author: faringtonmum
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights while touring the American West. Have previously stayed at Luxor & MGM so thought we would stay just off the strip to keep down costs. What a gem, a suite with all mod cons where we could relax and rest our feet after walking the strip. The other hotels didn't have any amenities in the room,not even coffee making machines so this was a treat . Our stay was between Monday and Thursday so we took advantage of the free beer and wine available 5pm to 7pm (another plus!) Coffee and tea also available 24 hrs in reception Definitely recommend and value for money

Reviews.Title: “This is where you should stay”
Reviews.Author: nettermo
Reviews.Content: We booked a room here because of the reviews on TripAdvisor and we weren't disappointed. For the price, you can't beat the accommodations. Front desk personnel were super-friendly and helpful. Every employee we met in the hallway smiled and greeted us warmly throughout our entire stay. We stayed in 1-bedroom condo, not huge, but plenty of room to stretch out for hubby and me, full kitchen, in-wall safe, all standard amenities, lovely large continental breakfast each morning which we took back to our room to eat. Bed was plenty comfy, although they did have those silly little 3/4 pillows which aren't long enough to hug at night. The one bad thing in the area of cleanliness, the carpet in our unit was very dirty, even got our white socks dirty walking on it...long overdue for a shampooing. I told the front desk when we left and they guy was more than apologetic and said they'd attend to it right away. However, that on its own was not enough to overshadow the good things about Desert Rose. Couple little personal piddly things...we couldn't get cell reception in our room, probably due to all the stucco and we were located at the inner corridor, but we could get a couple of bars on the phone if we stepped out on our patio. Free wi-fi is a must for us, which they had, but morning connection was sporadic, guess there were too many people trying to access it. The location was great for us, we had a rental car but only used it to go buy groceries. Of course, on the Vegas strip you're going to walk and walk no matter where you are. But the MGM monorail station was nearby (in Vegas terms), maybe a 3-4 block walk, so that was convenient. It was a quiet location, which we loved, and we never felt unsafe in the area even walking late at night. We did the pre-pay option on their website, which made the room quite inexpensive, especially for the Las Vegas strip. It will be our first choice for accommodations when we return.

Reviews.Title: “A great ittle hotel hidden amongst huge gambling monsters”
Reviews.Author: robles1
Reviews.Content: A great location next to Hooters and within 600mts of Luxor, MGM, Mandalay Bay etc. Low rise, non-gambling, quiet hotel with great great service and facilities. Managers food and wine/beer an added bonus. Really enjoyed the stay. Can recomment the prime rib dinner in Hooters. next door, at $9.95!!!!! Will certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home!”
Reviews.Author: anth2107
Reviews.Content: I loved this place! The staff were all really friendly and happy to help, the pool was a good size, the jacuzzi was awesome and I particulary enjoyed using the BBQs. The breakfasts were decent and the 2 hour managers reception of free drink was definitely a plus, and the snacks available werent too bad either, we had chicken nuggets and carrots sticks and tacos etc.. Short walk to hooters hotel and casino and then cross the road and your either in mgm grand or on the strip, we loved it. It was like a home from home with the overall relaxed atmosphere of the hotel an then the rooms were spot on! couldnt have asked for more! Awesome holiday, awesome place to stay, definitely worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay again- but carpets starting to look tired and requiring cleaning”
Reviews.Author: DarkBlueDundee
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 13 day stay at the Desert Rose, still the best value for your dollar in Las Vegas. The service again was first class, but the rooms are starting to look as if they need of a lick of paint and a heavy clean on the carpets. I would go back again as I like the suites and the comfort of their beds. By the way congratulations to Lainey1971 on your wedding. I spoke to you one morning at breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to experience Las Vegas without a casino hotel environment”
Reviews.Author: 97bs
Reviews.Content: Good in all respects: comfortable beds, nice suite, pool are not too crowded, pleasant staff. About ten minutes walk to MGM, under half an hour to the centre of the strip (what's wrong with walking?). Our only criticism was the very high cost of a couple of short telephone calls to Europe (tariff not specified in the room). Next time we'll use our expensive but much less expensive cellphones..

Reviews.Title: “Desert oasis”
Reviews.Author: nysingle
Reviews.Content: The short of it: great rooms at a great price, good location The Desert Rose is a suite-styled hotel. The rooms look new, the beds are great, there is a full kitchen and a balcony. The hotel also has free wifi, a nice pool, and a freebie continental breakfast (good, but nothing to write home about except for the coffee). The value is excellent (for around 70 usd/night). They also do an evening reception with free wine and beer. The location is good, it's on the south end of the strip, about a block east., very close to the airport, I-15, and the outlet mall. However, there is really nothing within walking distance except for the Hooters hotel (even though MGM, Excalibur, etc. look close on a map, it's a long walk). There are gas stations nearby (the arco on reno / las vegas seems to be the cheapest) and supermarkets too (the hotel has a small convenience store). Expect to spend $ on cabs/car unless you like to walk a lot. The staff was very helpful, there's a concierge with limited hours. The hotel is not a big casino, so don't expect nightclubs, restaurants, gambling here. Imho, it's a nice respite from the Vegas madness.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Lainey1971
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 10 night stay at the Desert Rose. We had a 2 bedroom suite on the third floor of building 3 and it was perfect, great views of the Luxor and Mandalay Bay from balcony. The beds were super comfy, best sleep I've ever had! Rooms were clean and well maintained. It took about 10 minutes to walk to The Tropicana or MGM so not too far out. We used the deuce bus to get around, $7 each for 24hours travel, great value. All in all a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “a rose in the desert”
Reviews.Author: true_blue_aussie2010
Reviews.Content: stayed here 3 nights in 2 bedroom suite. my partner and i were staying with our mum/dad and we figured we could save some money this way. we asked the front desk for a quieter area of the resort and she happily obliged. Room was really nice, it was no Bellagio but we were really happy it was modern, had two separate bathrooms. The large fridge was very welcomed. A previous review mentioned pigeons etc. yes there were some around but it seems the resort has put up wiring to try and keep them off the balconies - they weren't an issue. I am not a fan of housecleaning and put up 'do not disturb' signs so cant comment on that. The smallish pool wasn't too overcrowded or noisy, many 30+ people there and a couple of kids. Spa/whirlpool was small but hot and not many people in it. Continental breakfast was average. I was happy sticking to the toast and fruit loops each day, you wouldn't 'feast up' there. During the week (mon - thurs) they had complimentary beer/soda which was great to bring into the pool and relax. sleep was fantastic, beds were very clean and fresh/well made and pillows were highend pillows. Some mornings at say ?7am? you could hear a noisy truck with reverse beepers but I guess we should have been up to maximise our days anyway. There was a slight smell outside around the Hooters/Desert Rose front street. You couldn't smell this at the pool or inside the resort, it was not a dealbreaker. I would estimate a 10min walk to the strip, but considering the strips size it would be maybe 30min walk to where all the happening stuff is (Bellagio fountains). Alternatively you could just pop over to MGM next door which is the last stop for the monorail and pay $12 for a 24hr pass. I would recommend this place to people wanting to escape the noise and save a bit of money esp. for larger groups such as ours (2 couples). Check-in was quick (1 person in queue). Given the amount of walking required this is not the place to stay if you want to do multiple trips to the strip in a day. It is great if you want to go out once and come back once in a day. I would definitely come back here again if was trying to save money with my friends, but if i wanted a glitzy, easy accessible, high end place for a romantic get away and was prepared to pay 50% more I would stay at Paris. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “The Desert Rose is a GREAT place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: rycky1026
Reviews.Content: This is a quiet resort just far enough off the Strip to be relaxing but close enough to walk to the casinos, monorail or bus lines. They take great care of their guests. We've been there twice and will likely stay there again on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous”
Reviews.Author: jaffakelv
Reviews.Content: We've recently returned from 9 nights at the Desert Rose resort and I can't praise the place highly enough - from check-in to check-out it was nothing short of superb. I can't believe that anyone could moan about the supposed "long walk to the strip" - it isn't. Hooters is about two minutes away and the longest part of the walk to MGM is waiting for the pedestrian lights to go green to cross the road!! It is a true oasis in the wonderful mania of Vegas and I wouldn't change a thing. We're coming back to Vegas in January 2012 for two weeks and I've a good idea where we'll be staying........!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great off strip accomodation, clean, comfortable and great staff”
Reviews.Author: sasksunseeker56
Reviews.Content: This resort is just a short walk (4 regular blocks) to the strip. It is easy to catch a bus to get to a Von's supermarket, or catch the bus on the strip. The pool is big enough and there is a nice area to have a BBQ and large grills to use. It is very easy to get around the complex (Only 3 floors high) and we love having a balcony and full kitchen. If you are driving there is more than enough room to park. The staff are very helpful and friendly. The continental breakfast has more than the usual offerings and the managers receptions are a nice added touch. This is our second visit to the Desert Rose and we will be going back again, and recommending it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Best place for families to stay”
Reviews.Author: cflower101
Reviews.Content: We loved this place! It was so comfortable and clean and had absolutely everything we needed. The internet connection was a little on the slow side, but I wasn't there to do work anyway so it was perfect for checking email, etc. The continental breakfast was enough for us every day and the happy hour w/ wine & beer was a real bonus. The staff couldn't have been nicer at Desert Rose too. We had a two bedroom suite for 4 adults and one two year-old and there was more than enough room for all of us. The kitchen was fully stocked. Although we didn't do any real cooking there, it was still nice to have it available if we wanted to. The kitchen was very useful for storing our snacks and drinks. The pool was small, but perfect for our needs. Whenever we go to Vegas, this is going to be our spot to stay. It's close enough to everything yet quiet enough because there is no casino and no smoking in the rooms which is perfect for families. I didn't even gamble one penny on this trip and didn't miss the casinos!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: aaj6
Reviews.Content: The Desert Rose exceeded our expectations. Check in was professional, courteous and well organised. Our room was lovely. As a neat freak I always check the order & cleanliness of a room & I was thoroughly impressed, but not surprised after meeting the housekeeping staff who were so prompt every morning. I was also very excited about the kitchen. Everything was new & all crockery/cutlery was attractive & in mint condition. We had a nice balcony with chairs and table that overlooked the gardens. The pool & spa were my kids favourite retreat. I didn't use the gym, but I took a peep & it was in excellent condition with very good equipment. The kitchen staff who were so warm & generous always put on a good spread for breakfast and afternoon drink and nibbles. Drinks consisted of wine, beer & soft drinks (as much as you want) and nibbles were tacos, chicken nuggets, vegetable sticks with dips etc. It was very impressive how much effort the staff put into pleasing the guests. We loved Gloria & Sean from the kitchen, their service was immaculate. We cant fault the desert rose, it was a nice haven away from the busy strip, but not too far when you wanted to visit. It took us 5 minutes to walk to the MGM and maybe another 10 minutes to walk through the MGM to get to the strip. It was ideal for us!

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas Best of both worlds”
Reviews.Author: DillonII
Reviews.Content: Our 2nd stay at the Desert Rose. Far enough away from the strip to be as peaceful as you can in Vegas. Close enough to walk to the various casinos. Behind Hooters and Tropicana. Close to Excalibur and NYNY. Get yourself a deuce ticket and you can roam Vegas all day and all night. Nice pool to relax in and a continental breakfast if you want that kind of thing, we preferred the buffets. Had family in town the suite was great as a kicking off point for the 6 of us.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful retreat away from the brash lights and mahem of The Strip!!”
Reviews.Author: Alinicho
Reviews.Content: Tucked away in a corner, quietly unassuming and yet offering everything you could possibly want from a hotel. It was our first trip to Las vegas travelling with 2 boys 11 and 8 on route to The Grand canyon. The Desert Rose was everything the reviews say. The staff were very helpful especially Dixie on consierge duty. The rooms were fabulous. Large and clean and offering a full kitchen with oven fridge etc Having a separate sleeping area for the boys was a luxury having shared a bedroom with them for most of our trip!!! Great buffet breakfast and lovely pool that you can actually leave and find your children by! This hotel is so close to the strip you could actually throw a stone to it! BUT YOU CAN ESCAPE it if you want to by staying here!!! We had a great first night and did the whole MGM, Ballagio fountains, Caesors palace etc but I am quite proud to say that our second night we stopped in and cooked our tea and rented a film in our room!!!!! Thank you Desert Rose you certainly did offer that oasis!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Resort”
Reviews.Author: DrDawn2000
Reviews.Content: The Desert Rose Resort in Las Vegas is lovely. The staff is very accomodating, the breakfast is extensive and tastey, and it is a very low stress place. Parking is free and right outside the rooms. It was so nice to be in a low-key place especially with the Las Vegas strip only a block or so away. I would stay there again and have recommended it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms, but that's about it”
Reviews.Author: tokyotony
Reviews.Content: After reading a variety of good reviews about Desert Rose, I have to say that I was quite disappointed with the quality of the rooms and the hotel staff overall—although there were some staff who were helpful, others were more into giving lip-service. Here are some of the highlights/lowlights in no particular order (for some perspective, we stayed in two-bedroom suite for 3 days): • If you are not driving to the hotel or renting a car, you can take a taxi from the airport to the hotel in about 10-15 minutes. It costs about $15 + tip. However, our taxi driver didn’t know the place by name, so you can tell them it is near the Hooters Hotel and give them the address and they should be able to find it. • The lobby and check-in area are quite spacious and nice to park yourself for a while if you get there a bit early before your check-in time. • Staff offered to check us in early once the room opened up, which was nice since we got there at about 11AM (the only flight we could take to Las Vegas directly from Cincinnati.) • Continental breakfast was included, but I found it a bit lacking knowing that I could get a full buffet breakfast at other hotels—even if I had to pay. • The facilities seemed a bit old and tired overall (my son often made fun of the squeaking elevator doors). • While the number of people staying at the hotel, I found the pool small and crowded and the water rather dirty (you can’t see very far underwater even with goggles on). • Rooms were spacious but were a bit noisy with a constant irritating hum of the air conditioner. • Speaking of which, the air conditioners to the bedrooms were a bit weak but the main living room was okay. • The TVs were old and still “standard” and not widescreen or even HD. The channel selection was good, though, including Nickelodeon and Cartoon Network for those with kids. • Internet connection to our iPod Touches and iPhone was slow and unreliable. We had to manually reconnect any time we turned our devices on from sleep. • Not very convenient if you want to walk to a local store to buy groceries, especially if you don’t have a car. • Not a good location if you just want to set out to have a quick drink or bit to eat. You’ll need to walk a bit to one of the hotels. Being that the resort is supposed to be more of a “residence”, I would say this is probably not high on the list of someone staying at this resort, but something to keep in mind nonetheless. • On one day, when we came back to our room at 2:30 in the afternoon noon, housekeeping still was not there to make up our rooms. When I called housekeeping, I was told that rooms are cleaned “randomly” and that I had best schedule a time. I found this quite odd. • When I gave my feedback on the above areas that needed improvements to the staff checking me out, all I was told was that they would relay the comments to the manager. I’ve yet to hear from him or her! Overall, I would give Desert Rose a miss unless your priority is space (as long as the air conditioner has been well-oiled!) and you need nothing much else, especially if you don’t have a car where you can go out and pick up some food and drinks for your family. If you are coming with kids and need a want to be in walking distance of restaurants or a few drinks, then best to go to one of the more popular hotels on the main strip. You’ll enjoy yourself a lot more with the convenience and just have to sacrifice a bit of space.

Reviews.Title: “The best”
Reviews.Author: Adelard1
Reviews.Content: This was exactly what we expected and much more. The room was clean, large and well equipped with everything needed to be comfortable and prepare any meals. The breakfast was great and the staff was friendly and helpful always. The location is a bit of a walk from the strip and we did a lot of walking in Vegas so the extra walking wasn't great.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding value near the strip”
Reviews.Author: deerstop
Reviews.Content: £32 per night for a suite with seemed too good to be true. And in an excellent location opposite MGM and Hooters just off the strip. Breakfast wasn't up to much but was free, wifi was good and free. There was a mix up with the rooms but that didn't cause any probs, and the place was looking slightly tired, but this was superb value for money. Ate at the Mad Onion in Hooters (good value prime rib dinner} and Bellagios (top class dinner buffet). Went to the Hofbrauhaus but that wasn't nearly as good as the one in Munich

Reviews.Title: “THE ROSE IS STILL BLOOMING”
Reviews.Author: DavevalUk
Reviews.Content: Desert Rose is still our favourite in Las Vegas after another 2 week stay. The old problems are still there however, mainly, ignorant people reserving sun loungers around the pool for others who don't appear for several hours. The breakfast although perfectly eatable is still quite boring. This said, Desert Rose is still the best place to stay in Vegas, the staff are all very friendly and polite, the suites are large and clean and the grounds are extremely well kept. Don't hesitate to book here especially if you can get a decent rate.

Reviews.Title: “A great non-smoking place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Abbykat
Reviews.Content: This is going to be a long review, but I feel necessary. Firstly I would definitely recommend this hotel, so please continue reading, even though it was the worst check-in experience I've ever had in my life. We were to have a reunion with our daughter and her fiance at the hotel. We hadn't seen them in 12 months as they live in Canada and we in Australia. My husband and I arrived late in the evening from our flight, around 10.30pm. After being taken the long way to the hotel by taxi, we arrived, only to be told we couldn't check in as my daughter had made the booking in her name through a travel booking site. She needed to be present for us to be able to check in. She had booked a 2 bedroom apartment for 4 people. It was hot, around 35 degrees outside and we were looking forward to a shower before seeing our daughter. The manager point blank refused to allow us to check in. Nothing I could say would make him change his mind. Our daughter has the same surname and I had the confirmation email from her but he still didn't budge. He offered us the use of the fitness centre showers, so we took our heavy suitcases into the fitness centre. It was empty at that stage, and I was disgusted to find a small amount of faeces on the floor and toilet seat in the combined shower/toilet cubicle. (Probably from a child but it was a fitness centre so who knows). We showered and changed, and I mentioned the faeces to the manager who apologised and said he would get housekeeping onto it immediately. I tried again to get us into the room but to no avail. So we settled into the lobby and waited for our daughter. The manager then came up to us and said he had passed the information onto the night manager as he was finishing for the night. He was very apologetic but said he couldn't do anything. 5 minutes later he came back and I again showed him the email confirmation that was forwarded onto me by my daughter. This time he read it more thoroughly and finally allowed us to check into our room, even though he was very hesitant and said he shouldn't be letting us in He did mention that they had been successfully sued before by letting people into a room which was booked by their friends. When my daughter arrived an hour later, the receptionist was clearly relieved when she said that we had arrived and were in the room and my daughter was happy about that. I think they were expecting my daughter to object! Make sure if you're booking accommodation and people will be arriving at different times, that the booking lists all names, otherwise you may not be allowed to check in. Now for the good part! The room was fabulous. We had a two bedroom apartment and we each had a bathroom. There was a fully equipped kitchen, dining table, lounge, 3 televisions, and plenty of much needed air conditioning. The rooms were spotless. A very good complimentary continental breakfast was provided. Even though the check in was a disaster, the rest of our stay was very good. The location was a little out of the way, around a 10 minute walk to the strip and buses. It's located next to Hooters and a 5 minute walk to MGM Grand. The hotel is totally non-smoking, has free internet in the lobby and we enjoyed the remainder of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and enjoyable experience”
Reviews.Author: GenaB5
Reviews.Content: I loved the cozy nature of the rooms. The seperate kitchen, bedroom, livingroom spaces were great. Quiet at night, could park right up near your room.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, comfortable place”
Reviews.Author: rhverdier
Reviews.Content: We stayed twice on the way to and from a Grand Canyon raft tour. Reservations were efficiently handled. Staff friendly and helpful. Rooms comfortable and large. Price reasonable. Location just off the Strip across from MGM Grand suited us fine. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay”
Reviews.Author: krasna1
Reviews.Content: Once again I visited and stayed at Desert Rose. I will recommend this resort to everyone who wants to stay in Las Vegas and enjoy everything that goes with it. Personal at Desert Rose are professional, friendly, polite and helpful. Stay was again a pleasure. Breakfest, pool, manager's happy hour, rooms, employees... all A+. Book a stay today and enjoy it. I will return to Desert Rose again in January Zorka from Oregon

Reviews.Title: “If you want to experience the Las Vegas Strip and have a relatively and relaxed place to stay THE DESERT ROSE is perfect”
Reviews.Author: MLK5656
Reviews.Content: I loved seeing Las Vegas for the first time and experiencing the glitz and opulance. I also loved the Desert Rose, a great hotel within walking distance from the strip for getting away from it all to sleep. The Continental breakfast was good and a great way to be together with the family and friends who had come from both Canada and the USA to go to a wedding. The staff are more than pleasant and the pool was lovely. I should also note we were one half hour away from the gorgeous Red Rock Canyon, not far from Hoover Dam and onlu 3 hours from the Grand Canyon. Visiting Old Las Vegas is also a must. MK in Cleveland, Ohio

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem amongst the super resorts”
Reviews.Author: woggle
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Desert rose for 7 days Between 7th-14th sept. First impressions of the hotel were excellent. very well presented from the outside, Check in was very swift and JT was very helpful and efficient,. Myself , Girlfriend and Sister stayed in a Suite in block 4, Very large setup. kitchen, pull out sofa bed, kingsize bed in main bedroom. Decent bathroom but not that big. 2 Tv's one in each room. Breakfast at hotel was very good, daily 6-9 mon-fri, 7-10 sat-sun. Bagels. donuts, cereal, eggs, oatmeal, starbucks coffee, great way to start your day in Vegas Location of hotel is excellent, 5 mins from MGM grand and Monorail. Hooters hotel also very close which was good for the $1.50 beers, Concierge services also available at the hotel, didnt use the concierge but she seemed very helpful. Free internet service also available in the lobby. All in all this hotel was superb in my view and I would definately return. Feel free to ask any questions you have about Vegas and the Hotel, I would be happy to help.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great value for money!”
Reviews.Author: tfitt1
Reviews.Content: We (myself, husband and 21yr old daughter) stayed here for 2 weeks 1st-15th September and it was great. The rooms were clean and spacious and it is only 5 minutes walk from the strip! The staff were very polite and helpful and attended within 5 minutes to fix a problem we reported in the bathroom. The bed and the sofa bed were very comfortable (wanted to bring them home!!) and the kitchen was very well equipped. We found having your own kitchen saves loads of money, as staying in strip hotels before we had to go out in the morning in search of a much needed brew but here we had our own tea - (own teabags!!) and could make quick breakfasts etc. Also, there is money to be saved by NOT having a pool bar / snacks as you can buy your own MUCH cheaper and take them to the pool in cool bags with ice etc. We spent a lot less than in previous years and still had a good location. Would certainly go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money in Vegas...supply breakfast, starbucks coffee free all day and free beer and wine in the eveni”
Reviews.Author: Maria130951
Reviews.Content: Just off strip, nice pool, good rooms, cleanliness great, staff helpful, would not hesitate to use this hotel again..normally stay at Hilton, but Desert Rose a more restful place to be. I am a very light sleeper, asked for quiet room location, had a briliant room, no noise and able to sleep...Wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable place for us parents with teenagers”
Reviews.Author: Martina1968
Reviews.Content: Service was great, it's nice to have the room for privacy, location is great--we walked to the strip, also drove but that was because we went to other restaurants for dinner. What we liked the best was the price and also having a kitchen helps when you have teenagers. To serve continental breakfast is a great idea, not too many places do that these days,.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great staff, great value for money”
Reviews.Author: usa_is_better
Reviews.Content: Great location just off the strip, rooms very very spacious and well equipped, (3 televisions in 1 room)! Air con was great, breakfast very good. Woffles, cereal, toast, fruit, eggs... Very good. Monday - Thursday they h ad happy hour between 5 and 7pm. Free drinks and nibbles. Pool was very clean, and plenty of Sunbeds along with hundreds of towels for everyone to use. Pool was very safe, had a locked gate so only residents with a valid card could enter, so an excellent place for children. Over-all a great hotel and j would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Place to enjoy Vegas ....Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Monica_bernie
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a great stay...I am a travel Agent so have stayed in many good hotels , two other big hotels in Vegas but I must say this was a "real home from home feel" . Great rooms , great Staff ,lovely pool area to relax right upto 11pm (great after a hard day shopping , gambling or just taking in the amazing sights of this great city. Vegas is the one place you need to see in your life time and this is a great hotel to see it from.....Go Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jdhelvie
Reviews.Content: The Desert Rose Resort is a great place to base a visit to Las vegas. It is off the Strip a couple of blocks but near enough to get to the attractions by walking or a short drive. The suites are roomy and fully equiped. The prices are very reasonable and a complete continential breakfast is provided free. Employees are helpful and available.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and location but in need of some updates.”
Reviews.Author: RevChris_1984
Reviews.Content: Just off the strip and next door to Hooters and the MGM the Desert Rose is everything we needed for a value minded stay without the value feeling hotel. Rooms were very nice and large with nice furniture and cookware (kitchen included in suites). Nice clean pool and gym area. Decent continental breakfast to start or end your day. As mentioned above the locaiton was perfect and the place was dead quiet at night. Customer service was also excellent and they took care of everything I needed right away. Bathroom was a little small but seperate sink area helps cut down on waiting, great for couples but maybe not for families needing seperate shower time. My only complaints are that the carpets could use an update and the pool furniture could stand to be replaced/updated.

Reviews.Title: “Great find!”
Reviews.Author: Andre-Luciana
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights and we loved it. We'd definetely stay there again! The rooms were very clean and really spacious, and when I say really spacious I really mean it! The kitchen also surprised us with quite new appliances. The hotel is very well-located - near the strip and a lot of off-strip stores and close to the airport - and very silent, though. We didn't hear a plane whatsoever. If you're driving, just go East on Tropicana and make a left on Maryland. You'll find supermarkets, fast food restaurants, etc. I'd say, however, do not get too excited about the breakfast and the manager's happy hour. They're very poor, but remember it's Vegas and none of the hotels offer free breakfast!!! The breakfast area is okay. The hotel even offers guests their conference room so that everyone can get a seat. It can get crowded, though. Another thing to be pointed out is that beds are not made on a daily basis. I was sorry I couldn't use the spa because it was boiling! I know we went in the summer and that's a very hot summer, but they could manage the spa temperature for the guests to have a chance to use it. This is actually something we take into account when picking a hotel, but just couldn't GET IN.

Reviews.Title: “Very good place”
Reviews.Author: IsabelleandDavid
Reviews.Content: We booked a one-bedroom suite and decided to upgrade for a fee. The 2-bedroom suite was absolutely great. One king bedroom with en-suite shower/toilet and TV, one queen bedroom with TV, one lounge with TV, a second bathroom with toilet and a real kitchen with everything you need to cook, a large fridge and freezer, dishwasher, a table for 4 people to eat confortably. A cupboard and chest of drawers in each room. Laundry room on the ground floor (4 quarters for washing and 3 quarters for drying). We had a view across the car park towards the Tropicana Hotel and a bit further the Luxor Hotel. Very well-situated for visiting the big hotels in Vegas while retaining a small family-friendly feel. Really nice swimming-pool. Manager’s cocktail between 5 and 7 p.m. Breakfast included, breakfast room very clean, personnel efficient. Free internet worked but with some difficulties.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base camp”
Reviews.Author: GeoGirl-from-NE
Reviews.Content: Stayed before and after grand canyon rafting trip. Excellent for 4 people the 2 bedroom had two full baths, very important. Free breakfast saved alot of time. We just went down and got what we needed and cooked/ate in our room. They held our extra bags while we were on the trip for $ 5/bag. kitchen had everything we needed and more. beds comfy and its close to airport for rafting trip.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely rooms, like appartments and great prices and location”
Reviews.Author: latham_10
Reviews.Content: Great location just walking distance from MGM. Rooms are like appartments. We had a 2 bed 2 bath room with full kitchen and living room for £50 a night and that included free breakfast which we collected and ate in our room and free drinks and snacks in afternoon. The kids loved the pool but I found it a bit smoky and it was always busy. Loads of towles but loungers soon full but people did leave so could grab one. There were always chairs availble. We loveld this non gaming hotel and would stay again. Check in was so quick compared to the queues you get at the big hotels and nice and small here so it didn't take half an hour just to get to lobby from room.

Reviews.Title: “A week of romance, good food & lots of gambling”
Reviews.Author: aasantoscoy
Reviews.Content: Around the corner from Hooters & the Tropicana (good crap table spots) Easy access to MGM and the tram. Down the block from the Luxor & Mandalay Bay. Very quiet and safe location. Large rooms complete with kitchen. Decent size swimming pool with BBQ grills. We enjoyed our stay so much we extended by 2 days. (7 total)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent way to avoid the smoke and bustle of hotel/casinos”
Reviews.Author: TravelerAl
Reviews.Content: The excellent ratings and favorable commentaries of the Desert Rose Resort on TripAdvisor are what led us to choose it, and we were not disappointed. About all I can add is that it is an excellent way to avoid the cigarette and cigar smoke in the Strip hotel/casinos (the entire resort is non-smoking) and the crowds there. Parking was close to our apartment--we could see the car from our windows. The rooms were spacious, clean, and well maintained. And although we didn't use it much, the kitchen was complete (microwave, full size fridge, stove, coffee maker, blender, dishwasher), and even included cooking and eating utensils. Excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “i would definitely recommend: good fun, value for money,... (view my list )”
Reviews.Author: TurboN
Reviews.Content: this hotel is good fun: good service, own kitchen, good location (behind tropicana), a lot of space in your suite, nice pool (not very big), nice atmosphere behind the busy strip, free happy hours (during the week), good breakfast, free internet, free starbucks coffee, nice people... and not very expensive! do I need to say more? i would definitely recommend this hotel (best during my last USA trip)

Reviews.Title: “Definitely fabulous Place!!!”
Reviews.Author: Marites8
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Aug 23 to 26, 2010....totally exceeded our expectations and plesantly surprised. Very well maintained property inside and outside. Excellent customer service from front desk, housekeeping, engineering and security!!! We needed something or had any questions, they were there, very friendly, professional, patient, understanding and very accommodating. You can see they as a team. Hope their management recognizes the efforts of their employees making the guests happy. Located behind Hooters and Tropicana hotels and slightly away from the strip. It is walking distance but at 40 deg C in Las Vegas all the time, we took a cab instead (ranging from $7 to $20 depending where you want to go).
