Had a 2-bedroom room - very spacious, had centralized aircondition, had a kitchen with fridge, stove, microwave, complete with cultery, plates, etc., had a small dining area and 2 full bathrooms. There was 3 of us found the place so huge so can see 6 people stay here comfortably (see pictures with our review). No car - closest grocery is ABC store located on the strip. With car - go to VON's grocery. It was nice to sleep in a non-gaming and non-smoking place like Desert Rose Resort. This is also a place to get a complete R&R if you don't want to do the strip. Hotel also offers free full continental breakfast, a manager's reception from Mon to Thur where you meet the manager and enjoy complimentary drinks and snacks, very secured place, they had a concierge on site, they had a small store on site, wifi available if you bring your laptop, hotel computer available if you need to print out boarding passes, has pool and hot tub and huge fitness centre. Only thing wrong was that our 5-shower heads in our shower did not work, TV stations were limited not much to watch and the hotel computer was very, very slow (they need a newer computer). We stayed in 1308 third floor (to us) it was the perfect room and quiet. This hotel was better than any hotel on the strip!

Reviews.Title: “A great value, comfortable, quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: angie-mc-0101
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite for 4 nights in August. We were on holiday with our teenage sons and althougt we wanted to visit the casino hotels we wanted somewhere quieter and more spacious to sleep. We were not disappointed. We were early for our check in but that was not a problem. When we walked into our suite we were amazed. Both bedrooms were large. 1 had an ensuite which we did not expect. The living area was comfortable and large enough for us all to sit in and the kitchn area was spacious enough for what we needed. The suite was clean and made up each day. We did not have breakfast though. It was a complete scrum but it did not concern us too much as it is easy and cheap enough to get breakfast elsewhere or to provide our own. in the room. Our only other negative would be the pool, it looked lovely but there were towels on the loungers from 7.00am although no bodies in sight so we did not get to use it. having said that there is so much else to do it wasnt a problem. Although it is not on the strip it is a short walk away and only across the road from the MGM. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wanted to stay in a quieter hotel in Vegas. I could not recomment it highly enough

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: natanddoug
Reviews.Content: Desert Rose was a great place to stay. The rooms were clean and the resort is gated so we felt really secure. I cannot even begin to say how pleasant and helpful the staff there were. From the front desk to concierge, all were very nice to deal with. I would definately stay there again, in fact, we planned another trip in January of next year and we were going to stay at another hotel, but we were so impressed that we are changing our plans and staying at the Desert Rose again!

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN !! ICK !! UNCLEAN”
Reviews.Author: asdfghjkl95
Reviews.Content: Maybe I am too fussy, but stained carpets, stained furniture, used (slept in) looking sheets,poor lighting, questionable clientle, etc. I was looking to save a few bucks, but did not want to compromise on cleanliness..... boy did I make a mistake. They did allow me to switch rooms after I complained about the odor overpowering my sense of smell when I walked in. It wasn't much better and we just purchased an air freshener and dealt with it. My wife and I are not "germaphobes", but we do usually spray down the room surfaces (sepecially the remote and phone) with Lysol based on the fact of so many people coming and going. It just gives us a better sense of clean. Maybe we just observe the small details closer than others because we do this "pre clean" ritual. We must have been in one of the older buildings, because I cannot understand what people are thinking when they say this resort is clean.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: WVUeers2010
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with fiance and her dad during a week long vacation. -Free breakfast of toast, cereal, bagels, fresh fruit, coffee, juice. Enough to get you going for the morning. You won't find many hotels that offer this in vegas! -Concierge service everyday from 10:30am to 6:30 pm except for Tuesday and Wed. There is only one lady, but she is very nice and helpful. -Happy hour from 5-7PM Monday - Thursday with free alcohol, soft drinks and snacks. -Hotel is not on strip, but is very close to hooters hotel and 8 minute walk to strip. -FREE wifi - on the slow side, but good enough to check facebook and email. -They offer free printer to print your boarding pass or whatever you want to print. -There is a bus stop beside the tropicana that we used frequently. It is 8 min walk from hotel. -Pool is small, but GREAT for kids. Very family friendly as opposed to other resort pools. -Workout room is available. I never used this as I got enough workout just walking the strip! -Rooms are spacius with comfortable, clean beds. Rooms were very clean and included full kitchen. Did not use kitchen, but fridge was nice. -No smoking in ALL rooms. If you are looking to be in the hustle and bustle of the strip, then I wouldn't stay here. But if you are looking for a clean, quiet, family friendly place,this is your hotel. Also CHEAP!

Reviews.Title: “Regular guests”
Reviews.Author: angiebaby13
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at Desert Rose Resort for the last 5 years, the suites are spacious and like home from home. Our girls were young when we first visited so we decided on this as it has no casino and also complimentary breakfast, another plus is the Manager's reception held Monday-Thursday 5-7pm. Although the pool is not one of the largest in Las Vegas it is adequate and at times can be quiet. Breakfast time can be busy at times and finding tables a problem but they opened up another room this year which relieved the situation slightly. We have found all of the staff polite, helpful and friendly. I would definitely recommend DRR for anyone wishing to visit Las Vegas but not necessarily be faced with slot machines and casino's 24/7.

Reviews.Title: “Awful staff!!”
Reviews.Author: Malicette78
Reviews.Content: Clean, calm and big bedrooms. We had a very nice suit (2bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, living room and equipped kitchen). In the morning, the “breakfast room” was very crowded. Anyway, breakfast offers a large choice of food. The only problem we encountered there was the staff. They didn’t seem to care about us and were not very friendly. We had great difficulties to order a cab for 5 persons (they called many taxis for 4) and waited 40 minutes to get one!

Reviews.Title: “Don`t expect bells and whistles but perfect for a family holiday”
Reviews.Author: TheNewMrsL52
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Desert Rose for 5 days with 3 Children aged 15, 9, and 4 in a 2 bed suite. Having the extra space of the kitchen and lounge was ideal, and the layout of the hotel and pool allowed the two older children to pop to the hotel shop or to explore the hotel without mum and dad in tow. The pool by Vegas standards is tiny BUT perfect for the younger children as is doesnt get as crowded as the Strip hotel pools - there is a shallow pool for the tiny kids and a hot tub as well as the main pool and is open until 11pm. Breakfast was a bonus - fairly basic but lots of choice and no limit on how much you have. Walk to the strip took maybe 7 or 8 minutes so you really arent too far off the beaten track, and it was nice not to have to traipse through a casino to get to your room. Staff were all really helpful and nothing seemed too much trouble. So if you want a simple, clean, comfy accomodation while in Vegas then definately give the Desert Rose a whirl, but if you are looking for high class elegance with all the bells and whistles Vegas has to offer then stick to the strip. We will definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal, staff, location and room.”
Reviews.Author: EastBayLeche
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Desert Rose the week of 15 -20 Aug. The room was big and clean. There is an early continental breakfast style, free and early appetizers with drinks, free. Just blocks away from major casinos. Well worth the price and would stay here again. Very family friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable Price and Location”
Reviews.Author: Iambic
Reviews.Content: Positives: Large, clean, well-appointed rooms. Close to major attractions but not so close you feel like you're part of the show. The desk staff was cordial and helpful. Negatives: In Las Vegas, you need the help of a concierge. The Desert Rose only has one, who was always busy helping others. The hotel offers a free happy hour and breakfast, both of which are so cheap and so crowded that they're not worth the effort.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, clean, friendly, quite and no gambling”
Reviews.Author: shearer25
Reviews.Content: A most enjoyable stay, I have been to Vegas on a number of occasions and stayed in bigger, expensive hotels on the strip but this was best experience by far due to a friendly staff, hotel cleanliness, good service and it is situated in a quite area but within minutes of the strip

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel for a family with teenagers”
Reviews.Author: Valerimal
Reviews.Content: I found the Desert Rose in Las Vegas through the Trip Advisor and was not disappointed. The hotel is not located on the strip but is located 10 minutes walking from the Luxor Hotel. It is perfect for families as there is a pool, free breakfast, snacks and drinks in the afternoon. The appartments are very large and are a good value for the paid price. There are no gambling machines in that hotel which is perfect for families. Most of the guests were families specialy europeans.

Reviews.Title: “perfect....”
Reviews.Author: flanman68
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a fab 2 wks at the Desert Rose Resort,i'll keep it short & sweet,great location just behind the Tropicana & Hooters,5 mins walk from the Strip,nice pool opens at 8am & if you want a bed with an umberella get there early,some days are busier than others,the breakfast is basic,cereral,toast abit of fruit,just needs abit more,egg bacon beans & sausages ;-) that would be ideal,free drinks at set times but free Starbucks all day,lovely staff,thinking of going back next yr & would stay at the Desert Rose again,as for VEGAS, FANTASTIC,been 3 times now & still love it,loads to do,good shopping,2 outlet malls each end of the strip & not far from the Luxor is the Town Center,full of empty shops Including all your favs like A&F & nice bars & resturants. All In all a great place to visit,i'd recommend 2 wks for a stay..

Reviews.Title: “Great place! No Casino! Not just a room, it's a condo!”
Reviews.Author: liylu
Reviews.Content: Since this is a "vacation club", it's like staying in a full-size apartment. 1BR, kind of small BA (shower/tub), KITCHEN w/ supplies and LR w/ sofa sleeper. The pool area is nice, not spectacular, but what's really nice is that it's open until 11pm! And since it's still in the 80's @ night, this is a definite plus. My son liked that fact that there was no casino to walk through. The free breakfast is basic (toast, frozen waffles, fruit, 4 cereals, STARBUCKS coffee, juice) but good. I don't need a Denny's Grand Slam every morning. The location is good, right off the strip near MGM Grand and Tropicana. We were very happy with this place. The "room" was clean and the front desk staff was helpful & polite. FREE wi-fi access also GREATLY appreciated, altho' it wasn't functional until our 3rd day. We did ok w/o it. unfortunately, had to leave the A/C on all the time due to 108F heat, and it was LOUD.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Quiet in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Bookworms2010
Reviews.Content: This resort has spacious rooms, a pool and an adequate continental breakfast. There is no gambling on site but it is located just a couple of blocks from the Strip so meals and night life are close by. The beds are clean and comfortable and the rooms are cool and quiet....very nice

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Vegas Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Muncie_IN_JohnB
Reviews.Content: Stayed @ Desert Rose before & after Grand Canyon rafting trip. 2 bedroom suite. Very nice rooms,comfortable beds,great,friendly service.Couple blocks off the Strip,but well within walking distance. Well run lodging.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: swurvin_murv
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the first week of august and have no complaints. This was the second time I"ve stayed at the hotel, and we will definitely be back. Continental breakfast each morning was good, and the walk to the main strip area is super easy and fast, and if you don't wanna walk outside in the middle of summer, just cross the street and walk through the MGM. Will absolutely return.

Reviews.Title: “Past Its Prime”
Reviews.Author: PilotOne6
Reviews.Content: I was really looking forward to our stay at the Desert Rose based on reading other reviews. However, this hotel is way past its prime. We had a two bedroom suite. Our room was dingy, dank, and dirty. The main bathroom was very small and cramped with no place to set anything down except on the toilet tank. Kitchen had a nice granite counter top, but that was the high point of the room. The breakfast was OK, but very crowded with no place to sit. Kids enjoyed the pool. Location was just off the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!!!Had to come back in summer with the KIDS”
Reviews.Author: luv2travelx5
Reviews.Content: My husband & I decided to take a small trip with out the kids to Las Vegas, we booked with our timeshare. A 1 br. suite. We loved it, Walking distance to to strip, The rooms are nice and clean, A full kitchen, We booked in March so it was cold to use the pool. We decided to book in summer to bring our kids.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Stay, Will be back!”
Reviews.Author: Opus345
Reviews.Content: Being off the strip is the way to go. Great value. The only issue we encountered was the Internet. Anymore, being unconnected is not an option. jr

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay here”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneCaz
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved our stay at the Desert Rose. We had a two bedroom suite which was a bargain (booked the Go Green rate). Plenty of space, comfortable beds, full kitchen, free breakfast. We walked to the Strip which was only one block away. Last time we stayed at Paris which was great to be in the middle of it all but for this return visit, Desert Rose was perfect for us with the extra space in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: WAmum0f4
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights with 4 children and it was fantastic! Location was great rooms were clean great cooking facilities. The kids loved the pool and was a very short walk to the strip would defiantly stay here again. the best price and biggest room during our USA visit! Staff were very helpful and friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value!”
Reviews.Author: Britabroad585
Reviews.Content: This place was very clean, modern, the staff friendly and helpful. The breakfast was substantial and definitely a bonus. The location to the Strip and buses was excellent, yet it was very quiet and family friendly. Free wireless was great although a bit on the slow side. But all around, i would return to this place again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Watch Your Car !”
Reviews.Author: Notashe
Reviews.Content: My vehicle was stolen from the parking lot of this hotel in Feb. 2010. The police and I learned the next day the hotel has no security camera system on the parking lot. If staying here I suggest to request an outside room which allows a view of your vehicle. I had an inside room which posponed finding out my vehicle had been stolen by hours. Other than discussing the theft with the hotel security the next morning, the hotel management has not commented on the subject.

Reviews.Title: “A Quiet place just off the Las Vegas Strip”
Reviews.Author: wirebarbed
Reviews.Content: It might not be as fancy as some of the big hotels on the strip, but it had a great value to it with a 2 bedroom suite that comes with a living room and full kitchen. The staff was very helpful and friendly. I would stay there again next time I am in Vegas for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Everything and Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: DERKO
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in Desert Rose, it is nice and the staff are polite and helpful. Rooms are not wow but for the price we paid, it is more than expected. We Will stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Beatlemania2
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay. You have all you need of Las Vegas- a five minute walk to the strip,yet no noise or smoke. Very Family friendly, great for trips. The Pool was very plesant and relaxing with a main pool, hot tub, and kiddie pool. The rooms are fantastic- A Full Bedroom w/Bathroom, Full Kitchen w/complete full appliences, A living room with a flat screen TV w/ DVD player, a lounge couch w/pull out bed. And, your very own balcony! I reccomend suggesting building 2,3,or 4. The downside of building 1 is that you have a parking lot view. But the rest is a pool view, garden view, or Tropicana hotel view. They also have a full free Breakfast in the lobby with a gret selection. And, 7 days a week, at 5-7 o clock, you get free soda, beer,wine, and snacks. FREE! The gym is also fantastic. The Staff and service is excellent,great room service, plus you can get pizza ordered right to your room! I suggest this hotel to anyone because it is one of the best hotels i have ever stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: amep
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for two nights in Las Vegas. It is a three minute walk from 'The Strip' so you can be near to all the action yet away from the noise! The rooms were big and comfy and although the air conditioning is noisy it's the only minor bad thing about this place! the pool area was nice and it was great to be able to use the gym here. breakfast was cereal, break, fruit, eggs, tasty. I would def stay here when in Vegas again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: LindsayPinz
Reviews.Content: There are lots of excellent reviews of this place and I would just like to echo them. Only snag was the noisy air-conditioning and I have a suspicion that if you book through Expedia you get the rubbish rooms. Ours had no view but as we were only there 3 nights, we didn't complain. Other rooms overlook the pool or leafy, pleasant grounds so maybe we were just unlucky. The staff were friendly and helpful and overall, it was a great place to escape the madness of the Strip!

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: Hoite
Reviews.Content: There's not much to add to all the other reviews. I must say I was a little concerned when i noticed the hotel was literally on the end of the runway of Las Vegas airport but the only noise we heard was from the helicopters to/fro grand canyon. All major attractions at the strip within walking distance. Clean, large appartment, free breakfast en drinks at happy hour and a nice pool. What more do you want.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem.”
Reviews.Author: Karen617
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Desert Rose after a week long tour of the southwest. It was everything the other TA reviews said. Clean, comfortable, friendly staff. Loved the full kitchen. Very comfortable king sized bed. The teenage boys even said the pullout couch was comfortable. Check-in staff were friendly and helpful. We called for extra towels & blankets and they were brought immediately. Having a laundry room on site was a bonus. There was a large breakfast spread our 1st day. The only problem we had were the other guests acting like it was their last meal. One staffer overheard my son on the phone requesting a glazed donut. She went to check for more in the kitchen. She brought out a trayful but held onto 1 until I could get to the front. I thought that was above and beyond but that's how all the staff seems to treat the guests. Its located off the strip so its quiet. We rented a car so this wasn't a problem but if you wanted to ride the monorail, the MGM is 5 minutes across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place 5 minutes off the strip!!”
Reviews.Author: doyledOttawa
Reviews.Content: If you're heading to Vegas, this is the place to stay! After reading all the positive reviews on tripadvisor, we decided to book our 10-day family holiday at DRR. What a fantastic place that my husband, teenage son and I all enjoyed. The hotel is about a 5-6 minute walk to the MGM Grand so it's very easy access to the strip, to take the monorail, or the bus (the Deuce). However, as a side note, we found that busses only ran every 25-35 minutes despite their advertised "every 12 minutes", and the monorail was the much better and reliable choice to travel up and down the strip. We stayed in a 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom suite at DRR, with full kitchen, separate living room and dining room, plenty of closet space and a nice balcony. Given the length of our stay, we wanted to have more space than a typical hotel room to come back to after full days of sightseeing and this was certainly the perfect place. We used the pool a number of times and although it's not huge, we found it was just fine and very refreshing after the 106F weather! We had the included breakfast most mornings which offered toast, muffins, cereals, hard boiled eggs, cottage cheese, fresh fruits, juices, coffee, etc. Certainly enough to get you going in the morning. It does get busy in the dining area, so we took our plates up to the room, toasted our bread there instead of waiting in line, and enjoyed our breakfast in the privacy of our suite. In addition, the DRR offers free WiFi in your suite and throughout the hotel and does not charge a daily resort fee, unlike the big hotels on the strip. The only thing that was disappointing about DRR was the Concierge Services. Firstly, there is no concierge for 2-3 days per week, and although the front desk staff were always helpful, it's not their job (nor do they have the knowledge) to help with typical concierge requests. Secondly, when the concierge was on duty, she either wasn't at her desk, or when we finally spoke with her, she had very little to offer. We inquired about two different shows and her response was to go to the casino where the shows were playing and buy tickets at their ticket office - she had no way of getting discounts or assisting in obtaining the tickets. Essentially, she can tell you where to catch the bus (which we had already figured out since she wasn't working for our first 3 days at DRR). So do your own research before you go because you won't get much help once there. The rooms were fabulous, the price is very reasonable, the maid service wonderful, and all in all, we were very impressed with DRR. If we ever return to Las Vegas, we would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Best Value and Service in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Julesxxxxx
Reviews.Content: The Desert Rose has everything you could ask for in a hotel. The rooms are gorgeous, the service is excellent and the location is perfect. It is within walking distance of the Strip, the pool is open late and the rooms...the rooms are huge and extremely comfortable. I have stayed here six times already and it has become the only place I stay when in Vegas. Whether with my family, with boys on a golf trip or with a group for a bachelor party, everytime it has met our needs beautifully. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is planning a trip to Las Vegas at anytime of year, for any reason.

Reviews.Title: “Tip Top”
Reviews.Author: KenLiverpoolUK
Reviews.Content: Excellent reviews on Tripadvisor are well deserved. This is 'off the strip' so you are a little out of it but its also an advantage, Staff were excellent, very helpful and with good knowledge. Rooms were good and quite spacious. Breakfast was a little rushed due to the amount of people in a smallish room. There was a free happy hour with snacks Monday to thursday which was a big surprise. If you want to be in the 'thick of it' then stay on the strip in ine of the big hotels, that's if you are happy to be just a number.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place off the Strip”
Reviews.Author: kotchfamily
Reviews.Content: We started off our trip around the Grand Canyon flying into Las Vegas. With 3 teenagers we wanted a place off the strip. With 1 short block from the strip we loved Desert Rose. Our two bedroom suite was perfect. Big and spacious. Plenty of room for 5. It is a quite alternate to the busy strip. Kids enjoyed the large pool. Included a free breakfast each morning. Drinks and light snacks at happy hour. I would definitely stay at Desert Rose again.

Reviews.Title: “Truly a gem”
Reviews.Author: Antigony
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Desert Rose in late May. I picked the hotel because of all the good reviews I had read on TA and also because we needed room for 5 adults and we did not want to stay at a hotel with all the masses at the strip, or a room that smelled of smoke. We had the large 2 bedroom suite (accommodates 6) with 2 comfy double beds, 1 king and a sofa sleeper for $99/night including breakfast (cold items & Starbucks coffee)! I am very picky when it comes to cleanliness and try to stay in newer hotels or certain high-end chains. But I didn't have to worry about touching the remote or door knobs as the room was clean throughout and had a fully equipped kitchen, a balcony and a safe as well as small walk-in closets with lots of storage. The hotel staff was very friendly and accommodating at all times. This resort is a real gem only about 10 minutes walking distance from the strip, nestled in a garden sourrounding the 3 story buildings. Even though there were a lot of families with kids and the airport nearby it was never noisy. We left the car on the free parking lot right in front of our building and only used it once to drive to the supermarket open 24/7 right on Tropicana Avenue. All in all it was a wonderful 2-night-stay and I would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to relax....”
Reviews.Author: helgesenh
Reviews.Content: Recently spent 4 days at this resort and would recommend it to anyone with or without children. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful and went out of their way to assist in your needs. The facilities ie : pool, work out center where well maintained and very clean. The south LV "Strip" was very close (walking distance) however if you needed to get to the northern part of the Strip I would suggest a Cab. Or drive yourself. Cab fare was approximately $15.00 .The front desk is happy to call a cab for you. Look forward to another stay....If you go ENJOY!

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful and quiet retreat located near Vegas strip”
Reviews.Author: wk2010
Reviews.Content: Clean and nicely decorated room with sofa bed for additional sleeping needs if required. Very close to the large attractions on the Strip, but nicely tucked away from the crowds. Short walking distance to MGM Grand, Luxor, Hooters,Tropicana, NY-NY, and Excalibur hotels. No casino on grounds for a nice quiet stay. Free continental breakfast and light snack in the evening. Free high speed internet in room. Full cooking facilities in room and grill available in the pool area. Everyone polite and helpful. Thanks for a wonderful vacation stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay -- Already planning our return!”
Reviews.Author: sittingonready
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel on Trip Advisor, and could not have been more pleased. We found the rates to be reasonable for the accommodations offered. It is a condo-type hotel with no casino, and each room has a galley kitchen and den in addition to the bedroom. Part of our family took a 2-bedroom unit, which has 2 baths. None of us could have been more pleased. The beds slept well, and the location, while close to the Strip and the airport, is extremely quiet. There is Wolfgang Puck coffee in the rooms, and Starbucks in the main lobby / breakfast area. We stayed in Bldg. 4, as was suggested by another reviewer, and found that it worked very well for us. Don't expect more than a continental breakfast, with donuts available during weekdays but absent on weekends. However, you have a full kitchen (with garbage disposal...but please, NO bottlecaps or metal!), and can whip up anything else you might want. You're also very near the casinos, great restaurants, etc., and can walk to quite a lot of the Strip if you desire. Our tub did not drain properly on the first day and a bulb was burned out in the bath. I called the desk for maintenance, and the gentleman came immediately and took care of the problems. Could not have asked for better service. As for the tub drain, the guest prior to us had apparently pulled out the stopper and stuffed paper into the drain under it because the maintenance man pulled it out and showed us. There is just no explaining what some people do! We're planning another stay at this hotel already.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: CDRDAD
Reviews.Content: This is the 4th or 5th time I have stayed at the Desert Rose. I WILL be back. I will stay at no other hotel or resort in the Vegas area. Check in and Check out went extremely smooth and quick. The staff at the Rose is courteous, friendly, and most helpful. They will go out of their way to make you feel welcome and important. The Rose is located within walking distance of the strip, but far away enough that it serves as a "get away" from all of the hustle and bustle. The suites are large, quiet, and clean. The Desert Rose has my highest recommendation, and I travel alot. S. C. Krell

Reviews.Title: “An island of serenity surrounded by a sea of insanity!”
Reviews.Author: ethosian
Reviews.Content: We traded into this resort through RCI. We found it clean, comfortable and centrally located in the city. It is just behind the Tropicana and next to the Hooters casinos. The main strip is walkable, but it was over 100 degrees while we were there, so we drove. Parking is ample, the pool very nice and the staff were exceptionally pleasant. There is a continental breakfast each morning and even a Happy Hour in the evenings! Families will like that we did not see and gaming machines on site.Our daughter used the exercise room and said it was adequate.It was hard to believe that this place was so quiet and restful even though it was so close to all the action. If we return to Vegas, we will certainly return here.

Reviews.Title: “a little gem behind hooters hotel”
Reviews.Author: mackamelbourne
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights and everything was excellent including the free breakfast and happy hour. Staff very helpful and rooms very spacious and clean. Set back from the strip so very quiet location. Great for coulples and families. Roseann Mcghee Melbourne Australia

Reviews.Title: “Great service, wonderful attention.”
Reviews.Author: ROMEDI
Reviews.Content: This is a great, non-gambling hotel located just off the strip making it easy to access the casino resorts while making you feel as if you were miles away from the hustle and bustle of the strip. The staff was very friendly and attentive. The rooms were clean with all the necessary amenities. The internet service was somewhat slow and the continental breakfast could use more variety although there were many items to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the strip, clean and friendly place would have no hesitation in goin back”
Reviews.Author: SrC1983
Reviews.Content: This hotel was outstanding and very comfortable. It is very close to the las vegas strip aswell. I was weary the first time i went as i kept thinking i should of stayed at bellagio, mgm,caesars etc but after that first stay i had no hesitation in goin back the year after. Also the complimentry breakfast, evening meal and drinks makes this hotel very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Best Spot in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: MarilynB19
Reviews.Content: We stayed one week at the Desert Rose Condo resort, on Duke Ellington Way. What an amazing resort. Super friendly, helpful people, clean, relaxing (which is a must after the hustle & bustle of the strip). 2 bedroom 2 bath condo was immaculate. Kitchen was completely fit out with everything we could possibly need. Excellent gym, pool & hot tub. Towels supplied by the resort...nice ones too! Continental breakfast every morning made it possible to start your day without spending MORE money...beer & wine reception weekday afternoons was another plus. Staff ancitipated your every need. I swear, you would just think about needing something and 'poof' there was someone right there. They really seem to love working there. This resort is about a block & and half from the strip...not a bad walk, except when it's 110 degrees F outside. If I had to find something wrong with this resort, it would be that they don't have as shuttle to the strip. If they could even just provide transport to the nearest Deuce/Ace bus stop, that would be a great perk, but not necessary. I highly recommend this resort...especially if you are travelling as a family.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for families to stay!”
Reviews.Author: L0ves2Run
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in June (19-26) in a 2 bedroom, 2 bath unit. We were surprised at the size of the kitchen, with all its amenities: full size fridge/freezer, micro, d/w, blender, stove, toaster, and all the dishes/cookware you could possibly need! The free daily breakfast was great to have, and we especially enjoyed the Starbucks! We used the pool many times, and it was popular, but never overcrowded. Always could find a chair or lounger to use too. No wait to check in or out, there was a computer in the lobby with a printer, for hotel guests to use (great for printing boarding passes), free wi-fi in the rooms, free paper, and a manager's reception with drinks/snacks during the weekdays. EVERY staff member we came in contact with was polite, friendly and helpful. Although the hotel is not on the strip directly, the walk is about 5 minutes. We enjoyed not having to walk through a smelly casino to get to our room each night. Parking was a breeze, and we even made use of the onsite laundry facility! Beds were also VERY comfy, more than enough pillows, and we never heard any noise from outside or the other rooms. I would DEFINITELY come back!

Reviews.Title: “Great restful resort with beautiful, spotless rooms and a lovely pool.”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoLilly
Reviews.Content: Desert Rose has lovely suites that allow families to cook if desired, with a full table and four chairs and a living room area for relaxing, playing cards or games, or watching TV. The pool area was very nice, and the staff was very welcoming and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “What a place.”
Reviews.Author: dontreallycare
Reviews.Content: Like so many, we've been to Vegas many times. After four days hiking to Havasu Falls, this place was like heaven. The Desert Rose was, without QUESTION, the cleanest, nicest, best dealist, closest to the strip place we've stayed at in LV. The staff, the rooms!!, the value!!, the location, the pool, the value!!...and did I mention the rooms? The rooms are NOT rooms...they are condos. Full kitchen, wonderful furnishings, perfect mattress/pillows/sheets. It was sweet. The only downfalls? They ran out of USA Todays too quickly, were out of Tide, and needed to take a BIT more care of their washers/dryers. That's it. Period. lw

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly, home away from home”
Reviews.Author: kit523
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed everything. We were treated great by a friendly and courteous staff. The rooms were clean and quiet. We were surprised by the amount of room, comfort and cleanliness for the price. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Dumped from our prepaid 2 month reservation with Orbitz”
Reviews.Author: OregonTraveler57
Reviews.Content: Very excited to stay at this place due to my diligent research on Trip Advisor etc. After a day of driving got to resort at check in only to be told room was not available due to a "plumbing" problem. Pitched a fit, said I would take the room anyway, only to be met with a blank stare. Ended up at a hotel under the airport runway instead courtesy of the Desert Rose. Pretty sure my cheap Orbitz rate was topped. Beware.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we needed”
Reviews.Author: SFgal40
Reviews.Content: I went to Las Vegas in late May for a dual purpose trip--to have a family reunion of sorts, and to move my elderly, ill father back to the Bay Area. He'd been living in Vegas for 15 years, so I know the city pretty well and knew I didn't want to stay in a casino with my toddler. I chose this hotel due to all the great reviews, the price, and the location (and child-friendly aspects). We ended up having a great stay--in a 2 bedroom suite (and my sister and her fiancee had a room right down the hall). Our room was sort of the hub for other family staying at other hotels, and it was always spacious and comfortable. We didn't even mind the view of the dumpsters! We were there a week, and most mornings, I took my dad and daughter down to the breakfast (a bit of a mad scene, but nice enough), and each afternoon, after a day of dealing with doctors and taking care of business, we relaxed by the pool and enjoyed the happy hour. The beds were comfy, the bathrooms nice--the kitchen was a bit dark, but we used it for light meal preparation. We went to the Whole Foods and stocked up for the week, and it was nice not to have to eat every meal out. When my husband or I felt the need for more "Vegas action" we'd spell each other on the babysitting and walk next door to Hooter's, which was actually a pretty fun place with wonderful cadillac margaritas. Some family stayed there so we were back and forth. Anyway, Desert Rose was convenient, loved the parking right by the room (huge thing in Vegas--I hate parking garages), and being able to walk to the pool in 2 minutes (we loved the pool). Free internet in the lobby and I never waited once. For a family trip (or any trip), I highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, reasonable rates, comfy”
Reviews.Author: jjaku807
Reviews.Content: Very clean, comfortable hotel. Comfortable bed, not sure the young people (18 and 20) found the same, as they slept on the foldout sofa. Easy access to the strip, quiet, nice pool, a few little ones at pool in the morning, internet was sketchy at best, but we weren't there to surf the web. Breakfast was more than adequate for the adults, at least.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, lovely rooms, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Keithd001
Reviews.Content: My wife and 2 friends stayed here for 10 days towards the end of June 2010 and had a lovely stay. The price was terrific value for a resort located just south of the strip and a 5 minute walk from the MGM Grand. The contintental breakfast buffet was always fully stocked and a great way to start the day. The swimming pool was always very busy with children but that wasnt a problem as we weren't interested in a holiday by the pool, and realised before booking this is an ideal place to bring the family - but to all couples wishing to stay here don't let that put you off. The room we stayed in was a great size. Good living area, good size kitched with microwave, dishwasher, oven, fridge, freezer. Two wardrobes of good size, dressing area and shower and bath. I would recommend this resort to anybody, and would stay again without any hesitation. I just hope they don't read all their positive reviews and put their prices up!! ;-)

Reviews.Title: “The desert Rose was the best hotel!”
Reviews.Author: chevy6937
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I stayed from june 17- june 22 2010 had an awesome time laying by the pool and having a dinner in our room one night and the strip is walking distance and u can take the bus 7.00 per person 24 hours that was great! The breakfast was aweome and the cocktail evening was great! I think we would stay there again! We both highly recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “A very nice resort with friendly staff close to the strip and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: shawntue
Reviews.Content: Desert Rose Resort has spacious suites with full kitchen, seprate living room,dining room nice size bedroom and a very relaxing and private balcony. The resosrt has complimentary breakfast each morning that was great and on Monday -Thursday complimentary drinks from 5-7 pm. The pool was a bit small but it did have a nice area to cookout and relaxe by the pool. When I return in 2011 I will be staying here again the staff was pleasant and the resort is very close to the strip. If your going to stay in the area I will advise you to not get a rental car and save your money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Value”
Reviews.Author: Shellie71
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a family-friendly place to stay in Las Vegas, this is it. Non-smoking, non-gaming, clean and conveniently located just off the strip. The rooms are spacious and clean. The kitchen is appropriately furnished for small meals in the room. We ate breakfast in the room and cooked a pizza one night. The pool is nice for the kids--a little busy, but it was June. The staff was extremely accommodiating and friendly. The price of the room (we had a one bedroom) was exceptional. The one thing we were disappointed in was the breakfast. It was not as other people have described. We decided to go to the grocery store and just buy some breakfast foods. Otherwise, we were happy and would stay here upon returning to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “We really enjoyed our stay at the Desert Rose”
Reviews.Author: Mama56
Reviews.Content: I loved the fact that it was a home-away-from home; a one bedroom apartment with fully equipped kitchen, even a blender and iron and ironing board. The free continental breakfast included cereal, yogurt, bagels and fresh fruit, along with choices of juice and coffee/tea/hot chocolate. We did not stay long enough to enjoy the pool or fitness centre, but they were very popular. Ask to be given a room with a view, as we looked at the back of another building, but the walk from the room to the lobby was very pleasant, with fountains and gardens between the four buildings. The staff were very friendly, responded immediately to any of my inquiries, and check out was a breeze.

Reviews.Title: “great family place!”
Reviews.Author: TomGallatin_TN
Reviews.Content: As part of a trip with Arizona River Runners, I took my 8 y/o grand daughter to Las Vegas in May. On the advice of ARR, we booked and stayed at Desert Rose Resort. As advertised, the location was very close to the air port, nice since we arrived late (coming from New Brunswick, Canada). In addition the check in was quite efficient. Our room included a king sized bed and furnished kitchen. We did not have occasion to use the kitchen, but it was "ready to go" for anyone staying several days. It was clean, very comfortable, and a wonderful experience for her first trip away from family. An the continental breakfast was more than adequate to launch us on our rafting adventure. She is already asking about returning next year! Who knows?

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic accommodations”
Reviews.Author: Scoan
Reviews.Content: The service staff was courteous and helpful. Our room was a 1 bedroom suite, was spacious, and well maintained. The amenities were also great. The continental breakfast was average, but it was convenient to have breakfast on site. The location is about a (long) block off the Las Vegas strip. Walking to the "Strip" is possible, but it can be a little far when it is hot. Overall we liked the location, away from the noise of the "Strip". We disliked having to drive to casinos on the "Strip" when it was too hot to walk. Fortunately, parking at the casinos was not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Good for families and Nice for singles, too.”
Reviews.Author: willyandjetta
Reviews.Content: This was my first time to Las Vegas. I didn't really want to stay at a casino hotel with all the noise and extra foot traffic. Desert Rose Resort was a great alternative because it was quiet, offered free parking but still close to the action of the Las Vegas Strip. It was a very good value, well kept and the staff was friendly. I would definitely recommend it and stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “good price”
Reviews.Author: TheMuggins
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week and had a two bedroom suite. The room itself was spacious enough for us (2 adults and 1 child). Although we had two bathrooms we only used one as the shower pressure in our ensuite was non-existent, no big deal for us but if you needed 2 bathrooms this may be a concern. Our room was on the second floor, overlooking the pool; next to the breakfast area...needless to say it was noisy early in the morning with the breakfast crowd! (and people checking out) Breakfast was ok, we got the supplies and took them back to our room, one piece of advice...avoid their orange juice, it’s powdered and it sucks. The location was good for us. A 15 minute walk to New York New York, and that was with a stroller! For the price and location this place is great. If possible ask for a room not facing the pool to avoid the early morning noise and you should enjoy yourself.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT PLACE TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: AnitaBakersfield_Ca
Reviews.Content: Very nice resort. Traveled with one 12yr old a 14yr old and a 17 year old and my husband and I. We had a two bedroom . There was plenty of space for all of us. A total of three TV's, two twin beds in one room, a king in the master and sofa bed. The room was spacious. I do agree that the carpet can use a professional cleaning. The staff was very nice. Breakfast was great and so was the Happy Hour. I travel to Vegas at least twice a year and let me tell you, you don't usually get free breakfast, much less free wine and beer at any of the other places, unless of course you have lost alot of money gambling. The pool is not very big, but nice. People, don't pay full price for anything!. Get your show tickets through Travel Zoo web sight and you will save alot of money, I got show tickets for B lue Man Group at a huge discount, also got tickets to see Ka at the MGM through this web sight. Just get on the websight, then call the hotel and give them the promotion code or tell them if you can get the Travel Zoo price. Different shows come up on this websight so if what you want to go see isn't available just keep checking. When I checked they had discount prices for Lion King, Blue Man Group, mystere, KA, Jersey Boys, Tony nad Tina's Wedding and a couple of others I can't remember. Also get coupons for dining at restaurant.com websight, just print out your coupon and take it with you. Expedia gave us a great price for the room. We went to madame tussaund wax museum and also got a great discount through their websight. I am not really a gambler so can't tell you where the best places to gamble are, but just remember someone has to pay the light bill. All in all we vhad a wonderful stay at the Desert Rose. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: travels0metimes
Reviews.Content: The Desert Rose Resort in Las Vegas has everything that I look for in a hotel - free breakfast; workout facilities (treadmills, stepping machines, multi-station weight machine); swimming pool; room with separate bedroom, bathroom, dining/tv room, and kitchen; friendly staff from reception to cleaning to host; very clean; good price; and location near the strip, airport, and monorail station. This is an excellent place to stay without the casino.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ladyrhyan
Reviews.Content: We had a one bedroom which really was a one bedroom apartment. Full kitchen, dining area, living room, bedroom and bath. Nicely decorated and comfortable. Extra deep tub in the bathroom. Really enjoyed our room and it was quiet. Decent continential breakfast. Pool and jacuzzi were clean and worked well. Overall, I recommend this as a place to stay while in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Best thing in Las Vegas by far”
Reviews.Author: PhilWashingtonDC
Reviews.Content: This was our first and last trip to Vegas. Not my cup of tea as the English say. However the Desert Rose was an excellant bargain at less than $100 a night and I would highly recommend it to anyone traveling to that otherwise pricey desert city who does not need or want to stay in one of the casino hotels. As advertised, Desert Rose is several blocks off of the strip or in terms of time about a 10 minute walk via the Hooters parking lot Speaking of Hooters, they advertise a prime rib dinner for about $10 which we tried. I recommend it as a good bargain dinner and don't worry about half naked waitresses. There weren't any and the female workers who were dressed in the Hooters shorts and shirts looked modest compared to what one sees on the streets in many US and European cities. By contrast, we also ate at the Italian restaurant in New York/New York and for close to $100 got tasteless, bland food that I would have been ashamed to serve at home. I have one strong warning about Las Vegas. Several of the casino hotels have booths where sales people bribe visitors to take a tour of the Grand View Resort which is several miles away on the fringe of Las Vegas. The bribe consists of free food during the tour and free show tickets. You will be told that the tour last 2-3 hours. This is a lie. They take you by bus to Grand View from Excalibur and five hours lapsed from the time we arrived at Excalibur to the time we returned. Others spent 3 or 4 hours even thjoug they had babies with them. At Grand View they subject you to a varieity of .sales pitches that seemed to be blend of tactics used by used car salesmen (e.g., constantly changing figures scribbled on the scraps of paper) and the KGB (changing interrigators and fatigue inducement). Unless you are 100% certain that you are truly interested in a Grand View time share DO NOT FALL SUBJECT YOURSELF, YOUR SPOUSE, OR FAMILY TO THIS ORDEAL. You would be better off doing nothing at Desert Rose for 4 or 5 hours than suffering at Grand View. Incidently we chose the Kings Tournement (?) show in Excalbur as our bribe. While the show was somewhat appealing to children and adolescents, the standard food served everyone was bad and NOBODY at more than half of it.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant change from High rise hotels also close to the main attractions”
Reviews.Author: Hitchiker_bear
Reviews.Content: Our 1 bedroom apartment had a huge fridge, full kitchen; a blend of Tuscan and Mexican decor, quality furnishings and fittings. Overall spacious and pleasant accommodation. Plump pillows and comfortable beds and linens. Housekeeping to be commended on cleanliness of the apartment; this included windows and fly screens which are often overlooked in overall cleaning. The breakfast was continental style and a higher standard than most motel chains. The only improvement to overall presentation would be that management need to regularly schedule a commercial carpet cleaning. Housekeeping vacuum the carpets, but a deep clean is beyond the scope of cleanliness of normal housekeeping duties.

Reviews.Title: “a really nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: christyGlenEllen
Reviews.Content: We had family meet us there and together had 3 very clean nice rooms. The staff were all very friendly and helpful with any questions we had.The complimentary breakfast and social hours were very nice.We were within walking distance to the strip ,but quiet and secluded. the fact that the pool was open late was a nice bonus,for an evening swim . I hear other places are closed much earlier. I would definetly stay again if ever in vegas or gladly refer to others.thank you for a pleasurable vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: C0usinEddie
Reviews.Content: I just go back from 5 nights at the Desert Rose. I have to say that I loved it. I went with my 76 year old Mom and we both got our own 1 BR suite. It was great to have a nice safe place to hang around and to go back to at night. The service was outstanding and everyone seems to really enjoy their jobs. The free breakfast was way better then I thought it would be. Of course it gets a bit crowded, becuase its free. If you go at around 730 am then its not bad, go right before it closes and there will be more people there because they slept in a bit. They really do serve free beer and wine in the afternoons on weekdays which I didnt believe until I tried it. No problem, drank free beer and talked to some other guests, great time. My room had the best a/c of any room i have stayed at in Vegas. You can turn it down to 40f but once it hits about 58f I wcouldnt take it anymore and had to turn it up. The free internet was actually a bit faster then I thought it would be. Its not the worlds fastest but for the price it was great, i was connected the whole time. I left my laptop, mp3 player, camera out the whole time and they were right where I left them when I got back every time. The pool is nice for families. Its not a giant thing with hardbodies everywhere but I liked it better then those places because the big ones can be intimidating. I took beers with me and there was no one to say anything about it. You dont need to get up early to get a lounger either. very cool. If you are walking to the strip the easiest way is to go straight towards MGM and start there. Its about a 1 beer walk and I drink beer pretty fast. I cant wait for my next trip so I can stay here again. I would strongly recommend it for people who like things a bit more laid back. Its nice not to have to eat every meal out. I made BLT's in my room just about every night and loved it. This place is truly a hidden gem.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for the strip”
Reviews.Author: twoteapots
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the end of a 19 day fly/drive from the UK. Its a great location, just a short walk to the strip, but away from the hustle and bustle of the strip. We also asked for a quiet room and had a very peaceful time at the rear of the complex. Rooms, although a little tired, have everything you ever need, with fully equipped kitchen and lots of room in the suite. It has a great pool and hot tub in the center of the complex which, although it can get very busy, was ideal and was open till late each evening. Breakfast is a simple continental affair, which can get a bit hectic at times when the hotel is busy. The staff were great and overall, this was a ideal hotel for the price we paid and is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: BaznPatScarborough
Reviews.Content: This place had everything you will need to have on your holiday. And if anyone says any different they are telling porkies

Reviews.Title: “A great place for quiet R & R yet close enough to all the Vegas excitement!”
Reviews.Author: vaweston
Reviews.Content: As soon as we walked in we felt comfortable. Suite was great. Being able to sit out on your own private balcony was very relaxing. All employees were friendly, responsive, and knowledgeable of the area. Took in the morning buffet once, it was OK. We liked having a kitchen so we could eat at leisure, whenever. The pool area is comforting. The resort is in a wonderful location for quiet time,It is within a short walk to the wonders of Vegas. No need for a car, leave it parked at the resort. The Desert Rose Resort made our vacation a very comfortable, stress free vacation. We need more of these type of resorts in US vacation spots.

Reviews.Title: “Clean room, great location & very good price!!!”
Reviews.Author: nfromero
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights, the room was clean, the kitchen was fully equipped with kitchenwares. The bed was very comfy, which was perfect after a long walk at the strip. The location was great, a walking distance from the strip. Pool was heated and they offer free wi-fi. Overall, the hotel is family-friendly, especially if you're travelling with kids. We're very satisfied with the service and we're planning to stay here again the next time we go to vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, comfortable and cost-effective!”
Reviews.Author: mcmom2010
Reviews.Content: Needed a budget-friendly stay for a work trip and really didn't want to stay in a gaming hotel. Just off the Strip, the Desert Rose Resort gave easy access to the fun, without being right in the middle of it. My room was enormous and cozy with the convenience of a full kitchen. Loved the perks like free parking, evening snacks 'n' drinks and a simple buffet breakfast. Will definately be coming back to Las Vegas, so I'll be sure to book here again!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: krasna1
Reviews.Content: I book my trip to Vegas at Desert Rose resort. I was very pleased with everything. Staff and rooms and everything was excellent. Kitchen ,bedroom, living room and dinning room. Close to the strip . Quiet , nice pool and continental breakfest and free internet included. Will 100% recommend and will come back. Zorka fromOregon

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Michelle155019
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Desert Rose Resort and were very pleased. We had a full kitchen, separate bedroom and living room and a continental breakfast all for a very reasonable price. The rooms very nice and the location was excellent, right off the strip, yet quiet.

Reviews.Title: “didn't find the DRR to be all that it was said to be”
Reviews.Author: JeCe
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Desert Rose Resort for three nights recently. I was excited to see the resort after reading all of the reviews. It sounded too good to be true. I found it to be very average. The best thing about it was the fact that we had a two-room suite. Travelling with teenagers, this was a very nice feature. But I didn't find anything attractive about the suite at all. It was not cleaned either day we were there although the person checking us in circled on the room registration that we would be getting daily cleaning. I'm used to a hotel room being freshened up daily. We had to call for clean towels. Also, the internet was not working when we got there, and we couldn't even make an outgoing call from our room to ask about it. My husband had to use his cell phone to call the front desk and they gave him a number to call about the internet. He had to talk to the 3rd party provider, just as if we were at home dealing with a household problem. He spent probably 30 minutes of our first evening dealing with THEIR internet problems for them, because we soon found out from the provider that NOBODY at the resort had wireless and it had not been reported. We didn't find the beds comfortable, and it was noisy. The first night we had lots of noise coming from the suite below us--guess a few guys came in after gambling/drinking, whatever, about 3 and were very loud for over an hour before they passed out. I could hear every word of their conversation. The second night, we heard helicopters for several hours after we went to bed. I found the employees working the desk a bit rude, not friendly at all. I witnessed two of them rolling their eyes at a guest who came down in a panic, complaining that she had just been stuck in their elevator for over ten minutes. Breakfast was fine. Not alot of choices, but plenty, and for the most part, healthy. They always had some protein choices along with the usual toast, cereal, and bagels or muffins and fruit. I probably would not go back here again. Not anything special enough to make me want to ever go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay for 4th time”
Reviews.Author: JTHONOLULU
Reviews.Content: We arrived on May 20th and stayed until the 27th- As always the feeling is one of an apartment just off the strip. Business travelers may not like this resort if they are used to Hiltons and other types of high rise hotels that are posh with a view. Desert Rose is a a comfortable place for people who value a home feel and like to be tucked away from all the loads of people on the strip. It is a remodeled small apartment establishment with a small pool and modest offerings for a free breakfast. It is better than a comfort Inn or Holiday Inn but not as posh as a large mega resort. So if you are looking for comfort and a lived in sort of place that has everything supplied that a vacation home should have. this place is for you. If you are looking for a polished sleek new place or trendy place- somthing like the Palms or MGM may suit your taste a bit better.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem of a Find”
Reviews.Author: PolishPrincess2010
Reviews.Content: We feel so fortunate to have found the Desert Rose Resort! It is a gem of a place to stay, an oasis among all the gigantic hotels on The Strip. Because it is a time-share, each room is very large with a full kitchen, living room, dining area, large bedroom and bathroom. A bonus is the extra-deep tub/shower combo. The pool is lovely, quiet, and well-maintained . The morning continental breakfast (served in the large lobby) is good, and the coffee is EXCELLENT--Starbucks! The staff were all efficient, courteous, and helpful. There is no gambling in this resort (a bonus for us); however, you have any number of places to gamble as this resort is only two blocks off the Strip, just down from the MGM Grand. We will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Total comfort and great value.”
Reviews.Author: skyeFife
Reviews.Content: Wonderfull stay. Great value for money. More like an apartment than a hotel room. Friendly and helpful staff. Free Breakfast was adequate for our needs. Only minutes from the strip. Perfect retreat from the hustle and bustle of the casinos. Very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “An early Anniversary Trip”
Reviews.Author: jimchriston
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay in Las Vegas. The resort staff were most helpful with arranging for theater tickets and any requests that arose. The pool and the other amenites were above any expectaions I could have anticipated. We spent the mornings relaxing at the pool side. The after noons were spent shopping and visiting the Casinos. There are so many shows and places to see, you should plan well a head to get the most out of your time spent in this marvelouse city.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for more!”
Reviews.Author: Blooms1745
Reviews.Content: What a great little hotel (little by Las Vegas standards). Had all of the amenities without the hassle of a huge casino hotel (like walking a mile to your room -- through the casino). Staff was so accommodating; suites were roomy with everything you could possibly need, modern and clean! Best of all, could not beat the price. We stayed 5 nights total -- 3 before leaving for northern Arizona and 2 upon our return. Also close to the Strip. Would stay there again in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “We were very pleased with both the staff and the accomodations offered by the Desert Rose.”
Reviews.Author: FranksGal
Reviews.Content: Am always a little leery making reservations with hotels I am not familiar with. Prices for the Desert Rose were less than I had anticipated so I wasn't sure what we would get for the money. It turned out we were very pleased. It was very spacious and clean. The rooms offered a small kitchen area and separate tv area which I had not expected. We were walking distance from the strip and only a couple miles from the airport. I was grateful it lacked a casino area making it much more private than other hotels. The staff responded nicely to a couple of odd ball requests we made of them. I would definitely stay there again should we return to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Resort close to the strip”
Reviews.Author: crebroker
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the resort with my mom. This was my second visit. I was there for business and she joined me for rest and relaxation. The resort is impectible clean, the rooms exceeded our expectations and the complimentary breakfast was great. There was only one tiny complaint, they were having roof work done during our stay and the last two mornings we were woken up by 8 am due to noise. This I am sure is a one time issue and we understood the need for roof maintenance but asked the staff to instuct the workers to begin after 9 am in the future. Stay here! You will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “We Loved It !!!”
Reviews.Author: GPStin
Reviews.Content: What a great resort for a family vacation to Las Vegas. Far enough off the strip to enjoy peace and quiet around the pool ... close enough to be right in the heart of all the action after a short walk. We had a two-bedroom suite that accommodated our family (wife, three teens, and myself) very sufficiently. Great maid service, very clean and well-decorated room. Really neat shower in the master bedroom ... five shower heads!!! We were able to park right in front of our suite each day and night when we returned to the resort ... plenty of spaces available. If you're looking for a great family resort in the Las Vegas area, this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good for families, good value for Vegas”
Reviews.Author: tcombs
Reviews.Content: First off, As others have commented your not going to get a view of much of anything, it's either parking lot or very tiny court yard at best. That being said it is well situationed very close to airport and half block off the strip. I think it is well suited for families. Kitchen sitting room, clean and comfortable. Good value for the money. But not a high rise hotel. Comfortable bed. Don't get a room on the south side (Reno Ave). Nice pool area and good staff.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: amaddex75
Reviews.Content: We had a 1 bedroom suite, roomy, kitchen well supplied, most comfortable bed ever slept on in a hotel. Used the pool area, very nice, the only blip in our stay was the elliptical trainer was of very poor quality but we just settled for the treadmill instead. The staff were friendly and helpful. The location was great, just far enough off the strip to be quiet and relaxing and close enough to walk to the entertainment. Thanks for the great stay !!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: GranysT
Reviews.Content: I was only able to stay here 1 night, but wish it could have been at least a week.  I reserved it online, sight unseen, but couldn't have been happier, once we checked in.  I  reserved the 2 bedroom suite, for 5 of us. It was huge, and fit all of us very comfortably. Besides the 2 bedrooms, it had a kitchen, a dining area, a living room area, and a nice balcony. The only downside to this place is,  it is not directly on the strip, and does not have a casino in house. However, it is just a short 2 block walk over to the strip. I highly recommend the Desert Rose, and would return over and over.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing...”
Reviews.Author: TheGlobetraveler
Reviews.Content: After reading the positive reviews here I thought I would give the place a try as I was in town for a convention at the Mandalay Bay, the location was close by, and I'm not a big fan of casino hotels. I had reserved a one bedroom room for four nights but was unable to obtain a room not facing an interior courtyard (I use that term loosely, as it really is a quite small space and one half is taken up by room walls jutting inward) or in an uninhabitable state after checking in and viewing three rooms. The two rooms facing the interior courtyard offered no privacy either due to people peering in from the other side of the small courtyard or from the walkways right next to the rooms. The second condo had a view out of the living room directly into a stucco wall about 15 feet away. The balcony and chairs of the third non-courtyard room #1314 was covered with pigeon droppings from pigeons living in a pine tree right in front of the balcony and they were sitting on the balcony railings and lights when I walked in the room. Based on the tremendous accumulation of droppings it was apparent the balcony had not been cleaned in some time and there was a cigarette butt in the ashtray. I wasn't expecting any great views at this hotel, but those courtyard rooms offer no privacy whatsoever, and after seeing the third room I decided to cut my time lost and used the free WiFi to book myself at another hotel. I subsequently spoke with the on duty manager and he informed me that most of the one bedrooms are in this configuration and that generally the rooms facing outward were two bedrooms. He then proceeded to charge me a half a nights cancellation fee (past the 48 hour deadline) even though I never used any room and had checked in on time with every intention of staying had a suitable room been available. I would also note that I encountered other guests trying to change rooms during my extended time in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely return.”
Reviews.Author: lcwtourist
Reviews.Content: I live in Phoenix so I have been to Vegas many times. This particular trip was with my husband and we were meeting close friends to celebrate a 40th birthday. This place was perfect. It is located right off the strip (a small block) so it is convenient. The suites are a great size. There is a TV in both the living area and the bedroom. The bed was very comfy unlike many hotel beds. There is a small balcony. Having a full kitchen(with everything you need) was great because we ate breakfast in the room (they do have a complimentry breakfast in the lobby). We also kept snacks and cocktails in the room. The prices are more than resonable and be sure to check out their specials on the website. The staff was professional and friendly. One night the hotel had a complimentry happy hour of beer and wine. This place is definitely appropriate for families. I highly recommend the Desert Rose unless you need dining, casino and nightlife in your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: Laujam
Reviews.Content: The Desert Rose is a great place to stay while in Vegas. It's quiet, clean, close to the strip, comfortable and comes with a price you cannot beat. Staff is so accommodating and the suites are huge. Most of the guests are on the older side , which makes it nice for those of us that value peace over party.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: livemusic158
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay. The rooms were extremely clean and spacious. It was also very quiet and comfortable. There was a full kitchen, living room, bedroom (both bedroom and living room had a nice TV) a bathroom, a small dining area and a make-up/sink/counter space between the bathroom and bedroom. They had free beer, wine, soda, and snacks from 5pm-7pm which was nice. All of the staff were very nice and helpful. They had a computer in the lobby that we could use to print off our plane tickets, and they also had an ATM right in the lobby as well. The one bad thing about it was that it was on the far end of the strip so it was a long walk to get some of the attractions that were on the other end of the strip. We ended up taking a cab a few of the nights because it was such a long walk. If you don't mind the little bit of extra walking or taking a short cab ride (from the hotel to the other end of the strip cost about $10) this is a great place to stay and I would absolutely recommend it especially for those who are low-key and don't want all the crowds that some of the casinos have.

Reviews.Title: “Best Decision we ever made”
Reviews.Author: SuperLou40
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a hotel that did not have a casino and we stumbled upon the Desert Rose Resort. One word to describe it would be awesome. It was about 650 sq ft of luxury for an incredibily resonable price. It had a full kitchen which helped us immensely as we were on a tight budget. When I say full kitchen it had silverware, pot and pans and small appliances. It was truly one of the best experiences that we have ever had at a hotel. The staff was incredibly friendly and check in and check out was a breeze.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hidden Gem!!”
Reviews.Author: panda60
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on reviews here on tripadvisor as it seemed too good to be true! My rooms were spacious and had more than I expected.. including a dishwasher (detergent included too!) Fully equiped kitchen, large lounge/dining room with very comfy sofa. Comp toiletries in the spotless bathroom, plenty of towels too.. I had a one bedroom suite and it made the perfect location for my birthday treat! Local phone calls from the room were also free !! The pool area was not huge but the right size for the hotel and unlike other Vegas hotels that have very limited pool opening hours this one was open from 0800 to 2300.. fab to take a dip after a hard days sightseeing! Breakfast is included and had plenty of choice, no problem if you prefered to take your food/drinks back to your room to eat and no restrictions on how much you could have.. The Managers drinks and snacks Mon-Thu 1700-1900 was a lovely extra too.. again as much as you'd like!! The staff were very friendly and helpful throughout my stay, taxis would arrive very quickly when I asked for one. The front desk staff were great too, my request for a late check-out was handled with no problems too.. Whilst the hotel is off strip slightly it does mean you get a quieter area to stay in which can be nice after the busy strip.. It is a bit of a walk but I felt perfectly safe returning late at night.. It's about a 10 minute walk to the strip and the bus stops are near the junction.. It's close to the rear of the MGM Grand where the Monorail starts from so more convenient than other hotels! I would definately stay here on any future Vegas trips as there is no bad thing to say about the Desert Rose!! Taxi from the airport was about $15 and the return trip was about $9, so a winner there too!! This is the best hotel I've stayed in for solo travel in many countries.. can't wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Our "Go-To" Resort! Our favorite Las Vegas Gem!”
Reviews.Author: runmommierun
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this Gem 3 times so far. We love everything about it and feel so comfortable and welcome when we go. It is a short, short walk to the strip. Hooters casino/hotel is 2 minutes away! You are close enough to the action but far enough from the strip to get away from it all. The staff has always been so wonderful. The beds are comfortable, the kitchers are well appointed and the bathrooms are clean. We just can't say enough about this place! We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here anytime”
Reviews.Author: TheOCTravelers
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Desert Rose a couple of times and I would go back there every time we go to Vegas. We LOVE Las Vegas and go several times a year. We like a room that we can relax in and crash in. The rooms at the Desert Rose are EXCELLENT!!! They are huge and beautiful and for the price you cannot find anything better. The hotel is only slightly off the strip and a short walk or cab to the strip. The last time we were here we stayed for 4 days and loved each one. The hotel offers a free continental breakfast every day and a free cocktail hour during the weeknights. You won't get a better value for your money. We stayed in the bedroom and our friends slept on the sleeper sofa. There was plenty of room for everyone and we loved our stay. If you are going to Vegas for the pool they offer a simple pool...nothing to write home about but plenty of sun to get your bronze on.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: howmil
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Desert Rose for 5 weekdays from May 17-21. The breakfast in the morning and the cocktail hour from 5-7 pm add to it's value. We had a 1 bedroom suite and it had plenty of space with a full kitchen. The bathroom was rather small but adequate. We had a 3rd floor room in building one and never had any noise problems. It only takes a couple of minutes to walk to the Hooters casino if you want to gamble. It is about 2 blocks to the strip and is an easy walk. I could not get the wireless to work in my room but you can use the computer in the lobby if you need to get email etc. The pool area always had chairs available and was rather quiet but relaxing. We rented a car and were able to park right by our building without a long walk to our room. If you don't mind the lack of an onsite casino and a view of the strip this is an excellent choice. We ended up paying about 42.00/night thru resortime.com and would definately return.

Reviews.Title: “excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: johncl1953
Reviews.Content: Spend one week at the Desert Rose and could not fault it at all. Quiet location but only 5 mins walk from the strip. When I go back I will be back here.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious room at a good value”
Reviews.Author: gary053
Reviews.Content: We opted for the 2-bedroom, 2-bath unit on the third floor (top floor). Spacious, lots of closets, full kitchen and a balcony. These are timeshare 'condos', so have cooking utensils and dishes, plus other amenities that hotel rooms don't. We rented through Travelocity and that went smoothly; our first time and we were pleased. Some of the units had no view off the balcony (other than another balcony). We were on the outside, so could see trees and hear the birds. On the other side of the complex, views of The Strip would be available. Our room had three televisions, but they were dated monsters with not-very-good pictures. Good thing we turned on the tv only to watch the weather report in the mornings. We would stay here again; probably for a week: these are like apartments, except with daily maid service.

Reviews.Title: “Accomodating”
Reviews.Author: DC757
Reviews.Content: Stayed a week at Desert Rose Resort in 4/18 - 4/24 to celebrate friends birthday. What a pleasant stay in 'Vegas it was. The resort was just right. Clean, quiet and close to the action. Location 5 minutes from airport, off the strip but close enough to walk to the strip was perfect. Right next to Hooters and block and half from strip, MGM and the tram. Ideal since we didn't wanted to relax away from hotel casinos. A drive to Lake Mead and the Hoover dam took about a half hour and shopping was everywhere. The one bedroom suite was large with a super comfortable king bed, well appointed full kitchen and comfortable furniture plus free wifi. I was impressed with the cleanliness and service throughout Desert Rose. It quickly became a home away from home. Customer service was very good and given with a smile by every one we encountered at the resort. But there was one issue, with housekeeping. We had to call the desk a couple of times after we returned to our room and found it cleaned but with no wash clothes or towels. This was bizarre considering the dirty ones had been removed but not replaced. This was immediately resolved within 15 minutes of notifying the front desk. Desert Rose Resort helped to make a birthday celebration extra special. The comfortable room, cleanliness and customer service delivered means I will be returning on my next 'Vegas trip.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort”
Reviews.Author: Bella85033
