Reviews.Content: We traveled to Las Vegas NV May 17-21, 2010 and stayed at the Desert Rose Resort which was a wonderful surprise. The Resort people were one of the friendliest, helpful we have encountered in awhile. The resort itself was beautiful and just 2 blocks from the center of the Las Vegas Strip. Everything was just at our finger tips and great access to all the public transportation. Their idea of a continental breakfast was a full setup for us. We had our choices of several delicious food options which gave us all the energy we needed to start our day. Then the happy hour around the pool was just more than we could ask for. What a delight it was to stay at such a beautiful resort. If you are planning a trip to Las Vegas we highly recommend the Desert Rose Resort. The room itself felt like an apartment and like home. The accomadations were more than we expected and the service we received was top notch. Only one suggestion I would make is possibly have DVD players installed in the livingroom as well as the bedroom but if you want to sit back and relax with a movie they have HBO.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic again 3 times in row (this time for my wedding)”
Reviews.Author: longy7925
Reviews.Content: hey everyone myself , my new wife and all of our family stayed here in middle weeks of may and had a fantastic time once again myself and my wife have stayed here now 3 times, this year we were in vegas to get married at the wynn hotel the rooms are always clean, huge and literally like your own 2 bed aprtment which comes with everything u need, oven, fridge, microwave, balcony, king size bed etc the staff are lovely and go out of there way to help, we did have one issue with one of the reception girls who on that day must have been moody, but apart from that all where nice the pool area is great and where we spent most of our time, try to get there at 8am though to get a sunbed, u have to be like the germans with the towells, breakfast is good and wide selection overall we would stay here again, but not for few years, need a break from vegas, awesome place and best place to stay is here, location location is great

Reviews.Title: “great resort at great price”
Reviews.Author: johnhamilton_10
Reviews.Content: stayed in desert rose resort las vegas in may 2010.second visit here,located right behind tropicana 100yards from hooters.one block of strip..stayed in one bed apartment with full kitchen and balcony,very clean house keeping everyday,free breakfast,nice and quiet with pool and gym. stay 3nites get fourth free was promotion when we booked. great value.would stay again no problem.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: meggy
Reviews.Content: we stayed here from 5 may to 20 may quick ride fron airport arrived about 1pm went to check in asked for a room upgrade to 2 bed apt were given on for $25 extra a night but with husband and 24 yr old daughter we thought it was worth the extra the check in was ouick and we were in our room in about 15mins our room was facing the road above reception . the walk to strip was about 15 mins walk as my husband walks with a stick we were not walking fast would stay here again next time in vegas

Reviews.Title: “Nice view off the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: chillypea
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a busy Friday evening, the lobby was packed and we were immediately greeted. Check in was quick and easy, we didn't get harassed to partake in any timeshare opportunities, which can be obnoxious and it was an easy drive across the parking lot to our room. Upon walking in, I noticed the beautiful view of the strip from our balcony. We were still close enough to enjoy the tall buildings and the lights in the evening, but still far enough away to enjoy peace and quiet. We were well within walking distance to the main strip, and for night I packed a pair of heels in my purse and headed over in flip flops! The room was a nice copper orange color, the amenities and appliances were all updated. I was impressed with the granite counter tops in the kitchen and bathroom area. The tub was very large, great for 2 adults or even multiple young children. The continental breakfast in the mornings was a must have. They weren't lacking a thing when it came to options. It was definitely an extension to most that you see. The staff was courteous, I had a sore throat one evening and the front desk receptionist went into the Emergency Kit to get me a couple of lozenges as the mini convenience store on site did not have any for sale. Yes, there is also a special mini store where you can purchase items such as cold medicine, beverages, snacks and the shaving cream you forgot to pack! The pool area was packed, there weren't a million kids around, and everyone around seemed to be enjoying themselves. 2 small negatives: the A/C in the room wasn't circulating to the bedroom, and it seemed warm in the bedroom and the Hooters Casino, directly next door, had a loud DJ and music until 12 am or 1am. Ordinarily that wouldn't bother me, as I am a young adult, however, I wasn't feeling good one evening and the noise made it hard to get rest. Someone with small children or an older couple probably would have complained about it. All in all, we had a wonderful time and look forward to going back again!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best places to stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: caretaker69
Reviews.Content: What can you say about the Desert Rose, 1. Fast check in with no hassle. 2. Great location, 10 min walk to MGM Grand, if you turn right outside main entrance, 10 min walk to Luxor. Easy access to your room. 3. Close to Airport but not to close for aircraft noise. Room very quiet. Bed was fantastic. 4. Great staff, freindly. The free breakfast is more than enough to fill you. 5. Room size and quality are top marks, you could of lived in the room we had. ( one bedroom suite on 3rd floor ) Would i go again, yes it's better than the strip.

Reviews.Title: “sweet home with relaxing daytime and thrills in the night”
Reviews.Author: zhouyu112
Reviews.Content: All four in my family including my husband, daughter, and mother-in-law were much pleased by the two-bed room apt. The settings inside the apt suit all our needs, separate area for everybody, in-room safe, wireless internet, three TVs, the cooking utensils, etc. The staffs are very friendly and helpful. The location is also perfect, so close to the strip while away from the noises. I definitely will stay here when I come to vegas again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort Excelent Customer Care”
Reviews.Author: dltnana
Reviews.Content: The resort is a block from the strip behind the MGM. The rooms are good sized, they offer breakfast in the morning and cocktails<beer and wine> in the afternoon. They have a nice pool and exercise area. This resort stands out because of the excelent customer care. I didn't come in to contact with one person who didn't greet you with a smile and ask if they could do something for you. If you needed anything they were right there to help you out which also helps set the mood for everyone else.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay, excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: I-love-love-holidays
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for somewhere within walking distance of the strip and at a fraction of the price then this is your place! A 10-15 minute walk will take you to the MGM Grand and NY NY on the strip. Our stay came with continental breakfast which was great as Vegas is a money pit anyway, so saving on having to go out for breakfast helped. The rooms were clean however ours did have a slight musty smell - didnt warrent a complaint. Free wi-fi was available in the rooms and there was a PC in the lobby that also let you print for free - handy as I needed to checkin online for another flight. Overall we had a great stay. The pool area was looked great - however we never had time to use it! Staff were friendly and helpful. I would maybe consider staying on the strip if I was to go back to LV - but I think that would be for the experience - if you are on a budget this is a brilliant option (booked through Expedia for a great discounted rate).

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the stay.”
Reviews.Author: vegaslover2010
Reviews.Content: Stayed here again for the 3rd year running. The location was excellent and that fact it was not a casino was an advantage. We were there this time for eldest son's wedding at the Wynn Hotel. There were 14 of us in all staying at the hotel. The rooms are fully equipped with everything needed including the dishwasher ....................not that I did any cooking. The pool area was clean and plenty of sunbeds and clean towels. The grounds were tidy and flowers in abundance. The breakfast was a buffet and plenty for everyone to choose from. Happy hour was available but we were too busy to go. Free WiFi access available in the rooms and also in reception. Nothing was too much trouble and Dyxie the Concierge was very helpful when we needed to book limousines for the wedding day. Reception staff were very helpful and put most of our party in one block. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas for great weekends!”
Reviews.Author: AlbertaFamily_fun
Reviews.Content: We have had teenagers, and extended family trips and have stayed at the Desert Rose Resort on two occasions. We will stay again. Price is excellent; location certainly suits our needs, everything is within walking distance; beds are very comfortable; pool is certainly adequate. We had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Good value non casino location for one night stopover”
Reviews.Author: DWHandMJH
Reviews.Content: We needed a room for a one night flying visit to Vegas - and preferred a non casino location. Desert Rose provided this, just off the Strip; we got a good price through Expedia in the UK . Breakfast was adequate and pretty chaotic.

Reviews.Title: “It was the perfect place for us as first timers”
Reviews.Author: stuartrmwatson
Reviews.Content: Fully equipped kitchen allowed us to do our own breakfast/lunch/dinner when we desired. Pool was nice. A few more chairs at pool would be good. Cable TV had limited channel selection, but adequate. Other than that: staff was professional, helpful, charming. Property is well maintained, Rooms in great shape. Bed comfy. Water pressure was decent. Location good (but, yes, a "Las Vegas block" is quite long. Felt secure, safe. Free breakfast was good). Balconies were a welcome bonus, especially if one smokes. Great for families and couples who may want to be a bit detached from the bustle (and tip-crazy) strip hotels. Overall, we had a thoroughly enjoyable stay and will stay there again, without question. Oh, and the concierge service was above par. Great advice. Good discounts.

Reviews.Title: “Untidy Suites”
Reviews.Author: meg7890
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed here during the last week of April for a mini vacation, and we couldn't agree more with the rooms being too outdated. We noticed also there were dried stains on the walls, carpet and the bottom layer of the sofas...not a resort quality room. The location was so so we still did a lot of walking to the strip however.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Gladys50
Reviews.Content: I recently spent four nights at the Desert Rose with five female members of my family to celebrate two “big” birthdays. We booked a one bedroomed and a two bedroomed suite which enabled all of us to have a bed to ourselves. Two of these were the sofa beds, but were very comfortable. Our stay was very good value, with continental breakfast included, and on two of the nights we were there, the Manager’s reception with free wine, beer and soft drinks, and some nibbles. The coffee machines were available all day too. The staff were all very friendly. There was a laundry room with enormous washing machines. There is a small convenience shop next to reception where we were able to buy some milk to go with the coffee provided in the suites. If you wanted to cater for yourself, the kitchens in the suites were well equipped, and there were two barbecues near the pool which guests could use. Not sure where the nearest supermarket was. Slight drawback was that as there were six of us we needed to have two taxis to go anywhere, as five is the maximum the cabs will take, and on the odd occasion there were five of us we had to walk up to Hooters or MGM Grand to get a five seater taxi as the company the hotel deal with only have three this size, and the wait was long. Las Vegas is a great place to visit, but we wouldn’t have wanted to stay in one of the Strip casino hotels – imagine coming down to breakfast every day and being faced with all those slot machines and gaming tables! Desert Rose was just far enough back to be a quiet haven, but near enough to walk to the sights. We appreciated the pool on warm days, and the comfort of our living rooms on cooler days. The hotel also had free wifi access, great to be able to keep in touch with the male members of the family left behind! Would recommend a helicopter trip to the Grand Canyon – we went with Maverick Helicopters, and had a thirty minutes stop in the canyon with fizz and snacks. The canyon certainly is an awesome experience I would definitely recommend the Desert Rose.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort in Las Vegas near the Strip”
Reviews.Author: KarenM52
Reviews.Content: The Desert Rose in Las Vegas, NV is a wonderful place to stay. I like that it doesn't have a casino as part of the property, but it is in walking distance to the Las Vegas Strip so the "action" is close by. This was our third trip to the Desert Rose Resort in a little over a year and we will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Simple - cant be beaten for value and service”
Reviews.Author: aremdee
Reviews.Content: We were originally booked for just two days but, coming from York in the UK, were caught up in the Volcanic delays and had an enforced 11 day stay. Thank goodness we were here! It is an absolute gem. The location is off strip and a 5 minute walk to what is admittedly the southern end, Luxor/Excaliber/MGM/Mandalay Bay. It is small compared to the strip hotels, but as a result is friendly with a quiet bustle. The pool was great to sit around for a week and a godsend for the kids (10+12) who made friends easily. The staff are all so friendly and helpful, calling out hellos and when we needed them to quieten down a group of young lads in the room above (one night, and the ONLY loud group we came across in 12 days) they were great and the result instant after a simple call to reception. The rooms are wonderful - large, en-suite, kitchen, dining, lounge area and bigger than the suites at the high end hotel on the strip we'd stayed at earlier. Bed was wonderfully comfortable. The kitchen was invaluable when we needed to keep the costs down (there are supermarkets close-ish by, but need a bus ride, or a hire car). The front desk have take-away menus for pizza/chinese/chicken/burgers etc which can be delivered to the room. There are even two large barbeques in a section close to the pool which we used several times. Great for communal eating or a more private meal at any time. The complimentary drinks (wine and beer-as many as you like/need/want) from 5-7 every weekday are a wonderful touch and the breakfast will set you up for the day (cereal, bagels,toast,fruit,muffins,yoghurt...and lots of hard boiled eggs!). And complimentary newspapers. We met some wonderful people, many of whom were stranded Brits and who prove that the Dunkirk spirit is alive and well, and the Americans that this type of hotel attracts were all really special too. If you want a quiet base to enjoy this wonderful place, close enough to the fizz of the MGM and its neon associates (and even Hooters next door for fun and a good value for money meal) the Desert Rose is the place. We want to go back...

Reviews.Title: “A peaceful, quiet Oasis minutes off the Strip - Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: NDMELGIN
Reviews.Content: We were undecided but took the plunge to stay here mostly on the high rating and recommendations on Trip Advisor. I am so, so pleased we did. Firstly we were astounded that the 'long walk' to the strip that folk had mentioned was in fact a 5 minute walk. 3 minutes to the main entrance of the MGM Grand if you want to get technical. Secondly our room was huge, and quiet. Ideal after a mad night out when you just want to chill out. Thirdly, and this was a big part, the price, for what we had (breakfast included) was superb and allowed us to upgrade our car rental. Hotel staff were very helpful, and breakfast, although a bun fight at times, was actually pretty good. Would thoroughly recommend this place and would stay there again. Very very easy access to the strip and to the monorail stop through the MGM.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet alternative but close to everything”
Reviews.Author: lams45
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here. Bringing older kids with us, the suite gave everyone plenty of space. We really appreciated having 2 bathrooms! It is only a couple of blocks from the strip so we could walk to everything we wanted to see. It was nice and quiet so you could get away from the hustle and bustle of the casino hotels. We didn't use the full kitchen much but everything was there that you would need to make meals. The staff were friendly and helpful. Beds were very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “HIGH RATING FULLY DESERVED”
Reviews.Author: rollingstone66
Reviews.Content: I have to say the Desert Rose fully deserves its high Tripadvisor rating. The main reason for this is the excellent staff. I wanted to checkin early as I had many bags, and the Filipina-American lady (sorry forget her name) was so gracious and helpful in accommodating my request. James was helpful too. The hotel is right smack next to Hooters, near New York New York. Next to the airport. End of the strip. Works for me. The property looks like its at least 15 years old, but very very well maintained. Security is good, coz U need keycard to get in the central courtyards. Back road is closed off at night. My one bedroom apartment came complete with kitchen, but hey who cooks in Vegas??? The living room came with an L-shaped sofa so could sleep extra. Breakfast was competent. Dunno if it reli was Starbucks coffee from the machine... Tasted bland, so it most likely was!!! I just had fruit for breakfast. Love the fact it took me just a minute from car park to my room, after getting tired of staying in the mega hotels.... No fuss, clean rooms... Great people working there.... Will def stay there again....

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, quiet (but close to strip) place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: juy720
Reviews.Content: Desert Rose makes you feel like you are at home but on vacation at the same time. Very helpful and friendly staff. The rooms are spacious and the beds are very comfortable. The free breakfast and happy hour (Mon throughThurs) are a pleasant benefit. The full kitchen saves the expense of eating out all the time. It is near the airport so there is some noise from planes, but overall a nice quiet atmosphere. Close to the action when you want it. The pool is nice and the grounds are well kept.

Reviews.Title: “Just right for my purpose.”
Reviews.Author: richsudd
Reviews.Content: I went to Vegas on business and wanted something clean, quite, curteous and without the hustle & bustle of a casino. I found just that at the Desert Rose Resort. Also the casinos don't offer a continental breakfast, which the Desert Rose did. In addition, they have a Manager's special from 5-7pm, to include FREE beer, wine, soda and snacks. For less than a standard casino room, which gives you a sleeping area and a bathroom, the Desert Rose has suites with a private bedroom and bath, separate to a sitting room, a dining room and a full kitchen with all of the cookware and utincils you need. Between the inexpensive room, the continental breakfast, the manager's special and the fact that I bought my own groceries and cooked my own food; I saved a bundle of money for a 5 day stay.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC!”
Reviews.Author: sierramountaingirls
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Desert Rose. Both times I have only stayed one night while on our way to Zion National Park. We stayed in the two bedroom condo and it was great. Will sleep up to 6 people if needed. Nice to stay in Vegas without having to be in a casino. Staff is wonderful!!! Free happy hour beverages and breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families”
Reviews.Author: teddfamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Desert Rose (2ad, 11yr and 8yr) and couldn't have chosen better. Stayed first night in Las Vegas on the strip at the other end - awful. Moved to Desert Rose for the next 4 nights. What a relief. Spacious, clean, nice pool area, well equipped kitchen and a laundry room downstairs. So nice for the children to have their own room instead of sharing. Staff were friendly and helpful. Enjoyed staying just off the strip as much quieter but only few minutes walk to be in the action. Breakfast was a bit chaotic but absolutely fine for a quick bite before heading out to explore. Great to have free wi-fi as caught in the volcano ash saga so was helpful to find out what was happening. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK................”
Reviews.Author: RedWing11
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights - and it was just OK. Close to strip - you can walk; free cont breakfast & mgr reception - only ate one breakfast as we were not up in time the other days - it was just OK - lots of vulchars hovering around pushing to get to the free food.. Rooms are outdated and need to be upgraded - tvs are old - carpet was worn and dirty - but bed were good. Pool area small and we had to fight for chairs - I felt like I was in Mexico - people putting their towels on chairs and then leaving. Good thing is people go to the pool in shifts - so if you are out there long enough - you eventually get a chair. Staff was very nice - will give them that. I had my laptop and they have free internet which was great - you don't get that in most places. When you are in Vegas you are not in your room much anyway - but it was just OK.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best, but good for the price.”
Reviews.Author: samuelsm0m
Reviews.Content: This is billed as a "resort" though I am not sure why. There is no restaurant or spa or gift shop. I think it would best be described as an extended stay hotel. The suites are quite roomy though everything looks a bit worn. The hotel is convenient to all the large hotels and nightlife. If you are looking for a fancy hotel this is definitely NOT the place. If you just want a simple place at a reasonable price, than this would be a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: arte2k2
Reviews.Content: Walking distance from the Strip, yet quiet. Nice clean swimming-pool, large rooms with fully equipped kitchen, convenient laundry, nice reception good concierge--e.g.: Ms. Dixye--continental breakfast included (the only thing that could and should improve in quality, Eat Well, America!)--except for a good Starbucks coffe. The opposite of the mega hotels, it makes you feel at home. We enjoyed it very much and hope to go back one day!

Reviews.Title: “Too big for one person - got to come back with family”
Reviews.Author: flash54
Reviews.Content: The place is terrific, very big suites - actually too big for just me, so I've got to make sure I have more people next time I come. The rooms are spotless. The kitchen is well equipped - that's another thing - got to get to a grocery to take advantage of the kitchen - I don't usually rent a car in Vegas. The pool area is very nice, and they even have grills available if you want to have your own impromptu pool party. Location is good, close enough to the action, yet far enough for peace and quiet. I purposely chose to be about a mile from my conference in the Mandalay Bay to force me to walk for some exercise. Unfortunately, I got blisters in my toes the first day, and that made the distance from everything a bit painful - not their fault. The neighborhood is a bit dark and empty at night, so I was a little uncomfortable coming back late at night. Staff was friendly and helpful. They have a concierge during the day who can arrange side trips, and helped me with using the local bus system. The continental breakfast was very good, though my sweet tooth would have appreciated some muffins, donuts, sweet rolls or danish. Probably healthier for me that they didn't have them. Altogether, a very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, great value”
Reviews.Author: FTaylor60
Reviews.Content: Wow, what a nice place to stay. We stayed in a 1 bedroom suite for the weekend, and not only was the bed one of the most comfortable I've slept in, but the kitchen was great, had all I could need for a weekend stay in terms of pots and pans, dishes, silverware, full size refrigerator. Housekeeping staff was great, never bothered us though they did make us aware they were available if needed. Pool and hot tub were very nice and clean. And unlike most Vegas hotel, we did not feel compelled to gamble. Strip was only a block away if we wanted any other night life. I would highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Wish we could keep this place a secret!”
Reviews.Author: jimjinphx
Reviews.Content: We travel to Vegas a couple of times a year to visit friends. This was by far the best place we have stayed. Our group had five suites, all were spacious and comfortable, the rates were more than competitive and the staff always helpful. We will be staying here whenever we can on return visits, just wish we could keep it a secret!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Family Base to Explore Vegas and Beyond”
Reviews.Author: Sunnyfaces
Reviews.Content: We (family of five with three kids) stayed for four nights as part of our roadtrip around CA and NV in a very large two bedroom suite - the hotel exceeded all of our expectations with friendly staff, clean rooms, great pool, easy parking and just off the strip near MGM Grand, Luxor etc. The room had a good size kitchen and the nearest 'Safeway' was just a couple of blocks away so getting food and beer was very easy. The hotel had a relaxed atmosphere a world away from the high-rise zero-character corporate hotels nearby. Next time we visit Vegas we'll definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly quiet, yet close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: tami75
Reviews.Content: Our family (myself, my husband, my 13yo daughter and 7yo son) recently visited Las Vegas for the first time. We chose the Desert Rose Resort because we didn't want to stay at one of the Casino Resorts and also wanted a suite. The price was super reasonable. We ended up with a 2 bedroom, 2 bath suite. The Resort was clean and beautiful. The staff not only treated us like we were the most important guests ever, but they genuinely seemed to enjoy their jobs. The resort was seconds from the strip and had several choices nearby for dining options. They also provide a continental breakfast everyday that had 3 people staffing it. They took care of our trash and the buffet was completely stocked until it closed. There was a beautiful pool and hot tub, a laundry facility on site, free wireless and everything else you can imagine. The only thing that the Desert Rose Resort was lacking was a playground, but this was a minor thing. A wonderful family oriented place that is quiet and seemingly secluded, yet in the heart of it all.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: BRs21
Reviews.Content: The Desert Rose resort is a wonderful hotel in LV. It is 5-10 mins walk from strip so a welcome break from all that, but easy to get anywhere if you want to. It has every facility you'd need - things like free wi-fi, free local and 1-800 calls from room, good breakfast, fitness room, swimming pool etc ect - no extra charges for any of this unlike most Vegas hotels so brilliant value. Staff were really helpful when we were stranded due to the volcanic ash situation - and it was the best place to be. 2 bed suite really comfortable - nice, high quality finish - granite work tops in kitchen etc. Were moved by the airline to a 'casino hotel' for last night - made us appreciate Desert Rose even more, particularly its quietness and lack of smoky atmosphere and a nice lobby. Felt safe for children

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, afforable and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Jenn075
Reviews.Content: This was my favorite place to stay in Vegas. The rooms were clean. The resort was smoke-free and there wasn't all the noise of a casino on site. I would highly recommend this resort for families or those who are looking for a relaxing vacation that's not too far from the Las Vegas Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great alternative to busy noisy mall-like hotels”
Reviews.Author: mapantin
Reviews.Content: Great location and very clean and spacious rooms. Great value for the money with personalized attention. Close to MGM so you can get the Las Vegas mega feel if you want or relax is a quiter setting. Would definitely reconsider. Good breakfast as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Mefst
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Desert Rose with our teenager children in March 2010. We had a two bed apartment on the ground floor over looking the pool, everything about the stay was great, the staff, the facilities and the location. The breakfast in the morning was just enough to get your started and the Starbucks Coffee station was perfect for me. The location is about 10 minutes walk from the strip but this was ok because there is so much walking in Vegas anyway. The nearest casino was only next door at Hooter's. I would certainly recommend the Desert Rose for a family holiday. None of the hotels would guarantee connecting rooms which is why we decided to look at apartment accommodation. If I went back with just my husband then I would stay on the strip because we would be looking at a different sort of holiday. Although the hotel is close to the airport, the planes did not bother us.

Reviews.Title: “ideally for families”
Reviews.Author: aviv119
Reviews.Content: We (2P+ 2c (13y+17y)) did there two night stop. We had 2BR apartment which is huge and with fully equip kitchen. For us the big advantages were: Location – very good, just 5~7 min walk from the Luxor and all the south part of the strip. Quiet - contrasted to the big and bustling L.V hotels here you park just near your room and immediately you are in. Also free breakfast which is good for families and no casino or machines in site. Also happy hour (medium quality) if you want.

Reviews.Title: “Retirement trip to remember !”
Reviews.Author: 56steve
Reviews.Content: The Desert Rose Resort is a well kept secret in Vegas, situated just off the strip next to Hooters and Tropicana Hotels - no more than a 5 minute walk to the strip. The hotel features one and two bedroomd self contained appartments of a very good standard, with coffee maker, fridge freezer, dining table and chairs etc etc. Staff are really friendly and helpful and there is a complimentary breakfast. A very good option if travelling with a group or with children in tow.

Reviews.Title: “A GEM”
Reviews.Author: PURpleYAMS
Reviews.Content: Decided to splurge on my birthday and headed out west to vegas. STayed with Desert rose for the entire duration of our trip. Check in was a breeze although there was a mini line. Very busy during happy hours by the lobby, everyone wants the freebies. The rooms were comfortable, housekeeping did a good job in the upkeep of the rooms. BLdg 4 was were we stayed. Noises from other rooms could be heard from the inside but to a minimal. breakafast and wifi complimentary. WOuld go back again. In fact Im booking now for my next trip!!!

Reviews.Title: “An Incredible Find”
Reviews.Author: Rathskeller
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Desert Rose with friends on a "Boy's weekend". This place is fantastic! The rooms were big and clean, the service was outstanding and the location can't be beat. Tucked behind the Hooters Casino, it's an easy stumble from the Strip. The pool area was clean and organized with lots of lounge chairs. The free breakfast was simple and a little crowded, but certainly enough to get your day started. Have I mentioned how great the staff is? If you need it (show tickets, a taxi, recommendations for a good club) they'll take care of it. Oh yeah, and they have free wi-fi. Free wi-fi in Vegas? Are you kidding me? We had a blast in Vegas and it was largely due to the Desert Rose. Next time I'm back, I'm staying at the Desert Rose.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotel stays I've ever had!”
Reviews.Author: missyluvsandy
Reviews.Content: We were looking for something decent with a decent price and our expectations were blown away by this hotel. The staff was unbelievably friendly, the rooms were surprisingly nice and the location was great! They have kitchens with all the appliances and utensils needed. The rooms were quiet and very clean with a really pretty balcony. Located just off the strip, it's only a short walk to the strip and the Monorail system. They had happy hour in the lobby which gives everyone a chance to mingle and enjoy free wine and beer. The pool and spa was a nice break from all the sightseeing. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for something clean, pretty and quiet, close enough to enjoy the sights yet far enough away to be a relaxing break from the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but issues with service"”
Reviews.Author: luscious55
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel has a great location and the daily cleaning is appreciated, there were too many things that went wrong with the our stay. From a suite that was near the outside stairs, I was awakened every morning at 6:00am by other guests tromping down the stairs to cleaning staff entering the suite WITHOUT knocking to it taking 2 days to replace small appliances that were not working..........not sure if I will stay at this hotel when there are so many more choices out there.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant”
Reviews.Author: stringy26
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem. So close to the strip,5 mins walk to MGM, less to Hooters. Mandalay Bay, Tropicana , Luxor, Excalibur, just a little further. The hotel is very clean, the most wonderful beds, heated pool and jacuzzi. Staff are wonderful, breakfast is enough,cereals,toast, boiled eggs bagels ,fruit, butter, jam ,cream cheese. Endless coffee, juice. Coffee available all day. Not forgetting , cocktail time Mon - Thursday 5-7 wine and beer plus nibbles. Needless to say some days it is very hectic,breakfast is always busy. But you can always take it back to your room, or have room service. In English travel brochures i think it is advertised as room only, but breakfast and cocktails are included when you get there.. Would definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place close to the strip”
Reviews.Author: fourmoles
Reviews.Content: Stay close to the strip without having to drag your luggage and family through a smoky casino to get to your room. Clean, spacious and friendly. Great for a family. The most comfortable beds! ahh....

Reviews.Title: “Another Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: jaw914
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed at the Desert Rose Resort. I can tell you that it won't be our last! It offers all the comforts of home and then some. Love the location also, as you can walk to the Strip. We honestly can't find anything to complain about!

Reviews.Title: “You will feel welcomed from the minute you arrive”
Reviews.Author: Angel226
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Desert Rose Resort for 4 nights after reading the positive feedback from prior visitors. We were not disappointed. From the minute you arrive the staff is so ready to help...you can see that each employee takes their jobs very seriously. One morning I entered the elevator and saw a worker actually picking up crumbs that were on the floor of the elevator! Cleanliness and attention to the landscaping is evident as you observe the staff perfoming their daily tasks. We felt very safe and the room was clean and well appointed with just about everything you would need to feel like you were home! I would highly suggest The Desert Rose Resort if you are looking for a clean, quiet and reasonable place to stay in Las Vegas. Close to all the casinos and a short cab ride to the local supermarket makes for a great find! We would definitely return to The Desert Rose on any future trips to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “There hospitality was above the rest.”
Reviews.Author: mayday0509
Reviews.Content: The location was stuggled in behind Hooters. Close enough to walk to the strip. The rooms were very quiet, clean, extremely well maintained and well managed. Room service for breakfast was available and we took advantage of it. Daily newspaper and cleaning was a surprising service. The resort took extra steps to make everyone feel welcome. I would stay here again. We have been to Las Vegas 3 times, we always stayed at a bigger resort. We first thought the resort was going to be too small, however it was perfect. Not too big or too small.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: kmjlhs
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights during a spring break trip. Location is just off the south end of the Strip, easy walking to all hotels and restaurants. Free parking and free wi-fi, although a little slow. Continental breakfast is included, but get there early, because it can be a zoo. Our initial room was at the south end of the complex adjacent to Reno Ave. Trucks traveled through there during the evening and early morning hours, so be sure to request a room closer to the pool or lobby areas. They moved us after the first night. We had a 2 bedroom, 2 bath unit with kitchen. TVs in the living area and each bedroom. Overall, it was a great value at less than $100/night.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Hotel in Good Location”
Reviews.Author: thrifty
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel because of its good reviews and the reasonable price. The hotel staff were indeed very friendly and helpful. The location was perfect for us, within walking distance of our favorite strip hotel New York, New York. That’s where we enjoyed some good food and drink in the various pubs and eateries. On our first night, due to late arrival, we dined at Hooter’s (Mad Onion café) next door, which is also a pretty good place to eat. Breakfast, next day, in the hotel was fairly basic and much less exciting than we expected. The hotel suites were spacious, comfortable and the whole place was nice and quiet. Overall this was excellent value for money and we will definitely stay here again on our next visit. The only real issue was getting to the hotel, even though it is close to the airport. There were no shuttles when we arrived, so we had to take a taxi and as usually happens with us, we were ripped off. My advice to everyone is to wait for a shuttle. At least they have a fixed price and if they take you on an involuntary detour, it won’t cost you extra!

Reviews.Title: “Good cheap alternative to big casinos”
Reviews.Author: denandmark
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights while on a road trip in the western USA. We had a suite which was ideal with having my 15 year old son with us. The place is well situated just of the strip, next to Hooters and MGM. Breakfast is free, if a bit limited, and the rooms are fine, considering you won't want to spend too much time in them with everything else going on.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable value, but nothing special...”
Reviews.Author: familymomSanDiego
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for an inexensive place to stay near the strip, this is a decent choice, especially if you need separate sleeping areas for adults and children. Be absolutely sure to check into all special deals before you book. The pool was quite chilly, despite being advertised as heated. Breakfast and happy hour are there, but not substantial. Rooms were comfortable and clean, and a complete kitchen was handy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value - Avoid Rooms on Ground Floor Beside Major Road”
Reviews.Author: KMF_Manitoba
Reviews.Content: We booked this room based on trip advsior ratings. Overall we were not disappointed and this is a good value hotel. We would certainly book there again. During our four night stay, we found the staff to very polite and helpful. We travel often and found that the service at this hotel was certainly beyond what we have come to expect. The suite was spacious and comfortable. We didn't really take advantage of the fully euipped kitchen but it would be beneficial during a longer stay. The one piece of advice we would offer is to avoid a room at the south end of the cmplex. This overlooks a fairly busy road. Without exception we heard traffic at 04:00 am and through the night. The included buffet breakfast is a plus for those wanting to get an earlier start to the day. The selection of food is limited but, for the price, one really can't expect more. Although, if you were later to the buffet, pickings were that much more slim as was the available seating. The hotel is a short walk from the strip and handy to the monorail.

Reviews.Title: “Good spot in a mad city!”
Reviews.Author: DublinDolphin
Reviews.Content: Booked this based on trip advisor reviews and wasn't disappointed. Less than 10 minute walk to the main hotels/strip area. The room was clean and spacious. Hotel staff were very helpful. We got a good price on the net. The breakfast is a bit chaotic and a bit lacking in choice i.e. no fruit but there is plenty of cereal and toast. If I go to Vegas again I would stay at this hotel again. p.s. While in Vegas its worth going to the two outlets the one beside the airport and the prime one also. Prime one is mainly labels the airport one is more of a mix.

Reviews.Title: “If this hotel is available I'll never stay with relatives again. it was Great!”
Reviews.Author: carolynoats
Reviews.Content: Everyone was accommodating, friendly and well manored. It didn't feel like Sin City. It felt like home. Everything was made convient for us. The two bedroom was a plus for my family of 4. Your rates were affordable which helped me turn from the others and I was not sorry. We didn't even have to worry about breakfast. Please stay this way for years to come. I will be referring friends and other family members of course.

Reviews.Title: “Good, cheap not too far off of the strip”
Reviews.Author: Edub71
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Desert Rose during the first March Madness weekend. Figured it would be very busy, but with the economy still in the dumps there weren't as many people as I had originally expected. The hotel itself is located just behind Hooters and is within a 10 minute walk of everything at that end of the strip. Plus, it was fairly easy to find and had plenty of parking. The room itself was of the suite variety and more than met my needs. Honestly, why does anyone go to Vegas for the room? What a waste of time. Anyway, the room was clean and located somewhat close the pool. The only (major) downside was that it was also near a stair well that patrons used at all hours of the day. The door slammed over and over. Suffice to say, that was very annoying. And there doesn't appear much insulation between the floors. I could pretty much hear every step that the neighbor above me took. Aside from that, the hotel was just fine. Just try for a top floor and possibly away from a stair well. At $65 per night, it was well worth it. Even with the minor annoyances. If you are looking to save a few coins, I'd highly recommned this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great price and location”
Reviews.Author: PKPAmes_Iowa
Reviews.Content: Nice place for cost and location. Only complaints - noise from room above, we were on ground floor, living room was a little small with sleeper pulled out and breakfast very crowded but atleast they offered some form of breakfast. Would stay again. Front desk people were always friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and great room:”
Reviews.Author: ekf11
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights with my family (husband, 2 kids ages 6 and 3) and my best friend. We got a two bedroom suite for $102 a night, excellent price. We were within walking distance of the strip. Both my kids were able to make the walk to the MGM Grand where we road the Monorail so we didn't make them walk too much to go see the Treasure Island show, the Mirage volcano, or the fountain at the Bellagio. This room amenities were absolutely perfect. The bedding was superb and it had everything we need to feed the kids in the morning at their continental breakfast. If you have small kids and don't want to stay at a huge casino this is the perfect spot.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Condo”
Reviews.Author: ronniwho
Reviews.Content: The photos on this site well represent the look of this timeshare Condo we stayed 9 days at. My room, about 4 rooms in from the street, was quiet - never heard anyone. Police and Fire station is about 1 mile south so you do hear sirens, but it is not that loud. The breakfast is bread heavy - all kinds of bread, bagel, oatmeal, cereal, bagels, one option of whole fruit switched each day. Several conference groups were staying at the Condo's while I was there so it is hard to find a seat for breakfast between 8-9 a.m. free happy hour of wine and beer 5-7, M-Th, not a lot of ppl partake. pool is heated, we same even on cold eves., as long as you stay in pool, it's fine, jacuzzi's (2) are steaming hot, gym of 6 machines - they work but need repair - all the options do not work and the elipitical trainer could be dangerous being so jerky. Security is all around, but this is a safe area, up on Koval, on the north side of Tropicana is ALL homeless/drunks/drugs so security must be IF that element "wanders" over. staff is friendly. With kids, I would stay here all the time to get away from the casino atmosphere. there is a small snack shop, no real food items, just lunchables, and no alcohol. If you have a car, there is a Food4Less grocery about 2 miles south on L.V. blvd, otherwise, just an AMPM shop about one block walk.

Reviews.Title: “Very Very Noisy Room / Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Tristan017
Reviews.Content: I have been to Las Vegas over 100 times but this was my first stay at this type of property. [Smaller, Non Casino] This is a Shell Vacation property and is very much like staying in a nice large 3 story apartment complex. The suites are comfortable and spacious much like a one bedroom apartment. The decor though not my style is very well done and new. The parking is free and and the pool area though not on par with the major resorts is ok. The free continental breakfast in the morning is a nice extra though a bit hectic. For the prices this property charges it is overall an amazing value That being said I had issues with the room we stayed in at the far left of the property. . Between the excessive road noise [cars & sirens] , the airplanes flying overhead and the people walking around in the room above us I think our bedroom was one of the noisiest rooms I have ever stayed in. The construction of the rooms is such that you can hear the people above you and to the sides of you . Room Noise is never an issue staying in a larger Casino property in Las Vegas. I also had some issue with their excessive use of perfumed cleaning products. I have a specific issue with asthma triggered by chemicals and our room was doused with strong perfumed smells. All in all I would consider staying here again only to try a room on the other end of the property .

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant experience. Found the small size more able to provide quality.”
Reviews.Author: caentexas
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers spacious suites, clean facilities and kitchens with all necessary utensils. Centrally located, yet one block away from the noise of the strip. People were very friendly and helpful. I liked not having to plow my way through a casino every time I came or left.

Reviews.Title: “Good time”
Reviews.Author: hellodaddio
Reviews.Content: Not knowing much about Vegas we had a blast! The check in staff was great, pool and breakfast were good too. The only draw back was in sin city the breakfast was only from 6am until 9am which made it pretty rushed to get yourself out of bed after a late night! The pool seemed to be out of towels by mid afternoon but there were always more in the weight room. Location was perfect! We were worried being off the strip that we might get harassed by people or possibly mugged...didn't happen there were security gaurds checking around on bikes pretty much from 5pm on. Short walk, good cheap resaurant at the Hooters casino...called the Mad Onion, breakfast 24 hours a day if you are looking for something like that, coffee was also good. We wouldn't head back to Vegas, all the shows we wanted to see were sold out a month and half prior to knowing we were going on this trip. If you are planning on heading down make sure if it is your first time be preparred to spend loads of money! We had REALLY cheap airfare but once you're there you pay!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Desert Rose Resort, Las Vegas, NV”
Reviews.Author: Truanne2
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic place to stay, close to MGM,Tropicana,etc. The staff there are superior and the rooms are great and roomy. Everything about the place is top of the line. The breakfast and afternoon snacks and wine are a very nice added feature. This was our second stay and we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Rooms & Staff!”
Reviews.Author: TiffanieH
Reviews.Content: I planned a group event at this hotel without knowing much about the location, etc, and was overwhelmingly pleased with the results! they set up the group with our own reservation code so we were sure to all be near each other in the hotel, and the Banquet options were numerous, flexible and wide ranged. Compared to the hotel/casions on the strip, which is only about 5 minutes walk from the resort, the rooms are immense, in great condition and decorated very stylish, the tub in the bathroom was noticably deep and great to get a good soak! Security to access the rooms was fantastic, two locked accesses from the lobby to get to the room hallways! the neighborhood was very quite and realtively little traffic on the street. we brought our two young boys who loved the pool even thought i thought it was a bit chilly. The hot tub was perfect temp. They have a complimentary traditional continental breakfast and maintain stock on it continuously, the variety only changes slightly from day to day and we noiticed there was an ebb and flo cycle with breakfast where at some times you could go and there was standing room only, and other times there was hardly a soul. As a bonus, in the evenings during the week they had a nice Managers receiption where they served up complimentary sodas, beer, wine and light snacks such as pretzels or veggies. My Husband is very picky about hotel room beds and he said that these were right up there with the Hilton pillowtop comfort! The exersize room was nice and not widly used so we could get on whatever equipment we wanted to every time we went in. We had an assorted group join us from families with young children, singles, couples and families with older children, smokers & non smokers. everything about the hotel accommodated all of them perfectly. Even our exceptionally picky friends stated the hotel was surprisingly nice and close to the strip and definitely a hidden jem, many mentioned they won't be paying to stay on the strip anymore. As for our birthday party banquet, the food was excellent I would put it in the 3-4 star grouping and their service was exceptional, They were great to work with and extremely responsive and helpful with all our requests and inquiries. The entire hotel staff was exceptionally friendly and went out of their way at times to make sure you were taken care of, for example my youngest wanted cottage cheese for breakfast on a day it was not served and one of the ladies asked why he was upset, when i explained she went and brought him some! I can't rave enough on how well they keep their facility, the comfortablity of the beds, and the way treat their guests. we will definitely be staying here for the future.

Reviews.Title: “great place for families, near the strip & airport”
Reviews.Author: sugarlandmom
Reviews.Content: Our group of eight (grandparents & four kids ages 7-12), spent two nights at the Desert Rose as part of our Zion/Bryce/Arches/Grand Canyon tour. It is very conveniently located to both the airport & strip, but quiet & less expensive. The concierge was very helpful in recommending a family friendly show & providing discount coupons for Mac King, which we all enjoyed. Checking in & out was very quick (even at 4am for our return flight home). The rooms are spacious, clean & nicely decorated, with two nice bathrooms in the 2 bedroom suite & a more spacious bathroom in the one bedroom unit. The free breakfast is OK-hard boiled eggs, toast, apples, bananas & dry cereal, but hey, the price is right! We highly recommend this resort & will stay here again the next time we are in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: doodym
Reviews.Content: My extended family came to Las Vegas for my daughter's wedding. We had people arriving at different times, with different last names. The front desk staff was very accomondating, especially as some of the arrival/departure dates changed at the last minute. The suites were very comfortable and I was able to prepare a full brunch for 20 people in the fully-equipped kitchen. The housekeeping staff was very good, and every employee we saw throughout the property was friendly and outgoing. Don't let the map location scare you. It looks like it's next to an airpot runway, but we didn't notice any airport noise. The hotel is within walking distance of New York, New York, Bellagio, Tropicana and many others. They have a wonderful continental breakfast every morning, complete with Starbuck's coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, well kept and priced right”
Reviews.Author: Pa_traveler0148
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay if you don't need to be right on the strip or on top of a casino.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Relax”
Reviews.Author: Anylin3
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in the beginning of March. The rooms were great: clean, comfortable, light, and quiet. The service was great and the personnel very helpful. Desert Rose is located 1 block off the strip by the MGM. The neighborhood is quiet and clean. We are looking forward to staying again.

Reviews.Title: “It's like my home away from home”
Reviews.Author: lisamiller13
Reviews.Content: I stumbled upon this hotel in July on another travel site when I was planning my August vacation and looking for a hotel that offered a complimentary breakfast and the room had a kitchen. We liked it so much that I chose it for my business trip I just returned from. First, the lobby area is very comfortable and welcoming. I arrived on a Saturday morning and the fireplace was going (being from Minnesota, I thought this was strange in the morning in Las Vegas -- but I realize there are people who probably thought it was cool morning and probably appreciated the fire). The staff was friendly. I got to my room and it looked the way I remembered from August (a different room). They accommodated my request for a grab bar in the tub. Everything seemed the same. Then I started unpacking (so it would feel more like home -- I always do this) and noticed little things. Obviously, this room has been used a lot (like most rooms in Vegas). But I hadn't noticed this kind of use during my previous stay. Mostly it was fine, just little things: Refrigerator sat crooked in its space, the lower part of the sofa (where your legs sit against when you feet are on the floor) was filthy -- lots of body oils have rubbed up against there, there were permanent spots on the wall and carpet by the bathroom vanity (it looked like someone might have dyed their hair and didn't tidy up and housekeeping got to it too late), the faucet in the tub was mounted on the wall a little cockeyed. Like I said, just little things -- and nothing that hindered me from enjoying my stay. It's just been really used. One thing I missed as compared with my previous stay: there was a basket on the bed with two robes and two pair of slippers for my husband and I. We used them and got to keep the slippers. There was no robe and slippers in my recent stay. Again -- just a little thing. I made it to breakfast twice. Typical hotel continental breakfast. I didn't make it to the Manager's Reception. Overall, I really enjoy the Desert Rose Resort. With a car, it's in a great location. Without a car, the Strip is just a short walk, and both monorail stations are virtually across the street (free one via Excaliber and the longer, pay one at MGM). They'll take you from Mandalay Bay on the south end up to the Hilton on the north end. Great to have nearby. This is a "vacation ownership" type hotel, but they've never asked or approached me to listen to their "speil" on ownership (and I've seen a lot of those, especially in Las Vegas). I appreciate that. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay Off Strip with family”
Reviews.Author: Gr8Nancy
Reviews.Content: My two adult daughters, boyfriends and husband had a two room suite with kitchen for our stay in Vegas. It was a perfect location - close to the strip, yet when you wanted to get away from all the action, it was a comfortable room to go back to. They have a heated pool and hot tub and I wish we could have used it more - it was too chilly to just hang out. MGM Grand was just a couple blocks away and we could pick up the bus across from Excalibur to get anywhere we wanted to on the Strip and even into Fremont Street.. The staff at the hotel were beyond nice and friendly. Having internet access was great. The breakfast was perfect for starting up your day and it was worth traveling back to the hotel for the free happy hour/managers reception. A really great place to stay if you want a little more space than the average hotel room. If you get a room facing tropicana be prepared for some early morning trash pickups.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to stay”
Reviews.Author: lorit926
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a NICE, less expensive alternative to the casino hotels, then Desert Rose is for you. We stayed in a condo style one bedroom with living room and kitchen. It was very nice and clean and all employees were very friendly and helpful. Some of our friends stayed at Mandalay Bay the same week and constantly complained about how expensive everything was. We had free continental breakfast, spa and exercise room, pool, and happy hour with free beer and wine! It's a little off the strip but just a short walk away. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “very enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: DenverColoradoToady1
Reviews.Content: my wife and i came to las vegas for a softball tournament in which our granddaughter participated in. the desert rose was just ideal for our stay. the staff was very friendly and the room was great. we intend to return for the tournament next year and will most certainly stay at your fine resort--allen and linda higens(colorado crush softball)

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant place to stay”
Reviews.Author: srowvel
Reviews.Content: The room was very comfortable. The staff were all very pleasant and helpful; even the staff we met in passing in the hallways were always quick to say hello. It was a very pleasant stay and I will definitely recommend this location to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay-Just far enough off the strip but still close”
Reviews.Author: 2travelersasof2001
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at this resort. Room was very clean and loved having the 2 seperate rooms, full kitchen, living room, and dining space. We also liked that it was "off" the strip but still very close to all. We had our 15 year old daughter with us so did not want to be right in the action. Stopped at a grocery store and picked up most items to make our meals for our stay. Saved us a lot of money so we were able to spend more on entertainment. Only issue I had was that the water while taking a shower would go through cycles of being hot and then colder and back to hot again.

Reviews.Title: “Only place to stay with little kids”
Reviews.Author: brittanykh
Reviews.Content: We went with a 2 year old and an 8 month old and this was the perfect place to stay. Full kitchen, warm-ish swimming pool, breakfast in the lobby and close to the action. And we could walk to several casinos. I would totally stay there again. However, the rooms were a little smaller than I expected but fine and they advertise cribs but they really just offer pack-n-plays. Minor quibbles though - overall I thought it was perfect for families.

Reviews.Title: “A Rose by any other name could not be as sweet”
Reviews.Author: dreamtraveller24
Reviews.Content: Excellent value. Roomy, comfortable with excellent and very helpful staff. They truly aimed to please.

Reviews.Title: “Now THIS is a SUITE!”
Reviews.Author: Gatita1994
Reviews.Content: Let Desert Rose Resort be your home base in Vegas. The three-room suite is roomy and comfortable. It comes with a complete kitchen so you can save $ by dining in. There's even a dishwasher! It had a completely separate bedroom, which was a sleep-saver for me as my brother snores like a locomotive. He slept in the living room on a full size pull-out sofa bed (he said it was very comfortable). I took the bedroom and, with the door closed, slept like a log. The suite I was in had a tiny bathtub/toilet area. That's the only negative comment I have about the resort. I'm certain there are other room configurations which offer more bathroom space. The weather was a little bit chilly for me to enjoy the pool, but I saw some children having fun there. I poked my nose into the Fitness Center one day. I'm not the workout type, but there were several weight training machines, some stationary bikes, free weights and balls. I would consider the Fitness Center well-equipped. The complimentary breakfast each morning included freshly-brewed Starbuck's coffee plus a variety of cold cereals, fruit juices, breads for toasting, fruit, eggs, soda and hot drinks. I drove to Las Vegas, but my brother flew in. I could bring everything with me that I would need during my stay, while he was limited to one small carry-on bag. Fortunately, the resort provides coin-operated washers and dryers on site. The Desert Rose Resort has concierge service to help you find and book show tickets, arrange transportation, and point out local areas of interest. That's how I found out about the Atomic Testing Museum - and got 15% off at M&M's World. Located on the south end of the Strip (Las Vegas Blvd.), Desert Rose is a short block from the Tropicana and Hooter's Casinos. It's a longer block to the entrance to MGM Grand, but it's doable. Shuttles are available at the resort, or you can hop on a double-decker sight-seeing bus at the Tropicana.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely amazing!”
Reviews.Author: mobybich
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Las Vegas many times, as we live in Nevada. The Desert Rose Resort was a wonderful place to stay. There were 4 adults and 2 small children in our party. We rented a 2 bedroom condo. It was bigger than we anticipated and had 2 bathrooms. There was a small balcony off the living room, which was nice for my husband and me, as we both smoke. They gave us a ground floor unit, because of the small children in our party. The place was very clean, and the employees were kind and helpful. The location is wonderful; close to the strip, but far enough away to not be bothered by the noise. We did not go to breakfast, as we brought groceries to our condo kitchen. We felt like we had our own apartment in Las Vegas. The price was cheaper than what we have paid for a regular room anywhere else in Vegas, including off the strip. We didn't have to walk through any crowded casinos or be anywhere around the "action" unless we chose to be. Also, we didn't have to deal with any parking garages. There was ample, free parking for all three of our vehicles. We will definately be staying here from now on. We have found our "home away from home." You will not be disappointed with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This place was great!!”
Reviews.Author: BK-Travellers
Reviews.Content: The suite had a full kitchen facility, the beds were really comfortable and the master bath even had a jetted shower. Would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Would definately come back”
Reviews.Author: logging
Reviews.Content: Loved this resort! We had the two bedroom suite and had so much room. Four adults in a hotel for a week is cramped , but this suite was awesome. The kitchen was stocked with all the supplies. The continental breakfat was good, liked everthing I ate, but I would have liked to had maybe scrambled eggs or sausage gravy and biscuits. Would book another trip with Shell Vacations.

Reviews.Title: “Great for romance and family vacations!”
Reviews.Author: cjp300
Reviews.Content: Helpful staff, nicely decorated, spacious rooms, secure grounds, attractive pool area. Appliance were all in good condition, everything was very clean. Resort offered special events.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: triplaa
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this very clean resort hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The resort was very clean and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Spotlessly Clean”
Reviews.Author: staceypow
Reviews.Content: This was THE CLEANEST place I have ever stayed! It also had very comfortable beds! And nice, comfy bedding! We stayed in a 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom. It had 3 TVs...one in the Master, one in the 2nd bedroom, and one in the living room. Also, free wi-fi. It had a kitchen with full-sized appliances, along with cookware and dishes. We only stayed 2 nights, but it would be the perfect place to stay for a longer vacation. It also has a great pool and jacuzzi, and BBQ area. The only problem we had was NOISY neighbors the 2nd night. Hotel staff/security responded immediately. The walls are very thin. We could hear our neighbors' conversations word-for-word through the walls and ceiling.

Reviews.Title: “You will not find a better place to stay”
Reviews.Author: HeathandPam
Reviews.Content: If you are going to Las Vegas this is definately the place to stay. The staff are friendly and helpful, the concierge (Dixye, i believe) is the best in the business, and the place is spottless from the lobby to the rooms to the pool, gym and grounds. The breakfast is simple but convenient and more than sufficiant, toast, cereal, fruit and yogurt, a great start to the day without having to hit a pricy resteraunt. The resort is secure, safe and great proximity to the strip. We cant say enough good about this place, price, cleanliness, conveniance, friendly helpful staff, etc, no casino or hotel in Vegas can beat it !! Highly recommended. Also, the Wi-Fi is not slow, it worked perfect for us.

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: BogeyFred
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are Shell Vacations Owners and used our time share options to stay four nights at the Desert Rose Resort in Las Vegas. We found that our accommodations were very adequate for our purposes and the unit we had was clean and very well appointed. The Desert Rose is conveniently located to the Strip and other attractions. We intend to stay there again when we visit Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect option for a family”
Reviews.Author: oldrxstudent
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in a 2-bedroom unit with our daughter, son-in-law, and their two young girls (4 and 1). The ONLY negative thing I can say about the experience is that there is LITERALLY no counter space in the bathrooms. The sinks are pedestal sinks, so no counters there, and there is only a small shelf over the toilet (about 4" deep and 2 feet long). This was a little inconvenient because anything you'd normally keep in the bathroom had to be kept in the bedroom. But, other than that, this was a wonderful stay. The six of us had two bedrooms, two bathrooms, a nice sized living room, and a fully stocked, fully equipped kitchen for about $75 a night!!!!! The breakfast was basic but good. It was very crowded, but you could always take things back to your room. We ate there a few mornings, and other mornings we went around the corner to Coco's. Fantastic breakfasts there for an extremely reasonable price. The walk to the strip was extremely manageable. None of us are in the greatest shape, believe me, but we certainly had no problem taking the 10-15 minute walk to the strip. If you have a problem with that, how do you expect to do the MILES of walking you're going to do once you are there?? We took a nice loop with the kids in the stroller from the Luxor up as far as the M&M factory, had lunch at the Rainforest Cafe in MGM, and back "home." Nice day! We did drive and park to go up to the strip near Caesar's Palace, but we would have done this if staying at a strip hotel down at our end, anyway. We again did a nice loop from Bellagio up to Venetian and back. Everywhere is stroller accessible, and there is plenty for the kids to see and enjoy. The hotel had a very nice pool (heated, but too cold for us) and a nice hottub (perfect temperature) that we relaxed in almost every day. In addition, every employee there was extremely helpful and courteous. All in all, this was a fantastic stay, and I would highly recommend it to anyone going to Las Vegas with family.

Reviews.Title: “I agree with all the positive reviews”
Reviews.Author: badabing51
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights during the NASCAR in Feb of this year and upon reading the positive reviews of Desert Rose, I do not have anything to add. This place is sensational and only a very short walk to the strip and all the lights and glitter.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a family reunion”
Reviews.Author: margo_lorusso
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at this family friendly hotel for a family wedding and reunion. The rooms are spacious and clean. It's great to have a living room, bedroom and kitchen. The lobby/meeting room was wonderful for gathering with all our family. We enjoyed the delcious free breakfast, coffee all day, and weekday cocktail hours. Being able to walk to the MGM and other hotels on the strip was a big plus. We don't like the noise and smoke of the casino hotels so the Desert Rose was perfect! It's reasonably priced and the staff is super friendly. I'm looking forward to staying there on our next visit to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Desert Rose Resort - Stellar!”
Reviews.Author: idwt
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Desert Rose Resort was very satisfying, from the quality of the furnishings to the service, everything was perfect. The bed was wonderful with 6 pillows, some regular some king various softness, perfect. The facility is close to the "Strip", walking distance to many casinos and food. The continental breakfast is sufficient to get your day started and the coffee (Starbucks, free) in the lobby is as good as the gourmet coffee I make at home. I will be staying there next year when I return again for the Sprint Cup race.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: tmredneck
Reviews.Content: This is a great, quiet place to stay in Vegas. It's about 2 blocks off the strip near MGM and across the parking lot from Hooters. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The rooms are clean. We had a 1 BR w/ kitchen area, living area. Very nice. My husband and I liked the fact it gave the quiet and serenity you needed after being on the strip with all the hoopla. The airport is right there and you do hear the planes, but I think any hotel in that area you will hear them. It was not too distracting that would deter me from staying there again. The hotel atomosphere, looks, etc. made you feel more like you were in a tropical place than the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay with Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: rogers1951
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay, and liked being away from the casinos. The staff was friendly and they were able to take care of all our needs. We liked the breakfast and the little convenience store was just what we needed. I would recommend this resort to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: AudreyandBill
Reviews.Content: We were recommended this by a friend. She said it was great because there was no casino in it. We didn't understand what she meant till we got there. All of the big hotels make you walk through their casinos to get to the front desk or the buildings with the rooms. It was only 1 block from the main street and was very quiet. Our room was perfect, with a kitchen and living room. Very very clean. Breakfest was toast, cereal, boiled eggs, yogurt, and either danishes or bagels. Very highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a group!”
Reviews.Author: travelqueencolorado
Reviews.Content: Our family & friends stayed at Desert Rose for a Vegas wedding last weekend. The place exceeded our expectations. I chose it because of all the previous good reviews and I was not disappointed. The rooms were spacious and comfortable. The continental breakfasts included Starbucks coffee . The lobby area with the happy hour was a relaxing way for people to gather and visit. We had a cocktail party in one of the event rooms. The staff is well trained and service oriented. All our guests were pleased with the non-casino, family oriented environment.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back and have already recommended to others”
Reviews.Author: PatticakeOntario
Reviews.Content: Hope that won't make it more expensive or harder to book in the future when the word gets out about this little gem. We had a fabulous stay, very reasonably priced, responsive to our needs and we even got to swim a bit in spite of the cool temperatures as the pool was heated. Just a lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “Arbonne Convention”
Reviews.Author: heyo4ever
Reviews.Content: This was a great place!! The room was spacious and awesome! The breakfast buffet was great and they also had a happy hour that was fun! I would stay there again. There was two full rooms and full size kitchen with everything you need to make your own food !!! right down to a toaster! lol it was awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable - for its class”
Reviews.Author: RZC
Reviews.Content: What it feels like: Although it has a pool, it feels less like a resort than a cross between a motel and a graduate student dorm. But a very well run one at that. Pros: We had a one-bedroom suite. Everything was clean. There is a living room, a dining table, a real kitchen with all the kitchenware. Service was very good. The check-in and check-out were fast, and the staff courteous. We had a blown fuse, and they had it fixed very quickly. The continental breakfast was efficiently run. They even had a happy hour while we were there. Unlike most mega-hotels in Vegas, you get to park next to this hotel. It was very quiet inside the hotel. It was maybe an 8-minute walk to the MGM Grand entrance. Cons: I realize the following are not really "cons" per se, but traits associated with all but the most expensive hotels. The first thing I noticed upon entering our suite was the smell: the familiar, chemical smell of almost all economy hotels. It didn't really bother me once I settled in, but it just reminded me that I was not in a Four Seasons. The plant in the living room was a plastic one, and the furniture didn't exactly have style. At night, I could hear the people upstairs get out of bed, walk to the bathroom with a squeaking floor, and flush their toilet. Who it's for: If you plan to drive to Vegas and stay multiple days with family/friends in a quiet place with good value and want to prepare some of your own meals, this is almost the perfect place (book with the hotel directly for the lowest rates). If you want to be closer to action or luxury, you'd better shell out more for some of the other higher-end places. Verdict: Very good value for its 3-star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, off the strip but very close”
Reviews.Author: thomasgee
Reviews.Content: We arrived before noon but they had a one room suite ready for us. Clean, quiet, spacious, free parking, close to the strip (10 minute walk), breakfast included, pool, etc. A great value and we will be back fo rsure.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal!”
Reviews.Author: LNK56
Reviews.Content: My colleagues and I spent 3 nights at the Desert Rose and were quite happy with the accomodations, the location and the rates! One of our group stayed at the conference hotel and paid 3.5 times what we paid and had to walk just as far to the conference site itself. Two pointers. One, don't forget your AAA card Two, get an outside room for the best cell phone reception.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, Very Pleasant Staff, Great Find for Business Traveler”
Reviews.Author: Wetash
Reviews.Content: What a pleasant surprise! Not even the shuttle bus driver had heard of it! This place has everything the business traveler needs. Clean & neat with lots of room to work. The location is terrific - 5 min walk to the monorail that takes you to most everwhere you'll need to go - all the way to the Las Vegas Convention Center.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION & great Staff”
Reviews.Author: delpster
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here before and love the place. Have had 3 different rooms and I will say this last trip the 2 bedroom we had could use some TLC. Lots of cigerette burns and the carpet is getting thread bare. But we love the spasious rooms, friendly staff and everything that comes with it. We are time share owners and would like to see this one become a little more energy effecient. Such forcefull water, lights on all day and night etc. But would recommend to anyone going to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Great Place”
Reviews.Author: ShepVancouverIsland
Reviews.Content: My wife and I really had a wonderful 7 day stay at this resort hotel. It started with a very friendly and efficient check-in. The suites are clean, tastefully decorated and well laid out. The location was perfect- close to the Las Vegas strip and yet away from it in a serene quiet setting. The continental buffet each morning was outstanding in the variety and quality of offerings. Monday thru Thursdays, there is a really nice cocktail evening reception at which we met interesting fellow travellers in a relaxed setting. Staff were always friendly and helpful. The outdoor pools and patio areas were clean and well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Total Surprise - lovely 2 br apt”
Reviews.Author: darcysMissB
Reviews.Content: Meeting Mom in vegas - really kept my expectations low (weighing the good reviews with a grain of salt etc.) What a pleasant surprise! Can only speak for our 2nd floor room on the back side of the building: incredibly quiet, clean, nicely decorated 2 bedroom "apartment" in a gated compound (don't forget your room key) We had a rental car, so we made the 5 minute trip to the wholefoods on las vegas blvd for groceries and cooked all of our meals.
