Kitchen is well stocked with nice dinner ware and cookware (there is a dishwasher - you will have to pick up soap & sponge if handwashing) I'm a runner (lots of runners on the strip at 7am) but checked out the gym anyway: 3 treadmills a smidge on the cheap side but does the job. Outdoor hot tub is HOT. All Staff, from front desk to the cleaning lady, were friendly, with smiles and hellos. Technically, you can walk (a longish block) to the strip, but we were glad to have our cheapy econo car for trips outside the city, like Red Rocks. Only downside? No stairs. You can only access your room via elevator, which makes a quick run to the ice machine in February a bit brisk. Great place!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Theresa045
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and efficient staff, great continental breakfast, we had a quiet room on the 3rd floor, the beds and pillows were very comfortable, the bathrooms kinda small but who cares really, about 1 block to strip that you can walk to, knowledgeable concierge, warm pool and hot tub. No smoky smelling casino!

Reviews.Title: “A gem one block away from the action....”
Reviews.Author: tass98
Reviews.Content: What a discovery this hotel was! Not only do they have large clean rooms, but also free Wi-fi and a simple breakfast. We stayed in a 2bed room with sitting area, dining area and full kitchen. the rooms were quiet and very comfortable. The staff were amazing! always trying to help with a smile with a sincere care for its customers. The strip is litterally 5mns (1block) away. i will definately come back here!

Reviews.Title: “PLEASANTLY SURPRISED”
Reviews.Author: IWANTADVENTURE
Reviews.Content: This was a spur of the moment trip, and the timeshares and hotels I'd previously stayed at in Las Vegas were unavailable, so I decided to try the Desert Rose. I was pleasantly surprised with the friendliness and courtesy of the check-in staff and housekeeping staff, the terrific location of the resort, and the overall quality of this resort. With only a one-block walk to attractions, restaurants, and entertainment, this resort has everything you want within 5 minutes!

Reviews.Title: “QUIET, CLEAN, COMFORTABLE, CLOSE”
Reviews.Author: thecowdoctor
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay. Facility was quiet, and clean with a well equpped kitchen. Staff was helpfuland friendly. The continental breakfast was sufficient (coffee, juice,friut,cold cereal, hard boiled eggs,toast,bagels or muffins) and the happy hour was enjoyable. Free wireless internet was available and a computer with a laser printer was available to print out boarding passes or whatever you needed. Pool and hot tub were nice as was the fitness room. A car is helpful but you are within walking distance of the MGM Grand and connection to the monorail. My convention was at the Mandalay Bay, an easy 5 minute drive. Reasonably priced. Non casino no no ringing slots.

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: debSyracuseNY
Reviews.Content: The Desert Rose was a perfect place to stay with kids. The suites were ideal with 2 bedrooms and 2 baths, living room and kitchen. The location is great, only a short walk to the strip. The staff were all helpful. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: mary30Cali
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel for the price. good breakfast, free wifi, clean rooms the part i like the most twin beds in the other room good when you have 2 kids

Reviews.Title: “The resort and Staff were the best I've ever seen or recieved.”
Reviews.Author: 76ned66
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived we really were amazed at the beauty of the resort and the friendliness of the staff. Everyone was so attentaive to our needs I would recommend this resort to all my friends and family and will return again. thank you everyone the best time and stay ever. Artie Rosa

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Savcat
Reviews.Content: Large clean well equipped rooms, needs a little upgrading however no complaints. Bathroom a little small but shower excellent. Staff very friendly, easy check in and out, good continental breakfast each morning, nice pool area. 5 mins walk from MGM, therefore very close to the strip. Would definately recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay...”
Reviews.Author: Kookie51
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying at the Desert Rose Resort. It was an all girls weekend and I have to say it was the best Vegas trip yet! The staff is great, the rooms are very clean, the beds are great and the balcony is nice for the smoker. It is only a 5-10 minute walk to the Strip or the Monorail at the MGM. We are already talking about another Vegas trip for next year.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed my stay but......”
Reviews.Author: j.k.r.
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 10 night stay in Desert Rose and must say i have no complaints at all about service ,rooms and breakfast etc BUT and believe me it has rankled with me since, on my first night i popped into the pool for a quick dip and thereafter the hottub as there was no one else around. Well much to my surprise i was quickly joined by 2 scantily clad strippers from a local club and having had a wee blether for a while arranged to meet them the following night same place, same time. Long story short, they closed the dang pool and hottub for a total of 5 days the next day and all contact was lost. I'm sure you guys out there will understand my obvious discontent here..GUTTED!!! Also i must put on record my thanks to the night staff for averting what might have been a minor confrontation, (i neglected to mention we had taken my old dad with us as a treat and not being a late night guy he stayed in the room when my bro and i were having fun),i made the mistake of giving another 'dancer' my hotel name and she proceeded to show up at reception at 5am looking for me but was turned away by a kindly gentleman whose name has escaped me..Thank you sir!, you know who you are..God Bless America.. Roll on Oct.

Reviews.Title: “extremely poor front desk service”
Reviews.Author: deb03traveler
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms, one for myself and kids and one for elderly parents. They were overbooked and didn't tell us till we arrived that they had moved us to another hotel. Of course they only moved my parents and not us. The hotel they moved us to was nice but no breakfast or internet included. When we complained many times about having to all be together they moved me too. They said we had to drive or take a taxi back to the property if we wanted the breakfast included. The front desk manager was very rude and unresponsive to my concerns. I would definitely not recommend this hotel. I have since returned twice to Las Vegas(my daughter is in school out there) and have found the Homewood Suites by Hilton. Same price, much better breakfast, better service, better everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: roaddog11
Reviews.Content: This resort is about two full city blocks from the LasVegas strip. The service is efficience and friendly. I was there to celebrate my friend 68th birthday.This was also super bowl week-end. You are close to public transportation and most of the entertainment area. Those looking for free exhibits you are across from MGM lion exhibit which is free. Roller coaster at the end of the block at the New York New York hotel. Game show with Wayne Brady behind the resort at the Tropicana hotel. The continel breakfast change a little since I had visit before where they had full breakfast they had cold or hot cerals, boil eggs, sweet rolls, bagals, english muffin any kind of toast, coffee, tea, variety of jucies and varies type of milk. Fruit was daily and a different kind. Check in was fast and courtesty. Internet available but has a limit for time you can be on the computer. Room was clean and upon any request you could receive more towels or linen. This was a great place to stay and had all the amminities for a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable resort without the hassle of the strip hotels”
Reviews.Author: 3m0nkeys
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to the Desert Rose Resort and we have had a wonderful stay both times. The room are updated and very clean, the beds are wonderful and the staff is friendly and responsive. The location makes the Resort close to all the Vegas attractions but quiet and comfortable to just take it easy. Good breakfast variety with easy parking close to your rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: KADSIllinois
Reviews.Content: Like another couple indicated in their review, this was my husband and my first trip to Vegas and staying at a resort. We were very happy with both the location of the resort and how nice our one-bedroom suite was. We enjoyed being just off the strip and felt completely comfortable walking around even at night. Having a kitchen saved us on some meals, so we could enjoy spending the additional money elsewhere. We'd recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “So happy we found the Desert Rose”
Reviews.Author: Comedians
Reviews.Content: Not a modern resort but extremely comfortable with very friendly staff who were only happy to please. The room was large with everything one could need for an enjoyable vacation. Particularly good was the well equipped kitchen which lacked for nothing. The free high speed internet was an added bonus. The only thing I could fault would be the breakfast, which, being English & used to more, was a little lacking but it seemed popular with non Brits. Would stay again, and recommend to anyone not wanting to stay in the resort casinos and yet be within short walking distance of all the action.

Reviews.Title: “Superbowl Weekend”
Reviews.Author: jgred5
Reviews.Content: Our stay for for 4 nites. We had 3 rooms total over our stay and 10 people total. The staff was courteous. When we needed housekeeping, the were there within in 15 min. The concierge was such a great help both before arriving and during our stay. We went there to get married, and the staff at the hotel helped to make our stay very enjoyable. The Desert Rose is only a block off the strip and easy walking distance. There is no smoky casino to go thru to get to your room which was a big plus for me!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: DrJScott
Reviews.Content: Great Value if traveling with a big group. We had 16 people and it was perfect. It seemed like a very nice pool and hot tub. Front desk folks were really nice. One long block to the strip, located next to Hooter casino. We spent a lot of time across the street at MGM. Rooms were 2 bedroom suites ($345) fr Fri to Mon which was a steal for Vegas. If I were traveling with my wife and one other couple, I would prefer on the strip. Free b-fast was very light - hard-boiled eggs, toast , some fruit and coffee/juice. The rooms were like nice Time share condos. The rooms were not all alike. I would not suggest the rooms near the street - a little loud. Try to get the rooms facing Hooters or the back Parking lot. I would stay here again with a large group or family. Good Luck

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay with kids.”
Reviews.Author: NewYork67
Reviews.Content: Perfect place to stay with family! Full kitchen , clean room, good location. Away from casino and smoking . Very family style.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: carmoSaoPaulo
Reviews.Content: We are a family of four, my husband, two teenagers and I. We had an excellent time at the Desert Rose. The suite was clean, sofa bed comfortable for two teenagers, kitchen, big refrigerator. There was even a good table with four chairs with a charming chandelier over it. A lot of space and two TVs! Will certainly stay there next time.

Reviews.Title: “awesome lil'spot”
Reviews.Author: ImFabul0us
Reviews.Content: staff friendly. property well maintained. not far from the strip but far enough from all the craziness. clean rooms. loved fact that you can actually sit out in the balcony area. full kitchen with everything u need in it ...a total plus. ive stayed at other places that say full kitchen but then end up falling short so was surprised with this spot. the restrooms are small personal preference i like them bigger but everything was functioning. few channels came up un-clear... other then that i loved the place im thinking of making it my regular place when in sin city.

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: Kboop0178
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 days and 3 nights for a birthday getaway with my boyfriend. We had a wonderful time and I could not ask for anything more. The location to the strip was great, although we drove everywhere. The atmosphere was perfect because we did not want to stay in a smokey, drunk laden hotel on the strip. When we returned back to our suite it was nice and quiet. They had full kitchen amenities and we were able to even make some nice smoothies. I will come back again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised, and underated value...”
Reviews.Author: NhLulu
Reviews.Content: I booked this room based on reviews on Trip Advisor which I would always use for any trip in the future. I have been spoiled by exceptional lodging in the past and have high standards, the most important, cleanliness. I was pleasantly surprised with not only how clean the room was, but how spacious, tasteful and comfortable the room was having arrived at 11pm from traveling from the east coast. It is not a "Four Seasons" hotel, however it was a "Four Seasons Budget experience". There was a complimentary fitness room and internet access which allowed me to check my emails, work out and head to my destination relaxed the next day. The beds were comfortable, the kitchen a perk. I would go here again when looking to get dependable quality for a budget price.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable place -- close enough to the strip to be convenient, but far enough for some peace”
Reviews.Author: tolew
Reviews.Content: We had a group of 8 friends staying in 2 suites (living room, kitchen, 2 bedrooms). Rooms were spacious, clean, and well-maintained with a well-stocked kitchenette. We had quiet/restful sleep each night and didn't notice any noise. The rooms included free wireless internet, which worked but was not high speed (< 1 mbps). Continental breakfast (typically bagels, toast, cereal, yogurt, a few fruit, hardboiled eggs, juice) was also included and a 24-hour coffee bar. Breakfast was fine for a continental spread, but nothing fabulous. Still -- breakfast and internet were a great value based on room price. It looked like there were BBQ's available for guests, but we didn't use them. The pool was good and there were two hot tubs. We didn't use the fitness room. The concierge, Dixye, was helpful and gave us great supper recommendations, and coupons for discounted attractions. She would tell us the cheapest place to buy tickets, even if that meant buying them from someone else, which was greatly appreciated. This is a great place if you want to be just far enough off the strip to avoid the noise, but still within bus/cab distance of everything. We did a Deuce bus pass, which was $15/3 days, but everything down the strip is within a $15 cab ride too. Plus, the Hooters hotel next door has $.25 wings after midnight and $3 blackjack! Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably surprising! Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: freebird108
Reviews.Content: My sis and I wanted a place with no gaming and no smoking. We were so pleased with this resort. It was relaxing and felt like we were in an apartment. The commodities were exceptional! We didn't hear outside traffic and the resort was quiet. This is perfect for people who want peace and quiet in their room in Vegas. We will definitely make this our place to stay from now on. Good job Desert Rose!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and great location”
Reviews.Author: drjensh
Reviews.Content: This hotel is off the strip, but well within walking distance to Las Vegas Blvd and major casinos, the Deuce, and the monorail. The prices for the rooms are fantastic, and the rooms were spacious and clean. The staff was also phenomenal, including house keeping, front desk and especially the concierge. Whether you want a great deal so you have more to spend at the casino or because you have a family and want to have a respite from the casino--this hotel is a great option.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: BowtieJohn
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at the Desert Rose. Room was wonderful with tons of space, everything was clean, the bed was very comfortable. The continental breakfast was a nice bonus. Didn't have a laptop with me so can't comment on the free wifi, but there also is a computer with a printer for guest use in the lobby. Also no silly fees added. If you like to walk, it's easy to get to the strip. If you have a car access in and out would be easy with Duke Ellington Way having a light at Tropicana.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding place to stay when visiting Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Profethor
Reviews.Content: The staff, facilities, location, extras, clean rooms, I don't know where to begin, everything was great. The price was surprisingly low and the food was great. The only, and I mean, only problem was some sound coming through the ceiling of my ground floor room from the room upstairs very early in the morning one day. I believe this must be a construction problem, because even voices were coming through, although I couldn't make out what they were saying. If that may bother you, notify the staff and I am sure they will give you a room they know to be very quiet. It didn't bother me because the room was so spacious and everything so first rate for the money, that I only mention it because it stood out in an otherwise fantastic experience. I have stayed at so many Hiltons and other "world class" hotels around the world, I can't remember them all. But I must say I have never felt better staying at any other place then I did at the Rose. Congrats to all who made my stay so great!

Reviews.Title: “What a value!”
Reviews.Author: FruGalTampa
Reviews.Content: This hotel was within walking distance to MGM where we could pick up the monorail or get to the strip. No taxi's needed. We had a 2 bedroom/2 bath with full kitchen unit including a pull out sofa bed. The rooms were very clean. We were able to spend more dollars on fun activities due to the low room rate. I highly recommend especially for those travelling on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “best place to stay in Vegas!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MWL
Reviews.Content: Stayed three days- great room - really a small apartment. Staff were great - the strip is minutes away-supermarkets are minutes away if you want to cook. The pool is heated and free breakfast is quite adequate.Remakable value-will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in vegas-especially for kids!!!”
Reviews.Author: momx2kids
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 days in vegas with our 2 daughters. This place was great from the service to the breakfast (which was small but held us till lunch). The pool was also nice and warm for kids to swim. Everything felt very secure. You are just a short walk from the strip but it still feels like you are not surrounded by all the nude pictures and casinos. We did have a group of younger guys that we could hear with the music and talking under us but they quieted by about 11:30 so it ended up being good. We had a wonderful time! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “In a town with more hotel rooms than many states combined, a suite with a kitchen is a wonder.”
Reviews.Author: growbur
Reviews.Content: For a number of years my company has booked it's employees at the Desert Rose and it has a nationwide following among them. I recently spent eleven day at the Desert Rose in Las Vegas and understand their praise. All of the staff were friendly and efficient and the rooms clean and well appointed. Complimentary wireless access in rooms and a printer in the lobby help for boarding passes and for finding shops and restaurants. Having an equipped kitchen is a luxury not easily found in Las Vegas. From a full home cooked meal or Shrimps from the pool side Barby to milk and cookies after returning home, a kitchen makes a long stay in Vegas much more comfortable. The closest Casinos are Hooters, Tropicana, MGM, Excalibur, New York New York, Luxor, and Mandalay Bay but the Monorail stops at the MGM and connects with Casinos all along the strip. If you rent a vehicle the free parking within steps of your secure access doorway (not a half mile away, like other places) and easy access to the Strip, Airport, Freeways, Shopping and back routes to casinos make it that much easier to get around. It would be a pleasure to return to the Desert Rose Resort anytime I go to Las Vegas, Business or Pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Started out pretty good and went to bad!”
Reviews.Author: kmbailey001
Reviews.Content: We decided on the Desert Rose due to the reviews and the fact that our suite included a second room, and it looked fairly nice in the posted pictures. We traveled with my 3 yr. old and disabled brother. We arrived on Sun. Jan. 17 at about 12:30 p.m. and were told that our room was not ready due to being extremely busy. This was ok because we didn't remember to consider the 3 hr. time change from arriving from out east. They said they would call to let us know when the room was ready...that never happened. We returned at about 4:00 p.m. and still there was no room available so we sat in the lobby for at least another hour. We are now getting a bit fed up since we had been up since 2:00 a.m. eastern time (11:00 p.m. the night before.) Finally we get a room and were very happy with it. It was spacious and clean. It rained Sun. - Thurs. and on Tues. night I heard a dripping sound coming from the master bedroom. Found water literally pooring out of the window and pooling on the window sil and then dripping onto the carpet. I put towels down that night twice as the water was coming in so heavy. On Wed. I called maint. and they came to check things out and said they would report the situation to management. We got a message Thur. evening after being out all day to call management, and we did. We told them we didn't want to move for the last 2 nights and that we could just tolerate the towels in the window. I didn't want to have to move my toddler and disabled brother out, the rooms were nice enough and spacious enough that the water would not be problem for 2 more nights but they insisted we move. They moved us two doors down, and when we went into inspect it we found a totally different suite from the first. This suite had two rooms but it was cramped dingy and dirty. My husband spoke to management and they apologized for the space saying it was an end unit, and that it had been renovated at the same time as the other suite and should be just fine. Well it was terrible, there was an overall feeling of dirt and dingyness. I have posted pictures, but I still don't think that they can convey how dirty and run down the room was.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in every way!”
Reviews.Author: IFrodo
Reviews.Content: We travelled from New Zealand and stayed almost two weeks at the Desert Rose and found this resort to be a really great place to stay. The location is 5-10 mins walking distance from the strip so its easy access to big casinos like MGM, Excalibur, Tropicana, Luxor, New York New York, and Hooters. The huge advantage of choosing the Desert Rose is that you get an apartment here for the price of a room in a hotel on the strip. The staff were very helpful and friendly and Concierge Dixye is a gem. No need to go anywhere else for information on everything that's happening in Vegas - how to get around - all the tickets to all the shows are available from her desk even the Tix daily specials! Dixye has it all at her fingertips - a real bonus. We had a great apartment overlooking the pool - it was clean and comfortable, lounge, dining, kitchen, 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, 3 TVs! When we come back to Vegas we will be coming straight back to the Desert Rose.

Reviews.Title: “Dixie is amazing !!”
Reviews.Author: GarnetCanada
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in January 2010 or 5 days. Dixie the Concierge is amazing!! She was helpful beyond words, knowledgeable, experienced and very pleasant to work with. She was the highlight for us. The staff who clean the rooms are amazing. They are effiecient and very friendly, and repsresent this facility in a very positive and professional manner. The rooms are spacious and have everything you will need for a pleasant and comfortable stay. We requested rooms in a quiet location and together(two couples travelling together) and our request was accommodated. Our only disappointment was the presentation of front desk staff. These are the people one should be able to expect would be welcoming, friendly and courteaous. Unfortunately that was not our experience. However, what they lacked the others made up for. Kudos to all those who are less visible but who do a terrific job!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull Las Vegas Stay”
Reviews.Author: Triple7Lodi_NJ
Reviews.Content: It iso quite clean and neat and people are very nice smiling kind rooms are clear everything on time

Reviews.Title: “Nothing negative to say!”
Reviews.Author: agashi24
Reviews.Content: Perhaps I have simple tastes but all of my pet peeve issues at hotels were not a problem here. 1.) They had a safe in the room, pretty important if you win anything while you're staying in Vegas. 2.) They had a fan in the bathroom, surprisingly rare these days. 3.) Excellent water pressure, so you don't have to spend 30 minutes to get your hair wet enough to wash. 4.) Easy, efficient and friendly check-in. 5.) Super easy check-out, we didn't have any additional charges on our bill so we just called the front desk and left our keys in the room. 5.) Right next door to Hooters which is just across the street from MGM Grand (great location). 6. I usually don't like exterior door hotels due to security issues and noise but you have a gate to get to your room which you open with your room key and we had no more noise than any interior room hotel we've stayed. 7.) plenty of pots and pans and utensils to make any decent meal. 8.) Free internet, the place our friends stayed were charging $13.00 a day. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Like staying at home but with daily maid service!”
Reviews.Author: Horticulturist56
Reviews.Content: The desert Rose Resort in Las Vegas, NV was realy a home away from home. Nice living/dining area with ample furniture in like-new condition. The full kitchen was well equiped. The bedroom had ample space and, though small, the bathroom functioned well and was spotless. The staff was friendly and efficient. We had no problems with anything. A continental breakfast is included but was all breads and cerials, no eggs, meats or cheeses for protein. We opted to cook breakfast in our room on all but our arrival and departure days. Located adjacent to the Hooters and MGM Grand hotel/casinos, the Desert Rose is an easy walk to all activities on the strip nd also to the public monorail that connects the MGM Grand to the Convention Center. Parking is free at The Desert Rose and the buildings are gate-secured. The pool and spas are very nice looking though it was too cold (60's) to use them in January. The exercise room was well equipped. Though the grounds are very clean and well maintained, they're mostly parking lots with a fringe of landscaping, not the extensive grounds one might expect at something called a resort. This seems to be the rule in Las Vegas, though, as only the huge casinos have much in the way of landscapes. We enjoyed several shows, our visit to the botanic garden at Ethel M Chocolates, a day trip to China Ranch, the Amargosa Opera House and Death Valley, all within about an hour's drive from The Desert Rose. The Springs Preserve is also worth visiting as are the galleries in the newly-designated Arts District. While we enjoyed many excellent meals at various chef-owned/operated restaurants in the big casinos, Casa Don Juan in the Arts District can't be beat for authentic Mexican cuisine.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: PraireFire
Reviews.Content: My wife and I flew in from Colorado and met my sister and brother-in-law there for a 4 night stay. All of the positive reviews were what everyone said they were. A couple glitches..not enough towels and needed extra bedding. But the very friendly staff was on it Pronto! I can't say enough about this place and its staff and only a 10 minute cab ride from the airport. If we ever we go back and want to be off the strip but close enough to walk again it will be here. Rick

Reviews.Title: “nice place”
Reviews.Author: linnelor
Reviews.Content: private balconies for each room - very nice spot just off strip - very secure

Reviews.Title: “Desert Rose Resort made our family reunion a big success!”
Reviews.Author: mthompson590
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a four night stay at the Desert Rose Resort. This was a family reunion that consisted of four adult couples and four children ranging in age from seven years to eight months. We shared two - two bedroom suites, and one - one bedroom suite. We found this suite hotel to be the perfect venue for our group. The rooms are clean and fully equipped, including a port-a-crib for rent. It is more like renting a small apartment than renting a hotel room. All of the staff was professional and helpful. While the continental breakfast did not include any of the protein items that our family enjoys, there was a Vons less than two miles away where we could purchase anything we could possibly need. For those without cars, there is a mini-mart and a Walgreens all within a short walking distance. We could walk easily to all of the major casinos near-by, such as Mandalay Bay, The Luxor, The Excalibur, MGM Grand, and the New York New York Casino. There is also a monorail stop inside the MGM Grand that can take you to several locations all the way to the Convention center. While we cannot score this hotel at the very highest ranking, simply because it does not offer a lot of fancy amenities that you find in the luxury hotels and is just a bit off the strip, it couldn’t have been a more ideal location for this multi-family event. We extend our thanks to the staff of the Desert Rose Resort. Our happy memories of our visit there with our children and grandchildren will be cherished for many years to come.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff - just reduce the noise level”
Reviews.Author: TechyFeely
Reviews.Content: The Desert Rose was a good find. The staff was truly wonderful and responsive to questions. Well stocked kitchen and decent continental breakfast were both pluses. The only issue I had was a persistant knocking/pounding noise that occurred all night long. I could never find the location or source. I asked to move rooms but they were not able to accomodate that request, which is too bad as none of my party slept well because of the noise. Other than that, the property is something to be recommended as long as you know you will have to walk at least 10-15 minutes to get to the strip, monorail entrance or other sites.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely suite minus the night noise and crappy pans”
Reviews.Author: KimtasticSpaz
Reviews.Content: The suite was spacious, clean, and well maintained. We loved that the kitchen was stocked with a measuring cup, mixing bowls, cups, glasses, utensils, cutting board, toaster, blender, coffee machine, and cooking utensils. The major downer was the quality of the pans. We tried to make pancakes in the skillet, but it stuck hopelessly even when we coated the skillet with oil. So, if you want to make anything like pancakes, you should bring your own non-stick pans. The other major con was a strange knocking noise that became quite apparent during the night. We were in Suite 2304. We couldn't isolate the source of the noise, although it seemed to come from within the walls...perhaps from the plumbing? There is wireless internet in the suite, but beware that it is NOT fast enough to watch streaming video, such as Hulu or Netflix Instant Play movies. There is also no DVD player with the TV, which is perhaps the hotel's way of forcing you to rent more of their TV movies. Other than that, I recommend the hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mango43
Reviews.Content: Excellent place to stay while in Vegas. Stayed at two other places during our stay - wished we would have been at Desert Rose the whole time. Rooms were fully equipped - kitchen had everything you would need to fix a meal. Room was fully stocked with extras - extra blankets, pillows, towels, etc. Clean room. Friendly, helpful staff. Continental breakfast was great - staff was wonderful about cleaning tables. Very attentive to needs. We had one issue with the toilet and they fixed it QUICKLY! Very quiet. Close to the Strip - within walking distance, but far enough to be quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Very Spacious Rooms, Very Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Janice47
Reviews.Content: Booked through Expedia earlier in the year and paid up front - amazing value for money. Apartment consisted of a very large sitting room with comfy sofa's and tv. Decent kitchen. Nice size bedroom with tv and en suite. Happy hour during the week when wine and beer is free and a small buffet provided. Breakfast is adequate and hot coffee is available throughout the day. About a 10 minute walk to the lower end of the strip and bus can then be taken along the main strip.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home!”
Reviews.Author: MostNorthernNY
Reviews.Content: Clean, Roomy, Great Staff, Three things to fix. TV's are horrible, need more garbage cans, and another extrance to check out.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: iowafunmom
Reviews.Content: Just back from the Desert Rose, great place to stay, had a 2 bedroom and 2 bath suite. Super quiet and can sleep great there. Continental breakfast and free happy hour really helps cut down on costs while in Vegas. Free WIFI, one of the few places we looked at that had free WIFI in the room. We used our computer everyday looking up tickets, directions, etc. so it was worth it. Exercise room, pool, etc all very nice and they cleaned our room every day, it was very clean. It is a couple blocks away from the nearest bus duece stop and at the south end of the strip, but you have to walk a lot anyway so we thought it was worth it. Reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: BillAnaheim
Reviews.Content: Suite was large , well equiped and comfortable. Evening reception was terrible. When they say snacks they anre not kidding, one night it was trail mix the next it was raw carrots and celery. Did not try breakfast because it was too early at 6am to 9am

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: tinylibrarian
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here with my parents over Christmas. We were so impressed! 2 bedrooms, 2 baths, a sitting room, kitchen (nicer than mine at home!), and dining room, probably for much less than we'd have paid for one room on the Strip. Very clean, quiet and comfortable. It's off the Strip (and yes, it's behind Hooters, which we found hilarious, but didn't notice any rowdiness, etc.), so it's about a 10-15 minute walk to the MGM Grand/Excalibur, etc, but we were happy not to be on the bustle of the Strip. You do have to fight the feeding frenzy crowd at breakfast, but that's human nature, not the hotel's fault. My parents enjoyed the breakfast and there seemed to be some variety each day (I chose to sleep in and use the kitchen!). My parents also liked the manager's reception with wine, chips/salsa, and veggies. All of the helpful staff we dealt with were incredibly pleasant. A few little negatives - the wireless Internet is really slow (but at least they don't charge you for it like some of the big hotels!) and the carpet needs replacing. But those are minor quibbles - this is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: flutterby538
Reviews.Content: We stayed over the New Years holiday and were very pleased with the Desert Rose. The staff was very nice and the everything was very clean. The rooms were very comfortable and spacious. It is about a 15 minute walk from the strip, which was fine for us. It was a very good value overall.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic apartment in a great location at a great price”
Reviews.Author: journeydesigner
Reviews.Content: WOW! We couldn’t believe our luck when we walked into the apartment. 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, lounge/dining and fully appointed kitchen. It even had 3 Televisions, one in each bedroom and the lounge and a massage shower in one of the bathrooms. Breakfast was provided and also a managers reception during the week with free beer and wine from 5 to 7 pm. The location was great as it is only a 10-minute walk to MGM, Tropicana, New York New York and Excalibur. I chose this resort because we were travelling with our sons who are 12 and 18 and I didn’t like the idea of staying in a casino. I also took advantage of the excellent laundry facilities and the kids used the pool and spa. We managed to leave behind an expensive jacket at the hotel and had great service from Betty who located the jacket and then send it to out hotel in San Francisco. I highly recommend this accommodation to all families visiting Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Lousy Wireless Internet”
Reviews.Author: Selector34
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at this hotel. When I was there first I complained about the Wireless Internet, and they told me, that the speed and error was corrected. Therefore I went back to CES 2010. But to cut it in short. THE WIRELESS INTERNET SUCKS. It's non existing, and if you write for media, it's useless. I could send a telegram faster than a email, So I won't reckomend this hotel to anyone anymore. Very sad, because the rooms are big, the rates are fair. The employees are polite.

Reviews.Title: “New Year in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: askabrit
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a quiet oasis in the madness of Las Vegas over the recent New Year holidays. Great location, just a short walk to the Strip, near the MGM Grand. Our top floor room was spacious, with comfortable sitting and eating area, kitchen with all you would need to cook any meals. Bedroom had adequate drawers and closet space with safe. Cable TV in bedroom and sitting room. Balcony sitting area overlooking the courtyard. Continental breakfast was on the whole better than we expected with plenty of the usual Coffee, cereal, bread, fruit and boiled eggs ( eggs usually every other day). Their outside pool was heated which was a surprise as it was quite chilly weather while we were there. However some guests did use it (we did not). If we go back to Vegas we would certainly stay here again. However, Vegas was wall to wall people on New Years Eve. The fireworks were fun to see but I would not go again at that time of year. Too busy and very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like a mini-home making the week long trip easily enjoyable with all our kids!”
Reviews.Author: gconklin
Reviews.Content: We're used to cramped motel rooms with over-stated amenities, such as a tiny sink with a 2-cup coffee maker being their version of "kitchen". But Desert Rose's description was understated, if anything. The kitchen had a 3/4 sized fridge/freezer with enough room to put a couple weeks worth of food. The sink was large and deep with the full dish washer, full oven and stove, and microwave all right there. Even the coffee maker was at least a 10-cup. The two rooms were large, beds comfortable, living room didn't feel cramped either, and the couch pulled-out as a bed which gave the kids options for sleeping. We lucked out with the best view of the Luxor and on the corner near the pool. And the pool was heated but the hot-tub seemed too hot for most of us. We didn't complain since it might be the level others prefer so we just limited our time in it. The staff were ALL extremely kind and helpful. The concierge wasn't just the front desk, either. It was her full time job, it seemed, which meant she was there with knowledge. We will definitely look into using other resorts by this company in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place!”
Reviews.Author: Maeve1
Reviews.Content: Why haven't we thought of this before? After all the years of booking casino rooms, we have discovered a little magic in the Desert Rose. We had the one-bedroom suite which was very comfortable and cozy. We could hoof it over to the MGM or other casinos on the strip in a couple of minutes. The convenience of parking under our window was just a great bonus. I'm giving this a hesitating shout because I don't want its cover blown. This little jewel needs to be cherished by those of us who want the comforts of home while enjoying the Las Vegas nightlife. Sshhhhh! Don't tell anyone about the Desert Rose!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “It's the best! We definitely will stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: Emmy814
Reviews.Content: I went to LV with my BF as he had a business to attend to there. I picked this hotel as they have the amenities that are very important to me, the kitchenette and free wireless. I'm also tired of staying in the chain hotels as they started to look the same to me after a while. So when I read about the Desert Rose in Trip Advisor, I decided to go there and was very please with myself for making such a excellent decision with coming here. And my BF was very happy also We stayed there for 2 nights. The price is so affordable. I didn't expect the amenities that are provided but it was a nice surprise. The kitchen was more than anyone could ask for..it looks modern, clean with full electric stove, even stocks very nice silverware and plates. A family would definitely survive being stuck in the hotel. There is TV in both living and bedroom. The sofa is very comfy and contemporary. There is a marble? sink with a lot of are to put stuffs on. The breakfast area is very cool with a lot of breakfast options..you feel like you are in the restaurant or something. They also have nice convenient store that opens 24 hrs. On top of this, the location can't be any better. It's far enough from all the exotic/touristy stuffs but close enough that you could walk there. With the price we got, I couldn't have asked for anything more.. There are only few things that would make this hotel even better than it's already is- maybe there could be a little more lighting as it was a little dark especially in the bedroom and the bathroom is on a very tiny side but nice and clean. The parking is a little tight but you could always find the spot, but might have to walk a little bit. I can't say enough..about how absolutely happy we were to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay! Great Location and Staff.”
Reviews.Author: welltravelledLisburn
Reviews.Content: Great! Stayed here for 8 nights in October 09 on first trip to Vegas. The location is superb if you want a break at night from the hustle and bustle of "the strip". Rooms are fantastic, more like having your own apartment than a room. Staff are superb, really helpful, welcoming and courteous. When we return to Vegas we wouldn't stay anywhere else!! Hope this is helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good alternative to Theme Hotels”
Reviews.Author: PHOToronto
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort over the New Years weekend. If you want to be part of the action, don't stay here. If you are looking for a nice place to rest after a day of Vegas fun, stay here! It is a good change of scenery from the casinos, crowds and smoke. The Good: All rooms are suites and are a good size with a fully equipped kitchen. Security is good with locked gates and 24/7 security patrol in the parking lot. There is a complimentary breakfast which is nothing special, but one less meal to worry about. Staff is excellent and gave a pain free check in. The hotel is spitting distance from the airport (4 minutes by cab with good traffic) The Bad: It is a time share resort so there are a lot children (which may be a good thing to you). It is quite a hike to the main strip. It takes about 15 minutes by foot to the south end of the strip (Excaliber, MGM, Newyork) , which is OK, but too far to go back and forth multiple times. Plan your day accordingly.

Reviews.Title: “Please stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: horse-kyber
Reviews.Content: Although the reviews for this hotel state 'renovated' our room was very dated and was dirty. The light switches were absolutely filthy as was the sofa (there is such a thing as a carpet and upholstery shampooer). There was numerous hairs throughout the bathrooms (in the showers and on the floors). The bathroom floors had an over-abundance of dirt build up accumulated over time by mopping the floor rather then sweeping and then mopping. The baseboards and the walls were stained with who knows what (we sprayed Lysol everywhere to avoid contracting anything health wise). They put us in a room right outside the housekeeping trailer so each night at 11 pm the laundry truck conveniently pulled up and proceeded to load the dirty laundry from the day. The hydraulics of the truck were extremely noisy (as were the employees involved in this procedure) and were quite effective in making sure that people didn't go to sleep until well after midnight when they'd finally completed their job. Also, our room was right outside the main door of the building so each time someone came in the building, we would hear the door slamming and people's loud voices (a great wake up call if you want to awaken at 2 or 3 am). There is also no door closing the building in so if you're on the first floor which we were, your room gets extremely cold because there is no barrier to the outside of the building (the building apparently opens onto the patio). Lastly, even though we'd leave our room at about 10:30 am every day and return around 4:00 pm, our room was rarely cleaned during that period. There were a couple of times when the cleaning staff knocked our door at 5:00 pm asking if they could clean our room. Why can't they clean between 11 am and 4 pm like all of the other hotels in the world. It was very inconvenient to say the least. In our opinion, it was not a good place to stay and we won't be coming back to this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Love staying here and will continue to stay during my trips to Vegas”
Reviews.Author: jareyno1
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel more than once. It is very close to the strip while still providing an at home feel. The full size kitchen and amenities allowed us to save money by not being forced to eat out every meal. The rooms are very comfortable and provide a nice atmosphere. I have stayed here with my spouse and also with a group of friends. The setup of the rooms accomodates both situations well. Everyone that I dealt with was very friendly. The concierge was able to arrange us a rental car during very busy travel times. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: 12blueroses
Reviews.Content: We had 3 - 1 bedroom suites, with a full-sized kitchen and all the appliances. Everything worked. The maid even loaded the dishwasher each day. The bed was very comfortable with a down comforter and down pillows - very relaxing. Since we had 4 people sharing each suite it was a little inconvenient because the bathroom was in the bedroom, but it worked out. The maids and front desk folks were very nice and helpful when needed. They have a heated pool and hot tub, we didn't use, but appeared clean. We were located right next to the Hooters Casino and a short walk to the Tropicana and MGM Grand. We walked a block over to see the New Year's fireworks - quite memorable though a little cold outside. I highly recommend the Desert Rose and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: MarjorieC
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week and we liked it a lot! After going to the other hotels and only breathe the smoke, we knew we made a great selection. It is very close to the strip only a 10 minute walk to the strip or 5 minutes via the MGM entrance. The only two things that weren't too good was the variety of the breakfast menu since it was repetitive and the sofa bed was the most unconfortable thing ever, it felt like a comforter and springs,for a next visit I would choose the 2 bedroom suite, but everything else was good.

Reviews.Title: “Very good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: JeKaDteCapelle
Reviews.Content: The location was great, a block a way from the strip. De rooms very clean. The price is also very good. The breakfast is good, but some times very cowdy. The staff very polite and helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Little oasis just of the strip”
Reviews.Author: MsKSP
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week at Christmas this year...was sooooo pleasantly surprised! The value for the price was amazing. The staff was very helpful and indulgent. How can you beat free breakfast and happy hour for the price? Breakfast is a little busy if you get there near the end...we took food to our rooms...used our dishes two as the paper and styrofoam is hard to swallow...so much of it for everyday. Otherswise, the resort seemed enviro friendly, especially if you were willing to not change linens everyday. The location is perfect...on block to the strip...but when you are at the pool, you wouldn't even know you were in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for families”
Reviews.Author: sirkEdmonton
Reviews.Content: We recently spent a week at the Desert Rose Resort. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Location within walking distance to the main Strip. All staff very friendly. Felt safe and secure. Kitchen fully equipped. Beds very comfortable. Although we chose not to have our room cleaned during our stay housekeeping came by daily to ask us if we wanted cleaning and provided us with fresh towels and shampoos, soap, coffee, etc when we requested it. Basic breakfast provided was nice. Breakfast area got a little crowded but we chose to bring our food up to our room. Manager reception Mon- Thurs from 5-7pm was nice bonus. Pool area and hot tub was nice and the pool water was warm. Very few people using it in December! One computer in main area for internet use but FREE WiFi connection throughout. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “very good value”
Reviews.Author: geo_ark1
Reviews.Content: while the Desert Rose is a bit off of the strip, it is a very good value. the 2 bdrm suite was more of an apartment, which was great for us traveling with teenagers. We received a special "black Friday" rate which made our cost $79 per night. at that rate, we were able to afford a few cabs. No food outlet on site, but Hooters, MGM Grand and the Tropicana are within a 5-10 minute walk. $9.99 prime rib special at Hooters is a very good value. overall, it is a very nice property. the service of the front desk staff was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Brief stay but nice”
Reviews.Author: Nittfan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed one night @ The Desert Rose on Dec. 22 while enroute to AZ. I would recommend this resort if you can get a good AAA or AARP rate, which we did at $57/night inclusive of all taxes. This resort has friendly and helpful staff and is quite nice. There was a nice fireplace burning upon our arrival at night, which added a nice touch, and the lobby is open, clean and cheerful. Our one bedroom condo/suite had a full kitchen with all appliances, all of which were clean and in working order. Nice, comfortable, clean accomodations. Comfortable bed with nice linens. There were 2 large t.v.s ..... one in the bedroom and one in the living room. Breakfast in the a.m. in the lobby was a nice, continental style breakfast with the many cereals, fresh fruits, and the usual. That is what we expected, and it was fine for our needs. We used the outdoor pool (heated to 80F) and the hot-tub in the a.m. and it was fine for us as we are from the North-East where it is much colder than Vegas; it was a real treat for me to take a swim in the pool and then use the hot-tub. Most resorts in Vegas do not even bother to keep their outdoor pools open in the winter months from what I understand, so I was quite pleasantly surprised that their pool is open year round. The Desert Rose is in easy walking distance of Hooters and the MGM, and would not be an uncomfortable walk to Tropicana for most people. You would probably need to have a car or use public transportation to get to the "main" portion of The Strip (which I think is in the Bellagio, Bally's, Paris area). However, if you have a car and drive to Bellagio you can park for free and be right in that area. Bottom line - I would definitely recommend The Desert Rose, especially if you can get a great rate like we did. It is a very quiet, well-kept property and we felt comfortable and safe there. It is not "swanky" property and does not have it's own casino, but we personallly would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, quiet, and completely equipped.”
Reviews.Author: GazeNtransition
Reviews.Content: The strip is over priced, over crowded, and even so-called glamour accommodations are spartan serving medicre food. Las Vegas does have an abundance of diversity and attractions beyond the strip. Desert Rose is perfect for the visitor who prefers Springs Preserve, Chinatown, and the Atomic Testing Museum. Safe and convenient parking close to one's fully equipped suite. Unlike many all suite hotels Desert Rose is near the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Be Beaten for Value”
Reviews.Author: Gilly169
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights with 2 of our teenage kids. It was really cold in Vegas having come from a hot Aussie summer but it was a great place to stay. It is just off the strip near MGM Grand and next to Hooters and not a casino. After staying in "rooms" it was nice to have a 2bd apartment! So 2 bedrooms each with TV, lounge room with tv, balcony looking out over pool & bbq area and breakfast each morning. The breakfast wasn't great but it was ok - no hot food but cereals, bagels, bread/toast & fruit. Tea & coffee too. The thing I enjoyed at the Desert Rose was the 2 hour happy hour each evening from 5 - 7. Free drinks and nibblies was a great way to meet other travelers. We would definitely stay here again even without kids. Would recommend this place very highly!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff and Convenient to the Strip”
Reviews.Author: AmyStone
Reviews.Content: The Desert Rose is a pretty little place located very close the Las Vegas Strip. The resort is actually a cluster of four small peach-colored buildings with a pool in the middle. The buildings look kind of like adobe houses. The front desk staff made a very good first impression with their welcoming attitude, and also by accommodating us almost immediately even though we arrived about an hour before our scheduled check-in time. Our room was a cute one-bedroom suite with a full kitchen. There isn’t a grocery store on-site, but the resort does have a little convenience store in the lobby with chips and other snacks, as well as a place to get coffee, water and juice 24/7. Continental breakfast is also offered daily. Anyway, back to the room. It was decorated in warm south-westerny colors and the bed was super comfortable. The kitchen was fully equipped with dishes, pots, pans, etc. and the room offered plenty of closet and drawer space for our clothes and stuff. The only negatives would probably be that the TV didn’t have much in the way of channel selection, and the balcony was tiny and provided a lovely view of the parking lot and dumpsters. Then again, we didn’t exactly go to Vegas to just watch TV and sit on the porch, either. The Desert Rose Resort has an ideal location. An easy walk to the strip, you’re close enough to all the action when you want it, but just far enough away when it starts to wear thin. There is not a casino or actual restaurant at this resort, but again, everything is close-by. If you don’t feel like walking, the monorail station at MGM Grand is practically across the street. One of the best things about the Desert Rose Resort is the staff, especially Dixye, the concierge. She was extremely helpful during our stay. For example, when we decided we wanted to see a show spur-of-the-moment, she helped us with that. When I was trying to figure out how to get groceries (we didn’t rent a car) she called around and found out how to get them delivered. The employees were all great, from check-in ‘til check-out. If you’re thinking about a nice alternative to the typical casino hotel in Las Vegas and you want a great staff and location, my vote is for The Desert Rose Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MontrealNan
Reviews.Content: I booked a 2 bedroom suite with full kitchen, 2 bathrooms and a balcony with a lovely view of the Strip for an incredible price on the Black Friday sale. We arrived at the hotel at noon and were given our suite even though we were to check in at 4pm. The suite was lovely. Noise..We heard the person upstairs walking around in the night..no big deal. The front desk staff...well some of them were cold...no smiling...especially the younger people. The young man who was at the desk on the night of the 22 nd was especially nice as we needed to see a doctor. The middle aged lady and man at the front desk on the 23 morning were so nice they almost made me cry. They were so solicitous of our medical needs. Thank you. I am sorry I don't have your names. The breakfast..was very minimal. the coffee great. .the service was okay ..The lady in charge took it personally when I asked her if there were nuts in the muffins. (There were 3 kinds of muffins on the 22nd). Either her understanding of English is minimal or she was very rude. She finally asked me if my kids had nut allergies and brought me muffins from the kitchen. She may have realised that she came across as rude, because she was very nice to me on subsequent days. The evening reception..my husband went for this one evening and loved it..He said the fireplace and the welcoming folks were very nice. Thanks We saw the Lion King (quite boring) and KA (absolutely mind blowing) and walked to both performances from Desert Rose (10 minute walk). I also took the bus (return ticket $4 good for a whole day) to Vons supermarket.just down Tropicana Street. The folks I encountered at the hotel (except for a few employees), on the street, at the supermarket, in the bus, taxis and even casinos were absolutely wonderful. I look forward to visiting the USA again!

Reviews.Title: “If you're going to Vegas with children stay here”
Reviews.Author: Thomas061
Reviews.Content: Great value hotel. We went with two teenage children and had a two bedroom suite with living room, kitchen area and bathroom. Our bedroom had an en suite. For sheer size, convenience and comfort you can't beat it. The rooms were clean and comfortable and you couldn't ask for more. The pool was O.K. and it is located just off the strip very close to the MGM. The only downside I could mention (which is not really a problem) was that breakfast was just about adequate, but crowded in the reception area. I've found this with a few U.S hotels. A few people might baulk at walking and as it is located at one end of the strip we walked a lot. We enjoyed this. Some might use a taxi. I wouldn't recommend driving (from any hotel) if staying within the strip. STAY HERE!!

Reviews.Title: “Needed a place close to airport -this was great”
Reviews.Author: tahoeskicabin
Reviews.Content: Nice place and a good value ....has a hottub, complimentary breakfast and helpful staff. The room I stayed in had a fullsize kitchen which was handy. Free wi-fi. 10 buck cab fare to the airport was good. Tell the driver to take Tropicana and know the address...not all cabbies know how to find it.

Reviews.Title: “nice place good location good price and service”
Reviews.Author: ronmor
Reviews.Content: good location to walk to most places on the strip, elpful staff and The price is right

Reviews.Title: “Best value and location in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Ladyp55
Reviews.Content: The Desert Rose Resort is perfectly located to everything you want in Las Vegas. It is walking distance to the start line of the Rock n' Roll Marathon. The rooms are huge and beautiful. Great kitchens with everything you need. I will never stay anywhere else in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “You Want a Great Vacation, Stay at the Desert Rose in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: MarMar123Sc
Reviews.Content: I can't think of anything this hotel could have done better...It is close to everything 1 block off strip. Easy parking and driving to all. Great service and very friendly people, just Great. To top it off, free breakfast every morning. We go to Vegas every two years, this is our first stay at the Desert Rose., we will definitely go back. Thanks to all at the Hotel, M & M from SC.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely rooms, peaceful surroundings; close to casino's and restaurants”
Reviews.Author: PoohBearandTink
Reviews.Content: We reserved a wheelchair accessible room and it was perfect for my husband who had plenty of room to move about (we just had to slide the coffee table to one side). All of our needs were met and the staff was wonderful. They did serve us our complimentary breakfast in our room instead of us going out every morning which made it great to not be ready so early. That can be difficult with a handicapped person. We had assistance with our luggage upon arrival and departure and everything we could ask for; laundry; concierge; vending was close by.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay if you are not into the gambling/glitz of Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Travel Agent Traveler
Reviews.Content: Looking for an inexpensive yet nice place stay during a recent conference visit to Las Vegas, I came across the Desert Rose here on TripAdvisor. The price was right - around $60 - $65 per night including taxes - and the included breakfast was a bonus. The resort is a very short ride from the airport, and is located behing the Tropicana. Although the walk isn't very interesting and is longer than it looks, one could walk to MGM, Luxor and Excalibur. The tram from Luxor would then take you to New York, New York, and the tram from Monte Carlo next door to NY, NY now takes people to the new City Center and onto Bellagio. From MGM, you can pay for the monorail to other resorts. The staff was quite pleasant, check-in was easy and fast. My room was a one-bedroom suite, quite a bit larger than an Embassy Suites, with a fully-equipped kitchen, dining area, large living room, king-bedded bedroom, and bath. There were two TVs. The toilet/tub area of the bathroom is cramped but the rest is very spacious. For a great price, you get a simple breakfast, daily newspaper, and cocktail party in the late afternoon. The breakfast area was crowded every morning I was there, and finding a seat wasn't easy. I made a point of returning to the resort for the cocktail party one day, and it wasn't really worth it. There was wine, beer and soft drinks, and one small tray of crudites. I guess if you like to drink beer... The concierge was very helpful. The weather did not lend itself to pool use but there is a medium-sized pool. Each suite has free high-speed internet, which many Vegas hotels charge $10-$12 a day for! This would be a great place for families on a budget, with the included breakfast and the in-suite kitchen a definite plus. If the price stays reasonable, this is a very good buy.

Reviews.Title: “what a find”
Reviews.Author: angel030
Reviews.Content: this hotel was fantastic i have stayed on the strip many times in las vagas but never again i will stay here every time so near everything free happy hour every evening and free breakfast every morning setting was so prettty with the gardens and lovely pool and staff were great the rooms were fantastic i recomend this place to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location, great staff and really, really comfy beds!”
Reviews.Author: Disneyfan055
Reviews.Content: I went to Las Vegas for the Rock'N Roll Half Marathon. I wanted a place close to the start/finish (Mandalay Bay) and that had a fridge & microwave so that I could eat properly before the event. After much searching I sent to Trip Advisor and found the Desert Rose Resort. The reviews made me see that this was exactly the kind of place I was looking for, and it was really inexpensive. In spite of tempered expectations, I was exceptionally pleased with the property and my suite. I had the most comfortable King size bed with lots of pillows of different textures and degrees of firmness, a full kitchen with dishes, cutlery, pots, etc., and a spacious living/dining room. It was like an apartment and perfect for someone wanting a peaceful place to go back to at the end of a long day of shopping, sight-seeing, and crowds.The continental breakfast was nothing special, but there was always lots of hot Starbucks coffee. They also have an evening reception with wine, beer, sodas and snacks. And what can I say about the staff? Everyone I dealt with was pleasant, courteous and accommodating. I definitely will recommend the Desert Rose to any of my family and friends going to Vegas who want something a little less glitzey and crowded than the Strip hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Ash68Australia
Reviews.Content: Other than a small hiccup over the room on arrival everything was very good. the rooms were very spacious and comfortable. The kitchen was substantial and if you were into cooking you would enjoy. The location was perfect just off the stip.staff were friendly and helpfull. If you are looking for somewhere to relax without having to walk through the casino to get to your room then look no further. Is 4 star not 5 so this is what should be expected.

Reviews.Title: “One bedroom suite at incredible value.”
Reviews.Author: qflash15
Reviews.Content: Stayed one week in a one bedroom suite w/ kitchen for less than $75 a night. Great location on the south end of the strip. Easy acess to all strip casinos without driving on the very busy Las Vegas Bivd., (if you know the back streets of Koval, Paradise, and Frank Sinatra Way.) King size bed in the master, and pull out sofa bed in the livingroom. The large bathroom vanity has only one sink though and the toliet/bathtub area is very cramped. Has a nice continental breakfast that they change up every couple days. Never went anywhere else for breakfast. And a free wine/beer/soda at reception from 5-7 p.m. on weeknights.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!!”
Reviews.Author: CloverValleyGirl
Reviews.Content: Our Girl's Trip weekend was even more fun than usual because of the wonderful place we stayed -- the Desert Rose. All Five of us had our own space, yet plenty of room to enjoy each others company. Try housing five women in a one bathroom place, and you are asking for trouble. Luckily, the Desert Rose had 2 spacious baths, 2 lovely bedrooms, and a more than comfortable living/dining room. We could not have gotten a more convenient place as close to the Strip without spending all our slot money on a small, no living room, no kitchen, hotel room. We were a 3 minute walk to the MGM! That's as good as it gets!! We most certainly would stay at the Desert Rose again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: godsentuk
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights here and have to say we wish we could of stayed longer - clean, spacious rooms which we fully equipped. Friendly staff, good breakfast and location was 5min walk to MGM. Couldnt have asked for more.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and close to the strip, nice happy hour!”
Reviews.Author: rockinrodders
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Desert Rose resort for 5 nights in October after booking it following recommendations on Trip Advisor. Located just south of the main strip and MGM, the hotel was a quick and easy taxi ride from the airport. The hotel is about a 10 minute walk to the strip at MGM or Excalibur and right next door to Hooters. On check-in we were given an automatic upgrade to a 2 bed apartment as they seemed fairly quiet. The room was very spacious and had a good size kitchen and lounge/dining area. There wasa small balcony although the view was of the car park and away from the lights of the strip. The included breakfast was basic but was good to fill up on before heading out for the day. The buffet included juices, coffee, a chice of cereals, toast, bagels and preserves and occasionally eggs. On weeknight evenings (mon-Fri I think) the hotel offered a happy hour between 5-7 where they had a free bar offering complimentary beer, wines and soft drinks and snacks. We found this a great way to get a few drinks down before heading out and paying strip prices. If / when you get sick of paying strip prices for food and drink, there is a 24 hour mini-mart a short walk away and a 7/11 liquor store. Pizza and other restaurants will deliver to the hotel room no problem. The only drawbacks to the hotel was that the cleaners, although they did come in every day, didn't actually do much cleaning. it was only on the final day (tips day!) that they did a good job of cleaning and replacing the coffee satchets etc. Anybody with problems walking or paying through the nose for taxis might be better off staying directly on the strip instead of off it, although of course all the strip hotels you still walk through miles of casino to get to the rooms. The strip is so clogged with traffic that a taxi is no quicker than walking anywhere,, so be prepared to walk miles up and down every day!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet alternative to the hustle & bustle of the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Czern
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 bedroom unit which was clean and comfortable. Beds were comfortable and the staff was very nice. The fact that it is a nonsmoking property was very attractive to us since it's hard to escape the smokers in the actual casino. The property is close enough to walk to MGM although we had a car, we walked most days to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accomodations and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: p098770
Reviews.Content: Convenient location, close to major attractions, and in the heart of downtown. Everything you need for a comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay with kids”
Reviews.Author: jerseygurlz
Reviews.Content: It was like having our own apt. in Vegas. We will stay again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Property, Easy Access to the STRIP!!”
Reviews.Author: 91memaw
Reviews.Content: This resort was very clean, lovely accommodations, the rooms were furnished with everything you needed. It is only half a block from the MGM Grand Hotel and Casino and the STRIP! It's walking distance to everything. Very friendly staff, a wonderful concierge that knew about all the discounts and where the best shows were at. I would definitely go and stay here again, and again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis Just Off The Strip”
Reviews.Author: SaltyDancer
Reviews.Content: Very nice one bedroom apartment room that was super comfortable and well equipped. Very quiet also even though the airport is almost next door - never head a noise with the windows/slider shut. Easy walk to the MGM, Mandalay. After staying on the strip in each of our previous stays to Vegas, we really liked the comfort, roominess and peacefulness of Desert Rose, and will make this our preferred Vegas location going forward. The only recommendation we would make is to make the continental breakfast a bit more consistent and attractive, but then there is Coco's just down the street! Great wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect small hotel close to the strip with large suites and attentive staff.”
Reviews.Author: DrHNottingham
Reviews.Content: Excellent value hotel located off the strip. We stayed in a lovely one-bedroom suite with well-equiped small kitchen. Staff were always helpful. The continental breakfast buffet was nice.

Reviews.Title: “It's like having your own vacation home in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: rosebud72
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the most of the major hotels on the strip, but I really enjoyed my stay at the Desert Rose. Everyone makes you feel at home, and you don't have to go through a maze to get to your room at night. The rates are affordable and the layout is condo style so you have plenty of space and privacy.

Reviews.Title: “Revisit to The Desert Rose”
Reviews.Author: SwindonChris47
Reviews.Content: My second visit here in 2 years and I've upped my rating. Not perhaps the most luxurious accommodation in Las Vegas, but best value for money and totally adequate. I had requested an upper floor room in block 3 which was allocated and available on arrival at 15:00. As ever the room was spotless and clean. Unfortunately the room was situated over a noisy air conditioning unit which as I am a light sleeper woke me up a few times. The next day I requested a change of rooms which was granted without quibble. In fact I was allowed to look at a couple of rooms before I made my choice. I then switched to a quieter room, top marks to the staff for allowing this. The breakfast is much as I remembered- adequate. The evening cocktail 2 hours (free beer and wine) has unfortunately been reduced to 4 days per week (Mon to Thurs) and they no longer have the organ player, but you can't complain really. Free internet Wi-fi is a plus. I would recommend this place to anyone unless you're looking for a party casino atmosphere!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic place to stay,close to strip”
Reviews.Author: Lovinmambo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week and really enjoyed our time here, the resort is clean and the rooms were both spotless and comfortable. The staff are friendly and helpful, the breakfast was o.k to start the day off with and the cocktail hour at night was a welcome addition. The security was also very good at the hotel we felt very safe. Good location, only about 10 min walk over to MGM Grand.

Reviews.Title: “Desert Rose is an oasis.”
Reviews.Author: AZRaider
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend getaway. I have to say this was the nicest experience we have had staying in a Shell Vacations property yet. The staff was friendly and accomodating. The rooms (suites) are a nice size, with a small but full kitchen, and quite comfortable. The bathrooms were nice with a large tub, but the showers left something to be desired. Everything in our suite worked fine. When the maid failed to leave us enough towels, a quick call to the front desk took care of the problem almost immediately. Security is good, which is important being just off the south end of the strip. There is almost no overhead lighting in the suites, though, which makes them a bit dark at night. The breakfast buffet was continental but okay, and kept us going until lunch. The surprising decent Hooters casino is right next door. The monorail station in the MGM Grand is a short walk, as is the tram at Excalibur. On the way back, it is easy to get turned around in the MGM Grand parking garage though. I would gladly stay here again and reccomend the Desert Rose to anyone except young people who want a place to party. Vegas is full of other places for you. The Desert Rose was a nice quiet retreat at the end of a busy day (and night).

Reviews.Title: “10 out of 10 for Desert Rose”
Reviews.Author: lizpinky
Reviews.Content: What a beauty is all I can say about this place. If and when I go back to Vegas I would not hesitate staying again. It wan clean and comfortable, extremely affordable and only one block back from 'the strip'. It was great to be able to have some peace and quiet at the end of te day, and that's exactly what we got.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: JaneKn
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay. Easy walk to the Strip. Quiet and clean. Condo had lots of room for everyone. My only complaint would be the lighting in the condo. Very dark and no overhead lights. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT FIND GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: anngray8
Reviews.Content: Brill hotel just behind Hooters and opposite Luxor. So perfect location to get to all the big hotels. Great Buffet Breakfast included in price. Great size rooms we had one bed apartment fo myself husband and teenage son. Just left the double bed setee up all day No prob. Dinning table and kitchen. Take a tray then you can carry your breakfast up to your room in the morning as seating can be hard to get. Pool area nice although wish mades would not choose to bang and clang cleaning round it just as you nodding off about 11. am. Reception staff adorable and so helpful. Would deff stay there again. Especially as food in vegas expensive. so breakfast a real help

Reviews.Title: “We've found our spot to stay when in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: lynzilu
Reviews.Content: My mom and I recently stayed at the Desert Rose while attending the PBR World Finals. In previous years we've stayed on the strip but opted for something quieter this time around. The Desert Rose was the perfect place to stay. It was comfortable, spacious, and very clean. We took advantage of having the full-size refrigerator, microwave and dishes which definitely cut down on our overall meal expenses. It was conveniently located close to the strip but was still quiet and gave that homey feeling. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay at Desert Rose Resort”
Reviews.Author: IanBTruro_Cornwall
Reviews.Content: This is a brilliant hotel offering great value for money. OK, it's not as glitzy as some of the others in Vegas but it's clean, quiet, very comfortable and in a great location - just a ten minute walk to the MGM Grand and the monorail station. We stayed in a one bedroomed suite. It was very well equipped with a kitchen, a lounge, one double bedroom, a vanity area and a bathroom/toilet. Our only minor disappointment was the bathroom/toilet which did seem a bit on the small side. The well equipped kitchen had all the appliances to allow you to self cater if you wanted to save some money but you need a car to get to supermarkets as there are none nearby. We appreciated the huge amount of space to spread out at the end of a long day - much more than you'd get in an average hotel room. We appreciated the buffet breakfast included in the cost of accommodation and the early evening "happy hour" with free drinks. There was also a very good and extremely cheap self service laundry on site. The staff were extremely friendly, efficient and helpful. A bulb went in our room and was replaced within minutes of reporting the problem. If we returned to Las Vegas we would definitely choose to stay again at the Desert Rose.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: catzaun
Reviews.Content: This was our 14th year to go to Vegas for the PBR finals. We were tired of mile long casinos, so we checked out the Desert Rose and decided to stay off the strip and out of casinos. This was the best decision we could have made. We parked close to our room, about 60 seconds away instead of a mile away. The rooms were comfortable and very nice. A full kitchen stocked with all appliances and dishes and pots and pans. We are coming back next year and bringing more family. We really enjoyed this place and all the staff were extremely knowledgeable and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “most enjoyable & relaxing stay”
