Reviews.Author: benandsamdogs
Reviews.Content: John & Lorraine Sheppard from Mansfield Nottinghamshire England my wife& I stayed & for 14 nights, we relaxed by the pool by morning & early afternoon after a wonderful complimentary breakfast,fabulously clean white towels by the pool,constant cold drinks ,spacious sun bathing area & hot tub without the sound of slot machines but still within a short walking distance of typical VEGAS life & access to the monorail & neighbouring hotels.

Reviews.Title: “little gem within walking distance to strip”
Reviews.Author: geordiegirl19
Reviews.Content: good base for the strip, the first room smelt of smoke, but the reception staff were very good and changed the room straight away, the breakfast was good and the managers reception that was on from 5-7 mon-thur was very welcome. would def stay here again on next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful peaceful place to stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: GinetteandMichel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Desert Rose for 6 nights in October '08 & also in October '09. This resort was recommended to us by a friend, & is located within a 10 minutes. walk from the strip. Beautiful condo, very well maintained & very clean. All appliances are also very clean. Nice quiet retreat after spending time on the Strip. In addition to all the amenities, they also provide a free complete breakfast every morning. Excellent location; 10 minutes drive from the airport. The pool is heated & has a very well maintained BBQ area. All the staff members are very friendly & very helpful. We highly recommend & we will go back again. Ginette & Michel from Calgary.

Reviews.Title: “Our second visit was better than the first!”
Reviews.Author: ardac
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 5 days here in Oct, and had a wonderful , relaxing holiday in Las Vegas. Our room was top notch and the bedding was very comfy. From check in to check out we had no complaints. We stayed here last year with our 6 yr old daughter and had a great time, and had an even better experience this time on our own. I really enjoyed the evening reception as last year having our daughter with us, I only drank pop, this year I enjoyed a few beers poolside or in the hot tub. With all the hustle and bustle Vegas has to offer, its nice to have a quiet place to return to at the end of the day. This is a great resort for families, since there is no casino. The pool is nice and clean, and the hot tub was just what we needed for some relaxation. We will definitely stay here again when we return to Vegas, with or without our daughter....and highly recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Heaven in Sin City!”
Reviews.Author: ElceeEdmonton
Reviews.Content: We have a reunion every year gathering from coast-to-coast in Canada. Me and my cousin, the vivacious young adventurers, and my mother and her two sisters, all over 80. It's the perfect getaway. The sisters would get up and enjoy the complimentary breakfast every morning and meet guests from all over the world. The pool is a relaxing oasis where we would meet every day to make plans for shopping, shows, site-seeing, and of course our endless Scrabble tournaments. Mom and I would would then say good night to the gals and go gambling until 3am every night. Together we span 3 generations and it was perfect for all of us. See you next year.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: NelliBli
Reviews.Content: I just returned from an almost annual Las Vegas trip. I found the Desert Rose last year, after I had already booked a different hotel. I saw the reviews here on Trip Advisor, and was really looking forward to our stay here. It was great! The room was extremely clean, and well-kept. We only had one very small issue, and that was communicating with housekeeping. As seems to be usual in Las Vegas, most of the housekeeping staff is non-English speaking. Even though they say "OK" they really haven't understood you. I would recommend calling housekeeping, to resolve issues. The pool is great... check-in was delayed only a little, as they were full the night before and thus we waited until the official check-in time of 4:00 until the room was ready. Since this hotel gets such great ratings, I would imagine it is always full, and so you should plan to get there around 4:00. The pool was excellent. It was clean, well-kept also, and there were chairs and towels easily available. The continental breakfast was a lovely addition. Offerings were constantly re-filled, and varied a bit from day to day. I imagine almost everyone would enjoy this. I have one very strong recommendation... we were assigned to room 2217, and told it had a great view of the pool. This was true, however, if you wish to sleep in the evening, or after 6:00 in the morning, REQUEST A DIFFERENT ROOM!! The speakers for the pool are right under the master bedroom & blast music until 11:00 at night. If this is not an issue for you, then go ahead. Also, there are loud conversations from the gym, between housekeepers, and pool guys, and people preparing the breakfast, starting at 6:00am. If you hate earplugs, REQUEST A DIFFERENT ROOM! We will DEFINITELY stay here again, however, we will be sure to request a different room.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel. Would stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: ChiC28
Reviews.Content: We arrived after a very long flight from Barbados. Everyone was very helpful. Always happy and pleasant. The room was very comfortable and clean. It was like home away from home with a full kitchen. Large stove and fridge and dish washer. Nicely laid out plan. Excellent contiental breakfast. Felt very safe at Desert Rose. Excellent Location. Walking distance to the Strip. Fifteen minutes drive to Boulevard Mall. Would stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “This place is a treasure.”
Reviews.Author: Doogan2
Reviews.Content: We read and trusted previous reviews and booked a 4 night stay. Since we drove from Texas, it was hard to predict when we would arrive. We actually arrived in Las Vegas a day earlier than our reservation. The Desert Rose people were able to give us our room early and only charged half the regular rate for that night!! This place did not disappoint. The room was lovely and well appointed. Everything was immaculate. It is easy walking distance from MGM where we ate breakfast at Studio 24 and dinner at Rainforest Cafe. The Desert Rose is quiet and comfortable. There are no long waits for elevators that you have at the large hotels. The hot tub is great. Over all you can't ask for better. P.S. We came for the AARP convention and are 70 & 73 years old.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay, Roomy Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Applejacker
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Desert Rose. The suites were roomy at over 600 square feet and very affordable for all you receive. A full kitchen was included with full-size fridge, stove, coffee maker, blender, microwave, and all cookware and utensils. TV’s (older CRTs) were in both the living room and bedroom, and a DVD player with stereo system in the living room. Furnishings were very modern and attractive. The rooms were very clean, though showing their age a bit from the battered baseboard moldings. Internet access was free, though a bit slow @ 268 kbps. The “big” hotels charge you daily for any Wi-Fi use. Continental breakfast was free daily in the lounge, though the only hot items were toast and instant oatmeal with hot water. Only two toasters were available (one with the controls secured with duct-tape), so you had to wait a bit when it was busy. I would recommend they add an additional toaster, at least. The staff was very nice, attentive, and helpful. The “convenience” store” was open 24/7, a nice touch, though grossly overpriced. A free USA Today paper was included though you’ll need to be sure to grab one in the morning as they will be gone by noon. The Desert Rose is conveniently located immediately behind the Hooters Hotel and Casino, which is across the street from the MGM and its monorail terminal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: FloridaTerry
Reviews.Content: We checked in late and were upgraded to a 2 bedroom. Rooms were large and very comfortable. Nice large soaking tub for a long day of flying. We will always stay here when in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Did not disappoint”
Reviews.Author: jp43
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on the reviews it received on Trip Advisor and were not at all disappointed. My husband and I along with another couple shared a two bedroom, two bath suite. It was perfect! It made making plans much easier and maximized the time we were able to spend together since we live in different states. My husband and I arrived first and got there at 1:00. We were able to check in if we were willing to accept a handicapped accessible room. That was fine with us since we were prepared to have to wait until 4:00 to check in. About 10 minutes after we checked in we received a call from the front desk to make sure our room was satisfactory. Our friends were able to get their own room keys by just giving their names to the front desk. The walk to the strip was an easy walk and it was very near the city bus stop (we took the bus to Sam Boyd stadium for the U2 concert) and near a monorail stop as well. Even though the resort was located close to the airport, we were not kept awake by the planes leaving and taking off. We were worried about that because my husband is a light sleeper. The breakfast was light, but adequate. They had toast, danishes, cereal and either fruit or yogurt to offer. There was also coffee, soft drink and juice. The room was a little crowded, but we were able to find a seat and there was adequate seating outside or we had the option to take the food back to our rooms. There is a small convenience store located near the front desk which came in handy after a long night out on the town. We did wish we could have purchased beer there, however. Overall, we were extremely pleased with our stay at the Desert Rose and will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: Larik
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Desert Rose for a week in September. We had 2 bedroom/2 bathroom suite. First, we had to switch the room because it was located at the ground floor by the entrance gate. Metal door kept banging all hight long. The other room was much better with different layout. The swimming pool is sad, very small. Kids swimming pool was occupied by old ladies. I was getting "oh! kids! in vegas! in the pool while I'm here" kind of looks. Breakfast is a joke. Disgusting coffee (proudly served by Starbucks name), toast, apples. I asked for a cream cheese but they said they give cream cheese only with bagels and bagels were not on the menu that morning. Next time we are in Vegas we will not choose this hotel. There are much better resorts.

Reviews.Title: “A gem!”
Reviews.Author: Steve&Joanne
Reviews.Content: Spent 9 nights at the Desert Rose in late October. Weather was very good (a few degrees higher than seasonal norm - mid 80's most days). Flight - Arrived mid afternoon after the direct Virgin flight from Gatwick and room was waiting for us. The flight is great as it's direct but the downside of this is that everyone is going to Vegas so a) it's full so don't expect any spare seats and b) some of the passengers took too much advantage of the free drink so it felt a bit like a rowdy all-inclusive resort. Also the seat pitch in economy is poor - much worse than other airlines to the US and Carribean. Rooms - The rooms are in three storey blocks around the swimming pool and are fantastic. Plenty of space and loads of cupboard / storage space. We had a one bedroom apartment which has a lounge /kitchen diner and then a large bedroom with bathroom. Both rooms have a Phillips TV which have loads of US news and sports channels but also HBO and TNT so you can always find a film to watch. The kitchen is extremely well equipped with everything your kitchen at home - holiday places in the UK could certainly learn a lot (i,.e. salt and pepper / washing up liquid supplied) so you don't need to buy any of that when you arrive. Some takeaway/delivery leaflets were also supplied which we used once and was very good. The bed was very comfortable. Pool - The pool got quite busy and on certain days it was a rush to get a bed - again you get the usual inconsiderate ones who bag the bed then go off for the morning - but to the resort's credit the manager came round and removed the towels! The water was not to bad - OK once you got in. The jaccuzzi was very good and very warm. Breakfast - an added bonus was the continental breakfast and free coffee throughout the day. Basic but you don't really need a full breakfast with the ginormous portions you get when you go out to eat! Manager's drinks - this was a nice addition from 5-7 pm Mon-Thurs (not sure why they don't do it at the weekend - perhaps they were worried about all the people from the Virgin flight drinking them out of house and home!). Beer and wine - but good quality. Most people gave a dollar per round as a tip. It was a good way for a lot of people to meet others staying at the resort. Location - as most people have said the resort is a block from the Strip so takes a about 10 mins to walk. You can also go in the back of the MGM (valet and check in) which is handy for the monorail. The only downside is that unless you have a car there are not any decent grocery stores nearby. There are a couple of convenience stores so you can get drinks, snacks etc but no fresh meats, salads bits etc. The only one suggestion I would make to the management is to open a snack bar by the pool for lunches / drinks and they would make a fortune. Overall - a brilliant resort away from the madness of the Strip. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great suite”
Reviews.Author: Brian95616
Reviews.Content: The suite was extremely well outfitted and clean. We loved it. No loud slot machines in the lobby, just a quiet clean room. The morning breakfast was a nice addition. Less than 10 minute walk to the strip (MGM Grand).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic quiet location but near to all the sights of Vegas”
Reviews.Author: piemakers
Reviews.Content: The dessert rose one bedroom says for 4 people ok for familys but not for couples as bath and toilet are in bedroom and none inthe other room . The staff upgraded us at cost and it was great in a 2 bed 2 bathroom manythanks to Niecha. The Dessert Rose is in great quite locationbut near to all Vegas hes to offer would love t o stay again .Tipsget out of Vegas and see some great places.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and convenience -- a quiet oasis”
Reviews.Author: KathyBJax_FL
Reviews.Content: The resort was everything it advertised. We very much enjoyed the suite, the location and the service personnel. Breakfast buffet was perfectly adequate -- it gets more crowded later in the week. The cocktail hour was also a nice benefit. We would stay here again and would certainly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Jerseygirl8667
Reviews.Content: We just returned yesterday from 6 days at the DRR, our stay was perfect. We found it online and booked it after reading the reviews. The Desert Rose was not a disappointment, we had a 1 Br condo and it was roomy, impeccabley clean (as was the entire property), quiet and in a perfect location. The staff could'nt have been more accommodating or nice and we would not hesitate to stay again. The continental breakfast was great, (people who complain about it must not understand what a continental breakfast is) and the coffee was the best. Our only complaint was the rude Europeans who would push you out of the way to get to a bagel (they would also take enough food back to the rooms to hold them over for the winter) and who would go out to the pool at 8am and grab up all the lounge chairs even though they wouldn't return to the pool until hours later. That being said I would not let this negative keep me from staying there again or from recommending this resort to family or friends.

Reviews.Title: “The best value in Las Vegas, fabulous roomy suites and very modern and clean.”
Reviews.Author: Veronica056
Reviews.Content: Desert Rose Resort is just a short walk from the strip. We stayed 10 days and will definately be back. The 2 bedroomed suite was very spacious and very clean also a kitchen where all appliances were new. There was also a free buffet breakfast thrown in but go down early as after 8.30am it tends to get very busy. The staff were very friendly and helpful. It is great value and much cheaper than hotels and loads of room. I saw it first on trip advisor.

Reviews.Title: “Almost 5 out of 5 - Incredible value”
Reviews.Author: Buellrider
Reviews.Content: For location and price this place cant be beaten. The suites are superb, large, comfortable, clean and with lots of nice touches. Beats many Hamptons I have stayed in into a cocked hat. Great and friendly welcome too. The only failing is the bun fight, I mean breakfast buffet. I took one look at the mass of people and stuck my fingers in my ears and walked away but then for a place this size and so popular I guess its to be expected. If and when I ever come back to LV I will head here, no question.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place for one night or longer”
Reviews.Author: Lanceoak
Reviews.Content: We flew into Las Vegas and were only staying one night and then taking a lengthy road trip to the Grand Canyon and envrions. Well treated by the staff and given every assistance to ensure not only our stay was pleasant but that we could quickly get on the road the next day. Very large suite and spotless. For those staying longer, the kitchen area in the suite was very well appointed. If our plans had allowed, we certainly would have returned here to end off our trip to Vegas. Close to the strip (walking) but far enough away to avoid the crowds. Excellent breakfast and a place suitable for families. A definite spot to stay when we revisit Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “100% impressed!”
Reviews.Author: 1kidandpoodle
Reviews.Content: Best place we have stayed in Vegas for the price! Loved the GREAT rates you can get if you book early. Hope they continue to offer reasonable rates as they grow in popularity!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: jolamo30
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week and got an amazing deal on Expedia. You pretty much get an apartment per couple with an en suite bathroom, fully equipt kitchen and tv/lounge area. Breakfast is basic but good value (breakfast hall got a bit crowded) but if you fancy an all American brekkie there is an amazing diner called 'Coco's Lounge' just down the road where we went 3 times and always had great food. The apartments are in a good location off the strip, a stone's throw from the MGM Casino and it was quite nice being away from the madness for a bit. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A place you might call home”
Reviews.Author: noneez
Reviews.Content: Recently my wife and I had the pleasure of staying at the Desert Rose in Las Vegas while attending a convention hosted by our local Union. Having stayed at the Desert Rose previously we were aware of the careful attention they provide to their guests. However, this stay was a special experience in the way we were accomodated. The Desert Rose recognizes their elite members in a way that certainly makes you realize that you are being cared for. From the delivery of our breakfast each morning to the extra mile taken in helping us get our business taken care of the Desert Rose is truly a home away from home. One can certainly appreciate the consideration given by these folks when you are in a place that has the frenzy and glitz that can easily add more caos than relaxation. Thank you again for a job well done. We would not hesitate to recomend this location to anyone looking for a reward in Las Vegas. The Grears

Reviews.Title: “Faultless accommodation in great location”
Reviews.Author: whyteleafe
Reviews.Content: We could not fault this complex. Great location just off the Strip, all the amenities you could want and great value for money, highly recommended!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Reasonable”
Reviews.Author: vegeterian
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my daughter, her husband and 2 young children (4 yrs & 18 mos. in a 2 BR suite the night before our flight back to Atlanta. It was so nice that the hotel staff at the front desk offered to print our boarding passes for us so we didn't have to wait for an available computer or print them at the airport. Our suite was very nice and clean, except the carpet was old and stained and the sofa was stained and lumpy. They said they were in the process of updating their rooms but had not gotten to this building yet. My advise would be to ask for an updated room when making reservations. If we had been staying more than one night we would have asked to be moved to a newer suite. We liked having the car close to our room so we did not have to valet park or have to walk a long distance to a self-park garage like you have to do at the big hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Not as close to Strip as they say, but a nice place.”
Reviews.Author: MTWarrior
Reviews.Content: This "resort" is not as close to the strip as they say. It is basically behind and across the street from the MGM. We got more walking in than we bagained for. We had a one bedroom suite, with the bathroom accessed through the bedroom. A nicely stocked kitchenette which we didn't really use. Maids washed the few dishes that we did use. We were there to celebrate our daughter's 21st birthday. When we take our son, we'll stay in a casino on the Strip, probably Bally's or Paris. Small pool

Reviews.Title: “A secret gem”
Reviews.Author: jaanja
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay here, 4 days last year and two weeks this time. Always a great stay, daily maid service, great team and located very conveniently to the strip without the noise. Stayed in a two bedroom suite with two bathrooms and lots of room. We are recommending this place to everyone we know and am surprised that a lot of people we spoke to on our travels had never heard of the place. It represents excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Yearly Girl's Trip off the Strip!!!”
Reviews.Author: ToniaJ
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel because all 5 of us would be able to stay together. As soon as checking in we went straight to the grocery store around the block and stocked up for our 4 day stay in Vegas. We ate breakfast and lunch at the hotel and dinner on the strip. It was perfect!!! They had happy hour by the pool every night with free drinks. Not top shelf, but enough to get the night started! We had everything we needed in the hotel for the 5 of us to be comfortable including all cooking utensils! Staying off the strip was perfect! When out and about we did the "Vegas thing", but when we were done it was nice to come back to peace and quiet!!! Definitely recommend this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “A pleasure... highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: dogpatchusa
Reviews.Content: What a gem! After 3 weeks of Utah tent camping, we had a relaxing 3-night stay before flying home. The location was excellent, staff friendly, the room was clean and comfortable, kitchen a big bonus... will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for the Price”
Reviews.Author: Arabhrse
Reviews.Content: We wanted a place just off the strip that you would not have to walk through a casino to get to your room. This facility fit the bill. Was a block from MGM and was in back of Hooters. Place was quiet which was amazing as it was not to far from the airport and within the flight path of the tour helicopters. Very good continental breakfast but get there before 8 am to beat the crowds. Front desk is very helpful with needing cabs and the response time for the cabs was just a few minutes. Our room was a suite (I beleive most are) and was very comfortable and had lots of space. Overall good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: polarman1952
Reviews.Content: Well what can I say that others havent, what a great choice for our first visit to Vegas. From the moment we checked in, it was brilliant staff from cleaners to reception always had a smile and a genuine greeting, rooms were very comfy and spacious and kitchen had every possibe appliance you needed apart from Washer but hey theres a laundry on site if you really need it. Pool area always clean and we never went without a sun lounger in the 2 weeks we were there, saying that did get busy at weekends. Desert Rose a great place to come back to after the hustle and bustle of the strip. It takes about 15-20 minutes to walk to the begining of the strip, less if your younger and fitter. Deuce bus takes you along the entire strip with hop on hop off 7 dollars for 24 hours. Great place if like us, you are staying for 1 or 2 weeks. although you don't pay for it there is a breakfast every morning of Cereals toast, croissants, jam, marmalade peanut butter and juices. Coffee is available all day for free which is a massive bonus as is the managers happy 2 hours Mon - Thurs where beer and wine in available at no cost yes NO Cost anyone want further info just email me. would I go back DEFINATELY !!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Super_Fly6
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I stayed here for 2 weeks in September and loved every minute of it! We stayed and got married in the Vention last year and as lovely and beautiful as the Venetian is...I would choose the Desert Rose again due to the value! We checked in quickly and were made up with our room: spotless, comfy and everything we could have needed for our 2 wk trip, it really was a home away from home! Breakfast was fab, best to be early as any time after 8am can get crowded but pleanty of food to go around, also Managers reception was great, free beer, wine, soft drinks & snacks! The lobby has free Starbucks coffee all day! The only thing negative is there isnt enough sunbeds around the pool, if you got there any later than 8 am (which was the time it opened and you had to join a que of people!!) there was towles on every sunbed and you were stuck with a chair or sometimes nothing! The hotel is situated behind Hooters and the Tropicana, it was about a 10 min walk to the main strip but we would cross at the back entrance the the MGM (over from Hooters) and cut through the MGM lobby & casino as it was nice and cool! We love Vegas so much and planning a few nights next year when we travel around California and we would choose the Desert Rose over any hotel in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “What a great place with a great location and excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: carauction
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at the Desert Rose Resort. We came for the Barrett-Jackson Collector Car Event. Very nice place to stay with all the amenities you could possibley want or need! Close to the Airport and the Strip with very affordable prices. Any time I'm heading to Vegas I'm staying here! Sincerely, Dell Houston,Texas

Reviews.Title: “The place to be!!!!”
Reviews.Author: chictraveler08
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd time this year staying here. I love the location. Close to everything. Very family oriented. Quite, relaxing, rooms are super spacious. The staff is very nice and helpful. Excellent price!!!! Would stay again next trip to VEGAS!!!! 2 Thumbs up!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly service - Hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: jyztravelers
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week with husband and 2 friends in 2 bedroom unit. Room was clean and quiet, beds were comfortable and we had plenty of room for the 4 of us. Living/dining room is not large but Parents came for a day and we still didn't feel crowded with 6 people. All of the staff members we came in contact with from front desk to housekeeping were friendly and exceptionally helpful. Had no trouble checking in or out and no maintenance problems to report. Had a nice workout facility, a clean Pool and towels were provided, which is a plus (less to pack!). Resort is a quick walk, maybe a block, to south end of Vegas strip (MGM, Tropicana, Luxor, Excaliber, Mandalay Bay, etc.) so we hardly used our rental car other than to go to grocery store and downtown. Continental breakfast was served every day and was decent. We will definitely stay here again when we return.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: BJPToronto_Canada
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at Desert Rose, but it won't be my last. Talk about fantastic value...I found a sale on Expedia for only 90 dollars Canadian, after taxes for a two bedroom unit. The hotel provides breakfast. The place is spotless. The rooms are not overly large, but are spotless. Most of the guests appear to be time share people. You will need a car to get around as the hotel does not have a shuttle to the strip. It is just over a half mile to the strip and then you could take a bus along the strip if you wish. Or the monorail stop is just a block away if you prefer. But we found that a car was the most convenient way to get around Vegas. The staff at the hotel is amazing. Nothing is too much trouble for them and they always are smiling and saying hello. You could tell that the hotel is starting to do a bit of cost cutting as the breakfast this year did not have ham slices and boiled eggs each day the way they used to last year (only periodically now). But it is still a good filling breakfast and if you can find fault with it, then you should be staying home!! I love the idea of having a full kitchen and a living room and dining room when I travel. You can save a lot of money!! The only complaint I have ever heard about the Desert Rose is that the pool water is always cold. On this stay the weather was 105, but no one was going in the water as they said it was too cold. The loungers around the smallish pool were filled by 10 am. I would not recommend this place to you if you are hoping for a water type holiday. But if you are in Vegas to see the sights, then this is the hotel for you. It has the most comfortable beds. I'll definitely be going back there!!

Reviews.Title: “Little tired but good value”
Reviews.Author: FruOlsson
Reviews.Content: The Desert Rose is a nice place no doubt. No frills but good value! Good location off the Strip, but close enought o walk to some of the main attractions. The hotel offered free breakfast but usually ran out of quite a few items way too soon. The pool was not heated, which was a pity, and the rooms were rather tired with some what stained carpets and faucets coming out of the wall in the shower. However, this is a nice place to stay anyway. Good size rooms, well-equipped kitchen, nicely decorated, spacious bathroom and up-to-date amenities on the property. Your dollar is well spent at the Desert Rose! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and location and very close to the strip”
Reviews.Author: ambinomosquit
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right off the strip located by Hooters and less than a block from MGM Grand. It is on the MGM Grand and Hooters side. The hotel staff were very accomodating. They let us check in hours before our check in time as we arrived earlier. They were very friendly. This hotel is a great value for what you get. We had a two bedroom suite. Each bedroom had large closets, windows, and large comfy beds. There were three tv's in the suite. The master had it's own bathroom and there was another bathroom on the other side of the suite. The room had a full kitchen and dining area. It was very clean. The hotel is not a large resort and offers no restaurant. There is a pool. It was too cool in April to use it. There is a continental breakfast each morning. It was a short walk to the MGM Grand tram system. We used that for most of our long distance traveling up and down the strip. We did not rent a car the four days we were there. I would definitely stay here if you want to be off the strip but still close. It is a nice quiet hotel without the smokey casinos. Great location. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay at the DR - 5 Star comfort & service”
Reviews.Author: CostalGirl
Reviews.Content: From check in to check out this hotel aims to please. Our small family reunion was fun and affordable. We even cooked one night and had every utensil and appliance necessary. Can't recommend this jewel highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: LiLKittyMonkey
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel just this past May with 2 friends and my boyfriend, and it was perfect. We got a 2 bedroom suite, that had more than enough room for all of us. There were 2 full bathrooms, a sleeper couch in the living room, kitchen, dining area, balcony, and 2 decent-sized very comfortable beds in each bedroom. The only downfall to the hotel is the walk. If you have a car, it's marvelous and located like a couple blocks away from the strip, but walking is a little different because one block in Vegas is huge. So bring your running shoes! The desert rose also has a pool and a jacuzzi located inside for all the visitors to use which is nice if you just feel like relaxing during your trip. The desert rose isn't necessarily a party hotel, it's more of a family/lounging kind of place. So it wasn't that big of a deal going out with my friends at the other hotels, and walking back to the desert rose which was quiet and a nice change of pace after all the hustle and bustle of the city. I would definitely recommend the desert rose for those who don't mind the distance. Honestly, it was a lot nicer than even a room we partied in at the Mandalay Bay and three times cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations. FANTASTIC hidden Las Vegas Jewel!”
Reviews.Author: TrevorH2
Reviews.Content: This property is just fantastic. Clean, well appointed, comfortable and the rooms are enormous given the average Vegas room. The strip is great., and the resorts are fantastic, but if you're looking to maximize your dollar in Vegas, the Desert Rose is the way to go. Like you, I read these raving reviews on Trip Advisor and wondered could it possibly live up. Well it actually exceeded my expectations. With the money we saved on their rates, we were able to enjoy a fabulous 4 Diamond Vegas dinner, and a trip to the Grand Canyon. And we never felt out of the way. We could easily be INSIDE the MGM Grand in 5 minutes walking. Unless I just have money to burn, I'll always stay at the Desert Rose. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel for the location and the price.”
Reviews.Author: Wifey2J
Reviews.Content: I found this place online and based my decision to stay here on the reviews it received. I was not disappointed. Upon arrival I notice how close(walking distance)it was to the strip. Checking in was quick and simple and the staff was very friendly. There were six of us in a 2 bedroom 2 bath suite and when we entered the room we were very happy. There was plenty of room for everyone to sleep and put away their belongings. The room was clean and we had a balcony that faced the parking lot which was nice too. They offered a simple breakfast in the morning which was good so you can eat a little something before going out for the day. Although we did not use the pool during the day, it appeared to get full quickly so it's a good idea to get there early to get a seat. We went to the pool on our last night in the late evening and it was pretty much empty and the family and I had a great time. I would definitely stay here again. If you are looking for a family friendly place or something that doesn't have a casino this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant stay at the Desert Rose Resort”
Reviews.Author: fatsam1967
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay here based on the previous reviews and given the price compared to the bigger strip hotels. The location is perfect, just 5 min from the MGM and the strip but far enough away to be very quiet at night. There is plenty of parking and we were able to get parked next to our rooms every day. The rooms are huge with separate living and sleeping areas. They are also well stocked and the housekeeping staff keep them very clean and tidy (even putting on the dishwasher for us while we were out). The only small gripe that i would have is that the pool area is quite small and there are not enough sun loungers so there tends to be a mad rush for beds in the morning. Other than that could not fault the place and would definitely be back for another stay in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location but...”
Reviews.Author: WanderingJim
Reviews.Content: The Good: location, service and value. The Bad: We rented two 2-bedrm suites and both were not very clean (dirty couches and bugs). Our rooms had thin walls. You can clearly hear a person's conversation in the hallway and also the constant humming of the ice machine at night. Perhaps our stay would have been better in a different area of the resort. I would avoid the rooms near the front parking lot.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: spunky68
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Desert Rose Resort, especially for the price. It was nice to have 2-bedrooms and comfortable living space; living room and kitchen. Our teenage kids loved the pool area, and the idea that they could buy snacks from the little shop anytime of the day or night. They were impressed with the comfortable 'at home' feeling. The staff was very friendly, especially the room attendants. We would look to stay here again the next time we come to Las Vegas. It was conveniently located close enough to the strip to walk to easily.

Reviews.Title: “Great place close to the strip but definitely isn't the Las Vegas strip!”
Reviews.Author: Rockiesfamily
Reviews.Content: Thank you for a nice relaxing and beautiful place to stay during our anniversary. The Desert Rose had very friendly and helpful staff, nice amenities in the room, and a comfortable atmosphere. We could be part of the Las Vegas scene when we wanted to and then could definitely be away from the scene when we wanted that. I definitely recommend this resort as a great place to stay while in the Las Vegas area.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: oldglossopian
Reviews.Content: After being turned off by the price of the famous hotels on the Strip for the week we wanted to visit, we read the reviews on Trip Advisor to find an off-strip hotel in Vegas. We're really glad we did, the Desert Rose Resort is a gem of a hotel very close to the back of the MGM Grand. Don't come here if you want your hotel to have the huge Vegas buffet breakfasts/lunches and dinners, but if you want a clean hotel, with excellent pool, good size rooms, easy access to the strip, free continental breakfast, helpful staff, no long queues to check in, and an affordable price then this is the one for you. Previous visits to Vegas I have stayed on the Strip (Luxor most recently), and while that is an experience, I will always try and stay at the Desert Rose Resort from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay Just Of The Strip”
Reviews.Author: carshamus
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at the desert rose and are glad we did. Firstly check in was easy with no waiting and very helpful friendly staff. Later in our trip we noticed long check in lines at the major casinos on the strip so this was a big plus after the long drive we had just taken. The parking was easy and the room was just a short walk from our car. Well it is hard to fault the rooms here. They are very comfortable and well appointed. Nothing was dirty or worn unlike at previous hotels where we paid much more for a room. Our stay was quiet and with a great breakfast supplied every morning to start our day of it was hard to find anything to complain about. The Desert Rose is a short walk to the strip. We found it best to walk to the back of MGM Grand and through to the strip. The Desert Rose was really good value for the money, with helpful staff, clean well appointed rooms and quiet restful nights we will certainly be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Worthy of such a high rating”
Reviews.Author: DKEPei
Reviews.Content: My wife and I came in with high expectations based upon Trip Advisor reviews and we were not disappointed. Our 1st time to Vegas and we would certainly stay here the next time. Convenient walking / driving access to the strip, very close to the airport, the free breakfast very good and the 5pm reception a wonderful touch when coming back to the hotel after a full day touring and before hitting the Strip for the evening. Rooms spacious and very clean - full suite for the price of a regular room on the Strip! Great find - thanks to the Trip Advisor website.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: dougie1
Reviews.Content: I left this hotel at the end of my 3 centre holiday feeling frustrated. The resort has the potential to be great but many little things all accumulated to leave me annoyed and in the whole dissapointed. On arrival at midnight we were told that due to a maintenance issue they never had a room for us and were told to go to the bluegreen hotel for 1 night and they would have a room available the next morning for us (very suspicious as there was a big fight across at Mgm that night so draw your own conclusions!!!!!!). This hotel was another 5 mins drive away from the strip and on arrival we had planned to dump our luggage and walk round the corner to the strip for a drink or two(this ended up costing us $12 in a taxi each way from the bluegreen hotel. The check in at bluegreen was not simple as the receptionist on the front desk said that desert rose had not made the reservation on line for us so she had to go and make it manually herself. The next day we got an awful room with balcony overlooking a tree (no sun) and a roof with extractor units and no apology from the staff at desert rose. I complained and they moved us to another room which on inspection looked ok. We later realised the balcony was infested with cockroaches and covered in bird droppings. I complained again and advised them i wanted it cleaned when we were out which was dealt with. On arrival back to the room we both lay down to sleep and then a constant vibrating noise started which we could not pinpoint, this was so bad we called reception and was met with the reponse "well what do you want us to do about this in the middle of the night". I went straight to reception the next morning and they admitted that it was the air-con units on the roof above the 3rd floor and it can vibrate. Eventually we got given our final room which had no major problems until the hairdryer stopped working so we thought after calling maintenance(silly me it just tripped). After all the issues i had i thought it was time i spoke to the manager who i found to be friendly approachable and understanding which has certainly improved my opinion on the property. On the positive side the rooms were spacious and the managers complimentary bar between 5&7 weekdays and the daily complimentary breakfasts were a nice touch. The 1 free internet terminal needs to have a time limit on it as most hotels now do this. Certain individuals spent way too long on it and were ignorant to the fact others needed on it. I would not stay here again unless changes are made. I do realise i was propably unlucky and i wish everyone luck with their rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Trip of a Lifetime”
Reviews.Author: larryjScotland
Reviews.Content: What a find that was based on tripadvisor reviews. One of the best apartments my wife & i have stayed in. Spaceous clean rooms with excellent kitchen facilities, toaster,microwave (Takes a large pizza.) dishwasher 5 ring cooker & a large fridge freezer. The staff are most helpful & provide beer & wine between 5-7Pm for tips. The breakfast again has plenty of choice & you wont go away hungry. Free internet provided in the lounge with printing facilities & in each room there is a RJ45 internet connection. We only have one negative which was the noise from external AC units are rather noisy in the upper floors. We moved to a middle floor room which was ok. We would use again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Virginia_Voyager
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in a recent trip to Las Vegas. As a traveling couple the room actually exceeded our needs for an overnight stay. Very roomy, clean, comfortable, TVs in the main room and bedroom, a full kitchen, and a wall-safe to leave our valuables while out. Adequate parking, elevators, and a security gate. The front desk staff were superb! There might be better values for the same amount of money (as I said, the room was more than we needed) but we would not hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay close to the Strip. Clean and Friendly.”
Reviews.Author: Skikarp
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and friendly. Very close to all the attractions of the Vegas strip. This would be a great place for Families to stay as the rooms have all you need to not have to go out and eat at the expensive restaurants. If you use the Shuttle from and to the airport they drop you off right at the door.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: mel_0404
Reviews.Content: Like most other people, I found the Desert Rose to be a pleasant place to stay. Everything was clean, the rooms were spacious (it was nice to have a full kitchen after several weeks of dining out for every meal) and the pool was a welcome relief in the heat! It wasn't far off the strip (although I must admit, I wasn't really prepared for the sheer size of Vegas).

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: BarbEdmonton
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Desert Rose with my husband and son. The staff there are very helpful and friendly and the room was amazing. Lots of room for the three of us and very comfortable and beautifully decorated. We enjoyed the pool area very much (nice to relax and get away from the strip for awhile), the free breakfast and drinks by the pool between 5 and 7 p.m. was a pleasant treat. I visit Vegas at least once a year - usually stay on the strip, but now that I've stayed at the Desert Rose and been spoiled I will definitely make this place my Vegas home when I come to visit. Thank you all at he Desert Rose for making this a very enjoyable stay. We'll be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “A real gem in the desert”
Reviews.Author: JulieMIsrael
Reviews.Content: Arrived in Vegas at Desert Rose not expecting too much as our friends had booked us the hotel and we saw that it wasn't one of the big names on the strip. We were pleasantly surprised to find a great place located just off the strip and opposite MGM. We were even more surprised to see our room or should I say suite. It was great with 2 bedrooms, fitted kitchen, lounge and an outstanding on suite power shower in the master bedroom. The hotel was just what we needed. No casinos to walk through in order to get to reception, but close enough to the strip for anything we wanted to do. Our teenage kids loved the pool area and the breakfast. One small gripe the breakfast area wasn't really big enough for the morning onslaught. All in all a fantastic place to stay when in Vegas

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: ezmeltdown
Reviews.Content: My experience at the Desert Rose Resort in Las Vegas Nv. was just awsome. The staff was great, the information they had on me was accurate. They were very helpful on the locations of bus lines, restaurants, and casinos nearby. The hotel was very clean and new looking. The room was spotless and very luxurious. The room was equipped with a kitchen including dinner ware, glasses, and silverware. Dishwasher, coffee pot microwave, fridge, and toaster. They serve a nice continental breakfast and a nice happy hour from 5 to 7 pm.. Large clean swiming pool and laundry vacilities are there to use. i was very impressed and went back three days later and had a another nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “A very comfortable resort with some great amenities.”
Reviews.Author: ScottyGirlBend
Reviews.Content: We needed accommodations for two couples, and our suite at the Desert Rose was just perfect to allow a very comfortable stay for both couples. We arrived Thursday and thoroughly enjoyed the "happy hour." The morning brunch was just the perfect start to the day. Desert Rose's location made for easy access to the other casinos and the monorail. I also used the workout room one morning which provided and good little workout. We would definitely return to the Desert Rose Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Better than the strip!”
Reviews.Author: b00b00kitty
Reviews.Content: Employees were so friendly and worked hard. They wiped the place down like it was a cruise ship. This was our 2nd stay at a Shell Vacations Hospitality Resort and we can't wait to check them all out.

Reviews.Title: “Best little hotel in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Pinkscatty1
Reviews.Content: Fabulous little hotel, spotlessly clean, just off the strip. Nice pool area. Price included breakfast and during the week the hotel offered free wine/beer and nibbles (about 5pm). 3 of us travelling so booked 2-bedroom suite. One bedroom with en suite, 2nd bedroom and 2nd bathroom, full kitchen and living room plus balcony. 3 TVs. Really good sized accommodation for the excellent price through Expedia. Also benefit of laundry facilities (good as we were travelling around). 2 mins to Hooters (good value meals, good sized steak with all the trimmings $9.95). 5 mins to MGM Grand, New York, New York etc. 10 mins to airport. Good discount designer mall on the edge of town (ask reception for details).

Reviews.Title: “Great digs in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: chutchin
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Desert Rose Resort for six nights the first week of September and could not have been happier. The rooms were clean, bright and inviting, the resort was clean and we were within walking distance of the strip, albeit a bit of a walk. My only complaint would be the pool is a bit small for the resort, lounge chairs were few.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful alternative...”
Reviews.Author: PapaL
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful place to stay in Las Vegas. The Desert Rose resort is a great alternative to the giant hotels just a couple blocks away. We enjoyed the wonderfully clean and attractive suite at a great price. The beds were wonderful and the addition of a full kitchen gave us the flexability of dining in or going out. The pool was ideal for cooling off after walking the strip - and the complimentary breakfast was another plus. The staff was helpful and provided some good suggestions on where to eat. I think it is a great place for couples or familys to stay with easy walking access to all that is Las Vegas and yet a quiet retreat from the "circus" on the strip. I would highly recommend the Desert Rose as a great base of operations for a trip to Las Vegas or the surrounding desert and canyon sites.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money - Great for families”
Reviews.Author: Kaerius
Reviews.Content: Our family of five stayed three nights at the Desert Rose Resort in Las Vegas in August 2009. It is a non-gaming hotel, located just off the Strip, near MGM, Luxor, New York New York and Excalibur. It is a great homebase to explore Las Vegas for families with young children as it is so close to everything Las Vegas has to offer while at the same time it allows you to escape from crowd and relax in your spacious suite or at the pool. Breakfast was exactly what we needed to get going. This hotel had the lowest nightly rate out of eight hotels during our Southwest USA trip and offered by far the best services. If we would stay again in Las Vegas, we would not for a second consider any alternatives;

Reviews.Title: “Calm, lovely place.. we stoped at the palms for 3 nights and this place was warmer, better on most counts but bling”
Reviews.Author: sleepmeep
Reviews.Content: has a lovely mellow vibe, warm home from home feel, I would never stop at the palms after finding this little gem, not perfect but very good.

Reviews.Title: “If you want a quiet, safe, clean place to stay, stay here!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: olympiaguy
Reviews.Content: Other reviews sum it up! I am 39, work hard, and usually go to sleep by 9pm at the latest. I was able to have a quiet and safe night sleep here. This is not a party place, thank God! The place is very clean and well kept. I will stay here every time I go back to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of calm right in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: AJS1066
Reviews.Content: It's great to be able to easily walk to the strip and escape to the Desert Rose Resort when your senses are overloaded. I would definitely look this place up when staying in Vegas again. It's easy to drive in to and you can park near your room, it's also easy to drive to the strip or escape the city and if you're not driving it's easy to get about. It's only three floors high which we liked. The airport perimeter is at the end of the road but we didn't have a problem with noise. Our room had a side view of the pool area with a balcony and was quiet. The staff we encountered were friendly, helpful and many a smile which helps make you feel relaxed. We didn't use the pool but could see that it wasn't that big and there was a rush to bag the sun loungers every morning at 8am. The breakfast area can also get busy and crowded if you don't get up early.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: lorig36
Reviews.Content: What a great value. Clean rooms, continential breakfast, happy hour Mon-Thurs. This is located right behind Hooters and Tropicana. It was an easy walk to the walkways to either MGM, NY NY and Excalibur. We did not leave our end of the strip for 4 days. Staff was very nice and helpful. Definitely would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “I don't write reviews, but this place deserves one”
Reviews.Author: DelbertEtcheson
Reviews.Content: My wife and adult children stayed here for three nights. This was a very nice place, clean, brightly painted, with large rooms. We rented a two bedroom suite and it was very nice. I was expecting something of much lower quality based on the inexpensive price we paid. Pool is open early to late, which most 'strip' hotels are not. The included continental breakfast had a lot of variety and changes each day. Pool was very clean. The grounds were well kept. Staff was very helpful from extra towels to suggestions for sightseeing. The air conditioning worked very well. Three flat-screen tv's in the unit. When we come back to Las Vegas, we will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “good find, very pleased with rooms, service and location”
Reviews.Author: jankyb
Reviews.Content: we stayed there for 4 days in a two bedroom suite and would defintately stay there again. The rooms are spacious, comfortable, clean and are to a high standard. It is located in easy walking distance from the strip and as the strip is currently being dug up it is a mass of traffic jams so this was an excellent retreat from the hustle and bustle of vegas, which meant we had a really good quiet nights sleep. The staff are friendly and we had no problems at all, i would defintaly go back and with the cost of the rooms being so reasonable we could afford to stay for the week next time

Reviews.Title: “ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: TaxManFernleyNevada
Reviews.Content: Desert Rose Resort is located 2 blocks off of the Las Vegas Strip. We stayed in their 2 bedroom 2 bath suite, with a full kitchen. Each morning we were treated to a continental breakfast which was plenty of food. In the evenings they served wine, beer and snacks. You could walk to the MGM Grand, the Tropicana and Hooters Casinos. You were just a short 5 mile drive from the car rental return area. The location was quiet and yet you were close to all the action that Las Vegas offers. The Staff was must helpful and their repair people were top notch. Would I recommend the Desert Rose Resort, YES.

Reviews.Title: “For a quiet Business solo traveller- the Best”
Reviews.Author: geckogal00820
Reviews.Content: In Vegas for work (clothing buyer for a boutique), I had opted for a different place for the major part of my trip & thought Id relax on my last day at the Desert Rose. I wished that I had been there the whole week instead of one day! I could have easily walked to the strip for the Deuce bus shuttle or to the locations I had to be for my work. The full kitchen could have come in handy- they have a deal with a local market to stock it & I couldve saved on expen$ive meals I had on the strip! A comfy full size bath tub, separate living & bedrooms & cable tvs in both rooms. Quiet too & a pool (that I didnt have a chance to enjoy either), as well as other amenities like free continental bfast & laundry facilities. Next year its the Rose for me!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel near the strip !”
Reviews.Author: satyasrd
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 5 day vacation during which we had stayed at Desert Rose (1 bed suite). Here are some of the things we loved : * The rooms were spacious, clean; bed really comfortable; kitchen and bathroom were wonderfully done with nice cabinets and granite countertops * Only place we ever heard of that had a kitchentte and offered free breakfast ! * Housekeeping was excellent ! Very few places have free housekeeping everyday. * The staff was very respectful and courteous * And, of course you cannot beat the location at this price - it is only a 5 minute walk from the strip ! Whenever we go to Vegas in future, we are definitely staying at the Desert Rose. Plus, we have already recommended this place to two separate friends and they are already heading there.

Reviews.Title: “VFM- EXCELLENT APARTMENT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: UkGlobetrotter66
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Desert Rose, and were impressed with the price, location, pool. rooms,breakfast & basically anything the hotel throws at you. For the price you will not find better Value For Money in Vegas, it really is an excellent base on which to start your days in Vegas. just off the strip its about a half mile walk to Excalibur, MGM, & New York New York Hotels We had 2 full days on the strip and a full day tour of Grand Canyon via private jet,helicopter and pontoon boat.All of which were very enjoyable. my only recommendation on the hotels/casinos. if you have teenagers or younger kids visit the larger ones during the day, as after 9pm they do fill up with loads of people many of which are a bit obnoxtious. New York Hotel was great for kids even at midnight!!!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back.”
Reviews.Author: PJnMke
Reviews.Content: We were spending just one night in Las Vegas before our vacation through Utah to visit the National Parks. We were tied up in traffic on Route 15 coming from CA & arrived in Vegas very late. What a room--everything was very classy. The suite was very spacious, and well designed with a TV for viewing in the bedroom, as well as one in the sitting area. Everything was available that one would need for a long term stay- a full size refrigerator, stove, coffeepot, cookware/silverware, ironing board, full size dining table, clothes basket, safe, extra blankets, pillows-all the extras were there. We did not have time to enjoy the pool or the other amenities at the resort, but did enjoy the breakfast. We were quite impressed. The next time we visit Vegas--we will definitely book at this resort--and stay awhile!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway”
Reviews.Author: POOSBLACK
Reviews.Content: Maximum bang for the buck --- the two bedroom unit was perfect for our family of five. The kids had their own space, their own bathroom, which was excellent. The kitchen was FULLY equipped. The staff, hospitable and friendly. Housekeeping was so accommodating and very, very courteous and friendly. My husband and I appreciated the Manager's Reception, while the kids swam in the pool. A mere block away from the strip, it was an easy walk to New York New York, GameWorks, Excalibur and the rest of the strip. If you're looking for a family friendly place to stay, with some distance from the strip, with privacy, and an all inclusive resort, this is the place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great value near the strip”
Reviews.Author: cajol78
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with our young children for two nights. What we liked: - The suites were really like two bedroom/two bathroom flats; very well equipped with all amenities, allowed us to cut the long series of restaurant-eating in our trip and have dinner in the room. Very comfortable bedding and bathrooms. - Great value - by far the cheapest of all our hotels over a 3 week californian trip; - Close to the strip whilst not being in the middle of the whirl (which we hated, but that's really a matter of taste); walking distance if you can stand the heat! - Staff was, with some variations, generally pretty helpful. - Breakfast overall good quality What I did not feel great about was the pool, as water looked too cloudy for my taste after a long hot day (needless to say the kids loved it regardless); of course the pools is also dwarfed in size by the giant ones of the main casino/hotels. But again a good choice if you want to be close to the action whilst not being in the bigger hotel "factories".

Reviews.Title: “Desert Rose Excellent Place to Stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: DoriSocalDesert
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort -- found it through the RCI timeshare network -- for the first time in Aug. 2009. Loved that resort is small (vs. the huge casino hotels), clean and people were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret in Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: easterndixie
Reviews.Content: Off the beaten path, but easily accessible to the well worn Strip. Excellent value for money. Was perfect for what we wanted... golfing, Hooters, golfing, casinos, golfing. I'm not sure if giving a great review for this little gem will compromise the best kept secret in town!

Reviews.Title: “Brill -made our stay, an oasis away from the mega big hotels on the strip”
Reviews.Author: Cutchie58
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 10 day stay at this fab resort, with hubby, nephew & his wife who was celebrating a special birthday. Rooms were very clean & comfortable, and had everything you would need.for any length of stay. Beds/ pillows were so comfortable, much needed after all the sight seeing that Vegas has to offer.Air conditioning was very welcome, couldnt do without it Continental breakfast was a great start to your day, we didn't make the managers special, but other guests were impressed with what was on offer, and remember its free.Can get a bit busy, but didn't find this a problem as everything was replenished as and when needed. Front desk staff always very friendly, every time we asked for directions staff gave us a print out, which helped. Check in/out was fast, staff always had a smile and were welcoming Pool area adequate, you need your key card to get in- some times this didn't work, but other guests kind enough to let you in. Like others have mentioned, some extra loungers would have been good, just as we were leaving they were putting padded cushions out on the chairs, Clean towels are provided every day for the pool area, so no need to carry your own.Hot tub magic after a long day This hotel is close to Hooters hotel, approx 5-7 mins walk from strip- weather was so hot- felt like a hot hair dryer blasting in your face - be prepared take a cardi for going into hotels/ buffets as air conditioning is cool. We had a car, and it is perfectly placed to get on to the main roads, avoiding the strip. Did a trip to the canyon, booked with Maverick, Amazing- so glad we did this All in all, if you want somewhere clean- comfortable and friendly where you won't need your sat nav to get to the pool area or main desk, choose the Dessert Rose

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect for Vegas”
Reviews.Author: bluedriver
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night when visiting vegas last month. It is only one block off-strip and was just right for our needs. We are a family of 5 - 3 kids (15,13,10) traveling with another family with similar aged kids. What a great place!! No slot-machines. Superb rooms - we had a 2-bed Suite which was HUGE, comfortable, well stocked. All for just about $100 for the night. Friends had a 1-Bed Suite for around $75 and were equally impressed. Great staff at the Desk

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: daviespsl
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay just a short walk from the main attractions on the strip. We stopped for three nights and were impressed with the size of the room... actually more like an appartment with seperate bedroom, large(ish) bathroom, kitchen in main living room. Better than a self catering appartment in Greece. Complementry continental brekfast was good, if a little crowded if you left it too late. Things to do in Vegas..... check out the weird 'sky' in the Venitian and don't miss the fountains at the Bellagio

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Redwitchdiver
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights. It is just off the strip, about 7-8 minutes walk to MGM Grand so nice and quiet but close enough to be amongst everything quickly. The apartment we had was top class, service was superb, and everyone was so friendly. The pool was excellent and the breakfast was really good, although a bit crowded at times. Free drinks and nibbles every night between 5 - 7 pm (only did it once as out most of the time). This was overall a very good place to stay and value for money.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our experience and would return to the Desert Rose.”
Reviews.Author: EasyEd-67
Reviews.Content: We wanted to explore Las Vegas with our two college-age children. We stayed 4 nights and the 2 bedroom-2 bath suite was perfect for our group. The rooms were nicely furnished, but not to the standard of the high-end strip hotels. WHO CARES? If you want extravagance, stay on the strip. If separate beds and baths, a kitchen and living area are more important, the Desert Rose works well. With different people going different places and keeping different hours, the 2 bed/2 bath set-up provided plenty of privacy for all. PROS: Proximity to the Strip; WIFI; good housekeeping; free parking; free continental breakfast; free beverages and snacks 5-7 pm during the week; grounds were secure SUGGESTIONS: Increase number of tables and chairs in the area adjacent to the pool; add a couple more items at the continental breakfast. With a group like ours, diverse in ages, interests and agendas, we would definitely reccommend and would return to the Desert Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Good find”
Reviews.Author: bryvancouver
Reviews.Content: All in all the hotel lived up to our expectations. Friendly staff, good rooms ( although very worn carpet, but I understand they are being replaced--needs it). Very quiet at night--a relief from the hussle and bussle. I would go back to this place. My only critisizm is one that I read by another traveller--and I agree with him. There are not enough lounges for the pool area. Literally, there was a line forming at 8:00 am outside the pool area when it is unlocked in order to obtain one of the few. My wife and I lined up with other guests in order to snag enough for our family--Lets face it --its one of the reasons people go to Vegas to lounge in the sun. The place is great--so spend the bucks and get some more!!! How much can they be?? It would make such a difference

Reviews.Title: “Truly, a Rose in the desert!”
Reviews.Author: Pacman3
Reviews.Content: Been there done that in Las Vegas and for what this property offers, you won't beat it! Save your money and save your time online.... book it! And that's before I mention the GREAT service. You are a guest and will be treated as such.

Reviews.Title: “A Vegas oasis”
Reviews.Author: HPPG
Reviews.Content: A great little resort 2 blocks from the strip, near MGM Grand. Great for families; we could go do something on the strip, then retreat to our little oasis of calm and cool off in the pool. Rooms are nicely equipped... we had a suite with separate bedroom and kitchenette. Not huge, but very functional for our family. Most evenings there is a happy hour (actually 2 hours) with free beer, wine and pop, plus snacks. Lots of parking, which seemed to be pretty secure. Staff were all friendly and helpful; not something I'm used to in Vegas. Will definitely stay there again and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast is no option! Probably not coming back.”
Reviews.Author: Geotz
Reviews.Content: During our trip to the west coast we planned to stay 4 nights in Las Vegas. We're a familly of 5 (3 teenagers children), and had to choose between 2 rooms in one of the big casino hotels on the strip (with great discounted prices on Smartvegas.com) and a all suite hotel off strip. prices were the same. Desert rose had the best reviews on Trip advisor, so we choose the Desert Rose resort. I must say that we were dissapointed. Its not we thought it would be. The place was very crouded. breakfast is no option: small room, long lines (like an attraction in a theme park), noisy, no place to sit (to find a table is like to find a parking spot in midtown Manhattan), and if you find one - its dirty and you have to clean it yourself. poor selection in breakfast: after first morning - my kids didn't want to return. breakfast end at 9 am - not very convient, and from building 4 you have to drive! Rooms are nice and comfortable, no complaints about that, but public corridors are old, not renovated (like an old Motel 6), and open, so during hot summer days it is very unpleasant. The pool was not great either: old, and not so clean. many of the guests is like what you would find in a low grade motel. Business center - if you want to check something in the computer - the rate is "only" $4 for 15 minutes! unbelievable. Next time we probably wont come back. I read again all the reviews on Trip advisor, and I have my thoughts about that, I just say that it looks like the management is very aware to reviews on Trip advisor.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: orange_blossom99
Reviews.Content: This is one of nicest places to stay in La Vegas, it was a vacation. The room was very comfortable and had everything we needed and more. We enjoyed the breakfast in the morning too. The location is perfect, and we were close to everything. We can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Desert Rose, Las Vegas is a pleasant, relaxing, vacation.”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaBookworm61
Reviews.Content: Our trip was an unexpexted one. It was a weekend to spend with our children before they started college. Desert Rose was very willing to accomodate us on the same day. We arrived late because of traffic and they had our room waiting for us and were more than willing to bring us any extra necessities we needed. For my husband and I it was plus that it was walking distance from Hooters,Tropicana, Luxor. It is very close to the strip,but also very quiet. It was nice that they offered a continental breakfast every day. They aalso have a happy hour on Monday- through Thursdays. To us it was a very relaxing weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Best Kept Secret in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: chevrolet1
Reviews.Content: We have been going to Las Vegas for the last 16 years and have always stayed at a hotel from (7 to 11days). This year we heard of the Desert Rose Resort from friends and I decided to check out the reviews from different sources.We decided to try it and boy did we hit a jackpot. We had a 1 bedroom condo and the staff could not serve us enough, as they were very friendly and always accomodating to our needs.The rooms were very clean and we always had extra towels in our room every day. Good variety for a continental breakfast items, ( breads, fresh fruit , cereals, cheese, and starbuck coffee available 24hrs, and Monday to Thursday was the Managers reception, beer, wine, juices, snacks and all of this was included. A 7 minute walk to MGM where you could get the monorail to go to the other end of the strip, and 10 minutes to the main strip. We certainly will be booking next year at the Desert Rose Resort. Good place for a family as it has a pool and the cost was very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “The price is right!!!”
Reviews.Author: TresJolieMarie
Reviews.Content: Surprised and happy with this choice. Staff is welcoming, courteous and helpful. Nice continental breakfast service. Rooms are clean and comfortable. Nice kitchen with appliances, dishware, etc. Not the Bellagio...but then you are NOT paying those prices!

Reviews.Title: “Best and most relaxing haven on two week road trip”
Reviews.Author: Beccamj
Reviews.Content: We spent 13 nights on the road, and the Desert Rose was the best place we stayed. After eating out day after day, it was great to have a place to spread out and cook something as simple as macaroni and cheese for a break. We didn't actually get out much to see Las Vegas and the sites since it was so relaxing. Our two teenagers were comfortable and they established their areas from the first moment...one in one room, and the other in the other room. It was also close enough to walk to the strip without too much trouble.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay with kids in Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Polly0
Reviews.Content: We choose the Desert Rose based on the reviews in Tripadvisor. A great move! We travel with two boys aged 12 and 9 years. The rooms are great, comfortable beds, full kitchen and breakfast included. Do get in time for breakfast because it does get very busy. Between 5 and 7 you have managers drinks. Beer, wine and snacks. Really good value for money. The location is another big plus. Very close to the strip but not on the strip. The size of the resort is good. We have walked through the big mega hotels (with long long lines for check in) and were very glad to be at the Desert Rose. Our boys found their own way and went swimming, this would never have been the case in the big hotels. The service was quick, prompt and very friendly. The concierge we only saw once, so if you want something organised you better do it yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Surpassed my expectations again.”
Reviews.Author: SimonHThomas
Reviews.Content: Returned to the Desert Rose for a third time this year, this time staying in a one bed condo. 2008 stayed in 2 bed condo's. condo was roomy with a well layed out kitchen area.The wholr resort was extremely clean and maid service came in every day while we were there to clean and replace towels. Free breakfast was just what I needed each day, plenty of variety, and good coffee. Pool was fantastic and never got to busy, my children 3 and 2 loved it. This is our favorite place to stay in Vegas. The prices for the weekend we went were fantastic $46/night. You cannot beat this place for the price and with the free breakfast and fully equipped kitchen you are not forced to go out and spend $$$ on eating out.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bixby_butterfly
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful resort and the price is Out of this world for the awesome location. We stayed for a week and the room had plenty of extras, so we declined daily maid service. It was our own little home away from home...we bought groceries to keep from having to spend money on fast food. It was nice for the kids to be able to grab some breakfast and watch tv in the mornings in their own room while we relaxed on the couch and drank our coffee. The location made it easy to take a break from the strip to stop back at the room for a snack or a little nap...especially with our 1 yr old...with the "FULLY EQUIPT" kitchen you have everything you need, even cleaning supplies ex. (broom, iron, board, dish soap, dishwasher detergent, sponges, paper towels, etc) they even have clothes baskets for you to use at their on site laundry facilities....we have found our yearly vacation spot!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “No Hassel living"”
Reviews.Author: chatalus
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Las Vegas to celebrate my birthday and our anniversary. We also invited my sister and friend whose birthday's were also in 08/2009 along with their significant partners....We had a great time in Las Vegas and it was nice to return to our hotel which was clean, cool, and provided all the ammneties it had to offer such as "free continental breakfast" plus breakfast delivery to Shell Vacation Elite members....my guest loved the hotel, the cleanliness, the hotel staff especiall the housekeeping staff. I think anyone staying with the Desert Rose Resort will be treated to a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Sanity in the middle of Sin City!”
Reviews.Author: KBerryNorthCarolina
Reviews.Content: We love staying at the desert rose! It is so convenient to the strip but allows you to also "escape" the casino environment and come home to some peace and quiet. The staff is very friendly, the rooms are wonderful. Having a kitchen is a great help with all of the great leftovers you have in Vegas. We love the continental breakfast and the happy hours. Will definately stay again when I come back to Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “We are always happy here!”
Reviews.Author: vacationsalot
Reviews.Content: My family and I travel to Las Vegas 3 or 4 times a year. When I travel with my husband alone, we always stay at a casino hotel, but when we have our 4 children(ages 3-14) we love the Desert Rose. With 4 kids we need lots of room and some privacy. It is nice to be in 1 suite and not 2 rooms that are joined with a double door. As a mom, I love the fact that I lock the front door and secure it and they are all in a room with me, not lock there door and then shut the door in the middle and hope they don't lock it and then I can't get in either door. The Desert Rose is at a great location, right behind Hooter's so you can walk to MGM, Mandalay Bay, Excalibur, Luxor, NYNY, Tropicana, Monte Carlo and a lot of shops like the M&M store. If you don't want to wait for a taxi there you can walk to Hooter's less then a block away, there are always taxi's there waiting for customers. The pool is great, the continental breakfast is very good and saves you $, it actually has ham served along with the normal stuff you find at others. They also have a meet and greet thing in the evening, serving free beer, wine, soda & snacks for kids. The service is always great, the people are always friendy and the rooms are always clean. The best thing about this place is it is not a casino, so you don't have all the busy activity and people to get around to get to your room. It is a place for anyone, wether on business or vacation, alone or with family. We highly recommend this resort. We will be back. The only thing I recommend is during hot months ask for 2nd or 3rd floor rooms. During hot month crikets and desert cockroaches push their way in to the room through any crack on the 1st floor. It's not a big issue cause they do it at homes there to. The hotel is clean and they spray for bugs. When we had a few they came right over and got rid of them and sprayed the room with a non toxic odorless spray. We love it there, and are sure you will too!!! Look for the specials link on the website, we got a 2 bedroom suite for $99 a night when we payed up front. nywhere else would have cost $150 with no breakfast offers.
