Reviews.Title: “Best Stay in a Very Long Time !”
Reviews.Author: DaMoneyMan
Reviews.Content: This Resort is one of the Best I have stayed at in many years. I go back to some because I get used to them, but sometimes you just need to break away and make a change when things are not as they use to be. That's when I found your resort and It's AWESOME !!!!!!!!! The staff they have here really enjoy what they do and it shows.They all were a Big part in me making the decision to go back again. Great Resort and I will be back, with guest.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Friendly with a Great Price”
Reviews.Author: putmana
Reviews.Content: This a comfortable apartment style hotel close to the strip. It is quiet, clean and friendly. Breakfast is offered every day and provides enough food to carry you through to dinner. The pool area is not large and there is a scramble every morning to grab a free lounger. Rooms are clean and well maintained and all of the appliances are new and work properly. The complimentary manager's reception during the week is a lovely perk. I would stay there again on my next trip to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “great stay!!”
Reviews.Author: frenchguyHortonville
Reviews.Content: stayed at desert rose from august 3rd to the 6th, 2 bedroom suite, everything went well!! for the price it is a good deal!! me & wife & 3 daughters stayed here, we will consider this again! everthing went well, good value for the $$ great location!! met our expectations, not bad at all!! probably will stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and Fun”
Reviews.Author: Vegastravelor
Reviews.Content: We own a timeshare in Las Vegas but was not able to reserve our room when we found out our daughter and grandaughter were coming to visit. So we went on line and wanted something close to the airport and and nice in ammenities, that we were accustomed to. Desert Rose was that place! We could walk to the strip or catch the monorail. Our room was very comfortable and had everything we needed. The pool and grounds were clean and staff was very friendly. I would stay again and recommend to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “What a nice surprise!”
Reviews.Author: jasanipatel
Reviews.Content: The room was so cute. It was also great that it was a suite. We had just come back from rafting in the Grand Canyon and it was nice to have space to spread out. You can't go wrong with the price. I wish there were warm meats for breakfast rather than deli meat...but the other offerings made up for it. Definitely something to consider when going to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE GREAT PRICE!”
Reviews.Author: Ncameron22
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Desert Rose Resort for one night but wish I stayed the whole vacation. After we checked in we had a welcoming courtesy call. They offer a complimentary breakfast and do a happy hour. The hotel is beautiful and a one bedroom hotel for the cost of 100 or less is Great! Would definitly stay there again. Was right across from Luxor and Tropicana so location is great also!!

Reviews.Title: “So nice”
Reviews.Author: tourerBrighton
Reviews.Content: Nice location for roomy place to stay Would come again if visiting LV in the future. Have stayed at Planet Hollywood, Luxor, Paris and Flamingo but this is my favourite. Situated behind Hooters and Tropicana, this place is so comfortable. It is a Time Share location but stay there like any hotel. Security is hot there and you should be at ease.

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: floridagirlx4
Reviews.Content: clean,quiet,comfortable,perfect location! stayed 2 nights after exploring zion,brryce.GC

Reviews.Title: “Great value, perfect place for families”
Reviews.Author: WildTurkey1
Reviews.Content: We just spent a night at the Desert Rose. It was a great deal for a family with young kids. Well updated room. Good (unfortunately too crowded) breakfast. Walking distance to MGM Grand, New York New York and Excelsior. Comfortable beds, even the foldout couch. Great A/C. Quiet. Definitely stay here. Oh, and the security personnel was excellent. We got a call at night letting us know that there was an electornic device in the car that was turned on. My husband went to the car to check and the security guy was waiting for him to explain that it's best for us to take the portable DVD player inside, which we did. That's going beyond the call of duty in my book.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: 3xluv2travel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for about 4 nights, it's a great hotel. We stayed in a two bedroom apartment and it was very nice. And we were very surprised about the price, I thought it was wrong at first. My husband and I stayed in the main bedroom which also fit a crib for our 18month old son. It had an extremely comfortable king size bed, a tv and a really nice ensuite. My sister-in-law and her son stayed in the other bedroom that had a queen bed and a tv. And my brother-in-law stayed on the lounge which had a pull-out sofa. The room had a small balcony, a full kitchen (which was so awesome) and a small dining table and a second bathroom. It had aircon and a really nice pool and spa. It also had a toddler pool which was fantastic for my son. The hotel also had elevators, a laundry room (not free) and internet access (I think it was free, check the website). All up, we stayed in America for 7 weeks and this was one of the best hotels we stayed at. The only down-falls were that a few times I called the desk for some things and they took a while to deliver them...... And the carpet is a bit dirty, so wear your shoes around the room otherwise your socks get disgusting. Didn't encounter any bugs. Highly recommended hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, family friendly, clean and spacious, close to Strip but quiet”
Reviews.Author: m_madden767
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week in Las Vegas at the Desert Rose. As a family of four we found the Desert Rose to be a fabulous location and ideal for our needs. Buffet breakfast was fantastic, rooms were huge and contained every convenience. For mum, dad and two daughters of 15 and 21, two one-bedroomed apartments were ideal. Pool facilities are fantastic and manager's 'happy hour every Mon. to Fri. brings guests together. Just 5 minutes away from the hustle and bustle of the Strip gives one the choice of stepping in and out of the full-on Vegas experience at will. Most highly recommended. Maureen and family (in Vegas for Robbie and Lindsay's wedding, July 29th 2009)

Reviews.Title: “Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: jncallen
Reviews.Content: We booked our room online so we weren't sure if it would be a deal or a dud. We were very pleasantly surprised! There wasn't a day go by that we didn't at some point say how glad we were that we stayed at the DR instead of on the Strip. While we only stayed 3 nights, we felt completely at home. If you want a retreat from the fast pace of the Strip but want to be able to hop right back into the shows and casinos when you're ready, DR is the place for you! We're already talking about our next trip to Vegas and wouldn't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, clean & tidy”
Reviews.Author: Rakaia
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 two bedroom units for the 8 of us and would gladly stay at this venue again. The internet wasn't free back in Feb - that was the only downside. We booked it via expedia while home in Australia and everything went to plan. An excellent holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: eodmom
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay. The staff were very helpful and always pleasant. The total vacation was very wonderful. Thank you very much for all the help.

Reviews.Title: “Everything Came Up Roses at DRR”
Reviews.Author: KittyChan
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at Desert Rose Resort (DRR), from 27 to 30 July, and I'm happy to report that, once again, following the advice of Trip Advisor (TA) and booking accordingly paid off. I usually stay at one of the Strip hotels or South Point (see my review for that property; still my favorite hotel overall in Vegas), but when I read TA's reviews and noted its very high ranking (no. 4 when I booked last week) for DRR -- and then found a great rate on Expedia ($46/night for a prepaid booking) -- I decided to try something different. I'm glad I did. DRR lives up to the high praise from fellow TA reviewers: its location, suites, and amenities are all excellent; and if you can get anything close to the rate I paid (or close to, say, $100/night on weekends; I usually avoid Vegas on weekends, though), I highly recommend the property. I asked for -- and got -- a nice one-bedroom suite on the third floor of a building on the back side (i.e. closest to the Strip) of the property. (DRR is a garden-apartment style resort, with three-story buildings arranged in a square around the central pool and reception areas.) Checking in and parking couldn't be easier: the process took 2 minutes, and I was off with my room keys and map to park around back, right next to my building. All the gates to the buildings and main facilities are locked and accessible only with one's room key, which worked every time I used it. My suite was just fine: as promised, full kitchen, granite countertops, separate bedroom. The decor and furnishings are very similar to those at the South Point Hotel, so much so -- especially in the bathroom -- that I think DRR used the same company for its makeover. I had two TVs -- they were large CRT units, rather than the promised flatscreens, but that wasn't an issue, as I don't use TVs much in Vegas hotels. Both TVs worked and provided plenty of free channels, and it was handy having one in the living room and one in the bedroom. As some other reviewers have noted, the suites have good, strong A/C (70s/80s-style lever thermostat but works fine), but the temperature in my bedroom was always a few degrees warmer than that in the living area. No matter; I just kept the thermostat low, and the BR was sufficiently cool. I didn't partake of the free continental breakfast, but I appreciated the Starbucks coffee available throughout the day and early evening in the lobby, as well as the free beer and wine from 5 to 7 p.m. Again, a nice touch that sets the DRR apart from most other Vegas hotels. One of the best features of DRR is its location. Las Vegas, which is rarely free of traffic problems, has become particularly unfriendly to the automobile as of late, especially on the surface roads just east of the Strip. Many of the most heavily used roads, including Koval, Harmon, Flamingo, and Tropicana, are undergoing major, traffic jam-inducing reroutings and repairs. Fortunately, DRR is easy to get to, even with the upheaval taking place on Tropicana, and it's a very short drive or walk to the Strip. (The hotel is also accessible from Reno Rd., which is free of construction and leads right to the Strip.) Parking is a dream; you park right next to your building, and that's it. DRR is not very big, either, which adds to its human feel. While I'm a solo traveler, I noticed lots of families with kids at DRR, and I can see why: it's an outstanding value for families, and it really is an attractive, user-friendly property. The full kitchens, decent (though only adequate) pool, and other family-friendly facilities make DRR an excellent choice for most travelers. At night, the property is very quiet, and when in my room, I heard no noise from other guests. If you've been to Vegas before, you know what a rare treat that is. The free wireless internet, which I found to be fast and reliable, is also a great touch and one that you don't find in most Vegas hotels. Unlike some properties that give one limited free wifi in, say, their lobbies or pool areas, DRR's free wifi is available everywhere on the property, including in your suite. While I'll probably stay at one of my favorite regular hotels (S. Point or THEHotel) next time -- I do like the buzz of the bigger hotels -- I'm sure I'll stay again at DRR at some point in the future, and I highly recommend it if you're looking for a great lodging value in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “WAO!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jose2006
Reviews.Content: Will start by saying that is the best to stay in Vegas. Desert Rose rooms are not typical hotels rooms, are small apartments. Full kitchen, nice bed, and even a dishwasher. What else: free breakfast, free internet and weekly happy hour with wine and beer. Superb customer service. Well located. Just 5 minutes walk to the Strip through a street between the Desert Rose and the Hooters hotel. No casino, so quiet. Ten minutes to the airport. Only minor complaint could be the small bathroom. But not an issue. I have stayed in the many Vegas hotels, including the Signature. But, after this recent stay in the Desert Rose, it will be my new home in Vegas. In summary: Desert Rose is the place to be in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Overall it was a wonderful hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: edopia
Reviews.Content: The hotel was awesome it was great having free breakfast in the morning. It was also nice being only two blocks away from the strip. Our room was also fantastic having a full kitchen was a big plus. The only thing that we didn't love was the pool. The area was nice but we were hoping for a bigger pool. But other than that the hotel was great!

Reviews.Title: “Overall nice place except for the bugs!!!”
Reviews.Author: letsgoonvacation123
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in a very convenient location and has a lot of perks. The rooms are cozy and the kitchen is new and great for families. I would have really liked to recommend this hotel, except for a couple of little things crawling around. Yes, the roaches were a huge downfall in our experience. Roaches in the bathroom, around the outside and unfortunately in the lobby where the breakfast is served. The only excuse we were given is the heat. I'm not too sure I buy the excuse, because this is a big chain and they should try to really get rid of the problem. I've stayed at other resorts that experience hot weather like Vegas, and guess what, no ROACHES.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: sunshine65Idaho
Reviews.Content: The Desert Rose is a great place to stay with your family, while in Vegas. It is just off the strip, great rooms and staff. There were 5 of us and the 2 bedroom suite was nice and large. The continental breakfast was well stocked with muffins, toast, fruit, bagels, hard boiled eggs, and cereal. Was nice not having to go out to eat for breakfast while staying there. Happy Hour from 5pm-7pm on the weeknights is a plus. They served beer, wine, pop, nacho's and pretzels. We paid $65.40 a night for our room, and there were no hidden fees. Small but nice pool for swimming, had bbq grills and picnic tables if you want to grill. This was our families first time in Vegas and we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Desert Rose Resort is absolutely wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: marvelous23
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Desert Rose Resort was absolutely wonderful. The rooms were excellent. The staff was excellent. Everything was excellent. I would recommend this resort to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms”
Reviews.Author: martin1345
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very nice and I loved that they had kitchen supplies - it really cut down on our cost for eating out because we were able to prepare meals in the room. I was not a fan of the breakfast however, I would of preferred something hot instead of the selection they offered. All in all...nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Like staying at a timeshare without the presentation”
Reviews.Author: pateo
Reviews.Content: Booked based on reviews and price. Close to the south end of the strip ( 1 block from MGM, Tropicana, Luxor, Excalibur). Nice accomodations, full kitchen, quiet. Nice that you don't have to walk forever from your car to your room. (like the big casinos) Liked the complimentary happy hour (beer, wine, soft drinks, nuts, few snacks). Staff very friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a Girls Getaway”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveller31
Reviews.Content: We had a two bedroom two bathroom suite, and it was ideal for three ladies. There were two twin size beds in one room and a king size bed in the other. There was even a queen size hide-a-bed in the living room. We could have easily had up to three more ladies in this suite for a VERY, VERY reasonable price. Our suite was very clean, though a little worn (the furniture and the carpet could stand to be replaced). The bathrooms were immaculate, the beds were sooo comfy, and the sheets were so nice that we were all trying to figure out what kind they were so we could get some for our beds back home. It was great having a full kitchen and a dining table with seating for 4. There is a Wal-mart 3 - 5 miles away, but be warned - if you don't have a car it will cost you $45 round trip by taxi to go there for supplies. There was a flat screen TV in the living room and 32 inch TV's in each bedroom. There was even a balcony with two chairs on it where our one smoker was able to sit just off of the living room and smoke. She visits Vegas often, and she said this was fantastic because she usually stays at one of the casinos and has to go all the way downstairs into the casino to smoke (she prefers a non-smoking room because of her non-smoking husband). The breakfast was very good, with lots of variety. The managers reception was really nice considering that drinks were costing us $7 - $12 EACH in the clubs and bars on the strip. This place is located just off of the south end of the strip, adjacent to the airport, about a 5 - 10 minute walk to MGM, Luxor, Excaliber. Even though it is so close to the airport that I think it shares a property line, we were never bothered by planes landing or taking off. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. This is definitely the place to stay if you have a family gathering or a group of friends that want to stay together but don't want to be crowded into a standard hotel room. Really, I can't say enough good things about this place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: jmedina11
Reviews.Content: Check in was quick and easy. The staff is very friendly and helpful. We had a 1-bedroom suite. It was very spacious. The full kitchen came in handy. Overall it was a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great stay”
Reviews.Author: Fellowtraveler015
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay, the staff and Housekeeping were very helpful and friendly. The room we had was a 1 bedroom and it was beautiful. 1 block away from Hooters and 2 blocks from the vegas strip. We thought it was wonderful. We would definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “A nice spot near the strip for a family”
Reviews.Author: TigerBait
Reviews.Content: The Desert Rose was easy to find as four tired travelers made our way in from the car rental station at the airport. Check-in was a breeze. Once we got to the suite, the kids instantly decided that they loved the room with the queen bed and the couch. My wife and I woke early the next morning and hit the limited breakfast (that was because service started a bit later on weekends). We made a trip down Tropicana to Vons in order to pick up some supplies for the rest of the week. I even had a little time after breakfast to walk down to the Strip with the two (under 10 minutes to get to the bridge between the Tropicana and Excalibur) before we had to head to the airport for our 3-day rafting trip. My wife was on her own for the next two nights, and the concierge (who was fantastic) helped her decide the best ways to hit the Strip and see some shows at night. The hotel is also very close to the airport (an easy cab ride) but we didn’t hear any noise from the busy airport. One common question on the forums is whether it's safe to walk back to the hotel at night, and my wife (who doesn't like big cities) said that she never felt uncomfortable. What are some of the negatives about this hotel? The rooms will probably be a letdown for anyone that thinks they are going to a top-of-the-line resort that’s just off the strip, based on the stellar rating on TA. That is not the case, and to the Desert Rose’s credit, they are only billed as a 3-star hotel on TA. I’ve found that bathrooms say a lot about a hotel. The ones in our room left a lot to be desired, especially the one of the master bedroom, which was tiny. The resort also had a very crowded feeling at times, such as the peak times for the breakfasts/receptions, any time that the pool was in demand, or even when trying to find a parking space for the night. One other thing our teenagers commented on was the odor we were hit with when we walked down to the Strip through the Hooters lot. That’s nothing that the Desert Rose can control this, but it did make a lasting impression on our kids. Bottom line: would I stay here again? Maybe, if I were going on the same sort of trip where I needed a place for room our full family of four to stretch out for two nights, and one that was close enough to the strip that my wife could walk to some of the shows on the two nights that three of us were gone. But I'd probably pick somewhere else if walking to the strip was not a consideration, since it is very easy to drive from other parts of town to some of the casinos, if needed. And I also would suggest against the hotel for anyone who is interested in being in the hustle and bustle of some of the four or five star casino resorts in Vegas -- the Desert Rose would not fit their desires. I also think it's a bit of a stretch to call the hotel a "Resort", since it is just a quality 3-star hotel a block off the strip. I knocked my overall rating down a notch because of that, since the hotel does seem to be a bit overrated on TA. I also rounded down because of the followup email that the Shell Hospitality group sent out with a link to the TA review, since that probably contributes to overrating problem on TA.

Reviews.Title: “Great place - great value and location, and family-friendly”
Reviews.Author: hensyl
Reviews.Content: This is a comfortable, clean, convenient no-casino hotel with a great free weekday happy hour with beer, wine and snacks and a nice lobby to hang out with friends. The pool was great and having all suites with kitchens was a big plus. Perfect home base for our Grand Canyon rafting trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Second Time, even better than the First”
Reviews.Author: Mjg1040
Reviews.Content: The front desk was wonderful and even helped us switch rooms. We ended up being one of those groups that kept having to ask for help. They were wonderful every time. Great Location, easy walk but no casino crowds or noise.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: dmom28
Reviews.Content: The location was convenient and walking distance to the Strip. The complementary breakfast and coffee were nice to have. The front desk was very helpful during both check-in and check out.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis in the City”
Reviews.Author: DrDeb3
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded all of our expectations. Our two bedroom apartment was not ready when we checked in, but we were given two, one-bedroom apartments which worked out great for us. The beds were extremely comfortable and the apartments were quite luxurious, spacious, and well-furnished. Coffee was provided in the room each day (Starbucks) and toiletries were always replenished. We had read complaints about the breakfast, so were pleasantly surprised by the abundance of food offered. There were bagels, packaged danish and muffins, bread, cheese, turkey or ham, boiled eggs, and fruit along with gourmet coffee, sodas, and juices. There were always lots of people there and no seats were available, so we always took the food back to the apartment and prepared it there. I was amazed that the staff was able to replenish the food so quickly, as people were taking it as fast as it could be put out. The hotel offers a happy hour for two hours each day (5-7), with complimentary wine, beer, sodas, and snacks. The pool was refreshing, but very busy during the weekend. The spa was nice and hot. There were plenty of chairs around the pool. The location was excellent....two blocks from Luxor and MGM. We had a car and usually drove to a hotel / casino and used the valet to park there ($3 tip). It was so hot that this worked out great (though the valet lots were sometimes full, in which case we self-parked in the lot). However, it is an easy walk from the hotel to Luxor, MGM, and Hooters from the hotel (10-15 minutes). I highly recommend this wonderful hotel. It was our home away from home for four nights and we would definitely stay here again if we return to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Totally recommended!”
Reviews.Author: DrTanne
Reviews.Content: Great, clean, calm place and I agree with most of the positive comments already summarized by others. One thing I would like to add is: have you ever seen the check in/check out lines in the Luxor, MGM, Bellagio etc? A nightmare- they are miles long! You won't have this problem here because is a much smaller and more personal place! I certainly will come back here if I should visit Las Vegas again!

Reviews.Title: “short walk to strip”
Reviews.Author: FrankW53
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Desert Rose. We had breakfast in our room every day and free beer at happy hour in the lobby. It was a short walk to the MGM Grand and Luxor. Always plenty to do in Las Vegas. Fitness room and pool were available. We would definately return again. Also free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Family friendly without all the ding,ding,ding”
Reviews.Author: baddawgandbabe
Reviews.Content: We were in Vegas for a karate tournament that my husband and young daughters competed in. It was also the weekend for UFC 100, so it was quite busy. Desert Rose Resort was close enough to the strip to be where we wanted when we wanted, but it was far enough away to be away from all the slot machines and noise of the strip. The rooms were beautiful and comfortable. The complimentary breakfast was quick and easy enough to get us going in the morning. The staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “So glad we chose the Desert Rose Resort!”
Reviews.Author: spdracr
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Las Vegas in early April. At the time, our son was 20 months old, so we wanted a quiet place to stay that had a separate spot for him to sleep. The Desert Rose Resort was perfect! It was off the strip, but not too far. It was quiet and very spacious. The staff were very helpful and friendly. This place is perfect for families with young children, or for someone who wants a quiet non-flashy place to stay. If you're looking for a hotel with a casino, this is not for you. Otherwise, stay here! You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “great family hotel”
Reviews.Author: tallender
Reviews.Content: A wonderful, low-key break from the casinos. Easy access to the Strip, but far enough away to escape for a quiet evening. Particularly good for family travel with teenage or younger children. Resort was well maintained. Only downsides included very slow wireless internet connection and noise from air conditioning unit.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place for family near the strip”
Reviews.Author: sub580
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Desert Rose for 4 nights on our trip to Las Vegas recently. This is a family-friendly establishment with nice rooms, balcony, high-speed wireless, free breakfast, evening reception on weekdays, exceptional pool facility and fitness center, and within walking distance to the strip. To top it off, their prices are amazingly low. Our kids stayed in the pool most of the time because it was extremely hot in Vegas. They also made lots of friends in the pool and left us alone to enjoy. None of us like gambling, but we took a stroll along the strip in the nights to enjoy people and architecture. Kids loved the Adventuredome at circus-circus and hiking in the nearby red rock canyon. Highly recommended for families.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & The Friendliest Staff To Be Found!!!!”
Reviews.Author: crazydrudru
Reviews.Content: I just loved this hotel. For the value and the location. Its right by the airport and by the strip which is nice. The rooms were awesome! The moment you step into the lobby they were the friendliest group of workers in the the whole state of nevada. They took care of everything and promptly as well. Even security was deligjhtful I believe her name was Lisa she helped me with directions.In the words of Aronld, " I WILL BE BACK".

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: eagil06
Reviews.Content: the hotel couldn't have been more convenient, clean or comfortable. will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel halls not clean, but room was big.”
Reviews.Author: ete1st
Reviews.Content: I was not impressed when I walked down the hall to my room and the carpet in the hall was dirty. When I complained about the carpet being dirty I was told by the front desk I was told that they sometimes clean the carpet. No management was offered to speak with me. Also, I thought the pool was cloudy and there was no towels when I went to the pool at the end of the day. I did not care for the outside appearance of the facility. I thought it looked a lot better on line. The daily breakfast was great and a big savings. The 2 bedroom unit met my family of five needs and was big enough for us to be very comfortable. Overall I was not impressed. I felt that for 150.00 per night I could have stayed in a nicer place on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable,good size rooms, clean would recommend.”
Reviews.Author: sgraffy
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with this hotel, we had a two bed apartment that was well equipped (although no hotel in America seems to supply kettle and t-bags!!) only coffee maker, it was clean and tidy. There is a short walk to the strip - not far and its really nice to have somewhere quieter to come away from the strip to. Complimentary breakfast,very good but be early to get a seat. Good pool and seating, we were traveling three teenagers, this was the best hotel we stayed in for space/value.

Reviews.Title: “Great alternative from a casino hotel...simple but close to everything.”
Reviews.Author: TechJackets
Reviews.Content: We caught a rafting trip from here...it was clean, large rooms, surprisingly quiet and only a block from the MGM. A cab ride to the airport was only $8-10. Breakfast was ok, the staff very friendly/helpful and a mini-store was next to the front desk. Compared to the monster casino hotels, it was nice to walk in right to the front desk and get to your room within a couple minutes. It is larger than it seems, eat breakfast early or stake our your pool chair before the crowd wakes up.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and Reliable”
Reviews.Author: Mani2ban
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the third time in Vegas. Great getaway from the Strip even though it's right behind it! 5 minute walk to MGM and the Strip. Very clean quiet and relaxing resort. Bonus free breakfast and free drinks from 5-7pm to relax by the pool with. Free wi-fi unlike the Strip resorts that charge.Great for families wanting to get away from the casino's. Front desk staff is very nice and helpful. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful facility ~ absolutely loved it!”
Reviews.Author: vlmh
Reviews.Content: I just returned yesterday from a four-night stay. My friend and I wanted personal privacy and yet an area to socialize and relax upon our return to our room. The two-bedroom, two-bath suite was perfect for our needs. I was impressed from the first moment of my arrival: everyone was courteous, efficient, and helpful. Our rooms were exceptionally clean and well-appointed. It was such a pleasure to have a full kitchen with all necessary items readily available. I have already started to plan my next trip with my daughter, her husband, and our two granddaughters. My only regret is that it looks as if we will have to wait until the spring. Thank you to everyone there for a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Great trip.”
Reviews.Author: EVMIII
Reviews.Content: Location is one block off the strip away from some of the hustle and bustle. Easy walk to all the casinos on the southern strip. Staff was great, concierge was very helpful. Room was nice and the bed was very comfortable. Free continental breakfast was great to help save a few dollars in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “great price better stay”
Reviews.Author: bajanman61
Reviews.Content: the staff was friendly, service was great, i will be back and would recommend this place to all my family and friends. It is close to the strip to walk to, but far enough to enjoy peace and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “best value in las vegas”
Reviews.Author: little rock girl
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay, close to the strip but away from the madness. The only problem I had with them is that they were out of milk on Sunday and some breakfast items on Monday. The staff is very friendly and helpful, particularly the concierge. Other than that I would recommend them to anyone coming to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “BEST Family Friendly Resort”
Reviews.Author: griselda3838
Reviews.Content: We are SVC owners and loved our first stay with our points!! This place is unlike the Vegas hotels that are not family friendly in terms of smoking, gambling, night life but has all the amenities of a Vegas hotel on the strip and more: pool, spa, fitness center, free breakfast, laundry, BBQ grills (we grilled), full kitchens (we cooked), comfortable beds, nice furniture, great view from our unit, free wine/cheese evenings, nice/helpful staff, clean unit, well kept grounds, and is walking distance to all the glitz of Vegas if that's what you're into. As a mother of two teens I was impressed I could have it ALL in Vegas at this hotel, on a busy holiday weekend!!

Reviews.Title: “Great room for the price”
Reviews.Author: cormo13
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Desert Rose on the 17th of June for a week and I really can't say a bad thing about the place. a full kitchen and living room and nice bedroom with a comfortable bed. The only down side we found were. The bathroom was a bit small and the view of outside. we got a room on the ground floor facing what looked like a laundry room. We did try the breakfast on the first day and weren't impressed. It is free but unless you just fancy cereal and a tea/coffee its not really worth a visit. For the price and what you get i doubt you can do better that close to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: kerzamac
Reviews.Content: Just returned,Hotel was excellent from fast check in,arrived just after 1pm and started to unpack in our room within 10 mins,breakfast was free and excellent,bagels,toast,ham egg and cheese,with plenty of fresh juice.Did tend to get busy round about 8am ish.However did not seem to be a big problem, Plenty of towels and beds available arounf the pool most days,there were odd days when most of the beds,were gone by 10am. Felt safe going and returning from strip at night,always turned right from the front door heading towards hooters/mgm,crossing at the end of the road to MGM front lobby. Happy hour 5-7 Monday to Friday,free beer and wine with small nibbles Staff were friendly and always greeted you with a hello and a smile. taxi from airport $13 no tunnel !, $10.50 return? taxi from Freemont $21 taxi from Stratosphere hotel $19 Why go anywhere else?

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Affordable for First Class Quality”
Reviews.Author: munanjhalli
Reviews.Content: I was impressed first of all, by the appearance of the resort - very clean and well taken care of. Following that, every step of the way, we were more and more impressed. Check in was a breeze, no waiting and friendly, cheerful reservation clerks. Parking excellent and close to our room. The room was top class - furniture was comfortable and fashionable. The pool was awesome. Always had plenty of towels at the pool side, plenty of lounge chairs and tables. The continental breakfast was on time - just what you needed in the morning if you didnt feel like cooking or heading out to a gi-normous buffet. The entire staff we came into contact with were outstanding from the front receptionist, the maintenance staff to the housekeeping staff. The walking distance to the strip seemed like a "hop, skip and a jump" and we were very very happy that it was so close. The price of the room was phenomenal! I could go on and on. Needless to say, we will be telling everyone about the Desert Rose and we definitely plan to come back in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Gem in the Desert”
Reviews.Author: joeybborlandpark_IL
Reviews.Content: Desert Rose Inn & Resort - was by far the nicest hotel I've every stayed in! It's about 2 blocks off the strip and they are like mini apartments. They have a fully stocked kitchen, dining room, bedroom, bathroom, private balcony, pool, hot tub. The maid even does your dishes. The staff is very friendly and the grounds & rooms are clean. You can hit the strip in the morning and go to the pool in the afternoon and then go out on the town at night. Very nice hotel - would recommend to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, clean, good value , off strip”
Reviews.Author: SaintGeorge
Reviews.Content: Desert Rose is an excellent value Shell Vacations Club hotel resort. Have stayed there twice in the last few years. This trip was even better than the first. Rooms clean and quiet. However, the breakfast was boring - same food everyday for 8 days. The pool was nice but people tended to set up camp in the lounge chairs early and never leave all day. But convenient walking distance location next to Hooters and MGM and monorail.

Reviews.Title: “loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: jodiwales09
Reviews.Content: ive just got back from a weeks stay at the desert rose las vegas and i loved it. the rooms were big and had everything u needed in there plus more. good location within minutes walk to the strip. it is nice to get out of the madness of the strip this is perfect!! done a trip through the hotel which was very good. hotel staff were very happy to help with everything. very good vale for money would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “This place was the best hotel we styed in during our entirre month long trip! Extremely impressive!”
Reviews.Author: laurie3010
Reviews.Content: Desert Rose is a 5 minute walk from MGM Grand which means you get the advantage of being close to the strip and avoid the disadvantages of staying on it. The entire resort is spotless and the room cleaning staff even did our dishes for us. The room was massive, with a double room, dining area,open plan living room, fully fitted modern kitchen, walk in wardrobe, dress area, bathroom and balcony. It also had free wi-fi throughout the whole complex.The staff were extremely friendly and the free breakfast was the most comprehensive continental breakfast we had during our trip - (bagels, ham, eggs, muffins, bananas, toast, yoghurt and cerals). On the weekdays they provided free, yes completely free, wine and beer between 5-7pm along with snacks, like nachos, tacos etc. The pool was a good size and very clean. Although we didn't use the fitness studio it was very well equipped and as with everything on the complex, spotlessly clean. I really don't have enough superlatives at hand to describe how great we thought this hotel was and for the price it is a real find ($370 for 5 nights).We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves here and were disappointed we had to leave to go to another hotel (Riviera) to meet up with family - we spent the entire time at the Riviera reminiscing about the Desert Rose, especially since the Riviera was more expensive than the Desert Rose but not even half the quality. If you get the chance to book here do it, you will most definitely not regret it!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful week in Las Vegas/Desert Rose Resort”
Reviews.Author: sobota
Reviews.Content: The Desert Rose Resort is part of the Shell Vacation Club of which we are owners and the management and staff of the resort made our weeks stay absolutely very comfertable relaxing and certainly felt like home away from home.The Resort is well situated within walking distance of the Strip and also handy to the MGM Studios Resort where the Monorail begins.The staff were very friendly and always willing to assist when necessary.We would recommend this resort to all ages and families. Thank you The Desert Rose, we will be back. John and Gail Sobota, Queensland Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: enigmainnoc
Reviews.Content: The room I booked was a 1 bd room. Living room was quite specious with a pull out sofa bed, the kitchen was well equipped, and the bed room had a nice king bed with good matress. Only thing is that the bathroom was very small. They do not do a very good job cleaning the rooms. I stayed a whole week and I had to call the front desk twice as they did not clean the room or they did not leave any towels. Over all experience of the hotel was good. Except for the issue with house keeping. Also, hot water was a problem. Great Value for your money! Loved the Happy Hour!

Reviews.Title: “Family Friendly”
Reviews.Author: sonofyamhill
Reviews.Content: Non gaming resort - good if you need to visit Vegas for reasons other than everybody else. Felt like Phoenix instead. No slot machines, no long lines at check in. Parked the car near our room. Super friendly and efficient staff. Even the cleaning folks have smiles and say hello when you pass them in the hall. We had a family reunion in Vegas - my father's 75th birthday. We appreciated the weekday happy hour because all fifteen of us could sit in the lobby and chat. Beer, chardonnay, merlot, and white zin - and plenty of it, along with snacks that ranged from peanuts and pretzels to lasagna. Their daily breakfast was good - bagels, toast, cereal, ham, hard boiled eggs - enough to fill your tummy. Convenient location. Can't say anything bad. Good job DRR.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: smyork54
Reviews.Content: We would not stay anywhere eles but Desert Rose, it's a home away from home. Thanks to the staff and the wonderful services they provide.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, comfortable, spacious hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MacPennsylvania
Reviews.Content: As a family of 5 we found this hotel to be very easy to settle into. We stayed in the two bedroom, 2 bathroom suite and it was very spacious. The bedrooms were very clean, and the beds comfortable! The bathrooms as well were very clean. There was a small kitchen with microwave, and refrigerator which were both very handy. The complimentary breakfast was always well stocked throughout the morning. It was nice to be about an easy two block walk to the strip, and be away from all the noise at night.. It was our first visit to Vegas from Pennsylvania, and I would definetly recommend this hotel to family and friends!

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis”
Reviews.Author: Terryshops
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Desert Rose. This was my first visit. I usually stay at a casino hotel but this was so much nicer...breakfast every morning, a wonderful suite, very quiet. Truly an oasis right off the strip!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: southerngirlflorida
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for medical reasons for two weeks, it was close to my doctors office. The rooms are large and spacious and clean. Maid service was good, except they only vacumed when i asked and they never mopped, although when i asked the front desk they said they vacuum daily, which they did not! We had an issue with our garbage disposal, and for some reason they wanted to be cheap and not hire a plumber so it kept breaking and it was an inconvienience, it never was fixed which was a pain, esp since we cooked most days to save money. If you are traveling for pleasure this place is close enough to the strip you can enjoy the Vegas Strip life, but far enough away to have peace and quiet. The pool is nice, but small and the chairs fill up quickly. The morning breakfast is nice, and so is the afternoon receptions. They have two really nice grills (natural gas) by the pool you can use too, they were popular when i was there...got lots of use. The balcony makes a nice touch, nice to sit outside and enjoy some fresh air, can't really do that with the big strip rooms. Overall great place to stay, would recommend and would return if needed... The one complaint, i wish they had a door on the bathroom sink area, it was a pain if you needed to do something and someone was sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing in the little things”
Reviews.Author: PJinAK
Reviews.Content: Room was great: clean, large and comfortable. I stayed for four nights and the maid service was good. Now for the less pleasant bits: there were multiple exterior doors whose locks did not regularly work with the room key. It was a pain to have to walk longer distances late at night to find an exterior door that worked. Same problem with the laundry room. This problem was worse because parking lots were chained off at night, limiting the ways in to the facility after 10 pm. The morning breakfast service was always quite crowded but they did at least spread out the serving tables so the crowded were dispersed.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Suse0710
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at the hotel. It was really comfortable and we were fully satisfied with all our needs. If we ever come back to Vegas, we will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort for families with small kids”
Reviews.Author: azfamilywithkids
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with a condo feel. Perfect for families with kids - just off the strip and NO casino. We loved that we were close to everything but did not have to constantly walk our kids through a casino to get to our room. Our room was great, bed very comfortable and loved having a full kitchen. Continental Breakfast was good and Manager's Reception a nice break before dinner. Kids loved the pool and also the small kiddie pool.

Reviews.Title: “What More Could You Ask For! Comfortable and Close to Everything!”
Reviews.Author: domandon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Desert Rose for 3 nights while at a wedding in Vegas. We SAVED so much money because of the kitchen and the place was so comfortable. The breakfast was very nice. The staff was exceptional. Do not think twice about this resort. If you have the opportunity to stay here than do it. It was the best stay I ever had in Vegas. Will definitely book here again.

Reviews.Title: “The least sparkling hotel in Las Vegas, but the best gem!”
Reviews.Author: Sapengro
Reviews.Content: The reception desk was OK, there was no one to help us with our bags and show us to our room, but I can live with that. The location of this hotel is absolutely fantastic - a 10 minute drive from the airport, and a short walk to MGM Grand, Tropicana and the main hotels on the strip. The room itself was large, with a living room with TV, bedroom, bath/shower, fully equipped kitchen, and a dining room and balcony. Totally excellent, as I'm sure all the other guests and comments on here will agree! The hotel is great. We didn't have much to do with the staff but they seemed OK and friendly. The only two critisisms I can find are the rather chaotic breakfast area and the rather small pool where it was difficult to find a sun lounger after 9am. But then you don't come to Vegas for bland muffins and a small pool do you?!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, convenient, good value”
Reviews.Author: diesinker
Reviews.Content: This non-gambling, family friendly, hotel was a pleasure to stay at. The hotel suite apartment was a plus. The more than adequate breakfast was very appreciated since we had an early departure. Our group enjoyed the happy hour, pool and hot tub after a log day of traveling. The location was close enough to the strip that we could have dinner and walk down Las Vegas Blvd. When we return to Las Vegas we will certainly give the Desert Rose serious consideration.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay”
Reviews.Author: MoniUtah
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Desert Rose Resort and had a wonderful time. It’s only a block of the strip, so you get to enjoy the lights without the noise. It perfect for saving money on meals (dining on the strip can be expensive) with the kitchen that’s included in every suite; plus there's a continental breakfast and happy hour. The bed was super comfortable and very private. I will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: akbaldwin
Reviews.Content: Everyone that was working was friendly. We LOVED cocktail hour. The pool was always at a satisfactory temperature. There was not a bus stop on/near our road. We had to walk to Excalibur, Luxor, or MGM. About a 10 min walk. We will definitely stay there every time we go back!

Reviews.Title: “The Desert Rose Resort was perfect for us.”
Reviews.Author: Cache3
Reviews.Content: The Desert Rose has a friendly efficient staff. It is a nice place within walking/bus distance of major gambling establishments. In addition it serves a good continental breakfast and has a nice wine/appetizers reception in the early evening. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “spacious condos”
Reviews.Author: mazzzLeeds
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Desert Rose quite a few times and it is great value for money - love the breakfast, its plentiful for anyone. The rooms are spacious and there is everything a family/couple could need and more besides - fridge/freezer microwave etc, its home from home...perhaps if you were to look for something to moan about then it would be that the carpets need cleaning, and possibly up-grade the settees now, but i think they are starting to do that already....if you have a family and need a clean homely place to stay, then this is it..accessable for the strip and anything else you may wish to do in the fun city.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Raquel023
Reviews.Content: It's a home away from home. Quiet & relaxing. Staff was very helpful. Comfortable beds. Worth every penny. Will definitely go back when visiting Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “totally fabolous!”
Reviews.Author: brandaloochies
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying at the Desert Rose in Las Vegas and just like the first stay it was absolutely fabolous! I love that it's off the strip but within walking distance of some of the major casinos. I love that they have happy hour (mon-friday), and breakfast at the resort. I love that the rooms are always clean and comfy and quiet. The staff is very friendly and wanted to make sure our stay was enjoyable. I can't say too many nice things about the resort. I actually just booked another reservation at this resort for a group of friends of mine at the end of the summer and I can't wait to return to the Desert Rose!

Reviews.Title: “Desert Rose Resort”
Reviews.Author: ca-drew69
Reviews.Content: We stayed Jun.6th,2009 for two nights the resort was very nice. Grounds well keep. Pool clean. Rooms were very nice and clean.No need to go out and eat stove, dishes, pots, pans,refrigerator, a mini suite, dishwasher, microwave just like home. Breakfast had a lot to choose from as well .Would recommend this resort as a "A" for the staff and the reasons above.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing but nice things to say”
Reviews.Author: mstaostoad
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Desert Rose last week for 4 nights. I have nothing but nice things to say about it. We were in a one bedroom and had our two 18 year old daughters with us. The pool was nice (we were there right when it opened so no problems finding chairs), my husband used the exercise facility, breakfast was good (we were up early so not that crowded), attended the afternoon "happy hour" drinks and snacks (nice), used the concierge service to get tickets to tPhantom of the Opera and she was GREAT help! Rooms were nice and one daughter kept asking if we could just stay. Even with walking to Hooters to catch a taxi, my feet said we had to go home. Thanks for making it a special week.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet ,comfortable complex only 10-15minutes walk from the strip”
Reviews.Author: saveytravelers
Reviews.Content: My partner and I had a very comfortable 6 night stay at the Desert Rose Resort back in March 09. We had a one bedroom self -contained apartment which was very clean, quiet , well equipped and maintained by management. It was only a 10-15 minute walk to the MGM Grand where you could easily pick up the Deuce (consider at least 24 hr bus ticket if not a 3 day ticket as works out a lot cheaper) and begin your day hopping on and off the bus and exploring the strip at your leisure. There is a Vonns Supermarket just a few blocks east along Tropicana Av and we were able to use our Deuce bus ticket to travel there and stock up on groceries as the kitchen in the apartment was excellent and a great way on saving money on eating out all the time. The resort offered a complimentary breakfast every morning which had a good choice of breakfast items and their free wine hour during the week was a welcome relief for tired feet. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: kathieeb
Reviews.Content: The room was great, the staff very helpful, the location was great! We drove so the free parking was a bonus! We took advantage of the continental breakfast and the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Made for the perfect vacation”
Reviews.Author: PMallory
Reviews.Content: There are no words to express how wonderful our experience at this hotel was. We had a hard time finding a hotel that could accomodate our large family in Vegas, when we came across the web site for this hotel we were thrilled to find a suite that would accomodate our needs. Everything from making the reservation, to finding it, to check in was easy and pleasant. The staff could not have been more welcoming or helpful during our entire stay. For a large family on a tight budget there truly could not be a better place in Vegas to stay. We were pleased with the location- it makes getting around Vegas quite simple. While we did not take part in the activities (due to other family obligations) we were pleased to see the number of things this hotel offers. We feel that your web site does not due this hotel justice!! We have family that lives in Vegas so we will be back and we will definately be staying at The Desert Rose Resort!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best suite on strip for the cost”
Reviews.Author: goingthere09
Reviews.Content: Stayed here this past week after reading such good reviews on this site- we were very pleased with the room, location, comfy bed, fully stocked kitchen, nice hot tub, free beer on wk days, view of the strip, walking distance to Hooter's pool, and easy access to and from everywhere else. It has so many positives... we will stay here again if given the chance. However it is true that this property is a long walk to the main strip- you can see MGM from here but walking to it is a LONG stroll. And there's lots of traffic so it's better to walk to Hooters, then Tropicana.. and so on. It's also true that the air conditioners are loud but they work incredibly well... so didn't bother us. The last and only other non-positive thing is that because it's not on the strip some clubs will not offer you the complimentary pickup. And taxis seem to like to take the long way back here... so rent a car for heaven's sake. This place is awesome and the only place to stay if you're not wanting to buy a timeshare or pay waaaay too much. Enjoy it!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay with variety of family”
Reviews.Author: montero89
Reviews.Content: We picked this facility due to the proximity of wedding and convenience to strip - no previous knowledge of what to expect, though I was impressed with reviews I read on this site. We had 5 rooms and they were all nice, clean and comfortable. We had folks from their 70's down to teens and eveyone enjoyed it. Staff very friendly. Very, very easy to get to strip and monorail. Complimentary breakfast was nice with variety. We were glad we got to pool early on nice sunny day as and chairs and lounges filled up quickly. Overall rooms very much quieter than at higher end hotels - very little noise, though our nephew was next to an outside entrance and he did say he could hear the door close as it "slammed" with spring action to make sure it latched. We were in room right next to him and never heard a thing. We will stay here again on future visits to Vegas and look for Shell Hospitality Resorts during future travel

Reviews.Title: “Still waiting for charges to be reversed on card.”
Reviews.Author: jenjones28
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night at the Desert Rose. The room was spacious, although the carpet was filthy. Beyond dirty to filthy. Beds were comfortable and clean. We booked a two bedroom, two bath suite. I did not realize one bathroom had a shower only; no tub. Wi-fi was spotty. Fairly short walk to strip, but very dark and unlit at night. We had prepaid for our room through a travel site and had no problem giving them a credit card on check in for "incidentals" (which we knew we would have none), but four days after checkout I'm still waiting for the deposit to be reversed on my card. The deposit was almost as much as our room charge (within a few dollars). Really? For a prepaid room for one night's reservation? Perhaps they could have mentioned the amount they would be holding up front. Did not realize they had a concierge..... all we ever saw was one woman working the front desk. As a side note, if you are looking for peace and quiet, keep looking. I think a lot of families with small children stay at this resort, and you can hear EVERYTHING through the walls and ceilings. At least, we certainly could. It even kept my teenage son awake!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service - Loud AC”
Reviews.Author: DKGenius
Reviews.Content: The DR was a great place. The rooms were clean and spacious, the breakfast great, the staff very helpful. My only complaint was a crazy loud AC, which was a bit disturbing at night while sleeping...but still, I have a great time and it was close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place Close to the Strip”
Reviews.Author: r27779
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a quiet place to enjoy your time in fabulous Vegas look no further. We stayed in a roomy one bedroom with full kitchen (all cooking necessities included). Staff were curteous and friendly. Room was clean, although it could use a couple of paint touch ups. Free continental breakfast. Free weekday social in lobby from 5:00 to 6:00 (included wine, beer and snacks). Short walk to Luxor, Mandalay Bay, Tropicana, MGM and New York New York. Found great deal online at hotel website. Desert Rose is truly that, a rose in the desert.

Reviews.Title: “Great...BUT...light sleepers beware!”
Reviews.Author: bleweyz39
Reviews.Content: I would have given the Desert Rose Resort a 5 star rating except for the fact that we had to be re-roomed because of the noisey compressors on the roof. Warning....the 3rd floor is noisy. Every time the AC cycled on, it sounded like a freight train was passing thru our room! Luckily, the staff at the DR is soooo accommodating, that they moved us right away. Other than that, I have nothing but praise for the DR. Great rooms, great value, great location. Breakfast is wonderful, but CROWDED! I agree with other reviewers...rent a car, we did and were soooo glad we did. Also, if you plan to win, visit the downtown casinos. The odds there are much better. (Video poker)

Reviews.Title: “Why stay anywhere else in Las Vegas?”
Reviews.Author: AlanP00le
Reviews.Content: Brilliant place this - with a vast suite (not just a hotel room and bathroom - a large lounge /diner, next to the well equipped kitchen, large bedroom with wash basin off and bathroom), great pool (with free beds and towels at the pool side), breakfast and (from Mon - Fri) free beer and wine served for a couple of hours in the evening. This together with :- - friendly, efficient, staff - good location (very close to the MGM Grand) - great rates makes this a fantastic bargain - it could not be recommended more highly Thank you Desert Rose.

Reviews.Title: “Better than the Casinos”
Reviews.Author: gogolf78
Reviews.Content: Two bedrooms, two baths, and a large living area, a full kitchen and dining area for $102/night. Six or more people could have slept in our apartment.. There was free wifi. The wifi service was a bit spotty though, it would drop then reacquire the signal several times per session. The free continental breakfast, was more than adequate, cold cuts,fresh fruit, bread, bagels, boiled eggs, milk, cold, and cereal. The choices vary from day to day. Good service and clean. It is in a good location near the strip but out of the hustle and bustle, an easy walk to the strip near Hooters,The Tropicana and MGM. It is a good base for "doing Vegas". Parking is free, well lit, and convenient. The only two negatives. You should get to the pool early to get a deck chair and the equipment in the fitness room is not in good condition. We had stayed at several of the Casinos in the past but never again.

Reviews.Title: “A Sweet Suite!”
Reviews.Author: trojan85
Reviews.Content: Everything from the room to the service was fantastic. The concierge were very polite and outstanding. We stayed in a 2-bedroom 2-bathroom suite and were amazed at how much space there was. I fell in love with it! The suite was filled with gorgeous decor and the kitchen was stocked with everything you could think of! The beds were also extremely comfortable. This resort is a rare gem as it is one of the most affordable suites to stay in that is extremely close to the strip. It's only a block away from the strip! It's right across from the MGM Grand within close range of New York New York and Excalibur. Staying at the Desert Rose Resort was very affordable and convenient. We didn't want to leave! We will definitely be back this year and for our other future trips. You can't go wrong with this one!

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: IrelandRay
Reviews.Content: this was our first time in las vegas and we were very lucky on finding a nice place like this 2 stay, it's clean comfortable, very affordable, staff are very welcoming and helpful, the managments free drink reception every evening was great and the breakfast had something for everyone, i will be stayin here on our next visit without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “a true gem of a hotel amongst the chaos of las vegas”
Reviews.Author: mauisunseeker
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 4 nights and chose it as the main strip hotels were much more expensive. you would need a satnav to find your way from your rooom to reception in some strip hotels, they are more like little cities. the desert rose is only a 5 minute walk from the south end of the strip, we could see the luxor pyramid from our room. the room was more a self-catering apartment rather than a hotel room, with full kitchen facilities, a balcony area, and a separate living room. the breakfast was help yourself continental style, plenty of choice. the desert rose is smaller than most vegas hotels, this only added to its charm. all the staff were friendly and the room was spotless. i would recommend it to anyone who wants more than a basic hotel room and is happy to walk 5 minutes to the strip to join in all that vegas has on offer. if we return to vegas, i would not stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay anywhere else when in Las Vegas.”
Reviews.Author: Teach91
Reviews.Content: The staff was courteous. The room was very clean with all of the amenities of home. The location was easy to get in and out of. Was close to the airport and the Las Vegas Strip. What I did like the best was it being quiet and a non-smoking resort. I can honestly say it was a pleasure to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: lk0702
Reviews.Content: The Desert Rose Resort was everything that was promised. I have stayed at many hotels in Vegas including MGM, Venetian, Luxor and Mandalay Bay, and those are great, but if you want a place with a good location, plus all the amenities for an extended stay the Desert Rose it is!!! The king bed was comfortable and the kitchen had everything you will need to cook and eat. You don't really need to plan on breakfast though because they have a nice light buffett every morning. Nice pool and workout facility too. I had a great experience and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “home away from home”
Reviews.Author: jezba
Reviews.Content: me and my family had stayed in LA and san diego hotels before we ended up in desert rose which we found very decent and good place to stay especially if you are travelling with little kids.its almost like my own home we had a wonderful time and whenever we go to vegas we definitely stay there.we loved it loved it and loved it

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!!! Dont think you would find better, unless you are prepared to spend $500.00 per night”
Reviews.Author: PerthHoliday99
Reviews.Content: We booked this resort on the advice given by other posts on tripadvisor, and I would have to agree with them all. This is a little gem amongst a pile of rubble. Do yourself a favour and stay here. It is at the south end of the strip, within walking distance to the entire strip. The rooms are well furnished and very clean, beds very comfortable and a nice free breakfast to start your day. Check in, and out, was hassle free and we would stay here again without hesitation. Well done to all staff and management you are a credit to this establishment. Steve Mathews Australia

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, Clean, Quiet, Friendly right at the start of the STRIP!”
Reviews.Author: milabon
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Desert Rose and it was just as pleasant as the first time. Ideally located right across from the MGM Grand, the start of the Mono Rail and the start of the strip, so you are right where you want to be, but it is nice to come "home" to since it has no casino and is small scale. People are friendly and actually recognize you when you walk in and ever so helpful with everything. Although no luxury hotel, the 1 and 2 bedroom units are nicely decorated, everything you need is there (full kitchen), even free internet service and the beds are actually very comfortable. In the morning there is a nice complementary continental breakfast in the lobby area with Starbucks coffee (yep, free too), perfect to start your day and if you don't want to sit there, you just bring it to your room. Great value, will stay there again next time.

Reviews.Title: “What a find!”
Reviews.Author: cakes
Reviews.Content: I am so glad I found this place! Thanks, TripAdvisor. We spent a week hiking in Zion and decided to spend 2 nights at the end of the trip in Vegas. My husband had never been to Vegas and wanted to explore the strip but I knew the big glitzy hotels were not for us. The Desert Rose Resort was perfect! I know a lot of people complained about the walking but I don't know how you can see Vegas without a lot of walking. To go into the Venetian and walk up and down the "Grand Canal" takes longer than it does to walk from the Desert Rose to the MGM. We had to return our rental car at the airport and didn't want to deal with our luggage so we arrived at the Desert Rose at 11:30am. Our room wasn't ready but they happily stored our luggage. We measured the distance to the car rental return (3.3 miles) and decided to walk back. (I told you we were hikers!) By the time we got back (after a stop at Mandalay Bay), the Desert Rose had called our cell phone to let us know that a room was ready. Great service! Our two room suite was spotless, tastefully decorated, and very comfortable. There is a manager's reception during the week with beer, wine, soft drinks and snacks. The "continental plus" breakfast is decent and includes hard boiled eggs, which made me happy. There is Starbucks coffee available in the lobby 24 hours, I guess to keep you awake if you are out late gambling. :-) My only complaint is that the pool seemed very crowded but it was hot and all of the pools at the big hotels were crowded too. I don't think you can avoid that in Vegas in May. It was so nice to come back to the quiet of the Desert Rose after spending a day on the noisey, busy strip. We couldn't believe how long the lines were at check-in at some of the big hotels on the strip and how people had to walk through the casino with their luggage to find their rooms! No thank you! Give me the nice, personable Desert Rose any day. We plan to go hiking in Utah again and will probably fly in and out of Vegas again. When we do, we will definitely stay at the Desert Rose Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Large, Nice Rooms for a fraction of the price”
Reviews.Author: Erinkbailey
Reviews.Content: I am never staying on the strip again. I've been to Vegas several times and really enjoyed my stay at the Desert Rose. You are secluded from the loud obnoxious crowd on the strip for sleeping and relaxing at the pool, but can be right in the middle of it within a short walk. Huge rooms for a fraction of the price.

Reviews.Title: “great place, great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: painrelief
Reviews.Content: We arrived around 12PM the 1 week before Memorial day. I realized that Check in was at 4pm, but the friendly staff at the front desk got me a room that was ready. We stayed at Building 4, 3rd floor in a 1 bedroom suite overlooking the side of Hooters Hotel. The suite was spacious with a kitchenette and a nice balcony. We used the kitchen a lot to reheat food and snacks. There are 2 TVs - good, although not flat screen. Everything, including the kitchen worked. The staff was friendly and they even printed out my boarding pass for me. I would recommend this place to my family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: llknable
Reviews.Content: My husband and two children (ages 19 & 21) and I stayed at this resort for 2 nights. I purchased the rooms from expedia for about $100 a night. It was worth it. It was clean. Nice rooms, actually we had two bedrooms, two baths, small living room/dining room and small kitchen. It suited our needs well. We could go to Walmart about 2 miles away and get food to eat in. To get to Walmart go out to Tropicana Blvd and make a right then go about 2 miles. The only negative thing was our room was right beside a locked gate and people were coming and going at all hours. The gate was noisy when it shut. I was glad that they had them though. You need your room key to open the gate. It was nice...it was clean....liked the kitchen... it had basic needs. The pull out couch was not comfortable but that was to be expected. Also, I read on here about the blocks out there being to long or big and they were right. Expect to do alot of walking.

Reviews.Title: “great place especially for family”
Reviews.Author: ArizonaBruce
Reviews.Content: My brothers and sister and I stayed here for 4 days and it was great-I would like to find more places like this in California and Hawaii,etc. Selma Gonzales

Reviews.Title: “For wildlife lovers everywhere - if you like brown decor and noise.”
Reviews.Author: Chilldoubt
Reviews.Content: I am actually staying at the Desert Rose at the moment, have been here for 6 nights as I am unable to shorten my stay without being charged for the full week. Not enjoying it one little bit so it's difficult to know where to start with my comments. Firstly I would like to warn anyone staying here of the telephone charges. I made three calls to the UK on the room phone for 3 mins 20 seconds, 3 mins 59 seconds and 4 mins 35 seconds - the charges for these calls were $53, $46 and $53 respectively. Obviously I'd expect a call from a hotel phone to be something like $10 for a few minutes but that is ridiculous. When I complained to the manager they simply had no explanation but agreed that their charges are 'extortionate'. Thanks guys. Secondly, the place is infested with moths. To a massive extent. I have just killed three of these in the last hour and they have plagued the week I have spent here. I have had them crawling on me, flapping in my ear while I was asleep, everywhere. Disgusting. Thirdly, there is a roach problem, although I have only caught 2 or 3 in my actual room, the corridors and outdoors are really bad and other guests have complained about their rooms being worse. And they're big ones too. Fourthly, although the place looks close to the big hotels when you look on a map or Google Earth, the walk is really terrible - the sewers in this block smell absolutely disgusting - to the extent that I wretched repeatedly, and there is no proper lighting. My girlfriend was approached in a car during the late afternoon and since there is virtually no one around the area and it backs onto the testosterone-fueled-moronic-whoop-fest which is Hooters Hotel it was a worry. Fifthly, forget about the pool. There are 144 large condos in this development. with I suppose an average of 3 people staying in each. There are approx 35 sunbeds. You do the maths, but even in Vegas people do like to use the pool and this one is woefully inadequate. It's not that great either. For the last four days we have been walking the mile or so to the Luxor to pay $10 to use their pool - didn't expect to have to do that but there is literally no choice. Sixthly, it's the noisiest place I've stayed since I last went to Ibiza aged 18. I didn't come to Vegas for the peace and quiet but when I put the do-not-disturb sign on the door (that incidentally says "Shhhh... I'm sleeping") I don't really expect housekeeping to slam their trolleys relentlessly against the walls and constantly SHOUT at each other. That was really bad. Other guests were loud idiots too, but I'm not blaming that on the hotel (oh, okay, go on then I will). Finally, far be it for me to be a snob but the clientele that this place attracts are very hit and miss. The breakfast buffet is like feeding time at the zoo. I't's held right in the middle of the lobby, the food is shocking and in order to reduce costs (I guess) the management provide nowhere to eat properly, no trays and flimsy plastic plates. I saw someone with a bowl of bran flakes with a hard boiled egg balanced in the middle while they poured milk on them. Another elderly lady was perched on an easy chair in her nightdress, she had clearly walked directly from bed to the buffet bypassing every sink, hairbrush and item of everyday clothing. A pink nightie with no underwear, shoes or socks was just the ticket for her mealtime - and just the thing to put me off eating. I only went to the buffet once although I did get some jam on my clothes when I sat down in the lobby another day (does that count?). I'm a well travelled chap and I'm very reasonable and give credit where it's due. The hotel was good about calling taxis to get us from A to B. The concierge booked a nice restaurant for my birthday and generally the place is spacious. The staff were on the whole functional but not particularly friendly or exceptional. I'm quite reluctant to say this is a bad hotel, because I did a lot of homework before I booked this trip and virtually everywhere I looked said this place was great. But in all honestly it's not. It's pretty damn bad. And I hate to admit I picked the wrong place but I did. But please don't stay here unless you get a knock-out cheap rate. There are way better places to stay in Vegas and some hotels have real bargain rates at the moment. If you do stay here don't make any phone calls, don't expect to use the pool, enjoy your breakfast, have any peace and quiet or a pleasant stroll to the strip. And bring a nose clip unless you like the smell of sewage. Oh, and ear plugs to drown out the noise of the outdated air-con. Do bring a microscope because the bugs and crawlies could make excellent study projects for the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Hey, I'm not easy to impress. This was a wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: DIW2KStLouis
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed 05/17 thru 05/21 of '09. Total for 4 nights (plus tax) was $533.96. Hey, I'm not easy to impress and am the first to complain if something isn't just right. But, for our time there at least, I have to say this was a wonderful place to stay. Maybe I didn't get a bargain basement price but I've paid a lot more for a lot less at other places. The top 10 reasons for staying at the Desert Rose ... or ... What we got for the money: 1) A very clean 2 bedrooms, 2 baths, kitchen, dining area, living room and balcony. (Kitchen has fridge, microwave, dishes, utensils, blender, coffee pot, toaster, etc). The bed was possibly the most comfortable hotel bed I've ever slept in. They even provided pillows of different sizes and fill just so you'd have a choice of what you'd like best to sleep with. I've never seen anyone else do that. 2) The baths had the deepest tubs I'd ever seen in a hotel. The shower had instant (and I mean INSTANT) hot water. I don't even get that at home! 3) There were TV's in the living room and in each bedroom. 4) The air conditioning was wonderful and there was no AC or 'hotel smell' (i.e. people or chemicals). The air was very clean. 4) Pool (we were too busy to ever use but saw others did and never heard a complaint) 5) Very friendly and helpful staff. The only time I was ever 'bothered' was when the cleaning staff actually called on the phone once to ask if I was sure I didn't want the room cleaned even though I had posted a 'do not disturb' sign on the door so I could grab a nap. I wondered then if they would have ignored the posted note if I hadn't answered the phone. Hmmmm. 6) Continental breakfast (served until 9 AM) that was more than adequate (cereal, bagels, hard boiled eggs, deli ham, fruit, etc.) No, not the very best I've ever had but close and still nicer than what most places term a 'Continental breakfast' . Besides, do you really want to 'load up' or weigh yourself down before hitting the Vegas strip? Even if you have a car or are just going to use the monorail, there is still a lot of walking around involved with your seeing Vegas. 7) There was some sort of free drinks (cocktails?) and snacks thing in the afternoon (A Complimentary Manager's Reception was the official name) that we never attended but thought you should know about. 8) Free Wi-Fi. We never used it but mention it here anyway. 9) We never had a problem with noise at the hotel even though our room was one story above the parking lot. I never heard the people in the hall or in the rooms next to us - no voices, no footsteps, nothing. 10) There is no gambling at the Desert Rose. Whew! Returning 'home' to the hotel each night after being inundated with the noises of machines and people, I really appreciated there not being a hint of it waiting for me when I was ready to rest up for the next day. Final note: I'm not a world traveler but have stayed in a lot of nice hotels the last half century. Some of them thought a lot better of themselves than I did. This one, though, was a real find. The hotel claims "...this three-story, all-suites hotel is just one block from the Las Vegas Strip, yet miles away in ambience". That statement of what to expect is spot on.
