I regret not taking photos of the rooms to share. I meant to as the one's supplied by the hotel don't do it justice - don't even come close. Also, if you are staying in Vegas for a few days without a car, consider getting a multi-day pass for the monorail (around $25). We had 102 and 103 degree days during our stay, the monorail helped avoid a lot of walking in the heat (and I don't care who starts in about it being a 'dry heat'. A hair dryer is a dry heat. It doesn't help when you turn the setting on high and stick it in your face. It is still HOT, people!

Reviews.Title: “Best Place for Families”
Reviews.Author: edmice14
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from staying at the Desert Rose - May 13 - 19/09. We were travelling to Las Vegas for a wedding. Got a great rate by booking directly with the resort - $100/night for the large 2 bedroom suite. We travelled with 4 teenagers and stayed in a 2 bedroom with pull out sofa in Building 4. Size of the suite was fantastic and more than enough room for the 6 of us. Large master bedroom with full ensuite was great and having a well stocked kitchen helped keep our food costs down. After walking through many of the casinos on the strip, I was very happy to be staying at the Desert Rose. I can't imagine staying in one of the large hotels and having to trek your belongings 20 minutes to find your room. The pool was very nice and a good size. My husband had breakfast and his coffee poolside every morning and found it very relaxing. The teenagers loved jumping into the water after a long day of walking in the sun. And yes the pool is not heated, but being Canadian we didn't mind! A cool pool after walking in 37C temperatures is nice. Staff were ever helpful. The only complaint we had was every week day morning we could hear the either a delivery truck or garbage truck backing up. The beeping was very annoying. Other than that we had a very enjoyable time and would definite stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious and convenient, great for longer stays”
Reviews.Author: Steffi08
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel rather than a Casino resort as it offered a 1 one bedroom suite and more space for 3 at a good price. 1 friend cancelled, so we were 2 women to the suite which turned out even better spacewise. It gave us more room for the large amount of clothing/shoes we brought. Also, the bathroom is rather small and off the Master bedroom, so people sleeping in the living room will have to walk through the bedroom. Luckily, sink and mirror are separate from the shower/toilet. Kitchen is really nicely equipped but the free (cold) breakfast was sufficient for us in the morning. It is nice to have a fridge to store leftovers and drinks, etc. The Pool area is clean and rather large but on most days there were not enough chairs and towels for all guests. The cocktail reception at 5pm is nice and filled us up until we got out for the night. The fitness room is smallish but has nice equipment. All staff is very helpful at all times. Generous parking for guests available if you rent a car (recommended if you want to go back to the hotel during the day to change or relax before nightlife, as commuting takes up a lot of time and its hot out there!). Walking distance to the Luxor is 8 minutes. From there you can catch a train (5 USD/trip). From the hotel, taxi cab to the airport is approx. 10 USD, so for 2 it is cheaper than the shuttle bus which has to be reserved 24 hours in advance. Supermarkets are approx. 2 miles away from the hotel in each direction - the nicer option here is a nicely designed strip mall (Town Square) with Whole Foods, upscale shopping and some good clubs/restaurants (Claim Jumper). Desert Rose is a nice, quite place if you dont need to be in the middle of constant party and action. Really good choice for longer stays. The guests are a mixed crowd, all ages, also some kids. The free WIFI in the room is also a nice bonus and allows to catch some good ticket deals for shows or other things do do in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Gave all that was promised.”
Reviews.Author: Shirleybeth
Reviews.Content: First time to Vegas so had no expectations butt WOW!!!!!!! The Desert Rose was everything it had prmised it would be. Rooms enourmous, fully equipped for all your possible needs including spare bedding and towels. Breakfast was a bit caotic but items replaced as soon as they run out. Really good location and once you learn how to get into the MGM acroos from Hooters car park it does not take long to hit the other hotels on the strip. Execellent value for money compared to the bigger hotels. Didn't really attend many of the managers free drinks as usually not around at these times (free drinks and snacks Monday -Friday 5pm-7pm) but it would have been nice to have a bar within the hotel for a quiet drink before bed, but a short car journey down Tropicana ave takes you to Vans supermarket where we discovered some lovely Califorian wines to drink in our room. Would definaltly stay again and recommend it to anyone looking to stay in Vegas

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay a few days!”
Reviews.Author: scruffy49
Reviews.Content: This was a really nice place to stay, just off the strip, with family.

Reviews.Title: “The best time ever!!”
Reviews.Author: DaveFan
Reviews.Content: If you have a choice, stay at this hotel! The breakfast is fanatasic, the cocktail reception is wonderful, the staff is friendly!!! Hardly spent money on food - just snacks and dinner. Easy access to and from the hotel from the airport - Airport shuttle is only $6 each way (buy both tokens at once - makes it much easier) It's a block away from the strip - MGM is across the street so there's easy access to the monorail. I'm not much of a gambler, so not having a casino at the hotel worked out great from me. You dont have to worry about smelling like smoke all the time and the noise levels are low. The 1-bedroom suite I had was spacious and clean! The private balcony was great too! Full size kitchen with appliances (blender, toaster, full-size microwave, frig & stove). A nice dinner table and chaise lounge. The bed was comfortable and big. The bathroom is a little small, but makes up for it by having a deep tub. I have been telling everyone since I've been back - this is the place to stay! I will never stay at a casino hotel again. The rooms are much cheaper for a better quality room! I have no complaints at all when it comes to the Desert Rose Resort

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, relaxing place to stay close to strip”
Reviews.Author: Jenmboyd
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I recently spent a week here. I recommend booking through them directly, as you might get a good deal (I checked other travel sites and felt booking through them was best and ended up paying almost half price for my room thanks to a special). There is a pool, free continental breakfast, free WiFi and Mon-Fri they have a little get together for guests and invite people to come down for drinks and snacks. I found employees to be helpful, although to help find the place quicker, it's good to note that this place is directly behind Hooters on a side street. We had a one bedroom with a fully equipped kitchen. How equipped? Go to a store nearby, buy some food and you can make meals right in your room. There's a dining area and living room area. The bedroom was nice with a big comfy bed, and the bathroom was nice too. Everything was wellstocked, clean and it made us feel like we were at home. I would stay here again in a heartbeat next time we take a trip to Las Vegas. And if you feel like gambling, shopping, eating out, clubbing, etc, you may not be able to do it here but you're close enough to the strip that you only need to go about 5 min to get to all the big casino resorts.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis amongst the madness of Vegas”
Reviews.Author: James-the-Kiwi
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay close to the Vegas Strip but also want a sanctuary away from the noise and madness of the big casino hotels, the Desert Rose is a real find. Just one block away from New York New York it's quiet and peaceful, has large, very clean apartment style suites and a pleasant outdoor swimming pool and fitness room. Friendly staff too. And very god value for money. No restaurant (rooms have kitchens) but continental breakfast included. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Truly a rose ----in a Sea of cactus”
Reviews.Author: billLodi_ca
Reviews.Content: A place we have no problem recommending to our friends. All of are needs and desires were meet with a friendly staff waiting to please.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot away from the glitz”
Reviews.Author: Kiwis74
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely time at the Desert Rose Resort in Vegas. It was fabulous for a family with youngish children, like us. It was clean, rooms nice but no wow factor, handy to the Strip and main attractions, had a lovely pool, good breakfast and nibbles at night and staff helpful (except concierge - she gave us poor information more than once). Would recommend this as a great place for families who want to experience Vegas without being amongst the glitz and hype.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Bindas1943
Reviews.Content: Ceck-in, Check-out, services are fast and prompt. Continental breakfast, manager's snacks in the evening, room service, cleanliness of the property and pool side are excellent. Apartment is with fully equiped kitchen. Laundry services are cheap and good. Though the facility is just off the 'Strip' it has all the convenience of staying on the 'Strip'. However the atmosphere is serene and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort, wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Chester048
Reviews.Content: Accommodations are very nice, their complimentary breakfast and cockail hour are first class. Their complimentary internet access is an unusual treat as well. Location is great, within walking distance of the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, nice, cheap, friendly people, centrally located. What more do you want!”
Reviews.Author: travellee29
Reviews.Content: We didn't expect much from this hotel, since we stayed in the Venetian at the start of our vacation. But everything exceeded our expectations: rooms were HUGE, you had your own kitchen, everything was nice and clean, everybody friendly, breakfast complementary, nice pool, very quiet and just off the strip. It was a pity we only had one night here before flying back home!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, just off the strip with a kitchen.”
Reviews.Author: BusyTraveler23
Reviews.Content: Got the room on the day of my stay from a travel site. I did not know what I was getting. I was pleased by everything, from check in on. Great space, just off the strip. Instead of a little room which screams "go gamble" they offer a comfortable space with a kitchen and living room you can be comfortable in. Good value too. I'll use them again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and stay”
Reviews.Author: dmholiday
Reviews.Content: Room allocated spotlessly clean but we were put next to a carpark access gate which slammed constantly when guests arrived back at resort. A quick call to the front desk and we were relocated within 15 minutes. Decent breakfast, large 2 bedroom unit clean and well serviced by staff. Tip - ask for room on top floor to avoid noise from occupants above.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: dpickett
Reviews.Content: Exactly what I wanted - something peaceful slightly off the strip. The rooms are really nice and it was priced reasonably.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and a quiet oasis not far off the Strip.”
Reviews.Author: 1955traveler
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews we tried the Desert Rose and were not disappointed. Excellent value, very courteous and plentiful staff, and very quiet. If you want to be close to the action, this is not the place, but you are within walking distance of the 4 corners of the Strip. To avoid the crowds at breakfast, go early (6am weekdays, 7am weekends). No complaints, nice pool, generous poolside chairs/tables, etc, more than adequate continental breakfast, Starbuck's coffee, nice excercise room, very nice one bedroom condo, well equipped, in-room wireless internet, and all for <$50 per night (using a travel site w/discount code). Very pleased and will go back. Thank you Desert Rose.

Reviews.Title: “Even more than I expected”
Reviews.Author: JBrim
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel using Tripadvisor, and am usually satisfied - although sometimes the "best value" isn't the same as "best". In this case we found both. We booked a 2 bedroom suite (these are timeshare condo's, actually) because there were no one bedrooms available on the nights we wanted. No matter - only $108/night didn't break the bank. After travelling for several weeks in Holiday Inns, Hiltons, etc we expected a nice but standard box. However this was indeed a complete 2 bedroom apartment, each bedroom ensuite, a full kitchen with utensils, wine glasses etc. Our unit must have been upgraded in the last couple of years so everything was modern and worked well. Other reviews indicate some plumbing problems so perhaps our unit was special - the 5 nozzle massage shower was really nice, for example. Also, the three TV's seemed a bit much, but it didn't stop there. The breakfast was reasonable but not extravagant. However the free wine and cheese (and a veggie platter) at 5pm was certainly an unexpected perk. It was really nice to have a chance to socialize around the pool in the central courtyard with other guests. Furthermore, my misgivings about security of our vehicle were allayed by the rather obvious 24 hour security guard in the lot. The Vegas strip is about a block and a half away, and the airport closer still. One would expect a lot of noise, but somehow the whole resort seems to be very quiet - as if its floating in its own bubble of silence. The friendly desk staff and concierge were very good at answering all our questions. If I go back to Vegas I would certainly recommend this resort to a friend - but there was so much space in that suite that my wife and I rattled around. I imagine it would be completely adequate for up to 4 people without any element of crowding.

Reviews.Title: “Desert Rose with Thomas Cook”
Reviews.Author: spikey
Reviews.Content: Travelled direct from Manchester with Thomas Cook in economy, dreadful outgoing flight people crossing the aisle in extra leg room seats in row 9 even after being asked not to on four occassions by cabin crew. Gave up in the end but changed seats for return alot better. Desert Rose is a lovely resort next to Hooters and MGM Grand. A short walk to the strip short cutting through car parks. Small problem but quickly resolved by Judy the manager and Thomas Cook rep. Room space great and comfortable, could live there. Breakfast a bit of a mess, the food is good and varied but not many places to sit and eat, it is best to get there early. Now I know why people bring trays and baking tins down from their rooms and fill them up and take them back simply not enough room to sit. Will return without a doubt in the near future. Cocos restaurant to the right of Duke Ellington, just past the motel 6 sign.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: beachnut56
Reviews.Content: I looked at many resorts through RCI for my visit to Vegas. Most had construction going on, were not in good locations, or had bad reviews. My first choice was the Desert Rose and I was thrilled when a room opened up. Our stay was great. The staff was very welcoming and helpful. There were nice robes for us to use and a continental breakfast every morning. The location was perfect just a block of the strip near the MGM and Tropicana - we walked to everything. The bathrooms were small, but there were just two of us so not an issue. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “CAN'T THINK OF ONE BAD THING”
Reviews.Author: DMZArizona
Reviews.Content: It's not very often in this day and age you can say absolutely nothing bad about a hotel that you've just left, but I can! Eight women made a Las Vegas adventure for 3 nights and 4 days and we all had the trip of a lifetime! The hotel is a big expense when you get away and I can honestly say that Desert Rose compares to those top-named hotels that most people with families can't afford. We ALL felt comfortable, well taken care of, safe and assured that we got a heck of a deal for the money. The hotel is just two city blocks away from the strip. Continental breakfast is free with your stay and we managed to drag ourselves out of bed to make sure we didn't miss the array of cheeses, eggs, breads, juices and fruit each morning. We even managed to arrive during their Friday happy hour and had our first buzz on them! The pool was clean, the grounds were clean, and the room was clean and neat. Security was seen in the parking lot and we were constantly met with employees that offered smiles - from the guy in the suit (making sure everything was done correctly) to the room cleaning staff and those other dedicated folks with very repetitious jobs. Again, we're talking eight women... How many places out there could have satisfied ALL of us? Thank you Desert Rose... We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Well pleased with all features of this resort... as billed”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyAnglin
Reviews.Content: We read about 3 full pages of reviews before making reservation. All positive pretty much. Probably the strongest rating we have given any resort that we have reviewed. Suited us perfectly. Location is great to the strip and monorail. Great atmosphere. Nice little pool to relax by if you want to do that. We would recommend to anyone and will stay here again hopefully.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet little Gem and best value for the money hands down!!!!”
Reviews.Author: leoep79
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed at the desert rose May 1-6th 2009. I found the Desert Rose to be an excellent value for the price. I loved how it was only a 5 min walk to the strip, located in a quiet area. The FREE continental breakfast was FABULOUS, alot of excellent choices to eat.......one less meal to have to worry about especially dealing with trying to feed hungry kids first thing in the morning. The staff was always very friendly and accomodating, eager to help and always took the time to say "hello" The hotel was remarkably well kept, and they spent alot of time keeping the grounds neat and tidy. The pool is not large, but perfect for the kids to cool off in. Its nice to walk back into the hotel and NOT see a slot machine after walking the strip and seeing them everywhere - it was great to get back to the peace and quiet of the Desert Rose. The only downside, and no fault of the hotel is the ocasional wafting odor off the street, and a quite a few moths flying around outside and down the halls.......it was just the time of the year........ we would stay there again in a moment, and are already planning our next vacation. We recommend this hotel to our family and friends - best value for the money, HANDS DOWN!!!!

Reviews.Title: “I would definitly stay here again”
Reviews.Author: chocoWashington
Reviews.Content: spacious room, very friendly staff, loved the social time in afternoon, very quiet, but still close to strip

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: jetset4422
Reviews.Content: Having stayed here last year for a convention, I chose to come back this year without hesitation. The renovations going on last year are pretty much complete and they've done a great job. I used to stay in one of the large four star hotels on the strip, until I discovered this place. It's a short and safe walk to the monorail station which quickly takes you right to the convention center, avoiding the overcrowded shuttles and parking problems they have up there. It's like coming home to your own comfy condo at the end of the day. My wife joins me here for a few days now, enjoying a workout or some reading on the private patio and time by the pool during the day. We walk to the strip in the evening to get our fill of noise and bright lights, after all this is Vegas! We always say this would be a great place to bring our 7 year old, there are always a few kids around, but for now we're happy to keep this little hideaway to ourselves. It's squeaky clean, comfortable and has everything we need. Unthinkably quiet, considering the airport is nearby and huge casino hotels are literally around the corner. Think about a competitive nightly rate with free wifi and parking and you realize what a great value this is. They even have a simple breakfast and some late afternoon snacks put out. Just got back and already planning for our return!

Reviews.Title: “brilliant place”
Reviews.Author: palmerj1
Reviews.Content: what a great place to stay off strip. We have just returned from a 5 night stay at the desert rose. We have been to las vegas 7 times (we are from UK) but was our first stay here. Includes full continental (and a bit more). There is a managers happy hour 5-7pm for beer, wine and soft drinks with nibbles like spring rolls or chicken nuggets and some other stuff. This is available mon - fri. The pool is good but can be abit cold but when you are hot from the desert sunshine, its nice and refreshing. Beds (sun loungers) and towels are provided free of charge. The roon was fantastic, separate bedroom with en suite, lounge and dining area with a very well stocked kitchen for those that like to cook. Our room was at the side so not much to see (just the top of the tropicana hotel) but was very quiet. Other rooms can be nearer the main road so could be a bit noisier. The only downside if there is one would be that its a 15 -10 minute stroll to the strip near mandalay bay, which is a the very beginning of the strip. This does not put us off staying here again next year. A suggestion would for the desert rose to have a free shuttle to the strip or other hotels on the strip. I highly recommend the desert rose to my friends who also has repeat visits to LV.

Reviews.Title: “HOME AWAY FROM HOME”
Reviews.Author: ArizonaEasytravelers
Reviews.Content: The Desert Rose Resort made our stay there so free and easy it was like being home. My spouse and I have stayed there many times. We have deceided that the Desert Rose will be the only place stay when we are in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Simple but perfect, just what you need, spacious and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: philnjennyGeorge
Reviews.Content: We needed a hotel for 5 days in vegas at the later end of our 2 week trip, wasn't sure what we wanted to do while we were there so we picked something that was not so in your face and themed, it was perfect. So glad we picked this hotel, there are no slot machines in site, they can get on your nerves, it was nice to escape from them. Walking distance for the strip and mono rail and very close to the airport. Breakfast can get very busy some days, we found it easier to take a plate down and get what you need and take it back to the room, you've got all you need in the room even a toaster for bagels that toasts one side. Nice touch to put out snacks in the evening just before you venture out onto the strip. I only spent one day by the pool, but it was very comfortable, loved to see young kids having fun. If I had to fly to Las Vegas again I would stay at the Desert Rose Resort

Reviews.Title: “I will not stay any where else in Vagas”
Reviews.Author: cysasdc6
Reviews.Content: We really injoyed the room and the people in Vagas. It was quite pleaseing to get there early and there was a room ready for us. Very clean and right next to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing better in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: JPinktree
Reviews.Content: We were over in Las Vegas from New Zealand in a large group of 23 all of whom were staying at different casinos and resorts up and down the strip. During our stay at the Desert Rose many of our friends and family visited us at the Desert Rose and were extremely impressed at the venue, the facilities, the fantastic breakfast and the size of the rooms. Many expressed that if they travelled to Vegas again they would stay at the Desert Rose. My fiance and I stayed here for a total of 11 nights and ended up extending our stay as we enjoyed it so much. The rooms are huge for Vegas and you get a full kitchen which is so handy when you are staying somewhere for so long. I used the room to get ready for my wedding with my two bridesmaids, two hairdressers/makeup artists and my Dad and we still had plenty of seating in the room. We would recommend this hotel to everyone and will not consider anywhere else when staying in Vegas!!!

Reviews.Title: “The best kept secret in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: OhioReadytofly
Reviews.Content: The Desert Rose is far and away the best value in Las Vegas. Just one block from the strip, it is convenient to all area attractions. But what makes it great are the rooms and the staff. The rooms are terrifically appointed and the staff is attentive to your every need. I will visit the Desert Rose on my next stay and recommend my colleagues and friends do the same. Terry Black Fairborn, Ohio

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful quiet gem”
Reviews.Author: dieseltug
Reviews.Content: We visited for a family birthday with 12 people and 2 babies and can't say enough good things about the Desert Rose. As one who is not a Vegas fan, this was perfect. Unless you wanted to walk the one block to the 'strip' you would never have known you were in the heart of the Vegas hustle and bustle. The pool is very nice and is kid friendly for families. They continental breakfast and weekday cocktail parties were very nice. The suites were nicely appointed, although the carpeting and some of the furniture needed upgrading, this was minor. The kitchens were fully equipped, and it was very nice to have a private balcony. The staff was friendly and helpful....Walter in particular was terrific when we needed a late checkout. I would definitely stay there again. It was a fabulous value.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CSDunford
Reviews.Content: Stayed here per Trip Advisor ratings, wasn't disappointed. Near enough to the Strip to walk, but far enough away (about 3 blocks) that it's much quieter. We asked for a quiet room and they gave us room 4305 (building 4, 3rd floor). We could see the pool from our balcony, but weren't right over it. The free high-speed wireless was priceless as I still had some homework to finish. The cold breakfast in the morning is very nice. There's a soda and wine reception every evening, though we never made it to that. Overall, one of the best stays I've had in Vegas. Would definitely go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Trip Advisor”
Reviews.Author: harborette
Reviews.Content: I found this little gem thanks to T.A. We were there just one night (last night) but were so happy. Booked our one-bedroom suite about two months ago for $101 through Expedia and then checked a couple of days ago and rebooked it for a special $75 - what a deal! The suite was great, the pool and jaccuzi were great, the free breakfast buffet was good (cold only, nothing hot) and the location was great. The only flaw, and it's a serious one in my opinion, is that there are loads of aggressive pigeons everywhere. The resort definitely needs to import a couple of cats and/or have spray bottles handy at the outdoor tables. And there's cold beer free during 5-7 happy hour (wine, not too good) along with a couple of appetizers. By the way, if you love Mexican food, go to T & T's at the Luxor. Prettybar/restaurant and I've never seen Mexican food (which was delicious and I've eaten lots all over the country) presented so wonderfully. Comfy tooled leather bar seats and great lighting.

Reviews.Title: “A very clean and quiet hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Dodgertown
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth time staying at the Desert Rose Resort and we enjoyed our stay as always. The rooms were clean and the service was great. The staff was very helpful and helped me retrieve my lost wallet. We liked the rooms, the quiet nights without traffic noise, and the pool. The breakfasts were just OK. We plan to return.

Reviews.Title: “Re review - goofed on 1st review”
Reviews.Author: thelonewolf
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best stays in Las Vegas in many years. It i close to the strip and all the hotels. The rooms are well decorated, frnished and equipped. Thye staff was very7 friendly and treated you like royalty. We will be going back next month. Lonewolf

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful facility, well located close to strip, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: AZjazz
Reviews.Content: great place , beautiful rooms... love the resort feel. Has all the amenities- kitchen, living room, 2 baths.

Reviews.Title: “Yep, this is what they say it is...”
Reviews.Author: SantaFeFilms
Reviews.Content: The Desert Rose Resort pays attention to the details. We were in town for a conference and we needed a quiet place to work and relax. The Desert Rose delivered. Our suite was completely equipped with everthing we needed; the free internet was a huge bonus, the fully equipped kitchen (with dishwasher, oven, plates, silverware, and even a toaster), and the spacious suites allowed us to live and work comfortably while we were in town. It's not the Ritz, but it's one of the strongest values we know of in LV. The staff was friendly and efficient, making sure every detail was taken care of. We travel for a living and this resort stands out.

Reviews.Title: “Desert Rose Good Value For The Money”
Reviews.Author: pebbs07
Reviews.Content: We just returned from an 8 day stay at Desert Rose Resort. Good location just a short walk to the strip and monorail. Nice looking property, comfortable accomodations, priced right. We encountered a few problems.... over flowing toilet, jammed safe, malfunctioning air conditioner. All problems were corrected in an acceptable time frame with a call to the front desk. Free continental breakfast was only adequate. It consisted of bread, cereal, bagels, hard boiled eggs, lunch meat turkey, and beverages. Not enough seating on all days we went. Many of the guests bring pans and "load up" with massive quantities of food and bring it back to their rooms. Do yourself a favor and skip the breakfast. Coco's Restaurant is a quick walk away. The food there is absolutely delicious, the service exceptional, free refills on all beverages and great bfast menu. Personally I would definately skip the continental bfast at Desert Rose. All in all; if you are looking for a non casino property this is a good value for the money. Something to keep in mind before booking is maid service is only every 3 days. We did call several times to request clean towels and they were quickly brought to our room, no questions asked, but daily clean towels and maid service would have been nice. I would reccommend this property to anyone who wants a non casino property close to the strip. It is a 3 star accomodation; not alot of frills; but clean and basic. I will close by mentioning that on our last day at the Desert Rose we found one cockroach in the kitchen. Management apologized profusely and told us that is common in desert properties to see roaches. We were told exterminators come weekly. ;-D

Reviews.Title: “Great overall package/value/location”
Reviews.Author: gkstone
Reviews.Content: I come to conventions in Vegas all the time and really try to avoid staying at the Strip hotels (when I'm footing the bill). I've stayed Downtown and off-Strip and have found good values there, but this place has a great ambiance, is a safe 5-10 min. walk to the Strip, and having the complimentary breakfast is great. We had 3 people share a 2Br suite and it worked out great! The security staff is very conscientious too; I got a phone call at 1:30am that a window on our car was rolled down; something that we had overlooked when parking it. Sure, I didn't like having to get up to take care of it, but I'm glad they were out there doing their job!

Reviews.Title: “5 out of 5, truely exceptional”
Reviews.Author: SimAndBek
Reviews.Content: pros -all of the above really, truely excellent. -apartment style rooms with fully equipped kitchen and lounge area, 2 tvs, large bathroom. cons -complementary breakfast is like feeding time at a zoo, not hotels fault at all, give out free food, they come running., days we utilised we were in and out. Not hotels fault but possibly a different approach to breakfast could be thought of.

Reviews.Title: “Great - clean, non-smoking, well-located, convenient and economical”
Reviews.Author: anmore
Reviews.Content: I would not hesitate to recommend the Desert Rose. Excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for a non-party type stay in L. V.”
Reviews.Author: Bearilyevil
Reviews.Content: My friend and I chose the Desert Rose for our trip to the World Cup Grand Prix and couldn't have been happier. It was quiet, comfortable and only a 10 minute drive (or less) from the Thomas and Mack Center. It was also convenient to the strip to which we walked for dinner our last night. Our two bedroom suite was perfect for two women with different sleep habits. My friend is a nurse who works nights and is, therefore, accustomed to staying up late. I, however, am an early to bed type but who likes fall asleep to the soothing drone of TV news talking heads. With TVs in each of out rooms, there was no problem. Because each of us had tickets to the evening competition on different nights , we didn't get to the managers reception more thantwice, but found it to be friendly and a real plus for the resort. The breakfast was only OK, in my opinion, especially since they ran out of yogurt almost every morning and it was totally absent on the weekends. The good side of that, however, was that it was quite easy to keep some in our own refrigerator. The other negative was that since it is a family friendly resort, there were many families with many small children and the pool was a bit unfriendly from a senior's point of view, but that's nit picking. All in all, I can't think of a place I'd rather stay in LV. I would definitely stay here the next time I visit LV

Reviews.Title: “Great for families and a good value”
Reviews.Author: uncletippet
Reviews.Content: We just got back from 2 nights at the Desert Pearl. What a great value! If you want fancy landscaping and pool valets who spray Evian on you, go somewhere else. But stay at the Desert Peral if you want a 1BR condo that has everything you need. Full kitchen, king size bed, adequate pool with free pool towels, sofa-bed for the kids, FREE breakfast, evening reception and NO gambling. Other than the fact that it's next to the Hooters hotel -- it's very kid friendly. Some of the reviews indicate that the furnishings were old and dated but it looked like our room was recently updated. New utensils, new fridge, new easy-clean electric range and dishwasher. It even has measuring spoons so it's very well furnished. The beds were older so if you don't like the old style sofa-beds, you might want to skip this place. The walls were also thin so when someone showers or flushes, you can hear it. This condo is a step above the typical kitchenette room -- normally part of the Shell Vacations Club time-share so has nice touches. The staff was friendly and left voice mail with the daily weather report. Breakfast buffet was hectic and not enough tables/chairs so we just brought a pan from our room down and brought food back to eat. The breakfast included cold-cuts -- which was strange. We just assumed they provided it for us to use for packing a picnic lunch. Only one compliant. They were doing some landscaping and seemed like "natural" fertilizer was used. But the smell just lasted for a couple of hours and didn't bother us unless we were outside.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful little place right behind the strip”
Reviews.Author: jacquelinewright67
Reviews.Content: What a pleasant surprise! This place is right behind the Tripicanna which (coincidentally) was where our good friends were staying. Easy access to everything! Pretty one beadroom condo, great free breakfast and happy hour. We couldn't have been happier.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to stay in Las Vegas - close to everything but quiet.”
Reviews.Author: ropes22
Reviews.Content: I loved The Desert Rose Resort. The motel is located one block from the MGM Grand on a quiet side street. It is clean, quiet, friendly, and safe. A full kitchen is provided plus a living room and spacious bathroom. It's nice if you like to make some of your own meals and get away from all of the hustle and bustle once in awhile. Also, it has very convenient parking and is easy traveling to and from the airport. It's perfect for a single traveler or a family.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: arch96
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last week, gret place,can't fault it one bit. The place was clean had everything we needed.Good sized rooms.There is a small shop at the side of reception for sweets/microwave meals/crisps/drinks/ice cream etc.We didnt have a problem with the breakfast crowd,we were down at 7ish and always got a table.We were able to take some food back to the room for the late risers in our party.Location was fine a short walk from MGM and the monorail.We felt safe at night walking back to the room,we were in Block 3,at the back.Some of the casino/hotels are huge and difficult to find your way out of when you get off the monorail.It took us ages to find the exit ,when we got off at The Flamingo.We are going back to Vegas in October for a girlie weekend and will book the Desert Rose.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Gwen1976
Reviews.Content: I was traveling over Spring break with my 14 year old daughter and my 81 year old mother. I am a regular "user" of Trip Adviser and it has never steered me wrong but I hadn't been to Las Vegas in 12 years so I wasn't clear on the location. Everything about The Desert Rose exceeded my expectations. The rooms were fabulously clean, spacious and comfortable. We were in 3322 which overlooked the parking lot facing the Luxor so we could see it out our window. It was very quiet, 2 bedroom suite with the 1 king, 1 queen and a sofa sleeper which we didn't use. The housekeeping staff was terrific, the front desk perfectly polite and helpful and it suited all of our needs. My mother is an early riser so she went down early for the breakfast and brought it back to us so my teenager could sleep in. She said it was a madhouse but the other guests were super friendly and she met so many nice people We were there for a couple of the happy hours and although we don't drink alcohol, there were other drinks and nice food. We spent a lot of time at the pool and the chairs are so comfortable but you do have to jockey for them. Again, so many many nice people and most had stayed there before and wouldn't stay anywhere else. We are already planning on our trip for next year and we will stay there and request the same room!! Thanks for this wonderful tool!

Reviews.Title: “amazing”
Reviews.Author: kjamie
Reviews.Content: I resently had the opportunity to stay at the desert rose resort in las vegas, I had booked online and was not sure what to expect when we arrived in Vegas. On our arrival we were greeted by the most overly friendly staff, the accomidations where extremely clean and upto date, I was amazed, and truely excited to have found such a great place to stay. Desert Rose made our stay in las vegas ""AMAZING"""". Thank You Desert Rose.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Trena-Gillette
Reviews.Content: We went to Vegas for our family vacation and stayed at the Desert Rose. The first night we stayed at the Excalibur, and then the Desert Rose for a week. What a great hotel much nicer than the Excalibur. When we got there everyone is really nice. There was a nasty lady checking in before me, she was beyond rude, she was incredibly hateful and condescending when the front desk help was overly helpful and very nice and kind. The way they handled her with a smile was impressive. Along with everyone else, everyone was nice, said hello, and had a smile it was pleasant! The room was spacious and clean. We had 2 bedrooms, one was a king bed and the other was a queen. The beds had lots of pillows, and extra for the sofa sleeper. The beds were comfortable. The master bedroom had a full bathroom with a tub, the other bath was a 3/4 bath with a huge shower. The bathrooms had shampoo, conditioner, bar soap, each had a hair drier and there was even extra towels enough for our whole family. The kitchen is always a great additon to our travels. It was a full kitchen with a full sized fridge and freezer, there was a dishwasher they provide dishwasher detergent, full size oven and stove top, full sized sunken sink and they provide dish soap, also plenty of dishes, bowls, cups, wine glasses, can openers, and pots and pans, and utinsils. There was also a small balcony with couple of chairs and small table a nice place to drink coffee in the morning. We did go down during breakfast what caios! The people putting the food out where very busy, and did a good job considering it was like a mad house. However, there were a lot of people I didn't see anyone standing in a long line waiting (like at a lot of places we have eaten continental breakfast), we were down there at all different times from 6 to 9:30. There was a good variety of cereals, bagels, bread, fruit, usually a danish or muffins, hard boiled eggs, cheese, an either turkey or ham. There was coffee, juice, soda and tea. We did go down and took our breakfast back to our room (more relaxing). It was nice not to have to worry about breakfast. The hotel even had free internet if you brought your lap top, wahoo!!! The hotel is right next to Hooters and close to MGM. Public transportation is right outside the hotel to pick up the 116. This is definately a place we will stay again if we go back to Vegas. I would recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient”
Reviews.Author: OCfamily-9
Reviews.Content: First Time at the Desert Rose. Had a 2 Bedroom/2 Bath suite. Very nice. Worked out great for us. Comfortable. Was afraid the Airport noise would bother us but it didn't. Our windows faced the street Koval which can be busy. The noise was noticable. I would ask for a room that looks out the parking lot next time. Easy to go the back streets to the other hotels instead of using the congested Las Vegas Blvd. Unfortunately some of the back streets were congested due to construction. But most of the time it was better than the strip. Did not use the free breakfast or happy hour. Would recommend this hotel hightly and will probably use it again. Excellent Price for the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great room set-up for families”
Reviews.Author: Rexcat
Reviews.Content: Excellent large 2 bedroom suite, good location, quiet. An easy walk to MGM, NY/NY, Mandalay. Only gripe was the free breakfast area was terribly crowded, like eating in a train station. Overall, this is not a fancy place but it was clean, the personnel were friendly, and for a family it was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “You can't go wrong at the Rose”
Reviews.Author: Deezer25
Reviews.Content: The Desert Rose is the perfect place to stay in Vegas because it is so un-Vegas. Instead of paying $250 a night and being herded through check-in like cattle, you'll pay a fraction and will be treated as an individual. Instead of having to stumble through the casino first thing in the morning to fork over $5 for a Starbucks coffee, you'll have AN ENTIRE KITCHEN, complete with full-sized refrigerator, coffee maker, range, microwave, toaster, and even a blender available to you. Instead of your group of four being forced to pony up for two overpriced rooms or a suite that costs as much as your mortgage payment, you can stay comfortably in one two-bedroom, two-bathroom Desert Rose apartment. Three of us stayed at the Rose in March for the first two rounds of the NCAA basketball tournament. We stayed there last year, but this year was even better because we got a better deal and a room with a better view. I called ahead and asked that we be accommodated on the top floor, and when we checked in, I spoke with the person who entered that request in the computer. That's service you won't find across the street at the huge MGM Grand. And don't put too much stock in the reviews saying how much walking there is. It's a five-minute walk to MGM, ten minutes to Mandalay, and maybe ten to NY-NY. Plus, Hooter's is right next door. The Desert Rose is extremely convenient, and most people walk up and down The Strip all day anyway. If you don't want to walk, head next door to MGM and catch the Monorail, or walk the block to the Deuce (bus) stop. The Desert Rose is a quiet respite from overdone Vegas, yet it's so close to all the action. You don't have to walk through all the slot noise just to get to your room after a long night of fun, and you're not assaulted by bright lights and ridiculous props. Plus, it's probably half the price and three times the value of any other Vegas property. The three stayed comfortably (one in each bedroom and one on the sofa bed) for four nights for the same price that we could have booked a big-property room for two nights. And because we had the full kitchen, we stopped at the store for "provisions." We loaded the fridge with our own beer, milk, and OJ, and even bought and ate a frozen pizza one day. Where else could you save money by doing that? And here's the best tip: When coming from the airport, tell the cabbie to take Swenson to Tropicana. You'll need to turn left to go to the Rose, but if you turn right, you'll hit a Von's (Safeway brand) grocery store in about a mile. Load up with everything you need while the cabbie waits, and you won't go wanting your entire Vegas stay. You'll also save a ton of dough because you'll spend the same amount for a 12 pack at the store that you'll pay for two beers at any bar. The staff was superfriendly and accommodating, and we had everything we needed. The two-bedroom, two-bathroom apartments are great for large groups of friends or families; by staying here you can save your money for all the Vegas fun. We'll stay at the Rose for any future trips, and I encourage anyone to give this property a shot.

Reviews.Title: “Your next home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: bccc9914
Reviews.Content: Located just a block off the "strip" this Hotel/Suites has everything available you could ever need. Quality, Cleanliness and Service impeccable, Every evening complimentary wine with appetizers to meet other guests and in the morning a full continental breakfast. All included for the one price. A well stocked kitchen and luxurious towels and bedding. Definitely a home away from home. Check it out, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, convenient if you don't mind some walking”
Reviews.Author: William D
Reviews.Content: The Desert Rose is a block and a half from the South Strip at Tropicana Ave. As an Easterner, I wasn't as prepared as I thought I was for how LONG blocks are out there, but hey, we didn't need to visit the gym! The room and the people were excellent, and my concerns about how close the hotel is to the airport turned out to be unfounded. Another review has commented on people wiping out the continental breakfast to hoard food. The hotel's response to that has been to only provide tiny plates (5 inch) at the buffet (this from them in reply to my one and only complaint..) All that being said, this is not a place to go for glitz and glamor, but if you want a nice, clean, one bedroom apartment a close walk to the the strip for an astonishingly good price with excellent service, this is for you. I'd have to find a preposterously good deal somewhere else to not stay at Desert Rose if we go there again. One note - the MGM Grand is just across Tropicana, and if you want to use the Monorail's southern terminus (I recommend it for getting up and down the Strip, especially at night) you HAVE to access it through the Grand - it LOOKS like you can get to the monorail down the south side of the hotel, but pedestrians are not allowed and those are emergency exits that look like accesses.

Reviews.Title: “Great Accommodation Except for View”
Reviews.Author: jlinvill4
Reviews.Content: This hotel is part of a time share property so it caters to its members but treats rental guests very well. I stayed in a 1 bedroom suite with a full kitchen. The unit was spacious, clean, and very convenient. Dishes were nice and a full refrigerator. The only problem was that my unit had a terrible view. The living area view was to the roof and air conditioner and the bedroom view was to the roof. There was some garbage up there so it was best if I kept the drapes closed. Since this is only one block from the strip, I did not spend much time in the room except in the evening so the view aspect was not important. If you are renting, be sure to ask for a room that does not look out to the roof.

Reviews.Title: “A Quiet get away close to the action !”
Reviews.Author: Freddie37
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Desert Rose on two occasions and each time it was a wonderful experience. The rooms are spacious and very comfortable . The staff are friendly and efficient. The "happy hour " is a nice extra and the breakfast is outstanding.! If you are looking for the excitement of VEGAS but the quiet and peacefulness of a suite...this is the place. The Hot spots are only steps away. Thank you for a nice comfortable place to relax!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, staff and value”
Reviews.Author: matrix04
Reviews.Content: We have been to Vegas quite a few times in the last few years, and had never stayed at Desert Rose before. We would definitely stay there again, as the service was great, the location was great, and we liked getting away from the hustle of the casinos (Very quiet at night). This would be an ideal spot to stay if you were driving, but we used the bus (Deuce/Cat) extensively , as it is very easy to get around from this complex. Continental breakfast and mgr.'s reception were very nice. Most rooms do not have much of a view, but we were not in ours much. The only thing we found a little odd, was in our one bedroom suite, you had to get to the bathroom through the bedroom. Very clean, and a very friendly staff. The rate we paid, for what we got, was fantastic compared to most on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Improved”
Reviews.Author: ramonabare
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a year ago, while construction was under way - much complaining on my part at the time - We decided to try again and as mentioned the accomidations were great - customer service from front desk - consistently great. We love to drop in on the strip, but enjoy time by the pool and a quieter atmosphere. Breakfast is a great benefit to the stay - and the staff nearly run to keep items stocked on buffet. We will return again and I appreciate the companys effort to listen and improve its service.

Reviews.Title: “absolulely brilliant best holiday so far”
Reviews.Author: jenjohn077
Reviews.Content: had a 2 week stay at the desert rose, had an absolutely brilliant time. the apartment was very spacious. very clean and very comfortable the bed was so big and comfortable we slept like babies every night. i read on this site that it could be noisy which worried me because im a light sleeper but we never heard anything. the staff were all very polite, especially mia and kim at the concierge desk, they arranged every trip and taxi for us throughout our entire stay, any question we asked if they didnt know the answer they would find ouy and let us know. i would recommend this hotel to anyone, clean, nice staff and just far enough off the strip to be a calm and relaxing haven away from the crowds. we met some nice people at the nightly managers reception. we went to breakfast about 7.30 each morning and had no problems getting a seat and even if we had we could have took it to our room. the security was also very good with each of the blocks gated so you needed your room key to get in. first rate holiday couldn't praise it enough. a great big thanks to all the staff for giving us a brilliant worry free holiday

Reviews.Title: “Great value, met expectations!”
Reviews.Author: dolphinfan4444
Reviews.Content: My husband & I have been to Vegas before and stayed in a high priced hotel/casino on the strip. After this trip, we won't do that again! We kept saying how we would stay at the Desert Rose Resort again! Location was pretty good, close enough to walk to the strip if wearing comfortable shoes. The breakfast was repetitive all week, but it was free! We had to have each of our card keys reprogrammed through out the week, but they were quickly fixed. This was a great place! We traveled as a family with a 2 year old little boy and it was great to have a place for him to take a nap in a separate room. The kitchen was perfect and well equipped to fix simple meals throughout the week. Wireless internet access was a plus as well. The rate we had was great, but I booked early then rebooked when the price dropped later.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: swordspirit
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed our stay at the Desert Rose Resort. The people are very nice. The place was very clean and quiet. I would definitely stay here again. I am very picky about where I stay. And this resort was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, out of the way of the crowd”
Reviews.Author: RickJayhawkland
Reviews.Content: Great location, this was the second trip to this resort for NCAA Tourney. We had a good time. Actually this place was much improved from the last year as the remodeling was mostly done.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: rgsiii
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Desert Rose Resort for five nights. I found the staff to be very helpful and friendly. The rooms were large, clean, quiet and comfortable. The kitchen area was nice with what seemed to be adequate utensils--I did not cook. The breakfast provided was nothing special--sort of a typical on for hotels. The location is close to the MGM and Hooters. It is about a 25 minute walk to the area around the Flamingo/Caesars/Ballagio. Taxis are readily availble and are about $8-10 to the above spots. I was in Las Vegas for a meeting and used its location to allow me to get a little exercise. If you want to be in a bustling casino atmosphere, this is not the pace. For me, considering the reasonable pricing, it was near perfect.

Reviews.Title: “a pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: riverman12
Reviews.Content: Large clean room, comfortable beds with everything you need. Friendly Staff that were willing to help with any needs. Excellent free continental breakfast. Clean and well groomed hotel grounds.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Decent”
Reviews.Author: ckron79
Reviews.Content: The condo-setup was very nice - kitchen seemed very new and up-to-date. Comfortable size for two people - we managed 4 with the pullout couch. We did find a stained blanket which had a tint of red to it... this damped our experience at the Desert Rose. Location was good - NOT on the strip which we liked, but still easily accessible. Too cold yet to use the pool, but looked like a nice place to hang out. Continental breakfast was very nice!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home, comfort.”
Reviews.Author: Eddieko
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Desert Rose several times, and we have enjoyed ourselves on each visit, because of the comfort and the excellent location of the resort. A short distance from quality casinos, such as: MGM Grand, Hooters, Tropicana, and public transportation which includes the "Deuce", and the monorail which stops at the casinos on the strip. The staff provides excellent service, and there is a continental (plus) breakfast each morning.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: lasrn87
Reviews.Content: I had a recent stay at the Desert Rose Hotel in Las Vegas. I must say I was unsure as to what I was going to get for a mere $79.00 a night, but I was really pleased when I arrived there. We from the beginning were given great service upon checkin. Our room was extremely clean and had a living room, dining area, and fully equipped kitchen (if one opted to cook...not me). There is an outside pool and jacuzzi area that unfourtunatly was being updated when we were there, but it was too cold to swim this time of year anyway. Every morning a breakfast was set out in the lobby area that included Starbucks coffee, unlimited, all day long. In the evening they set out wine, beer , snacks and played music as well. The entire environment was well kept, clean, and plenty of flowers surrounding the area. There is a gym near the lobby that was equipped with up to date machines and kept very clean. We were very close to all of the casino's and the strip of vegas. The concierge was knowledgeable and helpful at all times. I would highly recommend staying at the Desert Rose!

Reviews.Title: “Unknown Surprise and value”
Reviews.Author: 95thunderdogg
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel by accident on hotwire and I was super amazed but the locationand value. It was close enough to the strip to see everything, but far enough away not to hear the noise. The fully equipped kitchen was amazing and such a great convenience. I could not have asked for a better place to stay on such short notice.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hideaway near the strip”
Reviews.Author: DavevalUk
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at many places in Vegas and this is definately the best, large clean suite, no hustle and bustle like the big strip hotels. Not the cheapest place to stay in Vegas but worth every penny, will certainly be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Desert Rose Resort!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingRN
Reviews.Content: Of the many places I have stayed I have to say this is one of the best! The one bedroom room we stayed in was great. Comfy bed, nice decor & furniture in the living and dining areas. The kitchen was well equipped with a good coffee maker and a full size refrigerator. Having two TVs was nice traveling with my teen. He loved the stereo system in the living area. The bathroom was good because the vanity was separate from the toilet and shower. The balcony was nice to have for fresh air. I will definitely be going back when I stay in Vegas because of the great little extras they offer for free like WiFi, breakfast, a fitness room, complementary beverages, and Happy Hour on the weekdays. After staying here, we stayed at a large, well-known strip hotel. We all wished we had just stayed at the Desert Rose for the entire vacation because the other hotel didn't offer any free extras and actually charged us more for many things that should be standard. Thanks, Desert Rose, for offering Vegas hospitality! The only downside was that their pool was closed for maintenance. While it is being maintained they refer you to the pool at Hooters Hotel/Casino. This hotel location is in the middle of the airport and the strip (Las Vegas Boulevard, South). You can hear the airplanes going by very well at all hours. The location is good and seemed safe although I would have felt more secure in a room on an upper level. It was a very quick drive or about a 7-10 minute walk to Excalibur, Tropicana, New York New York, and MGM. The front desk will call for a cab for you which gets there in about 5 minutes, or else you can just use that time to walk to Hooters next door where taxis are waiting. Happy traveling!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Accomodation - Amazing Value!”
Reviews.Author: MOMSBIGTUB
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Desert Rose Resort for 2 nights - 1st and 10th (last) night of our South Cal. road trip. On each visit we found the staff to be welcoming and very helpful - Our accommodation was a spacious, comfortable, nicely decorated full 1 bedroom suite - included separate kitchen/bedroom/dining and sitting/sleeping areas. We loved the hotel location because it was quietly tucked away - yet walking distance from the strip. Added bonus was that it was a non-gambling facility so we did not have to stumble through a maze of smokey slots on the way in and out of the hotel. We pre-paid so were able to take advantage of a super rate which certainly took the sting out of our very weak Canadian dollar.

Reviews.Title: “The Desert Rose staff was extremely helpful and the hotel was very clean.”
Reviews.Author: Monique98
Reviews.Content: The resort is very centrically located yet the area is quiet. It is one block behind the Tropicana and two blocks from the MGM. We had a 2 bedroom and 2 bath room with a full kitchen. The sofa is a pull out. The room was very clean and the staff very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A great deal and a great location for our family”
Reviews.Author: WeatherlyDr
Reviews.Content: We needed one night in Vegas on our trip and we wanted it to be a good one - for our family and our budget. The Desert Rose was right off the strip but - as much as possible in Las Vegas - it was quiet. The suite we had was comfortable/spacious and terrific price for the six of us. I have to also say that I really liked NOT staying at a casino or theme park that happens to have some bedrooms attached.

Reviews.Title: “A very good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: bcwolfe
Reviews.Content: We stayed in block 1 on the 3rd floor (above the courtyard) between 4th and 11 March, and found this location ideal for what we wanted. Our one bedroom suite was spacious, clean and suitable for our requirements. The staff were friendly and the concierge was helpful in organising a couple of trips for us - I'd recommend speaking to the concierge before you book any tours, as she was able to find very reasonable deals. The hotel was located just a 10 minute walk off the strip and to the monrail (via the MGM), which again was ideal for travelling up and down the strip. We would definitely recommend this hotel to both friends and family, and if we came back to Vegas, for a third time, we would probably stay here. Overall, a very good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Treasure”
Reviews.Author: MapleDr
Reviews.Content: Stayed Mon, Tues and Wed, 3-23 to 3-26, great room! Very easy check in and room was just great. We stayed in a two bedroom suite and it was perfect for two couples. The room was very clean and beds were very comfortable. We stayed on the second floor in the rear of the hotel and was very quiet, except for small amount of noise from the swimming pool repair crew, but nothing to complain about. Pool work was done on last day of stay. Continental breakfast was nice and the afternoon "Managers Reception" was great, even had entertainment. This was our second stay and will stay again. We passed the name on to many people we talked to on our trip. Thanks Deset Rose

Reviews.Title: “This place is incredible!”
Reviews.Author: tamcat_az
Reviews.Content: The Desert Rose Resort is a wonderful place to stay. As you may know, Las Vegas can be insane, crowded and loud. The Desert Rose Resort is jut a few steps away from the strip and yet it feels like a different world. Quiet, peaceful, safe! The room was exceptionally clean and the bed was so comfortable I wanted to take it home with me. After a long day walking on the strip I returned to my room to find a message waiting for me. It was the front desk staff informing me that I had left my GPS visible in my car. It was nice to know someone was watching out for me. I would highly recommend this resort to anyone who visits Las Vegas. You can't get a better deal anywhere!

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as expected”
Reviews.Author: GmanIowa
Reviews.Content: We had a two bedroom for our family stay in Las Vegas. The rooms were decent, we were pleased to have a kitchen and two bathrooms. I liked the location. Those are the good things. Now the bad: The pool and hot tub were closed the last 2 days of our stay there. When we first reserved the room, we were told the pool would be open for our entire stay. We had NO hot water the last 2 days as well. Everyone had to take freezing cold showers. A lot of noise too. You could hear pretty much everything through the windows and walls. We were woken up early every morning by the sound of garbage trucks. Unacceptable to me. I won't be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “No better place to stay 1 street back from the strip next to MGM. Rooms are excellent”
Reviews.Author: DavidStanley73
Reviews.Content: The only hotel we will stay at now we've tried for the 2nd time, great suites, buffet breakfast & a great happy hour with wine beer & tapas. roll on our next holiday

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: marykino
Reviews.Content: This location was just about perfect. Close enough to some of the attractions to walk. And very close the the Duece (bus that travels up and down the strip) so I could visit the other locations. The condo was in excellent shape, very clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!!!”
Reviews.Author: golf_hockeyaddict
Reviews.Content: Now I have been to a few hotels in Vegas (MGM, Planet Hollywood, Treasure Island) and this place is a great place for a really good price and not too far from the strip. It is right next to Hooters. During the week there is happy hour (free beer, wine, snacks). During weekdays and weekends, you get free breakfast. All day there is free coffee and soda. You get a nice place to relax, resort style. Bring food with you and you can utilize the appliances provided to you (refrigerator, toaster, dishes/cups/utensils, dishwasher). Free internet (not like other hotels) and a nice size pool. With this type of place, you get a little bit of home and when you leave you are out for fun. I highly recommend. I don't think I would go anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Better than a Strip Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Lullybird
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay with a roomy one bedroom and very comfortable furniture and great mattress. Super continental breakfast each morning and all the free Starbucks coffee you can drink 24 hours a day. Each weekday evening snacks and wine are served in the main lobby. We just took the food back to our room to eat. 5 minute walk to Tropicana Hotel. Just two disappointments - the carpet sorely needed cleaning in our one bedroom suite (didn't even want to look under the bed as dust bunnies in every carpeted corner - mentioned to front desk, but the place never saw a vaccuum in the corners for the 8 days we were there. Also they closed the pool for our entire second week for a scheduled maintenance check. I had specifically phoned directly to Desert Rose before booking our 2 week vacation to ask about the pool facilitites and was not informed of the closure. We had to waste a day of our vacation trying to locate other accommodation in the area and then waste another morning transferring to the new place. It was 85 above for the entire second week so was really important to us to have the pool open. Desert Rose's attitude was 'oh well'.

Reviews.Title: “Clean comfortable accommodation short walk to the strip”
Reviews.Author: Vivagold
Reviews.Content: Nice resort accommodation which is a short walk to the strip. Clean & comfortable with a complimentary happy hour and breakfast included.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and easy for families”
Reviews.Author: alli09
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Vegas and I must say this place was a great find. Although after much walking I sometimes wished I were in a hotel on the strip, this hotel really was not that far away. I took two kids and had a one-bedroom. The full kitchen, fridge, stove, oven, fridge and microwave was so nice. We did not feel cramped and the kids snacked when they wanted. The only real drawback was the pool closed on the 16th and we still had three days. We were able to access the pool at Hooters next door, but that was a little awkward with the children - lots of parties. Overall, I would certainly stay there again. the staff were great.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Experience.”
Reviews.Author: busymomOregon
Reviews.Content: After spending two days at the strat. before moving too the Desert Rose I can't say enough about this resort. Vegas is expensive with a family, so having a kitchen was a life saver. My family loved it there. It was clean, the staff were very friendly and the location was great. It is not far to walk to the MGM for the monorail. We did not have a car so this is how we got around. The pool was a little cold but even for my two boys who love to swim they did not care. They were so happy at the Desert Rose and having the extra room was great. We will never stay anywhere else if we go back to Vegas. A super place too stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice resort”
Reviews.Author: GreatTravel42
Reviews.Content: We were extremely pleased with this resort and wish we could have spent our entire time in Vegas there. Unfortunately it was not available the first part of our stay and we were deeply disappointed in the RCI resort we stayed in the first two nights. Despite being closer to the airport, your resort was much quieter and in a convenient location. This was one of the nicer RCI resorts we have stayed at and we will be recommending it to other RCI members in our future travels. Thank you so much =)=)=)

Reviews.Title: “A great”
Reviews.Author: jd2az
Reviews.Content: No casino, very quiet, nice pool and spa, great staff, a decent breakfast layout and a beautiful suite - actually 2 rooms, not what some call a suite. Yet within walking distance to the Strip at Tropicana (MGM; Excalibur; New York, New York; etc.) Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and quiet with adequate parking”
Reviews.Author: oldtimer07
Reviews.Content: Clean and the location was convienient to the strip, but far enough away to avoid noise and crowds. Nice pool and hot tub. Parking is free and very accessable.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressive”
Reviews.Author: nstarno
Reviews.Content: I loved it here. I had a one-bedroom suite. I was made to feel welcome and comfy. I only wish I had spent more time there. I was having so much fun on the strip, I neglected the leisure time at the resort. The staff was incredible. I have never seen a better organized continental breakfast. I did not have a car, so it was very convenient to the airport and the Strip. I was able to walk to the MGM and get the monorail from there. I will definitely return here whenever I am in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great value”
Reviews.Author: CanuckGal84
Reviews.Content: Overall my 3-night weekend stay here was great. The staff was very friendly and courteous, and for the $52/night Hotwire rate, it was a really great deal. (Mind you I would probably feel a bit ripped off if I had paid the $120 others have quoted.) The room was always clean, housekeeping even came while I was out in the late afternoon/evening after having the "Do Not Disturb" sign up until about 2pm! The kitchen was well equipped. The breakfast was great for a basic continental. The facility overall (pool, gardens, lobby etc) was very well maintained. The only complaints I have: -More strawberry jam!!! Every morning when I went to breakfast they were out of strawberry jam by the time I got there. -Housekeeping staff should keep it down in the morning!!! Our bedroom window faced the courtyard. I like to sleep with the window open. The housekeeping staff assemble in the morning, organize their carts and chat in the outside hallway along the courtyard. For 9am in Vegas I found them pretty loud. They didn't wake me up but they did prevent me from falling asleep on more than one occasion.

Reviews.Title: “excellent 5-day stay”
Reviews.Author: freqtravmuc
Reviews.Content: I did thorough research on the tripadvisor before deciding for the desert rose resort and I was lucky that I did! Very short trip from the airport ( I knew the exact way - so the taxi driver had no chance to do a "sightseeing trip" - which he tried!). Check in-and out were smooth, without any problems. I requested a high and quiet room ( as always) and received one. The room was absolutely clean every day. We were 3 people, had enough space (and enough towels, without requesting them!). I was attending a convention at the Venetion Hotel, which could be easily accessed by using the monorail (stops by the close MGM hotel). I especially appreciated the free breakfast and the free WLAN and also tha afternoon reception. No doubt I would book the Desert Rose again if I come back to LV.

Reviews.Title: “The Staff went above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: KHDCC
Reviews.Content: They were wonderful. The manager made a call that saved one of my coworkers a whole bunch of headaches. They were able to make decisions for themselves without delay. On top of making the right decision, they made the decision that took into account the person, not the business policy. (we had not listed a coworker on the sign in, and they of course were the first to arrive. Most places would not listen to reason, the staff at the Desert Rose did). I will be back and whole heartily recommend the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: ChuckLu
Reviews.Content: It is not flashy and not on the strip (though 5 minutes walk from the MGM), and with no restaurant etc on location, so if you are after a “Las Vegas Experience” this hotel isn’t for you, BUT it is clean, has nice and big rooms (suites), no noisy casino in the lobby, and nice complimentary breakfast all for a very reasonable price. Great value for the right traveler .

Reviews.Title: “very pleased with hotel”
Reviews.Author: festertruck
Reviews.Content: was pleasantly surprised by this hotel. great deal for 2 bedroom suite with a kitchen. short walk to the strip. will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A Real Gem Among All That Glitter”
Reviews.Author: pipepea
Reviews.Content: The Desert Rose offer one or two bedroom suites. I stayed in a spacious one bedroom suite with a full kitchen and living area. The bath and kitchen were beautifully updated with granite counters and newer appliances. The bedroom and living areas were nicely decorated. The resort has a large area off the lobby where a free continental breakfast is served daily. From five to seven in the evening there is a cocktail time.which is also free to guest. Wine, soft drinks, and hors d'oeuvres are served during this time. Some evening have entertainment. This provided a time to relax and mingle with the other guests. The best thing about the Desert Rose is its location. It is within walking distance from many of the major hotel casinos, The Strip, and local transportation. One can stay there without a car and not miss a thing.

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back”
Reviews.Author: tex_guy_cal
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff was vey helpful as well as the staff in general. I was quite impressed to be asked every day how I was enjoying my stay and what else could be done for me. The suite that I had was very clean, roomy and nice. The location is very convenient to the strip and just a short walk to casino & nightlife next door. Staying on business it was sure nice have a light complimentary breakfast in the morning and to unwind at the end of the day with the complimentary happy hour. The pool is also quite nice for relaxing in the afternoon. The most enjoyable aspect is to have a kitchen so that I could bring in my own groceries for dinner and evening ice cream. Tell us how you liked the room Talk about the location & amenities Say what you liked best & least

Reviews.Title: “Could not have asked for better”
Reviews.Author: bbatNL
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week in Vegas with wife and friends. We were all extremely pleased with the Desert Rose Resort. From a great room, to free daily breakfast and evening receptions, to excellent service from the front desk and cleaning staff - we could not have asked for more. Located within walking distance of the strip (close to Hooters, Tropicana, MGM, Luxor) but far enough away to be a nice, quiet oasis at the end of each day/night. Will not hesitate to book again on our next trip to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value and soooo close to the strip!!!”
Reviews.Author: doriesmith
Reviews.Content: We stay at this property twice a year. It is a non-gaming hotel just south of Hooters Hotel and Casino and convenient to drive to as it's right off of Tropicana Avenue. Since it's on the south end of the strip you avoid most of the traffic as well. The resort's parking lot is adjacent to the Hooter's property. The grounds are very well maintained, the staff is friendly and professional and the rooms are large and comfortable. From this resort you can walk to many of the casinos. The MGM Grand is across the street from Hooters and next door to the Tropicana. From either the Tropicana or the MGM you can walk across Las Vegas Blvd (the strip) to New York New York, Excaliber, the Luxor or Mandalay Bay. When it's super hot or bad weather, you can drive across the street to the parking garage of the MGM (free and a very very short drive) and can catch the Las Vegas Monorail (currently $12 a day or $24 for three days) to visit ride as far north as the Sahara. You can exit the Monorail at Harrahs and catch a free shuttle to the Rio as well. I would never stay at any other resort. I love that it is so convenient to get to and so close to the action but yet quiet with the feeling of seclusion. There is a nice pool and fitness center and a good continental breakfast served in the morning. There is also a manager's reception in the evenings where beer, wine and snacks are served. Also, since you have a full kitchen in your room you can take Tropicana east about two miles to a Vons if you need groceries or snacks. I think this is an excellent value in Vegas. I would rather spend my money on food, beverages, shows and gambling than to pay for a more expensive room in one of the large casinos. Your room at this property will rival or exceed what you will receive for more money somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: cory1969
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, friendly staff, clean rooms, home away from home

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: LMS101
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Desert Rose for 6 nights. The room was very nice and extremely clean. The kitchen is well supplied and made cooking very easy. Even dish soap and paper towels are included !! The beds are very comfortable. Hotel is very quite. Breakfast is included with the room and offers something for everyone. The hotel is very close to the strip. About a 7 minute walk. Great hotel for the price! Would definitely stay here again !!

Reviews.Title: “Great rates & room--So so location”
Reviews.Author: runtom
Reviews.Content: We chose the non refundable rate and paid an average of $86 per night before tax (Monday through Thursday) for a one bedroom. The unit was comfortably large, but the bathroom could only be entered through the bedroom. The carpet was unattractive and not very comfortable. The full kitchen included stove, full sized refrigerator, microwave, dishwasher, plates, silverware, pots & pans, butcher knives, coffee pot, blender, mixer, paper towels & even dish detergent. The property is located 1/2 mile east of The Strip in the South section near MGM, Tropicana, NYNY, and Excalibur. We did a lot of walking and visited many hotels & casinos.
