Our favorites were Bellagio, Mandalay Bay, Caesars and Mirage. If you plan to spend much time in the Mid or North Strip, you might consider another location. Wynn is at least 3 miles north of the Desert Rose. The staff was personable and professional & the time share representatives did not pester us. The Strip was another story--It seemed we were constantly harassed by sales people promoting time shares or “Girls to your room in 20 minutes.”

Reviews.Title: “Vegas Oasis”
Reviews.Author: Sparkatude
Reviews.Content: The Desert Rose Resort was a pleasant surprise. I found the hotel here on tripadvisor and trusted the reviews and I am glad I did. The rooms were clean and spacious, the facility was nice and the staff friendly and helpful. We had a one bedroom suite which had a living room, dining area and full kitchen. After seeing the dining prices in Vegas I recommend using that full kitchen.... The hotel is located off the strip behind the Hooters and across the street from The MGM so you will need to walk a little but it for us it was pleasant to get away from the energy of the casinos and have a little oasis to relax after a day at the convention. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great place off the strip”
Reviews.Author: sunman110
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for business travelers and families. Only 2 blocks from the strip. Rooms are large, very comfortable beds with great pillows. Kitchen is well stocked with all the utensils to cook any meal and bbq grills outside. The staff was very helpful. The rooms and grounds were very clean. Nice size pool. I will return very soon..

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, clean, comfortable, may be back”
Reviews.Author: freqtraveller50
Reviews.Content: Hotel was comfortable , clean and staff was fine. until chekcout day. Only issue i had which hurt my rating was on checkout day after a 4 night stay I asked to get a late checkout at 2 pm. The lady i spoke to wa snot friendly and sais that if we stayed after 12.30 pm we would be charged. i know th hotel was not full next day so they coul dhave been more thoughful. so next time, not sure:)

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in the glitz”
Reviews.Author: svgg3
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at Desert Rose Resort in the past three months so it now seems familiar and homey to us, a good feeling when one is traveling. We think the breakfasts in the lobby are a great idea with quite a bit of variety available, and find the lattes especially wonderful. The beds are comfortable, the kitchens excellent, and the entire place very clean. The staff are friendly and helpful. We stayed in a ground floor unit this past visit and did find it fairly noisy at times with kids running loose in the hallways and staff talking to one another on their phones, but would still recommend Desert Rose to pretty much anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: patches10
Reviews.Content: This place was just off the strip but right across the street from MGm so you could catch the tram. The rooms were spacious, clean. Great pool. Great hot tub. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Relaxing and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Jimcor4043
Reviews.Content: We had a great time in Las Vegas. We really appreciated the time we spent at the Hotel. It was Relaxing ,Quiet and most of all it was away from the noisy casinos. It has a very nice pool and exercise room.Also we had an excellent breakfast each morning as well as having cocktail hour each evening during the week. The condos are very spacious and decorated very well.We would recommend this hotel to anyone whether they have a family or not going to Las Vegas. The hotel is located very close to the airport and monorail at the MGM Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What A Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: angiekin
Reviews.Content: This Resort was above and beyond what we expected. It was priced perfectly compared to what we normally spend to just get a few beds a small fridge or microwave and one tiny bathroom because its a 4-5 star hotel. Desert Rose Resort was perfect for a family looking for more then one bed and we even had two bathrooms and a full kitchen with everything except for the cook and the food! It is located just a tiny walk away from the MGM and other nice resorts. There is a grocery store less then a mile away if you are looking to saving money on food and doing your own cooking. Plus they have a small grocery store right in the hotel. The only thing that wasn't very good was the continental breakfast. I do not know any child that will eat an onion or poppy seed bagel. Otherwise though, this was an outstanding place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “It's a great deal”
Reviews.Author: Baddahbing
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Desert Rose Resort in Las Vegas. We come to Vegas every year at the same time (for a week) and always stay at a time share. We were very pleased to have tried Desert Rose this year. The rates were great for a 2 br 2 ba. It was a bit small but there were so many other pros that it wasn't a big deal. Staff and housekeeping were friendly and accomodating. Beds comfortable and rooms clean. There was a manager's reception week day evenings (with entertainment and raffles) and a generous extended mini breakfast each morning. (get there BEFORE 9:00) It's behind the Tropicana on that end of the strip. It didn't seem too far from the convention center but took half an hour to get there in the morning because the traffic was is horrible. Nice little patio with each room for the smokers. We would DEFINITELY stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience”
Reviews.Author: FamilyFunAndTravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Desert Rose for two nights with our children ranging in age from infant through 9 years old. The rooms were incredibly spacious and contained every amenity imaginable. I was wary of taking my children to Vegas because of the adult theme of so much that is there. Desert Rose allowed us to be close to the strip without being on it. It provided us a true home away from home with our one-bedroom suite and the girls loved it. I would highly recommend Desert Rose to anyone with families.

Reviews.Title: “Tough One to Review”
Reviews.Author: tampafloridaman
Reviews.Content: This property is hard to review. Because when I go to Las Vegas, I have always stayed at nice hotels. The least nicest was excalibur years ago. Desert Rose Resort, I booked on there website for 59.40 a night! Before I booked I called and lady said 99.00, I advised her website said 59.40 and honored that. This is only my oppinion, But the room reminds me of an old apartment. The couch in the living room was very very outdated and dirty. All the other guests i saw like 90% were pretty scurvy looking. I definately didnt want to walk outside and go to other casinos. That just didnt sound like a great idea. On the positive side the bed was amazingly comfortable. The staff was friendly. Thats why i say its a tough review. Because 60.00 for a very large condo/apartment, with continental breakfeast. If you are poor or hurting for money, This is the absolute best deal. But im not poor and I wouldnt stay at Desert Rose again, sorry. Also one reviewer above wrote walls thin, thats very verty true! at 200am kids came running down hall. woke me up thats how thin walls are. Also room was hard to find and gate to go toyuor room, I saw people constantly letting other guests in. Again if you want a non casino very very large room and are used to outdated feel of a room, this is the best!!

Reviews.Title: “great for families”
Reviews.Author: 3ofusAlabama
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 night stay at the Desert resort. It was perfect for us, We stayed in a 2 bdrm 2 bath room. We always like to have a seperate bedroom for our son and this worked our perfect. 2bathrooms were are plus, kitchen was well stocked with utensils coffee maker etc. Beds were super comfy , pillows and linens clean and lovely. We only asked for housekeeping one day during our stay and that was perfect as well. Breakfast was good, didn't use the reception area as we chose to take ours back to the room. plenty of towels and paper products. The only complaint that We had was our room was next to the laudry delivery truck that came at midnight, but that wasn't enough to ruin our stay here, staff was friendly and accomadating in calling cabs for us and check out although early morning/night (4am) was a breeze. Very secure property, great self laundry, close to everything we needed. would definately stay here again and would recommend to families and anyone looking for a place with space and friendly service. My first stay in Vegas and it was nice not to have to wonder if the hotel was going to be ok once We got there. A++++ Thanks Desert Rose for making a very comfortable stay..

Reviews.Title: “Really surpised”
Reviews.Author: ChrisandPam
Reviews.Content: Quality gated facility of 4 3 rise blocks set around a decent sized pool with hot tub. Well equiped fitness room and immaculatly clean public areas Fully equiped appartments that are well sized with oodles of storage space. Comfortable bed, small balcony, excellent kitchen and generous living area. Bath/shower and vanity unit though small has constant hot water. Well sound insulated and just a stroll to the communal reception area where a continental breakfast is complimentary. Cereals, boiled eggs,cooked meat, loads of fruit,breads,coisants preserves,coffee,tea and juices. Evening happy hour 5-7pm with some basic snacks/dips and free drinks, beer, wine and soft drinks About 250 mtrs from a decent minimarket, and the same to Hooters Hotel for some really cheap meals. 400 mtrs to Tropicana Hotel for outstanding value buffet meals in a restaurant with a view over their pools. 500 mtrs to the strip and access to the Deuce Bus that will take you anywhere on the strip from LV Outlet in the south to the downtown Freemont Experience in the north - this is not to be missed. The Desert Rose at our time of stay, Jan 18/22 was predominantly used by convention goers who were obviously not within the facility during the day. Great! the excellent pool area was the domain of ourselves and 3/4 others. Whilst we appreciate that we stayed at a quiet time, both the reception service and the concierge were of an excellent standard. We had previousy spent 10days in strip hotels and the Desert Rose was exactly what we wanted If we return we would book the whole holiday at the Desert Rose. It is not an all singing, all dancing Las Vegas super themed hotel but within its own category it is superb. Can now see why it is rated so high on Tripadvisor for satisfaction. If you hire a car this is the perfecrt place. Easy road access and parking available outside your block

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: Goggles63
Reviews.Content: The proximity to the Strip (easy walk to MGM, Tropicana, NYNY) and very reasonable pricing made the stay enjoyable. Overall I thought the room was clean and comfortable. Had a kitchenette but didn't really use it. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Complimentary continental breakfast had enough choices to suffice. I would recommend this to someone looking for a reasonable inexpensive option to bigger name hotels - the key is its location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Canadagal
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 nights at the Desert Rose. We arrived late on the first night and were initially given a two bedroom unit that bordered Reno Avenue on two sides - it had an incredible amount of traffic noise. The next morning I went to the front desk bright and early and asked to be moved to a quieter unit. I was promptly and politely given my choice of a courtyard suite, overlooking the pool. This unit was much quieter and brighter than the previous night. The suite was well priced at approx. $100 per night which included a continental breakfast. The breakfast area was well stocked and well staffed so there was always ample food and a clean area. Unfortunately, you could see lots of guests taking advantage of the situation and loading up tons of food to stock their fridges and be used for lunches etc.. Honestly don't know how the Desert Rose can afford to run the breakfast with the amount of food that walks out the door! The pool area was clean and quiet. As it was too chilly to use the unheated pool, we did enjoy the use of the hot tub. The location is a quick 10 minutes walk to the Strip and a welcome oasis from all the activity of the Strip. About the only negative I can say is that some areas look a little tired. The first unit we were given was definitely more worn and used than the second unit. So I guess it could be hit or miss and the quality will vary with the different units. Lots of positives though - polite staff, nice work out area, good breakfast and a great price!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for families in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: dw104
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a one bedroom suite on the third floor (no noise from above) that was clean and well laid out. Though very close to the airport, it was a very quiet location --- no airplane noise, far enough away from Tropicana Blvd. and Las Vegas Blvd. that car noise could not be heard. The location allowed for easy (10-15 minute) walks to the MGM, NYNY, and Tropicana casinos. Having no casino on the property made it very family friendly. The pool was very cold (I'd estimate about 70-75 deg.) ; It would be nice if it was heated to a warmer temperature. We had a few sunny warm days where the kids would have liked to swim. The floorplan had one drawback in that the only bathroom could only be accessed off of the master bedroom. Children sleeping in the pull-out couch had to come through the bedroom to use the facilities. The kitchen was well appointed and modern. There is a safe in each room for valuables. The internet is extra ($10 per day) and beware, though it is wireless, it is only valid on one computer. As we had two laptops this was a bit bothersome as we expected both to be able to access the internet for one $10 fee. This property is formerly a Hawthorne Suites hotel that has been converted to a timeshare. Salespeople used the cocktail reception and other means to lure prospective buyers, however, they were not aggressive and left us alone. The staff, especially the cleaning staff, were very friendly and seemed to be always cleaning and organizing. As a result, the grounds and common areas were very clean and tidy. The morning breakfast was marginal, but about what you'd expect for a free continental breakfast. It gets very crowded towards the end of the breakfast period, so be prepared for lineups and no tables (or get there earlier). We found it to be very a relaxing and pleasant place to stay, and would return if we go back to Las Vegas with children.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in Las Vegas strip area.”
Reviews.Author: Gunshows
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with the room and secure atmosphere at this hotel. The room was large and very well laid out, with an high quality apartment feel. Beds, sofas, chairs all in good condition. Kitchen well supplied, with quality counter tops and appliances. Bathroom very nice, large mirror and vanity top, shower in good condition with lots of water pressure. There were a number of security personnel in the parking lot and walking through out the property, also security gates to the buildings and grounds. The parking lot is chained off at night with only one entrance and exit available, this is a plus as it tightens security. I was not at the hotel very much because of business, but while I was there it was great! Being so close to entertainment of the strip is a plus, I never had to move my vehicle the whole time I was there!

Reviews.Title: “Clean & spacious but thin walls”
Reviews.Author: wazkat
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4-night stay in a one bedroom. The suite had plenty of room for 2 and the kitchen had full-size appliances, even a blender and toaster. Location was within walking distance to the strip. We could park our rental car just feet from our room. Only negative thing was that our unit was on the ground floor and the bed was next to a main hallway and secured door. We were awoken repeatedly first thing in the morning, usually beginning around 6 am, as soon as guests and staff started going in and out of the building. We could also hear the people in the unit above us walking around. Overall I highly recommend this hotel if you want a little more space than a typical one-room hotel room, just be sure to get a room on the top floor!

Reviews.Title: “Great family resort”
Reviews.Author: KiwiGrit
Reviews.Content: This is a great place for a family. No gambling and only a small amount of drinking for the reception. Breakfast was good and the nibbles in the evening were an added bonus. The fitness room was small but adequate and the pool and sauna were popular with our kids. The service was ok, some staff were warmer than others. The extension rates were great! The rooms were good and the bed was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the Family while in LAS”
Reviews.Author: YumaJohn
Reviews.Content: The Desert Rose is owned by Shell Vacations and as an owner I automatically checked them out when booking Las Vegas. I am glad I did. We needed two bedrooms for us, our kids and their kids. It turned out we hosted some of their friends too so it proved a great place to hang out, The hotel was very clean and the staff very friendly and accomodating. They had the normal continental breakfast and also a wine and beer happy hour Sunday thru Thursday. At the happy hour they have a drawing for hotel nights in Hawaii. Guess who is going to go, since I won one of the trips. I wasn't as lucky on the slots unfortunately. We had a 2 bedroom suite which is just like an apartment. The kitchen was more than adequate but a tad small. The suite had two bedrooms with the master bedroom ensuite plus a second bathroom in the hall. There was a nice size living room and dining area as well. Our room was on the ground floor right beside the exit door which for us proved great. Easy for loading and unloading the car etc. It was a bit noisy however because the room patio faced a delivery area. In Las Vegas they deliver stuff at night which can sometimes disturb you. Overall though the suite was pretty quiet, we didn't here much noise from the hallway or door beside our room. We spent 5 nights there and enjoyed it all. Our daughter had her two kids one of which is a toddler so she was able to go out on the patio with supervision which she loved and run around the suite which out hurting anything or herself. Of course housekeeping probably had fun finding remotes and coasters in the cabinet drawers after we left. All in all the property was quite attractive and very convenient to the strip and to the airport also. Just east of Tropicana and south of Hooters. The closest restaurants were in Hooters with a Dan Marino Restaurant and of course the traditional Hooters. I went to Dan Marino and was able to get take out for dinner. I never made it to the Hooters restaurant but then my heart probably couldn't have taken the strain. Also very conventient is the casino in Hooters, Tropicana and MGM Grand with a short additional walk to New York New York and Excalibur and also the monorail. I think this is just about as good a location as you can get and still be off the strip. We will visit again....

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: settlervic
Reviews.Content: The Desert Rose is very well appointed apartments. The bathroom and kitchen have stone benchtops and the kitchen is very well appointed with all the appliances and cutlery you need. It is very well located just off the strip on the south side. It is just behind Hooters and very close to MGM Grand. We drove every day but you can just as easily walk to the MGM Grand. Every morning there is a continental breakfast which is pretty good and from Sun to Thu evenings there are snacks. For us having a kitchen was great as we cooked our dinner every night. All in all this is a very good value for money apartment.

Reviews.Title: “NIce Hotel but needs to improve on clean sheets”
Reviews.Author: Handiworks
Reviews.Content: Good Hotel for the money but the bed sheets had stains on them making it hard to enjoy a good night sleep. When we asked the room service to change them they did but with another set of stained sheets, this time with rips in them. It make me wonder about the rest of their house keeping. Time to by new linen.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean, friendly & convenient”
Reviews.Author: MissyAJones
Reviews.Content: We had 5 in our party; two 40 something parents, two 21 year olds & a 13 month old baby. The grounds are nice (would have been prettier without the snow). Surprisingly they had both hottubs running, and it was fun sitting there with the snow falling. The two bedroom unit was perfect for us. The kitchen was well supplied (we stayed a week & used the nearby grocery store), we had two very nice, very clean bathrooms, a nice living/dinning area, and a great balcony. The location is ideal; It's right between the strip and the airport, and you really can't hear the planes like you can at the north end of the strip. I'm not a huge Vegas fan, but if/when I return, the Desert Rose is where I'd choose to stay. I find the casinos too big & exciting to rest well... this resort was a homey place to spend our nights.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: rjmurphy1
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable rooms. The breakfast and happy hour are also great. Very convenient to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Desert Rose Resort family of five”
Reviews.Author: AusJen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Desert Rose in late September 2008 as part of a trip to the U.S. We have three chidren aged 16, 14 & 11. Our kids loved the extremely plush rooms and the space. Compared to the MGM Grand the space of the room and the appointments were greatly appreciated. Televisions in all rooms, great kitchen and extremely comfortable beds. It is a fair distance from the strip, but we managed to walk almost everywhere ( it is only one big block from the strip) The breakfast is ample, with a good selection and newspapers. There is a gym that no one seems to use but it is well equipped and has TV's and fresh towels. The pool was very popular but be aware that it is one of the heaviest chlorinated pools I have swum in. All the guests were pleasant. A large number were visiting from the U.K and were predominantly older or families. The staff were very helpful. We hope to visit Las Vegas again in 2010 and The Desert Rose Resort will be top of the list. I can see why it is one of the top rated tourist hotels

Reviews.Title: “Nothing More Than a Budget Motel”
Reviews.Author: law_girl_75
Reviews.Content: If you are a serious budget minded traveler, this is the place for you. For a 2 bedroom suite we paid $135 a night, and that did include free breakfast and free cocktail hour drinks. But you have to understand that this place is not a "resort", it's on par with a Super 8 or a Days Inn. It's a motel and nothing more. It's all "motel" style outside entrances, and the rooms are run down. In their defense, we were told that the building we were in has not been updated and the others have, but who knows? Our room was in rough shape - the carpets, the furnishings, etc...just looked worn. The free breakfast was a feeding frenzy of budet travelers looking to stock their in room fridges with enough food for a week. People were actually bringing mixing bowls and pans from their rooms and loading them with food from the buffet. One morning, the man in line in front of my husband cleared out the fruit bowl - including taking probably 6 to 8 bananas - all that were left in the bowl. When my husband asked if he could have just one banana for our two year old son, the man snapped "NO" at him. That was the mentality among the guests - it was this weird, survival like attitude as though these people hadn't eaten for weeks, snatching up everything in their paths. But the worst problem were the ants. The first morning following our check-in the night before we woke up to find ants in the kitchen, crawling out of a crack in the wall and heading to the garbage can. We had not left out food or anything that would have attracted them, and they seemed after something in the garbage. We promptly called the desk only to be told that it was an engineering problem and that engineering wouldn't be in until later. We asked if they could just send up a can of raid, ant traps or at least a new garbage can, and we were told that someone would be up later in the day. No one ever came up, even after multiple phone calls. By the following morning, the ants were worse, and still no one had been up to the room - so we decided to check out. THEN...we got a hassle about checking out early when we had booked four nights. We explained about the ants and told them we had tried to call multiple times, and the person at the desk told us we were required to go directly to the desk and speak with management if we had a complaint, and that we would have to pay for the two nights we weren't staying. After a lot of arguing, we were able to get out of those two nights, but they were extremely unpleasant about it, and not once did we receive an apology for the ant issue. We checked in to the Signature at $89 a night for a junior suite. We should have done so in the first place, but based on the reviews we tried the Desert Rose. We love Signature and in the past have loved TheHotel at Mandalay Bay. All in all, if you are used to staying at nice hotels, do not stay at the Desert Rose - it's barely clean, and you'll be surrounded by people looking for a deal. If you are a Motel 6 type person, looking for a budget place to stay near the Strip, you'll probably be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, friendly staff, good facilities, handy location”
Reviews.Author: QuaestorLondon
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a week at the Desert Rose with my husband, my brother and my father (aged 79). We had a great time and couldn't fault the resort for comfort and value for money. We had two condominums on the third floor and didn't have any noise problems. Apartments were spotlessly clean; kitchens equpped with cooker, microwave dishwaher, toaster and huge fridge. All staff were friendly and helpful. Looking at the huge, multi-storey casino hotels we were glad to be stayng at the low rise Desert Rose - only ten minutes walk from the Strip. Hooters just in front is very handy to find cabs (the quickest option for those journeys too far to walk) and MGM is just over the road. Having breakfast provided was very useful - the area can get crowded but you can always take stuff back to your room if you absolutely can't find a seat. The managers drinks are a good opportunity to make friends and we met some lovely people - shame the wine wasn't better but you can't have everything!. We heard from others that the concierge was very helpful in booking shows although this wasn't something we did. Would definitely stay there again if in Vegas and highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Option to Higher Priced Hotels”
Reviews.Author: CablemanCT
Reviews.Content: Positives: We were in Las Vegas for six days to attend and exhibit at a big electronics trade show. We wanted a spacious condo type setting, at reasonable pricing compared to the big hotels, for three adults to stay together. We had a two bedroom unit with two full bathrooms, fully equipped kitchen, a nice living room area with pull-out couch, a small dining area and three large screen TV's. Everything was in good condition and nicely maintained. Staff was friendly and helpful. Rates were an excellent value compared to hotel rates. Proximity to all hotels, convention activities and restaurants was excellent. Rates included a continental breakfast and full maid service once during our stay. Negatives: Our full maid service never happened. The only housekeeping service we received were daily replacement of towels and washcloths for bathrooms. No other cleaning services or change of bed linens was provided. Area for breakfast was off main lobby and space to eat was very limited and crowded. Food offerings were adequate but skimpy compared to other national chains offering continental breakfasts. Paper plates supplied were barely large enough to fit a piece of bread, necessitating the use of multiple plates for just a few small items to eat. Beverage cups were also small. After 2 or 3 tries at breakfast, we decided to find someplace more "user friendly" for the balance of our stay. Overall - a fairly good experience and a very good value for the size and scope of the accomodations. No housekeeping service, in spite of several calls, was a big negative. Breakfast offerings were a disappointment but not a deal breaker. Would stay there again if we had a definite guarantee for better housekeeping service.

Reviews.Title: “Stomped the night Away”
Reviews.Author: SkiandSnowboarding
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a few days at Desert Rose Resort because our son had a wheelchair rugby tournament at UNLV. The hotel was nice and changed immensely from previous ownership. The location was excellent because it was off the strip but very accessible. The resort itself had problems because it lacked floor sound proofing. If you stay on the 1st floor which must wheelchair accessible rooms are located you have no choice but to hear all the movement that goes on above you. You could hear folks wrestling, stomping and running. I'm one not to complain and am very tolerate. I could only tolerate it up to a point because I paid just like everyone else. I finally asked for help. The service desk told me that they security to the room twice but I continue to hear the noise. No other rooms where available to move into. The 2-bedroom suite was nice however the noise reduction materials for above rooms were insufficient during my visit. I think the hotel should evaluate the flooring structure to reduce noise. I needed some quietness and didn't get it at this resort. I asked the service desk, if anyone else made complaints about the noise level. The customer service desk gave me an honest response "yes, especially the first floor". I personally will select another resort before considering the Desert Rose Resort again, however; I could be persuaded if the price is right but only with the highest floor location to eliminate the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Family Friendly”
Reviews.Author: vegas_califgirl
Reviews.Content: Very Family friendly but kind of far to walk anywhere with the kids to get something to eat. The rooms were very spacious and clean. I wish they offered room service. I don't think I would stay here again unless I had my kids with me.

Reviews.Title: “Desert Rose in full bloom”
Reviews.Author: ritchieburgess
Reviews.Content: Just arrived home yesterday from spending new years in Fabulous Las Vegas, we choose to stay in the Desert Rose mainly due to the fantastic reviews on this site aided by the very reasonable prices quoted. We arrived almost two hours before the 4pm check in so was worried we may have to wait before we could check in and get onto exploring the strip, this was not the case and we was in our room within 10minutes, The staff on reception were very friendly, and were happy to answer any questions we had. Our room (or should I say suite) was lovely and incredibly clean, the kitchen was positively glistening; fully stocked with everything you could possibly need (blender, huge oven, even bigger fridge/freezer, plenty of plates, bowls etc, cooking utensils....) lovely big sofa in lounge with nice big TV and plenty of channels to choose from (this came in very handy for passing the time while I waited for my girlfriend to get herself ready to leave the room) the bedroom had plenty of space and storage for clothes, bed incredibly comfortable and dressing area nice, bath and shower had great water pressure and there was always enough hot water, You could also make free local calls from your room so long as it was under 60mins, this was very handy as we had friends staying in another hotel so this made it easy to arrange meeting up. The resort also had a nice pool with 24hr hot tub and a fully stocked gym with showers location was great also, we didn’t have a car so relied upon the monorail (situated by mgm grand which is five minutes walk away, runs 21 hours of the day and is every 5 minutes) we both purchased a 3 day pass for $28 each, this gave us unlimited rides up and down the strip as far up as the stratosphere and is very good value when you consider one cab ride up to the strat will set you back $25 plus. The complementary breakfast from 7am till 9am was good, no hot food but nice array of bagels, different breads, ham, cheeses, jams, yogurt, bananas, apples and oranges, fruit juices and carbonated drinks and a Doule Egbert’s hot drinks machine, also available was a good choice of cereals and some very tasty mini Danishes in their own packets (very handy for stocking up on for little snacks during the day) The Desert Rose also has a managers reception from 5pm till 7pm most days with a cheesy keyboard player playing lounge music, some cold pasta ( not to my girlfriends taste but very much to mine, cheeses, crisps (or chips depending on where you are from) a big bowl of dipping sauce and drinks (wines and beer, juices, sodas and hot stuff) even though the keyboard guy was on the cheesy side it made for a very nice start to the evening and he didn’t seem to take himself too seriously and actually did his job to a very good standard although not quite Sinatra.... All in all myself and my better half had a fantastic time and really did not want to leave (kind of wished someone had approached us about a time share as we most likely would've bought the whole apartment, all staff were very helpful except for one guy who could not understand my English accent but he kept on smiling regardless and I just made sure I got seen by someone else. The concierge ladies where all also very helpful and helped us choose our grand canyon helicopter package (of which there are millions) if you have the funds we advise you do it, was absolutely amazing ESPECIALLY THE RETURN OVER THE STRIP AT SUNSET and just added to the already amazing memories we have brought back with us. Anyone that is looking to visit Las Vegas really need not look elsewhere unless you have to stay in a casino type place, Desert Rose has it all and we would not hesitate in staying here again

Reviews.Title: “loved the desret rose resort”
Reviews.Author: sfgh2000
Reviews.Content: desert rose resort, las vegas 12/30/08-01/4/09 our entire stay at this resort is very convinient especially at holiday season. the place is so close to the strip, there is breakfast and dinner reception entertainment and room service. this is really a great time for my whole family. the staff are wonderful and the place is like a family oriented environment. i'm not a time share member at this resort but nice to try other resort and you will know the difference. sfca, new year 09

Reviews.Title: “Family friendly”
Reviews.Author: TravelingDDS
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed over for New Year's and a wedding anniversary event for a family member. I wasn't expecting too much since I saw pictures from the website. I was pleasantly surprised when I stepped into our room that the place looked so much better in person than in the pictures. The room was immaculate, very clean and well-kept. The room offered a lot of space and the kitchen was great too. Staff was always on hand when you needed them. No one bothered us during the whole stay (I read reviews wherein staff would try to sell timeshares). The free continental breakfast was a welcome treat too since after a night of partying, I doubt that anyone would have the energy to leave the hotel to get something to eat in the morning. The walk to MGM to get to the Monorail is about 3 long blocks so if you want to be where the action is, you wouldn't want to stay here unless you have a car or don't mind walking some distance to get to the middle of the strip. I felt though that for the price and condition of the room, I wouldn't really mind walking those extra blocks to get to the strip. This property is not for you too if being with a lot of children annoy you because you WILL see a lot of them here. One more thing, we attended an event in their function room (wedding anniversary) and was disappointed to see that the room looked more like a basement than an actual event room. If you are having an event here, please plan to splurge on the decorations to mask the ugliness of the function room. Overall though, a very pleasant experience. We would most likely stay in this hotel again :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location for a Great Value”
Reviews.Author: teamtip
Reviews.Content: Traveling with 4 children can get pricey so we were looking for somewhere with a kitchen and enough room for all of us. The Desert Rose provided everything we needed including 2 bedrooms and pull out couch, kitchen amenities, a workout room and even free breakfast. The staff was very helpful, the rooms clean and comfortable and best of all, the location was great...we walked easily to the strip. Although there wasn't anything for small kids in the resort, we easily found plenty to do once we got on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and excellent value”
Reviews.Author: jogeba
Reviews.Content: Our family of five stayed at the Desert Rose in a two bedroom suite in mid December. The Hotel is well located just off the strip and has excellent self parking facilities. The suite was clean, well maintained and has very good facilities including a fully equpped kitchen and televisions in each of the bedrooms and living room. A complimentary continental breakfast is included in the room rate and the food was both plentiful and had a broad selection including cereals, breads, bagels, pastries, fresh fruit, hard boiled eggs, tea and coffees. The Desert Rose is a great place for families to stay when visiting Vegas if you want to stay off the Strip in a non casino hotel. It is also very good value for the amenties available.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort Off The Strip”
Reviews.Author: Blaxton
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Desert Rose Resort from Dec 21-Dec 28 for 7 nights - we had rented the 2 bedroom condo and we were on the top floor with a view of the strip. The location of the resort is great and within walking distance to MGM Grand, Tropicana, NY NY, Luxor and Mandalay Bay from these resorts you can catch the monorail to many of the other resorts on the strip. The rooms were nice and spacious, comfortable beds with nice linens and each bedroom had it's own bathroom which was great! The kitchen was nice and well equipped with everything that a person would need. The drawbacks of this property for us were the lines at breakfast and the lack of seating. Also this is a timeshare property so they are trying to get you to buy time there, the Ladies selling were really nice though and we did have a good time joking around with them but you just have to say no and stick to it if you are not interested. The other issue was how dirty it was underneath the beds, they have not vacuumed under the beds for a very long time and we found that to be pretty bad. Even with the drawacks, I would still recommend the Desert Rose Resort and hopefully they read these reviews and make the appropriate changes to make this a 5 star!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: julie1978
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights at the hotel from Dec. 23 to Dec. 24 with only $53 per night. My family are very happy with the hotel. When we tried to extend our stay one more days, we were told that the rooms were sold out. Please do not hesitate.

Reviews.Title: “Great for non-gamblers”
Reviews.Author: Specialized_Brompton
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at this hotel and would definitely come back (if we had to return to Vegas which I don't think we will for a few years!) The room / apartment was almost bigger than our entire house in the UK. Everything was big - bed, TV's (x 2, 1 in bedroom, 1 in living room), oven, fridge, bathroom. I could live in this apartment. It was off the strip so nice and quiet and clean. Nice sized pool but a bit too cool to swim in as it wasn't heated. Breakfast was buffet which was fine, the usual yoghurt, cereals, eggs, bread, juice, etc. Even at 8am this area was busy with some small queues for tea & coffee. Staff very polite and helpful particularly on reception.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: ECOTRAVELLLER
Reviews.Content: Desert Rose Resort is a wonderful hotel,with fully equipped kitchen in rooms. We felt like we are at home and at th same time its not pricey,specially if you look at the amenities and its locations. Its 5 mins walk to MGM Grand , New York,New York,Hooters,Tropicana hotels. 10 -15 mins walk to Deuce Bus Stand,Excalibur,Luxor and Mandalay Bay Hotels . We had wonderful time during our stay and would definitely recommend to all regardless of age. Very useful for elderly and family class. Well,its equally good for romantic getaway and economic honeymoon,specially if you are looking for home like environment and don't want to waste money on food.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: Rebekahj0
Reviews.Content: We loved the Desert Rose! Here's our story: The morning we left for Vegas I gave the Desert Rose a call and asked if there would be a pack and play or crib available for our baby or if I should bring our own. The staff offered instead to have one brought to the room before our arrival (which impressed me)! We were checked in quickly, got to our room and didn't see the pack and play, but only because instead of leaving it in the doorway still folded up for us to trip over on our way in, they set it up in the corner. Thank you!!! Our room was a 2bed 2bath which suited us perfectly! It wasn't huge, but large enough that we were quite comfortable. The kitchen was nicely equipped, rooms equally furnished. One thing that stuck out was they provided a 5 disc cd changer in the room, no dvd player, though. Not that we had too much time to watch tv (other than the football games my husband caught bits and pieces of while we were in and out of the room)! Breakfast on the weekend was crowded, we ended up just taking the food back to our room. They served bagels, breads, ham, hard boiled eggs, danishes, and fruit with juice, milk, and coffee. The staff was always friendly, front desk, maintenance, housekeeping. . . they greeted us in passing or held doors open for us. When we go back to Vegas we'll be staying here again no question!

Reviews.Title: “Desert Rose definitely a great place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: judedkpaul
Reviews.Content: First of all we received a good rate while booking on the hotel's website directly. This was our first trip to Vegas and we kept hearing how important it was to stay on the Strip. We were four of us in our party (me, hubby, mum and a family friend). We booked a two bedroom apartment at the Desert Rose (DR) for three nights, and were thrilled with our booking from the moment the taxi drove us into the complex. The DR is a short 2-3 minute walk to the MGM Grand, Hooters etc. The apartment was meticulously maintained, and lacked for nothing. The beds were comfortable, the bathrooms spick and span and the internet connection was fast. The rate included an American breakfast which was more than appreciated by all in our party. One evening, we were able to attend the Manager's reception for about 20 minutes, and noticed how happy everyone around us were. The airport is a short 5-7 minute drive away too. The best part was that it was away from all the noise and crowds that Vegas is famous for. We then stayed at the MGM Grand for two nights, and that is a whole different ball game -- our room in the west wing, was no way as comfortable as the one in DR, no breakfast, and tons of walking to and from our room to the elevators, reception desk, restaurants, parking you name it. We kept wishing we could go back to the DR. The housekeeping staff too were very very friendly at the DR. If and only if we do return to Vegas, we will definitely stay at the DR and will recommend it to everybody. My personal belief is that it suits families, older guests, and guests who want to enjoy Vegas at their own pace and in peace :)

Reviews.Title: “Great deal for the price”
Reviews.Author: TravelerfromMoCity
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews about this hotel on Tripadvisor and other websites before booking. I got a great deal on Orbitz for flight/hotel for $304 pp for 4 nightes/5 days. Most of the good things mentioned in the previous reviews were true. The staff was mostly friendly, except that it took 30+ minutes and two calls to the front desk to get extra towels the first night we were there. The breakfast was complimentary and filling... however, it was the same for the 5 days that we were there. I cannot complain since it was free and the coffee/latte/cappucino machine was great!! Manager's reception was enoyable with free wine/beer/drinks/snacks and entertainment. Check in/out was fast... they had a $100 hold on credit cards for incidentals but that didn't block my card, like the other reviewers mentioned. The hotel told me that they only block further charges on the card if it's a debit card, not a credit card. The hotel was a short walk to MGM, Hooters, Tropicana, Excalibur, NYNY, M&M Factory/Coca Cola store, and the deuce. My kids (10 and 6) didn't complain about the walks to the different hotels. Excalibur was a great access to Mandalay Bay and Luxor via the free tram. l let my kids ride it a few times without getting off since it was fun for them. We took the deuce (closest stops were near Excalibur and M&M factory) one day and it was way cheaper than the monorail. The all day pass for the deuce is $5 pp... we didn't have to wait long for it either and there were always seats availabe. It was clean. Watch out for the cab drivers... on the way to the hotel, one driver charged me $19 without tip... at the end of the trip to the airport, the fare was only $9. Next time, I will tell them to NOT take the tunnel. My kids and I really enjoyed our stay at the Desert Rose. We will definitely go back since it was smoke free and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Good value residence”
Reviews.Author: KASAteam
Reviews.Content: My wife and myself stayed at the Desert Rose for a week in Nov. We arrived late on the Saturday and were checked in very quickly. Our first impressions of the reception and foyer area were it looked a bit tired and could do with a more modern facelift. Like wise when we we arrived at the room. The facilities in the one bedroom apartment were however very good with plenty of space in sitting room particularly. The kitchen facilities were also very good. We experienced a slight hic up with the power in the bathroom as it tripped a few times while we were there. For the non USA residents there is a reset button on the socket outlet in the bathroom which restores the power. The king size bed was very comfortable and the room servicing also very good. The free breakfeast is adequate to get you going and provided you can live with the paper plates and plastic cutlery its ok although a little repetitive. We found taking it back to your room a little more comfortable. The early evening drinks,nibbles and music are also quite fun again if you like your drink out of a plastic cup! Recommend the three day monorail ticket as decent value at $28. If you fancy a decent steak try Gallaghers in NYNY outstanding although not cheap. We found the lunch buffet in Mandalay Bay excellent value at $20 each also the revolving restaurant at top of Stratosphere worth visiting. The Desert Rose whilst not being in the same league as some of the big players such as the Bellagio does represent great value for money within a 10 min walk to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Desert Rose, a Great Time”
Reviews.Author: dbarms
Reviews.Content: We are from CT, wife and I had never been to Las Vegas and we weren't too expectant about the reasonable room rates at Desert Rose but having found it on the internet and not wanting to spend the $$ for a glitzy casino hotel with slot machines everywhere we took the chance at this place that is on the strip. We were very happy with the entire experience. Comfortable suite for a reasonable rate, walking distance to MGM Grand, New York-New York and the monorail, free parking, quiet, my wife and I were very happy with it. We made use of the simple but ample morning buffet which was very well attended and satisfying, and the fun evening happy hour, much fun too. This place is a treat. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find”
Reviews.Author: holidaytimeaylesbury
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights, great place to stay. Staff very helpful and friendly, room lovely and comfortable, and nice and quiet at night. Breakfast was a bonus, more than adequate, and the managers special of an evening with free drinks, food and entertainment was well attended. We loved our time in Las Vegas and would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: beachbumaz
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Desert Rose Resort Nov. 13 – 16. We had 4 adults and we shared a two-bedroom suite. Location is great…a 10-minute cab ride from the airport, around $12. A short walk from the resort to MGM, with Hooters Casino in between. Check In was quick and the Front Desk Staff was all very friendly. Our suite was awesome…nicely decorated, shared living room/dining room/kitchen area, with two separate bedrooms, each with their own bathroom. Nicely equipped kitchen with full-sized appliances and all the cookware and silverware you’d need. Even a nice bar area with two barstools. Dining room table with four chairs. Loved the sofa! Nice chaise lounge on the end…very comfortable! Also, a patio with a couple of chairs. Breakfast was good…a typical continental breakfast with a few extra options. It was very busy each morning, but we would grab what we wanted and bring it up to our room to eat. Sure, there were a few rude guests … but you cannot fault the resort or staff for that. Overall, we all really enjoyed our stay at the Desert Rose and will definitely recommend this to people looking for a more budget-friendly option while staying in Vegas. We will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “A Rose of a resort in the Desert”
Reviews.Author: lded
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are not gamblers and were not interested in a stay at a casino. Also, I am bothered by too much smoke and did not want to take a chance staying at a smoky place. I did a lot of research and found this gem. At the time I booked there was still availability for their "go green and save" promo, so I booked our room ( a one bedroom) for a great price. This ongoing promo has room service just once a week for a towel and bedding change. Not a problem for us. The continental breakfast was of the usual faire; we supplemented with our own omelettes we made in the kitchen. (we went food shopping at a local market). They also had an almost nightly happy hour with free beer (miller), wine and munchies and some music. A lot of fun, but we brought our own beer that we bought at the market without any concern from staff. The pool area was nice and quiet, and there are 2 hot tubs. We had one maintenance issue and that was taken care of within minutes. Our main reason for visiting was to see family for a couple of days, and we saw a couple of shows and did some day trips out of Vegas. We enjoyed seeing all the opulence of the casinos; one more impressive than the next, all without gambling our hard earned money away. And our stay at Desert Rose was a perfect oasis. Only about a 7 minute walk from the strip, but miles away from all the hustle and bustle.

Reviews.Title: “We really enjoyed the Desert Rose Resort!!”
Reviews.Author: GolfBrat
Reviews.Content: This resort if very nice. The suites are large and very nicely decorated and comfortable. They have everything you need right in the suite. The location is great - just a long block from the strip near the MGM and Hooters. The hotel is quiet and a nice change from the casino hotels. We stayed there for 8 nights and it was nice to have a suite/condo to stay in instead of just a room for that length of time. They have an upgraded continental breakfast each morning and a beer and wine reception with appetizers each night which is a plus. The staff was very helpful and friendly. We really enjoyed our stay and we will definitely stay at the Desert Rose again!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoying the Rose.”
Reviews.Author: dhach_33
Reviews.Content: Its was my first time booking any kind of hotel reservation in Las Vegas for me and it was a pleasureable experience. We had the two room suite and it was spacious enough for 6 people. The staff was friendly, each room has it own t.v, wireless internet was available for free, and the location of the resort was close to the Las Vegas strip. I will stay there again when we visit Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “A Rosey Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kk56
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay! The rooms were very spacious and clean. The whole resort was well maintained and the staff very cordial and helpful. You had everything you needed there and a nice view of the Strip from a distance. Continental Breakfast was very good with a wide variety to choose from as well as a great Coffee Machine! I would rather stay here than at a large Casino Hotel, more personal service, yet still close to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: KellyDee
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay. The kitchen was fully loaded (toaster, coffee pot, blender, dishes, dishwasher, etc.). The iron, ironing board and safe came in very handy. The bed was comfortable and the entire suite was very clean. The bathtub was huge and inviting after a long day of walking through the casinos. The staff was very friendly and we were allowed to check in early. I would recommend staying on the top floor if you are a light sleeper. We felt very safe as each building is secured with a gate to be opened with your room key. The location was wonderful, Wal-Mart Supercenter and the Thomas and Mack arena are only minutes away and Las Vegas Blvd. is just a few blocks. The only negative I found was that the room we stayed in was very dated. It looked like we stepped back into the 1970's. However, it was all clean and comfortable. We will stay there again on our next trip to Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Unsure About the Desert Rose”
Reviews.Author: Eveleyn
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our 3 children in Oct 2008 for 2 nights. We had a room with a car park view but it was quiet and we never had any security concerns. The breakfast was dreadful affair ; no proper tables, people pushing and grabbing and they ran out of the most popular items. We took breakfast back to our room to avoid the horror. For a family of 5 it was good value but if it was just my husband and I I would stay right on the strip. We had been to Vegas 18 years ago and found it had become more sleazy with pornographic cards being handed to my 15 year old as we walked along in the evening from 9pm. It was also the only place in our 3 week tour of east and west coasts of US that we felt a bit unsafe and the kids also. The pool was cold as was the spa. Gd value if you can get a deal but we probably won't return.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: MellyM
Reviews.Content: Too many great things about this place to mention... Solid breakfast (with the usual bread, cereal, coffee and juice - but also hard boiled eggs, ham, fruit). Great coffee machine! (Espresso!!!) Very spacious rooms (we were a group of 7 adults and one baby and had two two-bedroom suites side by side). Loved the fully equipped kitchen with a stove, large fridge, microwave, coffee maker, etc. (nice to be able to stay in and cook + keep snacks in the fridge instead of eating at a restaurant for every meal). Free beer and wine and munchies during daily happy hour (with live entertainment on many nights). Friendly and helpful staff! Yummy and huge cookies put out in the breakfast/happy hour area every afternoon (unfortunately we didn't discover this marvel until the second or third day of our stay). Free parking. Yes - this place isn't right on the strip. But it's a very short walk. A few small negatives - some of the gym equipment needed some maintenance work and our dishwasher didn't seem to want to wash. However the positives by far out-weighed the negatives and we will definitely stay here again! Very good value for the money!

Reviews.Title: “An all around great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: kekurutz
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights and was definitely impressed. This resort is a great place to stay if you're planning a trip to Vegas on a budget. Booked a one bedroom suite - living room, dining area, full kitchen, bedroom and bathroom. The room was extremely clean and looked to have been recently renovated. For a one bedroom, the room was extremely spacious - probably larger than your typical hotel room. The resort is only about a block from the strip with a short walk through the parking lot between the Tropicana and Hooters. They offer a free continental breakfast every morning which was nice - a great way to save a little extra cash. They also offer a free managers reception Sun.-Thurs. from 5-7pm with free beer/wine/cocktails and snacks. It's something we didn't take advantage of, but it's nice to know that it's available. Overall, the stay was a good experience - as long as you don't mind not having an in-house casino, this place is the perfect place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful...just wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Carreg
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Desert Rose for 5 nights at the end of October/beginning of November and don't have a single criticism about them. Every staff member we met, from the reception staff to the cleaning staff were polite, friendly, courteous and eager to help us as much as they could. They didn't even get grumpy when we decided to book in for an extra night and then changed our minds about which night that would be...twice! (We were originally going to tack an extra night on to the end of our initial stay but then decided to have the extra night after we got back from our 2 nights in Death Valley) Our suite (standard king) was spacious, clean, well maintained, quiet and homely, the bed large and comfortable and everything we could have possibly needed in the kitchen (other than food, obviously) was provided for us. It really did feel like a home from home. The cleaning staff were prompt and efficient, every evening we returned to a clean and tidy set of rooms, they even put our dirty coffee mugs in the dishwasher on the one occassion we left them out. We had heard poor reviews of the breakfast buffet so avoided it for our first two mornings but on the third day we decided to give it a go, my boyfriend sallied forth and returned to our room with seeded bagels, ham, hard boiled eggs, cream cheese & mayonnaise, we then used our own facilities to toast the bagels and make them up ourselves. These were so tasty and such a resounding success that this is what we did every morning for the rest of our stay so I have to say that we disagree with the other reviewers about the breakfast, although admittedly we did not try and sit in the lobby and eat it. So maybe a top tip for people staying at the Desert Rose would be to collect breakfast from the buffet and take it back to the comfort of your suite to eat it! The walk to the Strip is very short, less than 5 minutes and you're at the MGM Grand or NYNY, we didn't find it a problem at all to walk this little extra distance. In short, we loved the Desert Rose and would recommend it to anyone and we will definitely be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Momondago
Reviews.Content: I booked the room 7 months in advanced and paid less than $300 for 4 nights. The suite was spacious and the finishes were nice. Nice, quite and not too far from the strip. The breakfast was very continental and we had a hard time keeping a phone signal, but all-in-all, we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: suzyque56
Reviews.Content: Our party of seven had two rooms, one was the two bedroom suite. Each having there own bathroom. Very spacious. Nice big couch. 3 TV's. Nice kitchen if you want to cook. Beds were very comfy. Pillows were nice, not flat like most places. The other was nice and spacious with a smaller kitchen. Very clean! Nice continental breakfast. Nice Happy hour. Short walk to Hooters and Tropicana, MGM also close by. Near Busline. UNLV Thomas Mac center close by. But not walking distance. Walk to Hooters to get a cab easliy.They can call you a cab also. I would stay there again. Very nice staff on hand! Look forward to staying with them again at other locations. All the comforts of home! Great experience for our first time to Vegas! Sue Connecticut

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay”
Reviews.Author: flixflyer
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this resort in September 2008 for 5 nights & enjoyed my stay. The rooms were clean & the hotel felt safe at all times. My room was quite large with a bedroom, bathroom living/dining area & a fully kitted kitchen. The room also comes with a safe, iron & ironing board. I found the air-conditioning unit to be rather noisy, so I switched it off at night. The resort is just off the strip, next door to Hooters & a 5 minute walk to Tropicana & MGM. Car Parking is free. There is a decent sized swimming pool, although it got very busy at the weekends. The breakfasts are of a buffet style, but very good, although I thought it would had been better if the breakfast eating times finished at 10 AM not 9 AM during the midweek, like they did at the weekends. There is also a small buffet of drinks & crisps etc between 5 & 7 PM. I would defiently stay at this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: Littell
Reviews.Content: The Desert Rose Resort was a great place! It was better than expected. It is close to the strip but very relaxing when getting back to your room. The rooms are spacious and nice and the staff is very friendly and helpful. Parking is easy and close. We would definitely recommend this place if you would like to visit Vegas but don't want the hastle of the big casino hotels.

Reviews.Title: “peace and quiet in vegas”
Reviews.Author: LancashireJojo
Reviews.Content: we stayed here recently for 5 nights and couldnt fault with anything. very friendly and helpful staff at all times. our 4 friends stayed in a 2 bed apartment and we stated in a 1 bedroomed apartment, both were very nicely furnished and had everything you need. just a few minutes walk to the strip and all the action you could ever want. it was very nice to come back to the peace and quiet though. the free breakfasts were good although a little busy at times. we didnt attend any of the free special nights as we were always out and about , although the people we saw attending as we passed through reception looked as though they were enjoying themselves. would definately recommend staying here as we much preferred it to staying in a busy strip hotel.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: LyndyScotland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Desert Rose Resort for 8 nights and would highly recommend this hotel. This is a little haven amongst the hustle and bustle of the strip. We were a party of 9, divided into two, two bedroom suites which were faultless. Plenty of room, very clean and amazingly comfortable beds! The free continental breakfast was adequate and we more than welcomed the free drinks and nibbles every night from 5 til 7pm. This was a great time to relax by the poolside, wind down and meet other guests. Staff were always pleasant and nothing was too much trouble. The location is second to none, with the MGM monorail station just a five minute walk away, although i have to say, we didn't use it. We were able to walk to the strip within ten minutes. We are coming back to las vegas in the very near future and will definately be staying at the Desert Rose Resort. Can i also say, no one at the hotel asked me to write this review or even mentioned trip advisor. This is a totally unbiased opinion from a very happy holidaymaker from Scotland. Lynda Meikle, Kirkliston, Scotland.

Reviews.Title: “Great for us and will stay again”
Reviews.Author: MargeYorkshire
Reviews.Content: We could not really fault Desert Rose and had booked for 3 nights. We loved the apartment layout and found everything to our satisfaction. The continental breakfast was quite adequate and late afternoon nibbles and drinks good. We used the pool area and had no trouble in finding a sunbed in the afternoon. The location was superb for us as we needed to be near Hooters and MGM for the entertainment that weekend. No trouble walking to the MGM for the monorail to go up the strip. We stayed the following weekend in a four star large hotel on the strip and hated having to walk through the smoky casino for ages to get to our room. We will definitely stay again at the Desert Rose if we return to Las Vegas in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: LoveVacations08
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Desert Rose resort for a 4 day get away. This is our second time in Las Vegas and enjoyed both times. We stayed at the Rio the first time and the Desert Rose the second. Both are very different experiences and we enjoyed them both.The Desert Rose is just a short 2 block walk off the strip, accesssable but quiet. If you have a physical disability the walk may be too far. The pool and hot tub stay open until 11 pm compared to the strip hotels of 6 pm. It is nice having your own cooking facility. Going out to eat every meal is not my idea of fun. The resort had a nice continental breakfast every morning with a very friendly staff. The concierge was very helpful in printing our flight boarding passes. If you are looking for a retreat to get away from the chaos of the strip (when you choose) at a reasonable price, then this is the place for you. If you want non-stop action then stay on the strip (but pay more money). This was a perfect place if you have a car. No parking fee and easy in and out of your condo. Picketts, Michigan

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed every minute”
Reviews.Author: wjulie06
Reviews.Content: my husband and Istayed at the desert rose for a week in october. From arrival to leaving we had a lovely time. Staff were very friendly and helpful and our room had everything needed for a comfortable stay. The furnishings were lovely, two large tv's with plenty of channels one in the lounge and one in the bedroom, a large double bed and lovely bathroom. The breakfast was ok with bread, bagels, fruit, cheese etc. Afternoons between 5 and 7 there is entertainment and free wine beer and soft drinks, we only attended once as there is so much to see and do in Vegas. The location is excellent and although the big hotels are amazing I would much rather stay at the Desert Rose as the big hotels seemed so busy and hectic. We had a perfect holiday thanks to all at the Desert Rose we hope to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: biztravelerColorado
Reviews.Content: My sister and I just stayed at the Desert Rose Resort Oct 23-27 while attending a family wedding. Enjoyed our stay very much. Rooms were spacious and clean. Kitchen came in really handy, especially the frig magnet with the directions to the nearest grocery stores. LOVED the little Las Vegas Map attached to the key card envelope - we used that map a lot since this trip was our first in about 12 years to Vegas. A/C was a little loud until we figured out how to flip Fan from ON to Auto and it then only ran when needed. Housekeeping service forgot to leave replacement towel items a few times but was fixed quickly. Checking out took almost a half hour, even though I had prepaid. Desk clerk said the new online reservation service and their system weren't communicating and the rate I had paid wasn't correct, her computer was telling her I need to pay more. Got straightened out, but took longer than I had planned. I think their rates are a little high, especially in today's economy when there is so much available space in Las Vegas - could be more competitive. A hotel shuttle service would be a great addition - even though it isn't too far to get to the strip, the bus stop or the tram. If the shuttle ran every couple hours to/from downtown, that would make it easier to see more of Vegas. A shuttle service would put the Desert Rose a step ABOVE other options. All-in-all, good place to stay and we really enjoyed our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nearly excellent, but a few concerns”
Reviews.Author: Steve46Swindon
Reviews.Content: We booked our accommodation over 3 months in advance, followed up by a mail to the resort specifically requesting a 3rd floor suite, which was responded to accordingly. On checking in after a ten hour flight we were dismayed to find that a ground floor suite had been allocated and that a third floor one "may" be available in an hour. On showing a copy of our e-mail we were informed that this was a request only and could not be guarenteed! At this point the customer service manager Jeremy got involved an admitted that our request had not been acted upon and sourced third floor accommodation in 20 minutes. The 2 bedroom suite was roomy, spotlessly clean and the beds very comfortable. The 5-7pm happy hour was excellent and the breakfast very acceptable. The small gym was adequate, we didn't try the pool. The maid service to service the rooms tended to be late in the day (3pm) but was not an issue. On 2 occasions we were called to ask if we required the room servicing! On one occasion the lights failed in the bathroom and a maintenance man was quickly summoned to fix it. The conciege staff were very friendly, but did not seem to possess a great deal of local knowledge! I was interested in the comment from a fellow reviewer that their card was blocked, possibly by the resort pending any extras. We took plenty of cash and travellers cheques, but when they ran out I found that my card was blocked, even though i had plenty of credit. Whether this was down to the resort or not I am unsure, but it does seem strange. Also 2 attempts to draw cash which were unsuccessful resulted in withdrawals appearing on my account which are now being disputed. Again, I cannot state that this is anything to do with the resort, but if hotels are blocking cards in this fashion without advising their guests this is clearly unacceptable. Would I stay at the Desert Rose again? Yes I would as if you're looking for a non casino hotel you cannot do any better. I would want clarification over the policy on blocking credit cards (or not )first though!

Reviews.Title: “Not the best place to stay”
Reviews.Author: trainertom
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for fun and a conference. The rooms were nice, but the air conditioner was way too loud for the small one bedroom suit I was in- in addition, A/C only seemed to blow into the living area, not the bedroom. Was supposed to have a smoking room booked, however, room was a non-smoking room when I arrived in it. Couldn't open the windows or leave the sliding door open because the traffic was too loud - so had to decide whether to blast the TV volume to cover loud traffic or the air conditioner. Band music echoed throughout the complex. Wasn't bad if you had a room that faces out-away from the complex, but if you had a room that faced another building, the echo was horrible, including the music from their lobby. Food for the conference there was horrible and looked nasty. Not sure why they even bothered to serve it. Friend who attended ordered a vegetarian meal and receied a plate full of nasty looking vegetables and mashed potatoes. Obviously they didn't plan appropriately either as plate contents where being split up among people. It was an ok place to lay your head as long as you didn't spend any real time there.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied,but cranky with a few things.”
Reviews.Author: rockersmom
Reviews.Content: Our stay was enjoyable. However, it would be nice that during check out time the hotel staff wouldn't have the halls blocked. We were attempting to load our vehicle and every maid in the building had there carts lined up in the hallway. It turned a 10min thing into a 45min one. The "young girls" working the first desk need somewhat of an attitude adjustment. I like the accesiblility to the strip. It only took us about 5 min to get to the MGM, by foot. I will definetlly stay again. Katrina Phoenix

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: beammeupscotty035
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a short stay in Vegas. Was a bit worried as after we booked noticed that there may have been a problem with fake reviews but need not have worried. This was just what it says on their website. A small friendly hotel just off strip behind Hooters and 5 mins walk to MGM Grand/Tropicana. Handy for walking around the Strip. Units don't have great views but we stayed in two bed unit with two baths and kitchen and 3 tvs and very quiet. Pool quite small. We enjoyed the breakfasts,cereal, toast, bagels, ham, fruit etc which you could have as much of as you wanted. We went into the big hotels and were glad we didnt stay there - too big and easy to get lost in and you always have to go thru the casinos for everything and most allow smoking. For Harley Davidson fans, the store offers a free bus pick up from various hotels in the Strip and will drop you back off. We ate at the Harley Davidson Cafe which is worth a visit just to see the Harley's going around above your head but the food is a bit overpriced as was most of the Strip eating places. Grand Canyon is amazing and we would recommend the plane/helicopter/boat tour. Watch out for strip club touts on the strip - they tend to shove cards of naked girls in even teenage boys faces and the strip is littered with discarded cards.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel for a stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Sassy1722
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with 2 friends whilst visiting Las Vegas for another friend's wedding. It was perfect for what we required - close to the Strip but far enough away that we could escape for some nice peace and quiet when we needed it. We weren't sure what to expect as we'd paid so much less than others that had travelled out for the wedding and were staying on the Strip, but we were so glad we were staying here and not at some of the cheaper, more run down hotels that sell themselves on their novelty value. We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite and there was more than enough room for the 3 of us. The beds were really comfortable; fabulous kitchen (not that we really used it!); lovely to have a balcony and be able to get some fresh air (in many of the strip hotels you can't even open the window). We were also pretty impressed with the breakfast - nothing too fancy but just what we needed. The only possible downside is that it's quite close to the airport, but the noise is minimal and it didn't bother us at all. It also means that you can be at the hotel really quickly and don't have to leave too early to get there to go home! The staff were also really friendly and helpful. We'd definitely stay there again and recommend it to friends. Viva Las Vegas baby!

Reviews.Title: “Disapointment at the Desert Rose”
Reviews.Author: lesleyob
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this resort from Oct. 19-24 with my sister and mother. We were in Vegas for a vacation, and had booked the hotel (through an online travel site) after reading such great reviews about it here on TA. We stayed in a 1 BR suite. I have to say that I was somewhat disappointed with our stay. After checking in after midnight, we arrived at our room to discover the following; - the TV didn't work - a few hairs were found in the bed - that they had placed us in a 'loud' location, despite requesting via email and phone that we be in a quiet location I called the front desk the next morning to report the problems, and to inquire about upgrading to a 2 bedroom room. We were willing to pay more for the upgrade, but were hoping to get somewhat of a deal due to our problems. The manager on duty advised me that a 2BR suite went for $400/night, but that she could do me a 'favour' and give it to me for $139/night. As we had booked through a third party, and had gotten 'such a low rate', our credit card would be charged $70/night to make up the difference between the rooms. I advised her that I had checked online, and that a 2BD suite did not go for $400/night (the rate of extremely highend Vegas resorts), and that i felt she was trying to take advantage of us. She became quite defensive upon hearing this, and implied that she was offering this rate at great personal risk to her! Needless to say, we didn't take her up on her offer. We payed approx. $510 CAN. for our 5 night stay, which at the time of the booking (two months in advance) would have meant that we were paying approx. $90US/night (our dollar was quite high when we booked). At the time of our stay, hotel rooms in Vegas were being heavily discounted due to the poor economy (on the day we left I even read a piece in USA Today about the Bellagio offering $300 rooms for $149/night due to high vacancy). SInce returning home, I've checked out the Desert Rose website and have seen 2BR suites offered for as low as $88/night, evidence that they've also reduced their rates contrary to what the manager implied. I'm disapointed that the manager tried to take advantage of our situation, and i have to say it left me with a bad taste in my mouth about the resort. But I guess I learned a valuable lesson - booking through a third party makes it extremely difficult to renegotiate your rate if the economy takes a downturn. Pros; - adequate breakfast, although the layout of the items made no sense - comfy beds - good water pressure in shower - spacious rooms - friendly staff otherwise - no casino, so no associated noise/smoke Cons: - dishonest management - poor quality toiletries - bring your own if you have sensitive skin - shower stall leaked all over the bathroom floor no matter how firmly you 'closed' the curtain - inadequate counter space in sink area - 5-10min. walk to strip

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay at the Desert Rose”
Reviews.Author: clairelou123
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed at the Desert Rose Resort during September 2008. We had a one bedroom apartment that was very spacious and exceptionally clean. We didn't use the kitchen during our stay but it was very well equipped should you want to self cater. The hotel was secure and felt very safe and the reception staff were very polite and helpful. The breakfast was a bonus and had everything we needed to set us up for the day the only advice I would give is to get it early as it did get very busy and the seating area was small. The pool area was nice but even though we were up early the sunbeds were already reserved which was a bit annoying especially when some of the people who reserved them didnt appear until dinner time.
