The hotel is in a good location and is approx 10 mins walk to the strip (through the MGM Grand Hotel) We would definitely stay at the Desert Rose again.

Reviews.Title: “Just excellent”
Reviews.Author: derizzoUk
Reviews.Content: Our stay was undoubtedly the best that we experienced during our 3 weeks holiday. The appt. was spacious, very clean and everything was in excellent condition. It is well located in LV and we could walk everywhere we wanted to go. (ages 60+). I cannot find one single fault and to cap it all, it was also very reasonably priced. The staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: ryck
Reviews.Content: Family of four including 15 year old and 12 year old. We arrived very early (due to changed flight) 9am and guy at reception was very accomodating and said they could check us in immediately. Showed us two rooms - first had 2 Queen beds, was clean, tidy and on ground floor. We wanted second room to have twin beds so they showed us another room but this seemed old and drab, also on ground floor with door to roadway which did not have any deadbolts or other than standard ranchslider bolts so I went back and reiterated we would rather wait a couple of hours and get an upper floor room. The guy at reception seemed very unimpressed with my request and looked very annoyed, even though I was extremely polite which was a bit upsetting. I think he sensed he had upset me and calmed down and offered to have a room overlooking strip on second floor made up and ready by 12 but we couldn't get twin beds in the second room as they have hardly any rooms like that. We went to the strip and returned at 4pm. No room had been put aside for us and new receptionist apologised and let us look at a room on 3rd floor with view of strip (as far away from lobby and pool as possible), but it was very nice and clean and we could see Excalibur, Luxor, MGM, Tropicana from our balcony. After that it was great. Room was clean, tidy - the beds were fabulous (this was the third hotel in our trip and by far best beds and pillows). We had two room condo with two bathrooms, three televisions, full kitchen, and dining. My daughter slept on the sofa which was hugely comfortable and all was well. The breakfast in the morning is from 6am to 9am. The earlier you went the better table you got however we went about 7.30am every day and had no problem. We had cereals, toast, bagels, cold boiled eggs, danishes, coffees, hot chocolate and other drinks. Brilliant for free! We went to the mix and mingle drinks and nibbles one evening and it was very pleasant and we talked to people from UK so that was lovely. Pool was small and we didn't use it... every day by 9am all of the deck chairs are taken as people put their towels on them whilst they have breakfast and then sunbathe all day. Hotel is very handy to strip - 10 mins walk maximum to Excalibur, Luxor, MGM and 5 mins to Hooters, Tropicana. We used the $5 each all day bus pass and rode up and down the strip - good value for money but don't expect to get up and down too fast as it stops continuously but cheap sightseeing tour and it goes to the outlet malls too! I would stay here again as excellent large apartments for families compared to hotel rooms. Do NOT use the phone in your room though. I made a 4 minute call to NZ which should have cost about $10 and it cost $42USD. I queried this on checkout and the receptionist told me that the hotel charge about $20 just to dial out an international call and then charge quite a lot per minute and they usually "warn" their customers about this on checkin. (Just got the bill and $72 New Zealand dollars for four mins!!!!)

Reviews.Title: “Glad we went and will return one day”
Reviews.Author: swintontraveller
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th visit to Vegas and by far the best place we have stayed at. We stayed for 4 nights from 12th-16th October and booked way back in January for an amazing price of £36 per night for the room through Expedia. When we arrived it had been a busy weekend so rooms weren't going to be available until the stated time of 4 pm. We left our bags in the secured storage and went for a walk , an hour later our room was available, block 3 top floor, though there are only 3 floors in each block. It was so nice to be able to arrive at the hotel and be in your room within a few minutes without having to traipse through a casino, especially if you had forgotten something !! It has been said many times in previous reviews that the rooms are great, they are, everything is provided even down to a small bottle of washing up liquid, and pan scrubber !!! The fridge was huge and typically American in size with automatic ice making facility. Everything was spotless in the kitchen. The living room area was large , there was some staining on the lounging furniture where drinks had been spilled but didn't detract from how homely it all felt. We had a one bedroom unit and it had a walk in closet with an electronic safe which was free to use. The only negative thing was the actual bath and loo area was tiny, anyone of a larger than average size would have to squeeze around the door to close it before using the facilities . The manager's cocktail reception ( 5-7pm ) each evening was a nice touch, there was live music provided by a guy singing with a keyboard, some people actually got up dancing they were having so much fun. Snacks were also provided. Breakfast was appreciated in the lobby but could have gone on a little later than 9am, we only managed to make it on one morning out of the 4 which is what I suppose the hotel relies on !! It was very busy . You can take the food back to your room though . Pool area was nice but small and there were several selfish lounge chair hoggers during our stay. We witnessed towels and personal items left on loungers in the best spots for hours with no one arriving to claim them. I hope those people lost lots of money in the casinos!!! The jacuzzi was extremely hot but very good. I can understand not wanting to heat the main pool but felt that the toddlers pool should at least be heated as there were one or two little ones that wanted to go swimming but the pool was too cold for them. If you turn right instead of left towards MGM/ Tropicana when you get to the main road there is a restaurant called Coco's next to Motel 6 . It is open 24 hours and does breakfast specials as well as a senior ( age 55+) menu. We had a meal here and it was very good , We also went to Ellis island for their $6.99 filet steak special which includes a beer !! WORD OF WARNING- we have stayed all over the world and visited the USA many times but this was the first time this has happened to us. Our room was already paid for in full and we registered our credit card for incidentals which is standard procedure. When we went out the first night we found out our credit card had been blocked after trying to purchase show tickets. The girl told me that hotels put blocks on cards to ensure their bills are paid. I had heard of this but it had never happened to us before. To say I was fuming is putting it mildly. I queried this with reception and they insisted it was our credit card company. I found out at the airport that this was a lie as I was able to use my credit card to purchase perfume, I hadn't contacted my UK credit card company as we were able to use another card during our Vegas stay so it was the hotel who lifted the block when we checked out. The girl on the airport perfume counter was very helpful and gave me some good advice for our next hotel in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MeijiCollector
Reviews.Content: Just stayed there for 8 days. The room was very spacious and the kitchen had all the required items I needed. The breakfast was awesome and the manager's reception was superb. The staff of the hotel was extremely helpful and because a room was available, I was able to check in early. That really did help me a lot. I definitely will stay here again and couldn't have been any happier with the place. This truly is home away from home and can't wait to get back there again.

Reviews.Title: “A diamond off of the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Montana21
Reviews.Content: What a pleasant surprise. This wonderful resort is only a short walk from the Las Vegas Strip. It's quiet and the staff is extremely friendly and helpful from the time you get there until you leave. Rooms are clean and spacious but the bathroom itself is rather small. A continental breakfast each morning filled you up and this was a nice touch. Also the early evening beer/wine and cheese was a welcome touch. The security measures with locked gates and doors (your pass key opened these) made you feel very safe. There is no doubt I will be staying at the Desert Rose again when I'm back in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay - great find in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: nzers
Reviews.Content: Our family of 2 adults and 2 children (12 & 10 yrs) stayed in a 2 bedroom / 2 bathroom apartment for 3 nights in early October as part of a 26 day road trip and were very happy with our choice. What we liked: Staying off the strip out of the huge, smoke filled casino's but being close enough to walk there in only a few minutes, having that extra bit of room to move around, the full kitchen, the lovely relaxing pool area, good security, free parking, free breakfast and afternoon snacks/drinks, the helpful concierge. What we didn't like: People hogging pool loungers! Very busy breakfast area and running out of food, no free internet access. We generally didn't find Las Vegas itself to be that wonderful. Great to see, but only once. The people were quite unfriendly (fellow hotel guests & staff, shop attendants etc) and the secondhand smoke in the casino's was just disgusting. The hotels and their themes were amazing tho' and we're glad we've been there and done that...

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: MBrack
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Dessert Rose for 6 nights -- two for fun and four for a conference. The conference booked the four nights, and I booked the additional two months in advance (paid for on my credit card). There was massive confusion about this which has still not been straightened out. Essentially they had me scheduled in two different rooms the whole time and were annoyed that I didn't want to pay for both of them. Once that seemed to be straightened out they charged my credit card for a total stranger's "no-show" and that has still not been rectified. Also when I tried to review my bill on the room TV another customer's information came up instead of mine. Needless to say my confidence in their bookkeeping staff was not good. Tom in the office was very helpful though and is (I hope) still trying to get everything fixed. Other than that...the room was beautiful (building 2) although I visited another one that was really run down (building 4). The breakfast was complete mayhem. There's only one coffee dispenser for the whole hotel and if you are interested in a piece of toast or sugary cereal you'd better wear combat gear. Our group also had a dinner that was so unbelievably bad (and spoiled) that the hotel agreed not to charge us for it before they'd even finished serving. I won't bore you with the description, but it was bad. REALLY bad. Front desk staff were great. Housekeeping staff were surly and gathered like gangs in the hallway. I had to call and ask for someone to change my towels and empty the trash because they never came to my room. The pool is small and there was never a chair to be had. Overall, I guess that for the price the rooms are nice and the location is okay. If you stay there just plan to fix your own food in the kitchen and keep a careful eye on your bill.

Reviews.Title: “We'll keep coming back!”
Reviews.Author: ellenmary42
Reviews.Content: What's not to like! We have stayed at this property now 4 times and it has not disappointed. We like the rooms, having a continental breakfast, easy parking [free of course] and accessability to the rooms, as well as its close proximity to the Strip and to the Airport. The pool and hot tub are very pleasant too! The staff are always welcoming and responsive to any queries or needs.During the most recent stay we attended the Manager's Reception which was fun too - and did we mention the really good home baked cookies which are available most days in the lobby. Like we said: We'll keep coming back - as we think it's very good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort”
Reviews.Author: traveleasy60
Reviews.Content: Although the resort is near the airport there was no great amount of noise. The welcome we were given was most warm and friendly. The rooms are set in different blocks based around the pool. No high rise, they are comforable and well kept. The room was cleaned everyday A short walk brings you into the main strip in Las Vegas as the MGM Casino is just down the road A complimentary breakfast is served everyday and it is buffett style so you can start the day well fed. I would recommend this place to anyone and if we are ever back in Vegas we will be staying at the Desert Rose.

Reviews.Title: “Great Alternative to casino hotels”
Reviews.Author: jan01876
Reviews.Content: I booked this property through AARP travel as a hotel/airfare package. We are seasoned Las Vegas travelers, and are tired of hiking through casinos for 20 minutes just to get to your room elevator area. We also always rent a car, as we go off the strip a lot. This hotel is great property and location if you like to do this. We had a 2 bedroom suite, as there were 3 of us, and could not have been happier. Rooms were spacious, plenty of hot water in showers. Breakfast got a little crazy, as there was only one toaster, and things kept getting stuck in it,as well seating is limited, but you can take things back to your suite as ours had a toaster,and boiled hot water for the hot chocolate. Only downside was housekeeping wanted to tuen over the room at 9am on our day of departure

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: mtcatsfan
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at the Desert Rose after reading several positive reviews on TripAdvisor and then noticed they were having a 30% discount on room rates during the time of our stay. I was there with five of my girlfriends for my 40th birthday - four nights. We had the 2 bedroom/2 bathroom suite and it was perfect for our needs! The room was clean and we had plenty of space for six women! We didn't utilize the kitchen as much as we could have as we went out most of the time, but it appeared to have everything we would have needed to prepare meals right in our room. The breakfast was good - nothing over the top, typical continental - but it was adequate enough for our needs. The evening social was also OK. The pool area was nice (water in the main pool could have been a little warmer, but it was OK.) It appeared crowded during the day, but we utilized the pool later on in the day, so we didn't have any issues there. The area was quiet and we were a short, five minute walk to the strip. The service we received upon check-in and during our stay was wonderful. Staff was very attentive. It was also nice to stay in a "non-casino" hotel - since you get so much of that out and about, it was refreshing to come back to a place with no flashing lights and noise! I would definitely recommend the Desert Rose and will, most likely, attempt to stay there again on my next visit to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Desert Rose Resort, Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: flyoutOntario
Reviews.Content: My husband I stayed at the Desert Rose Resort. This was the first time in Las Vegas and also at this resort. We loved the resort, everyone was so friendly and helpful, anything you needed they tried to accomodate you. We were very impressed and we will stay there next year.

Reviews.Title: “Nice non-gambling hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hakan99
Reviews.Content: We've been in Desert Rose last month in a one room condo. As I've made a detailed research about the hotel and its properties before making my reservation, it wasn't a surprise to me having such a nice stay. There are several outdoor entries from the parking area which can be opened by your door key so your car is quite near to your room in almost every part of hotel. There's a problem with the cable of tv antenna in our room, so vision was a little bit noisy. Afternoon parties were quite good. Breakfast can be satisfying for most of the people. So especially for families or groups who want to stay in a single room and don't want to be in a gambling atmosphere for 24 hours a day in Las Vegas, I think Desert Rose is a perfect choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: CeeTeeandRay
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay. Quite pricey for a Saturday night, but worth it. We had 1 room suites and they were very spacious, lovely furnishings and very well equipped kitchen - the whistling kettle was good! The beds were very comfortable. Reception desk staff were also very helpful. The manager's reception was a great bonus - free wine, beer and snacks from 5-7 except for Saturday nights. Monorail stops at MGM Grand which is just across the road. Breakfast was good, plenty of variety but there was always a struggle to get a table - this needs to be sorted. Very nice, quiet small hotel. Plenty of parking.

Reviews.Title: “Smart Little Place”
Reviews.Author: Buzzsmum
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights after booking on Expedia. Having never been to Las Vegas before had no idea what to expect but this turned out perfect for us. The rooms were lovely and clean and spacious with a well equiped kitchen including an American size fridge and small freezer, for those who are thinking of a longer stay and don't want to eat out all the time. The pool area was also very clean and tidy and we had no trouble getting one of the many sun loungers spread round the pool. There were also table and chairs for those who prefer this. The area had sunny spots and shaded areas. The breakfast was basic but as mentioned the well equiped kitchen would allow plenty of scope for self catering. Other facilites included an on site laundry ideal for families with children. The location is at the south end of the strip with a 5 minute walk to the mono rail at MGM Grand hotel. There is no onsite bar or casino therefore is again ideal for families. I would go back to this resort and have no hesitation in recommending it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Locations”
Reviews.Author: deannaCanada
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Desert Rose and enjyed a relaxing time in the one bedroom condo. Spacious, clean, and inviting as well as being close to the MGM and airport. Our continental breakfast was served near the pool area. Deanna

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Tranquility”
Reviews.Author: KraftyKelly
Reviews.Content: We were looking for an off-strip hotel to relax while we took bus tours of Hoover Dam, Primm and Laughlin. This hotel met every expectation. The free complimentary breakfast was a definite bonus, as was the Manager's reception which offered the ability to mingle with other guests and have a good time. The musician was excellent. It is only a 15 minute walk to the Excalibur where most bus tours depart from. We loved the fact that the pool was open early and stayed open until 11 pm (another bonus). We were able to tour, come back and unwind at the manager's receiption and then jump in the hot tub to relax the sore leg muscles. The 2BR, 2 Bath suite was large and the bed linens top quality. The beds were absolutely the most comfortble we have slept in. Our room overlooked the pool which was a great view every morning while we sat on the outdoor balcony with our morning coffee. If you plan on staying longer and cooking, you will need to get to Albertsons by car or taxi to pick up food. The only downside to the hotel is that there are no "good" restaurants or convenience stores close by. An ABC store would have been great, or at least the hotel store should stock up on snack items. It had very little. WARNING! We booked this hotel for the fact that the pool was open late each night as we knew we could not use the pool during the day. One day while there the Front Desk posted a sign that the pool area had been booked by conventioneers - we found this very disappointing for an off-strip hotel to cater to conventioneers by closing the pool - that is what the convention rooms are for. We were ready to go to the Front Desk to complain, only to find out that the booking was no longer active and the pool remained open. I do not think that this hotel (which I believe are time share units) should be able to close a pool which the unitholders are paying for. If someone wants to book a pool area - tell them to book into a hotel on strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and all the amenties of home”
Reviews.Author: orfitnessdiva
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during a recent business trip to Las Vegas. The room was nicely decorated, clean, and spacious. Having a kitchen was a must and this place didn't disappoint. We even enjoyed the fitness facility, which had nice current equipment, the pool and BBQ. The continental breakfast was also better than most places we have stayed in the past. Will definitely consider staying here again when back in town.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time at the Desert Rose”
Reviews.Author: beatleslover11
Reviews.Content: Our stay was a short weekend stay but we had a great time and loved the resort. The pool was clean and a nice size. The breakfast was fine and happy hour was great! The rooms were clean and roomy and the resort staff were all very helpful and caring. The location of the resort is so close to the main drag that it was within walking distance but we rented a car as I am disabled from a recent surgery. The cost was very affordable also. This mini vacation was filled with happy memories.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 2 Weeks!”
Reviews.Author: glink124
Reviews.Content: We booked a 1 bedroom suite in the desert rose for two weeks Sept 10th thru 24th. The first good thing was the short (cheap) cab ride $13 plus tip. Check in was quick and easy, we where offered a choice of which floor we would like, we chose the third floor. Alocated to building 4 (at the northwest of the property) when we entered the room it was clean and everything we hoped for, full kitchen, fridge/freezer, dishwasher, microwave, cooker(stove and oven). Very comfortable (if slightly dated) living room area, L shaped couch, large tv with approx 30 cable channels, 5 disc cd player and 3.1 speaker system. Balcony has standard 2 chairs small table. Bed was comfortable and en-suite was good, vanity area was handy given the small size of the actual "bathroom", but it was more than enough. Also the in room safe was very handy. The free breakfast was good, ham, cereal, bread, bagels, fruit, yougurt, danish, tea/coffee and soft drinks ( bring one of the big cups from the room, styrofoam cups are way to small). The pool was good, gets busy early though and the bbq's are really good too. The resort itself is right next to Hooters casino, which has cheap table games and is no where near as tacky as I thought it would be. A 4 minute walk will have you at MGM Grand where you can get the monorail up the strip, handy when its hot. All up the Desert Rose was an excellent choice, will definitley stay again, and would recommend to anyone. Please view myuploaded photos of the Desert Rose Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the money”
Reviews.Author: drivelikejoewho
Reviews.Content: I visit the Desert Rose Resort every year. It is probably one of the best values in Vegas that I have found over the years. It is that reason that I return every year. They have one and two bedroom suites. This last trip I was trying to save money so we actually went to the Vons grocery store and picked up some food to make. I pretty much have nothing negative to say. They now include their complimentary cocktail service on Fridays for 5-7pm. It used to only be Sun-Thurs. Not sure if that is temporary. Breakfast is decent too. It won't "wow" you but it is a great option and it is free! The only problem I encountered on this trip was the refrigerator was warm when we got there and it took nearly a day to cool down. The freezer was cold though. I think they may turn them off to save electricity when nobody is using the room. I think I'll call ahead next time and ask them to check on it before I arrive to get a head start on the cooling process. Other than that, Desert Rose is right behind Hooters and Tropicana. The walk to MGM is maybe 10 minutes at the most. Not bad but it can be grueling in the summer heat. But that can't be avoided in Vegas. Oh and the rooms are much nicer than they were 2 or 3 years ago. The renovated them since I was first there about 4 or 5 years ago. It is like being at an apartment there. Much more confortable than a regular hotel room. And a full kitchen may not be necessary but it can come in hand. I would imagine it would be much more useful on a longer stay than just the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: lamberts52
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Vegas for four days and found this hotel suited us, having a two room suite. Is great for people who don't like the large hotels with casinos where smoking is available everywhere. The rooms were great but with the main downside being that there is no food store within easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my time at the Desert Rose Resort in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: vegaslover06
Reviews.Content: I visited the Desert Rose Resort a couple of months ago with a few buddies of mine and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We take a trip to Vegas annually, and this by far had the most space for a group of guys. The kitchen was fully equipped, the bathrooms were nice, and the beds were comfortable. Not to mention, there was a TV in each room. Additionally, there was a Happy Hour with funny music during the week, and the staff was very helpful to us with all of our reservations for shows, taxis, etc. The location was great being right across from MGM, so you still get a Resort vibe, while being walking distance to the Strip. Considering the location, the size of the room, you definitely get a good deal for your money as well. Will definitely stay here again and recommend it for anyone, especially those traveling with a group.

Reviews.Title: “Found Our New Favorite In Vegas”
Reviews.Author: mrsjest
Reviews.Content: We booked Desert Rose after seeing all the great reviews on this website and after going to the property's website and seeing the pricing was cheaper than Holiday Inn Express. Our three night stay which included a Saturday night came to $288 including taxes. The grounds, room decor, staff were all excellent. The concierge printed our boarding passes for free. Everything was clean, new and updated. The location was magnificent since we had a rental car. We could walk to MGM with ease or drive merely one block on Koval to all the strip hotels or down Reno to get to Mandalay/Luxor. Only downside was the air conditioner was a bit loud and the room upstairs could be heard running a bath quite loudly. Nothing that a pair of earplugs didn't fix.They do have drinks and snacks for free in the afternoons - beer was flat and warm, but the soda fountain worked fine. We did not take advantage of the continental breakfasts. WiFi was $10 per day. As long as we have a car in Vegas - and the prices remain great - we'll be staying at the Desert Rose.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: CalgaryGirl777
Reviews.Content: We loved this resort and wished we could have stayed longer. We stayed in the one bedroom unit and found the place to be emmaculate in decor and furnishings. Granite kitchen counter tops ,all the appliances to enjoy "a home away from home " feeling, stoneware dishes, etc .. Truly comforting. The kingsize bed was very comfortable.. The continental breakfast was great and we were able to sit outside on the patio to enjoy it. A morning dip into the pool was refreshing. I am a travel agent and have been in many different hotels in my life. I would recommend the Desert Rose when making Las Vegas your next vacation . It is located a block off the strip behind the Tropicana hotel and close to the MGM .. A definite !!

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: wally92
Reviews.Content: Our son made plans to get married in Vegas and while looking for places to stay we came across this place on the internet. We have stayed at the bigger hotels, but everything is so far away from the room and the price of the room was reasonable compared to the bigger hotels. We decided to give this a try and absolutely enjoyed it. Everyone was very courteous and the place was very clean. Also, is within walking distance to the strip. We attended the manager reception one night and enjoyed it. The continental breakfast was more than what I have seen at other hotels. Would highly recommend this place if you want to save on rooms. Would definitely come back again.

Reviews.Title: “delight at the desert”
Reviews.Author: geebeas
Reviews.Content: Great value for money.Comfortable good-size rooms fitted with all mod cons.Quiet setting just 5 minutes from the strip and monorail station.Pleasant compimentary breakfast and free beer,wine and snacks 5 nights a week.Helpful staff and concierge service.We would definetely return again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay”
Reviews.Author: KarenCornwall
Reviews.Content: I just completed my stay at the Desert Rose and I loved it all. Great location just five minutes from monorail. Room was amazing. Very clean and very beautiful. I loved everything and I have no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Great clean impressive Resort”
Reviews.Author: DarkBlueDundee
Reviews.Content: Stayed 12 nights nights this Sept. The suite was great, very well laid out with good quality furnishings, very clean and great beds. What was great about this resort was the staff, very helpful on any request that was asked of them and made you feel special. Went to the Managers night time party a couple of times which was something nice and different. The free breakfast in the morning, turned out to be ok, if you were on a budget, it would have been great, we went a couple of times, but it turned into, how much can my family get onto our plates and take up to our rooms from some American guests, without thinking about other guests requirements. If you require a typical great American breakfast, walk down the road to Tropicana and turn right away from Hooters 25 yards towards "Coco's" restuarant, for the best service and breakfast I have had in Las Vegas in a long while. Would I stay in the Desert Rose again, yes, yes, yes. We have been to Las Vegas 5 times in the last 6 years to all the best Strip hotels including the Belagio and this is best DEAL in town by a mile.

Reviews.Title: “"The Gilded Rose"”
Reviews.Author: Jersey_RN
Reviews.Content: All the reviews describing the beauty, comfort, excellent continental breakfast and happy hour of the Desert Rose are completely true. Rather than writing more about them, I would like to focus on the distinguished customer service that is at the heart of the Desert Rose. Through my travel agent, I had booked a two night stay followed by a one week tour of the National Parks. I was then to return to the Desert Rose after the National Parks for another six nights. I had requested a top floor room with an attractive view, but somehow my travel agent inadvertently did not relay this request to the Desert Rose. Traveling on my own I am often relegated to a ground floor room witha parking lot view unless I speak up. This did not happen at the Desert Rose, but the type of room I was seeking was not available. Not surprisingly, the hotel was filled almost to capacity. I spoke to the customer service manager, Mr. Jeffrey Owens, who listened to my concerns in an attentive and respectful manner. For my travails, he gave me a substantial discount and an upgrade to a large and beautiful multi-room suite. And yes, something similar was awaiting me upon my return from the National Parks. I would like to extend a most heartfelt "Thank You" to Mr. Owens and his kind and caring staff for making my vacation so special. While in Las Vegas the Desert Rose is the only place I would stay from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Better than a vegas hotel”
Reviews.Author: missgoodcookie
Reviews.Content: Ah and excellant is all I can say. Check in was fast and great. We had a 1 bedroom. It was our anniversary and friends also came to join us. All us ladies marveled and the clean equipted kitchen which got the guys to even cook for us. We all decided since we come to vegas often, having an apartment away from the noise and hustle and bustle of the strip is worth while. We will be back again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Ver Nice, good value”
Reviews.Author: knicholls
Reviews.Content: Very nice one bedroom suite. A separate living room / bed room is much appreciated for relaxing after a long day walking the strip. Continental brekfast is very basic and crowded. We elected to go to nearby coffe shops. Most resorts have free self parking garages, so we drove to the futher ends of the strip as opposed to the mono-rail

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: tdrice
Reviews.Content: I was in Las Vegas from September 17 through the 22nd and I must say that the Desert Rose excede my expecations. Everything about the resort was fantastic. It was clean, well kept up, friendly, and an all-around great experience. It's not far from the strip at all and it's just walking distance to MGM, Tropican, NY NY, and the Excalibur. We walked most of the time and took a short cut through the back of Hooters which lead to the parking lot of the Tropicana which made getting to the stirp a little quicker and easier. The 5-7 Manager special was a great fun, as was the breakfast and the pool. The Consierge was very helpful when I need to print information from the computer in the lobby. Other in our group stayed at the Tropicana and their rooms were terrible and they paid less, our room wan't that much more expensive but it was well worth the few extra bucks to get the 2 bedroom that we had.

Reviews.Title: “great staff”
Reviews.Author: furryfeet1
Reviews.Content: When we checked in to the hotel we were given a room that we discovered was very noisy as it was next to a busy street. We called the manager, Judy, the next morning and we were encouraged to select one of the rooms available that we would want to move to. The room we chose was very quiet. We were grateful that the manager was so responsive and pleasant. Also, the rest of the staff were consistently helpful and pleasant. The rooms were clean and in good, not great, material condition. I consider this an excellent value overall, especially since we were not subjected to casino noise and smells.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the room and location!”
Reviews.Author: noddy99
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Desert Rose just over a week ago for 4 days and had a fantastic time!! We were traveling with our 1 year old son and found the room and location to be perfect for us. We were pleased at the size of the room and had plenty of room for our travel cot and pushchair and various other baby items which was great. The kitchen was very handy and we enjoyed having the balcony (which had quite a high wall so we able to take the baby out with us!). The location was fantastic only a 5 minute walk to the strip and only a short taxi ride from the airport- the taxi fare was only $15 which we were quite happy with. The breakfast was basic but did the job and the drinks at night were a nice bonus. We loved this place and will definitely go back. The only slight problem we had was with being given a room that wasn't ready but we called down and it was sorted within 5 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: CarlosBc
Reviews.Content: We've been to Las Vegas many times and have always stayed at various properties on the strip. Decided to try something different this time and booked just off the strip at the Desert Rose. We were very impressed with the Desert Rose as a whole. The suites were comfortable and clean. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Free breakfast and Manager's reception were a definite bonus. Not much of a walk to the strip to take in all the action, but yet nice to come back to a quiet environment at the end of the day. We really enjoyed our stay and will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Cant Beat It For The Price”
Reviews.Author: Janzbro
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 13 days, a long time in Vegas but we had a great time. Location was fantastic only 2 min walk to hooters, 3 min more to MGM valet parking entrance (+ 2 min to Monorail station inside MGM) We were given a 3rd floor room, inside facing onto a small courtyard but it was noisy at times as the bedroom backed onto the corridor and trolley cases on the tiled floor in the early hours made quite a bit of noise - but we came prepared with ear plugs. The 1 bed apartment was large and clean, with a large sofa, flat screen TV's in lounge and bedroom, 4 seat dining table with a well supplied kitchen and very comfortable king bed. Air con was very good but very noisy,but I'd rather it be cool than quiet. Bathroom was little small but not a prolem as it had a sepearte sink worktop and mirror area before you entered the bathroom The laundry room had 2 washers and 2 driers (both cost 75 cents), powder available from the reception shop for $1 (1 load box) but the door lock to this was broken. The staff were all really good and we even had to turn the maid away a few times, but she still returned later on in the afternoon while we were out. The free cold breakfast was a nice touch with smoked ham, eggs, toast, bagels, cereals and coffee and orange on tap, but as always had the greedy filling there pockets after eating and bringing the massive mugs from their room down to fill up, so some items ran out early some days. There was also afternoon nibbles and wine & beer which some people appeared to have their alarm clocks set for as they were waiting for the freebies to be put out so they could stuff thier faces for free!!!! LOL Also forget about the pool unless your up for breakfast at 7am as people had a habit of reserving the beds with a towel (and I thought this was only a german thing), all beds were eventually occupied by the towel owners by 8.30 and the pool wasnt even supposed to open till 9am but that was the only real downside, still it was too hot and we had too much to do and see to worry much about that but a few hours round the pool would have been nice every now and then but Im on holiday and dont want to get up at crack of dawn just to get a sunbed.

Reviews.Title: “Simply outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: Frichel
Reviews.Content: My family and I truly enjoyed the hospitality and cleanliness of the resort. Rooms were a good size and the full kitchen came in very handy. The resort was near attractions and the price was definitely affordable. The only thing I would add would be more of a breakfast selection – perhaps charge a small fee. El Paso TX - Moreno

Reviews.Title: “Ideal!”
Reviews.Author: Soutenu
Reviews.Content: We were a family of 4 staying for 2 nights. The 1 bedroom suite we had was super, fully equipped kitchen, 2 TV's & plenty of space. Very clean, & our bed was huge and soooo comfortable. We enjoyed the happy hour with complimentary drinks, food & live music. Our children enjoyed the pool too. Breakfast time was quite busy but plenty of choice, even at the end. Helpful & friendly staff. The Strip was only 10 mins walk, but in the 109 deg temperature it seemed miles!! Family restaurants in the immediate area were limited to just one, but of course plenty of choice once you're on the Strip. We all enjoyed our time in Vegas without any gambling whatsoever - just made the most of all the free shows etc. The Desert Rose was ideal for this type of experience.

Reviews.Title: “best kept secret in vegas”
Reviews.Author: cymarron64
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Desert Rose Resort in Las Vegas in Sept. 08 We have been staying at this resort for the last 8 years , and you cannot beat the value you get here. We had a 2 room condo.with a full kitchen, balcony, free continental breakfast, free beer and wine and live entertainment from 5-7 almost every night. It's located within walking distance of all the major casinos. MGM, Luxor, New York New York etc. All this for $60/ night . You " can't be that with a stick ! "

Reviews.Title: “Wish I could stay longer”
Reviews.Author: sdnt
Reviews.Content: The moment I stepped into the reception area, I was welcomed with a warm greeting. We came right on time for the cocktail party. A glass of wine (free!) was like a drop of water in desert, for a group of 4 who had been on the road for 7 hours. The receptionist was friendly and told us everything we needed to know efficiently. The suite was clean, spacious, and really made us feel like home. (Although I think it would be better to have the bathroom accessible from the living room instead of the bedroom.) They've got everything you need, just like a furnished apartment, only better. The continental breakfast was great, with a lot of choices. The pool (could be larger) and workout room were also very clean and well equipped. We were totally relaxed and really enjoyed the time of our stay. The walk to the Strip was reasonably close. Overall we had a great experience. We are happy about the services we got for what we paid for. Will definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “4 years in a row”
Reviews.Author: bizopp
Reviews.Content: We highly recommend the Desert Rose for those who want to be near the action, but also like to get away from it all to recharge. Five min. walk from our annual conference at MGM. Time to unwind, swim, recharge. Booking even more rooms in '09 !

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Hairy_Baldman
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Desert Rose Resort for the last two years when attending the Photoshop World conference held at the Mandalay Bay. The stay was like having my own apartment in Vegas. The one thing I would change is I don't like paying for WiFi, but it was cheaper than at the MB. Thanks for a great stay and I hope to stay again the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: wdeejay
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from having spent 5 nights at the Desert Rose Resort, Las Vegas. We've always stayed in the large Strip hotels until now, but the Desert Rose Resort was absolutely terrific, easy to park and find our car, and not miles to walk to our room! All staff we encountered were very helpful and did their best to ensure we had a first class stay. Our suite was exceptionally well equipped with everything we could have needed for a stay of several weeks, including all crockery and cutlery, a full size cooker and microwave, together with fridge/freezer and dish washer. There was a very good full cold buffet breakfast, which was a little crowded on 2 of the 5 mornings we ate there, but we were always able to find a table to eat at. It was a delight to return to the hotel at the end of the day as, although it was only 2 blocks off the Strip, it felt so relaxed. We were concerned that it was close to the airport, but we didn't so much as hear a plane go overhead. This is an excellent hotel which is well managed and offers great value for money. We'll be going back next time we're in Las Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Nice getaway”
Reviews.Author: MTroperwife
Reviews.Content: In July, myself and four other women met in Vegas for a girls weekend. We arrived late at night, but were greeted by a lovely lady at the front desk. She processed everything in a timely matter, provided us each with a door/room key, and gave us an information sheet about the hotel. The lobby is a separate building with the outdoor pool in the middle of the all the surrounding buildings. There are doors that are key activated on each building as well as the outside gates. This key also opens your room door. Elevators are provided if you are on the second or third floor of your building. The room was very spacious. We had the two bedroom suite. Each had their own bathroom. One bath had a tub/shower combo, while the other had a huge walk-in shower with multiple shower heads. One room has a king bed while the other is a queen. The sectional sofa in the living room also folds out to a queen. The kitchen is very nice with updated appliances, granite coutertops and all the utensils and kitchen supplies you could possibly need. A small dining room is located just off the kitchen area. A small balcony is off the living room. Our room had a view of Mandalay Bay and surrounding area, but some rooms had a courtyard view only. A continental breakfast is provided every morning. Fresh fruit, bagels, cereal, and packaged danishes are just a few things offered. Many people chose to eat in the lobby or outside patio. Our group opted to make a few selections and take them back to our room. There is a concierge service in the lobby if you are needing assistance. The front desk will also call a cab for you if you need one as there is not a cab station. We found it easier to walk about a block to Hooters or the MGM for a cab. There is also a small diner and food mart about 2 or 3 blocks from the hotel on Tropicana Ave. The hotel provided happy hour on the weekend with prize drawings and karaoke. Make sure you keep your key card away from your other credit cards and cell phone as they will deactivate. We found this out the hard way in 109 degree weather.

Reviews.Title: “You should stay here”
Reviews.Author: Michael N
Reviews.Content: What an unexpected gem of a hotel. Having three kids we wanted somewhere where we could all stay in the same suite and yet still have some privacy. The big strip hotels were not suited to this so we found this hotel on trip advisor. To be honest we were expecting some motel like experience and a long walk to the attractions. Couldn't have been more wrong. It was the best hotel of the five we stayed in in California. We had a two bedroom apartment with two baths, 3 TV's, kitchen, balcony and spacious lounge, all within 200 yards of the strip. A lovely pool, complimentary breakfast and regular happy hour early evening (free beer, wine soft drinks and entertainment) added, all for the price of a single room in one of the big impersonal strip hotels. If you have kids and want a central located hotel don't go anywhere else. Note if you like perfect peace and quiet (well don't go to vegas for a start) but there was a little occassional noise from some guests returning to their rooms at all hours, but with the A/C on it was only occassionally intrusive. If this bothers you ask for an upper floor apartment or one away from the main entrances.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem!”
Reviews.Author: Debimail
Reviews.Content: Fantastic resort! We wouldnt even think about staying anywhere else after spending a week here. Located right behind the Tropicana and next to Hooters made it an easy 5min walk to the strip. We had a 2 bedroom apartment that contained everything we needed. Coin laundry in 3 of the 4 buildings require $1.50 total to wash and dry. Bring your own soap and quarters since there are no machines. The front desk has a little store where you can buy soap. The free breakfast every morning was very nice. If you want to take it back to your room, bring a sack or the platter from your room since none are provided. Happy hour from 5-7 was packed every night. We made friends with people from all over the US and Canada. We had the best times just hanging around the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay off the Strip”
Reviews.Author: JustforfunKelowna
Reviews.Content: Second time staying here. Great clean, comfortable accommodation. Walking distance to the strip but still off the Strip. Pool is not heated so it is too cold to use in the winter months.

Reviews.Title: “Desert Rose- an oasis in sin city!”
Reviews.Author: steff36
Reviews.Content: Fantastic resort and vacation! The suites were absolutely beautiful, the concierge team knowledgable and friendly. Our flight got in at 11 am and check-in was not until 4 pm, but they had our suite ready early and let us check in 5 hours early! Good sized kitchen, fully stocked with cooking untensils, nice patio with a view of Luxor's beam! Close enough to the strip to walk, but off the beaten path enough. No casino (which we preferred! Close enough to walk to the megahotels) and the resort had free happy hour from 5-7 with free beer, wine, sodas, and munchies! Live entertainment every other night. Gorgeous pool and hot tub, beautiful landscaping. The only mar was a big sales push to get timeshare for a ridiculous $24000. Would definitely stay there again and not attend the timeshare meeting even for the $100 in perks.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous non-casino hotle”
Reviews.Author: Janandfamily
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel conveniently situated just one block from the strip and the metro station. Great facilities and very comfortable and spacious for our family (2 adults + 2 teenagers). The breakfast buffet was adequate, shame about all the polystyrene waste though, would have preferred crockery to help save the planet.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Travelingirl02
Reviews.Content: Unbeatable value. Free breakfast each morning - get there early! Afternoon beer and wine along with snacks, conceigre service was fantastic. Nice pool area with gas grill available. My husband & I stayed for a week in May and we have another week reserved over New Year's. Will continue staying at Dessert Rose. Very short walk to Tropicana, MGM, Excalibur, Ny Ny ... With all of the walking one does in Vegas the 5 - 10 minute walk to any one of these casinos is nothing!

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: lvncristy
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect place to stay. It is close to the strip but yet far enough for privacy and comfort. This place was recomende by a co-worker and we LOVED IT as soon as we stepped in the room. Every time I go back to Vegas this will be the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic Find”
Reviews.Author: MrsAYorkshireUK
Reviews.Content: We decided to go to Las Vegas to get married so we searched the web for hotel's etc and came across "The Desert Rose Resort" it looked very nice from the picture's. We was totally shocked when we actually arrived thought as the desert rose was amazing and after going into a few of the big hotel/casino's we knew we had got the better deal where accomodation was concerned as in the larger hotel's you only got a room with your bed and a bathroom, where as our apartment had everythink and more !! The free continetal breakfast was more than ample with a very wide variety to choose from, there was snacks & cold drinks throught out the day and every evening there was a "manager's special" which was beer,wine & snacks all of which was FREE ( there is no bar though but dont let this put you off ) It was less than a 5 minute walk to the strip and if you walked onto the strip you could get a "deuce" bus which ran 24hrs a day and was only $5 for a 24hr ticket, very good if you wanted to get on and off at various hotel's/casino's on the strip ( will say that it isn't the quickest mode of transport though so if you in a hurry or need to be somewhere for a certain time do not use ) Best place for steak has got to be "Outback" ( next to M&M world ) you will not be disappointed trust me !! Must see's whilst there is "The Secret Garden" inside the Mirage ( dolphins & white lion's & tigers ) the top of the Straitaphere Tower is a must aswell and if you feeling brave then go on all 3 ride's on the top of the tower they are fantastic !! Go down town if you have time as Freemont Street is amazing, especially the light show's above you.....Don't bother going to circus circus "adventure dome " as it is a waste of money and it takes less than an hour to go on all the ride's. We are already planning our next trip to "The Desert Rose" trust me people you will not be disappointed with this hotel it is AAA* in our eye's I could go on somemore but I will let you make up your own mind's. Happy holiday's Mr & Mrs Ashford Hull, Yorkshire, UK

Reviews.Title: “A great stay”
Reviews.Author: donco
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 3 nights Aug 8-11. It is a very nice resort just like most of the other reviews say, we didn't have any problems other than the bedroom tv quit working and it was fixed pronto. They offer a continental breakfast that is enough to keep you going till lunch and Von's supermarket is about a mile east, not walking distance when its 105. It is easy walking distance to the strip and very safe, even in the early hours. If I had one complaint it would be that the pool is small but not a big deal and of course you always have the lounger hogs that throw there towel on then disappear for a few hours. I would surely go their again

Reviews.Title: “Great! (If you MUST be in Vegas)”
Reviews.Author: JabberwockyBeast
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for gambling, drinking, smoking, crowds & Vegas glitz, DON'T stay at the Desert Rose. If, on the other hand, you're looking for a relaxing retreat that offers easy access to The Strip, then this place fits the bill. Just behind Tropicana and next to Hooters. 3 minute walk to MGM Grand lobby. 5 minute walk to Luxor & Excalibur. Great rooms, well kept and responsive staff. 2-bdrm suites are smaller at corners of buildings. Middle suites are larger (i.e. xx02 room #s). We had 5 rooms (family reunion) so we could compare all types of rooms. Some bathrooms not as clean as they should be, but well appointed. Nice shower stall in master bath with glass doors and body sprays in 2-bdrm. Doesn't offer four pools with water slides and hundreds of people - just a nice, quiet pool to relax. Could use better towel control and clearing them from unused chairs. Missing a place to put used towels when leaving. "Breakfast" is very limited and very crowded from 8 to 9 (when they quickly take everything away). They could keep breakfast until 10am, considering this is a late night town. Staff is very helpful and eager to help. Had to call engineering for three issues - squeaky doors, dead phones & faucet prob in bathroom - which were met with quick response and resolution. WIFI is not free, which is a downside. A car is helpful if you don't want to stay in The Strip area. Once breakfast is cleared, the lobby is a nice place to sit and read except for the noise from the front desk and Concierge - sound bounces everywhere. All in all, the Desert Rose is a great place to stay if you're looking for a relaxing stay that's not in the center of the hustle & bustle, but close enough to jump in when you'd like.

Reviews.Title: “A Place more comfort than home”
Reviews.Author: BeachWalker13
Reviews.Content: The grounds and room were lovely. Kitchen well stocked. Felt very secure on grounds. Very clean and staff helpful. It was at the end of our vacation and everything including morning continental breakfast and happy hour in lobby was a good way to mix with other guests. We look forward to our nexr stay.

Reviews.Title: “great place, close to the strip”
Reviews.Author: jday105
Reviews.Content: Was pleasantly surprised by the property. Accommodation's were very nice, convenient to the strip, within walking distance to most things and to the monorail. Nightly happy hour had strange snacks compared to most other places that I have stayed but the beer was cold. I would stay here again next time I am in Las Vegas and recommend it to anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “Best cost-benefit ratio in Vegas!!!”
Reviews.Author: Worldcitizen1994
Reviews.Content: I spent a week in this hotel and I realized that I had a great deal!!! Beautifull hotel, great rooms, excellent service, breakfast for everyone, etc, etc... so many good things for a really low price. I'm going back for winter season. Never will look for any other hotel in Vegas. :)

Reviews.Title: “A rose by any other name”
Reviews.Author: Taralulu
Reviews.Content: If you are travelling in a party of 3 or 4 take taxis in Vegas- they are cheap and plentiful and more useful than the monorail (expensive and stations long walk from destinations) or bus (sardines). The drivers we used, however, did not seem to know the name of the "desert rose" (it was formerly called something else) and inevitably the direction we gave was "behind Hooters". But that in no way reflects their respective merits. Des Rose was a des res for a family with children on a few days trip to Vegas. Accommodation spacious and comfortable; pool clean and open all hours (it seemed) ; hotel conveniently located; parking free and easy; and staff helpful.A significant added bonus was the complimentary breakfast (7-10am) which while basic was good. It does,however, tend to be a bit of a feeding frenzy towards the end so to avoid indigestion I would suggest get in before 9 and take supplies back to the room.( At least thats what the Germans did). A similar observation falls to be made in relation to the manager's happy hour in the early evening though perhaps at a slightly more sedate lace with a max of 2 glasses of wine per person at a time.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: tilbee
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Desert Rose for 2 days before taking a Grand Canyon river rafting trip and 1 day afterwards. The location is just off the strip about a 5-10 minute walk to the MGM. The resort is nice but showing a little wear and tear as it seems to be popular with families. The pool is relatively small and seemed to be crowed most of the time. The free breakfast and evening snacks were nice but not exceptional. Overall, this is a nice place to stay for the value.

Reviews.Title: “We Love the Desert Rose!”
Reviews.Author: WinnipegTeachers
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at The Desert Rose for a 1-week block in July for the past 4 consecutive years. We love it.!!! During our last stay we found that the room was clean and spacious, and the staff was fantastic. We went to the pool every morning and also took in the free breakfast provided. The location is also IDEAL...just a short block to Hooters, and MGM Grand. We will definitely stay here again, and we will recommend this resort to friends and family. You can't go wrong by booking at Desert Rose.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: L0ngh0rnTraveler
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a long weekend at The Desert Rose. The resort is a homey southwest U.S. style convenient to casinos, restaurants and shopping. The concierge was helpful & the rest of the staff was vary friendly. We stayed on the ground level in a 2 bedroom/2 bath suite with a large living area, small patio and full kitchen. The continental breakfast had numerous offerings, the pool was tranquil- although a little small - It was a popular place during the day. We paid $149 per night for a suite which we thought excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mochabob
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews I booked are honeymoon stay here and we had an awesome time!!!!! The staff was perfict are room was perfict my wife and I enjoyed 7 wonderful days here. Its a short walk to the strip but if you want to get around a bit I would recomend renting a car google a grocery store aka vons albertsons if you plan on getting food and other things its alot cheaper than a cab ride or any of the little mini marts.

Reviews.Title: “Desert Rose--perfect for Bachelorette Party!”
Reviews.Author: bkimberly
Reviews.Content: I booked two two-bedroom suites at Desert Rose for my best friend's bachelorette party. It was the perfect place for that type of event. We put four women in each room and everyone had plenty of space. Having two bathrooms per room made it so much easier for all the women to get ready to go out in the evenings. We also loved having the kitchenettes because we could bring lots of beverages to enjoy before we went out or to take down to the pool. The rooms were all clean, but some of the furnishings were a bit old. Beware that check-in and check-out is very slow. Also, you must call a cab to come there and pick you up.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: ShakhJitendra
Reviews.Content: Excellent!! It was no less than a suite!! You have your own beautiful kitchen, dining, living, bedroom, walk-in-closet and a small patio for just 70$ per night!! The service and the staff was excellent! Breakfast was also very good. Since this is lil inside from the main strip, walking to the strip would be a pain if you dont have a car. If you are driving down to Vegas, I would strongly recommend this. We stayed for 6 nights at this place. It was an excellent experience.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: giovanniBreckenridge
Reviews.Content: Quiet condo accomodations. good pool. free breakfast. Fixed phone quickly when there was a problem. It was great to be with in a close walk of the strip and all the big hotels and not deal with the hassle of the masses of people, smoke, distance from your car to your room,noisy slot machines etc. Was just what I wanted for a business trip in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, would recommend”
Reviews.Author: bobmcc33
Reviews.Content: With 3 kids in tow, we were looking tor a property which could fit us all in, and give us some flexibility to cook our own meals. And it had to be a good price. This place fitted the bill perfectly. With a 2 Bedroom Suite there was plenty of room, and the kitchen was a great size. We even found time to have a swim in the pool. The strip was a short walk, which was lucky since it was 110 degrees... The monorail is also just a short walk away. It was really good that we didn't need a car, although the nearest grocery store was a couple of miles away, there is a gas station just up the road for snacks etc. Front desk was great, as was the on-site concierge. Breakfast was a bit of a zoo, but once we had found seats it was great, and the kids could eat and drink at their own pace. Very close to the airport, $12 by cab. All in all, I would recommend this place for people with kids, saves on getting 2 rooms on the strip and is plenty big enough.

Reviews.Title: “super”
Reviews.Author: betty123Seaham
Reviews.Content: my wife and i have stayed there twice in 2006&2007 and reallyhad a good time its very handy for the strip it was a bit dark outside at night they could do with a bit more lighting but we didnt feel unsafe all in all very good time we are going back in nov thisyear2008

Reviews.Title: “Just what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: HUNTINGPARTY
Reviews.Content: Booked here for our last 3 nights on a tour of the area and it was just what we wanted. We booked a 2 room apartment that meant all of us could have our own space and there was plenty of room to chill out in. Kitchen was well equipped although we didn’t use much more than the kettle. Also, having the 2 bathrooms was nice. Had forgotten about the breakfast by the time we got there so that was a nice bonus, saved us a few $$s every day and meant that we could have as much or as little as we wanted. Took a little exploring but we discovered easy routes to our room via the stairs and security locked doors. Also made use of the laundry facilities – we were in building 1 but I think there are laundry rooms in each building. It was a bit noisy when someone moved in upstairs but it sounded like they were jumping and kicking. The air conditioning didn’t cool the bedrooms that well if you left the doors closed – but after a bit of trial and error we managed to set it to a good temperature for our son on the sofa bed & by keeping the doors open the bedrooms were cooler too. Didn’t try the pool but it looked very busy and a lot of the sun-beds were ‘bagged’ by about 9.00. It is really close to the MGM / Luxor / Tropicana end of the strip and it is nice to be away from the glitz. We walked to & from the strip several times and I felt reasonably safe. Would definitely recommend this as a place to stay – particularly if you have under 18s.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: slnewton
Reviews.Content: The resort was clean, quiet and met our expectations. The only complaint would be the mix up after checking in. All customer service representatives working the front desk should all be on the same sheet of music. Upon check in the lady that service me, told me that our bill would be paid upon checkout. I found out a couple of days later that the hotel was billing my credit card each day of our stay. Upon speaking with another rep at the desk, he told me that our bill should have been paid upon check-in which I specifically ask the lady upon check-in and she assured me that I would paid upon checkout. Also the television in the master bedroom was on a timer or some sort and it continuously shut off and had to be unplugged to reset it per the maintenance guy that showed up after calling the front desk. I enjoyed the happy hour and the pool. The resort is not on the strip but the walk was not too bad considering the 110 degree heat. Overall I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “As it says on the tin!”
Reviews.Author: Roy Little
Reviews.Content: I'm always wary of seeing too many great reviews for a hotel, but trusted my instinct on them this time. Thankfully, all the great reviews were justified and we have come back from a wonderful holiday at Las Vegas. Added to the fact that we paid a ridiculously low price for the place, this has got to be the best hotel deal we have ever had. The staff at the resort could not have been any more helpful and the one bedroomed appartment we rented was superb. Sure, the air conditioning was a tad noisy, but it was such a minor thing, it's the only semi negative thing I could find with the entire place. The only slight problem we did have (and this has absolutely nothing to do with the resort) is that on each of our trips to the strip, we had to go through "Hooters" car park. The smell in places was disgusting (sewage smell). Other than taking a different and longer trip round the other direction or holding our noses, their is no way of avoiding this. If we were to go back to Vegas, we'd definatley use this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend for families w/kids only”
Reviews.Author: L15nene
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel based on reviews we read on tripadvsior.com. The resort itself is more family oriented as there are a ton of kids on the grounds. The (small) pool area was constantly full with kids. When we would decide to head down to the pool area, we were rarely lucky to find a spot to lay since the area is somewhat small compared to the bigger hotel pools on the strip. This hotel is not on the strip, but it is very close - a couple blocks from the luxor, (you can walk through the back lot of MGM), although I don't think I would recommend anyone doing this at night unless your with a large group. The lay out of the hotel is also a little annoying. Our first night there we had to circle around the block to find an entrance way as a chain would be put up towards the side we were located (Building 3) at night and we would have to park our rental car near the first entrance and walk around the building to get to our room. The room layout was pretty nice though. Every room has a fridge, stove, microwave, and other kitchen amenities which was nice if you want to save some money on food. The continental breakfast is pretty decent , although this was packed with people every single day and we were amazed to see so many kids here. The front desk staff was very helpful and so was housekeeping. I would recommend this place for families with kids under 18 only. I think next time we return to Vegas we'll definitely consider somewhere on the strip and larger pool area as the sweltering vegas heat makes it a necessity for all to get some "refreshing" pool time.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location & Quiet”
Reviews.Author: Aleanza
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to Las Vegas, didn't want the hassle of casino life with small child in tow, opted to stay at the Desert Rose being non-gambling. Very pleasant introduction driving in, reception staff at the ready and polite, very quick check-in. Conceirge was pleasant and helpful. Booked a 1 bdrm condo, very pleasant and clean. Beds were very comfortable include pull-out in lounge. Kitchen handy to prepare own meals with full size fridge a plus. Picked up groceries at local Vons supermarket located about 4mls on Tropicana Ave, use of BBQ/grills located in pool area for guest cooking as well. Room was located away from swimming pool so was quiet from any noise. Found the aircon to be very loud and set on one speed, need better vents into bedroom/bathroom as these 2 areas can be warm. There are laundry rooms in each of the blocks for guest use, be aware housekeeping also use these facilities. Pool area is very pleasant, can be a wee crowded at times, but otherwise manageable. Big size pool towels are few and far between, weren't enough available and no replenishing of these towels thru out day, only available towels were teatowel sizes. Despite limited towels, you dry off quick enough. There is a Happy Hour each day, providing drinks & nibbles and some cases giveaway prizes. Tried breakfast once, was very basic, wasn't enough tables, so head back to the room. Didn't rush back during our stay. Resort location is a plus, only a short walk to MGM Grand to catch the monorail, or venture by foot to see the sights, or drive and park your vehicle at any major casino for free, or $2 fee for valet parking. Overall our stay was a memorable one, and the location of this resort was a definite plus, close enough without the strip noise. With the airport so close as well, no aircraft noise was heard. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Family152
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at the Desert Rose after flying into Las Vegas, having booked it on the basis of TripAdvisor reviews. We stayed in a two bedroom suite overlooking the Strip, which was only a short walk away, es[pecially if you cut through the MGM Grand. The rooms were spacious and the bedrooms clean, although the dining table had clearly not been cleaned for some time - it was sticky. We did not have any problems with noise, or with the air conditioning, and the staff at reception were helpful booking taxis etc. The hotel was actually very quiet and peaceful - an oasis compared with the bustle of the Strip. Breakfast was very basic but adequate. There was juice, coffee, tea and milk, with a range of cereals, eggs, pre-packed Danish pastries, bagels and cream cheese, apples and oranges. We would be happy to return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value for families”
Reviews.Author: Luv2cruzWkids
Reviews.Content: I searched for a long time to find a location and accomodation just like this one. My husband and I were traveling to Las Vegas with our three children and most hotels forced you to get two hotel rooms. Even some suite properties could only accomodate four people. At the Desert Rose there was room for everyone with a two bedroom suite and pullout sofa bed, that was actually comfortable for our teenager. Two bathrooms plus a full kitchen were great additions. The daily breakfast buffet saved us lots of money by avoiding restaurants for that meal. The buffet included mini-bagels, bread for toast, ham, whole fruit like oranges, apples, or bananas, danishes, cereals with milk, yogurt, and hard boiled eggs. There were three or four juice types plus a coffee machine that could do anything including a decaf cappucino!

Reviews.Title: “Average Stay, Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bballmom8
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a stay at the Desert Rose Resort. We were in Las Vegas for a national basketball tournament for our 15 year old son. My parents also came to see him play so we reserved a two bedroom, two bath suite. This hotel was just okay. The room size worked out well for us but I think we would have been better off just reserving two rooms at one of the hotels on the strip. The air conditioning didn't work that well, the living room was cool but the bedrooms were both very warm. I was also at the front desk when another customer was complaining about their air conditioning not working. The Tv in one of the bedrooms kept shutting off and wouldn't turn on. This happened four times and maintenance had to come to re-set the tv each time. The continental breakfast which was another reason we booked this hotel was probably one of the worst I have run across. Dry cereal, bagels, and toast. I saw one review commenting on this and saying "what do you expect for free". But if it's offered as an amenity at the hotel it really should be a decent breakfast. I've seen better at your basic hotel than the one offered here. They clean everyday which I wasn't sure of because of the property being a time share, but they don't do a really great job. I had to keep setting the trash can out in the middle of kitchen so they would empty it. The front desk service was fine other than their computers being down. We have stayed at the New York New York twice before for other events and I will definitely stay there or at another hotel on the strip when we go back.

Reviews.Title: “Desert Rose Great”
Reviews.Author: verspenc
Reviews.Content: Get place to stay and great customer service. Two bedroom suite very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Desert Rose!!”
Reviews.Author: TAReviewerSouthTX
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at the Desert Rose for 3 nights. I loved that it is still on the strip, but away from the main part of the action. We paid $70 a night and enjoyed their complimentary breakfast. This was such a great deal for a nice, clean and spacious hotel room with tons of amenities. I would definitely stay here again and highly recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “What a Blessing!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tinamariew
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with the accomodations. I was concerned at first because we paid up front and were not able to get refunded if something happened. We stayed in room 2108. It had a full kitchen with everything you need to cook or bake, one room with a king size bed, one room with a queen size bed, a family room with a sofa bed that could sleep 3 people, 2 full bathrooms, walk-in closets, and a dining area. It is what it says and more. It is perfect for a family. I highly recommend it and intend to stay there again myself.

Reviews.Title: “Great little apartment hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yobabs
Reviews.Content: My 12-year-old son and I arrived at the Desert Rose on Friday, June 11th, 2008, for an 8-night stay. I’d checked out the property on a previous trip to Las Vegas, and I’d red numerous Tripadvisor reviews, so I felt good about our choice. My son was attending a week-long event at the Mirage, but their rooms are too expensive for us, plus we liked the idea of having more space, including a full kitchen. We paid less than $700 for the 8-night stay. The hotel is arranged in four buildings, each of which houses a quarter of the 200 guest rooms. I believe that only one of the buildings is accessible directly through the lobby. With the others (such as ours), you use your room key to open either a security gate or an outside door, and then you can get to any of the rooms in that building. (Note: if you’re traveling with a large group, it will definitely be more convenient if you’re all in the same building. Well, of course, that’s assuming you like the group.) Within a building, the rooms are arranged on three floors, with a sort of a central courtyard, but the courtyard is just gravel and a few bushes, i.e., not very interesting. There are concrete hallways to get to some of the rooms, leading to carpeted hallways to get to others, but even the carpeted hallways are more or less open-air. I believe that all of the rooms have small balconies, each with a couple of chairs and a small table, but since the view from ours was of the tiny courtyard (and of everyone else’s balcony), we didn’t really use it. We arrived at about four-thirty in the afternoon, but the line was short and check-in was quick. The check-in clerk noticed our request for no down bedding (I am allergic to feathers); she put us in a room on the third floor of building 2, and asked housekeeping to replace the bedding. By the time we got to the room (maybe five minutes later), the housekeeping staff was already there to take care of the change; I was impressed at their efficiency. My son absolutely loved our room, which was basically like a little apartment. The kitchen was well-provided with cookware, utensils, glassware, plates, etc. Appliances included a toaster, a blender, a coffee-maker, and a mixer (that’s in a drawer), as well as full-sized fridge, oven/cooktop, dishwasher and microwave. All rooms, except for the toilet/shower room, were of a good size, and well-appointed. There is an anteroom to the toilet/shower room that has a sink, huge mirror, and maybe six square feet of counter space – plenty of room. I ended up setting up my laptop computer on the bathroom vanity, where it was convenient but out of the way, and had a small bench seat that tucked into a knee-hole. I believe there is just one smallish elevator in each of the four buildings, but since there are only about 50 rooms per building, with a third of them on the ground floor anyway, there was never much of a wait for the elevator. We bought groceries for the week (we had a rental car, without which this would have been difficult). When we put the cold stuff into the fridge, we found that the fridge door wouldn’t stay shut (it didn’t close well when the fridge was empty, and the problem was worse when the fridge door had stuff on its shelves). We phoned maintenance and a man came up immediately to fix it. So again, the housekeeping/maintenance folks were efficient. Our maid tended to forget to replenish both the dishwasher detergent and the bath gel, and she seldom left us any hand-towels. I think she even forgot to vacuum for several days. When I called down for dishwasher detergent, they sent some right up; I didn’t bother with the other issues. We had a couple of maintenance problems (e.g., the toaster didn’t work, and the drawers on the TV stand really wanted to slide open), but in general, anything that wasn’t just right was put right immediately upon reporting it. I must say that we did find the hotel to be a bit noisy, especially at night. I don’t think the sound insulation was very good, as we could frequently hear other guests moving around, running in the corridors, or even, in one case, greeting one another loudly, from their balconies, at midnight. My son slept in the living room, and the noise of the air conditioner going on and off kept him awake the first couple of nights, but then he got used to it. The hotel is quite close to the airport, but we weren’t really troubled by airport noise. I used earplugs to shut out the noise of the other guests, and that worked well. Breakfast was fine.
