You could take it back to your room to eat (as we did), but please note that they don’t provide trays for that. (I’m assuming that’s to discourage folks from taking enough to feed the neighborhood.) We’d brought a couple of small plastic trays from home, so after the first morning, I just brought a tray with me when I went to pick up breakfast. They consistently offered boiled eggs, yogurt, bagels and cream cheese, bread, butter, jam, cereals and packaged pastries. They usually also had rolled slices of ham, along with mustard and mayo packets. One morning, they had lox. The coffee machine made cappuccinos and lattes (regular and decaf). There were also tea bags available. The crowd at breakfast was usually not too big for the area, except for one day, when, for some reason, there was a real mob. We did go down to the little happy hour a few times, but it wasn’t anything to write home about. One night, the snacks were tortilla chips, salsa and cheese cubes; on another night, there was a large bowl of pasta salad and another of crackers. The pasta salad wasn’t really anything you could take away as you wandered toward the strip, but I think maybe that was the point, as the “happy hour” appears to be somehow tied in to the timeshare thing (they wanted you to hang around in the lobby so they could try to sell you a timeshare). They served alcohol (I’m assuming just beer and wine) from a service window in the lobby, and the soft drink machine was turned on during happy hour, so you could help yourself to that. And there was a guy playing a keyboard, singing, and telling very tired jokes. In another review, the writer complained about being bothered by messages from the concierge about picking up their “welcome packet,” and how, when they finally went down to get the packet, it was just a bunch of brochures. We had a message from the concierge every morning, giving the weather forecast and reminding us that we could stop by for our packet. It was clearly just a group voicemail, so I listened to the forecast and blew off the rest. There were also occasional concierge messages to remind us of the evening happy hour; in that one, there was generally some mention of a raffle to give away a trip. I didn’t want to get roped into a timeshare hard-sell, so I didn’t check it out. There is a guest laundry room in building 2. I think it’s the only one on the property, but I’m not sure. The washer and the dryer each required 3 quarters. (Note: there was no change machine in the laundry room, but you can get change at the front desk.) I brought laundry detergent and dryer sheets with me (again, due to allergies), but a sign did indicate that laundry detergent was available in the tiny convenience store in the lobby. The wash took maybe 30 minutes, and the dry maybe 40. The room and machines were clean and in good condition. The hotel apparently contracts with an outside company to provide wireless internet service. It costs $9.95 per day, and I think the day ends at 4:00 pm. The service, provided by Wayport, worked fine. I’d be giving the Desert Rose a 5 if it weren’t for the maid service and the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Luv!!! the Desert Rose Resort”
Reviews.Author: naughtymama
Reviews.Content: Absolutely Fabulous. You know that saying, “you get what you pay for”, well not true in this case. The price we paid for the room was VERY reasonable. For what you get, really no where on the strip will you find a room like at the Desert Rose. The bed is very comfy and I find myself really looking forward to sleeping on it because I sleep quite well. How often can you say that about sleeping in a bed other than your own? The kitchen is fantastic. It’s helpful if you are watching your dollars. You can cook some meals in and then head out for some fun. With each unit you get an awesome breakfast. What a great way to start your day. The Desert Rose is conveniently located just a short walk to the famous Las Vegas strip next to the Hooters Hotel and Casino. From the minute I arrive to the time I check out I find myself showered with magnificent customer service all the way from the font desk to the wonderfully hard working housekeeping staff. I really find it hard not to feel at home when I stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again...”
Reviews.Author: tribsp
Reviews.Content: As many have written, I wasnt sure what to expect. We were getting a great deal via Shell Vacations. I based my final decison to stay here on many of the reviews I read in tripadvisor. Overall our experience was good. We would stay here again without question. It is a very modest place to stay but is great option if you dont want to stay anywhere on the strip or want the option of having an insuite kitchen for home cooked meals. Von's (Safeway-so bring your card to get the discounts) is 6km down Trop ave. In the hot summer months like July I would ask for a 2-3rd floor room. There were crickets all over the grounds. While we were there they were doing regular pest control but it only involved the main floor. The breakfast (free) was okay, nothing special but good considering its free. Be sure to be ther early as food can run out. It can also be quite crowded, but maybe this varies with the time of year? It took about 10min to walk to the strip. We walked around Hooters until we were on Trop. AVE. We walked this route many times and it wasnt really an issue. FYI- Dan Marino's Restaurant in Hooters-is good. Their sandwiches are huge and can be easily split for two. (esp. Stripdip-prime rib). $9.99 Breakfast buffet was great. Good value for the money. The only issue I had with the stay was there was 4 of us sharing a 1 bedroom suite to save a few dollars. 2 problematic issues..the first is that in the 1 bedroom suite there is only 1 bathroom that is off the matster bedroom. Hence if you are sharing means sneaking through the bedroom whether the room is occupied or not. The second issue is that I trusted the hotel when I asked if the "sleeper couch" was comfortable....NOT. We even tried removing the mattress and placing it on the floor....still sucked. If the quality of sleep is important to you then upgrade to a 2 bedroom like we did.... Never used the pool....but there were many others. There is a tiny convenience stool in the main lobby. There are a few things there if you feel inclined to grab a snack Staff were friendly...and yes this property is very family oriented.

Reviews.Title: “Desert Rose rocks!”
Reviews.Author: ontheroadster
Reviews.Content: Hurrah for a clean, well located and nice hotel in Las Vegas! No blinking chirping machines, no come ons, no bothersome offers. We were so impressed with the quiet and reserved aspect of our stay at the Desert Rose Resort in Las Vegas - I will never use another hotel in LV. Friendly staff, clean rooms, a nice pool plus a secure atmosphere all contributed to a lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Toronto Review”
Reviews.Author: Iluvtotravel123
Reviews.Content: Las Vegas ---Nevada-----Desert Rose Resort---July 2008 If Marco Polo in the pool is your thing with the kids then a stay at the Desert Rose in Las Vegas is ideal for you and the family and many kids. The pool was a "must-go" for all the kids at the hotel. The kids loved being at the pool till it closed at 10 or 11 at night. Not to mention the free continental breakfast. The kids devoured as many muffins as they desired. There was only a little bit of screaming, crying and running around in the main lobby area. The suites are worth the price. They were clean and very spacious. I loved the microwave and fridge---came in very handy. The staff were courteous and pilote and always most helpful. The only thing the room needed was ummmmm...... a flat screen TV. Maybe even high def, as well. All in all, I would go back to the Desert Rose for a stay in Vegas. Good, but not great.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Desert Rose”
Reviews.Author: AceOnTheRiver
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed 3 nights the Desert Rose in a 2 bedroom unit. Good amount of space and the rooms were very clean. Nicely equipt kitchen. Location is in short walking distance to the strip and the monorail. The Continental Breakfast was good and the staff was very helpful. The rooms were quiet. I recommend the Desert Rose for anyone who wants a quality place to stay in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: fun_time_vegas
Reviews.Content: Our Stay was great. We experienced good service and the rooms were excellent and met our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Property”
Reviews.Author: rpjones68
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights with 3 buddy's on a weekend poker trip. We had room in the 2 BR suite for all of us and it was clean and quiet off the strip. We booked the early bird summer special so the price was right! The breakfast was good, pool area nice and the happy hours were ok. Would certainly stay there again! The reviews are accurate.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: patsyflo
Reviews.Content: Two friends and I met in Las Vegas for a get-together. We were so fortunate to have found the Desert Rose Resort, as it really met our needs. We wanted to stay off the Strip, but not so far away that it would be a drive to get there. The Desert Rose was perfect! We were so close, but didn't have the hassle of walking out the hotel door and into a mob of people. Our room was beautiful (two-bedroom, two-bathroom) with one king bed and two twins. The kitchen was nice-- we could keep cold drinks, etc. in the refrigerator, and even cook if we wanted to. The continental breakfast was a great added feature-- we didn't need to go out and find somewhere to eat and it was enough to hold us until lunchtime or later. The room was nice and quiet, the staff was very friendly and helpful. The bed and pillows were super comfortable. The parking was great-- not a hike to the car like in the big hotels. We just loved the Desert Rose and will be returning with our husbands next time!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort!”
Reviews.Author: Ridingfun
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful resort for those looking to have a top notch room with benefits an amenities not found with strip resorts. This resort offered our family a wonderful pool atmosphere, barbecue area, and room quality that was and is family oriented. Our family would recommend this resort for those looking to enjoy there resort as much as enjoy Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: KenNguyen
Reviews.Content: I booked at Desert Rose Resort for my trip to Las Vegas on June 24, 2008 after reading the reviews online. What I got was exceeding my expectation, friendly staff, nice and clean room for the price I paid for, exellent room service, swimming pool & fitness area are very comfortable, breakfast was good and plentiful. I would surely come back in the future, and also recommend to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Incredible Lodging”
Reviews.Author: warmfrost
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated our 20th anniversary at The Desert Rose. It is is a Las Vegas oasis! When we entered our room, it was clean, cool and inviting. After our 7 night stay, it was confirmed what a restful experience we had. After visiting every hotel on The Strip, the casinos all begin to look the same, and the crowds were quite encroaching over the July 4th weekend. We were always able to park close to our room with our rental car, or rest quietly between walkabouts. The continental breakfast was approximately the same every day, which after about 5 days had my husband longing for some bacon and scrambled eggs. I, on the other hand think the Desert Rose breakfast offering to be perfect for starting a fast paced day; there was plenty of cereals, milk, boiled eggs, bagels, luncheon meats, instant oatmeal, pastry, yogurt, fresh fruit, coffee, juice, soda, toast... I thought the selection was copious, light, and incredible. My advice is to go early, and enjoy relaxing at a table. Whenever we came in closer to closing time, it appeared more hectic, but we never experienced a crowed at 6:30 or 7 AM. All this for the cost of our room, which saved us A LOT on our food budget. The front desk staff was accessible and polite. The concierge appeared to be doing more than just being helpful; I think they also sell Shell Vacation Memberships, although I didn't sense a lot of pressure, as you sometimes do on The Strip, to listen to their sales pitch. We were able to have our airline boarding pass printed at the concierge desk, and were very appreciative of that. If we ever head back to Vegas, I'm sure we'd seek out the Desert Rose again for value and quality!

Reviews.Title: “Desert Rose - Excellent for Families”
Reviews.Author: annieplum
Reviews.Content: We booked a two-bedroom suite at Desert Rose over the 4th of July holiday. We stayed for 8 days. This Resort was excellent for our family of five. The suite had: a kitchen with stove, refrigerator, microwave, all cooking necessities, dishwasher, even a garbage disposal; dining area for at least six people to sit and eat meals; nice living room off of the kitchen area with a pull-out couch; a small bedroom with a double bed; a master bedroom with a king size bed and its own bathroom including a large stall shower; a separate bathroom in the hallway; also I think this suite had more closet space than my house! Generally, the hotel was very low key. NO gambling at all - not even a slot machine. Breakfast was included every morning which consisted of the following: mini bagels, toasting bread, apples, oranges, mini danishes, hard boiled eggs, yogurt, cold cereal, slices of ham, juices and coffee. The breakfast hours were quick and crowded - get there early - seating was minimal. The lobby contained a small convenience store that sold items like soda, water, laundry detergent and boxes of chicken you could stick in the oven. There was a very nice fitness center right off the pool. The pool was small but proportionate to the resort. I don't believe the water was heated but our stay was in July so the cooler water was refreshing for us. There was a ping pong table near the pool too. Also a very tiny kiddy pool that we mistook for a jacuzzi. Then we found the actual jacuzzi - little too hot for July though! There were two very nice BBQ's for your use in the pool area as well. The location of this resort was great. It's a short walk to MGM, Luxor, Excalibur, New York, New York and the Showcase Mall. It's located directly behind the Hooteers Hotel/Casino and it's easy to find and get to. Our stay at Desert Rose was perfect for our family. In contrast to the big hotel/casinos, we loved this resort. We would have been lost had we stayed at the Luxor or the Bellagio. We didn't have to walk 20 minutes or use GPS to get to the pool and we didn't have to spend $30 on breakfast every day. If we had to choose one thing that we didn't like about this hotel it was the concierge. They were not really helpful. Of course, this is a time share so they did want to pitch their properties. That part wasn't the problem. They were actually very low key about that. Their incentive was, "spend 90 minutes with us and we'll give you $100 in Hooters money and ?? slot machine money". For us, we actually went to Hooters the first night we arrived and it was absolutely horrible so $100 in Hooters money was not worth our time. The other incentive was not worth it either, believe me. But just about every piece of information the concierge handed out to us didn't really pan out. They told us fireworks would be 9pm on the strip on the 4th of July - well, there were NO FIREWORKS on the 4th of July in Vegas!! You would think the concierge would know that! They gave us outdated instructions to Red Rock Canyon - we figured it out though. They weren't responsible for the brochures in the lobby which ran out mid-week or the internet computer and printer which ran out of toner just as I was printing my boarding passes. These things were located right in front of their desk. This was a bit frustrating! Hope you all choose Desert Rose - we'd choose them again.

Reviews.Title: “Best yet”
Reviews.Author: shingers
Reviews.Content: Located at the end of the strip behind Hooters and Tropicana, the Desert Rose is well placed and good value. The 2 bed suite we had was very well appointed, the beds were comfortable, the lounge was large and the kitchen had everything inc. a dishwasher. The pool sometimes got busy but as it was 110F people tended to not stay too long so the beds soon cleared. For what you get for your money this hotel was the best we had on a two week trip in CA and NV.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accomodation & awesome service”
Reviews.Author: Vegas4MeSanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a two bedroom suite which was excellent with all the possible amenities you could think of. Kitchen was very well equipped. Very friendly room service with very good response time. You could see MGM grand and Manadaly bay from this resort - its a very short walk down these places. When we were there, there were manager specials with free cocktails everyday evening which added to the fun. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, some greedy guests”
Reviews.Author: vin
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel in May.Walked in off the street, so paid the high price.I could have booked 3 months before it would have been $70 +tax a bargain as the previous reviewer has stated. But we travel by the seat of our pants, and it was still worth it. The hotel lived up to expectations, the reception staff were very pleasant and patient, as we did not like the position of the first room (first floor) But the next one on third floor was just what we wanted. Nice big lounge/dining room. with large flat screen tv, with a kitchen off. D/W liked it too, but informed me that the kitchen would not be used, she was on holiday too. Large bedroom with king bed and another large tv, dressing room and a small bathroom.The whole suite was spotlessly clean and well equipped, as shown on the website. This standard of cleanliness was apparent throughout the hotel, the public rooms, hallways, pool area, the gardens. Staff were always busying themselves keeping up the high standards, but still found the time to say hello. The free breakfast was plentyful, with coffee, o/j, milk, cereal, bread, bagels, cold meats, cheese, hard boiled eggs and fresh fruit. The down side of this is that some guests who had already had breakfast, were then filling their pockets/ handbags/ plastic bags with food from the buffet to eat later. A complete abuse of the system. A managers reception was also a nice touch with beer/wine/soft drinks and nibbles. At the end of the reception it was obvious that again certain guests had over indulged. We enjoyed our two nights stay, the location is a 10/15 minutes walk to the juction MGM/NYNY. The route through HOOTERS carpark and left up to the TROPICANA. Safe walking what ever hour.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury on a budget..”
Reviews.Author: Kelly-Jayne
Reviews.Content: My huband and I stayed here for 4 nights in May 2008, paid around £40 a night for a gorgeous 1 bedroom apartment/suite. Everything about this hotel exceeded our expectations; from the helpfulness of conceirge, to the free continental breakfast, parking and week night pool side drinks/snacks. To the location (being a 5 minute walk to the strip), the fitness centre and swimming pool area and of course most importantly the stunning, massive and most homely apartment/suite we have ever had the pleasure of staying in for such a low cost.! I could not fault this hotel/resort in anyway.. we wanted a 'casino free' base away from the costly high rise strip hotels but close enough to walk to the 'action'. At the desert rose we got that and so much more.. the location is adjacent to Hooters 5 min walk to Luxor, MGM and my favourite hotel New York New York. Would we stay here again..? Should we return to Vegas we wouldn't look anywhere else..

Reviews.Title: “Affordable Luxury”
Reviews.Author: TouringAgain
Reviews.Content: Tucked quietly away behind the Hooters complex, This is affordable luxury at it's best. Fully equipped and super comfortable, this offered you the opportunity to cook in, if you wished, or take advantage of the abundant restauants nearby. Walk to the corner to catch the "deuce" that for $5/day will take you anywhere in Vegas. The beds and bedding were awesome....I wanted to take it home with me...I slept like a log! Friendly helpful staff would help you with anything you needed....like printing boarding passes the day before we flew back! I didn't get time to enjoy the pool, but it looked nice,.... maybe next time...We'll be back!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: bab123
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel! We stayed one night with another couple just last week. We reserved a two bedroom apartment and it was plenty of room for all four of us. The breakfast was adequate and the price was just terrific for the accommodations. Very good service as well. I would recommend. I also would look into their other locations (part of Shell Hospitality Clubs)

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Desert Rose”
Reviews.Author: my2maskedcatz
Reviews.Content: The Desert Rose Resort was everything promised and more! Our 1 bedroom suite was just as pictured. The down bedding was a plus and made sleeping mighty comfortable! The free cocktails in the evening were nice, especially when enjoyed poolside. The free breakfast was also a bonus. The central air conditioning was exceptional! Our room stayed between 62 and 64 degrees the entire time (my husband likes ice boxes!!!). This was great since it was about 105 degrees all week. The resort is just a short walk to the strip. The easiest and coolest way is to walk through MGM. Thank you Desert Rose for making our stay so enjoyable! We will definitely return next year! TIP: Book your room early. We booked 3 months in advance and got an amazing deal. (We paid about half off the going rate).

Reviews.Title: “Affordable Luxury!”
Reviews.Author: judyzol
Reviews.Content: Spacious room, lovely surroundings, friendly staff, close to the strip and a surprisingly lavish breakfast. I will stay here whenever I am in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Away from the strip in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: fung1964
Reviews.Content: If you want a full kitchen, 1 bedroom, living room, dining area, this is your place. Why pay for a studio hotel room and spend money on your meals. They provide continental breakfast (which gets crowded), and there is also common laundry room, small gym, and the pool is small with limited seating for all the guests. The hotel states it's behind the MGM Grand, true but it's really behind Hooter's Casino Hotel. Sort of funny they don't state that. You do need a car to get around unless you lilke walking in the heat. All the casino hopping was done with free parking. Cabs get expensive and need to be called in.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Value - Beware of Timeshare Lady...”
Reviews.Author: TravelDragonFl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights, great spacious apartment style room. Carpet and furniture could use a bit of updating and bath/toilet area is very cramped, but otherwise a great place! Very convenient to highways and the strip, free breakfast and some other weeknight meals. The only complaint I have (and the only reason it did not get 5 stars) was that the front desk kept calling me to tell me there was a "welcome package" waiting for me. I finally walked down to retrieve it and all it was - was some Vegas brochures (the kind that are in the lobby anyway) and a pushy sales woman's pitch for timeshare sales. UGH!!! That irritated the heck out of me! Quite mean to trick people like that, especially when they are hot and very tired at the end of the day. Desert Rose, are you listening??

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Rooms.”
Reviews.Author: AZ_Cousins
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a long weekend with nine of my female cousins. We occupied two suites at the Desert Rose. We were all pleasantly surprised by how nice our accomodations were and how centrally located the hotel was! We were concerned that we might be too far from the strip but found that it was not a problem at all to walk to the strip. The only thing we were a bit disappointed in was the pool. But even that was fine, as we spoke to the concierge, who called another hotel for us, and set the way for the ten of us to go over there and spend the day. We had a great time, and are planning on making this an annual trip. We all decided that the next trip, we will again stay at the Desert Rose.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, a good deal”
Reviews.Author: RCROh
Reviews.Content: Accomodations were adequate. Hot tub and pool were both nice. Fitness room looked fine, but we didn't have time to use it. The breakfast was fine - wasn't expecting the rolled slices of ham so that was a nice surprise; however, there could be more variety in the pastries (only packaged danish available until they ran out). Sometimes there was whole wheat bread, other times only white. It would be nicer if the bathroom was not off of the bedroom if you've got 3 or 4 staying. If just two in the room, it was fine. Kitchen was well enough equipped - you can save some $$ by taking food with you. There's a large fridge and dishwasher. Would stay here again if price stays within reason.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: ktowntravllr
Reviews.Content: Got an absolutely terrific rate through expedia several months before our trip. We had a one bedroom on the first floor in building one. We had a view of a wall, but what we expected with the deeply discounted rate that we paid (rates more than doubled even on expedia the week after we booked). Happy being on the first floor though for easy access to our vehicle. Room was clean and well stocked. Nicely decorated. A little worn around the edges, but overall not too bad. Loved being able to make our own dinner in the full kitchen. We also prepared some food and put it in our cooler for the days after we left Vegas. Pool area was nice, but the pool was a bit cold (a bit of a shock in the warm weather). Air conditioning worked well in the living room/kitchen, but didn't seem to send any air into the bedroom so it wasn't quite as cool as I like it to sleep, but it wasn't intolerable or anything. Hotel was relatively close to the south end of the strip, but I'm not sure I would stay here if I didn't have a car. We had hiked a lot on the way to Vegas, and of course with all of the walking in Vegas our feet were getting quite sore. When we were staying here we drove to a few of the strip casino parking lots and walked from there to try to save our feet a bit. Breakfast is what I would consider and expanded continental. Very good selection and always lots for everyone. Evening reception had free beer/wine/soda and potato chips or veggies and dip, that type of thing. Not something I would go out of my way to attend, but if we were heading out anyway, we stopped by for a drink. Overall a good experience, and I would definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to Stay in Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: sjphansen
Reviews.Content: The Desert Rose Resort got great reviews on the internet, so this is how we chose to stay there on our vacation... I am so glad that we did! These are the things we loved about it. 1. As we arrived at the resort( very close to airport) There was a theme party going on in the lobby with food, drinks, prizes! (We got there too late to win the Hawaii trip! ) 2. The concierge's were wonderful and never too busy to help you to make plans, or to print you a map of somewhere you wish to go, or to give taxi tips! 3. The pool was clean and refreshing, near the pool were 2 huge gas grills to use, and a ping pong table. 4. The rooms were spacious, clean, and decorated nicely. The bed was very cozy and restful. 5. There is a Vons grocery store in walking distance ( We are late 30's, not overwieght and walked in moderate desert heat) The taxi ride back was 7-10 dollars depending on traffic on Tropicana ave. The kitchens were stocked with everything needed to cook with. We enjoyed eating in. ( It is nice to have when you are following a specific diet ) The maid even helped me do some of our dishes that we didn't get to! 6. It is located next to Hooters, and the Tropicana. Close by is MGM, luxor, Excalibur, and new york new york...Easy walk to start at that end of the strip. 7. We loved that there were no slot machines at the Desert Rose . It was peaceful, a great family place, or even romantic as a couple 8, The continental breakfast included a wonderful assortment of coffee's and hot drinks, fruit drinks, boiled eggs, yogurt and fruit, pastries, bagels, toast, cereals, ham. 9. There is a convenience store with beverages, snacks and a few things you may need. 10. The only negative was that on the first night we went to bed with cockroach in our bed! This didn't bother me because the room was emaculent, as was the rest of the resort. There were always people about cleaning. It was just a stray bug, unfortunately a freakishly large one! It would not deter me from staying here again, and from highly recommending it to you. You've got to check this place out!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value.”
Reviews.Author: Kat1sydney
Reviews.Content: Beautiful resort, good location and easy to walk to the strip. If you would prefer not to stay in a casino this is is a great option due to its location and price. Walk to the strip whithin 10 minutes outside MGM casino and you can get the Deuce bus to any location on the strip. Breakfast was great, you can take it back to your room if you want. Happy hour between 5-7pm was a great suprise. The rooms were spacious, clean and comfortable. The pool was great after a long day and the staff were very friendly. After reading the downside of casinos this was a great choice and not smokey. People were everywhere so you always felt safe coming home at any hour of the night. We highly recommend this hotel. Kat and Mike - Sydney

Reviews.Title: “Great stay the the Desert Rose”
Reviews.Author: hockeyIllinois
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 just returned from a trip to Las Vegas and stayed at the Desert Rose Resort for 5 nights. I picked this hotel based on reviews from tripadvisor.com and as usual the reviews were right on! We had a 2 bedroom unit which is great for 2 adults, 3 kids - plenty of room. The unit was very clean and we did not see any bugs! The maid service was great - our room was made up every day. Also, security was very good - gated entrances and the back parking lot entrance is blocked off during the night hours. What I liked most was the quite atmosphere after walking along the strip. The breakfast offered is basic, but it was nice to have it available. Be careful of the time share sales - we had a message from the concierge(salesperson)? to come down for our welcome gift which included brochures and a sales pitch! This resort was a great value for our family and I would definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Resort”
Reviews.Author: Flossie68
Reviews.Content: We've just spent 2 weeks at the Desert Rose Resort and I just had to write and tell you what a fantastic place it is to stay. If you don't want to stay in one of the main strip hotels this is the next best thing! Just a 5 minute (if that!) walk from the Desert Rose through Hooters carpark and you're on Tropicana Avenue opposite the MGM Grand. From the MGM you have access via Monorail to any hotel on the strip. The rooms at the Desert Rose are brilliant, a large lounge and bedroom with a handy kitchen, it's also nice to have a bit of out door space with a balcony - something you won't get with the majority of the strip hotels! Kitchen is fully equipped although we only used it for making cups of tea and a bit of toast! We had every intention of buying more food for a self catering holiday but in all honesty the nearest supermarket, Vons, was quite a distance (ok if you have a car), we walked it once, I wouldn't recommend it - get a taxi! We also found buying food to prepare quite expensive, with the good £ against the $ at the moment we were expecting food to be bit a lot cheaper, but it wasn't! I'd suggest eating out.... a much less expensive option in the long run. Would also just like to mention Coco's diner which did an excellent, non expensive breakfast on Tropicana Ave (again walk to the end of the road towards Hooters and take a right, Coco's is 5 mins walk), we'd definately recommend it - also next to Coco's, the motel 6 has a 24 hour shop selling water, alcohol, bread etc. Also would like to recommend the food courts in the large hotels - less expensive than eating in the restaurants and we couldn't fault any of the food we ate - also recommend Panda Express (chinese) in a few of the food courts and on the Strip at the Showcase Mall. For something a little more expensive (and a great experience) try the Rainforest Cafe in the MGM Grand. We'd definately recommend staying at this hotel for a more laid back holiday than the hustle and bustle at the strip hotels. Pool was great, water cold as mentioned, but great for cooling of when the temperatures are hitting 100 degrees. Manager's drinks in the evenings Mon - Thurs free of charge were also a nice touch! Staff all very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location Desert Rose”
Reviews.Author: featherMaryland
Reviews.Content: We spent the weekend in Las Vegas at the Desert Rose Resort with our 3 kids and in laws. We were able to get a very affordable 2 bedroom suite that was very nicely furnished and included a full kitchen. It was basically a little apartment. What we really appreciated about the Desert Rose was the peacefulness while being within walking distance of the MGM Grand and the tram that runs to all the casinos. The kids loved the pool and ping pong table. The breakfast was an upscale continental breakfast. The kids like the hot milk and in laws the various coffee options.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Desert Rose Resort”
Reviews.Author: triplasvegas
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Resort for 4 days and 3 nights. The resort was very convenient to the Strip. We stayed in the 1 bedroom suite and it was very nice. The resort offers free continental breakfast which is very good (choice of cappucino, cafe mocha, etc. coffees; cereals, bagels, boiled eggs, fruits and pastries). With our resort experience, we will be back again in this place considering the price value.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Place to Stay Just Off The Strip”
Reviews.Author: lesleyjo
Reviews.Content: My sister booked this hotel for my family and her family, along with my parents to celebrate their 40th Wedding Anniversary in Vegas. We stayed from Saturday May 31st through Thursday June 5th, and had a wonderful time! Each of us (couples) had a wonderfully decorated one bedroom suite... My hubby and I were on the 3rd floor with a slight view of the pool and the Tropicana Hotel. Housekeeping did a great job at keeping our suite tidy and spotless daily, and the kitchen was fully stocked with all the utensils one would need for their stay. All in all, we had an excellent stay at The Desert Rose. It was a very laid back and quiet place, which was a lovely change from the "chaos" of the strip. The hotel is located just southeast of the Tropicana, and directly behind the Hooters Casino (the old San Remo Hotel), so we found the walking distance to the strip was very easy (about 10 minutes at the very most). The MGM Grand was a quick 5 minute walk, and it gave us easy access to the Monorail system. The pool area was lovely and clean, and the pool itself was cool and refreshing after our hot days out on the strip. The hotel grounds were also kept very nice and clean, and you felt more so like you were in a resort instead of just a hotel off the strip. Every morning there was a basic continental breakfast with cereals, mini bagels, toast, boiled eggs, and various coffees and juices. It was nothing special, but certainly made for a good start to your day. Overall, it we had a fantastic time at the Desert Rose. I would most definately stay there again if I ever head back to Vegas, because of it's wonderful laid back charm!

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Resort”
Reviews.Author: JuliannaML
Reviews.Content: This resort is only a block from the MGM and Tropicana hotels. An easy walk. It is also a great family resort, with lots of space in the suites and everything you need in a kitchen (dishwasher, blender, mixer, dishes, salt and pepper, fridge, microwave, etc). They also provide continental breakfast. Other amenities include a pool/spa and fitness room. Overall a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great for entomologists! (but don't try to ring anyone about it!)”
Reviews.Author: BrainOfMorbius
Reviews.Content: First impressions of the rooms at the Desert Rose Resort were fine. There were three of us on this trip and there was more than enough space in the room for all of us. In block 1 on the ground floor, the room came with two TV's, a king-size bed and both the fridge and microwave big enough to store a fully-grown racehorse, so we were all fairly pleased on arrival with what we'd booked. But, after only one full day, things took their first bad turn. After travelling from England the time difference took a day or two to acclimatise to, consequently I was up early during the second night of our stay and was greeted in the kitchen by a bug bigger than my thumb, scuttling around in one of the kitchen cupboards. Both me and my wife saw a similar beastie in our bedroom in the morning and reported this problem at the desk. Fair play to the guy at the desk who gave us a new room immediately on the third floor in block 3. So we packed our gear and moved room. A great start eh? Maybe they’re just on the first floor… My wife decided to call her mother back home to tell her how we were doing. She hadn't bought a phone card yet so she knew the call would have to be a quickie. She was on the phone for 5 minutes (according to the desk staff). We were charged $39 for this call. $39 FOR 5 MINUTES. I still can't believe it now. We found out the charge for this call through a feature on the TV and my wife went off to the desk to query the extreme cost of the call. To be honest, the response and attitude of the staff were nothing short of staggering. Firstly, they pleaded the hotel's absolute innocence by saying that the phone charges were nothing to do with them as the room phones were handled by an external contractor. Secondly, my wife was told, according to the disclaimer, that international rates may vary. I don't know what their idea of variance is but $8 per minute isn't mine. The lady behind the desk also had the nerve to tell my wife that she should consider herself lucky (!?) as an American chap who was checking out at that very time had a phone bill of approximately $300. My wife asked for the contact details of the phone company so she could address them directly - but guess what? The phone company's 'privacy had to respected'. What about the rights of their guests to get a fair deal out their holiday package? The hotel's attitude over this debacle bordered on ignorance and showed utter contempt to those of us footing these extortionate bills. Surely it can't all be bad, or can it...? Well, a kitchen cupboard door fell off in my wife's hands, almost taking her head off. The hotel did send someone to fix the door quickly so fair play there. Another bad point came during the second week of our stay; I've never stayed at a hotel where the staff will not cash a traveller's cheque for their guests, so you know what's coming next. Yes, we were told to go to the hotel next door (Hooter's). I started to think that I was not really in a hotel but in some American TV prank show with hidden cameras. With only two days left of our stay the final nail was thrust into our coffin. Ants, and lots of them, had decided to lodge with us without our consent. What’s worse is that they had decided to use the kitchen as their lodgings. The kitchen cupboards were crawling with them, along with the floor and benches. They did have one thing going for them; at least they were clean. I could tell by the fact they had begun to occupy the bathroom too. The hotel sent a guy to spray the room to rid us of our horde of tiny squatters, and also a cleaner to tidy up the plethora of ant -corpses. She remarked that the whole of block 3 had the same problem, which only served to mystify me as to why something more stringent, and on a larger scale, hadn’t been done earlier to solve this problem that the staff were apparently aware of. I wouldn’t come back to the Desert Rose as I genuinely think that my money would be better spent at another establishment. The good thing is that the poor quality of the hotel didn’t ruin my stay as Las Vegas is such a great place for a holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Webtours”
Reviews.Author: webtours26
Reviews.Content: We are a English couple of 50 yrs plus and found the Desert Rose to be excellent for what we paid for 8 nights. Its just the right distance away from the STRIP to avoid all the hussle and bussle. On check in we were asked what floor we would like so we went for 3rd as to have no one above.Room very good ,only made tea and coffee, fully equiped kitchen if you wanted to make meals. AC worked in every room we did not have to leave door open as mentioned by other travellers. Pool area very pleasant with nice background music. Plenty of staff keeping all areas clean and tidy, and always very pleasant and helpful. Towels and bedding changed on a regular basis. To send postcards back to UK use the MGM business centre and they will do it for you. The DEUCE bus is a handy way of travelling the strip and the $5 fticket can be used over a 24hour hour period. DO NOT use the phone in your room to call UK as we found to our amazement it cost $75 for 15minutes, they guy behind the desk told us should have bought a phone card !! As for shows we recommend "O" and "Mama Mia" both excellent. The breakfast was a bonus and it was enough to keep you going until a light lunch. As for shopping for some good bargins head for the Primium Outlet village not far from the Stratosphere- $16 in a Taxi HOT TIP - If shopping in "Macys" department store present room card and PHOTO ID and you will receive a 11% discount card for all your purchases(we made a copy of our passport) All in all the Desert Rose is great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “We spent our honeymoon there.”
Reviews.Author: Phil-Beth
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Desert Rose Resort several times. We always love it there. We save money because we can cook our own food. There is always clean dishes and pots and pans. You have everything you need except the food. They also have social gatherings with the guests in the main lobby. We love the rooms. There is plenty of space for everything you need. The beds are very comfortable and there are TVs in the living and bed rooms. Very nice balcony off of the living room. We recommend the Desert Rose to all of our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: familiarface
Reviews.Content: Non-smoking and non-gambling property. A haven within walking distance of the strip. I stayed in a one bedroom suite which was spacious and comfortable. The kitchen is well supplied with basic cooking equipment. The AC is in the main living area so to get some AC in the bedroom you have to leave the door open. I started out with 2 face towels, 4 hand towels and 4 bath towels. I had hung up my towels for reuse, but each time they were taken away and not replenished! By my third and final day, I had no face towel, 1 hand towel and 2 bath towels. The staff was friendly and very accommodating. I plan to stay here again when I visit Las Vegas. This city is my least favorite destination but my stay at the Desert Rose Resort made my last trip very enjoyable. Lee 4312 5/29 to 6/1

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis In The Desert”
Reviews.Author: longball44
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed about four days at The Desert Rose. Thursday through Monday. When checking in the staff was helpful and let us change our room from a top floor to a bottom floor room more near the pool. Thursday afternoon we caught the managers free happy hour. Good snacks and free wine or beer. The morning continental style breakfasts were larger than normal and pretty good. Full kitchens in the suites are always a plus. Our only problem was the usual thumping sounds from the room above as people walked across, that was to be expected. The odd noise, that we couldn't figure out, was a kind of squeaky door hinge sound followed by a thump and then three more rapid thumps. When we checked out and mentioned it to the front desk they told us it was the security doors closing as people went in and out during the night or early morning hours. You are in Las Vegas so that is to be expected. My suggestion is that you stay on the top floor if you think that might be a problem. We will next time. ThankUBye.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal for a great price!”
Reviews.Author: kbheida
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in walking distance of the strip and our room was right behind the Tropicana hotel parking lot. We stayed in the spacious 2 bedroom suite with good size lounging area and mini kitchen where we were able to make our own meals. The weather was semi rainy the weekend we went but we were able to relax in the room and not get "cabin fever." It was nice to be away from the constant noise of the strip and sleep in peace!

Reviews.Title: “Okay Stay at Desert Rose”
Reviews.Author: sadie155Denton
Reviews.Content: I booked a 1 bedroom suite for 2 nights since we had 2 kids with us and figured for the price of 120.00 per night it was a good deal. The room was clean and spacious but the balcony was blocked by some kind of wall where it looked like they were doing some work. We only had 3 towels in the room and since there were 4 of us, I asked the housekeeping girl who was outside my room when we got up for anothoer towel. Well, she spoke NO English and had to lead me to another girl who spoke a litte English. We gave our room mumber and she said she would leave another towel. When we returned to the room after a long day, only 2 towels were left for 4 people. I complained at checkout and was told I should have called the front desk. The complimentary continental breakfast was suppose to be from 7am to 10am on weekends, however, when we went down at 9am Sunday, there was barely anything left. A man told me had been down earier before church and there was a lot of food. They ended up taking the food away at 9:45am. If they say 7-10am, they should have enough food until 10am. I complained at checkout and was told the delivery didn't show up so they ran out of food and had to shut down early. They advertise WIFI in the room but wanted a 9.99 per day to use it. They had a computer in the lobby but you had to use your credit card to use it. It was 3.95 for 15 minutes!!! Even the cheap Comfort Inn doesn't charge to use the lobby computer!! I heard a man saying that he got charged a fee for each local call he made from his room. The pool was crowded and we could never find a chair except after the sun went down. It is a nice place in a good location off the strip close to everything but I have stayed at nicer places for the money. It is a timeshare resort and we were lucky enough not to be hounded about attending a presentation since we were only there for 2 days. The best thing about this hotel was the extremely comfortable bed in the bedroom. The AC did not work well and the room was a bit stuffy so we had to keep the AC running constantly and had to leave the door open to the bedroom for the air to reach us. It was cooler outside as it was in the 50s at night and unusually cool in the days for this time of year in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!!!”
Reviews.Author: brandie442001
Reviews.Content: Beautiful rooms, excellent location, friendly staff......I will definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: janie_nw
Reviews.Content: Nice 1bdrm suite for the price. Close enough to walk to the MGM, Tropicana, New York New York.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Bluesman69
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 1 bedroom appartment for 6 nights. For us it was a home away from home. Quiet, very clean, fully equipeed appartment. The staff was very helpfull and nice. We personally did'nt have our room made every day, I prefer to just pick up my towels, soap, cofee ect. from the cleaning lady. We only had the breakfast once not because it was not good but because we decide to stay in bed in mornings. The bed was very comfortable, we slep like at home wich is a plus after a long day on the Strip. Although we were so surprise to have a free breakfast for the rate we payed and the utilities we had in the appartment. We cannot understand why people complain when some morning there is no breakfast. The only small inconvenient we had was with the key. We had to renew our card 3 times....but did'nt bother us too much beacuse it was very fast to have another one. Its not far at all from the MGM, maybee 10 minutes walk but as we rented a car it was easier for us to go enewhere we wanted. We visited other hotels but none of them can give us what we had at the Desert Rose for the same price, so no hesitation at all ...we will return at the Desert same time next year. We highly recommend Desert Rose.

Reviews.Title: “Great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Zueri_Eddy
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Desert Rose. We paid for a room but found ourselves in a generous two-room suite with *two* televisions and a kitchen many Europeans would be glad to have in their homes. The hotel breakfast, included in the price, was the best of any we can recall. The only improvements we might have appreciated were free Internet access (it's available, but for an extra charge) and a free airport shuttle (the taxi costs about $12.00).

Reviews.Title: “Ditto All the Good Reviews”
Reviews.Author: TullyToo
Reviews.Content: I really can't add anything new, but we were extremely pleased with the Desert Rose. Easy check-in. We had a 1-BR unit which was very nice. Kitchen was very well equipped. Location was great if you don't want to stay in a casino. Area seemed very safe and I did a lot of walking. It was easy getting in an out when we wanted to take day trips....no traffic hassles. Only negative was that the hot water heater was out in the kitchen so the first two days the breakfast buffet and happy hour were cancelled. They gave us a $10 certificate to Hooters. Hooters buffet was $10 so for the two of us we ended up spending about $13 which we hadn't planned on. The second day we got carryout eggs, bacon and toast from Hooters to take back to the room. Supplemented it with some honey buns from Von's and we were set to go. The pool area looked great although we didn't use it. I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We love the Desert Rose!”
Reviews.Author: pa3141
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Desert Rose and loved being close to the Strip but away from the crowds and noise. The one bedroom suite was perfect for us and definitely more comfortable than a hotel room. We bought a few groceries and stayed on the property for some of our meals. The breakfast provided was also a plus. This property is perfect for anyone who craves a quieter oasis in the hubbub of Las Vegas but still wants to be close to the Strip and the monorail.

Reviews.Title: “great place for the price”
Reviews.Author: coma07
Reviews.Content: Very nice place. Just off the strip a couple blocks, but not bad. Pool water was alittle cold. Trip was really nice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Property”
Reviews.Author: Traveler60089
Reviews.Content: We generally book at Marriott or Hilton properties because we are quite fussy about our lodging. This time we took a chance and booked at The Desert Rose. It turned out to be an excellent choice. Our room was a full suite with a separate bedroom and a full kitchen. The kitchen had a full sized fridge, a full electric range and oven, and a dishwasher. We also had a toaster, microwave, coffeemaker and a set of dishes, cookware, etc. The room was spotless and housekeeping was very good, even washing our dirty dishes! All the employees we encountered were extremely friendly and courteous. We had a car, so the location was perfect since the LV casinos all provide free valet parking. Otherwise the walk to the Strip is a couple of blocks. The grounds were nicely landscaped with the parking only a short walk from the room. In addition, we had a nice balcony. The continental breakfast did not offer as many choices as other places we have stayed, but nonetheless it was still excellent. Each morning, they had large platters of lox with onions, capers, tomatoes, bagels and cream cheese. They also offered toast and danish, a choice of cereals, yogurt, hard boiled eggs, granola bars, juices, fruit, coffee, tea, milk, soft drinks, etc. The only problem with breakfast was that they could use an additional coffee dispenser during the busier periods.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal on a suite”
Reviews.Author: Oscuro
Reviews.Content: Our stay here was mostly positive and we would consider staying here again. The suite we had seemed to be partly renovated - new counters but dated looking carpet. So if having the most recent styling is important to you, this might not be the place. But we are more concerned with space and quiet so were happy with the Desert Rose. We prefer not to have housekeeping come in during our stays so can't comment on what they cleaned or didn't. The suite was certainly very clean when we checked in. We did request replenishment of a few things in our room when we saw one of the staff in the hall, and the response was positive, polite and quick. Since there are so many reviews of this property, I will not go in to much more detail. But I did want to mention that we were also there when the breakfast and afternoon snacks were not available due to a kitchen problem and we felt it was not handled well. Since we prefer a cooked breakfast (one of the reasons we always stay in suites) we didn't plan on making use of the breakfast. But if we had come here assuming we would get breakfast everyday, we would have been very annoyed. Like another poster said, no compensation what so ever was offered. I also don't think that we should have had to go request compensation. Everyone staying there at that time should have been given either an amount off their room or the coupons for some other property should have been offered automatically to each room. They were able to leave us all messages on our phones telling us the food service was not available. That message should also have mentioned that coupons were available at the front desk for those who wanted them.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, but other annoying problems”
Reviews.Author: woolmerc
Reviews.Content: I concur with a lot of what the previous reviewer described. However I had a number of other annoyances that frustrated me. Firstly an overview on the room: • I stayed in room 4112. Possibly the most comfortable room I have ever stayed in. I was overwhelmed by the size – almost too big for me to stay in by myself! Bed was extremely comfortable. Fantastic facilities and 2 tvs. Unfortunately like a previous reviewer has said, the TV remotes would hardly work – possibly a battery problem but I am not sure. • One of the cleanest rooms (and hotels on that count) I have ever stayed in. The staff: • Fantastic really, very friendly. Fast checkin Now for my list of annoyances: • On the fist night I arrived, my plane was majorly delayed, so didn’t step inside the room till 11PM. Went out quickly and got a bite to eat, only to come back and find I could not get back in my room! My key card swiped OK, but there was a problem with the electronic door lock and it would just not open. They even tried the master key and that failed. So I waited about 75mins for my door to be opened…. I finally got in about 1.30AM. Let me just say, the security guy, and onsite engineer were fantastic people, very friendly and helped as quickly as they could – thankyou. The guy at the front desk was also great as he let me have a free snack. Now I wouldn’t normally comment on such a thing (because these things happen), but the other annoyances I had, forced me to include this. • I went to use the ATM machine beside the concierge the next night and it simply didn’t work - the screen was frozen. They restarted it, and still the same. After trying again the next morning I gave up, and had to walk all the way up to the next hotel to use theirs. • What is it with this hotel – everything is breaking down!!! As reported in the last review, the breakfast facilities were closed due to health regulations – fair enough. But the whole situation could have been handled much better by the staff. I was given an $8 voucher on arrival to use the next morning at Hooters. The next night I had to go back and get another voucher – only this time they said they could not issue them till after 7AM. I went to the front desk at about 10.15AM (knowing that Hooters breakfast went till 11AM), thinking there would not be a problem, and they told me I could not have one, because the ‘desert rose hotel’ only served breakfast till 10AM. So even though Hooters served till 11, they still wouldn’t give me one. And why didn’t I get told of this picky rule earlier!!! So I had to buy my own breakfast. I talked to the manager the next morning and I said my breakfast should be refunded to me. She said ok, but I needed a receipt…. silly me, didn’t obtain a receipt from the breakfast – so no refund!! Personally this was just not good enough – this is false advertising, you cannot advertise a complimentary breakfast and not give it. • And my last gripe is that management told me the credit card I gave them on checkin, would not be charged and I would be given the opportunity to pay cash for any in-room charges on checkout. On checkout, it was too late, my credit card had already been charged the day before. Normally such a little thing wouldn’t bother me, but my card is a foreign one and a number of fees get put onto it for overseas purchases. The reason staff gave me for this problem was their systems were playing up and not working properly. They offered me no refund and NO option to pay in cash like I wanted to. Argghhh, is anything electronic in this hotel working!! Very disappointed. I had a lot of frustrations when this was meant to be a very comfortable stay. And I know the management will respond to this report…. you need to clean up all these little nuisances.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: summergs
Reviews.Content: GENERAL- 3 Stars - Upon arrival I was a little nervous as the exterior and lobby were dated circa 70's. The continential breakfast was disappointing but you can't really complain. After check-in, I moved the car closer to where I was staying in the 3 level apartment like complex. Security is good with locking gates. SERVICE - 5 Stars - The staff was very friendly and helpful. ROOM- 5 stars - To my shock, my room was was very clean, comfortable and quiet without any evidence of cigarette or other foul smells. Kitchen fully equipt: Full Size refridge, Stove/Oven, Dishwasher, Microwave, Toaster, Utensils, etc. The Sofa, Bed, Pillows, etc. were all clean and comfortable. FACILITIES- 5 stars - Very Nicely Done, almost 'homey'. Pool, Jacussi, Workout Room w/Shower, Cookout area, Ping Pong table, etc. INTERNET- 1 Star - My business requires internet connectivity and Deser Rose uses Wayport as the provider. Once connected, it works like a champ. The problem is Wayport charges $10 per 24/hr period and the rediculous part of it is that the 24hour period is not determined by the time you sign up, rather, the 24hr period is from 4pm-4pm. Which means if you sign up at 2pm you only get 2hrs worth of service. RIP OFF!! Try calling the Wayport Tech Support Number, GOOD LUCK!! If it were not for the assistance of Desert Rose, I would have been SOL. This daily occurance made my stay upsetting. Desert Rose should include internet connectivity free of charge.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing in the Southwest”
Reviews.Author: dos_companeros
Reviews.Content: The Desert Rose provided a relaxed experience and an aesthetic one might expect in New Mexico or Southern California with easy access to the Strip. The monorail was two blocks away, three if you include the trek through the MGM Grand. The cost was 1/2 of the strip hotels and I didn't have to deal with the constant ringing of the slot machines. Really the best of both worlds. Yes, the continental breakfast was down, but they gave me a coupon for a cooked breakfast next door, which was even better. How many ways can a place be better? I got an apartment instead of a room, a better price, a nice walk to the monorail, friendly service. It was super clean and even had recorded jazz in the lobby. It was close to the action, but you could still rest in the hot tub and enjoy the desert breeze before bed. I am not being paid to write this review and I save 5 stars for the truly special experience. Well done! And then the cab ride to the airport was only $10. A beautiful place to relax whatever you're doing in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: FredSATX
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Desert Rose Resort along with a friend for a quick weekend getaway to Vegas and booked the hotel at the last minute, it was a great find. I was very surprised upon arrival at the property of the proximity of the hotel to the strip. It is a short 5 minute walk to the MGM Grand and monorail. Check-in was fast and easy, staff was very helpful in answering all of our questions about the area. The room was very spacious, comfortable and clean and had all the amenities we needed for our weekend trip. Bathroom was a little small, shower/toilet area, but was not too much of a big deal. At check-in, we were informed of the free continental breakfast and management reception but we did not use these services. Overall I would definitely stay again because of the helpful service I received, clean room and short hop to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but it could use some improvement”
Reviews.Author: boyumz
Reviews.Content: First of all, I'll start with the positives....the check in was smooth and the girls at the desk were very friendly. Our room was very clean and the bed was probably the most comfortable hotel bed I've ever slept in. However, we arrived on Thursday evening and was not told there would be no complimentary breakfast because the Health Dept had come in and shut them down due to no hot water in the kitchen. We found this out when we came in the next morning at 7:00 AM. I asked if they offered any kind of voucher for a nearby restaurant, and they gave me $20 in Hooters Bucks (Hooters is right next door). It would have been nicer if I didn't have to ask for them, it made me wonder how many other people were entitled to them but didn't get them because they didn't know to ask. So it went the entire stay, every morning I had to go to the lobby to request my Hooters Bucks. As stated before, the pool is not heated and even though the days were in the 80s, it still wasn't enough to make the pool warm enough to swim in. The hot tub was very nice and relaxing, though.There is construction going on at the hotel, and Friday morning I heard noise outside my bedroom and peaked out the slider to find a construction worker sneaking a cigarette outside my window. The kitchen was very well stocked with pots, pans, utensils and dinnerware. One thing we could have used was a baking sheet...no bigger, I just flipped the roasting pan over. They only supplied 2 napkins, that was kind of strange. I guess my biggest disappointment was with housekeeping. They didn't replenish anything! We had to go to the lobby to request more soap, more shampoo, more dishwashing soap, even more towels! They didn't do anything but make the beds and empty the garbage cans in our room. The shower and sinks were not cleaned the whole 4 days we were there. I know this is a timeshare property, and if I was there using my timeshare points, I would have been very unhappy. I've stayed in timeshares before that were much nicer, in fact, just a block or so away is the Wyndam Grand Desert and it is much nicer than the Desert Rose. It even has washers and dryers in each unit and the rooms are much bigger. I don't think I would stay at the Desert Rose again.....sorry, I know they tried, just not quite good enough.

Reviews.Title: “Good Servicable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Raeleanne
Reviews.Content: We arrived early at the Desert Rose for a four night stay over the Easter long weekend. We had booked a two bedroom suite as we were travelling with another couple. We were not able to check in early but they held our bags for us no problems. When we came back later to check in the process was smooth. However, when we got to our suite one room had a double bed and the other room had two singles. I called the front desk and Tom was very helpful and quickly offered us two one bedroom suites for the same price, available immediately. We were very pleased. The rest of the stay was uneventful. The breakfast was servicable. We were able to take items back up to our room and not have to eat with all of the other guests, which was very nice. The kitchen was fully stocked, our own toaster and coffee maker was a definate plus. The breakfast food was pretty standard. Better than some, not as good as others. The cleaning staff did a very good job each day. They were friendly and responded to requests very well. For the most part our stay was quiet. I had been worried about being so close to the airport but I never once heard a plane or any loud industrial noises, which was especially nice becuase of the construction going on around the hotel. Over all our stay was a good one. I would recommend the Desert Rose. For the price you get a nice place to stay very close to the strip and to the monorail stop at the MGM.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: nicern99
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 5 nights. Was able to check in a few hours early. Room was very clean and decorated nicely. Full kitchen had everything we needed to cook our own meals. We even grilled steaks and chicken by the pool. The grounds we maintained beautifully. There was a new building being constructed but we were never disturbed although this was right outside our building. Only complaints we had were the bathroom was too small with the tub and toilet, no room to move around in. The continental breakfast and managers reception were both cancelled the last few days due to a problem in the kitchen. Overall, we loved the stay. Loved the location, the beauty of the resort. We will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - And You Avoid the Casino Crowd!”
Reviews.Author: FolkWorldTravelers
Reviews.Content: With three weeks before the trip, we needed a good choice for hotel lodging in Las Vegas. We had planned on a players' suite at a strip hotel but they been booked by the time we had chosen our trip dates. As an alternative, we found this all-suite hotel just off the Strip (4 nights at $555 total including continental breakfast) and with a 9 year old, we didn't mind avoiding the casino crowds. We arrived Friday evening and quickly picked up our rental car at the Las Vegas Rental Car center which is located off-airport property. The rental shuttle was well-marked and left quickly with little to no delay from the airport to arrive at the rental car center. Once at the rental car center, we were able to do our paperwork quickly and was out the door with a md-size car of our choice for only $89/four days rate from Dollar Rental Company. I would recommend obtaining a car in Las Vegas since the rates are so reasonable and ALL of the hotels located both on the Strip and the Downtown area have free parking available. This car was also handy to make quick trips to the local supermarket for food essentials. As you exit the rental car facility, you take an immediate right and then another immediate right which should then be the Las Vegas Strip. To arrive at Desert Rose, just travel down the strip until you see the lights of Excalibur, Tropicana, New York New York and the MGM Grand which is the intersection of Las Vegas Strip and Tropicana Blvd. At this intersection, take a right and just after Hooters, take your immediate right onto Duke Ellington Way which is where the Desert Rose is located. You are literally one-half block from the MGM Grand Lobby and the Monorail and just one-half block south of the Strip. It is an ideal location to traverse Las Vegas. Now, sign-in was no problem; however your choice of buildings could be. Our original building was building #4 which is in the northeast location of the property. Our room had a very noisy A/C unit and since I am a light sleeper, I could hear it come on and off. Also, you need to be careful as to not be on the hallway where all the maids meet in the morning to start their rounds. You can definitely hear them and I do think the room's walls were somewhat thin. After one restless night, we requested and received a move to a different room which was located in Building #2 (southeast corner of the property) which we were informed had been newly renovated with the flat-screen TVs. The room was just as pleasant as the other and certainly a bit quieter than the old room. The rooms are standard Marriott/Shell timeshare quality with your fully-equipped kitchens and bathrooms. We had a nice size king-size bed/bath on one side with a living area/kitchen/dining area on the other. The pull-out bed was comfortable with pillows/sheets and comforter provided. No issues as to room quality or convenience were noted. There was 2 TV's with pay-per-view movies as well as a room safe. The included breakfast was nothing special but ample - lox/cream cheese/bagels, cereals, yogurt, fresh fruit, hard-boiled eggs, and milk, coffees, juices, and teas. There was also happy hours with free beer/wine/snacks that we didn't partake since we were always out sight -seeing. Vonn's Supermarket is easy to find - just continue south down Tropicana Blvd. and it is on your right about two miles pass Duke Ellington Road. And the airport is also just down the street from the hotel off of Tropicana Blvd. but surprisingly, you don't hear any of the planes. Now as to Las Vegas itself, you are a short walk/drive to any of the number of casinos. With a young child, we tried to find as many child -friendly locations as possible. We first went to Excalibur. Their arcade area was labeled "lame" by our experienced 9-year old so off to New York-New York arcade area which was rated the best by our child rater. He had a good time winning coupons which he traded for cheap, typical arcade fun items. From an adult standpoint, the Excalibur Casino was well-used/worn and the New York-New York was newer/better in quality. We also visited the MGM Grand across the street and enjoyed the lion exhibit. The MGM was on the same quality level as New York-New York. There are lots of eateries in the MGM ranging in price from expensive to very inexpensive (McDonald's as an example). From our other casino exploration, we found that Circus Circus was the lowest in quality/ ambiance (we felt that all of Central America had declared this to be the only spot to visit in Las Vegas) and it was certainly showed its worn spots both in the Casino and the Adventuredome area. My child hated the arcade and rides so that will tell you something about the quality found there. We also took side trips to Caesar's Palace which has held up well although you could tell it was older. The Mirage was still beautiful having the most extensive foliage that we saw. Now we didn't visit the new Venetian and Wynn but there were certainly gorgeous from the Strip. The Luxor Hotel/Casino was definitely worn and looked old and their arcade area was being closed permanently as of 4/19/08 so adjust your plans accordingly if you had included that in your lodging activities. Finally, Mandalay Bay was nice and could be a good location on the Strip with its extensive pool areas. They only had a shark exhibit for children and again, after Sea World, this was not really satisfying to a child who has seen and petted real dolphins and penguins. For activities, we took a side trip to the downtown hotels and there is free parking (you have to join one of the downtown hotels players club and show that you played $ in their machines to receive the free parking validation). The downtown casinos were interesting and from what I was told, has the best payouts in slots. They had a few of the older style machines if you preferred to hear the coins coming out (which I do!) but you had to search to find them! We were told that "Lots of Slots" which is located in front of Circus Circus on the Strip had lots of the older machines and also had better payouts if you wanted the "old" slots experience. But regardless, any of the machines will take your money gladly and not return it! So, the odds have not improved with the technology and in fact, have probably gotten worse on the slots. So, just enjoy the "noise" for the entertainment value on the old slots. The new slots just don't have the same effect/pleasure as seeing lots of nickels/quarters falling since all you get is a number counter changing digits and you have to sit there until it does its thing. As to other activities, we highly recommend a helicopter tour of the Grand Canyon and Hoover Dam (we took Maverick Company tour which has an excellent safety record). The cost is high so do your comparison of what tour to take. The more flight time, the better the deal. We can also recommend the "sunset" tour since the Las Vegas lights at dusk are beautiful. And we drove to the Hoover Dam and took the full tour offered by the Park Service at the new Tourist/Guest Center. Do be careful with the advertised Hoover Dam tours. They charge you just for the bus ride and many of them do not include the tour fees that are levied by the Park Service. From the Park Service, we opted for the Dam/Electricity Plant tours which for 2 adults/1 child was approx. $90. Remember that this park tour cost IS NOT normally in the bus fares just to get to the Hoover Dam and make sure that aspect is covered before paying someone $50 just to take you to the Dam! That is why a car is so much more reasonable. There is a small parking fee at the Hoover Dam Tour center but certainly well-worth it. The drive is only 45-60 minutes from Las Vegas and the view heading back to Vegas is nice! For children, the only worthwhile arcade experience was at New York- New York and do choose your strip casino carefully since many of them are showing their age (Excalibur, Circus Circus, Luxor as examples). And for any of the night shows, you can easily get there by using the free parking options in the casinos so don't think you need to stay at a hotel just to be near their shows! It really is cheaper to have a car to travel where you want to go. The monorail was expensive with $5/each way and $11 unlimited day and the stops are not as convenient to the Strip as you may think. For 3 people, it is cheaper to rent the car! And it is so easy to get around Las Vegas (the maps are clear and you can't get lost since it is such a compact area and you can always orientate yourself by the Strip lights or views). Summary - Desert Rose Resort is a great location/ worth the money for a suite/kitchen and you avoid the casino crowds.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: toughy
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Desert Rose Resort several times. It is a great place to stay! Very close to the Strip, yet very peaceful and private. The rooms are nice and very new!!! will stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and Roomy”
Reviews.Author: cactuskev
Reviews.Content: The room was excellent! Clean, comfortable and plenty of room. It was like having an apartment just off the strip. Staff was pleasant. The pool was clean and sparkling. The bed was the most comfortable I've slept in. Cabs are a little tough to get right there at the hotel, but the cab stand at Hooters is a very short walk. MGM Grand is also a easy walk. I will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Desert Rose”
Reviews.Author: words2
Reviews.Content: Very clean newly built resort. HUGE rooms and friendly staff. Will stay with them again. Loved my visit

Reviews.Title: “Superb service, awesome units!”
Reviews.Author: LoisLaneFlorida
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this delightful resort for five full days while attending a convention. The rooms were incredibly nice, the beds and sheets felt fantastic and the service was amazing. There is also a complimentary breakfast each morning in the lobby. The units feature a fully equipped kitchen plus a separate dining room and living room. It felt like home! It was a short taxi ride to my convention hotel, but I really appreciated the fact that the Desert Rose was not directly on the Strip. I would easily stay there again and again.

Reviews.Title: “lived up to my expectations”
Reviews.Author: WLATraveler
Reviews.Content: Check-in was quick. The staff was efficient. I got just what I asked for- an upper floor unit. It was in a quiet location facing an inner courtyard. No great view, but that didn't matter. We were there for three nights (Sun.-Tues.) so I can't comment on the weekend situation. But we found it to be very pleasant. A brochure in the unit indicated that the building was formerly the old Hawthorn Suites, and had undergone a major renovation, just recently completed. I'd say they did a great job. It's a very large complex, located about a block down a side street from Tropicana Blvd. At the end of that block is the MGM Grand parking lot and the monorail station. It's a relatively short walk to the strip. The advantages are obvious- no long check-in lines, easy access to your room, close-in parking, and near the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Possibly the best hotel in Las Vegas??”
Reviews.Author: trumptonfireman
Reviews.Content: We visited Las Vegas for a wedding, and had many friends staying in other, much larger and well-known hotels, and from what we saw of our friends rooms, the Desert Rose is head and shoulders above other Las Vegas Hotels. The room was more like an apartment than a hotel room. It is easily the largest room we have stayed in. The whole suite was spotlessly clean and well-appointed (it was great having a fridge-freezer). The staff were very friendly, and the complementary breakfast (eaten by the pool!) was good. Although the was some building work going on, it did not interfere with our stay at all. It did seem the whole hotel was in the process of being renovated (even though it didn't need it!), but again there was no noise or disruption to us whatsoever. At night the Desert Rose was quiet and peaceful, allowing a good night's sleep in the excellent bed every night. If I were to visit Las Vegas again, I would not hesitate to stay in the Desert Rose again, and I would recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: sailing_123_888
Reviews.Content: We just came back a week ago. This hotel is excellent. It's clean and quiet. It has a kitchen with everything you need. The hotel provides good breakfast and it's free.
