We are so glad we booked this hotel. Comparing to other big casino hotels, this one is quiet and no smoking. Especially if you have kids, they would love it because it does not have casino. My daughter said, in her opinion, this is a 5-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Reservations screwed up”
Reviews.Author: swerdl6659
Reviews.Content: I originally booked for Wed-Sat, but added Tuesday at a later date. When I arrived Tuesday at midnight they did not have my reservation and their computers were down (I found out later they added the extra day to the end of hte trip, not the beginning). They did recommend another hotel. I went to the hotel again the next day to cancel (I did not want to move the 3 kids) I was told I need to talk to the manager to have the 48 hour cancellation waived. He was not coming in until noon. I did call later in hte morning and was able to cancel without penalty. A lot of construction was going on. The pool was being filled. According to other guests they were allowed to use Hooters pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: vegas590
Reviews.Content: We were not very impressed when we got to our room, kind of small but nice. Most of the people that worked there were nice; we did run into a couple people that were crabby. There was construction going on everywhere from the lobby to the outskirts of the hotel. They had a cocktail reception that was minimal at best. The location is wonderful. Walking distance to the strip is five minutes; less than that if you are going to the MGM. The landscaping is very nicely kept inside the hotel. The pool was nice but closed the first two days we were there due to a leak then it was very cold. We would probably stay here again because it was priced well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: maxjkk
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with hotel. Walking distance to strip--about 5-7 minutes. Service was great. Had a few minor problems with room but they were attended to immediately. I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous resort, we loved it”
Reviews.Author: IreneMagadan
Reviews.Content: I liked everything about this place! We found it very comfortable, great location close to Strip but quiet, spacious clean rooms, with nice furniture, balcony for fresh air, full kitchen with dishwasher (!) , nice pool area, delicious breakfast - everything was very nice. The price was surprisingly low for such service, so I plan to stay there again when in Las Vegas and will search for Desert Rose Resort chain in other cities and countries!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: bmitraveller
Reviews.Content: We have now stayed twice at this resort and would not hesitate to stay in the future. Requested and received a quiet 3rd (top) floor room each time. The rooms are extremely comfortable - we always feel at home immediately we arrive. A good position for the strip, and easy access to the south strip, I15, 215 loop and the airport. Good selection of tv channels - too many hotels in Vegas do not want you to stay in your room watching tv. Would have liked more than nachos and chips at the manager's reception, though, eg hot dogs, spring rolls, etc, something hot. Kitchen very well equipped.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location! Apatment Like Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: myvegasISshowing
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay! The rooms have a full kicthen and comfortable furniture. Just a short walk from the strip and MGM Grand. Rooms are clean. Would definitely recommend the Desert Rose!

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful retreat from the ding ding of the slots!”
Reviews.Author: spcohio
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at the Desert Rose, and it was even nicer than the first time. I had heard that they had finished their renovations and it really was a very comfortable place to stay. It is very similar in style to a lot of other shell properties, decent kitchen with granite counters, all full size appliances, and even a toaster and blender for those in room cocktails. Living room had nice sectional sofa with chaise, TV and dining room. Bedroom had a very comfortable matress and the bathroom had plenty of counter and cabinet space to be able to hold all the necessities. The grounds are small, but the have a nice pool area with hot tub and grills, nice comfy outdoor furniture. The pool was too cold to swim, but the hot tub was lovely. The great thing I think is to be able to park right near your room, no walking down endless hallways and the casino to get to your car. The building has locked gates so it feels pretty secure. There is no casino here but it is directly behind the Tropicana and across the street from MGM. Hooters is right next door, but that isn't our scene so we have never been there, I hear it is going to be under new ownership soon, so it will be nice because it is really close by. The have a nice breakfast in the morning, bagels, muffins, hard boiled eggs, etc. they give you bags so you can bring it back to your room if you like. Everyone was very friendly and we enjoyed our trip very much

Reviews.Title: “Great Oasis in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: WisconsinMonalisa
Reviews.Content: The Desert Rose Resort in Las Vegas is a wonderfully clean and secure place to hang your hat when visiting Vegas. The rooms are clean, well appointed, and the most comfortable bed since home. Staff is friendly. The local is close to both airport and starting your trip down the strip. One could walk if desired. We drove short distance to Mandalay Bay parking structure. The ONLY negative was the unheated pool. It may be fine in a few months but certainly not for March enjoyment.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Our Expectations!”
Reviews.Author: julz1130
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Vegas & while I wanted the full experience of going to the Strip I wanted to be able to get away from the craziness to relax too. Not only that, but we had friends and family members who stayed at the hotel too. And, the living room area of the suite was an added bonus. This gave us a chance to sit and comforatably visit with each other. Everyone that went with us agreed the hotel was a fabulous place and the price could not be beat. We also used the concierge service to book a tour to the Hoover Dam and to go see a show. Thank you Dixye for all your help ~ we enjoyed them both very much!!! The other things that we liked were the breakfast that was offered every morning and the reception in the afternoon. A lot of hotels will offer the breakfast, but not many do a reception ~ very nice! This was my husband's second trip to Vegas (1st time he stayed on the Strip). When we were making the plans to book a hotel he wanted to stay on the Strip. I talk him into trying Desert Rose and he was so impressed has already said that this is where we will stay when we come back again!!!! That says a lot!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Quiet Resort”
Reviews.Author: TomTraveler1
Reviews.Content: Desert Rose Resort -Las Vegas We stayed here 3 nights the first week of March This Resort was very convenient To the strip.The rooms were Quite nice and comfortable.There is no resturant or casino at this resort but thats what is nice about it.Very quiet without the casino.There are plenty of casinos and resturants within easy walking distance.They offer a very nice cold breakfast every morning.Plenty to get you going in the morning.If your back at the resort there is also drinks and snacks from 5 to 7 PM Sunday to Thursday.The pool looked nice but was very cold when we were there but the hot tub was perfect and very clean.Having the kitchen and living room was nice so we could come back relax have a drink and a bite to eat.The balcony was small but also a nice feature to have at the resort.We will be coming back here again sometime for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Non Gaming Resort!!!”
Reviews.Author: VJourdin
Reviews.Content: This was our daughter's 1st visit to Las Vegas and we wanted a good location close to the strip, but security and safety played a vital part in our selection. The Desert Rose not only offers the non-gaming atmosphere, but it has a great location close to the MGM, Excalibur, New York New York, Tropicana and the Monorail system. The accomodations along with the staff personnel were wonderful and the resort has many ammenitites that make it feel like home. I would highly recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place”
Reviews.Author: ABQ1
Reviews.Content: We loved this place. They had the best bedding I have ever slept in. I don't know if this is called Triple sheeting or not but I was wondering where to get the same sheets. Staff was lowkey and housekeeping didn't get in our way. Just thought it was great. We were in a one bedroom suite and I loved having a balcony. It was quiet and although we didn't feel uncomfortable I did like seeing the security guy around. Great breakfast and free cocktails. Laundry room was locked so it was secure and machines were up to date. Our place was spacious and everything seemed brand new. It just doesn't get any better - I think it is our new favorite place in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal!”
Reviews.Author: tmezzo36
Reviews.Content: We got this deal through Expedia for $80/night from Wed-Sun. Awesome location, right behind the Hooters/Tropicana and MGM and Mandalay Bay are close by. This hotel is a non-gaming hotel so it is nice to come back to sleep in a quiet place with no smoking! The breakfast is AWESOME...we went down the first morning & they have little bags you can fill up and take back to your room and we had enough stuff to last us for the next 4 mornings! Bagels, toast, oatmeal, cereal boxes, danishes, fruit, yogurt...lots to pick from. They also have a managers reception from 5-7 Mon-Thurs where you can get free wine, beer & snacks! The rooms are bigger than an average hotel room with a fully stocked kitchen with fridge, microwave & stove, a dining table, living room & seperate bedroom/bathroom area. Overall we enjoyed our stay there and would highly recommend it to anyone travelling to the Las Vegas area.

Reviews.Title: “A jewel in the desert”
Reviews.Author: larryaw56
Reviews.Content: I cannot get over the level of quality and cleanliness of the one bedromm condo I had. From the flat screen tv in the living room to the kitchen appliances and well stocked cookware/utensils, there is no better value anywhere in LV. Convenient without the trappings of a casino hotel. Great fitness room...I could go on and on.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Little Hide-away”
Reviews.Author: ralu25
Reviews.Content: Travelling with my wife and a buddy. First time to Vegas. He booked the Desert Rose through his timeshare. After a day of being stranded in snowstorms in Toronto we arrived in Vegas after 11pm. We were tired and cranky. That changed the moment we hit the Desert Rose. Check-in was smooth and polite. The room was terrific. We had two bedrooms with their own tv's. Two bathrooms. A large living and dining room. And a complete kitfchen. A little balcony that faced the Tropicana. Very comfy and cozy. The pool was unheated (brrrrrrr) but the jacuzzi was fine. Nice deck area for suntanning. The Desert Rose featured a breakfast each morning but we just stole a few things and made brekkie in our room. Apparently there is a happy hour each evening but we were always out and about. The internet is intermitent. My only complaint (besides the arctic pool) was that it takes a LONG time for a taxi to come. We waited 20+ minutes each time. Better to just go and flag one. The Desert Rose is reasonably close to the MGM Grand and the strip. Great bargain. I would certainly go there again. It was very relaxing and the staff were very friendly. Nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Best bargain in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: bgco
Reviews.Content: Heres the deal , this place is a spruced up motel that is behind Hooters and the worn and torn Tropicana. However the location is actually very nice it is a step away from the hustle and bustle of the strip , but you can still easily walk to the south end of the strip and MGM is right across the street, I have traveled to Vegas 20 times in the last year or 2 and this place ranks up there with the best in terms of convienance and comfort. The only warning I have is the front desk guy was very rude and would not honor my confirmed price ($70.00)untill I showed him my printed itenerary. He tried to charge me double the rate I had confirmed so beware and bring proof of your room rate.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: vwkar
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location, very quiet, roomy, good location for non-casino place. Only downside is the pool is not not heated, and we had some trouble with our room keys not working. Also from conversations I over heard we were not alone. Staff was helpful. If the pool was heated and the room keys reliable I wouldn't recomend anywhere else!! With that said , my husband and I agreed, this would be where we would want to stay next trip, anyway!!

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis”
Reviews.Author: bldrgrl
Reviews.Content: I found this place as a part of an Expedia flight/ hotel package and my 3 girlfriends and I absolutely loved it! It felt like Florida resort, but was only 1 block from the strip. If you want a clean, beautiful room that's easy to park at and get to this is your place. Easy walk to MGM, Hooters, Mandalay Bay. Great breakfast in the morning and nice pool, although it's too chilly to use this time of year. I would definitely recommend this for folks who enjoy some fresh air among the smoke and neon of Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ABRCalifornia
Reviews.Content: My wife,son and I stayed in a 2 Bdrm Suite. Nice clean room, lobby and grounds. Friendly and helpfull personel. Close to Casinos. Excellent value. Best deal in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, great location”
Reviews.Author: wolfboylb
Reviews.Content: Had to find a place in Las Vegas with 2 Bedrooms, and that wasn't going to break the bank. I found the resort via a hotel search. Location was great (walking distance to Hooters and MGM Grand). The hotel room was well appointed and well kept. Very clean, and the complimentary breakfast was great. I would recommend this hotel to people who need more than 1 bedroom. I did find that the pull out bed did not have a set of sheets in the closet, like the extra blankets and pillows were. Other than that, it was great!

Reviews.Title: “Wow What A Place”
Reviews.Author: spooky51
Reviews.Content: We were worried how FAR OFF THE STRIP was. Very short walk. Resort was very clean , staff friendly and knowledgable. The continental breakfast had a very large variety of choices, oatmeal, cold cereal, bagels, pastries, yogurt, fruit, smoked salmon too. Had coffee or tea 24 hours a day. We will definitely come bak here and we have told all our friends what a great place this resort is.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!!!”
Reviews.Author: saeColorado
Reviews.Content: The rooms were fabulous and the staff were extremely nice and helpful. The reception held every night and the breakfast every morning were delicious and beyond our expectations. We highly recommend this resort!!

Reviews.Title: “Highly commendable property, people and position”
Reviews.Author: OkanaganNorth
Reviews.Content: We arrived in the early hours of the morning to find our promised reservation and room exactly as described. Desk clerk was polite and helpful. Room was clean and kept clean by a motivated and competent housekeeping. The location, two blocks from the "Strip" is ideal. Great value, privacy, relaxing property, described accuratety in their website. Highly commendable - we would definitely recommend as well as return.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: rexgarth
Reviews.Content: Great location. Nice 1 bedroom apt style with kitchen about a block off the strip. The employees were very pleasant and helpful. A manager's happy hour with complimentary wine/beer & snack plus a continental breakfast makes the Desert Rose a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Desert Rose resort”
Reviews.Author: goldenSanDiego
Reviews.Content: We had a really room at the Desert Rose resort. This is the second year that we have stayed there. And will continue to do so. When ever we are in Las Vegas. Rooms are big and beautiful and have everthing you need. Including a full kitchen with dishes and all. Bedroom is seperate from the living room. So if someone wants to sleep you won't bother them . The rooms have been completely remodeled. The are beautiful Loved staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and Convenience”
Reviews.Author: Ultra-gal
Reviews.Content: Just spent an enjoyable 3 nights at the Desert Rose. The property is very convenient to the strip without the bustle and noise, and has a good atmostphere. Free parking was an added bonus. The 2-bedroom unit was perfect for the family to have some space to relax, which we thoroughly enjoyed rather than a cramped hotel room. Although the unit smelt a little of smoke when first entering, it was immaculate and well equipped with everything you might need in the kitchen too. The buffet breakfast was perfect to start the day - a good variety including fresh fruit and yoghurt - although we recommend you get to breakfast early as it does get crowded and tables are in short supply for the last 15 minutes. It was too cold to use the pool or spa, but the area was clean and inviting. The gym area also looks great. The check in and out process was very smooth, and we were impressed with the friendliness and efficiency of all the staff. Overall an excellent experience.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend to all our friends”
Reviews.Author: Travelers-II
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I traveled to Vegas for the UFC/Super Bowl, and stayed a total for 6 nights. The Desert Rose Resort met and exceeded our expectations, especially when you consider the price point of the hotel. The cleaning staff was extremely friendly and always did an excellent job and the front desk staff was always willing to help with whatever we needed. I'm not sure why the continental breakfast has recieved criticism, as it far exceeded many others that I have had at other hotels. There was a selection of muffins, danishes, bagels, toast, cold cereal, cream of wheat, cottage cheese, fruit, yogurt, boiled eggs, smoked salmon and ass't beverages. They leave the buffet open for 3 hours every day and of course have to draw the line of when to close it somewhere. So as long as you arrive before the end of the breakfast, there is ample fare. When we first arrived there was a problem with our smoke detector's battery, and within 5 min of informing the front desk, the problem was fixed. The rooms were spacious, and although we found the bed was a bit soft, that all relies on personal preference, as it is impossible to please all the people all the time, in regards to that aspect of a hotel stay. The atmosphere was quiet and a world away from that of the strip hotels. We found this quite appealing, as we enjoyed having a relaxing place to stay, while still being so close to all that the vegas strip has to offer. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wow...what a great resort !!!!”
Reviews.Author: blsbls99
Reviews.Content: I was impressed by this resort. Huge rooms, with all of the features (even DVD players and a great stereo system). They have a full kitchen area, so you can take "home" the leftovers after eating out. Beautiful room decor...I could live there ! And free continental breakfast in the morning, and not just the skimpy stuff (boiled eggs, bagels, yogurt, cereal). Service was great too. It was nice not to have to walk through miles of casinos in order to get to my room. But, MGM was right across the street for my gambling needs. There wasn't a negative thing about this property during my visit. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED !!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: jlguerra
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay at the Desert Rose and it is not my last. I have always been completely satisfied at this hotel. It is conveniently located on Tropicana, two very short blocks off the strip, making it walking distance to Las Vegas Blvd. The suites have a full kitchen, comfortable living room, and a nice bedroom (1 or 2 bedrooms available). On this particle stay last weekend, there was a problem with the bathtub. We called for service, and the staff responded immediately with a smile (Thanks Keith!). See you in a couple months DRR!!

Reviews.Title: “It is OK, simply OK. Get up early for bagels at the trough.”
Reviews.Author: Fotomkr
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Desert Rose during a trade show in late Jan-early Feb 2008. I slept there for a total of five nights. Yes, the bed was comfy (after I dislodged the sheets from underneath the mattress, which until I did, made it impossible to have my feet upright while laying in bed to watch tv). I arrived very early in the morning, and was able to check into my room without a hitch. The front desk staff was very pleasant, and out of the three of them, two spoke fluent English. I liked that they did NOT speak the room number, there was a crowd around, and my luggage mostly contained computers and camera equipment. The only complaint I have checking in, and in no way is it the front desk worker's fault, was that they had my reservation arriving one day earlier then I did, and checking out one day earlier. I showed them my confirmation supplied by the trade show I was attending, (which showed the proper dates), and they had no problem correcting their system. Off to my room. I was on the third floor of Bldg 3. HERE IS A HINT if you arein Bldg 3. Take the first hall to your right after going through the door near the pool to get to the elevator. Why am I telling you this, because there are no signs directing you to the elevator. NONE of the buildings I was in visiting friends had signs showing you to the elevator. First place in my life, and I was all but born in a hotel room, have I not seen even an icon sign towards the elevator. One feature of the hotel is that some rooms are in a carpeted hallway, and some are in a deep grooved tile hall. You know all those susie cream cheese flight attendant bags that people use with the wheels, well, due to the way this place is laid out, you can hear them from ANYWHERE in your room, if your door is on the tiled section. Immediate impressions, If your room in bldg 3 ends in an 11 or 13 your view will be of the doors across the public area, or the back side of the elevator. YOUR VEGAS VIEW WILL BE A WALL OR HALL. All other rooms from what I could tell, have some decent type of view out the window. Open the door, and the heat was on full blast. The temp had been set to 90 degrees. What the heck is that about? Called the front desk to let them know what housekeeping is doing, and their reply was that it is cold right now, and they are trying to keep the rooms toasty. The furniture in my room looked used, because I am sure it had been, dings, burn marks, etc. The kitchen appliances were all clean, and new. Silverware was dishwasher clean. Plates, glasses, etc, all were sparkling clean. TV worked with good picture on both sets. Bathroom, cramped. The throne is next to the door, so if someone were to open the doors, your knees to thighs would be impacted. In my room the door NEVER stayed open, which was not fun when as a guy were standing to do our business. Shower: Showerheads like yester-year, very high pressure flow type. Hot water lasted forever, multiple baths within 30 minutes or each other and water never changed temps. Tyr that at a home, let one person take a hot bath, stew in it for about 10-15 minutes, empty the bath, and then start a new one, betcha the second person will have luke warm by the middle of the fill, and we are talking regular sized tubs. Towels: The were way too small, but then they had one multiple folded towel that once unfolded, was almost, but not quite a bath sheet. That came close to me not wishing to have brough my bath robe. Security issue: During our stay the hotel was working on new walls, and decor, but portions of the heavy security fencing had to be removed to work in the area. ANYONE could enter the grounds. All they had to do was walk through the fenceless area. Each night I saw kids, teens, etc, walking in (teens, or people that looked like teens) carry beer to the pool and hot tub. They would be gone with 15 minutes of me informing the front desk. Off to the monorail: The hotel will tell you it is a short 5 minute walk to the monorail. Plan on 10 to 15 minutes. I walk extremely fast, and I have no idea who could do the walk, as laid out by the front desk in 5 minutes. First you wak through the Hooter's Casino parking lot, then cross a major intersection. BTW, if you want to cross quicker, hit the traffic buttons on the pole. in LV they actually do work at stopping the traffic quicker. Then you have to walk through the lobby of the MGM Grand, then follow the signs tot he monorail. You will not be walking through the casino. If you are walking through the casino, you went too far down the sidewalk. Enjoy the day/night in Vegas. Back at the Desert Rose, they have afternoon drinks, wine or light beer. One day the beer tap froze solid, so they handed out 7oz bottles of Corona. Each day they either day chips and dip, bags of chips, etc. No problem getting refills on drinks, and the days that the tap was frozen, they handed you multiple beers to take back to your room. Enjoy more of Vegas. In the morning, pay attention to when the bagel trough is closed. Do not think you can show up five minutes before the closing time, and get fed. AT EXACTLY THE CLOSING TIME, the hired help starts demolishing the buffet line. The first thing to go is the bagels in individually wrapped plastic bags, and then the sliced lox. That is as fancy as it gets here, lox on the buffet. Then the coffee machine and toasters are turned off. In order for you to get the hint to leave, if you have been lucky enough to get some food (which they also provide cereal, bread, yogurt, fruit, etc) the janitors start sweeping everywhere, and as I was chewing my food, his put his dusting thing NEXT to my plate, literally next to my plate. "STUFF" got on to my cream cheese. I was a tad bit unhappy, but not as unhappy when I asked to get another bagel (the trashed on one had two bits out of it) I was promptly informed that breakfast was over, and I needed to get here earlier. When I told them what happened, they VERY SLOWLY brought me a bagel. When asked to get it toasted, they said the toaster was put away. I knew which door they put the toaster in, so I went and retrieved it. They told me not to, and I repeated to them why I was doing it. They asked me to please not remove the toaster, which was already out of the cabinet by now, and I asked them to go get the manager. He came out, and after I explained what happened, he let me use the toaster, and asked if I want anything else to eat. He brought me a huge serving of lox, and four cream cheeses packs. When checking out, I was handed the wrong bill, correct room number, wrong bill. They had me there for seven nights, and a large phone bill. After I showed them my airline schedule, I asked them to show me a video tape of me checking in on the date they said I checked in on. I then showed them my monorail receipt for the tickets I had bought. I then asked if the rate I had, was for a limited time frame, which it was. I checked in on the first day of that rate's time period. They finally realized they had made a mistake, and the correct bill was given to me. Here it is a few days later, and I have to ask, when we go back to Vegas for another trade show in a few months, this time with my wife and kids, will we stay here. I doubt it for one huge reason, the monorail. Would I stay here if traveling with just my wife and I, maybe. Now, the thing I have not mentioned to this point, is that I have stayed at the Desert Rose over the past few years, maybe a decade, when other companies were paying for it, and never had issues like I did this trip. For the price, (less then 120 a night) most likely can not be beat. The not being a casino is a non-issue for me and my family. Were there drunkards at this place, every night, in the pool area. Were they loud, you betcha. Were they there or still loud after the front desk was called, Not that I saw. Have a great time Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Very Spacious, Very Quiet, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TheHam7
Reviews.Content: Just completed a 4-night stay at the end of January 2008 - wonderful, quiet, spacious accommodations. About a 5 minute walk to the MGM Grand. Great parking, clean rooms, nice continental breakfast included - a great deal compared to strip hotel rooms. I would highly recommend this property to anyone who wants to be "close to the action" but still get some rest and relaxation afterwards. After full days and nights in crowded, noisy, smoke-filled casinos, it was a pleasure to return to a quiet, non-smoking, casino-less property to re-charge the batteries for the next day! I will definitely be choosing this property on my next visit to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: dulo87
Reviews.Content: Superbowl weekend was great for my wife and I in Vegas. Especially with our stay at the Desert Rose Resort, I would describe it as nice,elegant,peaceful, and a great location with easy access to the strip. I would recommend it to anyone.....also its secure very well. I plan on staying there this summer with my family.......GREAT!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfort just off the Las Vegas Strip”
Reviews.Author: nbrtmpr
Reviews.Content: The Desert Rose is a very nice property just off the strip (behind Hooters). It's rooms have been redone and are uniformly comfortable. The staff tries to please. Having stayed there more than ten times I have to say that the staff is human. There is always one little thing not right. No newspaper, no washcloth, the TV won't work (perhaps a little quality control on housekeeping?). The continental breakfast is good, the security is noticeable (yes) and it is close to the airport. All in all, a good property worth a stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Quiet Stay”
Reviews.Author: tessklatt
Reviews.Content: I was stuck in Vegas after a trip and needed a place to stay. This place was wonderful, quiet and just what I needed. The rooms are nice and big with a full kitchen, balcony and a VERY nice King sized bed. It's just off the strip (1 block from the MGM Grand) which made it easy to get to any show or attraction. The staff was very nice and friendly. I would absolutely recommend this resort to anyone just wanting to go to Vegas to relax. Better deal than the strip and MUCH better room!

Reviews.Title: “Great for business stays”
Reviews.Author: mch2o
Reviews.Content: I stay here regularly while on business in Nevada. In the past I've stayed at other stip loacations but the Desert Rose is my favorite. Low noise level, easy access to the airport, well equiped suite, excellent access to AT&T wireless internet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend”
Reviews.Author: RoaminFam
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Desert Rose before and love it. It's always clean and nice and the staff are very friendly and helpful. It's just out of the way, but easily accessible (when there's not construction) to the strip and shopping. Would highly recommend for overnight or a week!

Reviews.Title: “A true delight”
Reviews.Author: JimClements
Reviews.Content: I usually go to Las Vegas near Christmas, room rates are cheaper and crowds are less. This was my 16th trip, staying at places ranging from the Bellagio to the old Stardust. I'd read the reviews here and elsewhere and had no idea what I was getting into -- until I tossed my bags into the suite and almost had my breath knocked out of me. The two-bedroom suite was better than I expected, better than I hoped, even better than the pictures in the advertisements. That simple. Nothing seemed to have escaped their attention. The people I encountered in an extended stay were polite, friendly, eager to assist and always had a smile. I tried to tip one of the cleaning staff and she tried to refuse, never had that happen before in Vegas or anywhere else. Problems? Well, the breakfasts and the Manager's Get-together were nothing to write the New York Times about, but neither were they to be complained about. The proximity to The Strip has to be understood in Vegas terms. It is about a block-and-a-half, but that is Las Vegas walking. And everywhere in Las Vegas is a very, very long walk. No problem there either, and it was nice to get away from the bustle of The Strip. For me Red Rose never lived up to my expectations, it exceeded almost every one of them. And always with a grin.

Reviews.Title: “Off the Strip stay”
Reviews.Author: Beachbabyny01
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Desert Rose Resort in Las Vegas. Our 2 bedroom, 2 bathrooms Condo was clean and very well equipped. Maid service everyday was great. This is a time share location, but we booked it thru Orbitz .(package with air from NY). Very good for the price. Advertising will say that it is a block off the strip, but it is really 1 long block, You have to be in good shape to walk to where you need to go. If you are only going to the strip I guess you could do without a car. We were traveling with a senior so we needed a car. The only problem with this resort was that they were doing construction in the lobby, and there was a very foul odor. The rest of the property was clean and in good condition. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel off the strip”
Reviews.Author: lizzybeth42
Reviews.Content: I was sent to a class at the Desert Rose for work last spring, and once I checked into my room, I knew I would be back. I recently was sent to Vegas on business again, and immediately booked a room here. I was lucky enough that they were having a winter sale, so my hotel room (which is bigger than some apartiments I've lived in) was only $88/night. After talking with my cab driver, I found out that the resort used to be an apartment complex (he used to live there) hence the full kitchens, dining rooms, etc. The beds/couches etc. are really comfy, and the jacuzzi is nice and toasty. There was only one drawback: The usually more-than-adequate contenental breakfast was closed during our visit due to construction, so we were given iffy sack breakfasts instead. Since construction looked like it was not major and nearly completed, I would expect this will not be a problem by Christmas of this year. Overall, a great hotel in a convenient location. I would reccommend this place to anyone travelling to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant accomodation”
Reviews.Author: mkglw
Reviews.Content: Thought positive reviews must be exagerated. Hotel was excellent. Apartment large and clean. Kitchen fully equipped, beds huge, clean and so comfortable. Would reccommend to anyone. Stayed for 2 weeks and could not get enough. Some reviews complained about breakfast - couldn't fault it, and it was FREE! Pool was too cold to use but jaccuzzi was roasting. Good to be quiet and have no casino, unlike the strip. I'll be back

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: kimsgramma
Reviews.Content: We were just there for a conference and our room was fabulous! I was very happy with everything (there were a few minor problems with architectural design but nothing catastrophic). The only thing that could use improvement was the noisy a/c and the sounds of flushing toilets above our heads. Really, all in all, the room was great and I would stay there again. The conference rooms leave a little to be desired and the breakfast was just okay, nothing very healthy to eat except for some fruit that some people had which was gone when we got there. Our first lunch for our conference was pretty good but the next day we arrived to find lunch sacks. Bummer. Anyway, we were very happy!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: welshrugbyfan
Reviews.Content: Loved it here. Quiet and relaxing after pizzazz of the strip. Only 5 mins walk to monorail stop at MGM grand, max 10 mins to strip. Breakfast was great - cereal, juice, coffee, croissants or bagels etc - basic but clean and plenty to choose from. Lots of space in the rooms, clean, very quiet - so close to airport that we expected to hear plane noise but didnt, staff were helpful and friendly - nothing to complain about at all. If you want noisy, smoky, busy casinos with long queues for buffet food, check in, taxis etc then stick to the strip. If you want access to all the attractions and a quiet friendly place to stay at night - choose the Desert Rose.

Reviews.Title: “Beware!! The outside looks ok but wait tell you really see what's up”
Reviews.Author: BayArea-Cali
Reviews.Content: I had the worst stay ever at this hotel.I booked a two bedroom suite with a king and queen bed for three nights.When I arrived to my room it was the wrong room ,so I had to wait for security to bring me a key to a room far away from the one I was in and no help with transporting my luggage! Then not even 9 hours later maintence called and asked me to run the water in the kitchen sink for 3 minutes stating needing to check for a leak.Then after about 20 minutes needing to come in and patch a hole up.It was 9a.m. when they wanted to do these repairs and I wasn't even up yet! So I called the manger, Judy ,and she didn't even know anything about it. Told me she would check things out and call me back.After waiting around for 2 hours I went to the front desk then was told I needed to change rooms again ,for the 3rd time in less than 12 hours of my stay!!!! And they didn't have a room availble for a couple for hours.Judy said sorry compt my for one night then found me another room sooner than an hour.Judy also told me that my new room was the same as my old one!Once again I packed my stuff up and moved to room #3 only to find out it was not the right kind of room ,a smaller one!!So again I went to the front desk ,everyone that was there was clueless!!Judy of course was on a break!! Finally they found me another room and stated some one will come help us transport our luggage,but after waiting for an hour for them,I just moved my own luggage.Let not talk about all the repairs going on, the banging and supplies all over the place.So there is no sleeping because of the noise!The windows are fifthly ,bird crap all over them!The carpets are stained and they have big roaches on the outside!Let's not even go there about the horrible breakfast ,And what's up with the security guards guarding the breakfast?On the web site, internet stated free monorail shuttles to 10 different hotels on the strip ,but of course staff unaware said that wasn't true you have to buy it from the concierge .Went to Vegas to relax and have fun ended up getting stressed out on my first night loosing items with the multiple moves! I will never ever stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Desert Rose is A-OK!”
Reviews.Author: Ponchodon
Reviews.Content: We had read pros and cons, but decided to give it a shot. Price was very good, amenities sounded good, and we were not disappointed in any way. A very clean 1 BR suite, nice, fully equipped kitchen, great bed and very good service. As some others have said, the breakfast buffett isn't fabulous, but it's free, and if you don't like it, other restaurants are nearby. No gaming, no smoking, etc. is a plus in my book, and a short walk to Hooter's for those things. Plus, only a short jaunt (10 minutes or less) to the Strip. Desert Rose will certainly get our business on our next Vegas trip.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem of a hotel just off the strip”
Reviews.Author: itzmehereagain
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from a ten night stay in this hotel, would agree with all the positive comments from other reviews. Difficult to find negatives but for the sake of those looking for all the facts here goes: Would give breakfast a miss, easily done if you don't get to bed till the very early hours anyway as it finishes at 9am. Nice 24hr. restaurant /diner five minutes away, left out of front entrance of hotel walk to end of road, turn right it's on the right. Could do with more than the eleven sunbeds in the pool area. That's it as far as negatives. When in Vegas do use the buffet's at the casino's for evening meals, choices are endless great food, great value for money. Would certainly use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for the strip at sensible prices”
Reviews.Author: smcc1879
Reviews.Content: Room was clean and spacious. View from ground fllor of the car park, but wasn't there for the view. 10 minute walk the the intersection of Las vegas Blvd and Tropicana. Only down side - they use disposable cutlery for breakfast. Very wasteful.

Reviews.Title: “Desert Rose Resort--Best kept secret in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: luv2travelProvo_UT
Reviews.Content: we were very worried booking this property, because we had never heard of it. When we checked in, we had booked a one bedroom suite and they put us in a 2 bdr condo. It was beautiful. Granite countertops, full kitchen, bed and bed linens way above average. 3 flat screen TV's. 2 full bathrooms. We were only there for a long weekend and I wished we could have stayed the whole week. All the staff was very gracious, and helpful. They were very kind to my kids 9 and 5. We paid under $100 a night and felt we got an extremely good deal. Another bonus was it's location. Even though not on the strip ( a bonus in my opinion) we could just cut through the Hooters parking lot and Tropicana parking lot and we were on the strip. No casino on site and no smoking. YEAH!!! Will always stay there from now on when in Vegas. Good for families!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for the money!”
Reviews.Author: orangectyny
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay in a 2 bedroom suite. The suite consisted of a king size bed and a full size bed, living room with pull out and a comfortable chaise lounge. 3 tv's 2 bathrooms- one has a very large shower and the other has a good size soaking tub. Kitchen was equipped with stove, mico, coffeepot, blender and toaster, dishwasher and refrigerator. They suppled dish soap and dish washer deteregent. They also left packets of coffee and decaf as well as tea. Cabinets have pots, dishes, cups glasses and silverware etc. Staff was very helpful upon check in and we were able to check in a hour early. Just as we finished a bus came in with wedding guests. It appeared that they were well prepared for them. Every staff member we met during our stay was helpful and courteous to all of us. The front desk even printed out our boarding pass on Sunday night. The buffet was ok- items changed daily and appered to change hourly. Go early to the buffet!!!! I did see a security guard on Sunday but not Saturday. Hot tub was very nice. Pool was cold as it was not heated. Our room was at the end of the hall away from the elevator and so we did not have the noise but housekeeping did not start until 9 am with the carts on the weekend. One thing we did notice. We could have a conversation in the living room and could not be overheard in any of the other rooms. The entire suite was like that. You could not hear bathroom water running in either of the bedrooms. The material on our couch was frayed and there were a few rug stains near the balcony door. Other than that the suite was clean and well set up. One recommendation would be for a mirror in the 2nd bedroom. My daughters will stay here again but I would prefer to stay on the strip. It was a great value for the money and would recommend it for anyone who is willing to stay off strip.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: lulu-chi
Reviews.Content: I found this to be a very nice hotel. Within walking distance of the strip (right behind Hooters). It is reasonably priced. It has a full kitchen and a separate living area with a nice sofa. Televisions in both the living room and bedroom. It is clean and the staff is friendly and accomodating. The free breakfast is crowded--get there early! The pool is unheated but nice with two hot tub areas. There is a spa and a gym (which was under construction but they had passes for guests to work out at a nearby location). I didn't take advantage of this facilities since I didn't have time. The only draw back was that the maid carts and people with their luggage is pretty loud going down the outdoor hallways. It is a nice place and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all round”
Reviews.Author: JulesNewcastleUK
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend the Desert Rose. We have just spent 8 nights there. Ideally located just off the strip 5-10 minutes walk from Hooters, Tropicana and MGM Grand, with other big hotels not too much further to walk. Accommodation was first class, very clean, everything (and lots more) that you could possibly need if you wanted to eat in. Pool area clean and never too busy. Free drinks and nibbles week nights in the reception compliments of the manager. All in all a top class place to stay. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “From Cliff's to Desert Rose”
Reviews.Author: jeffnrena
Reviews.Content: We own a timeshare at the Cliff's but traded through RCI for a couple nights at Desert Rose to be closer to the Strip. The rooms and service are FANTASTIC. The resort itself is not "beautiful" on the outside, nor did it have fancy grounds, but being close to the strip in a two bedroom unit (careful if traveling with another couple, the 2nd bedroom had twin beds, we expected a queen bed) with a full kitchen and living room was wonderful! And the rooms were TOP NOTCH! The linens and showers stood out for me as some of the best....comfy beds and pillows. The shower has 5 shower heads. The kitchen has all needed utensils. Maid service comes daily! They even leave a goody bag for you with some chips, chocolates, granola bar and cookies. :) Continental Breakfast is free every morning! The pool and jacuzzi are nice. There is a wine/beer reception Monday thru Thursday with free drinks and snacks from 5:00 to 7:00 which is nice to enjoy before a night out on the town. The resort itself is walking distance to the MGM.....from there we used the Monorail or the Deuce (double decker bus) to travel up and down the strip. You can walk from Desert Rose down the strip, but if you want to enjoy walking through all the hotels along the way you get pretty tired! The bus was a slow way to travel, but got us more directly to our destination. The monorail is fast and easy, but only runs on the east side of the strip, so walking through the hotels and to the other side can be far (especially if you are dressed up for a show). The staff is excellent at the Desert Rose, and we were never even asked to go to a timeshare presentation the way we usually are at RCI resorts. There is construction across the street which can be loud, but there is construction EVERYWHERE in Vegas right now. Ask for a room inside the resort....our room faced the front of the resort, directly across from the construction site. Hooters is right next door---catching cabs is easy there so you don't have to wait for the resort to call one for you. Overall I enjoyed this location much more than the Cliff's!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but staff can improve”
Reviews.Author: DoktorCB
Reviews.Content: I stood for about one week during September 2007 in the Desert Rose Las Vegas attending a conference in town. I had choosen the Desert Rose, because of the price and location. I was unwilling to pay 300 USD/night for a strip hotel and I had good experience (Summer Bay) with another 2nd row hotel two years ago. This time I wanted to try something new and the desert rose has some remarkable good reviews. The hotel is easy to find, close to the Hooters and the Tropicana at the south end of the strip in second row. The location is also close to the airport, even though I was suprised that this was not disturbing as I expected - actually quite. A lot of construction is going on in Vegas right now, so in this Resort as well. Everywhere were people maintaining and renovating parts of the hotel. I can not even say that the suite I have been in was just to be renovated or already finished. At least it looked ok - about clean, the maintenance of the room was only ok, and I had to ask to the engineer to get the lighs and the toilet working. After this the room was fine. Not very big though but nicely equipped and with a real full kitchen (even if I only used the fridge). Around the hotel what they call the resort is actually very small: a pool area. the water was very refreshing (it was cold) and the pool in excellent condition, probably newly plastered and well maintened. But that's about the whole facility. If you expect a big pool area, forget about it. One thing I liked was, that even it was quite full on the pool deck, it was very quite. Beside this lets talk about the staff. The checkin counter is typically the first impression what you get from a hotel - and this one was the bad experience, as well as check-in als also on checking-out: is it that difficult to smile and be friendly, instead: "name?" - "here you are ..." - "no we don't" ... terrible unfriendly without a reason, two people actually waiting for guests. The other point is that if a hotel ask for special preferences than they should know about it when I check-in and not answer with a " what? no available" (because we don't want to bother about this preferences, makes working so difficult ...?). On Check-out the same story, unfriendly, and not a word too much. It looked to me as simply unmotivated front-desk people. Lets talk about something else: this hotel offers a complimentary breakfast. Complementary menas it is included in my rate, but it was treated as for giving it away for free ... the difference is in my understanding I pay for it, so I would like to see happy people presenting what is there (and the quality and the richness is ok so fare, not great but enough). But what it is is that sombody pushes food outside and you see it more "take it for free ..." -like, if you understand what I mean. The presentation should reflect a hotel and the people should feal happy in what they are doing. And this is the missing point in this hotel. As mentined before there is nothing to complain about the breakfast, its simple - no cooked food except cold boiled eggs - but functional. My last issue I would like to mention is the "wireless internet" what attracted my attention when I booked this hotel. On my reservation it said " ... room, breakfast, wireless internet" - so I though I will have complementary internet service. Wrong: it only tells you that it is available for 10 USD/day no discounts if you need it for a week. Advertising this in this way is not ok in my understanding - so be aware, even when they promise something does not mean you get it without extra charge. Always the question to me whom I can recommend this hotel to? If you are looking for a functional small suite as a single or max. a couple without needing the facy stuff around then it is ok for you. In less than 10 minutes you arrive at the strip, even though at the south end - means better have a car. Don't expect a real resort with many animities - its not there and there is absolutly nothing for kids. Would I go there again? Its not bad, its ok, so I might go there again, but there are more hotels of this kind around in Vegas, so I probably will try something else on my next trip - may be with friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Desert Rose is a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: BrianM55
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 7 nights at the Desert Rose, Sept. 9 - 16. Our one bedroom suite was extremely clean and comfortable. We had no complaints about anything. The suite was cleaned every day. The entire complex appeared to have been recently painted. Our suite appeared brand new. All appliances were new. Our interactions with the staff were limited, but any time we had any questions of the front counter staff, they were more than willing to assist. The Desert Rose is situated an easy 10 minute walk from the Strip. It is a great place to stay as you can experience the Strip, but escape back to the Desert Rose to get away from it all. We have no reservations recommending the Desert Rose as a great place to stay. We would not hesitate to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: prac1
Reviews.Content: The best overall accomodations out of seven hotels we stayed in during our trip.We stayed here twice when comiing into and going out of Las Vegas. It was great. Everything was clean and in pristine condition. The bed was so comfortable, with crisp sheets and oversize pillows galore. Staff was friendly and helpful. The breakfast was included and was outstanding. It was continuously replinished by a doting staff. It was right off the strip in Las Vegas within walking distance. This would certainly be an acceptable alternative to a strip hotel. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “This place is a great place”
Reviews.Author: catsandra
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 nights. I had a 1 bedroom. Beautiful. The view on the patios are the only thing wrong but for summer weather you don't even want to use it. The couch had a extended lounge, which you can use as a bed for children. Very spacious and quiet. You can walk to the MGM and next door is Hooters, which they have a special for all you can eat ribs, which was excellent for taste and quality. We would definitely go back at 89 a night

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place!”
Reviews.Author: JayneyMcIreland
Reviews.Content: This is a really fantastic place to stay in Vegas. its location is excellent, just behind the MGM grand but yet away from all the madness of Vegas. We had a 2 bedroom suite which was fabulous to say the least. A gorgeous big bedroom and equally fantastic bathroom. We were so lucky with the price too as it wasn't expensive at all. The pool area was lovely and really needed in the hot weather, not too overcrowded with children either. During 5 to 7 in the evening free drinks were served in the lobby and some snacks too which were lovely. The breakfast was continental and was quite nice. If i was traveling to Vegas again i would definitely stay here. this place comes highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place”
Reviews.Author: t7gc
Reviews.Content: Went to LV for a convention for 6 days. Wanted somewhere with a small kitchen & near my convention place (MGM). This place is excellent. Very nice & tidy. The kitchen has all the utensils & detergent needed. It was just awesome for me. Breakfast is toasts & cereal & refillable drinks (tea/coffee/juice/soft drinks). Will definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Families!”
Reviews.Author: treasuresgirl
Reviews.Content: The Desert Rose is a perfect choice for families or for anyone who wants the best of both worlds: It's a wholesome, restful environment that's just steps away from the excitement of the Strip. Our room was spacious, well-decorated and had every amenity a family could want during a week's stay. The location is central to everything (we found LV in general to be quite easy to maneuver) and the breakfast was an added value. We would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “loved the desert rose !!”
Reviews.Author: sdjra
Reviews.Content: we were in las vagas for a dance competition so we had several families from the studio staying at the desert rose and I have to say I was very happy about our choice to stay there. The rooms were very nice -big and spacious and came with everything from coffee pots, and blenders to silverware and hair dryers ...--the house keeping service was very friendly and very good-- It's a perfect place for families --the strip is just a short walk --and the pool area was also very nice -- I will recommend this hotel to everyone I know who plans on a vegas vacation --

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: UKBloke47
Reviews.Content: We arrived 2 hours before the official check in time, but were given our room, with a quick check in, without any problem, the staff were friendly and efficient throughout our stay. We had a phone call from the manager 2 hours after arriving to see if everything was alright, but were not bothered again. The room turned out to be spacious, spotlessly clean, with a big TV that had the usual channels, plus pay per view films, the bedroom was a good size, with a big bed, the bathroom was an adequate size, and the kitchen was very well equipped with everything you need, tip, if you have transport and want to purchase food etc, take a right out of the resort on to E Reno Ave, drive the short distance to the Strip, make a left there, and drive south until you come to the Cancun hotel on the right, there is a large Food4Less on the opposite side of the road, with all your needs. The car park, stretches all the way round the resort, with close access to any room, making unloading easy and quick, the electronic room keys are needed to entrance the resort area. As has been said in other reviews, Hooters is the nearest casino, and only a couple of minutes walk, they do great all you can eat ribs for $16. The Tropicano is a little further, as is the MGM, where you can catch the monorail. To catch a bus along the Strip, take a right out of the resort, and right onto Reno, and it's just a short walk to the bus stop at the end of the road. We didn't eat at the complimentary continental breakfast, but the ones who did said it was good, we preferred to have a cooked one in our room. The pool area was not too busy, a good place to cool off. The elevator was quick when called, as there are only 3 floors, so you only spend seconds in there, the housekeeping staff we met on there, were always cheerful and friendly. I have to add, this wasn't our first choice place to stay in Vegas, we had booked a room in a moderate hotel/casino on the strip, but had the Desert Rose resort recommended to us by friends, and booked direct with them via their website, that saved us $70 compared to the price at the other hotel, this is where we will be staying on all our visits to Las Vegas.

HotelInfo.Name: Desert Rose Resort
HotelInfo.Address: 5051 Duke Ellington Way, Las Vegas, NV 89119
